demLJnHp0u25ygo9qqf_Iw.text: I went here for happy hour today.  The bartender was very attentive. I ordered shrimp and crawfish fondeaux and catfish beignets. I also ordered a large swamp thing to drink. The swamp thing was really good. The catfish beignets were delicious. I didn't love the fondeaux though. First of all it had mushrooms in it and I hate mushrooms. But also the shrimp tasted like dirty dishwater, which is not unusual for shrimp in my opinion, but that ruined the fondeaux for me. Overall my experience was A-Ok.

U_9RhItRgzQZ1WU3XXmCOA.text: Wonderful meal with copious amounts of fresh seafood seasoned perfectly. The bread is excellent. I'd recommend staying away from the gumbo...it's not terrible, it's just not necessary. The Mixed Seafood Grill and the risotto were great. Our server, Annie was efficient & helpful without being intrusive. This was a great end to an excellent day in the Arizona sun.

SryDOkrlkvQ2-P1NHCCkpA.text: Fast service, fastest i have seen!! Also very nice servers!!! I reallllly love their foods here oh and their bread omg!!! Honey plus bread=ftw

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their calamari is the bomb!!!

ju7YyAMBY0kBH60sdglx2w.text: We went there on Saturday, and it was" very" busy, not just cause it was a Saturday, but the Saturday before Mothers Day. However our experience was awesome. We sat at the bar, and well gotta send a "shout out" to Jemma, who was not our waitress, but was delivering food to the bar. She took time to tell us what each dish was as this was our first time there. She was Awesome! And our two bartenders who took care of us Nick and Missy, hooked us up on the lump crab & spinach dish which was amazing. The food here was very good, and these three persons great service will definitely bring us back!!

FJCtga-fce8EWKGnXDPrgQ.text: We had to go to the west side of Phoenix and that was just the excuse for another dinner at Pappadeaux.  This time we were there in the middle of the week so there was no wait for a table.    We went the same route on the appetizers with alligator and oysters.  No sense messing with perfection.  The hubby ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  Expensive but fabulous.  I stole a couple of bites and it was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  Heavenly!  I wasn't very hungry after appetizers so I just had a bowl of Lobster Bisque.  HUGE chunks of lobster in there and so warm and satisfying.  This will be my choice from now on if I'm not feeling super hungry.    Pappadeaux definitely has my vote as the best seafood place in Phoenix.

ZYrfA8ACgebHMeMSjSLOcQ.text: We've driven by Pappadeaux's on I-17 for years and have always wanted to stop for a meal but rushed by to get home 100 miles North.  Until today, that is.  Seven of  us lunched here and all were very satisfied.  The appetizer was about the the best and lightest deep fried calamari I've had in years, the gumbo was authentic and good, and my fried oysters were wonderfully done.  The seafood pasta dishes, fried shrimp, tilapia and catfish got high praise from the others. The batter on everything was light with no hint of oiliness. I lived in new Orleans for several years.  Cajun style food this good with uncommonly courteous service in the New Orleans manner  would get praise on the Gulf...to find it in desert-bound Phoenix AZ is amazing. The drinks are great too but I give only 4 stars because its become pricey. Figure about $50 each with two drinks per.

emRF7cfkZSNAhAJh86OFFg.text: This place is simply amazing.  If this place didn't break the bank I would be there all the time.  The crab cakes covered in rich sause with crawdad's is unbelievable.  Atmosphere draws you in and the service is top notch.  It is pricey but once you taste the food you will understand the price.

-LE5WbY7Avow_11Hoavgmw.text: Love...love...LOVE this place. And I think I'm hearing life music, what a treat. The fried alligator is the most.

cP0-NEXq3sXGPXjMZXcFsg.text: Visited Pappadeaux's on a Friday around 8pm and there was no wait so we quickly ordered drinks and began looking at the menus.  We munched on bread while we waited for our dinner.  I ordered the Seafood Platter ($25) while my friend ordered a pasta and seafood dish ($30).  Our waiter was Brian and he was a friendly guy. He appeared to be new as he had to see the menu to know what sides and such we would receive.  The blue lump crab cake was good, but not as good as I remembered. All the food seemed to taste the same.  I also had the spaghetti squash and it was fairly bland. My friend devoured her pasta and seafood dish, but it wasn't much food for the price.

_FpcIs2DtvBCiz6UP6KoIA.text: A solid cajun restaurant.  I really like gumbo - ambrosia for the gods as far as I'm concerned (the gods miraculously don't gain weight from it).  Yes, I've had better gumbo elsewhere, but the gumbo here was quite flavorful and I enjoyed it.  I tend to prefer the creole gumbo which is usually thicker than the cajun gumbo (the gumbo here seemed to be of the thinner cajun variety), but meh, it was still good.  I only ate here for lunch.  So, I got the gumbo with a half po-boy.  The po-boy was also quite good.  I picked the shrimp version.  Could have used more shrimp on the po-boy to fill it out a bit more, but again, not a deal breaker.  Price is tipped on the higher end for my usual standards.  This is expected for any place that serves seafood though.  So, I wasn't surprised.  My server was excellent.  Polite, knowledgeable, prompt.  Can't complain.  Ambience.  Again, can't complain.  Seemed nice, though from what I read, it can get loud at dinner.

j7DNFNrgdRvfmp9ARVKD_Q.text: I really don't give 5 stars that often (ever?) but I absolutely love Pappadeaux.  Both times I have eaten there, I've gotten absolutely delicious food across the board.  Typically I will have appetizers (mussels, clams, some gumbo, etc.) but I've also had the trout (which was delicious).  I find their food seasoned well, balanced in flavor, and visually appetizing without tasting too greasy or obnoxiously oily/buttery.  They are open late as well, and the drinks are outstanding.  Fresh lime juice margaritas, not too sweet, with Patron where they don't skimp on the booze?  What can be better?  Pardon my brevity on this review, but just go and you won't be disappointed.  Hats off to the Pappas' group for bringing a great restaurant to Phoenix.  Please don't expand and ruin a good thing either!

8AVXetkK_LipxAgvtEmVoA.text: We went on a Friday night. Very busy. My husband had the MahiMahi with Dirty rice it was Bomb!! I had the shrimp, scallops with pasta which too me was way too salty and unedible. The waiter was very good offering me a replacement. Great customer service but very pricy for the ambiance.

UDA89a10E7M85tJdPzbohA.text: 2 favorite dishes are Costa Rica Talapia with spaghetti squash  or blackened Costa Rican mahi with cream cheese grits.   Came here again yesterday with my family and since my son is sensitive to many things the manager came out and asked us exactly what he was allergic to in order to make something custom just for my son.  He was so accommodating that I just had to write another review on it.  I had to order my usual Talapia and it was fantastic as well.  I also did not know that they ship in new seafood daily and everything here is homemade, which is probably why this place is full of awesomeness!

QLF9POeeDRc3wHmbke2nsA.text: Maybe it's because this Pappadeaux is in the desert it's not as good as the one's in Texas. But I have been to one in Dallas and one in the Houston airport and both are much better.  Sorry but I don't remember what I had but I just wasn't impressed and didn't get the feeling the seafood was really fresh. I guess I will continue to look for a place to get fried seafood in Arizona.  If you are expecting Pappadeaux like it is in Texas don't go here. If you are expecting Legal Seafood don't go here.

8pd8l018K2A05MDN5xgSrQ.text: Oh, where to begin..  I stopped by Pappadeaux last week to grab a bite when on a Wed, they told me it was a 45min wait for two.. wow.  The place was packed.   The hostess recommended we make a reservation for the weekend, so we made one for Friday at 7PM.  The smells coming from the place when you first pull in automatically keep you wondering what delicious things are waiting inside.    I'm so glad we did.   We showed up and they gave us a card with a number and once our number showed up on the screen, it was seating time.  I think we waited maybe ten minutes.  After gazing over the menu for a quick minute, we decided to try the fried alligator with creole sauce.  Being one to enjoy new things, I was pretty excited.  The waiter took our drink orders and and put in the appetizer.  The place at this point was insanely packed, but it was nice to see a place like this.  Made ya feel that something good was to come.  Heck, a place cant' suck if it's this packed, right?   So we order our food, I decided on the stuffed shrimp and the rest of my friends all ordered different things.  It would be a share-a-meal night..   About 10min into drinks and conversation, they bring out the fried alligator..  Ok, if you've never eaten anything weird before.  Please please.. you've got to try this.  It sorta reminded me of a cross between soft pork or chicken.  The taste literally melted in my mouth.  To top it off, the creole sauce that went with it, only complimented it.  I could easily have eaten the entire plate alone.  Sadly, I had to share..  After quickly destroying the fried alligator, we got our entrees.  I took one bite and had to pause a moment.. the taste of the stuff shrimp with the crab, Alfredo, spices inside just floored me.  There were only six pieces, but after sharing a piece or two and eating the amazing green beans, this was plenty of food.   I can't wait for my next trip here.. fantastic food.

YboXe1tKhHtAbdwrD24fzw.text: I love this place! They don't have it on the menu any more but one of my favorite things you can still order is Mediterranean style calamari. The gator appetizer has the best sauce too. My favorite experience there was when they had a live jazz band playing. It's very noisy and crowded and usually you have to wait for a table but it's SO worth it if you like seafood.

6V4yrzkkQbPvJQk9HLAftg.text: Honestly this was the best meal with my family in a very long time. Not only is this place absolutely beautiful, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the food is amazing! I had the spiked cherry limeade with my dinner (yum!). We also had both the calamari  and the alligator and appetizers. My husband and daughter had steak and lobster and I had the grilled shrimp brochettes. Each dish was fresh and flavorful! Not a dud in the bunch. We had a wonderful time and are looking forward to returning.

9dVYD2v7rGebT7MHQlDBDQ.text: Service was awesome tonight. Although they over cook my filet mignon, they gave me another hole order to make up. Thank you

bpeSwp79hFATAqyLQKmEcA.text: Treated my friend's family here recently, on a busy Sunday night.  We have been here several times now, but I do not remember the food taking this long.  We had reservations for a party of 7 at 6:30pm, we showed up early at 6:15pm  but we still had to wait till about 6:50pm to be seated.  It was extremely busy.  Food took awhile but it was worth it.  Our server was pretty nice and overall we had a good experience.

PL23afQpGWVZ9t_KtvkNCA.text: The BEST seafood every time we go and great service too!!! We had the best lobster we have ever had !!! The fried alligator with that dip is amazing !!

7L7i8yrOb1IY8aE2JcVX5A.text: I try to get to Pappadeaux at least 3 times per month.  This time I ordered catfish and grits it did not disappoint. The place was busy (typical) but the service was good and fast. Oh and they have a great happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t really go wrong with Pappadeaux.

bLt4xgsFjNeWDjCtiUFm5g.text: I really love coming here.. even if we only come here for sometime of celebration but every time it's soooooo worth it! My husband and I have been here 4 times now and every time it's been nothing but the best dinner ever.  A must you must get or try whatever floats your boat is the alligator tail. Don't be so quick to judge this taste appetizer we usually get half blacked half deep fried. Our 8 year old says it's his favorite thing to get when we come. And we all know kids are picky but he loves it. Our last time in we got that and we got the trio which came with calamari, this mini shrimp/crawfish cheese dip and the alligator tail. The dip was amazing only down side is that it only came with 2 little slices of bread we were a large party of 8.  I always go in and get the giant shrimp with giants it's a no fail amazing dish. My husband is always daring and willing to try something different but his all time favorite to get is Atlantic salmon Yvette... it's his favorite other then the gumbo lol. And you can't leave without getting a dessert Come eat make a reservation before you come in It's amazing

tED7ra376tUgU8S4jVM6Qw.text: We were very disappointed with our first visit to Pappadeaux for dinner. It's a beautiful restaurant and the service was attentive. We were surprised by the high prices for such small portions. We ordered a farm raised grilled salmon and it only came with about a half a pound of undercooked and cold green beans. The fish was too salty for my taste. I ordered a cup of hot tea and the water came back lukewarm twice. We also had two salads that were drenched in dressing and one fried shrimp appetizer that was cold. All told we paid $90 for this meal.

8LU8Cfk1KG2CvgWMFgmQNg.text: Love this place. We go here for every special occasion usually. However the last time we went I ordered scallops and after awhile they come back to say they ran out. How do you run out of scallops?  oh well. Still love this place

2S88Nji8HawU7nEFuDVOcA.text: Coconut shrimp was outstanding.  Dirty rice was over spiced and bitter to taste.    Excellent service.

qUaCcBpnV9U-xJ48_FEHsw.text: The food here is always fantastic, so pricy but what do you expect to pay for great quality seafood?

DN486nRlnr2r8saHcpXmWg.text: I'm always excited when my boss takes us to Pappadeaux but I'm never really happy with my food. The staff is polite and they handle our large groups real well.

h_CQNfEBuPnYxGF41RYOHg.text: Excellent! My ONLY somewhat of a criticism would be that it's kind of loud in the dining room.. Was hard to talk with our party but, we were aware of that, our guests had never been & we just didn't think about it before making reservations.. but the food and service outweighed the noise!! BY FAR!!

00Qjntep678CFvaDncBnzQ.text: For all the money and hype, this seafood restaurant is not all it's cracked up to be. The food was under seasoned and lacking. I was so excited to eat go eat there again only to be let down. I've been there many years ago and remember enjoying whatever seafood pasta dish I had ordered.  But this recent visit left me wanting more and unfortunately it wasn't more food from them.

ecStkFUIY3e8GeB0NAF7iQ.text: I love this place! Service is great from the door greater to the waiters. The  food here  is delicious.  I've  tasted all their plates made with Mahi Mahi. Have the alligator  or frog legs appetizer next time you stop by if you're not in the mood for trying something new try the calamari. You can not leave without having desert they are all good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y8A1_RQf8wdMiWsq8dJpNw.text: Beautiful atmosphere/decor.  We had a great family dinner here. I had shrimp and lobster, so good.  We will definitely return.

5oK5J0cPcBlJKVQjHCH_AA.text: Never disappoints, large portions great southern atmosphere and the food is delicious. You have to get the crawfish trio, not on the menu and it's worth every bite. Fresh food cooked to perfection. Off the chain!

QRYQ7Ih_vERAwhH0BTAquQ.text: This was our first visit to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen. It was fantastic, we had a great server named Wyatt. He was very helpful and explained about the Seafood. We ordered the Grilled Spanish Octopus appetizer and were so happy we did, it was awesome. Then I ordered Halibut in garlic butter sauce and  a Shrimp and Jumbo Lump Crab Cobb Salad, both were exceptional and the portions are huge. We were full but went ahead and ordered a piece of Key Lime Pie with a praline and graham cracker crust it came with fresh whipped creams and a raspberry sauce. Everything was fantastic and we are already plotting our return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key Lime Pie
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Jumbo Lump Crab Cobb Salad
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naked Halibut in Garlic Butter Sauce

OxluQvMJRzpL3pMyY_sncw.text: I really enjoy Pappadeaux's amazing southern cuisine.  The etouffee is incredible, the oysters are always fresh and reasonably priced.  This restaurant gets pack and can get loud on the inside.  I recommended stopping in when the nights are little cooler and patio seating is available.  Nurse a cocktail while you savor your meal and stick around for the live music.

HdCPbZNi0RaR27L11jEmrg.text: One of our family's favorites.  Can't go wrong here. Good service, usually, and always great food.

3daPp5NyEtLCOKV6lNiwrA.text: Fun place. But a recently changed menu took off the best salad.  Now gone is the lobster/shrimp/crab salad. We always make it a point to stop at the other sites at DFW and IAH.  Not my more.

wAl8SKDh7nn-JMKfT3U5_A.text: My new favorite spot! Everything was yummy! Even my children loved it!the servings were huge and our waitress was awesome! Definitely returning

kEL2tJeuPLgEHgDOsvPCtQ.text: The seafood here is awesome! Love the atmosphere & the prices are good for the portions, always great service and friendly staff!

fQfmnl_wpnt5pj_iUYMZ-g.text: It kills me to write bad reviews and I know this place has a good rep. I just had a bad experience and rating off my experience. My waitress was extremely aggressive, it's common sense to cater to who you're serving. One of the people I was with wanted to know the price difference between a smaller and larger glass of wine, the waitress didn't know which is totally understandable and we would never expect for them to know off the top of their head but at that point is when you check and find out. She asked but wasn't nice about it. I ordered my food and asked for the sauce on the side (which is was) but the shrimp was in the sauce, the reason why I wanted it on the side is for portion control which is pretty obvious. Aside from that, my fish was too salty. The waitresses short and aggressive attitude was not welcoming at all. She could have had a bad day to give her the benefit of the doubt but the food was not that great either. Not sure what the hype is all about, I probably wouldn't come back again.

g-81Wiu90-t-1c8JTN51zQ.text: First time that I try alligator meat and it was actually really good... food is amazing...  deserts really good also..

ItGfyR5D13zWBPCuIOaJnw.text: Went here with my friend and the wait time was horrible. It took them 2 hours to sit us because they were so busy. However the service was amazing and the food here is to die for. Honestly worth the 2 hours wait but still too long to wait for food. That's how you lose customers. When seated noticed there were many tables open..... The bus boys took their sweet time cleaning tables and didn't seem to care. If they're faster people can get seated a lot sooner.

YIcEOAhOp8nxzTTWUgZ4mg.text: So we went Pappadeaux'a in Phoenix! It was terrible we got the Caatfish/Cod and it was decent, I got the Filet Mignon with Asparagus and Mash potato's and the only thing that was good was the Mash Potatoes! But they have Military/LE Discount NEVER COMING BACK!

Yl3THEQEALI9OwfABuHzDw.text: I was looking for a location to host a party of 50 for a business function and this was perfect. The service was top notch, food delicious and atmosphere exactly what I wanted. I love their outdoor garden so I had our event on the patio. I had the salmon that melts in your mouth and my husband had the shrimp wrapped in bacon. They should rename it " heaven shrimp "

F7wNaTkT8DGQEsTQm6MPZw.text: Close your eyes; listen to the waves on the beach crashing, the smell of fresh shrimp in the air, the warmth of the sun massaging your complexion.  Oh wait we're not in the Bahamas, were at Pappadeaux!   Great atmosphere, AMAZING food, and great service. Growing up in a beach house, I know fresh seafood. I'm talking fish and shrimp from water to plate in 10-20 minutes! This place is amazing! Not only did it taste fresh, but it was fresh! Either they have the ocean in their back kitchen or their transporting their product in giant fish tanks using 18 wheelers!  Great food, great people, amazing experience.  Thank's Pappadeaux's for an amazing experience with my wife.

ejtd69Isxx88Xep3nIklbQ.text: Great, I mean talky great service today. Food is always good here. We stayed for a few hours for a meeting today and service was consistent the entire time.   I certainly will be back.

Igma0N9ssnTCNF5x0lPh5Q.text: What an absolute disappointment this place was and we are still kicking ourselves for going. We walked out of their wondering "What in the world, these people must all be lottery winners"! I had the Mahi Mahi which was really quite good.  My husband ordered the pasta with scallops, shrimp and octopus which came out ice cold and had to be sent back. It was completely tasteless and after being warned about the "cajun" flare that it would be spicy was the opposite and bland. We had the oysters in romano cheese, these were really great, but I ended up sick all night.  We walked out with $145.00 less in our pockets and quite dissatisfied.  Service was mediocre and they leave trays of dirty food in and around the tables.  I had to ask that the one next to me be moved as it was gross looking at other patrons dirty plates. Atmosphere is great, but we will not be returning! My advice, go to Blue Water Grill, you'll get more bang for your buck.

KN_4Anyz3rnY5urXBwXIpw.text: Loved!  Oysters were wonderful. Red fish and lump crab with jumbo shrimp and squash risotto and the pasta with vodka cream sauce were delicious and very well done. I was a little disappointed on the bread pudding; it was okay, but I'd come back any time.  The service was prestigious.  Barely any wait time for NYE at 9:30pm. It was great.

ht_CI8FY1exW4BkiuoIR2w.text: Not sure how I feel about this restaurant. Came here for the first time last night.  I was given silverware with a visibly dirty disgusting napkin, had to ask for another set. Waitress never offered drink refills, had to ask. Very very busy and only the large party tables really received attention, our table was not as important. Lastly , asked to see dessert tray. Picked out bread pudding then later told they were out. Offered another dessert complimentary but then we were charged for it. Good grief.

ViQp-t3ed6TeYbqIoYe7Tg.text: We tried this place last night. We both ordered the seafood andouille gumbo. It's a very watery gumbo and there was bits of crab shell in my gumbo I had to pick out. We then went on to order side salads and then the picatta halibut. We received our meals after ordering in like 10 min. It was really fast but a little too fast. If it was fresh halibut I think it would take a little bit longer to cook. The halibut did not taste fresh and was really mushy and fishy tasting. We never received the salads. We also got the butternut squash which is streamed plain squash, no seasoning and it didn't taste like any butter either. I was really disappointed because I've heard such great things about this place.

lP76YoPKVlzPwL5LyO5b6w.text: My favorite restaurant in world and they are from Texas! They never disappoint me, great service, great food, great atmosphere, clean restrooms, if I give it a negative mark it would be the wait to get in, there is always a wait but it is so worth it! Thank you Pappadeauxs!

v1ntWzXtpPVSyk-24o_7-Q.text: I WILL NEVER STOP COMING HERE!!! Everything I have ever ordered has been phenomenal. Great service & atmosphere!!! Worth the wait...

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d5AsaEUFHtUjLp9bdmnl1A.text: I had the Crispy Alaskan Salmon & Scallop, and Crete Brulee. Both were excellent. My main arrived a little cool. I asked the server to warm it up. The manager cane over right away, treated me to a beverage, and removed the main from my bill (which was not necessary but appreciated). I enjoyed every bite. Excellent old fashioned service and cooking deserves 5 stars.

wB3KYvcK4IZXODzy8GEzVg.text: For healthier items, eat from the "naked fish" menu; that's what I did. The meal started with a crispy Cesar salad, which was very traditional, and if you love this kind of salad this will do the trick.   My main course was the 11oz Costa Rican Tilapia, which was served with a green bean potato medley. Fresh fish, cooked right, no complaints.   I want to come back on a cheat day and get on down with some of their fried foods, and tempting desserts. This is a beautiful restaurant on the inside and out. Bring a date, have some wine, eat some oysters, get all hot & randy, then go home and make sa-weet love to each other.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The patio
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Costa Rican Tilapia

lHBCCN_232dC3wMB-9ix5Q.text: First time dining here....extremely disappointed. We dined for my girlfriends birthday on a Friday night. It was a very busy night, which was encouraging in the hopes that a lot of people obviously like eating here. We sat at a round table in a corner of the dining room (we had a party of 6). Even though we were in a corner, it was extremely loud. I could barely hear my girlfriend who was sitting next to me...not much anyone can do about that, so that's not why I'm giving them 2 stars.   The reason why is whoever is on the grill in the kitchen needs to find a new profession. I ordered the Fillet with lobster tail, and for paying upwards of $60 for that plate, my expectations should be somewhat high. Boy was I let down. I ordered the steak medium rare, it came out charred on the outside (literally crunchy each bite) yet bloody and undercooked on the inside. I hate sending food back, but for what I'm paying, I had no choice. The lobster was a bit dry, but I ate it anyways. By the time the second Fillet came out, everyone else had finished their meals. As soon as I laid eyes on it I could tell it was under cooked....again. It was so freaking bloody, I swear I heard it Moo. I could barely cut into it, it was so freaking rare. At that point I just told the waiter (who was a nice guy) that I did not want another one. He took it off the bill, as expected.   Overall, if you're going to spend that kind of money on a nice dinner, don't waste your money here.

oqLOCxG8nVMuE4w_4Ncctw.text: This is one of my top 5 favorites in the US. Great sea food. If you come before 6 usually can get in quick.  The salmon topped with one of their sauces is the best you have ever had.  This location in Phoenix is equal to their Huston locations. 2 can share any meal and be full.

VMV-duYKeQCvQQebAYdJhA.text: This is definitely the go to place for seafood in Phoenix. That said, I don't really like fish that much so I didn't really know what to order. I got the blackened catfish because I figure that is a staple in this type of eatery and it was pretty good for what I ordered. I definitely would go for the shellfish though, they've got some great deals during happy hour.

CYQ46oy9koMqCAAAZDgLNg.text: Soooo disappointed. We use to love Pappadeaux, but it wasn't good this time. We moved to Sedona and brought friends down to enjoy a great seafood restaurant, but it wasn't the same. All of our dishes came out cold. Clam chowder, they did take off because it was sent back. No one had eaten their fries, and our friend had left most of his shrimp. The oysters were great!!!  Our poor server was overwhelmed and was lacking on refills and forgot most of what we had asked for. We would love to bring more friends back, but probably will not make the drive, since it's not the same. Too bad.

1Lnl15nFmFOm9eqnuJnJrQ.text: My favorite things here are the fried alligator and for my entree I always get the bacon wrapped shrimp, it's to die for and by far the best thing on the menu. Such a unique flavor I love coming here ... oh and the swap things are a must try!

ANHz2ZrbvVotKJlh7209NQ.text: I had reservations at 8pm on Feb 10th, for 17. 17 wasn't able to make it which they stated was fine. It was 14 of us. They informed me that as long as majority of my party was there they'd seat us by 8p, well my whole party of 14 was at the establishment by 745. I informed them that my party was here they reassured me they'd get us seated. 805 comes around we're still waiting by the bar, my party was hungry and their feet were getting tired. I asked the, rude and dismissive, woman upfront and one stated their getting the tables together now, it'll be just a moment longer. So, 820/830 rolls around, now "it's the party won't leave, they've been there for over 3hrs, and i cant ask them to leave, Im sorry"...and this was stated by Kathy the Hispanic manager. We were not seated until after 9pm...approx 930 was when my party and I were seated at two different tables, not one as promised. The waiter Mike was awesome but the food was bland, and mediocre I did not eat my entree and neither did my friend next to me. It seemed rushed, taking they close at 10, it might've been. The manager did offer us free appetizers...but my whole birthday experience was ruined because of how they lied to us and then separated us at the tables, and made less than mediocre food. When I asked at 805 if we were getting seated she should have gotten the manager and told me the truth then, and the manager kept stating we'd be seated soon, but soon was an hr and a half later. Had I known they gave our table to another party we could've left and ate somewhere else. My friends/family and I loved Pappadeux before this horrible experience. We won't be giving them anymore of our service. Thanks for making my birthday experience and unforgettable one by the way we were treated.

mvPl21V5Q7godPNXzNOiSw.text: Simply terrific!!! Our waitress Audrey was the best!!! The food was delicious so happy we went out. I had the Pappadeaux platter way more than enough for two. The atmosphere was amazingly relaxing and welcoming. Best customer service I've had in a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappadeaux sampler
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappadeaux sampler
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mud slide

V06UH_sK4mzLNhniq6Ckyw.text: Having grown up in Texas, exposed to lots of cajun food and now living in LA where there is none, a promised visit to Pappadeaux was what sealed the deal for me to visit Phoenix.   Pappadeaux did not disappoint - food was just as good as I remembered the chain to be in Texas. I love my crawfish etouffee. And going at lunch (even on the weekends) is definitely the best bang for your buck. They are very, very generous with the portions.

8qoPUWNPIC1gZHBCpLDiqQ.text: I went to Pappadeaux last night for my Birthday and I have to say it was the worst experience that I have had. Although there was a bright spot and that was our waitress Latica, she was the best part of the evening. We got there and was seated then ordered and it took 55 mins to get our food. Latica kept apologizing for wait and she offered a Salad or Bread. Then when the food came it was one the worst meals that I have had. There was so much water in the plate that the food had no taste. The Shrimp and Scallops were both over cooked. The waitress got the manager to come over and he acted like that he didn't even care. So we told the waitress that we were ready to leave and paid the bill and left. Again the best part of the waitress.

6c8Ki3dRhcXXoxIExkTIXw.text: So our night begins with arriving at Pappadeaux at 6pm with my family for my mother birthday. Wait time is an hour to an hour and half (which is to be expected for a family of 17 on a Friday night). We are finally seated at 745pm and dinner orders are taken within 10-15mins. Time ticks away and no food, more time and still no food. Asked our server, along with another server and what seems to be a manager and all three gave us the same seemingly rude perhaps rehearsed responses which basically blamed us for having a large party. As a paying customer we should NEVER be treated as an inconvenience or daunting task. Again it's to be expected to have a wait for our food BUT NEVER place blame and attitude on your customers! I'm so disappointed and saddened to see my mothers birthday dinner ruined, especially after seeing and hearing her excitement all week. Her favorite cake was also brought to the restaurant but by that point mom was so upset she just took the cake home! After so many years of enjoying Pappadeaux, I will never again let a restaurant spoiled a family members birthday!

qjP_dTk8OYtZPutTUTKWPg.text: I'll be honest, the food and bread is outstanding as well as the whole experience and ambiance altogether.  It's a beautiful place, but expensive and should be kept only for special occasions!

NCQGY2OZhs75q7pkbMZTXw.text: We love this place. The stuffed shrimp are to die for!!! The lighting stinks but the food makes up for it...it is pricey so make sure you got enough in the bank..drinks are good as well.... Great party room too

RmEBwnMdaTidLGNGKCjaNg.text: There's really so much to say about Pappa's. I've been a repeat customer for over 20 years. Go and try it yourself and see why!

anM2Fc9CdQRUosbKsbjiGw.text: The food the service and the atmosphere are good not great. I have been here several times and each time I am whelmed. They tend to go a little heavy on the dirty rice but other than that I can't complain. The overall experience was very meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IPlArIOYsAtuMGo11uJ_zQ.text: If you like any kind of seafood, this is the place for you! The trio-appetizer is amazing. Crawfish and shrimp fondeux, fried alligator (better than I had in NOLA!) and calamari. Next course was lobster bisque, which is easiest the best I've ever had!! I had the stuffed shrimp for dinner and it was perfect. My boyfriend had the Mardi Gras pasta and the sausage in it was the best thing on the table.  I had the sweet potato pecan pie for dessert and I could eat a whole pie of that! The creme brulee looked awesome, but no one at the table ordered it. That will be for next time.   I HIGHLY recommend this place if you're craving creole or seafood...or both!! It is a bit pricey but definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8rJ18ho0zvL7sn1SzpyFZA.text: Its a good franchise with great Cajun cuisine, a fancy atmosphere, a bit pricey if you are in a budget but so good. I recommend trying the blackened alligator. Woooooweeee

hutYNd8DforXHC-ofxyUBw.text: Best creme Brule I've had in arizona! And the half smoked Half fried alligator appetizers are to die for! And I had never even tried alligator before! I've had it in a few other places but this by far is the best! I'm guessing it's supposed to be "fancy" but people come however they want to dress. So don't worry about it if you are in jeans

p50dKlw_PdqHQw_qrhf4gQ.text: I was in Phoenix for the NFL Pro Bowl last weekend and had to try this place because it came with a very good recommendation. We had a dozen Taxes oysters, fried alligators and calamaris for appetizers and for dinner we had seafood gumbo, lobster bisque, and a seafood grilled combo which came with shrimp, white fish, vegetables and rice. Huge portions of food. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and taste really good. The servers were really attentive to all their customers. Oh the spicy Bloody Mary were very good also.

b4VQAVn0ZCFXQh9mB2wfYw.text: What a great evening! My husband and I enjoy trying new restaurants (to us) and decided it was time to try Papadeaux's. I'm not going to lie, I was a little apprehensive since I'm not a "frog leg" or "alligator" type of person and up until this point, that's all I knew of Papadeaux's.  Boy was I wrong! Brenda, our server, was so helpful and suggested different ways we could try our selection of foods. She was on point with checking in at our table to make sure everything was good. Drinks never went empty and the food arrived one right after the other. Our bartender came by our table and it was then we learned he was actually one of the managers. Forrest had heard it was our first visit and wanted to  expressed his gratitude that we chose to visit Papadeaux's and even went out of his way to make sure our first visit was perfect. I've never been so pleased with a restaurant before visiting Papadeaux's so a big thank you to Brenda and Forrest. The drinks were amazing, the food was amazing, the service was amazing, everything was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pecan Praline Cheesecake
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jumbo Shrimp Brochette (front) and Jumbo Sea Scallops and Shrimp (back)
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Greek salad with lump crab meat.

AZvut3_LyejsEwBKffI9OQ.text: Food here is really good ..had the fried platter which consisted of crawfish, shrimp, fish. Couldn't finish ...!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood platter : crawfish, shrimp, fish
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Swamp thang

pfSCkuhDvUZJfl2OdpE3GQ.text: Wow, I'm going to have to give my first awful review. Waited 15 minutes for our first waiter visit, then another 15 minutes for a glass of water, so we were 45 minutes in before ordering. I had such high hopes for a good sea food experience in the desert. Their menu says, "fresh fish flown in daily," but I know what frozen filets taste like. I ordered the naked halibut. The Brussels sprouts were flavorful, burnt and very oily. Oily as in sitting in a pool of oil. The halibut might have been okay if it had come out to the table on time but it had obviously sat in the window for at least 15 or 20 minutes, because it was maybe just barely luke warm and extremely dry. I was tempted to suffer through it with a smile but three bites in I crunched into a small pebble. I gave up after that. My wife ordered the redfish risotto. The risotto was decent but the fish was cold, dry and over salted. Son ordered chicken fingers. They were extra extra well done (over fried) as well, and he said the fries tasted like cardboard. Truly disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Custom glasses will remain empty for most of your meal. First drink served in a broken glass!

cY0Lchn-8HUbxQuMpLzQVw.text: This place is by far the best seafood in Arizona, this is why it gets 5 stars. However, it is a bit pricey on the food. But Pappadeaux also has some seasonal specials that make up for that. Like 50 cents an oyster. I could spend all day there at that price. Also they have a great happy hour both on drinks and food.  Its a great atmosphere also with great service. They offer a variety of mixed drinks that are superb. I recommend the sweet tea and the swamp thing.  Also don't forget to try the crispy fried alligator ;)

xybpTgHzaYzshPUeVmYW2A.text: Happy Hour and Calamari with the fresh marinara is great! Also the Fondue is rich and cheeses. Customer Service is hit or miss. Some days they are fabulous while others they are dull and unhelpful and I end up having to reorder my food because it was incorrect.

Egg4XtYIqc5eOaXtGbQREQ.text: Came here for a mamas night out date night. We arrived around 630p on a Saturday. The atmosphere here is wonderful. The good: large menu selection, fresh fish, beautiful dining areas, polite waitstaff,  delicious desserts, decent wait time during peak hours. The bad: we were seated at a corner table in the main walkway directly outside the bussing station. Worst table in the house. We asked for another table as soon as we were sat there and the hostess told us we would have to go back on the wait list. We were re-sat in about 5 minutes. The next 2 couples they tried to sit at this table also asked for other seating. Our food took almost 45 minutes to come out. My scallops were overdone and the risotto was chewy and raw. It was very loud inside and hard to hear. Poor parking. All in all, if I could rate 3.5 stars I would.

wUeyGqiatjYCDL9HgyNh8w.text: Great food and service.  Love the dozen oysters on the half shell special they are offering during December Mon-Thurs - just wish it was all year round!

OpZq9stwaK-apdlQWi4RFQ.text: Ridiculously overpriced.  If you want good Cajun food, head on out to Flavors of Louisiana in Avondale.  Better prices, great food. Heck, you're better off at Popeyes on Greenway and 35th Ave.

1fkaw7f_Bf7yFTx6K1iPfg.text: My family ate here on Christmas eve.  The pros: crawfish bisque was excellent, the serve was great, the deserts were very good - large portions.  The cons: my Crawfish platter which included both Etoufee and fried crawfish was awful.  The etoufee had a dark brown gravy like taste that overwhelmed the few small pieces of crawfish it included over brown/dirty rice.  It was nasty, I picked out a few of the crawfish, but their flavor was overwhelmed with dark sauce -- I didn't eat.  The fried crawfish was a little better, but instead of being lightly fried, it was very small pieces of crawfish with heavy breading.  Basically, my meal was a waste - so I really didn't bother to eat much of it.  On the flip side, the rest of my family thought the place was pretty good -- not excellent, but good.  I would recommend avoiding the fried platters. My son ordered the chicken, he rated it as nothing special. I should mention that the noise level in the restaurant was extremely loud - so much so, there was a strong desire to exit as soon as possible, even possibly boxing the deserts to go home and eat instead.  Based on this experience, I have no plans to return.  UPDATE:  I guess Pappadeaux reads these reviews as they contacted me shortly after posting.  They asked if I'd be willing to give them another try when in Phoenix if they sent me a gift certificate.  I agreed, but even after providing address information, no certificate was ever received.  (In all fairness, I do know others who have visited other Pappadeaux locations and say it's great.  It just wasn't my experience.)

kMKhZcWHEE5llZzjBfSjVQ.text: Great service. The only thing is the waitress was ghost like. Asked for my ice tea couple times to be refilled. Got my salads the same time I received my lobster a little annoying. Overall food outstanding

sldDeKxBMC9aL0sL-TKjAg.text: This place has never failed me! I am familiar with Pappadeaux's because it used to be my favorite place to eat at when I lived in Houston Texas. I now live in Michigan and there isn't any there. So we had to have this for our dinner when I found them on Yelp. The food is fantastic and the ambiance is fantastic as well.

xQKeXuRSlQZsFtvj005N4A.text: I give it 4 stars only because the place was so PACKED and the service was a little slow but understandable.   Even packed like it was, I thought they did a nice job.  The alligator was great! we got the combo blacked and fried, we both prefer the blackened.  Our steaks were well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  We'll be back the next time we are in town.

sWviQKVJv0AxAhkAEQFPTw.text: This must be an acquired taste cuisine I have never given a place 1 star but we have a winner . Let's get right to it the shrimp po boy a foot long baguette with 5 pieces of tiny shrimp plenty of old lettuce and wilted tomatoes and the shrimp andouille gumbo is it supposed to taste like old tap water and tomato sauce? This by far was the most disappointing $80 ever spent . As we tried to stomach our food we observed other people also with disappointment bottom line the food was flavorless I wish I could turn back time on this dining experience wow!

vsACff1hip5q6c7l9f-Znw.text: Normally my go-to place for great Seafood. Tonight was a gigantic this appointment. The prices have gone up just like everything in this world but the quality and the portions have gone way down. Very unexpected dinner tonight not very happy will return but hope that he gets better and portions get back to normal. The picture is of a soft shell crab. I've never seen such a pathetic soft shell crab.

mShnVNij8cyVqB5pC-gzOQ.text: I took my daughter for her first visit to any Pappadeaux restaurant. We thought all was great until today,  2 days later, Thanksgiving Day, when we discovered that we DID NOT get the featured sweet potato pecan pie!!! Ugh!!  Imagine your mouth is watering just thinking about it. You open the box and it's a plain old pecan pie! We gave it to another person who likes it. No dessert. Oh yeah, they're closed.

JQiqz7LiTrvOFpfZlmsIrQ.text: I was in Phoenix celebrating my Birthday and had to  eat at Pappadeaux. I had a reservation for 7pm, but arrived a little early. They weren't quite ready as they were extremely busy, so we waiting until just about 7pm. The waitress was nice and welcoming, appetizers were delicious, the bread was addictive (my weakness), meal was great (didn't have room for dessert) and the swamp thing was tasty! If ever in Phoenix again, I will be back.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Birthday Girl...Fabulous 47!
