6cCYDWGKrUubYKzeFZuKRQ.text: So Cal residents staying in Phoenix decided to try Pappadeaux. Greeted by our waiter Jacob who was friendly, helpful explaining menu items and all around great waiter.  Ordered Glazed Salmon with Scallops and it was delish......so cooked well and presented.  COuple of appetizers that were great as well..... Supervisor Alejandro S. came over and asked how dinner was and spoke to us several minutes about our dinner....Nice.....Highly recommend this restaurant to all. Great dining experience.............

p_hXVUTaE1QZrjGY350Inw.text: Good service food was tasty  Expect a longer lunch time relaxing time  Nice atmosphere

h-W-n4_8YqrXU_N6yowfAg.text: Tonight's dinner and service by Conner was excellent! We were looking for a good seafood dinner and dessert. That's exactly what we got! If we're ever back in the PHX area we'll be sure to stop in.

afuchn35MzbDlk8vjM-4Eg.text: I'm a chef, so it's very easy to criticize other chefs food, can't say enough, this place is delicious, on point with every dish. I've been there a few times when I'm in town, tasted almost everything and I don't think there was anything I didn't like.

bSb9ddUf21874UB3gC7z1Q.text: Oh Lord how did I not review Pappadeaux's. I've been going here since the first night they opened and I stood in line for three hours to try their tasty food. This place is Louisiana amazing. The freshest tastiest fish. You can have frog legs & alligator tail if you country folk. I'm country folk, we come from the swamp in North Carolina. We eat fried everything. My favorite thing ever is the Pappadeaux's platter because it has so much food and the only thing better is the deluxe you can literally feed five grown adults or two hangry people. You get two fish fillets of your choice always get catfish. it's the best. Enough oysters and crawfish that it should be an appetizer. Then the most amazing stuffed crab.  When you think it can't get any better they break out with the stuffed shrimp as good as the crab.the mountain of french fries you get are some of the tastiest fries I've ever had. They remind me of childhood fries at home. Always get the gator no matter who you are. It's delicious, it tastes like the best chicken nuggets ever. The Po boys are amazing. I've had a steak here. Tasty, but why do you go to fish place for steak doesn't make sense. You can do it but I always say get the fish. Blackend is my favorite way to get any of the fish if it's not fried. the gator water and the swamp thing are my two favorite drinks I don't know which ones which but they both are delicious and I never get mad if I order the wrong one. When you see the lines you know it's a good thing I also saw my peoples waiting in line and I knew if they could sit through church all day long and then wait in line for some food, it was good. Oh snap you'll kick yourself if you don't try the sweet potato pecan pie with the bourbon sauce get it oh my God is it so good.

9jgXH_9H1Pm9_Ek2VR5e6w.text: I got my much needed crawfish Etouffee! Boy was it good! Noisy and busy for a Sunday afternoon but very much welcomed! No need to be quiet here! Seated in five min drink order taken as well as the alligator appetizer! The larger pieces were a bit tough but delicious! The water came first but the bar must have been backed up because it took some time for the Wine and beer to come out. Moving on to the entrees-to die for Crawfish Etouffee done to perfection, tried a good portion on the halibut (let me just say (SUCCULENT). Pricey but oh so worth it! Service was great you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 8oz Cabernet Zinfandel
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alligator appetizer
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Linguine Picayune

lH6C_gBu2Ytd3uyZzdiZEg.text: I rarely eat out, so when I do and I'm able to finish my food, it must be good. I love eating at Pappadeaux because the food is always good and so is the service. Never too long of a wait to be seated. The Mediterranean style calamari is absolutely delicious and so is the buttery lobster bites. The Moroccan salmon and pearled couscous is the best!

MUzbU25Hc3kW_uRMkP6AXQ.text: I love this place!  I had the Texas Reddish Ponchatrain and it was axing as usual, but my wife's Filet Mignon Oscar was charred pretty badly.  The manager not only removed the charge for the Filet, but she also hooked us up with a free Creme Brulee. Amazing customer service!

mNLkFMgHkb-zN6cbVxwzxw.text: This is probably the best seafood restaurant in Phoenix! My brother recommended us this place. Didn't disappoint at all!

KIJbcsh31U-rtxsTK96tvw.text: I love Pappadeaux. The ambiance of this establishment is beautiful and southern. Walking up to the fountain with running water surrounded by the green nature is a great feeling. The interior has amazing decorations and is well put together. I loved our waitress, she was prompt and friendly and completely knowledgable about the menu. We got the calamari as our appetizer and we were not disappointed in the slightest. AMAZING.

94OIXMs8r0DioU27Nn-M6g.text: I am not very happy that they took the Mediterranean Calamari out of the menu !!!!  Why??? At least give us an explanation .

VHHjdBtkbWRFyiLLMZAdtg.text: I had a wonderful experience at Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen! I came out here with the family for our weekly get together dinner. Before i get into the food i have to say how amazing the atmosphere was. I absolutely loved the decor and the vibes i got from this place. It reminded me of an old traditional seafood restaurant you'd find on the east coast, but with an upscale feeling. It was simply amazing. I was also impressed with our waiter, he was very friendly and prompt. As for the food, we all got different dishes and tried each other. My absolute favorite was the macaroni and cheese with lobster. All i have to say is the cheesy lobster combination with the pasta was to die for! Among the other dishes, was calamari, shrimp, and catfish which all were pretty great as well. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone who's in need of a quality seafood fix!

-O5qHrj7a2nwMtSoCuUTZA.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant, looks and tasted like the quality has changed so much.  It was mediocre but not great like I remember.  I'm wondering if they changed owners?

xBI_5-j65coBQxqUiAxH-A.text: Deliciously tasting entrees with great portions. The price is on point for the quality you get. The server was amazing!!!! Honestly she was the best part of our entire visit. (I forgot her name but she had super short red hair and told us about her twins).   Ambiance - is nice but too loud.   Parking - plenty of space.   Decor - beautiful restaurant for its kind.   Menu - there's a variety of options but not overwhelming.   Overall, every dish we ordered was cooked to perfection.   One time stop, though. (We're from CA).

3txkcsHgr9duBY7Tg2s-UA.text: I've always heard great things about this restaurant but had never gone. I decided for my 29th birthday that I would take all my family and friends here for dinner and drinks.   The service was okay. Kids meals came out with the rest of the food but it took a while for drink refills. No big deal. Food looked very good when served. Here's the kicker.....  I became deathly ill about a week and a half after my birthday dinner. I'm talking- convulsing on the floor ill and then shitting my brains out while vomiting at the same time. I was like this for a solid week. Went to my doctor and had a lot of tests run. Spent another two weeks living feet away from the toilet because I couldn't stop crapping myself. Turns out Papadeux fed me tainted shrimp from China and I got Salmonella poisoning. I've got the report from the MCHD to prove it. Not only did I receive Salmonella from them but a lot of other people did to. I will NEVER go back nor recommend this place to anyone I know.

MWx7rVFrrmTtT2mA_CTtCQ.text: This is our go to restaurant! I have never had a bad experience. The food is delicious, the environment reminds me of New Orleans and the staff is so friendly. Esther is our favorite waitress! We can go months without coming in and when we do, she remembers us immediately. We love the courtyard that greets you upon arrival and if you're lucky enough you can catch some live music on the weekends. The raw oysters are a must for us, they are always served super cold and taste great. My absolute favorite dish is the Pasta Mardi Gras. Flavor explosion!! I always make the mistake of filling up on the hot delicious bread and butter, but it works out since I always package the left overs and have a second meal (typically around midnight the same night )

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NnlxorHfw56-aK_2ZDPImA.text: By far one of my wife and I's favorite place to go! Everything from the moment you step foot inside to sitting down. Service is excellent, food is delicious never had anything I did not like here. To top it off the Desserts are really good! Everything is fresh made to order!

41jgm3T6pYHEa4fBhCuJXQ.text: Came here with my daughter for my 45th birthday and I couldn't have been happier with my meal. We started with crab claws which had an amazing sauce. Personally, I don't think the rice on the plate with this app was necessary; a few extra claws would've been way better. My daughter ordered pasta with shrimp and scallops which she loved it. I had the salmon with shrimp and scallops over sauteed spinach. Both of our meals also had crab meat on top. My daughter had leftovers, I'm happy to say I did not! After dinner our server brought us the dessert tray which was on the house for birthdays. We had the banana pudding that came in a mason jar that we got to take home. Raised in Florida makes me picky about my seafood and although this place was a bit of a drive, I will go back for more than just a birthday dinner. Kudos for making great seafood in the middle of the desert!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IxQElxC1ZZXBHoRJW-f6-g.text: There is nothing like dining in NOLA, but this place is good. You will spend a bit more than most places but its certainly a far trade for the quality compared to most restaurants. The baked bourbon oysters are good but I wish they charbroiled them like in NOLA.

MFyEUI8vWsY9NoJn7Qg6VA.text: Always great food!  Their is never a disappointment going here... everything we get we love.  I always hope for a table by the windows.  Especially on a rainy day.

dA22Yt2cfdKGZ4Il30mEUQ.text: We go here every 6 months especially on Fat Tuesday! They are a little pricey but the food is fantastic and we enjoy the atmosphere!!!!

i1Y1emExJsB6Zy8AJ9SR1A.text: The waitress, Esther, made me feel like a bother for requesting half crayfish, half oysters for my seafood plate. I wish I'd taken the hint, because I ended up paying $50 for food poisoning. Currently reciting Psalms and praying for death to take me quickly.

R6cqCnJeBI-5yonny29Qpw.text: Must have blackened alligator, along with king crab legs.  Make reservations this place is always packed.  Great for a date night or family outing

WSSMJQk2vRei1AxbsuXdUQ.text: Damn wish this place was closer to Gilbert. Best southern seafood I have ever had outside of Louisiana. Everything here is amazing . Crab cakes, alligator and Oysters are fresh and any fish you get you can't go wrong. Love this place and will be coming back as long as we are on that side of town,

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PkxvYIQDUs1zcdZ6FCQ0pg.text: I always enjoy my visits to this restaurant.  What's not to like; the seafood is amazing.  This time I ordered a dish that was a bit too salty.

6yiBjddfgAh_y3PfZrHWkw.text: We started off with some alligator bites. Very well cleaned, and wasn't gamey at all. The dipping sauce was really good too - buttery and not too spicy. We ordered gumbo - which the flavor was a bit bland. Lots of shrimp and seafood, and the juicy andouille sausage. But the broth was lacking and super runny...  I was definitely a big fan of the Pasta Mardi Gras! HOLY MOLY!!! the cream sauce was delightful :) Abundant pieces of shrimp, sausage, scallops and crawfish! Swimming in that tasty cream and tomato sauce. The whole bowl of dish was accompanied by a buttery garlic crostini that was used to sop up all the leftover sauce. Can't stop talking about that sauce!  The servings of the dishes were huge and overwhelming - but i'm definitely not complaining. The service was overall good - the food came out in lighting speed.

bt3QhBo9ioCy5nM62UgAvw.text: Great place to go and try new thing. The atmosphere is amazing at nights it's like being on a beach in Mexico's night sky glazing at you. Music though the air so calmly this truly a deal breaker

GYMw92y5PwR8BK3uF_ogaw.text: I came here for the first time with some friends and my cousins for my cousins birthdays. The food was delicious. The service was on point. I wish I could have remembered our waiter name. Everything was perfect! Thank you!

LKc1QBfFTH1yKEvx2SP8Yg.text: Andy is an excellent server.  Briane is also a good server.  Food portions s are plentiful.  We went for lunch and retruned for happy hour & dinner. Bthis was our first visit.  The only negative thing we had to say was about the fondu appetizer that comes with crawfish & shrimp.  We asked that it be served without the crawfish, only the shrimp.  When the menu said "shrimp" that is what we received was JUST ONE SHRIMP.  That was a rip-off.  One would think that if they are only.going to pi in one shrimp and one crawfish, they could have at least replaced the one crawfish with one shrimp.  So, be careful.  When the menu reads, "shrimp", it isn't plural.

zdH-yrvZwSg-m6hat8OQIQ.text: Pappadeaux is always amazing food! Except....have they increased their prices? Ouch! We used to come here a couple times a year, not sure we will be back due to the price increase.

yNFqBAI4w6EVMMtATN1gXg.text: This is my brother's favorite place to dine, and now I see why. My husband and I took my brother and his family out to Papadeaux's during our visit to Phoenix.   Having just visited NOLA last year, I was impressed by the ambiance. The service was TOP NOTCH, and the food...my goodness! I got the Morrocan Salmon and Cous Cous...SO DELICIOUS!!!! I'm adding Papadeaux's to my food itinerary, right next to Karson's Kornbread in DTPHX. Oh and don't sleep on the banana pudding!

9kv7C9Tzi9cAQKe9CpnfBw.text: I love  good food and Pappadeaux's never disappoints! I would like to thank our server Nick for such great customer and the manager Arizania ! They were super busy but they made me and the birthday boy feel as though we were the only ones there! To the rest of the staff you all are awesome great staff it was my boyfriends first time there and he wants to come back! Thank you for making this such a special night!

GzpeMZx4hbrANLlyKgGVGg.text: First time at Pappadeaux. Arrived 10 mins early with reservations and waited 20 anyway. Hmm. Our server, Reno, arrive about 7 mins after that. He dropped off water and turned to leave but we had waited long enough to know we wanted the Oyster Duo for an app. He tried to leave again before we could order drinks. Not a good start.   Besides the app and two drinks, we got Filet Minion with Lobster Tail and the Atlantic Salmon Alexander. The bill came to $119.20 plus tip.   The oysters were good. Our favorites were the cheesy ones but the spinach-hollandaise oysters were good too - just too much spinach. Most of the food on the entrees was excellent. The fillet was seasoned perfectly, tender and juicy-just what my wife wanted. The lobster tail was huge, accompanied by a vat of butter and some big, tender asparagus. My salmon was cooked just right, with a crispy crust but was still moist and with great Cajun seasoning. The crawfish, scallops and shrimp were all good but the shrimp were small. The decadent sauce over all was rich and creamy. I didn't care for the dirty rice but I think it was due to flavors, not the way it was cooked. Just not my kind of rice dish.   Reno was okay as a server. He was new and didn't have a routine down yet but he was warm and engaging and he will be good if his managers will give him a chance to bloom.   We may go back to Pappadeaux again. The parking lot was cutthroat and the wait time for some was brutal. Perhaps we'll return in the summer when the snowbirds have left!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Filet and lobster tail. Excellent choice.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Atlantic Salmon Alexander was very good. This was the small, 7 ounce portion.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just two ousters from the six piece oyster duo. Good app but a bit heavy on the spinach.

L044WxfyGv8jp_nHxAj1cQ.text: The bad: can be loud inside. Not really the fault of the restaurant, more due to the fact that the place is basically one giant dining room. Also, the corporate undertones are strong with this one. Good service on steroids is the best way to describe it. Hard to explain why that's a "bad" thing necessarily, but I think anyone who knows anything about the restaurant industry understands what I am saying.   The good: portions are generous and the food overall is great. Oysters and such are fresh, shucked well, and not watered down. The soft shell crab entree is bomb. Servers always have a smile on their face. Pricy but you get what you pay for.

PtCA2d7pn66sMbxfDcG00A.text: After being a customer for several years and getting a mixed portrayal of their quality and service I decided to start trying their large 6 lb. fresh lobsters. The first one I had was over-cooked and tasted like rubber (They claimed their steamer broke down) so they offered to replace it. They finally got the lobster in and called me and it was fine. I asked the Manager to order me one every 2 weeks.   Of course, I needed to chase him to order it and after waiting 3 - 4 weeks I called and left a message again. They finally called and told me to come in, as they received the lobster. I told them I would call back to set a time within the next 24 hours. I called and set an appointment for the next day at 11 am. When I arrived and they seated me, I explained, the manager had a 6 lb lobster waiting for me. After waiting about 10 minutes, a lady manager advised me they sold my 6 lb lobster last night to someone who allegedly said he had a lobster waiting for him. I traveled 30 minutes and took time out of my day and this was the best they could do. The General Manager never addressed it with me or offered a viable excuse, so I am finished with this place. Unfortunately, they have lost their way when it comes to quality food and excellent service.  If I treated my customers this way, I would not have a business. Disgusted.  Ron Sanders

E79Lt_WAbZBpugzEdeB8jQ.text: if you like cajun food this is the place to go. they have a wide variety of everything.  service is always good.  if you are planning a large party call ahead, getting a table is always going to be a wait. all the times i've gone, i've never waited less than 30 minutes to be seated so plan accordingly.

5ps8hhjd_o24tkf6MA2_Ow.text: Mostly disappointed. I'm from New York and no stranger to fresh seafood. I understand we're in Arizona and flown in is about as fresh as you can get. Be warned not EVERYTHING is flown in daily. Only one page of the menu is. My boyfriend and I shared frog legs, crab Mac n cheese and the Chilean sea bass. I will say the Mac n cheese was freaking delicious but I tasted very little crab. The frogs legs were the saddest of the 3. Just plain fried like the heap of French fries it comes with. No finesse or seasoning. A lot of their menu is just fried seafood. The sea bass was ok. I don't think they treated the fish amazingly and the toppings/accompaniments are lackluster. Overall nothing was really elevated or screamed fresh seafood. For the price and drive I will not be going back there. Check out little cleos for a much more exciting seafood experience.

AP-p0hYpELVep1TltLd4dw.text: Pappadeaux sure is the real deal! Which explains the big crowd of people waiting to be seated outside. This is an eclectic restaurant that is great for any type of gathering, from a romantic date with your significant other to a big blowout birthday celebration with friends and family.  We came on a busy Friday night with no reservation, so we were given a pager. We snagged seats at the bar and started off with drinks. They have a huge selection of their own alcoholic mixed beverages. Bartenders can sure make a mean cocktail!    If you don't mind the loud hustle and bustle, then there would be a shorter wait for an inside table. However, we loved the fun outdoor lighting and decor, so we didn't mind the extra wait. When our pager finally went off, our hostess immediately seated us at our table before a live band. I couldn't get over how charming the patio area was.   The food is AMAZEBALLS! Please keep in mind that the portions are LARGE, especially the appetizers.  My Loves:  Sea Bass and Shrimp - My favorite dish of the night. It must have been a special, as I don't see it on the menu. It was fresh and tasty and had lovely presentation.  Coconut Shrimp - Can't go wrong with this dish. Each bite sent me to food heaven. The marmalade sauce it came with complemented it perfectly. And the shrimp was huge!  Oysters - very large and fresh and muy delicioso  My Like:   Crispy Fried Alligators - Tasted kind of like chicken, but a little slimy. It tasted great with the Creolo sauce it came with. However, I thought it was a bit too oily and fried for me.   This was absolutely way too much food for two people. I highly suggest going with at least a group of 4. That way you can share and try a lot more items. Pappadeaux is definitely worth trying. I cannot wait for my next visit to Phoenix, so that I can feast here again.

CxI9XFDuCDU5yFc1Umfb7g.text: Everything's bigger in Texas, including the crab cakes!!!  My review says lacking because I'm from Texas so I know what Pappadeaux should be.  I gave it three stars bc I can't bring myself to rate a Pappa chain alongside Red Lobster. I have frequented (and I mean often) the Pappa chain in Dallas and Austin.  The AZ restaurant obviously has the same recipes bc the sauces are unforgettable but their portions, especially the crab cakes, are tiny. They do have the same mutant huge potatoes.    I was primarily disappointed with the service, mediocre at best where as, coming from TX, I was expecting the normal Pappa hospitality and bend over backwards to leave an impression - staff.  It was early evening and the sun was setting. I was literally told I could not move, nor could the blinds be lowered, despite being blinded by the sun in my face.   It's saddens me to have this restaurant tarnish an amazing name. Save your money bc you have the same steep prices but not half the experience!  Btw Pappadeaux in TX was my favorite restaurant - Austin and Dallas, I assumed they were all that good!

0PQAveuX7REMllcQRe-DKA.text: Love this place so much we have spent Christmas Eve here the last 15 years.  One of our favorite places to go.  Visited last Friday and the service just seemed overwhelmed.  Only writing this hoping it was a glitch and whoever reads this takes a look at the operations.  Timing was off (slow) and a very big no no on a pet peeve of mine - Please don't serve cold beer in hot glasses right out of the dishwasher.   Bartender fixed rounds 2 and 3 after we mentioned it but it should be obvious from the get go.  We did enjoy the music on the patio.  Whoever the singer was, was very good.

yxZ_uCLfMieDB3Flx_W_gg.text: Very beautiful restaurant. Very beautiful. Food isn't spectacular and the price surely will leave you budgeting in order to afford a meal here again. Very pricey... even for simpler meals of chicken and noodles. If money isn't an issue, then definitely go. It was more of an experience then anything else. But a good, memorable experience. :)

5bcHGjTltAJlf91hVlJBsQ.text: A bit overpriced, I think. It's really good... but not 5-star amazing. I've gone here many times before, and I'll come back eventually. This is a great place to take a date, but some of the seating is just awful. Who wants to sit near the entrance or on the edge of a hall with people constantly walking by and bumping your chair? Kind of annoying... especially when the place is empty and there are far better seats.  The little things are what get you 5 stars.

buV7NST1e2cQNpjlFFqTwQ.text: We had the crab cake and spinach dip appetizer which was very good.  I had the crawfish platter with fried crawfish, etouffee crawfish and dirty rice.   The rice had a crunch and seemed under cooked, the crawfish was alright.

wKdPDASzsFOR1rRbssZVCQ.text: I am 21 and the Manager wouldn't serve me any alcohol because my drivers license were from Utah , the manager said that my drivers license were tampered all because a had a little piece of tape on the bottom where the address was to show my address has changed which at the DMV in Utah said that was okay to do that rather paying 20 dollars for a new drivers license. After the manger told me That they wouldn't serve me she began with sarcastic comments which was really rude. Probably won't come back again. Don't recommend for people who are visiting from other locations with a changed address.

mttwojfCxDFdrxyDdT1K1A.text: 2nd visit. Tonight, Saturday.  15 min wait, Nice drink at bar. Dozen blue point oysters w/ 3 sauces:Great. Mussels w/sausage large bowl: tender, tasty broth, good broth. Salad:okay. Crap Mac/cheese over cooked. Waiter took off bill. And offered a free desert. Crab cake/sauce was excellent. So satisfied, didn't even need free desert. I hope to go back in two weeks. Great staff, great mix of happy people enjoying the night

onPj93OzXwv2TkuOqBsd-w.text: Went there for my birthday dinner.  Everything was wonderful.  Super busy for Sunday afternoon.  The sweetie waitress,was outstanding.  I even got to pick which dessert I wanted for my dessert.  Wish I could work there

Jg7xue4MKk5UStZTLmN9zg.text: Sat at the bar for Happy Hour.  The bartenders were friendly and made fresh squeezed orange juice for my drink. Had a really good half size fondue app.  Dinner was delicious... The best scallops I have had!   Also had a really good atmosphere. The patio section was beautiful!

PCnbXPjM_nJ3RkIqcNY-HA.text: Wife found Pappadeaux on Yelp, and boy am I happy she did. We have been watching a lot of Duck Dynasty, and after watching Mrs. K cook up a whole lotta squirrel Brain Jambalaya, my cajun taste buds kicked in.   we started with the frog legs and lobster egg rolls. The frog legs were incredible, I could not believe how juicy they were.   For an entre, Tasia got the scallops, and I got the blackened catfish with the dirty rice. I loved this dish, but could barely finish half of it.   We will be back for sure

raX952Ki_yRN5SWGgg5-cA.text: I am all about good Cajun food. I wasn't expecting to find it in Phoenix, but I sure did! I had catfish with shrimp etouffe, and the traditional calamari as an appetizer. The calamari tasted fresh, and wasn't like the cheap rubberband-like calamari you find at bad restaurants. The catfish was light and flaky, but the shrimp etouffe was my favorite by far.   The decor reminded me of New Orleans. It was beautiful weather to sit outside, and the waiter was prompt and friendly.

gRu6qZqNy1wpik3HLD0v8Q.text: Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen is my family's favorite place for dinner and has been for over 10 years.  From the moment you walk in you can sense the magical ambiance, and the staff is warm and welcoming and quick to address any needs.  Our favorite dish is the lobster tail and filet mignon (the best of surf and turf), but we've had almost everything by now and it is all amazing, fresh, and spiced to perfection.  Every dessert is fantastic if you manage to have any room left but I will say I've never tasted better creme brulee.  The food is a little pricey so we do reserve dinner here for special occasions, but I have enjoyed every meal here so much that I would gladly pay more everywhere for this kind of quality and attention to detail!  Also, the restaurant is pretty busy during dinner hours so reservations are always recommended.  I would absolutely recommend making your next dinner plans here immediately!

sVkr0D8AC4T3rFmFxOiFjg.text: As local Phoenicians, we used to love this place, but our latest experience will be the last. The food is, and always has been fabulous. Unfortunately, that is not the only reason to pay high prices at a restaurant. Ambience and service are also a big part of a pleasant dining experience.  By the time we left the restaurant, one person in our group had a headache from all the noise. The staff was not especially friendly and all appeared to be running - adding to the frenzied atmosphere. It is clear from the crowds at this restaurant that this review won't mean much to the company. We really want to love this place, but it was our last visit. We will frequent restaurants where we don't feel rushed and we can carry on a private conversation without having to talk over the noise.

CsnzoBgECy6z1IZSEXcemQ.text: This place is d'lish for seafood in the desert !  My boyfriend and I have been twice in the past few years because it is pretty far on the west side for us.  But it is well worth it when we are craving some crawfish or crabcakes!  It's easy to pass by if you haven't been because it is along side the highway shortly after you pass Bobby-Q's.  The front entrance is very pretty with the vines, fountain and greenery.  It's nice to see this in the desert...it cools things down drastically !  The bar inside is great and every time I've been it's always been packed but chairs open up pretty quickly.  The bartenders are great and always happy to tweak drinks (I got the mango margarita and added strawberry puree). :)  They had oysters flying outta that bar like ninjas!!  I wished that I liked them because it's part of what everyone loves about this place.  Just can't get past that texture....yeesh.   When we sat we were in the back room that if this restaurant was on the water we would be hanging right over it....I wish.  Our waiter came back who was VERY stressed out - he stressed US out !  Wiping the sweat from his face, hands shaking, running back and fourth.  It's a good thing they have food runners who help out because I'm not sure we could have handled that all evening.  Now, onto the good stuff....  We ordered a small bowl of Seafood Gumbo to share and try as well as the Fried Calamari.  The Seafood Gumbo was delicious with a little bit of spice to it, lumps of seafood which I'm pretty sure is what gave the yummy broth it's good flavor! Calamari was crispy and good.....not as good as Salt Cellar, but good. :)  For dinner we split the Seafood Platter which they split up for us before it got to our table.  It had.....EVERYTHING.  Crawfish, crabcakes, stuffed shrimp, oysters, etc.  It was a MASSIVE portion so do not order this on your own unless you can gorge yourself into a coma.  I don't recommend it because they have a lot of desserts to chose from.    On that note, we ordered the creme brulee.  Good....lawd.  It was amazing.  the inside was super creamy and perfect. Top was crispy as expected with a side of strawberries and raspberries.  I was very happy with our choice on desert!

KccCpJzG-PkxZK2OlSlUTg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The seafood is very fresh, I'm not quite sure how they do that. The crab cakes are to die for. They put crawfish in them and the sauce is d'lish. I love the plank salmon too, but I recently discovered the pasta mardi gras (seafood pasta). I'm usually not a fan of seafood pastas because they taste so fishy, but this was really good. I've never had anything less than great here and each time I go I try something new.  The drinks are good, but the speciality drinks are pretty weak. If you want a good strong drink, order a mixer. On the weekends they usually have live music on the patio, which is usually jazz or blues. It makes waiting for a table all the easier for sure. They do take reservations though, so if you don't want to wait an hour, call ahead.  If you go all out on the meal (appetizer, drinks, and dessert), for two people, you can expect it will easily be over $100. Worth it! Though we usually save it for special occasions.

hUzso_WpTYFJrc3mSIhxJg.text: *3.5 stars*  My hunny loves this place, so we went for his birthday last Friday. I'm glad I made reservations because the restaurant was packed (like sardines *har har*) when we arrived at 6:30 pm. It was VERY LOUD inside...This is NOT a good place for a first date because my husband and I were practically yelling and we still could barely hear each other. The 4-man N'awlins band playing was complimentary to the atmosphere, but the music just added to the din. Phil was our waiter and he was friendly and personable.  We started with soup...hubs enjoyed his shrimp gumbo, although he and I thought my cup of lobster bisque was better (my mouth is watering as I'm typing this!) The french bread that came out before the meal was standard and nothing special. My entree was filet mignon with mashed potatoes and asparagus. I also added king crab legs which my sweetie and I shared. The filet was cooked right, but didn't have much flavor...had to ask for A-1 (gasp!) The asparagus were downright delicious and the taters were yummy too. Crab legs were fresh and tasty. I liked the tealight our server brought to the table to melt the butter for my crab because it kept the butter melted throughout dinner. My husband got mahi mahi with etouffee on top (came with dirty rice) and he was transported to food heaven.  I had a weird experience when I excused myself to go to the restroom. After admiring my hair, a woman (that I had never met) told me she was a spiritualist, said she saw lots of tension around me, and saw lots of change in my future. All I saw was the crab shell that had lodged itself in my eye when I had attempted to crack it. Along with the tears running down my cheek because of said crab shell. Bet you can imagine how annoying it was to be accosted in the bathroom...and it was......but I just can't be rude to someone who says I have pretty hair. Even if she was a wacka-doo.  Next time we go to Pappadeaux's I'm going to avoid the crab and the ladies restroom.......  Just kidding.  I'll still get the crab.

c8UkXrNTx49BSfysjFGisw.text: This is my first time visiting Phoenix and because I am a lover of this style of cuisine, I had to come here. We had a party of six and the place was packed! We didn't have a long wait under 5 minutes on a Friday night. We were seated right away and our server Mia was fantastic. Her recommendations were right on and her timing was impeccable. We started with the Fried Alligator appetizers and had the lobster pot, another lobster dish shrimp and the crawfish ettoufe and another seafood platter. All was fantastic with above average portion size.  no one left hungry as we didn't have any room for dessert.

mM0VWrrnQk7BQKPY0kNnOA.text: It's a glorified and expensive Long John Silver's. Greasy fried seafood but 5 times the price.

DX9rRoMG52Dn048Z_K7UCQ.text: This was my second time eating at Pappadeaux and I have to say that I was equally impressed as the first time.  The service was excellent both times and the food is pretty good too!  I had the Shrimp Etouffe the first time and it was an excellent choice and the second time I had the fried shrimp with a side of the Seafood Gumbo.  I really liked the fried shrimp but didn't really care for the Seafood Gumbo, it just totally fell below my expectations (it was chunky and bland) but I was so impressed with the rest of my food that it didn't take away from my overall experience.  We also had the Crab Spinach Dip...yummy!!

cYdaL-cLffLKZkRxDduauA.text: I have never experienced better service and than I did tonight when we went to dinner. The wait was fairly short, we got drinks at the bar while we waited and the bartender was very friendly and fast! We were seated near the kitchen which was kinda cool because I got to see first hand how well the staff here worked together as one cohesive team. Everyone was helping each other and looking out for one another. Our waitress Hannah was amazing, she was so sweet and so kind and very efficient. We had some appetizers then orders the crusted Atlantic salmon. When we got our meal it was cold. We told our waitress and she immediately apologized and offered to bring us another meal ..... We decided to just get dessert instead. She boxed up our cold meal since they were just going to throw it away. Shortly after the manager came over I think her name was Kaylee she apologized for the situation and offered to comp our dessert. When we got our bill she took care of the whole thing..... We were completely shocked! We left our waitress a nice tip and thanked the manager .... We will definitely revisit!

bl2SGdxyk3_TkhRu8xTGlA.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix being from Bx, N.Y it's no City Island but the next best thing! !!!!

Y0fpMiUMB1fasbk8DGTG3w.text: Whenever you want awesome service and amazing food you come here!!! Seriously I carve this place everyday. I eat out a lot and I promise you can not miss with these guys! Food is amazing and the restaurant its a fun, loud, classy, sassy experience!!food for the whole family! Tons of flavors. They really know how to serve you! Love, love, love!

ZxQ9yIgKl2R-feos3AGzBA.text: What can I say, oysters are the bomb here, and the deserts are top notch, my favorites are the key lime pie and tried a new one called pumpkin cheesecake - delicous!

9vaaLw8GhCc7_kk27-Q9iQ.text: I absolutely love the crispy Atlantic salmon & Maine Lobster!  What a wonderful dish!  The most moist salmon I have ever had, seasoned perfectly with lobster and grilled shrimp on top.  It was on a bed of super sweet roasted acorn squash.  My boyfriend ordered the Mississippi Catfish Opelousas.  It was amazing!  A huge portion of fish and seasoned well.  I like that this place is a made-from-scratch restaurant and you can customize your food.  I also love that they sell Vietti Moscato.  A good moscato is very hard to find at restaurants for some reason, and this is a really good one.  They even put fresh raspberries in it!  Would come back again and again if I lived in Phoenix.  Wish there was one in St. Louis!

gF_bUxcVRJ7_tmlUX7by6Q.text: Thank you, Pappadeaux, for giving us landlocked Phoenicians a nice seafood place that doesn't break the bank.  The relatives from up north were coming to town and the request was for those classicly native Phoenician foods, lobster and crab legs.  There were going to be 8 of us, and I was getting ready to take out the $1,000 bank loan when Yelp pointed me to Pappadeaux.   Thank goodness they take reservations for 8 or more.  I'm all over it.  Turns out it was crawdad night (crawfish for you cultured Creoles), and the place was an absolute madhouse.  We lucked out finding a parking spot and slowly made our way through the crush of people waiting outside.  I lost my entire party in the crowd and by the time I made it to the hostess desk was sure our reservation was a goner.  But the disheveled hostess, who probably suffers from PTSD after that night, said we were good.  whew.  I sent a rescue crew to retrieve my lost troops.  It was incredibly noisy so we had to do some strategic table placement for the hard of hearing.  The service was impeccable.  Demands for substitutions, butter sent back because it was too salty, help needed for seafood haters - our waiter fielded them all calmly and accommodated even the pickiest requests.   Everyone loved their food, which really was very good.  I got my favorite banana pudding - who needs an entree, really.  The bill was reasonable and everyone was happy.  Another mission accomplished, another bullet dodged.

lU4DhQApHW9FMI_jOndTCA.text: I really love this place!! Nothinglike a fun Sunday meal with my family to make me love it even more. We stuffed ourselves with delish catfish, fried shrimp , and tasty hazelnut Mahi. Service from Rocky was  really fast , effiecient without that fake cloying attitude. Felt like we were the center of the restaurant. Funny how things like fast drink refills, quick service and welltime plate removal can do that.   And here is the kicker of the evening ..I know have ordered or tasted every dessert on thier dessert tray, scary but True. Did you know that three of their desserts are made fresh there the rest including cheesecakes are made in Texas and brought in. I got the fresh Brulee  . yummy.   Can't wait to go back.

-jon1wAQbI65Fv2xi0q69w.text: Worth coming in here at least just for the $3.95/dozen oysters! Steal of a deal!  Albeit I came for a late Sunday dinner, I shall count the ways why this place is bomb diggity:  - SUPER warm fresh french bread roll upon being sat - Did I mention a dozen oysters for $3.95?! - A bigass piece of delicious tilapia that was still good as a leftover lunch - Cajun shrimp creole- definitely worth trying - Excellent service: helpful, informative, efficient, and not overbearing at all  Well worth a visit!

afFzO7LpvjZTt5BdYCbFow.text: Been on our to-try list for months, and we finally made it.  Sorry, we won't be hurrying back  First, order two glasses of wine at a time.  That way, you'll get one decent sized serving.  Had the catfish po-boys.  Huge, but something was lacking.  We just didn't think much of the sauce, kind of a strange flavor for Nawlins, which is where I go to compare po-boys.  We would have been happier with a smaller sandwich, if it had some flavor.  Or I would have ordered a catfish plate, but how can you eat catfish without hush puppies?  Service was like the food - just ok.  And someone said the place was tired.  Yep, my take as well.  But 8 glasses of wine out of a bottle?  And not cheap wine either.

Xv0iYXfrubxNIS2Mh5FMPA.text: Great food, great service. And they were happy to accommodate to gluten free or other allergy needs. Very good fruit ice tea.

p7rJXngwiWgF-rzHpkEMmw.text: Best seafood I've ever had hands down!! The Mediterranean calamari are the best I've had and I've tried lots of different calamari all over the valley. I will never go to red lobster again it's McDonalds compared to pappadeaux!! The staff is friendly and always knows the menu so well. The Pappas salad is fresh and tossed right in front of you. I dream about their filet and lobster plate!! I've found my favorite seafood restaurant!!

kKQFAy278HWTW7UKPhz0lQ.text: Great place for a New Orleans style feast.  The restaurant is easy to get to; in a great location; beautiful patio; and has a great atmosphere. I went on a Tuesday night at 7:30pm and there was no waiting.  The service was great and the food was excellent.  I ordered the blackened catfish covered with shrimp and crab in a cream/creole sauce.  It could have been a bit more blackened and spicy.  The house salad was good and the gumbo was excellent...just spicy enough for a good kick.  They serve a full loaf of French bread with warm, whipped butter.  There could have been more beer selections.  I may go every night while I'm in town here for 3 days.  MMMMMmmmmm.....GOOD!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio Entrance
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful Patio View

GAP16i6hbTku-J54Im6SGQ.text: can't wait for crawfish seafood ... most of all can't wait till they open one up on the east side ... like gilbert az area ...:)

VCEdzieFaonMOU6gL-fuAg.text: I went there last Saturday right after my 6 hours intense exam, it's a long drive from Mesa.  The waiter was very nice and helpful, I got seated right away without waiting, it's weekend, so the restaurant was very crowded. I ordered a crawfish platter, which I have been missing for quite a long time and Pappadeaux seems the first decent seafood restaurant I found that serve crawfish.  Both the service and the food were excellent.  I just feel the sauce was a bit spicy for me, should have told waiter to make it less spicy.  I also like the environment outside the restaurant, very pretty view~   I would definitely go back and try some more dishes if I am in Phoenix area next time and feel ok with long drive.

xduOr2eHV_HDsp2T8K8jFw.text: Got the crawfish boil...yum!  Good spice mix, but I would have loved to have it spicier.  The oysters were mediocre, not the best quality.  I prefer Ocean Trail for my oysters.  It was super busy, luckily I got there at 5 and didn't have to wait.  I'd really only come here for the crawfish--everything else was average and not special.

WdE4K6tfKS_P_azvzKMh1w.text: What a great place to eat! My brother and I have had lunch here a couple of times and the food has been excellent both times.  We tried the alligator bits. As cliche' as it may sound, it "tastes like chicken".  Although people always make fun of me for it, I like catfish. I ordered the blackened catfish with dirty rice and it was excellent. Portions are very large and I couldn't finish my meal (although not for lack of trying). My brother had the tilapia on one occasion and a mixed seafood dish on another. Both were great.  The seafood tastes fresh, the location is great and the service staff is friendly. Also, I love the patio in the entrance area. Highly recommended.

MNFxB8AvARFjtRegKQM0PQ.text: Seafood was fresh and superb everything was delicious the seafood platter had different tastes and elements that made the food stand out not mediocre at all something very hard to accomplish with fried food. The dessert trio was to die for and the service was excellent. Definitely coming back

-FtJ91yLgAjT2NAsGYYRTA.text: I've had Pappadeaux in Dallas, Austin, Albuquerque and Phoenix and was more than satisfied every single time!  This is one of my favorite chain seafood restaurants!  The quality of the seafood at every location is suburb.  Big portions and flavor galore!  I must admit ... this location I think has the slowest service ... even at the bar!

G9TCm6OdURFRgimhRH2VDg.text: The food here is so yummy. It's never a disappointment. Our server was very friendly and super quick. Only negative is they don't take reservations so if you're going on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait. On a good note the outdoor waiting area is large and has beautiful waterfalls and firepits.

ujKGJyg-s0EL7-CeKlHg_g.text: My fiance and I went to try Papaadeauxs on a Friday during Lent. We were not disappointed. The service was superior. Our waitress always checked on us and made sure we always had full drinks.   We ordered the oysters papaadeaux and the only thing I'd say is they were a bit salty, but nonetheless delicious. The creme brulee also did not disappoint!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KbIDEHEDsgzoEgZNIl33DA.text: We went there in a short road trip, we had a two hr wait, but a nice waitress told us we could wait at the bar, we found a very large lounge area, we cancelled the wait and had dinner at the bar area, it was awesome,  if you are ever in Phoenix with a loved one, or just a weekend trip, this is a treat!! Very nice!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_hWxhB7LdnULGD8S0_0cpg.text: I came here with co-workers on a business trip to have some great food and unwind.  The decor is nice, and we were seated very quickly.  Service is fantastic and I never had a water glass less than half full.  Excellent specialty cocktails and ice-cold beer complimented our food.  I ordered a appetizer sampler and it was incredible.  Highly recommended.  Also had fish which was cooked to perfection.  Pappadeaux is a bit on the pricey side, but that was expected and the food and service are definitely up to par with the prices.

dvcw0FR12s0yrMIah9_otA.text: We love the food here but quite honestly had the most hideous service ever!  Our waiter would walk by, see we needed drinks, whatever and go hang out with the hostess.  Every time we had to throw a hand up....bizarre because it's not cheap! I finally went in to ask him to please take our order and a manager I thought took note but actually not.  We drive 30+ minutes to get here and most likely won't do it again!  Back to our old school Salt Cellar...if jimmy n is your waiter run for your life!

JLUrUtqdgygXSXjIT6Cv-w.text: This place is very good but expensive. More upscale and definitely worth the money. Yelp needs to changes the pricing range to $$$ though, it's misleading and needs to be updated. Please update it.

LfnuA-K6Ij9AETV4dQsbyA.text: Best Happy Hour in Phoenix AZ!! Love this place  great food & service every time! My absolute favorite is their fried calamari with aioli dipping sauce. YUM! My hubby loves the shrimp and crawfish fondeux, but honestly you will not be disappointed with anything so go ahead and step outside your comfort zone and order something different- the food is excellent in every way!

BtNGgibjGZdM_4vK4TEoOQ.text: This place is awesome!!! I've never been here before and when we showed up it was packed. No where to park and the wait was an hour to an hour and a half. So long story short we tried sitting in the bar and there was some miscommunication about where we were sitting. Meagan came and totally took care of us. I was shocked at her resolution for the problem. We were seated right away. I was like.... what!!!  She didn't have to do that. The service was great. The meal was so delicious. I just can't get over their level of customer service. I can't wait to come back and visit and eat here with my husband (we are from Dan Diego).  Oh by the way our server was Kaylene. She was so sweet and adorable. She played along with us and was funny. Loved her!! Thanks for making my last night with my girlfriend a memorable one!

ucvdKrwy0tqHUDmTh30B3w.text: It was my first time coming in and it was great! The food was really good and the service was even better!! Thank you Jaclyn for making my dads birthday dinner special!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mfFajVybBPrJLamphDKsSA.text: The wait was long (I rolled my eyes and apparently a 30-60 minute wait is "good" for this place) The management doesn't have the foresight to have a hostess selling drinks. Leaving money on the table and the customer unhappy!   The food was fabulous every item was perfectly prepared. I am happy to spend money on food but $9.95 for 1 crab cake appetizer that is SMALLER than a hockey puck means I will be spending my $184.50 for 3 people at a much better restaurant. The cost for the quality is why this is NOT a 5 star review.  Food 10 stars value 2 stars.  I have had much better food for much lower price and much less waiting.  I'm sad.  Please comment and follow me for more reviews! I would love to have you!

_Jg_YEaPCZ6-NnGH3U6UqQ.text: Great food, fast food service to the table, the wait time was long to get a table, but the hostess's attitude was the real mood killer. When I first checked in I was told it was a 45 minuet wait time by the hostess and that was fine since it was a Saturday night and I expected a wait. After about an hour I went to ask how much longer it would be and the hostess was kind enough to tell me it had only been 58 minuets and she said it was going to be an hour so we needed to step back and continue to wait. I told her she said it would be 45 minuets when we checked in and she told me she would have never told me 45 minuets and we had only been waiting 58 minuets so she would get to us when there was a table open and there was 3 parties ahead of us. I stepped out of the way and they called up the first party they were seating. I didn't want to go far if they were going to call us soon. They called up and sat 4 more parties in the the next 15 or so minuets I was standing there. By that time my girlfriend was getting visibly upset, so thank goodness they seated us right after that. In the end it wasn't the long wait, I get that it was a Saturday evening and very busy, it was the hostess that had to be so condescending telling me we had only been waiting for 58 minuets, not a full 60, and implying to me that I was either wrong/lying/or I didn't listen to her say 45 minuets when I checked in. In all honesty the food was great and the desserts were amazing. We even ordered extra desserts so we could give the babysitter one. It's definitely on the higher end of mid range restaurants but well worth it if you love sea food. Also I recommend just ordering a few appetizers if it's just you and a date because the portions are really big. I really wanted to give more stars.

ZlVOw_hFYX3LJhpK5mmxeA.text: The best seafood restaurant in the valley. The food is so fresh and tasty. It melts in your mouth. I think this gonna be my favorite restaurant in Phoenix area despite the high prices!

LRc71jddGkYgGx1ImByJnQ.text: Excellent happy hour!! Great service. Love the shrimp poorboy and loved the gulf oysters! Boiled Shrimp decent. Prices are high if you miss happy hour but an excellent place for business dinners.

i-h-13EFECwxX5785ZQKZA.text: This was a delicious experience.  The atmosphere is fantastic and so is the food and finally the customer service.    The first items I ordered:  fried alligator 5/5(the sauce was spicy, creamy, and almost gravy like).  The next was the spinach dip with the bombest bread ever 5/5!  For the main course I had to try the Andouille, Crab, and Shrimp Gumbo!  Delicious people!  It took me down south with every bite!  It was an explosion of flavor that I truly enjoyed.  Also, the Shrimp Po Boys were fantastic!  Finally I ordered the Fried Catfish with almost a beignet covered in spicy gravy!  Yum!  Also the sides were great I highly recommend the Cheesy Grits with Andouille.  Bring your friends, bring hour family, and definitely bring your fat pants!  Pappadeaux oh how I've fallen in love with thee!  Cheers !!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l7wYwICUM4phEWnt_XX5Og.text: oh nom nom nom nom here. I've been to the one in New Mexico - but for some reason, it didn't stand out as much there. I think it might have been the Lunch course.  THIS was definitely a much better experience.  We got here a little after 8 pm, a bit early for our 8:30 pm reservations. They had our table ready and whenever we were ready to go. They were uber accommodating - even when our party of 10 became a party of 8.  Brook was our server. AWESOME MAN. Fantastic suggestions, substitution, and all over awesomeness. Wished I lived closer to have this place all the time.  Wine cellar for our private party. You should ask - it fits about 10-12 people comfortably.   What we ordered- * Mississippi Catfish Opelousas - Blackened catfish with shrimp, oysters  & jumbo lump crabmeat in a lemon garlic butter sauce with dirty rice ... It was so light, so flavorful. OH my. I totally understand why my friend LOVES this dish. $29.99 *Atlantic Salmon Yvette (11 oz. 26.95 .. 7 oz. 22.95) Char-grilled salmon with shrimp, crawfish, mushrooms & spinach, in a sherry white wine sauce, with dirty rice. * Pappadeaux sampler - Fried fish filets (choice of catfish, tilapia or both), shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab with extra fried shrimp & crawfish)... the extra is what separates the seafood platter vs pappadeaux sampler. ($32.99) *Oyster sampler appetizer - with both of their baked oysters (Oysters Pappadeaux - Baked oysters on the half shell with crabmeat, spinach & hollandaise and Oysters Baton Rouge - Oysters on the half shell baked with a Parmesan Romano cheese sauce) - $13.95, with three of each oyster. *Appetizer Trio - Mini shrimp & crawfish fondeaux, fried alligator & hot smoked salmon* (we switched the salmon for Coconut shrimp) OH nom nom nom. This was one fantastic appetizer - can be shared or ordered as an entree - $22.99  Somewhat disappointed in their section of raw oysters - Gulf Coast and Blue point only.  Lobster tank in front, with their prices per pound.   Will definitely come back especially now i know what I ordered. Pretty pricey, but totally worth the flavors and food. OH nom nom nom indeed

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mississippi Catfish Opelousas
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappadeaux platter
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster tail

CYuds-_iu0ZEJhGMPDK_EA.text: I've been here multiple times throughout my life but this past experience is what made me come onto Yelp and make review.. First, the food is great and I am obsessed with the shrimp and crawfish fondue. I have literally come to Pappdeaux and ordered that as my meal! But what really pushed me to do this review was our waitress Jada. I would come in and wait just to sit in her section! She knew the menu, answered our questions fast, my drink never dipped below half full, she was just fun to talk to, and always had a smile! This girl really made the experience just a bit more fun and personal. I'm all about customer service and she was just off the charts.

MQcnS_2igZHirfdSCSqX6g.text: I would go there everyday if I had the money it's super great food here the people are very nice and caring and super great food the best

eydXAU6cZ7eY-72NoWr1dQ.text: So tasty. Food is the best as far a seafood goes in the state. Drinks are nice as well and staff always has a great attitude

gi8w8rN5zRF0BhVjDTxGfQ.text: I am a fan of Pappadeaux...Went on a Saturday night in JUNE; seated right away; hostess/manager came by to say our server just had a "7 top" and was taking their order; and would be there to get our order.  It took over 15 minutes to get our drink order; because none of the wait staff or management told our server that we were seated behind a wooden support beam.  We didn't even get water; not good...But after our server saw us he apologized for the delay; and the meal was great from that moment on; the food & drinks were great.  Our server after the rocky start; was one of the best I ever had at any establishment.

ermSwEiDWDX5lEMe0O43Ag.text: Can't go wrong with Pappadeaux.  We come to this place a few times a year.  We've had almost every item on the appetizer list, and quite a few from their main dishes.  Great place to dine.  Their servers and service are also top quality.

tDgrKR4zcBESyBZmyO9X6w.text: We were in Glendale for a friend son's football game and it was lunchtime, so my husband asked me to check out Yelp for restaurants near us.  I really love the iPhone app, I sorted my bookmarks and Pappadeux was the closest.  My husband ordered a chicken pasta dish (not in the mood for seafood), our friend a Cajun combo plate and for me the fried crawfish/etoufee.  Everyone enjoyed their food, our friends really liked the dirty rice. My dish was absolutely delicious, the etoufee sauce was smoky/spicy and very flavorful and I as well loved the dirty rice The fried crawfish was ok, nothing special. The loaf of bread before dinner was warm and crispy, very good. The kids menu didn't had much for my 17 mo/old son,most  everything was fried  (he doesn't  like fried food much...I know, he didn't got that from me;) but he filled up on bread and the crackers they had at the table. The waiter was very nice and prompt, although it took a while for our food to come out.  We have friends from New Orleans who are great cooks and they enjoyed the food here as well.  I'll definitely will come back for the dirty rice and crawfish etoufee.

At2v3wT6lwN3PA2DROS0iw.text: Pappadeaux has one of the greatest happy hour menus at the bar.  The seafood fondue is one of our favorites.

m3jXAk5CLHz9XzeL7c4iPw.text: Pappadeaux was definitely a highlight of my trip to PHX. The Oysters were great, fried alligator was moist, bread was fresh, lobster bisque was flavorful (altho a tad salty), and the blacked cat fish I had was cooked perfectly.   Hard to imagine better than this outside of NOLA.  Enjoy!

FmnVBfz3NqSFPPriyvL0hg.text: Eating here is more like an experience than just a meal. I had the salmon Yvette tonight, it was perfectly cooked, in a luxurious citrus sauce with crawfish and shrimp... This is definitely the best seafood dish I've had in Phoenix to date... Go to pappadeaux! You won't be disappointed!

NF83Y2IlZwK9UEJHHxu8zw.text: Pappadeaux is over the 5 start rating.  It was the first time there.  The photos do not do the place justice as it is so much better in person.  Lucky to be seated away from the bar area to avoid the noise.  Very accommodating as asked to be seated at a bit larger table that was available.  There was a number in our group.  I'm more about the food and could care less about the settings, not so here.  From the minute you are in the parking lot you feel like you are mentally taken away and transported to somewhere else.  Never been to New Orleans but, the other guest said it was very nice.  So, from the minute you get out of your car take the time to look around. Enjoy the settings from your car and including up to your table.  Glad to be seated away from the bar area noise.  The inside was nice as the lighting was just right as not to be to dark or to light.  I like to see what I'm eating and enjoy it, perfect lighting. Staff was helpful and nice.  We all got the Pappadeax Platter. We were told it is a lot of food and I thought, ya sure I'll see.  It was and had some to go home and I'm ok with that!  Enjoy it a bit longer.  The food was very good and was fresh, even the next day ... what I took home.  We all were to full for any desert and then saw some of deserts pass by to the next table, we're drooling at the site.  Just to full so, we plan on going back before dinner crowd just for desert. For a special night out it is a winner.  It is a relax place without the stuffy attitude that some places have.

_lEhgV4bsDph273aQAfgsg.text: Pappadeaux has been one of my family's favorite seafood restaurants in Phoenix for several years......until today!  We just went for dinner fairly early to beat the Friday rush.  We ordered our drinks and appetizer, approximately 15 minutes later my beer showed up after I had to ask the waiter for it again.  That was the first disappointment but was actually the least disappointing!  We ordered our food and were patiently waiting, we understand that the food does not arrive immediately.  20 minutes went by...then 30.  After about 40 minutes the waiter came out and let us know that he was sorry it was taking so long and that our food was coming right out.  After this extremely long wait our 22 month old son was at the end of his rope and was out of patience.  We told them that we had to have the food to go since it had been so long.  The manager came out and apologized to us and offered us either a free desert or a gift certificate ($7 desert or $50 gift certificate...don't take the desert!).  We do appreciate the gift certificate, however the disappointment was not over.  We got home to eat the food (travel time only about 15 minutes).  My fried oysters were cold and soggy, I assume they had been sitting on the counter for quite awhile before they packaged them up for us.  My son's kids shrimp meal ended up being only 4 shrimp in the box with no fries!  My wife was also not very happy with her fish, very bland and not satisfying.  We are very disappointed that Pappadeaux's has sunk to this level, we used to love it in the past but will not be eating there again.  To whoever we end up giving the gift certificate to.....sorry!

meoFK5XskUUm1lJE-YWJYQ.text: Good food but service was subpar

CyB-ynI3o4hZVteBdCe3sQ.text: Ate here on a recent trip to Phoenix and loved it. We had a group of 16 guys, mostly drunk and they even put our meals on separate checks without us asking. Gratuity included of course. I had Penne Pasta with chicken as I am allergic to shell fish and had no worries watching everyone else engulf lobster tail, gumbo and crab claws.

jjz7qOGYuezZVKoGmAfkRQ.text: First time diners at this great restaurant and have nothing but great things to say! My hubby and I celebrated our 18th wedding anniversary Saturday night and after asking friends where we should go, most suggested Pappadeaux. Of course when I called for reservations, the time I wanted was fully booked. However the hostess suggested I call 15 minutes before getting there to be put on the wait list (which was a 30 min wait)... Did what she suggested and after checking in, getting the pager, only had to wait another 5 mins! Driving almost 30 mins to get there ... This was awesome! LOL  We had two waiters (I think one was training or was paired with our main waiter) were wonderful. The one who greeted us, took our drink orders cleared our plates after each course and filled our water glasses was so welcoming. (I have to say, while we were being seated, we crossed paths with a few wait staff and all said " welcome to Pappadeaux".)  Our main waiter, Sam, was THE BEST. I asked him what he liked and he recommended the Mahi Alexander... Which I ordered!  My husband ordered the filet and lobster combo. Everything was cooked to perfection. The steak was so tender, the lobster was so buttery and tasty and my Mahi Mahi was paired perfectly with the dirty rice and the creamy crawfish.  YUMMMMMY!!!!  Of course, we couldn't finish everything ... Oh, and the baked oysters were soooo good! We ordered the Oyster Duo for our appetizer ... We also order the banana bread pudding for dessert... Also good! Our girl waiter took our dessert order and asked if we were celebrating anything special and after telling her it was our anniversary, our dessert came with a note written in strawberry jam "happy 18th wedding anniversary" Couldn't finish it all either but was able to take it home in the mason jar it came in. :)   What a great impression this place gave us! From the gorgeous courtyard with the fountain and live band outside, to the well trained wait staff (BRAVO TO THE CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGER!) and of course to the EXCELLENT food! We will definitely be coming here again ... And not just for special occasions.

4N_DvdECJS9eCyO7VQXOcg.text: I love this place! I live in AZ, and have gone here many times. HOWEVER, it seems almost 90% of the time my food/soup/appetizers are NOT HOT!!! I took a good look over the rest of the yelp reviews to see if anyone else said anything about the temp of the food. Nobody has said anything, which really surprises me! Do people like food that is not hot? The last visit I made to Pappadeux I really wanted to ENJOY my meal without having to return it to be "nuked" so I told the waiter of my issues and he looked at me like I was crazy - I AM NOT CRAZY!!! Hahah I swear my food is just not hot enough, and it's not like I want it to burn my mouth off I just don't want it to be - warm! That is not SUFFICIENT. Hot meal please, yes thank you! I pay good money, I want hot soup. I want HOT seafood not WARM. The waiter said something about how they need to cook it at a certain temp...um yes I know how to cook seafood that doesn't mean it's served warm.... along with everything else on the dish that is NOT seafood. Nice try. So I guess I have sort of a love/hate relationship with this place. If they would just serve it hot the first time, I would be in heaven.. /end rant.

ngQUWf2aSbfXlXbb4Ndo_w.text: Let me start by saying the crawfish ettouffee was the best I've had in a long time! The food itself should probably get 4 stars, however, our service was just plain bad, so I'm just going with 3 stars.  The outside patio area was really nice and they had live music and a bar outside.

tIsbbhTp2x1q_l3DsEbS7w.text: The atmosphere was awesome, great courtyard area, open kitchen. Service was top notch. Food was incredible! Very fresh, didn't have the typical give of a chain restaurant. My boyfriend and I went on catfish night and though we didn't get any it was fun to watch everyone get their buckets. Cocktail was yummy.. calamari melted in my mouth, halibut in burre blanc was amazing.

0oC_6yGA6A0cxQIjawtpug.text: this place is awesome! I brought my family for lunch along with some out of town guest. great food. the marti gras pasta ( shrimp, crawfish,sausage, and clams) was awesome along with the service.

gx_xA1EJrS7pC0irWIIAsg.text: One of my fave restaurants in Dallas and so happy there is one here in this godforsaken wasteland.  If you like raw bar seafood..this is the place for you.  Their oysters are awesome (just hint..don't be swayed by the more expensive oysters..not worth it and they are smaller.  Texas gulf oysters are delicious).  This place can get expensive, but the portions are huge and splitting is recommended.  The raw bar is very very reasonable and it's where I tend to hang out.  Bakers dozen of oysters and one of their sublime Bloody Mary's is a perfect combo.  Usually get their mozzarella sticks too which are light and crunchy with a very good marinara sauce.  Salads are yummy.  I tend not to order off the menu as the appetizers are filling enough, but I have had their fish, although I don't Cajun anything..if it's a good piece of fish and cooked right, you don't need to pepper it up.  Seafood brochette over dirty rice is one of my favorites and always tons left over for like a dinner and a lunch.  Best seafood place in the valley..hands down.  Oh..and the waitstaff is top notch.

8Pr11b7lF3A9wD8YKyDZ0w.text: I went to Pappadeux a few years ago and it was fantastic. The place was nicely appointed, the service was great as was the food and it was worth the price. Recently my husband and I decided to go there for lunch for our anniversary and were disgusted by the negative experience we had there. The place looks more like a cheap Vegas cafeteria now, the carpet is filthy, the silverware was dirty and the service was horrible! Our waitress seated us directly next to the only other people in the place which was ridiculous since the entire restaurant was wide open. The waiter waiting on that table was bringing them bread and going over the menu with them, ours did none of those things. We ordered the fried alligator appetizer which was over seasoned and chewy and when our lunch came it was clear that the catfish my husband ordered had come straight from a bag of frozen fish. The fact that the sauce and butter are served in paper cups at $20 a plate was unreal. The food was cafeteria quality at best my food was inedible. The waitress was rude so I finally asked for the manager who came over made excuses and finally comped the meal. It was a complete waste of time and we both left hungry. I don't know what happened to that place but it has become a terrible restaurant and we will NEVER go back!

xaJPdwTme5HGMG7vXxiRXg.text: Disclaimer: for a weekend night the parking lot was beyond a nightmere...imagine the mall on Saturday December 23rd.  We actually saw a guy steal a spot and then just about get into a fist fight over it, THEY WERE OUT OF THEIR CARS PEOPLE!  FYI, with a little patience we found a great spot close to the enterance.    For a chain....this place is AWESOME!  First of all the garden and fountains had me 100% even if the food had sucked (which it didnt).  Live music and cocktails while sitting in lush foliage with the sound of running water and the beauty of sparkling light made the 2 hour wait worth it (it was friday night, I've been told its not that bad on other days).  You pretty much HAVE to try the Spamp Thing cocktail....its the strongest bomb pop you'll ever drink.   We also sampled a strawberry peach cooler and a 'catagory 5', also fantastic.    Our server was great.  Charles Chester  was double sat but did an awesome job of making us feel as though we were his only table.  The general atmospher is very southern bayou with dim lighting and gas lamps, pretty unique for phoenix even if it might be considered cliche.  And listen here ladies, that flickering gas light does WONDERS for the complextion!     Alligator bites, eh....but the Lousiana Talipia I had served with green beans and spagetti squash was SOOOOOO GOOOODDD!  Plus I added a garden salad (which was huge....I actually ate very little of my meal due to this) for 2.95.  Where do you see THAT price anymore??  My dinner partners enjoyed a blackened talipia with dirty rice, fried catfish with fries, and a steak with mash potatoes and brocoli.  There was not a single complaint at our table!    Dessert was great.  Pappadeaux has those cheesy 80's dessert trays where everything has a coat of acrylic to keep it looking fresh....I LOVE those corny presentation trays!  FYI Pappadeaux has maybe 15 options for dessert?  Pretty impressive.  As a first time visitor we were offered a dessert on the house (WOW) and choose a chocolate brownie turtle thingie which was served warm w some yumm-o vanilla ice cream.  The single slice was HUGE, even shared between the 4 of us we hardly finished it.  Somehow we were able to force it down :)    For the price i thought the meal was a good value with plenty of fresh options.  The only think I'm dissappointed about is that Pappadeaux is not actually locally owned, although it is family owned.  It doesnt feel chain-y but I still try to avoid them as much as possible.

_smqMgOFXi7CwQMtsFovbg.text: Delicious Cajun food! A friend took me here for my birthday and I am definitely a fan. Great flavors and great selections. The food is slightly pricey but wonderful for the restaurant. Very memorable. :)   I would definitely come back. I love spicy and butter and this place has a wonderful combination of both. The portions are also large so it will feel you up until you are a happy full. Service at the table is also a hundred times better than the bar so sit at the table. For Westcoasters, like myself, definitely give this place a try!

4xyCQUuKt8GyON14dXTLzA.text: They've gone down in general.  Portions are smaller for happy hour.  Service is still aright.  Drained the pond out front.  Sad.  Bread and butter were not fresh last week and I always look forward to THAT simple pleasure .  We can forgive the burnt and salty lobster since they gave us a new one on the house without us even asking.  Just disappointed as we used to LOVE this place.

hLw64XIvVNa8dOYAcOt8mQ.text: This is one of favorite places to eat when visiting Phoenix My parents are True Southerners, Kentucky and Louisiana. So I have had a lot of Southern dishes.    I do not believe you will eat a better Cajun dish outside of Louisiana than what you will eat here. We have tried several things on the menu and everything is wonderful. To find this gem of a restaurant in the middle of the southwest desert is truly amazing.

TS6OePi3KK4QS68nLEnCTA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for so long! I have so many friends in the South that talk and post about it. When I was visiting Phoenix and passed this on the freeway I knew where I was going for dinner. A friend recommended the red fish, along with my server, and that's what I got. My friend and I ordered drinks which were ok, and coconut shrimp appetizer while waited for our food. They were yummy jumbo shrimp. It came with 5 and a sweet dipping sauce. Even tho I had to send my fish back, the manager and server were so kind and accommodating. The manager comped my meal and included a desert. It was such a wonderful atmosphere and meal, plays great service, I'm looking to trying one the next time I'm in the South.

XfwC1WcKQWG9YXIdWI8vwg.text: My husband and I had the cajun shrimp and eats,it was so good.The grits was made to perfection. I highly recommend
