wUwo9Ad_NAy8dF1Go5UOBw.text: Yummy!!  I recommend it to everyone! I'd eat here every wk. if I could afford it. :-) I found out that I even love craw fish; a dish I swore I'd never eat. Love this place!! Never had a single complaint about the food or service here. Service and food are above a 5 star click!! :-)

-LttBUbFQqoc9QPGQoEMyw.text: After years of my wife telling me we ate here once and I telling her that I've never been there. We happened to be in the neighborhood so I said let's go and I'll see if I remember the place. As soon as I walked up I knew I had never been there. The courtyard with the fountain I would have remembered. When we got inside I was certain I had never set foot inside. Has a Louisiana seafood feeling. I was impressed with the interior. Not super expensive high end but really nice.  Unfortunately I'm doing keto now and doing my best to stay on track. I have been craving grilled shrimp Ceasar salads. I got thier Ceasar, and added extra shrimp.  This was the best Ceasar salad I've ever had. Being as good as it was I don't want to know how many carbs were in the dressing. Don't tell me. That dressing is Awesome!  I wish I had got a picture of it. I will be back. We live in the city of Maricopa and I will drive the distance for good seafood.

FBCJ6dRHi6jHFwZqpd-9SA.text: This gets 4 stars because of the dinner prices.  Happy hour is amazing and they have cheap appetizers and drinks.  If you come for lunch or dinner try the bacon wrapped shrimp and dirty rice.  I have also tried 3 or 4 fresh fish options and they are amazing.  Their servers are knowledgeable with the menu and will help if you have questions.

RXp3v4sTNTt6s_MtIjGaUw.text: 3.5 years in the Phoenix area, and I had never been to Pappadeaux.  WTF was I thinking?  Seriously!  WTF?  I would soon find out that I was missing out....big time!  My buddy was out for Spring Training, and I had decided that we would finally try this place out.  We arrived around 11:30am and were seated at a table right away.  We ordered our drinks and some appetizers (alligator, and boudin) , then browsed the menu for a bit.  I had an idea of what I was going to get, but there were SO MANY delicious sounding items, it was hard to pick.  I made up my mind though and placed my order for the lunch sized portion of the crawfish combination.  While waiting for our food, our waitress delivered a loaf of French bread and some butter.  Here is how everything was...............  Alligator-  I had only had alligator once before (Dragos in New Orleans), and thought it was delicious.  Somewhat of a chicken texture, but a tad more chewy.  When we went to order the alligator appetizer, our waitress informed us that there was an option for it to be grilled, also (the menu only offers the fried option).  We decided to go with a large order and went half grilled, half fried.  It was a damn fine recommendation by our waitress.  The fried portion was crispy and chewy and had great flavor.  The star of the show though, was the grilled!  It was blackened in a great seasoning, and had great texture.  It comes with some "alligator sauce", and a few dips into that, put my mouth in heaven!  Both my buddy and I liked the grilled a little more than the fried.  Both choices were freaking delicious though!  Can't go wrong with either option!  Boudin- Boudin is a Cajun sausage stuffed with a dirty rice type mixture.  This appetizer came with 2 links on top of a pile of rice.  The casings that they use and pretty strong and somewhat hard to cut.  I pretty much split mine down the middle and just ate the "guts" of the sausage.  It definitely had a different texture/taste.  Reminded me of a "white hot", almost.  It was tasty, but not sure if I would crave it or get it again.    Crawfish Combination-  This was my entree, and it was damn tasty!  This mountain of a plate came with a massive pile of dirty rice topped with crawfish etouffee, and a massive pile of fried crawfish.  This entree should be split by 2 people.  One man should not try to tackle this thing on its own.  And this was a "lunch" portion.  Can't even imagine how big the "dinner" portion is.  The fried crawfish were breaded and seasoned perfectly!  I kept popping nugget, after nugget into my mouth and could not stop eating them!  The etouffee part of the entree was delicious as well!  It was a thick gravy filled with tons of pieces of crawfish, layered over dirty rice.  I am not the biggest rice fan, but this rice was awesome!  I ate until I could not eat anymore, and there was still about half of the etouffee left.  Got it boxed up and gave it to a homeless lady on our drive home.  My buddy went with the Cajun Combo (catfish and shrimp Creole).  He let me try some of his blackened catfish (biggest filet of catfish I have ever seen!) and it was delicious!  The shrimp creole was a bit skimp though.  It was mainly veggies and very few shrimp.  Total opposite of my crawfish etouffee (overflowing with crawfish).  After we gorged ourselves silly, we still went with some dessert.  My buddy loves key lime pie, so we went with a slice of that.  Holy hell!  Delicious!  HUGE piece of key lime pie.  Great graham cracker crust, perfectly chilled filling and it was topped with berries and puree etc.  It was a great piece of pie!  (It was comped off the bill, too.  Read other reviews of people getting a free dessert if it is your first time dining here...not sure if that is True or not, but it makes sense.  And, that is freaking awesome if that is why!)  Overall, it was a great lunch!  Pricey, yes, but that french bread, alligator, boudin, crawfish combination and key lime pie were all fantastic!  Pair that with great service, great company, and an awesome setting (the restaurant is beautiful!), it justifies the price, somewhat.  Can't eat here every day, but for special occasions or a few times a year, this may be my new "go to spot" in Phoenix.  It wasn't just the best meal of the weekend, it may have been one of the best meals I have had since being in Phoenix!  It was awesome and I can't wait to go back!

xvuhx8eOYnySVmDsZj4AFg.text: Terrible service. Food was so, so then pair with service that was worse than a Denny's ....not a good meal. Will not probably go back to this one again

HAMKEpeeZX4S9pXY7TsWuw.text: Great food. Susan was a great bartender.  Very good company.  Can't wait to bring more friends.  Thanks Susan for a great experience.

ZDC2o-owpECquv2akXpgJA.text: I come from a small town so when I stumbled across this place I completely fell in love. Everything I have ever gotten from here is just amazing! They always have fun drinks as well. My favorite dish is the Mardi Gras pasta!  The gator bites are another favorite.

Q7CkJBZjgWnvk5Cb7MuP-Q.text: Really great food and service. Everything I've had hear I've loved. Great please to meet friends and relax.

QqwO7AluAzWxKL2YrmsDHg.text: They were very busy when we came. Their service is great despite how busy they are. The portions are too big and the foods are on the saltier side.

jwOeWBFq41KaROWPVMw78A.text: Ambiance, service and food was outstanding. Went with my husband to celebrate our anniversary and being new to AZ this place did not disappoint.  I'm very skeptical of sauces so when I ordered the tuna they suggested the sauce on the side and I after I tasted it I gladly poured it over the tuna. Buttery goodness is what my husband and I kept saying. We will be back.

wOdkm5M5_NXhydGHtHTcwA.text: The food is decent, but it's nothing special to come back to. The price was outrageous. Almost $30 for a simple order of plain grilled "naked" salmon and a side of green beans. For that price, I was expecting either phenomenal quality and flavor, or a huge quantity. I got neither. I would have expected to pay $18-20 for that meal, not almost $30.  We had a table of 7, and waited over 40 mins for our meals to be served after ordering. Later, it was mentioned to us in passing that the food took forever because someone ordered a half chicken which takes a long time. The server should have warned us when that person ordered that dish, or at the very least should have come back to the table to check on us in that looooooong amount of time that we were waiting.   Overall, the quality of food was good, but not excellent. However we felt it was extremely overpriced for the quality/quantity, and the dining experience was poor because we had to wait so long.

_30Wyi_zYxugHW8T4kXDvA.text: I really want to give this 5 stars, I do. The food was excellent, the setting was lovely, but the service was a disappointment. Went here for lunch recently and was impressed with the pretty outside seating area, and the menu options. At first I was surprised at the prices, but when the food came it was totally worth it. We ordered several appetizers and shared. Lobster bisque, alligator, crab cakes, shrimp and crab cocktail, gumbo, salad... everything was delicious!!!  It was all just a little let down by having to ask for things several times over from our waitress who really didn't seem to care at all, maybe she was having a bad day, who knows, it's just knocked that 5th star off for us.  Will be back though for sure.

Ib-5Oune_xl3wCYkfdfwNQ.text: I use to love Pappadeaux in the location.  It was always amazing.  I went here last week for the first time in a long while.  I was disappointed that the Mediterranean calamari is no long an option on the menu.  It was fantastic.  I ordered the naked red fish.  I remember loving this dish but today it was just average and a little dry. Maybe the chef was just having a bad day, but today was not the Pappadeaux that I'm use to.

BaxlUNIhse-uUg_pzaBXzA.text: I am only giving Pappadeaux 3 stars and it's sad! I've been coming here for years and have always felt it was a 5 star place. My husband and I went there on a date night last night. The wait wasn't too long (we called ahead), but we wanted drinks while we waited. The bar was very busy!! Didn't happen. Lots of servers walking by us, why not serve drinks to people who are waiting? They'd make so much monSo we got seated but it took the server another 10 min to get to us. We placed our drink orders but the drinks took 15 min. Our app arrived before them! We ordered and the food arrived after about 20 min. The prices have gone up a lot but unfortunately the quality of our food was low. It wasn't even close to the quality as before. I don't even want to eat my leftovers. I had the Pasta Mardi Gras... it tasted like dirt. Literally. My husband didn't even enjoy his bacon-wrapped shrimp. The quality just wasn't there.   Pros: calamari was good Cons: very slow service, low quality on pretty expensive food  I really hope management reads these and makes changes. I'd like to go back but I will never drop another $150 at that place if it continues to be what it was last night.  UPDATE Management contacted us via Yelp and sent us a gift card to try again. They said this locations manager will be made aware of our complaints. It's nice that they cared and did this  another update Went last night for my cousins birthday. Everything was great just like we have experienced in years past. Excellent, efficient service and great food (worth the price this time). Haven't used the gift card yet, but last nights visit helped us want to try again.

rJNy2Lx4WEtWamEARNleWg.text: This is my favorite seafood place in Metro Phoenix.  I have been disappointed with anything that was ordered.  Thanks again for a great meal and service.

x0Y0BJq_VPx6g0vtRZOZpg.text: I have been here before and I didn't like it. My awesome brother loves it and wanted me to go. So i said okeeee.   It was packed as a mo-fo cause the UFC fight was on. We thought we would have trouble getting a table but they got us in right away.   Our lovely servers name was Brianna (liking that girls name)! Anyway, I got the crab mac and cheese.  ehhhhhh.... it wasn't that great. There was little to no crab and it just tasted normal. I won't complain too much cause I really do love macaroni and cheese.  The service was nice just like before but the food isn't really doing it for me.  I know i'll be back lol so I'll write another review on something else next time.  just ok

XqBbEmogvdJ1tORF87SBFQ.text: The server and staff was very accommodating and attentive. This is my third try as I have not wanted to wait an hour just to eat here. So it's after lunch hour and the crowd is gone, the pace slow and relaxing. I'm looking forward to a great experience and delicious food!   For appetizers it was lump crab and spinach, it was tasty but no crab flavor, then I got a side of gumbo. Gumbo as I remembered it living in Louisiana and how I learned to make it was usually in a thick broth, what I got was basically a wet salty soup, so salty I stopped after the first spoonful.   Moving on, my main course arrived, I ordered the lunch combo of blacken catfish on a bed of dirty rice and shrimp (4 pieces) creole over white rice. Again it was so salty I could not eat the catfish, my white rice along with anything supposing to resemble a vegetable was soggy. I ate 10% of what I ordered, the rest was thrown away.   Perhaps this is the after lunch crowd quality of left over or watered down food, I'm not sure. What I am sure of, is that I will not return for the quality of food for the price point was not present. I would not return there even if they offered me my next meal at no charge.  Also surprising my server did not question the amount of food left on the plates, especially after I mentioned how salty the food was. I should have requested a refund, the other party with me also complained of the food and stopped eating citing an upset stomach. I suppose if I had an adult beverage I may have tolerated the feasting of the horrible food... good thing I do not drink.

t7LzQAzIG2Q21RsXpAQVnA.text: So very friendly stuff  The food was amazing  It's my first time at this restaurant and definitely I will come back  Everything is so perfect

C72rFSxTXjRzvy8Hb0kN-Q.text: My family and I visited this location for lunch on Sunday. The food was great, service was mediocre. We noticed that the manager checked on every single occupied table but ours. Will we come back? Yes, definitely!!

d2IyeH-SBOfv6Vk3yjrIFA.text: Came here for me and my bf's three year anniversary, we usually love it but tonight was beyond disappointing. We ordered the seafood platter to split and after biting into the catfish, I realized it was completely raw. Literally feeling ill, we brought this to the server's attention and he brought us an unnecessarily crispy new fillet. I consider myself a pretty reasonable person, but I was upset to say the least when we weren't offered any compensation or at least dessert even after telling him it was our anniversary. Staff just seemed frazzled and confused on the patio. Luckily the manager was super nice and understanding and refunded the platter after I spoke to her, but the whole experience literally left a bad taste in my mouth.

CKRMym4cq5yKqrUvHlT5kw.text: Omg was absolutely great fried shrimp was unbelievable beautiful restaurant great for family really nice bar great service

1D88GGIfpFN3HxNJurnA6A.text: Server Felicity was an amazing. Extremely friendly welcoming and will definitely be requesting her when we come back!!!

vvkahlXWLpW0SKKLqM7x_w.text: I've been wanting to come here for a very long time after several friends claim it's their favorite place.  I arranged for a ladies dinner with a few friends.  Love their reservation process...you get a text confirming and also another one as a reminder the day of.   We arrived starving!  We were promptly seated and the ordering began.  My meal started with the Lump Crab Artichoke Dip.  It was very delicious.  However, I have to note that it did not taste like it had any crab in it.  No 'lumps' of crab whatsoever, not even a seafood flavor to it.  Still trying to figure that one out.  Did I say anything?  No, because it was a very delicious dip.  But I have to admit that at $17 I was disappointed there clearly was no Crab in it. After the appetizers we were brought warm bread and butter that was amazing, as well as salads and soups for those that ordered them.  My entree was the Mahi Alexander, per our server's recommendation.  Wow!  It was delicious.  I ordered the smaller portion and it was more than enough, I ended up with leftovers-yay!   Our service was great.  We were not offered dessert...just brought our checks (which were wrong and had to be corrected).  If it weren't for those 2 little things I would probably have given 5 stars.  We paid before one in our party realized we weren't offered dessert and she wasn't too happy about it.  I personally was way too stuffed! For me personally, I am an ambiance girl and I don't feel this is the right ambiance for a date night.  But it also was a little difficult with a large group because it is SO loud.  I would much prefer to sit on the adorable and very NOLA patio.  But being a December night it was much too chilly! I'd like to return in the spring and sit outside where it's quieter.   All in all, I was pleased and will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n08Ld9tTrU57O0b_ZXsJKQ.text: As someone who HATES Seafood, I am always so scared and hesitant to go to a seafood place. My husband recently celebrated his birthday, and wanted to try Pappadeaux. I agreed because it was his birthday.   To begin with, our waiter was amazing!!!!! Also, I got a Greek salad with chicken, and Oh Em Gee! The chicken was phenomenal! I have been craving it ever since!   This review is for anyone that doesn't like seafood! Although most seafood spots don't have very good non seafood options, that is not the case for Pappadeaux! Their food, whether seafood or not, is so good!

Tntfufs3by031kErfgH6Pg.text: Mixed experience.  Came in on a Friday around 730.  The place was pretty busy.  Tried to make reservations over the phone earlier but were told no reservations were available.  Walked in and the hostess said 30 minutes.  Went to use the rest room and the place looked 30% empty.  Walked back out and 5 minutes later were told the table was ready.  Kind of a shaky start.  Our waitress Nancy was extremely helpful and friendly.  She went over all the specials and the whole background of Pappadeaux.  We ordered several items to share.  Calamari cajun style, crab legs, Texas redfish, and Mississippi catfish.  We waited for our food and no bread was served.  We literally ate some of the crackers on the table.  Drinks were also very slow to come out.  We received the calamari and it was okay.  Kind of small for the price and could have used more cajun spice.  Our food finally comes out after quite a wait.  The large order of crab legs consisted of about 4 legs.  We asked for them to be cut in the back and there were a couple small slits on the legs instead of them actually being cut down the middle.  We expected much more from a restaurant that accounts for 1% of the entire seafood consumed in the U.S and charged $55 bucks for 4 legs.  The Texas redfish was ridiculously flavorful.  The brown butter and wine sauce just danced all over my taste buds.  The fish was fresh, buttery, and everything went perfectly with dirty rice.  Every bite was absolutely delicious.    The Mississippi catfish was quite dull in flavor after the Texas redfish.  It was severely lacking flavor and freshness.  We really regretted this choice.  For dessert we ordered a banana pudding to go.  It was okay.  Nothing special to really say about it.  Our bill came out to $240+.  Probably won't be back for quantity/quality vs price ratio was too much in favor of the house.  If by chance I do happen to come back I am definitely ordering the Texas redfish!

ETYqANm7XSWbJkAdb7aXaw.text: Best seafood restaurant in Phoenix!!! Had a great time with my wife and son, we really enjoy seafood and this place blowed Joe's crab shack out of water. We had the crispy alligator for an appetizer with the provide sauce, it was fantastic! My wife and I shared the SHRIMP, SCALLOP & SPANISH OCTOPUS PAPPARDELLE PASTA, I know a mouth full but every single item on that plate tasted absolutely delicious! The grilled octopus was the best not tough like most octopus we tried in the past but very tender just terrific! We also shared some raw oysters, very fresh and of a good size. We usually don't get dessert but since we were sharing our meals, I decide to order the pecan cheesecake. After we tried it we were more than surprise how well it turn out, very creamy. My wife is a tougher critic with desserts but she had nothing but good things to say. Overall we came here to try out some seafood with low expectations since we lived in San Diego and gone to places like Hawaii, tried amazing seafood from Roy's restaurant so we already had the bar set quite high for our palate. This place truly is a contender with other fine seafood restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a6c9o7B3Z42Oqd97KYjQZw.text: For a chain restaurant it's fine. The food was good and the service was great. What I had to ear was good and I'd eat there again but what I would do for a family restaurant instead. But what can you do? It's Phoenix and we're no where near Louisiana.

6Db-3LGIhm7R7lq-gpDeEw.text: This place gets a 5 stars because the food was wonderful and the portions were so big. I came all the way from L.A. to visit my parents and I am so glad I came to this place. The Po Boy sandwich with French fries was the best and it was so big it was enough for two meals. My mom got this seafood mix like a kabob and the dirty rice was amazing. My dad got the fettuccine pasta it had that hot sausage, shrimp and crawfish. I can't say enough about this place and the server Wyatt was the best server. He sings and he has the best personality. Make sure you tip him very well because he is worth every dollar. His singing voice (even with a cold) was great. Whenever I am on Phoenix I will be stopping here. It is well worth the money.

fYVLwVJhXQIJT0NkXkK_3Q.text: We used to love this place. I'm over it. I think the prices have increased & the food was mediocre.  Service was ok; our waters were never refilled & I wasn't offered another speciality cocktail.  My avocado shrimp cocktail was served in a cold glass bowl but then placed on a warm plate. I asked for a cold plate, he brought another warm plate. A cup of lobster bisque$18 for 1 1/2 c of soup with three small pieces of lobster.  $80 for two for lunch plus $20 tip. Expensive lunch.  I'm over it. Sorry going to find another seafood restaurant in Phx.

IszfZoMx68hB1Qq4cBZApg.text: The authentic Norleans in the desert restaurant, from oysters to fish they are the top notch. A little pricey but you have to expect that with fish brought in from the sea. They have other stuff but its all good

gQtcBm7EXvc5GLd-00oOzw.text: Historically good and unique but this was neither. Fondeaux was sent back, food was otherwise underwhelming. Char grilled, Texas red snapper was good yet broccolini was bland. Disappointing visit.

ofz1vLUP1xEQlBLdxtZ5KQ.text: Good food! Service was nice, and speedy. Because we came on Mother's Day, the wait was close to two hours. So, we were pretty starved. Since things were pricey, we were in luck to find that there was no extra charge for sharing. Overall good, but a little pricey and we had to wait an awful long time.

o5lnjPdoXXIwOALriazv3w.text: My husband and I have been celebrating Mardi Gras at Pappadeaux for several years. We have had the best waiters that are extremely fun and cheerful. The manager even stopped by our table to make sure my chocolate food allergy was taken seriously and made every accommodations for me. We definitely had a terrific experience.  Complements to the chef - alligator was nice and tender, as well as my crawfish. Thanks for a wonderful meal.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CAhrWOAWe9S76kGW-tstQw.text: We took a large party here for lunch today. They did a great job! The food was amazing and the service was very good. They were attentive, made sure our drinks and bread baskets were refilled, the food was hot and fresh when it arrives at the table. It doesn't always happen with a party of 14. We ordered the Cajun combo, Po Boy, shrimp and grits, several kids items and gumbo. The only reason I couldn't give five stars is because the gumbo was not as good as expected. The broth had very little flavor and we would not have expected this from occasion restaurant. However, the blackened catfish, etouffee, dirty rice we're all amazing! I definitely recommend this restaurant for large or small parties.

NYJIwLhZy8dyFkNmLRZSGQ.text: I would give it a 5 but it is seriously expensive.  Everything that I had was amazing and flavorful. The service was attentive and professional.  All the food was high quality and done to order.   The atmosphere is a bit noisy and open so if you are hard of hearing it can be overwhelming.  I would recommend for a special occasion or a treat!

A8Q7soN4-xQhR6h9WIE5kA.text: I like seafood just like I love other foods I wouldn't prefer it over any other food so I'm not obsessed with seafood but but I eat it and love it. So I wouldn't be able to tell you how great or not great or fresh something is. I went with a friend that is a sea food person and says that this is the freshest you will get in Phoenix. The food is sometimes heavy but still delicious. It's southern food and people go here to get that Louisiana type of taste.

ZPFwHYNBFtEZhLh0YZNPOg.text: The salmon was raw on the inside and cool when brought to the table.   Very  overpriced for the quality and lack of service.

wxS4xF45v8b7Y9wZBpSWmg.text: So I came to Phoenix to visit my family and work. Just so happen to drive by this Texas gem in the middle of the desert. So you know my friends and I had to stop inside. We get there and put it names on the list. Was expecting to wait 30 min...boom 15 min. Got seated fast and I order the voodoo drink. Filet mignon with the lobster. Side of asparagus and grits. I love this place and I love it more now that is on the west coast. I want one in California. Just love the Southern hospitality! The servers are always well groomed. The good is always perfect. It's worth every penny.

vkVkCMVUZUY3rdDk2F5uuw.text: Usually I don't give four stars to a chain, BUT Pappadeaux is usually pretty good and this one being this far west I am a fan. I do live in Las Vegas, but when I goto Phoenix I try to swing by here at least once every trip.   The boudin is always something that I get here, it is usually pretty good. If I am alone this is enough for me to eat along with a glass of wine.   If I am dining with others I try to get some alligator along with some other type of sea food appetizer so that I can have a variety.   All of the sea food is good here, but not as good as their locations on the coast, you just can't beat the freshness of the sea food on the gulf coast!

fUwr1ZN15s0sievYGgcwRg.text: Food was ok but service and follow up was lacking...  waited over 20 minutes for water refills and just to check out was 15 minutes more than it should've been.

PJxhIsDFYvFeUfV1tfZexA.text: Came here for Oysters Blue Point which were very good. The presentation was nice. The server we had which was a lady was new but very professional, and accommodating. I was here for a business meeting and the manager came by the table to confirm with my partner on the ingredients in a soup that he had ordered to avoid any food allergies. The service is pretty good here but on this particular day I was really blown away. They have gotten better over the years with changing their menu, and providing the best service. They really left a lasting impression on my client as well as myself

7r33DVPpj7rGAgQEouhUHA.text: The food here is expensive but really good. I especially love the alligator bites appetizer that they offer. We were seated within two minutes of coming into the restaurant and already had our drinks within five. I do plan on going back but with my budget, I have to say this will be a once or twice a year place for me to visit. I definitely recommended though because it has some of the best seafood in Phoenix.

yZ7wgP2XK5Qd_6V4gpucIQ.text: The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. Wait staff was average. Food was good but not memorable. We tried the frog legs, catfish, stuffed crab, and crawfish etouffe. You have to request the bread to get it and it's warm and tasty. Wouldn't drive across the valley again to go but glad we tried it.

sdFjyl__1cp53YLXBWkkoA.text: I never tasted alligator until my bf took me here, it's very good.  We've tried a few different plates here and love them all. Will definitely be back.

orwBtRZSHC8OzASMJFVIkw.text: Absolutely extraordinary. Best seafood I've had in a long time. If you've ever been to Savannah this really has the feel of "The Pirates House".  The food, the atmosphere, the server were just sensational.  Having grown-up in MD, I consider myself a crab-cake aficionado, best I've had east of the Mississippi in 20 years.

QTFRa7WJoA8197QMGlADFw.text: Too expensive, more than red lobster, and red lobster is good. We went knowing that this place was well known, however way to greasy, small portions, and we kept smelling fish that smelled expired. We tried it and my party of 4 all got sick. We were told that when fish smells too fishy it usually means it's bad or old. Plus our waitress continued to come to our table to inform us that the bartender was too busy and our child's milk would be out as soon as it could. "What did you have to milk the cow out back"..... come on the place is always busy , hire more support.

UMjUWBWEmasYl4LWfnxVXQ.text: I don't give five stars very often, but yes Pappadeaux's deserves them all. Coming from the east coast, I do miss my seafood. I'm a bit wary of any seafood I get in the Valley because it obviously has to be flown or trucked into the desert.   Pappadeaux's was recommended to me before I even arrived in Phoenix. The moving company driver told me about this place when he was loading my belongings on his 18-wheeler in North Carolina. I found the place on Yelp, showed him the picture, and he said, "Yep! That's it!" I bookmarked it in the app to check out.   I've been here a couple times already, but for some reason hadn't reviewed it yet. I most recently came with a friend for his company dinner (dinner on the boss! yay!). I had lobster, shrimp, oysters (fried and on the half-shell), calamari, and something else I can't even remember. The food has always been great. They have some pretty good salads and other items on the menu if you're not into seafood (my friend isn't, so that came in handy).    Love this place -- will definitely come back!

8FVEEiaCs970KNnFNdS7Og.text: So good! Love the food, atmosphere, everything! If your going for dinner make sure to make reservations 2 hours early! I highly recommend the Pasta Mardi Gras and the Crispy Fried Alligator (both kinds)

X0pBi6Nj0UVqd0qSQFwlwQ.text: Tried out this place for lunch with my family. Ordered the lobster and shrimp salad + small clam chowder soup. For $22 salad, I was expecting a lot more meat. Sadly, it only came with a few bite size lobster and couple shrimps. Clam chowder was good, but bit on the salty side.  We were given free toasted bread with butter. Bread was delicious! The place has a beautiful outdoor patio and our waiter Blake was excellent.   They also had a secret crawfish plate that was done upon request. Best crawfish I ever eaten. Extremely fresh. Try that out next time if you're a fan of crawfish.   Other than the high prices, this place was good.

VMqLCEMnafqhtRjVs5YDXg.text: Last time i was able to visit papadeauxs for dinner (excuse my spelling) my experience was less than stellar at one of the Georgia locations. This time around this location knocked me off my feet with the quality of food and service for their carry out orders. While in phoenix to celebrate my friends wedding. I didn't have enough time to dine in so i opted to carry against my usual notions that carry outs are never as good as dining in. Well, I would like to thank papadeuaxs for changing my mind because my carry out meal was phenomenal. It was just as fresh and delicious as if i would have dined in. The portion size and quality was not skimmed on. The food was still hot when I made it back to my fathers home which was about 30 minutes away from this location.  You can tell that this location puts pride into every dish they serve out their kitchen!

atxtK3To1bndUK93pAVWCw.text: Love this place! Great food! Great drinks! Beautiful patio and copeous amounts of space for parties of all shapes and sizes.

UJ-qyTDE68LJJjijfmK9OA.text: I walked in and 3 employees stood and stared and smiled at me... No greeting or anything until I asked "should I leave?"   Finally they woke up one said hello and asked if I was waiting for another person in my party.  Now I don't know of they just don't get single parties... Or maybe it was my tshirt and jeans (clean and groomed)  but by this point I was getting frustrated and I had not even been seated yet.   My server was more professional.   I had seafood gumbo ( which was sour)  I've never had sour gumbo before. Terrible .   The lobster bisque made up for it,    Over $31 for two boils of soup and a sweet tea.  Also restaurant with only 1/2 of the tables filled it was extremely noisy.  Only good thing was server Audrey B. sweet tea and bisque.   I think I'll not be back anytime soon.

uOslhjS_dW0DEaKBf8bfLQ.text: My wife and I stopped by for a late lunch around 1:30. Place was much busier than we would have guessed but were seated immediately. Server seemed busy and took awhile to get our drink orders. Since we had been seated for a time we ordered our entree at the same time.  Appetizer came before the drinks and shortly after manager came by and explained that they had to change out the CO2 and it would be a few minutes. Entrees came before drinks and when drinks finally came we said we didn't want them. When server came back to check and apologize for the late drinks I told her 25 minutes was unacceptable. She was very rude saying she was busy.  Manager came later, we told her what happened and to our surprise she bought our lunch. In addition gave us a gift card. What a great place!  (By the way, food was awesome as usual)

rsKnjfupxcqzwXmP2pzkoA.text: Excellent Dinner.  Great food, service at a fair price. One of my favorites in Phoenix area.

84cJyFgSQCskj_iBrBso_A.text: Very impressive!!! The place looks classy very romantic atmosphere... On a friday night (we arrived at approximately 8:40) at which point they  said the wait time would be about an hour. We sat outside enjoyed the live music & within 20 minutes... BAAAMMN we were seated! Our server NATHAN was oh so helpful in recommending food as this was our 1st time. Everything was delicious & well portions were filling no room for desert :'(  A bit pricey but great place to take a date or celebrate something! Will definitely come back soon!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster &amp; those black shrll thingys LOL

7jagyFFUCpVOLzZyI68J9Q.text: Food is amazing. Absolutely delicious. Its loud when it's busy so something to take into consideration. If you want an intimate setting or in our case we had my older parents with us, we couldn't carry on a conversation it was so loud.

pAVw9Ykun0xdbs7uiPhujg.text: Awesome food and staff. Happy hour here is perfect. Get a chance to sample a lot of  menu items at a great price. Get there early, it fills up fast.

8hssXSsR5CfatzDGsw7FNA.text: Loved it, I can't wait to go back when I'm not on a date so I can make a fool of my self devouring my food in a fashion befitting it's awesomeness. I had fried oysters, and granted you can't mess that up to bad, these were cooked just right (not over done) the baked potato could have been a river boat and was loaded down with all the yummy topping you could wish for. The lobster bisque had nice chunks of lobster in it and it was served with French bread and butter. Now the gumbo was not my favorite all though I was impressed that there were oysters in it. I will also admit I'm from Louisiana and I have a high standard for gumbo as my pawpaw is basically a master at making it. The staff was super friendly. Two request- please get a remoulade sauce, it goes good on everything- and get some family dinning specials. I would love to take my three sons for a meal with out having to sell a kidney.

3LSDpHfi9lykkxnk5vf20Q.text: The price is a bit high. The kids' meals are good quality compared to some places. We have gone here three times. The service is always good. I typically get some kind of fish along with raw oysters. The included bread is good. We enjoyed the blackened alligator appetizer.

W3BtqC9GwZDErCG_Nl3auw.text: The setting was pretty dark. Open dining so kind of on the louder side of dining. I give the service a B. Menu selection was pretty good. A lot of fried food, and a little expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut shrimp appetizer. The sauce was great
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely drinks and fresh bread

vQUQMDucddyzbqfyvy-Qww.text: Spend your money elsewhere!  First time at Pappadeaux we had a bad experience with 1 staff member, brought it to the attention of management and were given a $50 gift card to make things right (was a pretty bad experience, not normally complainers)  When returned for a 2nd time, to use the gift card, the hostess sat our party of 3 in between 2-10+ person parties.  Our 4 person table was squished in between the 2 parties that when the server went to take people's orders at the big party she was literally standing over top of me, shouting to the people on the other side of the table.  We asked to move as they clearly had open tables in other areas that were not so cramped - it was such an ordeal to allow us to move 30 ft to a new table.  We get a new table and it takes 15-20 minutes before anyone comes over.  By this time it's about 6:15pm and we know happy hour is only until 6:30pm.  We asked for a round of drinks and are told happy hour is only available in the bar area.  WTF.  We decline ordering drinks at the table and one of use walks to the bar, orders happy hour priced drinks and brings them back to our table.  Genius!  Apparently this is frowned upon though, oh well.  And the happy hour drink prices are laughable, a sweet tea...whatever its called was $8 - what the hell does it cost non-happy hour.    Their food is horribly over priced for what you get, its on par with Red Lobster and almost twice as expensive.  My friend ordered the stuffed crab and the server lets her know there is no crab in this dish, its 2 empty crab shells stuffed with breading, shrimp and fish bits.  12 shrimp cost about $17, I did not see any evidence that they had been dipped in gold prior to the fryer.  My friends Caesar salad has ONE lone crouton floating in the soggy, limp lettuce.  Our server, Jimmy was empathetic that we were having a rough experience and he gave us a creme brulee on the house.  Not to sound unappreciative, but I'm glad we didn't pay for it, was just meh.  Time to pay.  Our bill comes to $72.  We have the $50 gift card and throw in $40 in cash and decide to let Jimmy keep the difference which is a pretty nice tip, since he had given us dessert.  He picks up the check book and we tell him we are good, no change needed.  We start to get ready to leave and another server/manager perhaps comes over w/ a receipt showing we owe $18 after the gift card was charged.  The $40 has disappeared, did Jimmy think we gave him a $40 tip??  To avoid any further annoyance we just leave and leave the $18 DUE receipt on the table.    Go to Red Lobster :)

4PtOcMYbEnKuQqkg_wQrgQ.text: Last night was the worst experience I've ever had at a Pappas establishment. I've eaten at all of them but the service and timing last evening was horrible. I waited 1.5 hours to be seated then after 45 minutes waiting for the appetizer the manager came over and pretty much said he would take care of us. Well that did. It happen either. We paid full price for horrible service. The food was great but my two year old grand son just did not have the patients to be there 3 hours. Please reach out if you care.

Iqz_zRv8ir8kpBW645jq_g.text: New update guys..   Group of 5 came in on Fri. Our server will, was amazing very detailed oriented and punctual even in a large room and crowd. The food has gotten alot better. In the past it tended to be a tad bit salty. This time everything was on point. Oyster where super fresh no sand witch u tend to get alot out here.had po.boy catfish recommendation more coleslaw the fries or amazing creole seasoning.gumbo had amazing taste not overly salted  Wish They Would Increase Beer Selection MO RE Stouts Ipa.etc. better then last time service and food amazing.

XQJkKMizlDbAE63GWcMTiw.text: So disappointing. Decided to give this place another chance with a new to town seafood living couple because it was fresh the last time I went. After calling ahead of time, they said the wait would be 15 minutes. It was 45. We have been here for almost two hours, no food on the table yet. I am starving. There are so many people, the waiters are stretched so thin. My little lunch just became dinner....

VHcWchGXJrf-YXJXmkiPpA.text: One of my favorite places for canun seafood. Never ordered anything I didn't love.  Great atmosphere.  Stafd is always friendly.  Great place for date night anf anniversary dinners.

kqRu2aKeoeI2-X1CmO6zgA.text: We went here yesterday evening to celebrate a birthday. Made the reservation several days in advance since we had a party of 20 expected. Really enjoy Pappadeaux's. We come here often enough and at times in larger groups. Once we were seated we were greeted by a really personable server. The food here is always great! I understand that a party of 20 can be challenging. We let the server know we would be doing separate checks right off the bat. I'm not sure what happened but the ends of the table were asked for a drink order and appetizer but the middle was never approached. Waters came out and bread. Next thing I know appetizers were out and I never got to put one in so I just figured ok entree it is. Well once again server came out to take the order sporadically. She would take an order and than walk away. I thought it was a little strange why not take all the entree orders at once? Well after the entrees came out no one came out to check on us or they would have found out we were missing three entrees. When those of us who got our food were finished we were left waiting for the check. Several in the party had to try and find someone to bring us the check and take the payments. At this point the dinner had gone on longer than what anyone had planned for and everyone needed to go home. We didn't even get to do cake and sing happy birthday because by the end everyone was feeling really disappointed and tired. The missing entrees eventually came out at the end of the meal. No manager came by to apologize for the service or to make sure everything was ok. Overall the food and drinks that did come out were great but the execution left little to be desired.

R8-HSXXYHJ0uajUrKLS8Eg.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! I have been coming here for years, especially when they have their seasonal crawfish and the all you can eat lobster deal. Their crawfish is nicely seasoned as it includes a corn and few small potatoes. My good friend always order the soft shell crabs and lobster bisque, both are delicious. Then again, all their food is delicious.  The one thing I find good is their customer service. I've had a few visits where my food came out cold, too slow, or wrong order (which often happens at restaurants anyways) and the manager came over to apologize and comped that meal, even when honestly half the time I don't even realize it.  If you are a seafood fan, don't hesitate to come here. You won't be disappointed.

lSe2u6mt9Gj6eL_Xzn0-mA.text: Lunch visit:  I dine here with work friends once or twice per year.  Huge fan of the seafood salad, frog legs, alligator, shrimp, catfish, and clam chowder.  I like the change of pace and it's large enough that you rarely have to wait being seated around noon.  For groups of 8-10 ask for the Wine Room off the bar for a more intimate dining experience with groups.  It's a nice quiet room where they store their wines, a great place to have conversation when you are with an oversized group.  The courtyard is nice transition zone from the parking lot and helps set mood.  Unfortunately when you get in it can be a bit noisy.

x5B80JAm1PgefmqgSCdgAw.text: Came here to celebrate my birthday and I loved it! Great atmosphere and excellent cocktails. I had the Costa Rican Mahi Alexander and it was delicious! Will definitely recommend and come back again when I return to Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Costa Rican Mahi Alexander

hDoH7jk-NaB3jTNg_7tLGg.text: Happy hour is well done. Drinks and small plates. Spicy shrimp with potato and corn cob is really good

VW1fzYhTmi9azNFZGAPAog.text: The wife & I finally got back to give these guys another try by using the gift cards they sent us in apology for our last experience. This time was much better. Our server, JENNIFER (a trainer) was awesome. Never wanted, needed or had to ask for anything. She was on top of her game! Food was hot, fresh and came out in a relatively quick amount of time. I had the fried shrimp & catfish filets again and my wife tried the Lobster & Crab salad. We were both happy. We also started with a lobster bisque which was just slightly on the salty side. I still think the portions are small in relation to price. I had 5 shrimp and 2 catfish filets ($25). Overall, a save on their part in customer retention.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dapy6m5yWarado_lDWLCDw.text: Such good bread and butter at the beginning we knew it would be good! The Sea bass was delicious but my spinach was undercooked! Also the crab dip is Such good bread and the Seanad was delicious! Also the crab dip is so good! We are stuffed! It's a little pricey but good!so good! We are stuffed! It's a little pricey but good!

WCNP4WfCxWER3ABKiTCfsQ.text: My girlfriend and I went to the I/17 location in Phoenix last night for the first time.  The parking lot was packed, so we were excited that the food must be great.  The hostess said it would take an hour and a half, so we saddled up to the bar instead.    The bartender's were nice, but way understaffed.  It was taking an average of 5-10 minutes for new people to get recognized.   The bread and butter was the highlight of our meal......warm, crisp and fresh tasting.  My girlfriend's salad was loaded with dressing that was mediocre tasting ( she only had a few bites).  But,my gumbo was pretty good and very fresh tasting.    My girlfriend's mussels and lobster dish was overcooked as the seafood was hard and rubbery, while my crispy salmon dish barely resembled the awesome picture on the menu cover.  It tasted bland and only had a single, tiny speck of the delicious crab advertised on the picture.  We ate exactly 1/3 of our meal before calling it a night, and a hundred and fifteen dollars later, we left disappointed.

7cuV0kBkRsJC-iAjJ86j6A.text: Great Environment,  Love the live music. Great Happy hour.  We came there one night for a workers outting. Classy yet Relaxing.  A bartender that makes a fine drink and food that is pleasing to the pallet. Do make sure you budget a decent amount.

ZpU-VZzlaONQdPpvKijQhQ.text: I just had my wedding here on Tuesday! The staff was amazing!! The food was better than ever, and they even helped to accommodate some family needs. We wanted a tiny wedding with the ceremony outside on the patio by the wall fountain...it was PERFECT!!!! I highly recommend for small parties (up to 20/25) and date nights! Don't let the food price scare you off, it's worth every penny!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fountain on the patio for an evening wedding.

IG0eyMPTSPU6SNjlFoHFZQ.text: The Pappas restaurant group is always superb, with Pappadeaux being one of the best. Food is high quality and serving size is larger than most restaurants. Service is always attentive. Atmosphere is pure cajun. We tried the oysters on the half shell and shrimp gumbo for appetizers, the pan seared tilapia was outstanding, and for dessert the pumpkin pecan pie with ice cream was delicious. Wine list is extensive with wine by the glass available, and the bar is stocked with premiums too. Pappadeaux is highly recommended. Enjoy!

1cSTY6tCnzIQX8vPlTsffQ.text: Just had the best birthday dinner in sometime. Chilean sea bass with crab over spinach was awesome. Hurricane with spicy rum mmmmmmm. Isaiah was also awesome with great  descriptions and prompt service.

AbpfT6dDT2Wyv2bSK07oJQ.text: A wonderful menu full of great seafood options with portions that will leave you full to boot! It's on the expensive side I would say though with a full dinner costing over 100 especially if you want to try something like alligator.

_Uklz-FdEq5BDkgeX21EhA.text: Horrible hostess service prevented us from eating at all. We were told it was a 45-60 minute wait. After waiting patiently for more than one hour, we were told there were three 5-top tables in front of us and it would be at least 30 more minutes. No apology or accommodation was offered. No restaurant is worth that brain damage.

PN8DdZ_9DQEwoe6Oa76Q-g.text: Amazing food. I've tried almost everything on the menu from the gumbo to the alligator and this place doesn't ever fall short. Definitely try it if you haven't already!

Svmm9M2rKD153wjQnYkdgQ.text: OMG the alligator tail appetizer, and probably some fo the best salmon and craw fish etouffe I have ever experienced!

3dIsLcNE3MRLp79nQjg9-w.text: So good! Best seafood in Phoenix. Reminds me of my grandfathers seafood restaurant.  I highly recommend getting some fresh raw oysters and my favorite fish dish the Chilean sea bass.  The only thing I don't like is that they took the shrimp montage off of the menu and it was amazing!  If its just you and your lady eating dinner save some time and grab a seat at the bar.

_E82mBXqRiSLyj7dJImozw.text: Hello I went tonight and once again a nice time the server we got ask for he was very freindly nick michalle it was a very nice birthday

XPlzb1CiiU0fenxze8sq6g.text: Top of the line! Went there to celebrate several birthdays in my family. The waitress was the cutest thing ever. She was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. She did make a mistake but quickly corrected it. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was pleasant.

MGEAzhlOBug9yO1fFb2TiA.text: We had a large party here;  the service was impeccable, the food was delicious & the atmosphere is delightful!

yZP4YCxq7hZbG4xtbDGzGA.text: Location: Phoenix, AZ  Parking: Not an issue at all since I walked here from my hotel, but there's a massive parking lot with many available spaces.  Ambiance: The ambiance and decor immediately transport you to the bayou, although I have never been to the bayou and only know it from what I've seen in the media.  Went twice during my stay in Phoenix.  Once during dinner and also a to-go order for lunch.  During dinner, it was very dim and some would say too dim to even see what you are eating.  Very loud so you can forget about having a nice, tranquil conversation with whomever you are dining alongside.  Service: DINNER - service was ok.  I got really irked when I asked for recommendations from our waiter.  Their menu is massive and I had a hard time deciding what to get.  I asked for some recommendations and the waiter immediately blurted out the most expensive thing on the menu and nothing else.  Hmm so just one recommendation...do you really think that's good, or are you just fishing for a bigger bill which will lead to a bigger tip?  Water refills were on time, and the wait staff was for the most part attentive, so the recommendation thing was the only major downfall. LUNCH - Called in my order and said it would be ready in 10-15 min.  Walked over from my hotel (about a 10-15 min walk) and went inside.  Hostess pointed me to the to-go pick-up area.  Went over and waited for another 5 min before being attended to.  Paid for my order and waited another 5 min before receiving my food.  Waited a total of 20-25 min for my food.  Not that big of a deal, but they should know this for future reference.  Food: DINNER - After receiving a short-ended recommendation, I had to look over the menu a little bit more so my table mates placed their orders first.  I ended up getting the Crawfish Etoufee.  The dish was filled with crawfish.  Everything tasted fine except the white rice.  I'm Filipino so I've had my fair share of rice in my lifetime.  This rice tasted like minute rice.  That might fly in Phoenix, but in my world I expect something a little better.  At least the rest of the dish kinda sorta made up for it.  Portions are huge!  Everyone at my table had leftovers.  I would've had leftovers too but I was pretty hungry and ended up leaving super stuffed! LUNCH - I ordered the "Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo & Shrimp Po Boy.  Now this was good!  Gumbo had a bounty of different seafood and tasted awesome.  The po boy had plenty of fried shrimp.  The bread on the po boy could have been better.  When I dipped the po boy into the gumbo MAN OH MAN was that BANGIN!!  Here's a tip for a new menu item: instead of a "French Dip," how bout a 'FRENCH QUARTER' DIP = Shrimp Po Boy + ("Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo - white rice).  Dip the po boy in the gumbo and as Chef Emeril Lagasse would say BAM!!!  Overall: 3.5 STARS this place is A-OK.  It is a bit overpriced.  If it weren't for the great lunch I had, I probably would have given it a lower rating.  Get the GUMBO and PO BOY and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Louisiana&#34; Seafood Gumbo
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch: Louisiana Seafood Gumbo &amp; Shrimp Po Boy
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crawfish Étouffée

Zm2-7pAyHv4M-N3Y-Y6G0A.text: I love this place!! My partner and I had our first date here and have been addicted ever since!!  Etouffee till I die!! It's amazing!   All the staff is awesome, the bands/performers they have are way awesome and on point for the atmosphere!!   Quickness of service is surprising considering they are ALWAYS busy!   LOVE THIS PLACE!! Try it!!

bIA8hfgAZk1-CYAWCvDrDg.text: Probably the only place to get fresh seafood in the desert. Cajun cuisine at a reasonable price!

XfPfXkyC5TTz5B6TVxkLPQ.text: Always a favorite, the food always is amazing and well prepared. The Tuna was outstanding!

H32LkyTNN0cAJ8eOCm2b4A.text: My husband and I have been here several times and have always been pleased with the quality of our meals.  It's hard to find fresh seafood in Phoenix and this place has delivered time and again. We always go during their happy hour which is from 3-6 M-F in their bar area which includes seats at the HUGE bar top and a few booths.  Not sure if HH is available on the patio... Compared to their normal menu prices ($$$) their HH pricing is fantastic.  And if you have a hankering for oysters this is the place to go.  Last time we went we got a dozen  of delicious Gulf Coast oysters for $7.95. They have several other HH food items in the $4-$7 price range ( calamari, catfish poboys, steamed cajun shrimp served with sausage and corn on the cob) but our favorite by far is the alligator.  They typically serve it fried but on our first visit our server recommended trying it blackened. We went with her suggestion and were not disappointed. It is served with a rich, brown sauces that is is on it's own fantastic. The drink prices on their HH are decent as well.  I usually go with their specialty cocktail "The Swampthing" It's a deceptively strong, frozen drink that I highly suggest. Get the large, it comes in an icy goblet that will keep your drink nice and cold as you enjoy your meal. They also have a good draft beer selection if that is more your thing.  The bill between the two of us is usually around $50 for a few  apps, a couple drinks a piece and a dozen oysters. They will also provide you with some fresh baked bread.  The regular menu is rather large and features a variety of seafood.  You have quite the selection to choose from including alaskan king crab legs, live maine lobster  and all sorts of fish.  I think I saw a scallop dish or two on there as well.  They also have several "combination" platters that feature fried shrimp, fish, stuffed shrimp, stuffed crab, etc. My husband once ordered a cajun tilapia (mahi perhaps?) with scallops dish that he loved off their "Specialty Menu". I can suggest the live lobster as well.  On one visit I saw the lobster tank and couldn't help myself. They actually had an 8 lb lobster in there! He proudly carried the title "KIng of the Tank" He was $159 and probably would have been worth every cent but I opted for one of the smaller guys.  I was not disappointed.  Mr Delicious was served with drawn butter and a side of pasta (linguine with diablo sauce I believe) and I have actually gone back and ordered just the side of pasta it was so good!   The restaurant itself is rather large but it is always busy so get there early or at least call ahead.  Especially if you have a larger group.

1olW1avWZzuNUgpfKS4RhA.text: Freakin love this place! Pricey, but the food is always great and the service is exceptional. I met Alice Cooper here once too.

lrGxm-CLyr9IFS0-wKfMwg.text: Yes!!!! It's expensive, but it's soooooo good. Our table had the salmon, shrimp and grits, oysters, and a seafood salad. It was all delicious! I just wish this location was closer to the city. If you want good Cajun seafood, just go try it!

WFn2eOb6Q9Q2Fl-QbWYscw.text: If you love oyster then this is the place. Jose has been with this restaurant from opening day. He is an oyster expert. Stop in and  experience heaven with on the half shell.  Love this place!!!!

LFkaWz77MHzgiRsjX585kQ.text: I personally think this is great food! Best clam chowder I've ever had. The wait can be harsh and long,  but it's worth it and it gets really busy so I understand why. overall, great food and great waitresses and waiters!

GCfjOqLkVGUnvpfnkyez7w.text: A must if you are in the area!! We had a party of 6 and everyone was pleased with their meal. The decor gives you that New Orleans vibe. We were seated promptly although it was very crowded.   The crab legs ate HUGE, mussels very flavorful and the fried platters are amazing!

FVBVERgKrt89PTMM5POORw.text: One our faves, and now our new favorite bartender Cierra took it up a notch. Awesome meal!

qtzeerscv8gF967mN3ZY9Q.text: I've been here several times and the food is excellent.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because on my the last visit my date and I were bombarded by flies (we sat towards the street by a window) However the food is amazing!  Seriously, the only thing i've ever had bad here were all the dates I've been on. The mediterranean calamari is orgasmic, the lobster bisque is yummy.  The service is good.  Get there early or else you'll be waiting, either for a seat at the bar or in the dining area.

j-Du4op4hmc7u38BKh7_Zg.text: Pretty. Busy. Too expensive for what you get. Ordered an amaretto on the rocks & got a glass full of ice with barely enough amaretto to wet my palette. All of the food is A la carte which,  if it's served family style makes sense but, for the price of 1 baked potato you can buy 10 lbs. Our friend's ordered the oysters & they were undercooked, which can be dangerous.  The cheese grits, However, we're excellent.  In a small town perhaps I could understand the popularity of this restaurant but, in a city like Phoenix there are too many other restaurants with the same type food for less money & better food. No need to return.

3Rb2UfWTzKJ3mSXw3TRP3w.text: This was my first time trying Creole food and I was pleasantly surprised. The service was amazing. I ordered broiled shrimp with spaghetti squash which was nicely cooked and tasty. The fried catfish fillet was also very good. The calamari was a little spicey.

bSctSULthryEuraMI_wGKw.text: I just reached out to them because of something I saw on their to-go menu. I was transferred to a low energy to go person. I asked if they had a family pak item at their store I got a simple no we don't and that was it. there was no effort to maybe attempt to get me to look at something else. Family paks start at over 60 dollars so it would have been a nice ticket for them, but I guess they are doing so well they don't need or want that type of business. I have eaten there once and it was just Ok so not surprised about the interaction.

f-u7FxIJDvWzn9Rcrod-Jw.text: We left town early enough to make it here before closing.  It's our favorite place for fresh fish.  Every time we come, regardless of the season, the food is always top notch.  The service is just as good as the food and tonight was no exception.   For months we have been waiting for this trip, knowing we would be eating here made the planning even more exciting, and we finally got our most favorite desert, the carrot cake cheesecake.  We had tried this a long time ago and been waiting for it to come back on the menu and we were lucky enough tonight.     We love this place so much, we always end up buying gift cards for family members to enjoy it too!

jtYDGJ_x8UAfKKN7jxmlrw.text: The food and service is amazing. The portions seem to be getting smaller while the prices continue to go up but overall it's a great restaurant.

H_lsO1FIRIY1p6_CCjCMJA.text: The food was good even though by steak was overcooked AZ for medium-rare and I got well done not the way I really like to eat my steak but I went with my wife for our anniversary little expensive but the meal was good

8XtaIVyT1JnO00W6oF7Djg.text: I love their lobster bisque and Pecan/Praline cheesecake. The stuffed crabs and fried crawfish are also very delicious. Its a little pricey but its worth it more often than not.

xjSILSm8V39Mj3lWZ9Nllw.text: 3 1/2 stars. It's been a year since last time I dined here and we sat in the main dinning room vs the outside patio. This area is large and overly noisy and it's difficult to even communicate here.  For dinner I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras Linguine tossed with crawfish, andouille sausage & crimini mushrooms in a marinara cream sauce topped with jumbo grilled shrimp. The dish was tasty and the seafood was fresh except for the crawfish which was out of season. The pasta was not temperature hot - I think the noodles were cold and that made the dish lukewarm. The other entree we tried was Seafood Platter - Fried tilapia fillet, shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab and french fries. This was just eh! There was much filler on the stuffed items and I thought was pricey for what we received. Favorite item was the tilapia. For dessert we split the mint chocolate chip cheesecake which was yummy.  Our waiter was the best - very attentive to details constantly checked in with our needs and handled every request immediately. He was formerly employed at Pappadeaux in Houston but this gent could work at any dinning establishment.

bPYdImu0nAQ0trKWZXoPgQ.text: Welp... This was a huge disappointment. First, the service was horrible. I asked for a refill for water. They said someone else was coming. After the third time, they refilled it. Once it was time to order, we were told we could not move spots. Not in a joking way, but more of a we will hate you if you do. My food came and it was cold. They brought out new food pretty fast so that was a plus. Also, Personal space was an issue. I must have been in the wrong seat. I was brushed up on and touched way too many times. At one point, I got up and moved to the other side of the table because i had no space of my own left between myself and the server.  I paid way too much for average food and really bad service. I will never come back here again. Totally not worth it.

YOrWXl5nErKI6T7XlO_Cag.text: Always awesome never fails me whenever I'm in the city where one is I am there without a doubt this location tends to be busy on the weekends but the bartenders will still noticed you in passing so no complaints here great food

QKzkwwcdPzhqofQpyI4xAw.text: This was the crab fingers sauteed dinner for 23.95 Before we even touched it! It looks like someone's left over meal, not a fresh entree .. the appetizer we ordered at the restaurant was full of sauce and almost no oil.. this thing is like an entree of oil and a side of crab fingers. Gross and tiny portion smaller than the appetizer !   We ordered it to go and received it in a closed container already bagged... I wonder why? Who on earth works in their kitchens to approve this to go out ?   We ate a lobster bisque bowl and the crab fingers appetizer while we were there and both tasted good and were well presented so did not think to open this and check it.. mistake.   This was our first time there.

z7YQVDUvbw6eJWQrgOvNZw.text: Tonight hubby and I visited the restaurant and as usual they were busy! I notice after the  Oyster appetizer our food took a little longer to arrive. About 30 minutes later the hostess came by and knowledge this and asked if we wanted anything a salad or soup? I asked for some bread. Then we got some bread. 10 minutes later she came back and apologized again and said she would comp our dinner. I was very pleased on how the restaurant handled this. I had to wait a long time yes but we were not mad or throw a fit or anything but they just somehow made my dining experience a positive one giving of course we would return again! My fish was cooked perfectly. Great job on customer service!

75r3icWL7qtZ7rr2GtTx4g.text: So good for seafood in Arizona. Everything from the drinks, to the crab cakes, the gator , and the crab is so delicious. Fun place to eat love the vibe.

T4Zk4QGlRkQVmddJRZrMOg.text: Love this place!!need I say more...staff is great ..sea food is delicious....the drinks are quite tasty....

uZQHqGXVXEhrVLfo8DVoHA.text: Came here the Saturday before Mother's day. It was busy, 1 hour and 45 minute wait, which we were expecting. We called earlier to make reservations, but were told all reservations booked up 2 weeks prior.  Got drinks & apps at the bar to pass the time. Closed out the tab there as it could not be transferred to the table.  When we finally sat, our waitress Megan did not bring out utensils. I had a few questions about the menu, she didn't know the answers. She compred some dishes as "similar" as her only form of description and after a simple google search, I found they were very opposite. We started to eat some bread after placing our orders, but there was no Megan around to ask for napkins. I saw a bucket and grabbed some for the table. A manager saw and half-apologized.   Our food came 30 minutes later and my dish was completely wrong. Megan claimed my hard shell crab was soft shell. She claimed she brought me a dish that wasn't on the menu. She tried to cover up her mistake. I wasn't having the lies and just asked her to take it back. Not once did she apologize or say sorry. A different manager came over and gave me the right dish to go.   Started to eat a side of the dirty rice someone at my table got, it had a LARGE onion shell in it and was very dry.  We tried to get our check but Megan disappeared. Waited another 10 minutes to flag her down.  It seemed they were understaffed - even though they had been expecting this crowd for over 2 weeks. Kinda felt bad for Megan, but that wasn't an excuse. Please steer clear of this place. Customer service and food are subpar.

YLAixkmcVd9__fswCB3SeQ.text: Good food but unless you make reservations it's a long wait. Super loud in there. Becoming less of a favorite for me.

wWIVtqFev2G3jutBdANB5A.text: I'm too fat and happy to write this properly now but holy schnikeys,  Batman, that was some good grub.  And atmosphere.  And service.  More later.

G9DpfzpDt4ObRFwV2U45Qg.text: I love this restaurant and when I came to Phoenix, had to make sure that I came here...what I get is usually the same...crawfish etouffee  and I take a piece of key lime pie to go....what can I say, some habits I like!  The waitress was amazing and I am so sorry I didn't get her name...she took the time to just make sure our experience was a good one and the person I came with had never been there before!  Left a good impression on her...and it would have been nice to remember her name...to give her a shout out!    LOVE LOVE LOVE this place it has never disappointed me!

I grew up eating tons of seafood and I know it's expensive but I know what I'm getting and how much I can get with the same money at the market. I wish it was just a bit less expensive and I would definitely would go more often.

djZ6ALGY3KVJo5RB_Y_CxQ.text: This restaurant is by far one of the best places to eat in the valley.  If you want great food and great customer service, Pappadeux's is the place to go.  We go here a few times a year.  We went there today for my wife's birthday.  Nia was our server and she did an outstanding job.  We did have one issue, but it was taken care of very quickly.  I had ordered a dish and when I received it, it wasn't cooked all the way through.  We brought it to Nia's attention, and she agreed that it was not cooked properly.  We were very polite with her, by not getting upset, because it was not her fault, nor did we blame anyone else.  She made it right by letting us order something else off of the menu.  A short time later two of Pappadeaux's managers, Stephanie and Brooke came to our table to apologize.  We told them that everything was okay and that we were able to order something else off of the menu.  They told us that they would compensate us for that meal, that wasn't prepared properly.  I understand doing that, but like I told Stephanie and Brooke, we are not those kind of people that go out for a way to try and get a free meal from a restaurant.   Granted they did the right thing, but that's not what I was looking for.  Hopefully we made up for the meal, by giving Nia a little extra in her tip.  Great job Pappadeaux's for hiring great people like Stephanie, Brooke and Nia  Brad and Kim

u2qQtNvGb7faV4-som2SPw.text: The Blue Point Oysters were on point. We enjoyed the oysters so much that we came back the next week. We are both foodies and have the same tastes in food. We are seafood lovers and that makes this place the perfect restaurant for us. Only wish is was closer to home. The Salmon Alexander was also served to perfection. I have always received great service and served the freshest seafood. I wish I took pictures of everything else but I did get some pictures of the oysters. By the time the food came, we were ready to devour it. No time for pictures once the food arrived.

vLRkX4CWaBqlZHS3lTuyMA.text: Came here last night to celebrate our 41st anniversary. We were seated right away but after 15 minutes of being invisible to the staff I went up to the desk and said, "It's has been 15 minutes and I don't even have a glass of water!"  A manager came over to apologize and offered to buy our appetizer. The soup came before the appetizer, the appetizer came before our drinks. When the appetizer arrived, it was the wrong one.  We come here because we expect good food AND good service.  We won't be back!  BTW: Does bread come with the dinner? I ask because we were never offered any.

HpAIZ-FiieL5Bm0xx3bY-A.text: After going back a second time, I think my first review was a bit unfair. My husband who doesn't like seafood said he loved the place after going there for work (he is pretty picky). So we went back together and I recognize that this place is pretty unique to other restaurants in the area. For one it is French creole type of food, which is hard to find around here and a unique flavor. Secondly, I do think the seafood is pretty fresh compared to most places in AZ (the lobsters are right there in the tanks). I tried the seafood sampler and it had a delicious mixture of crab, jumbo shrimp, mussles, tilapia, and others served fried with tartar n cocktail sauce. I think I was disappointed the first time bc most of the seafood is fried and I was expected it to be baked or broiled. My husband gets the steak and lobster served with butter sauce which was very good. The mashed potatoes are garlicky-how I like them. Third I love the ambience and landscaping of the place. The bread pudding for desert was to die for, very comfort food. I will stay say this place is expensive, but for a treat now and then its worth it plus seafood tends to be expensive anywhere.  Every time I go this place is packed n prob for a good reason.

Coming in at 5:30 PM with a reservation seemed to be the way to enjoy dinner promptly. Shortly after arriving it was S.R.O.. We enjoyed a nice lobster dinner that was overshadowed by our waitperson Victoria, a very charming young lady. additional items that were ordered were coconut shrimp, scallops, with key lime pie and brulee completing the dinner.

Fi5mCgz3vl-kJWDzeZoy0g.text: A must for seafood fanatics! All their seafood is super fresh. I've had a lot of different plates here since I started coming to these in Dallas 10 years ago. But my go to is the salmon Alexander. It's has the best salmon, crawfish and scallops combo. I usually get the smaller piece because it's a lot of food. The appetizers are awesome as well. I always get the oyster duo and the seafood fondue. Even the bread is good there. Makes sure you get the crawfish or the lobster bisque for starters.
