BK3k8usdkt5GjEtg36KL0g.text: Pappadeaux has been around here for a long time.  It is a "chain" restaurant with locations in eight states.  I would say it's a high-end cajun seafood restaurant with a substantial menu.  I remember coming here a couple of decades ago, and we finally returned with my family recently.  We got seated at a round table for 5 and our hostess was very gracious and attentive.  After looking at our menu for a while, we opted to get the large order of crispy fried alligator bites.  After a few minutes, we upgraded to the Appetizer Trio, with mini shrimp & crawfish fondeaux (this was EXCELLENT), calamari with octopus and fried alligator.  It was seriously too much food.  After eating our complimentary bread and working our way through the appetizer trio, most of us were already stuffed!  Still, we ordered our main entrees:   * Pasta Mardi Gras - FANTASTIC...omg  * Shrimp & Scallop Orecchiette Pasta - WOW, a stunner  * Kids fried chicken & shrimp plates  Seniors get lunch prices on entress ALL DAY, so my mother took advantage and ordered a sampler platter off the lunch menu.  We verified on the bill and yes, it was the lunch price.  Overall our service and food was excellent.  We paid dearly for it:  bill came to $260 after tip.  That hurts the wallet let me tell you, but the food was really worth it.  I literally had leftovers for three nights in a row!  Will most definitely come back, after I save up for a year or so ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. CRISPY FRIED ALLIGATOR With fresh cut potato sticks &amp; Creole dipping sauce
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. APPETIZER TRIO Mini shrimp &amp; crawfish fondeaux, crispy fried calamari with octopus, fried alligator

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PASTA MARDI GRAS Linguine tossed with crawfish, Andouille sausage &amp; crimini mushrooms in a cream sauce topped with jumbo grilled shrimp

iwGkq62micMCT84IRmbJEQ.text: No matter how many times I come here, the service is always amazing. The food is wonderful and I always leave over-stuffed because I can't stop eating, it tastes soooo good. The food is undoubtedly fresh and the cocktails are great.

pvUZNuarpz4yXO7FF_XNHg.text: Giving this 5 stars based on the amazing food we had here & only that. There were a couple of little things that I'd normally rate lower, but the meal was so amazing & afterall, that's what you come for, so a perfect rating it is.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail (perfectly done shrimp), and two lobster tail dinners (absolutely amazing)!   Not sure why we never came here before. Likely because we're not into Cajun type food & that's what we were picturing. But no, they also prepared classic seafood options & ten times better than Red Lobster, (which was always our go to until now)...none of that overcooked tough lobster here. I was always convinced you just can't find decent seafood in the desert so never really looked. Everything we ordered was huge, from the shrimp to the lobster tail to the baked potato (a meal in itself)! Everything was cooked to perfection & the wait staff & welcoming hostess staff were so friendly, always smiling...it was a very welcoming & happy atmosphere.   The only down side is it's very loud when crowded & it was very busy & you definitely need to raise your voice to have a conversation. In spite of the crowd, the food came out fast, however our check did not & getting the check & paying seemed to take the longest of it all, but it was Christmas Eve & the meal itself I'd rate as one of the best I've ever had. Their lobster was so perfectly cooked, they definitely know how to make them. We'll never go to Red Lobster again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Cocktail Appetizer

cV3bFPIKfBPhT_xlfD3KpQ.text: I've been to Pappadeaux a couple of times since my initial visit and review. Most visits have been pretty good - the worst was when they lost my reservation completely even though I could prove I called and everything. Luckily we got there fairly early so the wait for a table wasn't TOO long. The visit was off to a rocky start and the service was ok.   We decided to give Pappadeaux another chance and skipped the reservation this time (after what happened last time). We were seated in the alcove area which was nice, minus the fact our waitress kept forgetting about us. Water was warm and nearly hot, food arrived without silverware, bread basket never arrived, we had to ask several times for side plates. Luckily the food was still delicious in spite of the mediocre service.   We ordered the lobster salad which is a favorite, the fried alligator, the shrimp and grits, coconut shrimp and key lime pie. Although the key lime pie was a standard key lime pie it was delicious! The coconut shrimp stole the show for sure, we ended up liking it better than the alligator (which is why we started coming here).

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried alligator, large portion.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut shrimp, delicious. Service needs work.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and grits.

cupmBDWZrtRUQ4UiQmT4lg.text: I was so excited to find a Pappadeaux near by because I haven't eaten at one in about 10 years. The food did not disappoint, I was all in. I had the blue point oysters to start along with some fried alligator. Next I had the grouper w/ alexander sauce, topped with shrimp and mashed potatoes on the side. The best part of the night was the service from Katie, she didn't lead me wrong all night on her recommendation and had great patience. If you want to be taking care by one of the best ask for her.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1/2 blue point and 1/2 gulf.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried and Blackened alligator.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grouper fish w/Alexander sauce.

N_GQCh-Sz0CEJ2bZP19ESA.text: My hubs loves this place so we visit when we want to treat ourselves to s wonderful seafood experience. The food is outstanding. Honestly one of the nicest restaurants in town for soy herb style seafood. Employees are great. Atmosphere is romantic and comfortable. I just wish it was a tad less expensive so we could visit more often!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vb-Lg_ePk8_al8VRCIrSwQ.text: This is one of my favorite seafood restaurants in the state. Every meal is delicious and the oysters are to die for!!!! I even proposed to my fiance here!!! This is our go to place! Their gumbo is second to none it's so delicious! If you have t been you must try!

rr6tw4ueQzDiAq70YAtb9g.text: Let me tell you a story.  I was  deployed last year to Houston with my Disaster medical team for hurricane Harvey.  The last night in Houston before being redeployed to Florida for hurricane Maria we went to eat at Pappadeauxs.  We were in uniform.  When we went to pay the waiter said our meals were paid for by someone who wishes to remain anonymous.  He then brought us gift cards for Pappadeauxs.  While visiting Phoenix we found they had a Pappadeauxs so here we are.  Pappalonnes and I had the Crawfish combo.  Fried mud bugs separated by dirty rice from Crawfish etouffee.  Wow the roux was perfect.  Just the right amount of spice.  We both loved it.  Baby mama had the shrimp and grits.  She gave it a 5.  Velvet had the Greek salad and the coconut shrimp.  She was very satisfied. I hope I can do as well.  Service by Jackie was over the top.  Give her a raise.  Thank you to the anonymous gifter.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qeyx_Hj5-H9LLPgRW9-Scw.text: Great food and service.  Fabulous place for lunch or dinner.  My favorites are lobster (they make it right; not overdone!), Greek salad (made table side), and Crawfish Combination (Just the right size and amount of spice for lunch).  Never, ever disappointed here!  Everything is delicious!

0BH0-6V4Nk0shOwa-AJCSA.text: First of all I'd like to thank God, my Mom and all of the folks at the Academy for my life and being alive in the time and space where this place exists. I want to thank all the bullies who picked on me in elementary school so that I studied super hard, got a great education, started a multi million dollar corporation and can afford such a great meal. Without you I'd still be awesome but my review wouldn't be so funny to read. To Taylor my hostess and Eddie my server thank you for making it such a memorable night.  (Big thanks to Eddie! Thanks for listening) The Texas Red Fish Pontchtrain was off the charts delicious. So much so that I failed to take a picture. I'm so 1994 Dawson's Creek that I blessed the food and just ate it up!

wUe-BDANBwRdeCnM_IQapw.text: Now I'm not a huge seafood fan so coming here at first I was totally not feeling it. I didn't want to spoil the night for everyone else so i made due. I ended up ordering the Mahi fish with rice.....It was freakin ridiculously good. The seasoning and flavor was so intense in a good way. I really didn't want the meal to end. I am a fan now, hope to cone here again!

mUR-ELsUhLJ3CLbDPP31GA.text: This is the  very popular Phoenix location of a restaurant chain, with 32 locations, 23 of them in Texas.  The faire is mostly Cajun, so gulf type seafood dishes, blackened spices, and Texas size portions are in the norm. This location gets jammed packed, and you will wait 45 minutes if you are there after 6:00pm. They do have a number call system. The mains are solid choices with nice side dishes. This is not high brow food, but it is a good meal and a place to go with friends to drink, laugh and yak, as it gets pretty loud at peak times for anything else.

Im-Tqbq2aMbWCWRKkU1q6A.text: I've been to this restaurant more than a few times and am rarely disappointed.   On most occasions I sit at the bar with one or two friends. They have a great atmosphere, decent happy hour, and well trained bartenders. I have never had a "slow service' problem eating here, but then again I rarely sit at the tables.   It gets busy pretty much EVERYDAY not just on weekends so if you are going with a big group or even just a few people and are gonna want a table, I would recommend calling ahead.   I would have to say their best deal is when their oysters are on sale for something like 4 buck a dozen. They aren't the most premium oysters (out of season) but still pretty good, especially when they are at a bargain price. Try their blue cheese chopped salad its great, they have some kind of special blue cheese dressing that is something to brag about.

DUSRkh90EyyO-NVc2kE0Ug.text: Pappadeaux. What can I say? You are DELICIOUS!  Our waitress was probably the best waitress I've ever had. Carrie was enthusiastic, really attentive without being overbearing or annoying, and just overall super awesome.  We came in for lunch around 1 p.m. (their lunch is until 3), and I ordered the sampler platter, but I don't really like tilapia, so I asked if I could get some calamari instead of tilapia - done, without a hassle. Mum got the crawfish lunch. The bread they bring out is amazing, by the way. Our food was out in probably ten minutes. Not only did I have an abnormally huge portion of calamari on my plate, but our waitress brought me out all the sauces that go with the calamari - their spicy marinara and a lemon aioli that you will stare at for several minutes and wonder how an aioli can taste that good. Yup. Several minutes. Our waitress checked in on us often, and when we were done, boxed up our meal for us while we got our check.  It was really hot out, and I was dreading walking to the car to sit on sizzling black leather seats, and before I know it BAM! There is a take-out cup for each of us, filled with our respective drink choice, our food bagged up and extra sauce for my leftoevers in little plastic take-out cups... Has anyone ever seen such awesome service? If you go... you better ask for Carrie. If you don't, you will be incredibly and horribly jealous that you did not get the best waitress I have ever SEEN.

7Q1FKR-gqigslt-gx2lv7g.text: When I found out there was a Pappadeaux in Phoenix, I wanted to treat my girlfriend for something different since she's never tried Pappadeaux or Cajun style food.  Atmosphere was great, but it was a tad bit chilly inside (had to grab my coat from the car).  The oysters and cocktail shrimps were nice and plump not the miniature sized ones you would find in other chain seafood restaurants.  I ordered the deep fried soft shell crab and it was amazing as usual and my gf ordered the mahi mahi with the cheese grits and green beans.  One thing that my gf complained was that the menu did not have indications of the food being spicy.  Her grits were a little bit spicy.  But I told her it's kind of inferred since it is Cajun style.  Other than that, food was fantastic.  And would definitely try it if you're in the PHX area.

lY1Di6F6FdGpvVbZF0PH2A.text: The service sucked!! We had a party of 20 and we didn't get our food till 2 hours later...I got my food 5 minutes after everyone in my party was done!!  Seriously you really need to have a talk with your staff!!!!  i work in a restaurant...serving the customers their food on a timely manner and not forgetting orders is very important!!

D8ORQzwXLiqVhy4cOEtCGw.text: I'm having a real hard time writing a review for this restaurant. I want to write a great review, but I don't wanna use the words "superb" or "excellent" when describing the food, and I don't wanna say the service was "friendly" since all of these are overdone. So let me give this a shot:   Upon walking inside I'm greeted with "The Saints Go Marching In" playing in the background and the aroma of some great food being served. The four of us go to the auxiliary bar (4 stools inside, main purpose is to drink up the patio guests) and have a seat and order drinks from our lovely waitress. Her timing was right on the button with EVERYTHING as drinks were always full and there was no lull between courses.   As for the food, WOW. For the appetizer I went with an order of the Lotsa Shrimp. One dozen cold boiled shrimp (whatever cold boiled means) served with cocktail sauce mixed with fresh horseradish. Boy let me tell you that puts every shrimp cocktail I've had between San Francisco and New York to shame. Just the right amount of kick to it, but not the same old lame old.   For the entree I had the Pasta New Orleans. Overall just an explosion in Cajun flavoring going on in my bowl. A wonderful blend of linguine, crawfish, sausage, mushrooms, and jumbo shrimp mixed in with a creamy yet spicy marinara sauce. And unlike every other place that skimps on the fish, you will not be disappointed here. Portions here are big, so bring an appetite.   I hate writing lengthy reviews, (yes this is lengthy to me) but this place deserves it. One of the best meals I've had in a long time as far as value for the meal, overall presentation of the meal and restaurant, and just an overall well trained and attentive staff.   I normally don't drive west of the 51 freeway, but I'm looking for reasons to do so now.

Dj5bQ_01qdTxQz9ZVd2Vgw.text: We went to meet some friends and had drinks while our friends finished dinner.  The server was OUTSTANDING!!!  She knew her job and did it with amazing accuracy! I have not had this kind of service since leaving Okinawa.  The place was packed but we were acknowledged immediatly and there was no issue when we joined our friends. :-)  CANNOT wait to go back for a full meal!!

NYJ1PTYcQhQ8aVJiBPgIQg.text: I love this restaurant. Whenever I'm in Phoenix for work, I make sure I stop by. The service is wonderful and the food is pretty damn good. I love the soft shell crabs with a load mashed potato. I've also tried the Alaskan King Crab, Lobster, and Salmon and Pappadeaux never dissapoints. They sometimes have specials for a half dozen oysters for only $5.   I'm from Los Angeles and I wished they tore down all the Red Lobsters and Joe's Crab Shacks and opened a couple of these restaurants closer to home.

DHeOEZCWt6zydKuhPUwa9w.text: I wanted to order the Caesar salad until I asked about the ingredients and found out that it is not a True Caesar, but is made with soybean oil mayo.  94% of all soy has been genetically modified.  If you want more info on GMOs (genetically modified organisms) watch "Genetic Roulette" on YouTube.  No human safety studies were done on GMOs before these poisons were unleashed on an unsuspecting public.  In animal studies they have been shown to cause tumors.  They can also cause gastrointestinal problems and allergies.  The food that has been genetically altered include soybeans, corn, sugar beets, cottonseed, Hawaiian papaya, zucchini and yellow squash.  Cows have also been treated with a genetically modified hormone called rBGH which causes pain to the cows as their udders become infected with the unnatural increase in milk production.  The residue from rBGH in milk reduces has been linked to breast cancer.  I only buy organic when it comes to these products as they can't be genetically modified.

X1H9sUrwuJVpl8mcX-kQGA.text: This in truth had been my first "Cajun" eats.  The atmosphere was cool. The service was good. The food was rich and filling.

WvyrwE9efqYJdR2OtR4HcA.text: Father-in law was in town and felt like some seafood. I thought nowhere better to take this out of town-er than Pappadeaux's.. My husband and I have eaten a few times here for lunch and everytime it's been out of control good. We arrived friday night, no waiting needed.   We sat in the back and ordered drinks, and a medium size gator app, yes as in alligator. My margarita was very sweet, felt like they added a cup of sugar in it, and it came in a fu/fu glass. The gator was good, but too small for three people.  Wait staff was very nice and explained that the fish flys in fresh daily, and went into detail of the dishes we were going to order. I ordered the Marti Gra.. My husband and his dad got some seafood array?? not sure of the name.. but it looked good. My main dish came and woohoo... it was slammin good. It had crawfish, sausage, shrimp over a bed of creamy pasta.. it was so good, I could only eat 1/4 of the bowl. The portion sizes are pretty big. By the way there bread is baked daily and is so good, they serve a loaf of it for an app, if you eat the whole thing you can ask for another. (Very Good stuff)   Anyways.. always fantastic food, if you have visitors from out of town that like seafood I would recommend this place... Lunch is cheaper, around $12-16 a plate.. Dinner from $15-35.

Aij-rz_9uqdaxFw9sd9dTg.text: I have been around Phoenix for about 4 years and today was one of the saddest days of these 4 years... I realised today that I was so close but so far away from an amazingly delicious kitchen of Pappadeaux Seafood for those 4 long years... wish somebody had told me about this place earlier and I would have spent at least a double dozen nights at Pappadeaux while I was in Phoenix... what an amazing place !  We started with a bowl of "Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo... yummmm... spicy and so tasty ! ... (those who don't go for spicy food should stay a yard away from it... it was really spicy... as in Indian Vindaloo spicy... ) ... I felt like I could have easily had a couple more of that gumbo... :)  Shrimp Creole With white rice and Crawfish Etouffee With dirty rice followed that gumbo... both of these were so mouth watering... a perfectly cooked Crawfish with rice so close to Jambalaya, it was probably the best seafood I have had after my last visit to New Orleans...  The place carried a very nice, relaxed ambiance with light jazz in the background... our server was very soft spoken and knew her way through the menu and preparations... I don't think this place gets crowded easily as it could sit, to my guess, 5 times more number of guests that an averagely large restaurant...   Overall, definite 5 stars for variety, taste, ambiance and service... be it a family or a romantic one on one dinner, this place is just too awesome !

CCpSs3ZGiNo3Y0yxq2us-A.text: I love Pappadeaux. I've been going to Pappadeaux for over ten years starting in Houston. When they opened up the one in Phoenix, I was sooo ecstatic! Seafood in Arizona! And I don't have to drive 40 min to Scottsdale to enjoy it!  Before I gush, I will say that I have received some crappy service. When it's bad, you have to make sure you get your waiter to bring you everything you need at once, otherwise it may take a while to track him or her down. Usually these are the times when the place is really busy so I guess I can't get too mad. For the most part though, the waiters know the menu, can offer some good suggestions and come back often for refills.   OK, now for some love. Seriously, Love love LOVE when it's $3.95/per dozen oyster time. You do have to make sure it's the right time of the season otherwise you can get some measly oysters. But 99% of the time the oysters are incredibly tasty and fresh. For the person complaining about slow oyster service, they shuck their oysters when you order them. So when they've got 8 orders, there is going to be a wait. I don't know what oysters you're used to eating, but I know shucking oysters is not easy. (Plus you're doing all that work and you don't get to eat them! That would be torture for me!)  I've had a lot of the main fish entrees and they've all been very yummy. It is really pricey, but one entree at Pappadeaux's can last me 2, maybe even 3 meals. It's the damn butter! It fills me up! Butter, you ask? YES! Pappadeaux has the most taste bud pleasing, whipped, salted butter that I have ever eaten. It helps polish down that loaf of freshly toasted french bread that impedes entree eating time.  Fave dessert is the creme brulee for sure. Best way to end the meal. How I have ever had room for dessert, though, is beyond me. Dang butter.  Other dishes I recommend: Calamari, alligator, Greek salad, crawfish etoufee (!!!), soft shelled crab (broiled and fried, ask to go easy on the salt), crawfish gumbo (they only have seafood gumbo listed, but you can ask to have crawfish only)

4T_STGAacgrDINzYEPdp9w.text: We went to Pappadeaux's for the first time tonight and it was seriously amazing. My wife and I started with the Oysters Pappadeaux they were very good. It was our first time trying any kind of baked oyster, we like the raw ones better for sure. We also had the greek salad with lump crab. Oh wow that was good. My wife had the Halibut Picata for dinner and I had the Snapper with Live Maine Lobster. The fish was cooked perfectly and the respective sauces were rich and citrusy balanced to perfection. The sides were great as well. For dessert we had the Strawberry Cheesecake and the Carrot Cake Cheesecake. Both were very good. The staff was freindly and engaging. Our waitress was very helpful and knew alot about the menu. We always ask our first time at a new place and she was very very good. This place is all class, the food is delicous and the staff is fantastic. I highly reccomend this place when you're in the mood for seafood.

yUp9ld_CRVW1282NslK6ew.text: It is no New Orleans but the food was surprisingly decent for a chain restuarant.  The seafood was fresh and cooked well.  I had the halibut with the Diablo sauce.  They are great with mixing and matching sauces and fishes.  We also ordered a dozen raw oysters and oyster pappadeux.  There are hints of southern style cuisine such as dirty rice, crawfish sauce, and any seafood you like fried.  As for actual taste, I didn't get much southerness from the flavors.  The second time, we got the seabass and two of us got the all you can east lobster. The seabass was cooked well and the sauce was tasty. The lobsters came with dirty rice as the side and it was pretty good. The lobsters are a good decent size and good quality lobsters. I finished 5 of them and the other finished 9 of them. I think eating 3 would be good. i cant say it is necessarily a good deal because it is just eating too much lobster unnecessarily. The time in between each round of new lobster fluctuated a lot and the service was just decent.

RXvJRtJB__uekFvopWGoqA.text: Setting:  Dimly lit, nice for dates.  Very clean.  There is another room for bigger parties.  Nice bar for just to hang out and watch a game.  Food:  Yum!!!  Had the steamed Maine lobster.  For less than $20 it was very very good!  Meaty too.  They give you the whole lobster, complete with thick juicy claws.  Oh, and the Greek salad was very very good as well.  Highly recommended for big groups.  Finally, the fondeaux is also very tasty.  Although it's a bit think on the cheese.  But hey, if you like cheese, this is the appetizer for ya.  Service:  Awesome folks, we had a cool waitress.  So sorry we made you take pictures of us and you almost fell off the table!  :(  But she was a great sport.  Very helpful, very nice.

MWbaWlg_zNnuprthtjPAmg.text: Last night, we again experienced Pappadeaux excellent food!  Because we eat out 3 times a week and have dined here many times before, I feel qualified to review accurately and honestly. 1. Caesar salad dressing is much improved.  It frequently  has been too bitter to enjoy.  I believe that the kitchen preps, reamed out too much of the inside whites of the lemons, which is very bitter.  (juice and zest are not, but the white membrane is very bitter) Why not add (more?) anchovy paste?  That is TRUE Caesar and as a high-end seafood specialty restaurant...you need "Authentic Caesar" with anchovy! Thank you for little or no vinegar! 2. Excelent Reisling wine.  However, Margherita on the rocks was so bitter, my man could not enjoy it and didn't order a second one. Tart is good, bitter is miserable. 3. Pappadeaux always has the BEST  Halibut in town!  Rivals the best we have had in Seattle, where it is the freshest. You manage to keep it moist without under-cooking.  The crab topping however was in very short supply last night!  You have skimped on it and we don't appreciate that on a $37. Entree! 4. Salmon topped with crab was also excellent...rivals our many meals in Washington state...again,  short supply of crab on top for a second $37. Entree. 5. Vegies were fine. 6.  Crusty on the outside and soft on the inside French bread was consistently good.   Of course, we will return.  Glad to see the improvements in the salad you made and hoping for anchovies in future.  Happy about the wine, entrees excellent.  Work on the other issues mentioned above... All-in-all....excellent fare!

53hFsBQ7wY4ZsG1-pOScgg.text: Wow!  I ordered the Louisiana Blackened Catfish topped with pecan butter and spicy pecans with dirty rice.  The fish was done just right -- succulent, moist and flavorful.  I also had the fried alligator appetizer.  The meat is tender and scrumptous.  If I can eat it, so can you.  Oh, you haven't tasted a roll until you have one from Pappadeaux's.  Hot and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.     If you're in Phoenix, be sure to make this your top restaurant visit. You won't be disappointed.

74IOetILFu8Kx1n7PwAicg.text: Absolutely amazing food. Our server was Amanda, she was unbelievably attentive, especially for how busy they were, and extremely sweet to my children. It was our first time there and I already can't wait to go back!

C6ZRCyiKiWuHUWMy58kkqQ.text: Always a fan of Pappadeux.  The last time I was here was for a group Valentine's date with two other couples.  Love was in the air that night especially since the couple at the table next to us got engaged.  Not exactly what I would call a romantic intimate setting but hey, it worked for them because the lady said yes!  I love their crawfish, the fried alligator, and the Pappadeux oysters.  I haven't really ventured out to try anything else besides those three items.  The crawfish they serve up here has good flavor and are big but not exactly the best with all the new crawfish boil shops popping up.  I do think their fried alligator is still the best in town especially with their dipping sauce.  As for the Pappadeux oysters, what's not to love?  It's a dressed up oyster!  This place gets packed fast, it's always super loud in here, and the decor is kind of tacky and gimmicky but it's a seafood restaurant so what do you really expect?  Come to Pappadeux for a fun night out with some decent eats!

DXcf_eWJuv0hS16HyE0EMw.text: My favorite place for fish.  Great service, excellent food.  Consistent quality across all the locations I've been to (Houston, Dallas, Albuquerque and now Phoenix).

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Broccolini. Perfectly cooked.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naked halibut with lemon/caper sauce, Spaghetti Squash.  Excellent!

YC_fv3qX3LYGw8F6Fd7I9w.text: We read all the reviews and we super excited to go with our kids to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary...sorely disappointed. Just a step above red lobster. Started with alligator and calimari app. Alligator was good as was calimari but we ordered large portions of each. I think we got 10 nuggets of gator and the calimari was more fried artichoke hearts than calimari. At $20 a pop a real disappointment. Entrees were masked by butter and heavy cream sauce. No real flavor and again at these prices the fish should have been incredibly fresh.  On the positive side, the desserts were very good. Had the cheese cake and seven layer cake.  Our service was wonderful. Ashleigh was charming, attentive and prompt. Unfortunately not enough. I would never go back. A shame. Also made me lose confidence in Yelp reviews.

Yht2aGuI4BR0uisdiWKwLQ.text: If you want real seafood Cajun style this is your place. Their food is to die for!  I had the most succulent fish. The salad was crisp and tasty. All good seasoned well. Glasses were quickly refilled even during the presentation. I have been here several times and will certainly go again.

lBD79g7p7MTrZVz0OYeNig.text: Holy wow. Choices galore! We had catfish which was perfectly fried in a super light batter and absolutely fresh! Talapia was ok, a little dry. The crawfish were New Orleans style and perfectly seasoned. The calamari to die for! If you go you must have the cheesy grits with corn and andouille sausage! We also tried the gator, a bit on the hot side but absolutely perfection and the wedge salad was crisp, cool and loaded with bacon and blue cheese bits! All in all not a thing wrong with the food and portions are substantial! The only reason they don't score a 5 is our server, served our drinks with his fingers placed firmly around the rim of our drinking glasses and my first jameson nd tonic was served in a dirty glass (yuck). A little work on serving etiquette and this is a 5 star easy! Eat well, live well! Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fountain out front
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum. Wedge salad. Just the beginning

VkTCUG1aKkjKwQBPGv_dYw.text: I came here on March 25th for my boyfriends birthday as a surprise dinner. Let me tell you, I had no idea what to expect and it was more than I could've imagined. This is my boyfriends favorite restaurant, which is why I brought him, and now my absolute favorite as well. We started off with an appetizer; a dozen blue point oysters. For people who don't know me, I love pretty much all seafood except oysters and squid (I used to love squid but the texture freaks me out. Maybe someday I'll love it again) but my boyfriend wanted me to try it, even though I knew previously I didn't like it. So I did. He put lemon on it and there was 3 sauces to choose from. There was one that reminds me of soy sauce mixed with wasabi, like a person would dip their sushi in. But I'm not sure if that was what it was. But I put that on mine and it was actually really good. So officially I like oysters now!! And then we both got a soup cup. He got the lobster bisque and I got the Louisiana seafood gumbo which I have ALWAYS wanted to try! Both soups were super yummy. I was very impressed. So far I had not been let down! Next was our actual meal. I got the pasta Mardi Gras and my boyfriend got the grilled Caribbean lobster tail. My pasta was amazing. I've always been big on pasta. The sauce was tasty and it has sausage and shrimps in it. My boyfriends included lobster, mashed red potatoes and broccolini. His was good too. Lastly, I had told the waitress by the name of devyn (I think that's how she spelled it) who by the way was very nice and friendly. She had great customer service. If you go, definitely ask to be seated in her area!! Anyways I told her that it was my boyfriends birthday so at the end they offered complimentary dessert. They had so many good ones to choose from. We picked the banana pudding. Haha thinking about it makes me hungry and my mouth water. I've had banana pudding before. I usually only like my family's cause it's a family recipe but pappadeux's knows how to make some amazing banana pudding. Lastly a couple things, if you are going for a special occasion, I recommend making a reservation. I was so glad I made a reservation. When we got there it was so packed, inside and out. Second, the place is beautiful. If you can, and you know it's going to be a nice day, I'd say sit outside. We didn't get to, but that's okay. Thirdly, everyone there is nice and quick and efficient. Please check this place out! They deserve some more good business.  I can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is beautiful.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana pudding.

PyYrPZqzkkCiS0-QIq_hjw.text: I had often heard of this place and was excited to go. I must say that I was not disappointed at all. The customer service was excellent from beginning to end.  The peach ice tea was great, with a fresh taste to it. We ordered the large basket of calamari which was shared between 3 people. Large, warm  French bread was included and it was fresh. With so many options to choose from, I chose the Seafood Platter. The seasoning was not overwhelming, but rather just enough, to still know you had seafood on your plate. This meal is actually enough to share with your special person.   I highly recommend this place for just about any special occasion or with a group of friends.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Seafood Platter ****

sHDcEWnN-uzGFqDd5A686A.text: I prefer my food from the land and not the sea so seafood is not a dining favorite of mine. My picky style has never resisted me for taking up an opportunity to dine at Pappadeux as they have on shore tasty items on the menu. I always seem to dive into the crispy chicken fingers along with the wide variety of sides, however my last visited I was tempted to try the broiled half chicken. Boy was I impressed. It was so flavorful and fell right off the bone. Not only was it not dry but it was juicy. Matter of fact those seafood eaters who dined with me tasted a sample and wanted to clean my plate. Too bad and so sad for them they will have to come back because I ate it all. Along with the spaghetti squash and a bed of white rice.   The great thing about this restaurant is they have a wide variety of options to choose from. A large dining area for larger parties and even a private room. You can dine casually to a romantic date or even have a party the whole crew will be impressed. They even have a full size bar with the same great menu.   Pappadeaux the place to go!

5uJnbrMGgkmd8TF7vrjZCw.text: This place is more hype than anything. Being from the south, I was surrounded by places that fried-up seafood, which is apparently what this place is all about. It has some more "cajun" style things than I'm used to, like fried frog legs, but still same concept: food put in a deep fat fryer. Yippee.  Being bored with such fried vittles, I opted for shrimp creole with andouille cheese grits. It was okay, but for the price ($22.50) it was a huge rip-off. I was with my company and thus wasn't paying, but I'd be mad if I had paid 23 bucks for a few shrimp in an average creole with an ice cream scoop full of grits.  I got their New York cheesecake, too, but it was typical restaurant (think Applebee's) quality, complete with food-colored cherry sauce.  The highlight of the place was the service, as our waitress and hostess were both very nice and attentive. The atmosphere is all right, too, but still pretty typical of a cookie-cutter franchise like Olive Garden.  I dunno, maybe I sound like a fuddy-duddy, but certainly not as exciting or "authentic" as other reviewers would have you believe.

BoQOpxcXcbsRYJgnKkOBaA.text: My wife and I are both big lovers of seafood and we're very excited about going to Papaduex to eat. Our first visit was great, we both loved to food and our service was excellent but our next visit was just horrible!  My sister wanted to celebrate her Birthday there and made reservations for a party of 13, friends and family on Saturday 10th of February. Management asked that the entire party be there by 7:45 pm in which we all were. At 7:45 we were informed that the party before us had not left the area reserved for us and that we would have to wait till 8pm. We all waited patiently and stood chatting because of the crowd there. At 8pm they informed us that a couple of people were still sitting in the area we reserved and instead of asking them to leave or go to another area the forced us to wait a entire hour! My sister got emotionally upset because a couple of friends and family members got tired of waiting and left. It was the worst example of management I've seen anywhere and totally unprofessional. We were all starving and forced to wait on other people when she had tables reservations for us. They tried to make things a little better by offering free entrees but my sister was so upset because they had ruined her special moment and Birthday with everyone she invited. Some of us drove 45 minutes to an hour just to be there. The food wasn't satisfactory for some of us, maybe because expectations were ruined from wrongfully having to wait when we shouldn't have. All in all it was the worst moment at a restaurant me and my family and friends have ever had, one star would be too much. I don't know if we will ever give our buisness to them again.

69B8VkLWfIRsEkAsqKmSaA.text: We used to love Pappadeaux when I lived in San Antonio and in Phoenix but this trip we had a less than steller experience. I want to love this restaurant with the cool vibe and atmosphere. It started out with Bread that was a little over done on the outside, and then their version of Lobster Bisque which was a little too cajun for my liking, but it is a cajun restaurant after all so they won't loose any points there. The Wife had a good Pasta dish with Crab and scallops which was a little peppery but still good.   I ordered a stuffed 2 lb lobster which was a cluster from the beginning. About 5 minutes after i ordered it, the server came out and said they were out of 2lb lobsters but they could give me 2 one pounders for the same price, so i went with it. Another 5 minutes passes and out comes a manager and trainee with a menu telling me they are completely out of lobsters and I would need to select something else. Then another 5 minutes pass and the server comes back out, takes my menu and says the manager didn't know what she was talking about and he has them working on my 2 1 lb. lobsters. Now another 10 minutes pass and out comes my meal, and i get 2 1 lb. lobsters, however they forget to stuff them. So now we get another visit from a different manager apologizing yet again for the mixup. I finally get my lobster and it is overcooked and tough. Guess it wasn't my night for lobster, or theirs for that matter.  They did give us dessert on the house which was a nice gesture.  I think next time i'll pass on Pappadeaux.

wH3iuxsrpnpulRDWyXvAZg.text: Several years ago, when business travel to Houston was regular, I became a big fan of the Pappas family restaurants-- Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen in particular.  As we drove north from Phoenix airport to Sedona I noticed a sign for Pappadeaux, and knew that this would be a lunch stop when the final portion of our vacation brought us back to Phoenix.  The restaurant is large, attractively appointed and comfortable, with an encyclopedic menu of fish and seafood offerings.  Although best known for their Cajun preparations, there are abundant choices for everyone who enjoys well-prepared fish and seafood.  Our server, Nicholaus, effortlessly navigated a crowded lunchtime dining room with our order.  Although a bit distant, he was a consummate professional.  Brought first to the table was a large platter of crispy fried alligator nuggets, served with a full-bodied spicy sauce.  I ordered a platter of fried oysters, one of my favorites, while my family selected po boy sandwiches of shrimp or alligator.  We each had a cup of their Andouille, Crab, and Shrimp Gumbo.  The sandwiches were bountiful, and from what I was told, absolutely delicious.  The same could be said for the fried oysters.  A tartar sauce whose consistency was a bit less obvious as a packaged commercial product is all that separated this lunch from greatness.  The seafood was all fried just to the point of presenting a crispy coating surrounding tender, moist and flavorful protein.  Hardly an inexpensive lunch, Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen is in that class of restaurant that I would seek out wherever they operate.

J6LcZPAznNs2qyfvaw4c7w.text: Love this place!! The Happy Hour food is awesome!! Especially the seafood fondue!! The atmosphere is charming!! Love the patio!!

-0-IE0FRzb0RPy1KObSvlQ.text: One of the best seafood places I ever been to.  I was in doubt at first since I am in Arizona, but found out this family owned operation gets daily deliveries from Houston.  Frog legs fell of the bone.  They offered Caribbean lobster and clam chowder was so tasty.  Also had the Bluepoint down oysters.  So many options on the menu it was hard to decide.  Try it out if you are in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spiny lobster + filet mignon
