KYI_vq3AGsc5T9ey0iBK5A.text: Hoo, boy..these are some good eats!  We stopped in for lunch to find a bustling crowd in a massive restaurant, though the attentive staff more than made up for the lunch rush.  We were seated quickly and had little trouble finding something on the seafood heavy, Cajun-inspired menu. Kicking off the meal was an order of the alligator bites: spiced, fried chunks of alligator with a zesty red sauce for dipping and a heap of crispy potato straws. The gator was cooked perfectly, neither mushy nor rubbery with a noticeable punch. Figuring it would be awhile before I saw alligator on a menu again, I went for the half po boy/gumbo lunch combo. The baguette was stuffed with fried alligator, lettuce, and pickles covered with tartar and cocktail sauces. Topped with a squeeze of lemon, it was hearty, delicious, and paired nicely with a cup of fiery andouille and seafood gumbo, packed with crab meat, sausage, shrimp, and that holy trinity of bell pepper, celery, and onions.  Worth the trek from lower Phoenix (or the suburbs).

03MGMvuNH9-_jwAttPeP_g.text: Well, we were terribly shocked.   We always rave about this restaurant, brought friends and 3 were disappointed One of the favourite dishes was Maui Maui but it wasn't on menu anymore, so we asked and server said sure they do have, so Blacked was requested, it was horrific !!!  Tasted like something from freezer section, no taste and not blackened, rated meal a 0  Other dish was chicken linguini, not good either, picked all the tasteless chicken pieces out before he started on pasta which was ok!!!  Not good or great but ok  The table ordered 4 salmon glaze with 1scallop 2shrimp.   3rated it as a 3.5, other only eat 1/4 of meal, due to being drenched in a pool of butter.  What a shame We went Monday night Nov 13,2017

5V-QKvu3rpdIxQqmvqbQWw.text: I have been to this location four times.  The first was good.  The fourth was flawless (and also on a Sunday @ 11 AM).  The second and third were disastrous.  The third, unfortunately, was my birthday.    The BOTTOM LINE:   I would go back, my spouse will not.  However, I would not risk a special occasion on this restaurant.    THE GOOD:   (1) a something-for-everyone menu  (2) truly spectacular tasting menu items  (3) managers seem genuinely contrite, and they are adroit at making good on mishaps.  (4) reservations are accepted, but waiting with a drink on the patio is a great experience.  THE BAD:  (1) a service bar so slow during dinner peak that you'd think the first step in making your drink was applying for a liquor license.  (2) if you're like me and appreciate a well paced meal, you'll have to DIY-it by specifying to the server when the kitchen is OK to begin preparing the next course. (inept and thoughtless pacing happened 3 of 4 times)  (3) You will invariably be first sat under a full-blast A/C vent or fan aimed at your upper back, and you will have to request a new table. (happens every time I sit inside)    The UGLY: The food quality is inconsistent. (3 of 4 visits resulted in myself or someone in my party sending back a deficient item for being too cold, overcooked, watery, etc.)  Rectifying the problem takes long enough to ruin the pacing of the meal for the table as whole.  Ordering is slight gamble, which, for a restaurant, is the deadliest sin of all.

6UHzxP_hwn-D-BRgE3HfcQ.text: Pappadeaux's Pappadeaux is what my family and I chanted following our dinner...its not like a rally chant PA-PA-DEAUXS! It's more of a shake our heads, what have you done to me and why way of saying it. Papa-deaux's Papa-deaux's. Cocktails are pricey from the regular menu but tasty.  Great combinations that are not  overwhelmed with alcohol  (some may prefer a stronger drink but I'll forgo the "burn" with my dinner) Watermelon mule light and refreshing The Grand Hennessey definitely on the stronger side but still sweet and flavorful. Pink Sapphire who knew gin could be so tasty?  I did but it was good to have with dinner while the drink taste also light and....pink. Crab fingers...EAT THESE sauteed.  The lemon garlic butter sauce theyre sauteed in is  delicious. Seafood gumbo was bland and watery. Papadeaux's fried seafood platter was average at best. They had a parpadelle with Roasted squash, shrimp, scallops and crab meat that was very very good.  Pasta and seafood was fresh and the sauce creamy and garlicky. The star of the table was my Texas Redfish Pontchartrain, this was my 2nd time having redfish and it did not disappoint.  It's served with a brown butter that I can bathe in and dirty rice (dry).  Not over seasoned fish remained flaky and moist. EAT THIS!

zbx029IDCBtbgKTlvrC67w.text: I love this restaurant.  Our server, Taylor M, was AMAZING.  She was super attentive to our needs and provided a wonderful dining experience.  We started with the Oysters Pappadeauxs. AMAZING!  The catfish and redfish were great choices.  We finished off with Key lime pie & creme brulee. We always have to drive a distance to eat here.  I can honestly say I have never been disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crème brulee.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key lime pie. Oh my. Delicious.

h3p1t3VjaSqiF4oKp2Vn7w.text: So I love seafood.    And at times I find pappadeaux over priced for what they are serving.   They have a good atmosphere and good drinks.   Fish is brought in daily - of whatever they are running low on.   So it is freshish sea food.

8hHDLfdBN8AZBTn4xojHnA.text: Best seafood restaurant I've ever been to. Seafood flown in fresh everyday and all the sauces are made from scratch everyday.

ygf1MRPGQpFCxE0slvg6JQ.text: Service that went above and beyond excellent!  The food was great too.   My father is the most high maintenance customer that ever came into a restaurant, in other words he is a huge pain in the ass. He thinks it is clever to ask for a plate of lemons, squeezes all of them into his water, adds sweet n low, and is proud he got free lemonade. He is also hyper critical of servers and demanding with no regard to everything they do. Don't even get me started on how he hits on female waitresses. Hey, I love my dad, but he is no picnic. I just wanted to give a little exposition so you would understand how fantastic the service was.  The waiter actually took the time to pay attention to my dad's unfunny comments as my mom and I cringed in embarrassment, even though I'm sure he had things to do. He made a decent wine by the glass recommendation for me, and gave me great ordering advice when I was wavering. He kept all our our drinks filled and the table cleaned as we finished things like soup and bread. We never wanted for anything from soup to dessert!  The lobster bisque was delicious, I had the Pappas Greek Salad, which was great, and prepared table side with flair. My parents split the Tilapia, which they loved, and the waiter brought them two plates without them even asking; thank God.  Since it was my mom's birthday we did dessert as well. Thank god I had soup and salad. Of course my dad had to ask for my mom's dessert to be comped in front of her since it was her birthday...classy. My mom and I both had the creme brulee, which was not the best I've ever had, but still pretty good creme brulee.  Our waiter was friendly, patient, attentive, and overall fabulous! Seriously, who knew service would be this wonderful here?  I will be back for sure!!!

EyIxfxetDky6XVkDVzpMIg.text: My wife & I went for dinner with some friends at Pappadeaux's.  The food was good.  We had fried alligator tail for a starter.  My wife had the softshell crabs.  I had the andouille sausage and seafood gumbo.  Both were very good.  The creme brulee we had afterwards was also wonderful.  For Arizona, I would call this good Cajun/Creole....however, nothing beats the French Quarter in New Orleans.

p065EIMSIRjEOWexMz3rAQ.text: We came came for a schmoozing from a corporate client. It worked.   We had the Mediterranean Calamari for apps. They were really good, I like the deep fried artichoke.   I had lobster bisque, it was really creamy and had great flavor.   The lunch was a halibut fillet sandwich and dirty rice. The rice was perfectly seasoned and fluffy. The halibut was cooked perfectly and was a very nice size. It was flaky and not dry at all.   The building was really neat, I think a nice outside happy hour would be great in mid to late October.   The service was perfect, not over pretentious or up on you the whole time.

AFAe99dZRFn_F-c187pePQ.text: They were absurdly busy. I had a bar's eye view of the care that goes into the $3.95 1/2 dozen oysters. I would not order them myself. Dinner felt rushed, I didn't feel like a very valued client, and the poor gentleman next to me waited at least 25-30min for his 1/2 dozen oysters (carelessly drained of their delicious fluids).  My dinner was good, but relied heavily on it's fat content to carry it's flavor. My cocktails were good, I would come back for those.  It took another 10min just to pay my tab after I had finished. My dishes were cleaned up by a bartender who looked like he just run a marathon, dripping with sweat. Not exactly how I like to finish my evening.  Thanks, but no thanks Pappadeaux.

f6pbda-581lZvrY5VWnB8Q.text: I waited for 1 hour for the food I ordered. The lobster and oyster were not that fresh. Gumbo wasn't taste right as well. There was a fly around my table! It is not a good experience. I am disappointed.

QTK1t2UVaLKPlBQln6Q8qQ.text: The unyielding devotion to this chain (which is a half step above Bubba Gump's) is quite amazing, but they truly live up to their good rep.  I had a great time here.  I have family in Texas that rave about this chain, so when I when I drove by this one in Phoenix, I knew I had to check it out.  And as fate would have it, a friend decided to bring me here for happy hour.  We were on a mission to try the Category 5.  This is a blended drink which combines a house Margarita with a Hurricane.  This won't knock you out like a Hurricane, but it definately packs a punch.  What kind of punch you ask?  The one that let's you think that ordering FRIED Calamari (with artichokes), FRIED catfish (I think) and FRIED Alligator is a good idea.    Yeah, I said it.  "FRIED GATOR".  Yes, it tasted like chicken, and it was delicious.  I think after a Category 5, they could have fried up the sole of a shoe and I would have liked it.  This place has great ambiance, and a good fun, festive vibe.

t_0XSuO24REaqyg-aesqVA.text: Is there such a thing as orgasm in a bowl?  YES!  Crawfish ettouffee at Pappadeaux! I had no idea this was a chain restaurant, or I probably wouldn't have gone.  I'm a mom-and-pop snob :} Anyway, we had a party of 6 and had about a half hour wait.  We had reservations.  It was a beautiful night, so sitting out on the patio was no big deal.  The hostess even came by once during our wait to let us know they hadn't forgotten about us! I don't usually get fried calamari (I prefer non-fried seafood) but it was light and crispy and the calamari wasn't rubbery at all. Service was great, too.  We never had to ask to have our glasses refilled. it's a great place for a date or a group!

pEX73zy_m3EN4lDn2Y8XZQ.text: After writing the review the other day I had a taste for Pappa's. So I went last night and YA-HUMMEE! I tried something new the Hudson platter and this baby did not disappoint! Perfectly grilled scallops, 2 succulent and sweet lobster tails, 4 huge shrimp brochette. If you are not familiar with shrimp brochette it is shrimp stuffed with Monterey jack cheese and a sliver of Jalapeno, wrapped in bacon and char -grilled. DELICIOUSNESS! It is served with the fabulous dirty rice and sauteed green beans all for are you ready for this wait for it 22.95!   I also indulged in sharing a little pecan sweet potato pie with Hagen daas vanilla ice cream and bourbon sauce. WOOHOO! FYI all deserts purchased until July 26th will have a portion of the proceeds go to a local food bank!   Dinner last night was sooo freakin good I may be back tonight! Bon Appetite

ht34UzDqFCxWz0PgiLWQig.text: We get to Pappadeaux's on a Monday night.  It was packed.  We put our name in and we were told it would be a half hour wait.  Not bad.  We were early and we were waiting for another friend to show up.  She finally arrived and we chatted during our wait.  Our half hour wait turned into an hour.  How did that happen????  My friend complained and we were seated just like that.  We made it to our table, relief.  Our waitress was friendly.  The bread was good.  There was a great special on gulf oysters and our waitress explained that the season was coming to an end.  $4 something for a dozen oysters.  Great deal.  They were tasty too.  We had them for an appetizer.  I was happy so far.  I ordered the scallops.  They were not huge.  In fact my entree was not that big portion wise.  I had to order a salad a la carte.  No bang for your buck here.  The scallops were over $20 bucks and adding a salad to that pushed my portion of the bill over $30.  I had an ice tea too.  I enjoyed my salad and the scallops were good.  BUT!  I felt a little ripped off.  One thing they have to change is the PA system.  "Bob party of 3 your table is ready" is heard loudly throughout the entire restaurant.  Yikes!!!  Change that please.  Pappadeaux's is A-OK.

-HzA2KDV30CdzvvMRpQTzg.text: Food is hit or miss 50/50. Once I got an awesome andoulie sausage with seasoned rice. Another time, I got very bland pasta with way too much grease and very little seasoning. I guess it all depends on what you order.  Wait times are moderate to long depending on what time you get there.  I like the misters in the waiting area in the summer.  Pretty cool decor, especially the outdoor fountain area. Kind of nice when the lights turn on.

n8kODL8V4GkhdQpDYTpFCg.text: Pappadeaux is definitely my favorite restaurant.  The food is to die for! Cajun deliciousness and fresh seafood!  Who could resist?  Things to definitely try:  Oyster & Shrimp Fondue Mediterranean Calamari Shrimp Brochette Pasta Mardi Gras Crawfish Bisque Mussels Blackened Opelousas Desserts?  Where do I begin???  Sweet potato pecan pie ala mode, carrot cake cheesecake, creme brulee, bread pudding, banana pudding, all are good!  The list goes on.   They also have yummy cocktails, including the famous Swamp Thing.  It's a fru fru girlie's drink and pretty sweet and potent.  If you like that sort of thing give it a go!  Things to note:  If you are on a diet forget it, there is nothing lite on the menu.   They have a happy hour M-F and a live band on the patio on Friday/Saturday.    The service is almost always good and the interior is warm and inviting.

hc1Ce392HpfUTPxOH1OrUg.text: This seems like a great date place... it has clean, nice atmosphere and a lovely patio outside to enjoy when it's not ridiculously hot.  We arrived for lunch promptly at opening time (11 am) and the place got busy really fast.  We had very attentive service and our server was very friendly.  Fried alligator appetizers were wonderful (the secret IS the sauce) and I enjoyed my shrimp etouffee.  Banana pudding and pecan pie are both great as well.  A bit pricey (lunch for 2 w/ dessert plus tip $86) but fabulous! A great place to splurge.

Csi1juN_DYlR2qhgkkuu2Q.text: Fantastic place to dine in I would recommend this place for any and all occasions.  Food is outstanding and service is great also.  Thanks

MroTgJwrRt_C2nqjR_ZAsQ.text: I learned to eat in New Orleans, so I'm not easily impressed by Cajun places. This is authentic. I love good crawfish etouffee and this is really good. I can recommend this cuisine to anyone. It isn't fast food cheap, but it isn't fast food. It is good value because it is such good quality.

vOROB3dvyAakG9JwNbRxAA.text: Your one-stop destination for all the Cajun food you've been craving. Met up with friends here for a Wednesday night outing, so that we could try their boiled crawfish. I have to say that this is crawfish done right... and at $3.95/lb, you can't beat the value.  We started with an appetizer of Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux with garlic bread, which was free by using a coupon I got by signing up on their website and providing my e-mail address. I would've been a bit disappointed if I had paid for this particular appetizer, since it skimped on the bits of seafood and wasn't a particularly well-done fondue (not nearly cheesy enough), but it kept the group I was with something to nosh on while we waited on our entree orders. Judging from the other reviews, this place is always busy.  I was very happy with the 7-oz. Blackened Mahi Yvette covered with shrimp, crawfish, mushrooms and spinach in a Monterey Jack cheese sauce. No need to order the larger 11-oz. filet, since I had already started filling up on bread, fondue, and a dinner salad. The dirty rice was delicious and scarfable.  Everyone seemed more than happy with their selections as we all shared and sampled from each others' plates of oysters on the half shell, boiled crawfish, and fried alligator. I think the place delivered a great value on the meal, a fantastic selection of nearly every Cajun delight you can think of (although I have yet to spot the elusive Muffaletta on area restaurants' menus), and a great dining experience. This place IS busy... I can only imagine the crowd on the weekends, but the wait staff did their best to be attentive and tend to all of our requests.  We left satisfied and stuffed, reeking of Cajun spices. Now if only they had some Oompah Loompahs available to roll me to my car...

UCjMGWHH6DPPcz0amBcKNA.text: Good atmosphere, good service and awesome food, Lobster tails are HUGE and always seems to be fresh. I love going there for the seafood, it's a nice treat. The wait staff always seem to be helpful and the service is good. They can also handle large groups looks like to me.

n9L2QT5E34pt6fgxxrC8qA.text: Pappadeaux and Mammadeaux too~ This place is kicken for Happy Hour Mon-Fri 3pm to 6pm with crazy good food at great prices. Start off with the Blackened Oyster Fondue (under $10), Cold Boiled Shrimp (under $5), Fried Alligator (under $5) and a tall Blue Moon or Swamp Thing! The place packs up around 5ish and the Happy Hour prices only apply to the bar area. A band plays every Friday starting at 6. Good times!  The main restaurant is a great place for groups, however, can be a little loud for intimate dates. The menu is extensive with a lot of great choices.  Check out the website for menu details.

JOHoWWZPmefCc9YimmLgSQ.text: For being a chain restaurant, Pappadeaux is pretty good.  For an appetizer, I usually have the Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux or the Lump Crab & Spinach Dip;  both are luscious and come with French bread.  My two favorite entrees are the Crawfish Etouffee with white rice and the Pontchartrain Panbroiled Fillet.  My adult beverage of choice is the Swamp Thing.  I do not know what is in it but it is quite tasty and pretty to look at (Yes, I'm a girl!).  I have never had dessert;  have always been too full.  However, my sister and nephew swear by the banana pudding which is served in a Mason jar (Ick!).  The only real draw back  to Pappadeaux is the wait for a table.  No matter when I have gone, the wait has always been at least an hour.

oYZikz3K9t-uxNOcdiVWKA.text: After all the positive reviews the hubby & I decided to check it out. Upon entering everything looks great, the place is spacious and we were greeted and seated immediately.   I ordered the cajun comb and my husband got the tilipia. While we're waiting for our meals to arrive our waiter offered us fresh baked bread right out of the oven. Not wanting to fill up on bread we declined. We're still sitting there when a roach scurries arcoss the ledge near our booth. ALL BUGS FREAK ME OUT!!!!!!! My husband said it wasn't that big a deal and I should just calm down. The table next to us received their food a couple of minutes before us, as soon as the waiter sat the food on the tray flies swarmed. I tried not to FREAK out but I was really getting uneasy about the safety of our food. Finally, our food comes out a couple of minutes later and I'm eyeballing it like a hawk.....no flies touched it, but it didn't stop them from trying to attack our food once it arrived. It's hard to enjoy your meal while you're swatting away flies and make sure roaches are coming up behind you.   On to the food, my fish was salty and my husband's was buttery. 2 perfectly good pieces of fish were ruined.  While I went to the restroom my hubby ordered a slice of keylime pie for me. The pie was delicious, our waiter was great, the people watching is extremely interesting, but we will never return here.

X21FUq9ja_NopoLW4mlRYw.text: Had dinner here with a friend before I leave phx. Didn't think to find good Cajun food in Arizona?!? What great food, drinks and atmosphere. We had the fried crocodile for appetizer and I had the shrimp etoufee for my main course, which was to die for. I highly  recommend this place for lunch or dinner.

W74KFxIcARYxiKC1loOMAA.text: Been here a few times, the most recent of which was Wednesday evening for their annual crawfish broil (offered Wednesdays and Thursdays through March and April).  The seafood here is pretty fresh and service is usually top-notch.    I'm not a fan of crawfish, but my friends always rave about it, so I gave it a shot. I played it safe and ordered the 1 1/4 lb option ($7.95) while they ordered 2.5 lbs ($15.90).  I ate about four of the crawfish and sorry folks, still not a fan.  The seasoning was too spicy and salty.  I ate the corn and gave the rest of the crawfish away.  I'll stick to crab, lobster or shrimp  - more meat.  I ordered the jumbo lump crab cake ($13.95) and shared an order of the P.E.I. mussels ($10.95). The crab cake was delicious - kudos to them for not skimping on the meat.  I was not a fan of mussels before Pappadeaux, but now I'm hooked and always order their P.E.I. mussels.    This place seems to always be packed, regardless of which day of the week it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1 1/4 lbs of broiled crawfish
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2.5 lbs of broiled crawfish
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. P.E.I. mussels

UDfuTvzii5aTii2adMsjuA.text: I know you wouldn't be thinking of eating seafood in AZ, but if you are around you gotta try it out. Back in the day when home-base was Pheonix I would frequent this place, it was pretty much my religion. Pappadeaux is some of the most amazing cajun food you will ever experience. Why 4 and not 5 stars you ask? Well, I went home to visit the family and came to eat and wasn't too impressed since things seemed to have changed, sad but not overly sad.  I always get the crawfish, always always. Always perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. Crawfish etouffee is amazing, tastes like a million bucks. Appetizers like calamari and fried allligator are pretty normal, nothing special. Don't miss out on dessert, the dessert trio lets you try a little bit of everything. A++

bPrW01Gj-9Xa214jkkOT_w.text: I've never had a bad experience at Pappadeauxs. I've been here at least a dozen times and have to say that the food and service is always outstanding. There are so many delicious looking items on the menu that it is tough to decide what to order sometimes.       I'm combining experiences here. I recently drove 200 miles round trip to have lunch here. My waitress/bartender Erin was awesome.      Appetizers... alligator is unbelievable. I always ask for it blackened instead of fried... sooo good. Shrimp and Crawfish fondeaux is sooo good yet so bad if you're on a diet. Don't miss out on the oyster duo.. cooked 2 ways. Mediterranean calamari is great, also crab cakes, oysters on the half shell...you get the point.      This place feels cajun and gets you in the mood with its ambience. Fresh fish, great food, service and generous portions are what Pappadeauxs is all about. You won't be dissapointed.

YeGn2CpSiiM2ybBVdZsCHQ.text: Out of town and close to where we were staying. Looked at reviews and was excited to go. The place is HuGe. We couldn't get a table for 45 min so ate at the bar. Food was really good. But note this is not a chap place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mussels

fHobxKG2eD3YT_2B7cTOPQ.text: Stopped by late night for a nice big beer and some alligator. We tried the appetizer trio and the seared ahi tuna. Food was delicious. Service was great for a Friday night. Definitely go for the larger beer on tap. The bigger size is definitely worth the dollar!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large tap
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seared tuna
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizer trio

6Dir56tyLvi02sS9x3sXhA.text: I absolutely love Seafood and this place is amazing!!! The freshness of all the food really shines through. The atmosphere is casual with a fine dining feel.  Prices are pretty  reasonable especially for what you get.  I had no problem paying $150 plus tip for a family of 4.  Even the kiddie meals were outstanding and they aren't shy on the portion sizes......This will definitely be my go to place when in need of supremely fresh seafood and steaks!!!

NCBQq5nwOrov0qNjxJ65Hw.text: My husband and I had not been to Pappadeaux's for many years and thought we would revisit the restaurant.  Although it was very busy we were seated right away.  The waitress was prompt and helpful giving us suggestions on appetizers and main meal.   We placed our order and the food came out quickly and was hot all though it was busy.  The food tasted great, but why I gave it 4 stars because we found it to be very expensive for the small portions we got.

RliP4Udn8q2CiXzsQf2iwA.text: We only go here about once a year to celebrate something really special. However, I crave the Chilean sea bass dinner all year long. It's some of the best I've ever had. It is pricey, but worth it. My husband always tries something different and everything he's tried has been perfect and delicious.

-6grLksqCYHJLJmie7bLgQ.text: Was here about a week ago and if you are in or going through Phoenix this is a must go to. Had several items and all were great. The Oysters were fanominal.  The Lobster was terrific and the steak was beautifully cooked. The most disappointed part was that I could not have dessert.  I was just so full.

J8f7r6SWdQ3f0bprwzutgw.text: So I kept driving by his place a bunch of times so I figured I would give it a try . I pulled up and noticed this is a large ass reasuraunt good thing I went on a monday night, I got seated quickly and got a menu in hand. Getting ready to order will review shortly.... Started out w lobster bisque which was good there was enough lobster chunks to make it worth while to eat  For main course I got house salmon , portion was large and the shrimp was a nice touch they added to the dish  Overall nice seafood place to take a date to and plenty of things to choose from

5qQZnzodZ40pvmqj_8WYSg.text: Always enjoy the experience of dining at Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen. Probably the best selection of seafood items in the Greater Phoenix area. We both ordered salmon dishes. My wife's was med-rare and she ordered well. It was quickly taken care of and corrected.   The service was excellent. Our waiter, Ed, helped make the evening a good time. He was efficient, but took time to chat and make sure it was a nice experience for us.   We like the way the restaurant is decorated to add to the experience. From the outside curb appeal, to the entry way, to the inside, you feel like you have left Phoenix and are in some New Orleans restaurant.

DdY3P22QsauXd4iwLDo2pw.text: My wife and I were so glad we found this restaurant. I'm originally from Louisiana and was looking forward to some Cajun fare. I wasn't disappointed. I started with a Captain's Hurricane cocktail and it was very tasty. Then I had the andouille sausage and shrimp gumbo and it was fantastic - full of flavor aroma and perfectly cooked ingredients. My main meal was a platter of half fried crawfish tails and half crawfish ettouffe (sp), with a border of dirty rice in between. It was all so good and flavorful! Almost as good as I've ever had in Louisiana. My wife had the salmon topped with shrimp and crab. Normally she complains that the salmon is not just right or overcooked, but this time she said it was prepared perfectly. Finally we had the vanilla crew brulee and it too was as good as we've ever eaten.  We were glad that we enjoyed our meal outside on the patio since it seemed a lot less loud than the indoor dining areas. Our waiter, Brent was outstanding in his craft, and was pleasant to talk with. Our only complaint is that each course seemed at least 25% more expensive than it should have been. Next time in Phoenix we will stop again for hopefully another very satisfying dining experience.

OV76hCHfvQE-m8TADdUfcg.text: very enjoyable,  fun atmosphere with hearty portions.  the seafood was wonderful,  better than expected for Arizona.  service was friendly and fast. would go again on next visit

wGZbtDtjk5CtqLnXB9T8qA.text: Love the environment and the food. If you are going specifically for a special, like the oysters ask first..... They always run out.

t23uiLKaOfHBn_VKjJ2brg.text: I made reservations to surprise my boyfriend because he loves eating here (minus this time).  We were early and the people who were walking in, were seated before us ( I was listening to see if they had reservations, and they did not).  We were standing right in front, by the hostess stand and people just kept coming in and were seated.  Finally my boyfriend went up to one of the young girls and she said "oh, sure, we can seat you now".  UMMMM WTF!!!!  What was the point of making a reservation if it wasn't even used to our advantage?  Complete BS.  The food, eh... it was so so.  We had a waiter who was CLUELESS.  He didn't know the specials, if there were even any.  We didn't get any bread, he said the oven wasn't working properly but mind you, people who were sat AFTER us were getting fresh bread.. The kid knew we were pretty pissed so he gave us a free desert.  Big deal.  I personally have zero desire to ever go back to this location.

4y4_l8buwFjnIVPtSQ6VoQ.text: I am not a huge seafood fan but went here for a birthday for a friend. I ordered a steak which I really enjoyed. It was cooked perfectly and was flavorful. My husband ordered the oysters and said they were the best he has ever had. Everyone else really seemed to enjoy their seafood. Gets really busy and I can see why. A little bit pricey but for good food it is worth it. I would rather have quality food, then a quantity of food that doesn't taste good

CLSUaj8qOdUX9daxhu3K5g.text: I ve been to Pappadeaux about 6 or 7 times and this time was the worst. The service was very good but the food was overpriced for the amount we got. I always order the same thing,Pasta Mardi Gras, and never could finish it before but this time there was less than half of the normal amount. Disappointing.  mY wife got the scallops and she got 3 tiny, tiny scallops for $25.  The last time we went the same thing happened but I chalked up to a 1 off. Overall, a very good place to eat but the last 2 times have been disappointing COMPARED TO THE PREVIOUS 2 YEARS.  I may be unfair judging a restaurant by the amount of food given but spending $25 for a pasta dish, I guess I am used to copious portions.

fwGcxAV0hS2TtfLYNwk5QA.text: we always have a good time here!  we love the alligator with the gator sauce...yumm!  hubby loves to get the different baked oysters.  I had a nice cod dinner and he had shrimp etoufee...both very good but plan on $24 for those plus drinks and appetizers it adds up.  Still, it's good service and a fun place.

OwxG3eE8jpzw3H2oTgcvMA.text: Delicious, really fresh seafood! They also care about their customers. I have an allergy to only one kind of seafood item and they always have a manager talk with me to make sure the dish I order will be safe and prepared to my satisfaction.

caH_7nn2me6gIKm4XNPIAw.text: Huge restaurant, beautiful and nice hangout get drink and enjoy music when you're waiting. Little expensive but great food.

oojtg_Eyp7litrReqtsRgw.text: IF YOU'VE NEVER EXPERIENCED CAJUN FOOD, THIS IS WHERE YOU START, BABY! My family is from the bayous in Louisiana and Texas and we eat here (and the ones back home) for every special event. Now that I live in Arizona and can't have mama's cookin anytime I want, I go to Pappadeaux's to get my fix! The food is always cooked perfectly and they never skip out on the delicious Cajun spices! Seafood fondue, pan seared frog legs, you name it.. they've got it! They have plenty of cocktails to choose from that are sweet, refreshing, and delicious.. especially in this Arizona heat!  The staff is on another level of customer service for sure. I know these folks go through extensive training in order to serve here and they understand the quality you expect from a 5 star restaurant. HATS OFF TO YOU BADASS SERVERS! LAISSEZ LES BONS TEMPS ROULER!

Cd_YmjYldhoqpbf6idFjiw.text: Becoming one of my favorites- this is the Ruth's Chris of seafood / Cajun!  So many menu options make every picky diner take 20 minutes to decide what to order.  My boyfriend and I have taken his grandma here as well as my mom and I having dinner here on a different occasion.  The prices aren't cheap but either is the experience.  I'd say the only downside is it can get very loud at peak dinner times.  Every time we get a helpful server with an a+ attitude trying to make their guests enjoy their experience.   When we waited for a table at the bar with my bf and his gma- the bartender had the people's appetizer upgraded next to us so we could have some too!  I also love their margaritas and New Orleans inspired drink menu here- always starting the party with a frozen margarita or mai tai!  I enjoyed the Moroccan salmon and also had the naked salmon previously.  The kitchen has a tendency to serve broccoli raab with the naked salmon instead of green beans like the menu lists.  Broccoli raab is so gross and I do not recommend it!  Lastly the dessert tray is the real reason for my review!! Old school offerings on a tray always entices! Last time we had the pecan praline cheesecake (seasonal?) which is the most delicious thing ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert tray of death!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Praline CheeseCake
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee &amp; Praline Cheesecake

yPnO-M1LAxu9YQAVVh4JZg.text: Today, my family and I decided to go to Pappadeaux for lunch about a quarter to 3. Before anything, I'd like to say that the ambiance and service were both outstanding. Our server Paul was phenomenal, he took care of all our needs and easily surpassed our already high expectations. We sat off the bar in an outdoor area. This was very comfortable and clean along with the rest of the restaurant. Having come here before, we had a decent idea of the quality and quantity to expect. We chose Pappadeaux for their quality of seafood in the past. Unfortunately, that quality was not there today in regards to the salmon that we were told would be cooked medium rare, arrived rare (a generous description). When Paul came to check on us, we informed him of the issue and he was very helpful, the manager then arrived who was nothing short of apologetic and helpful. She was eager to rectify the issue and ensure a happy customer, which she did. We will definitely be back

c2C653Xov5_G9eBfLkwtTw.text: Wonderful outdoor seating. Service here was great and I was so thrilled to see I could find them in Arizona. I can't come here without ordering the dip and a swamp thing. One of my favorite dishes is the Texas Redfish Pontchartrain but I honestly don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. I wish there were more locations on the east coast where I'm from.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor patio
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mPviYghY3qW4TcI8-oz4SA.text: I love this restaurant! Excellent food! I highly recommend this place.  You cant go wrong!

SEfXwA6bmFpqmbpn3N1iQA.text: OMG!!! So good!!!!  I was in AZ for work and I asked a colleague to do lunch and she recommended Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.  I absolutely love this place.  It was a beautiful March day and we sat outside.  It wasn't too hot or too cold, just perfect.  The service was great with tons of parking.   We ordered the following: Shrimp and Scallop Orecchiette Pasta ($30) - It has shrimp, scallops, oreccheitte pasta, lump crab, asparagus in a creamy parmesean vodka sauce.  It was delicious.  The shrimp was huge, the scallop was rich and delicious.  Everything came very well together.  Grilled Redfish and Jumbo Shrimp ($34) - My colleague had this and it was fantastic.  I was able to taste the Redfish and it was flaky and delicious.  This is the dish my colleague always order.   Cup of Seafood Gumbo ($7): So good.  I asked for spicy and it definitely was not spicy.  I should have asked for extra, extra  spicy.  Lots of flavor with good pieces of sausage and seafood and rice.  When I'm in Phoenix again, I want to try their Crawfish Etouffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge scallop on the grilled redfish and jumbo shrimp
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge lump crab on my shrimp and scallop orcchiette pasta
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge shrimp on my shrimp and scallop orcchiette pasta

QZEVlNjUP30U41Gzczj2Mw.text: Love this place. I only order the Blackened Alexander With the fresh fish, Mainly Halibut. You wont find this on the menu though, I asked the Waiter What He liked And the next thing I know, I have this dish in front of me that was to die for. Im not Sure if he was Supposed to divulge This info but I'm glad he did! Oh, and don't pass up the Swamp Thing!

VIrSEOG4qzSEnDImqI6oRA.text: Third time here and they've yet to disappoint! Our server, Audrey was friendly and very attentive to our needs. Boyfriend and I shared the Pasta Mardigras and the desert trio, both of which were really good. The pasta had just the right amount of seafood and the desert trio was more than enough to share between two people or more.  Overall, a good dining experience with great customer service and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert Trio - Bread pudding, creme brulee, and sweet potato pecan pie
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Mardi Gras

VEJX3207cqVxCqGGoZNO9Q.text: I love this place. I don't get here as often as I would like because my kids are not huge seafood lovers yet, but this place always delivers. Last time in my wife ordered the shrimp and grits. Neither of us are huge on grits, but is sounded good for some reason. It is literally one of the best seafood dishes we have ever eaten. We have eaten seafood on the docks in SF, Seattle, and Juneau, so our opinions are not totally based on seafood in land locked states.

TSSuobJwVhu7MPDrdZYoKw.text: Amazing!!! Being on Keto needed to stay close to True... Schena did a great job recommending but not pushing. Had the Padedillo pasta sub spaghetti squash --- amazing! Schenda deserves every tip and more!

kM3Cbac1t3M5H9ykWJMzzw.text: Best seafood on my 10 years of Taekwondo trips.   How to describe it?  Authentic  Creative  No parallel  Must comeback  Worth every dip of sauce   Don't want to leave  Definitely will come back  Don't want to fight in other state championship

zBGSuzMu9Z6wqlnT337GkA.text: I just love the exterior of this restaurant! Unfortunately, it was July and I really wasn't feeling sitting outside in the middle of the day or in the evening. Yep, the food was so good at lunch that I went back the same evening after a work dinner for dessert.  For those who aren't aware, this is a popular chain based in Houston. They feature Louisiana-inspired food and they do a great job!  I got the full po'boy and it was ginormous! I could barely finish it but I did. Everything was great: the flavor of the shrimp, the crustiness of the bread, the sauce.  And, as I said, I went back the same evening for dessert. Strangely, I don't recall what I had but I remember being please and glad I came back.  Lastly, the service was excellent. Our waitress--I had the same both times--was attentive and helpful when I vacillated over what to order.  Nota bene: I went to the restroom in the evening and this friendly older gentleman asked me what I thought of the food. Of course, I told him I liked it and we chatted for a few minutes. The gentleman just happened to be Harris Pappa, co-owner of the chain!

OXDXpGrHv_9KX4uXWkhWIg.text: What can I say that hasn't been said before about this place? It's delicious. My wife and I go every time we get a chance. Don't forget to order the oysters

oXphaDdQlhaktDltBY2QHA.text: The service and food was amazing. Even though they were extremely busy, our server was on her game! She was polite, funny and never let our drinks get empty. Sure wish I could recall her name!   The food was amazing! My steak was cooked to perfection and the rock lobster was delicious! We were a party of 5 and everyone enjoyed their food!  Will definitely be back to this location!

5hG0OTMySm_trpH42CoL2Q.text: I have never been disappointed by the chain or this restaurant. After taking my folks here years ago, it became a "must visit" on their annual spring road trip to the Southwest. This year was no exception, even with a glitch in service.  The patio with water feature was perfect in April and we could talk at normal volume in contrast to the sometimes loud interior.  We placed two orders for grilled trout with shrimp and sauteed spinach and my mother ordered salmon with dirty rice. I got a mixed greens salad and my father got a beefsteak tomato salad with crab meat. The salads were excellent.  The fish was done just right and nicely presented. The trout plate was just the right amount, while my mother left some of the rice on her plate.  The one glitch was a mix up, missing my father's entree. As soon as the first two main courses came out, the waiter realized he had made an error. A manager showed up quickly to apologize, assure us they were fixing the problem, and offer a cup of chowder or bisque. My father took the lobster bisque and the second trout plate came out rapidly.   In the end, the bill showed that they comped my father's whole meal! Way to make things right. Again, we had a great meal with unrushed conversation on the patio. We will certainly plan on returning here and have a strong positive view of the brand.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The water feature adds a pleasant background sound of falling water.

GI1immtCalYbFIXP8hFWvg.text: Okay is a good summation of Pappadeaux. The food is good. Sometimes very good. But certainly not inexpensive, so for the price is SHOULD be good - arguably even better. A reasonable portion (about 6 ounces) of gator, for example, as an app is about $20. 3.5 ounces (medium vs. large) is $15. Is it good? Heck yeah, though with many of the smaller pieces, the gator taste is concealed by the fried batter flavor. But there's no value there.  The entrees are also quite pricey and again good, but not great. In my opinion, not good enough to warrant the prices. To be clear, when you set prices at a premium level the expectation is set deliver a premium meal. Good isn't good enough.  With all that though, both our orders were wrong and after waiting 45 minutes to get in and another 45 to get our entrees we took what we got. The bill adjustments were minimal and did little to reduce the grand total.  Would we come back? Perhaps if it was a special occasion and we wanted their food items specifically. But we eat out OFTEN and would not return for casual or even somewhat fancier dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ex59JjU61beg8gC2Ot7dAQ.text: Great server, great management! Thank you Wyatt for your patience with a 17 mo old kiddo and a large group of people. Having a toddler anywhere for more than 30 minutes can be a challenge but no one seemed to mind our walks to the lobster tank or outside to the fountain. The seafood was perfect (I ordered the shrimp and talapia plate for my son and I ended up eating most of it, it was so much food and so good!). Melissa, the manager, was personable and on the ball, and even offered to take a picture of our group. Pappadeaux is a large restaurant, many tables and seating options, but it nails quality service. We cant wait to come back!

TW-5Csv9zVreFHtLxfZUUw.text: This place rocks with great Cajun food besides San Francisco style seafood dishes. Pleasant atmosphere inside and out! When I have guests from out of town, I like to take them here. Friendly service.  Just a different experience than most other restaurants because it has a feeling of being outside on a big porch with big picture windows. Close by hotels. All seafood seems pretty fresh considering there's no ocean in Phoenix.   Dan W. Miller

egcyWPQ7diroMA990NLS2w.text: One of my favorite places. I like to order from there appetizer menu and their seafood fondue is thee best! I haven't been here in a while but stopped by just to try there Mardi gras temporary cheesecake on a saturday evening. A band was setting up out on the patio and our waitress was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Grass cheesecake and pecan praline cheesecake

nNdlszjvlAaTKpsNWBb_IA.text: The service is great, but the food is just eh. I was expecting a lot of flavors, but my food was really bland. The only thing I would go back for is the alligator.

zrwIUz9gG_6NxSDB87BTVw.text: I eat here regularly, and always have a pleasant experience.  I am absolutely addicted to their green beans in lemon butter sauce.  They have excellent Salmon and believe it or not, their chicken dish is one of the best around, even for a seafood restaurant.  I have had some incredible waiters and waitresses! Very attentive and engaging!  Great customer service, and they really make the experience just that much more wonderful.  A waitress in particular comes to mind, which has served me over four times now.  Julia is her name, and she absolutely did a fabulous job! So so so many good things to say about her!!!  There are a few other waitresses that really have gone above and beyond in service.  Im terrible at names, and for the life of me, cannot remember the others.  But I am always blown away by how fabulous their wait staff is at this restaurant!!!

dJ7Owp9UXsI42hSANcbDvA.text: I order togo which was very fast on everything was correct.  Had a couple of drinks while I waited.  The N'awlins punch is awesome with fresh watermelon.  I found a new drink instead of the Swamp Thing.  Brook the bartender was GREAT... THANKS for a great experience when my second drink was not right.

Rk9V3lvJ9nYiqiqYY2zxig.text: I really enjoy this place. I've been here many times over the years. Love the majority of the food on the menu. Happy hour is great. Drinks are always perfect and strong. I strongly advise everyone to order the fried gator. The roux served with this delicious meat makes me feel that I'm in New Orleans... The only difference is the spiciness. Nothing here is as spicy as True cajun food but still very good. The reason I am only giving four stars is that i am holding back because of the cost of eating here. Two people can get in and out with a couple cocktails for $100.  We celebrated my husband's birthday here recently... all food was great however with a party of 7 our bill was $300 and three were children. I believe there were 5 alcohol beverages on the tab... but still this is just too much for my liking.

Fqcbx6HTSynvIfA2OCsA0A.text: AMAZING. WORTH the hour long wait. Best seafood I've had in AZ. I recommend the jumbo crab cakes and the swamp thing (drink). Pretty much anything else you eat there will be amazing!

nyPtiMSZO8mKrVoEF_ZqqQ.text: Every year we are in Arizona my husband and I have to stop here for dinner.  He absolutely loves the fried alligator.  I love the fresh fish dishes.  The prices are a little bit high but well worth it for the quality of food you receive.    On this past visit we had a great waiter.  He was very helpful and friendly.  He did the right amount of "check ins" on us without being overbearing.

TF9fCxhE65hUIhQetYPFAQ.text: I've wanted to try this place out for a while but never did because it's a bit of a drive from the East Valley. But, I had the opportunity to dine here tonight with my boyfriend for a nice dinner out. Since it's a Friday night, we did have to wait but decided a nice drink at the bar would be a good idea. The bar is pretty big and the bartenders are very friendly. Full service bar too so if you don't want to wait, that's an option. The couple we sat next to are regulars of the restaurant and raved about the food before we even sat down to eat. The restaurant itself is very vibrant and nice. The decor is a little outdated but still comfortable. You can dress up or be casual.  When we got our table, we were greeted by a friendly waitress. We were immediately served bread and continued to have great service throughout the night. If our waitress didn't get to us, there were many other staff available to get drinks, napkins, bring out food, etc. When I asked to sample the gumbo, they were more than happy to bring out a sample. It tasted great with the bread! I decided to eat light and went with the mussles whereas my boyfriend ate the mahi alexander. He loved it! Big portions but also a big price tag.   For good seafood, this place is amazing. They also have a nice outdoor patio and on a nice night, it's nice to sit out and eat. They also have a live band on the weekends too. Overall, this place is great and will definitely return!

02E4GvBDHe-m8ydp_TGB3Q.text: Okay so we had our valentine's dinner here and it was amazing from the parking lot to the live entertainment outside while you wait on your table. Once we got inside I was completely taken by the atmosphere the linen was perfect the decor was warm and welcoming I was definitely impressed. Our drinks where delicious the food was outstanding and this is coming from someone who is not a seafood lover. What a memorable experience. We will definitely be coming back.

AfW-6KRdtMDVJOG8V2G5-Q.text: I've eaten here a lot and while I've been disappointed with the food a couple of times my experiences have been mostly positive. The service is always pretty good too. We will definitely continue coming here!

cHO-sya_o50gpElHU5bAWg.text: You don't have to love Cajun food to love Pappadeaux!  They have fantastic seafood and there's something good for everyone. From the apps to the desserts, everything is delicious!  And their cocktails are fantastic!!  Great, friendly service too!

fO3eIrU07mIgxpWZw8QIRA.text: Pretty good. Not as amazing as I expected because the flavor was there on some things but overall hit and miss. When there was flavor it was AMAZING. Definitely worth trying not so sure it was worth the price but I will probably come back and see if it's better next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummm. This is an appetizer!! Frog legs, fried alligator and crab/crawfish fondue. Definitely worth it!

A0PSn8Vf6GT3Vcy_NxMaFg.text: I'm a very picky eater and could not say one bad thing about this place. Jarrett was our waiter and did an awesome job. New everything about the menu like he made it himself. My boyfriend is allergic to nuts and the concern they took was above and beyond. Ask for Jarrett!

jxiSGoJKMwSrFax_r7Bggw.text: Best steak I have had in a while! The steak was comparable with Mastros! I could not believe how good it was for the price! Also the service was great! Definitely recommend!!!!

fi_xRU-w3npJWtoa1aHJyQ.text: The frog legs and oysters are amazing. Came for a birthday was told I would get a free dessert and didn't see waitress for 45 minutes. The bill was over 200$ ....might come back still deciding if it's THAT good

p_G1CY6Vh1bJleWYT7rgnQ.text: Excellent food, loved the blackened fish w/red beans and rice.  The blackened alligator is also very good.  Our waiter was named Matt and he was excellent with his service and really knew the menu and gave options on how things could be prepared or changed.  Top notch service!

XlXVyFZ7isGcDKYpxNPDug.text: Good food.  Whenever I want a special meal, especially seafood, I go here.   They make a mean sea bass and you can't go wrong with the gumbo.  Can get a bit crowded on Friday and Sat nights.  Oh and the oysters rock!   If your an oyster fan.

Eh_fA6Tez09b3xh22zGDJg.text: Be prepared to wait 10 minutes on the phone just to place a togo order, and then deal with a rude server on the other end. The food was flavorless, which is the furthest thing from what you expect from a creole inspired restaurant. I tried to contact management and was not followed up with.

3_K5SfyBCJTBuZoDXTNIhw.text: Have had gone a few times for seafood great place! But  just recently had a surprise for my girlfriend who has a daughter in the Army. Her daughter and I made arrangements with the restaurant and were very gracious to help us out with the surprise. Since her mom had no idea she was here in state. What the restaurant did next was even a bigger surprise, all 7 military personnel and three of us as family members received a 50 percent discount off our bill. My hats off to them, any other place that I know of so far give 10 to 15 percent. What a great way to say thanks for service and support to our troops.

fQ1lOiH0rQFb1MGHV4ocKQ.text: All I ended up getting was the Seafood gumbo and a caesar salad. Both of them were good. The service was excellent. I think the gumbo could have been seasoned more. I didn't try any of their specialties. I was tired from sitting in the airport all day, a little hot, and jet-lagged, but I am definitely going to go back (and update my review). Be prepared to spend some money because they are definitely pricey.

LW9uUe8nXQkSCLuaDxLTiw.text: If Papadeauxs were a person, it would be a large, well dressed, garish Rolex wearing pompous ass of a man who talks big and has little in the way of substance. Think, well, Donald Trump. Yes, this place is "the Donald" of rip off dining!!! The service was excellent. Marcus was friendly and most professional. But the food sucked. I tell you it was pitiful for the value. The martini glass was literally just half full. Pathetic. They should be ashamed of themselves, and for $10 per drink.   Granted, Im a Louisianan, thus a tough critic on any pseudo LA house beyond my home state. That said, I tasted the gumbo: watery, huge chunks of celery sparse proteins and just truly a joke. Campbells in the can puts this stuff to shame.  I opted for the halibut. Previously frozen, the piece was tough and the sauce devoid of flavor other than that of the overwhelming tablespoon of huge capers atop it.  In sum, Papadeauxs is a hands down sad imposter of Louisiana cuisine and so overtly overpriced its simply comical.  I had the halibut ($33), two puny martinis and a shrimp cocktail, the high spot of the meal, but whats is that, Ketchup and horseradish? Really??  My tab was $72.00!! Highway robbery. Do yourself a favor and head to Texas Roadhouse for a steak or Red Lobster if you must have seafood outside the state of Louisiana. Save the difference a few times then take a nice vaca to the Big Easy, treat yourself to Commanders Palace or Galitiores in the French Quarter. Your check will be identical but your meal superlative in every way.

Yp27Sa0NfchmsiAZHlPaLg.text: I came on my Wedding anniversary with my lovely wife. The restaurant looks very nice inside and outside. The service was excellent. I had the sample plater i was very satisfied with it but I wish I would of order something else. My wife order the Alaska Salmon Alexander and it was delicious. The food was fresh and tasty. If you like seafood and Cajun food this is the place to go. The desert was made in heaven I order the bread pudding and it was out of this world.

zYjI5o0lJo2dTeweE0bTHA.text: We haven't been to a Pappadeaux's since we left Albuquerque years ago. It was as good as we remembered. Can't wait for our sons to come visit, they miss it too! Awesome food!

_m_8wSjXhTPFijW1dNadfQ.text: First time at this location, but not a stranger to the franchise! As usual, the food was great! I ordered the Fried Alligator and upgraded the side for asparagus. The alligator & asparagus were cooked perfectly. My girl friend ordered the Scallops with Broccolini. She said, the scallops were just a bit too salty for her taste. I tasted it, it was fine to me. She also ordered a slice of the Carmel pralines cake. She shared it and it was good as well, but it's not the type of cake I would select for myself. Our server, was a nice young man, very friendly & attentive. I will definitely comeback back, when I return back to Phoenix.

89smYpdqnR-RfwcbBMOOUw.text: Delicious. We come here a few times a ywar and we love it.  The fish is so fresh.  They are always great if we ask to split entrees.  We lile to try a couple appetizers and split an entree.  They get very busy during peak times.  Totally worth it.

8rLtQt1DlhK9TLEmkV49mA.text: The service is great, environment is nice. I just simply didn't enjoy the food all that much. It's not bad, but it's nothing special either. Had lobster bisque and seafood salad. Just wasn't wowed by either of them.

7DlOz6HGte2hSPEa8qdXqA.text: I finally found a great place for oysters and fish.  Went with some friends and had the fried alligator (YUMM).  I had oysters and the chilean sea bass.  For dessert we had the key lime pie and the praline bread pudding shuffle'.   Can't wait to go back.

oLz0HEvhJrCUW0tl8l30vA.text: I had the salmon Alexander. Was very filling. The dirty rice that accompanied it ha stop much spices for my liking. We also had the oyster duo that had 3 oyster Baton Rouge and 3 oyster Pappadeaux. Both which were delicious.

n-Zi4-dFRdNDJXc2etiqcQ.text: After multiple great experiences at Pappadeaux here and in New Mexico we did not have a good one the last time. We were watching a food show that featured crab and were craving it so we decided to give Pappadeaux another shot. We went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too busy. We were seated immediately. Our server was very attentive. We ordered the crab and spinach dip, our favorite that I feel I could eat bowls of like soup. My husband and I both ordered the crab finger dinner sauteed. Those crab fingers are delicious. The sauce they cook them in, which is probably made with a pound of butter on the dirty rice is a match made in heaven. Since my husband and I both had the crab dinners we had leftover which we ate cold the next day....still very tasty. The service this time around was top notch so we will def be back before crab finger season is i

aaP44K5xsI7T1gxH-9lOWA.text: In the mood for NOLA? This place will take care of it! If you decide on the Gumbo get a bowl cause the cup gets empty to quick!  Fish was fresh and tasty!

pb_fZp9-szDAgOSfi2GqPQ.text: Amazing Seafood! I hope they bring this place to Vegas! This was my 2nd Time business the restaurant I had previously visited the one in Atlanta. The restaraunt in Atlanta had an area that displayed the seafood nicely which this location did not. But they did have a live band on this Saturday night on the patio that was actually pretty good.  I ordered the lobster bisque and stuffed crab the Lobster bisque was super creamy hot and decadent ! The stuffed crab was full of delish delicate seafood and lightly fried. The seafood was fresh in both dishes.  I also ordered a cocktail that had fresh muddled raspberries and it was very refreshing. The turtle brownie sundae was amazing and also decadent. A great dessert for sharing.  Hope to see more locations pop up on west coast!

The food is delicious, the service is excellent the oysters are amazing and our meal was exquisite. Come to Los Angeles

UwRQsVCAqq79rHaqDPjXDg.text: ow some of the most over priced food I have ever had. I felt like my plate had more shells then a gun range on it. I kept spitting out crab shell and shrimp shells that were not properly disposed of and the red fin was very chewy and had burnt pieces. I got the redfin and shrimp with lump of crab meat at a private event company meal. Glad I didnt end up paying the money for it. Went to mastros a couple days prior and got the salmon and crab and didnt have this same issue and it was less expensive and the salmon melted in my mouth. Definitely will not be back my business in the future will be with mastros. No where near a 40 dollar worth plate

euRPtB-hp9oFgV3XSjoJAg.text: Went to Pappadeaux last night and had such an amazing experience all thanks to our server, Ashleigh. She is so knowledgeable, pays attention to detail, and so friendly and personable. You do not come across an incredible server like Ashleigh too often so she deserves all the credit in the world! Thank you Ashleigh! My mom, my best friend and I had a blast and we will be back to see you! And of course the food and oysters was AMAZING!!

vmXx4sYduPfueT4PoShYXw.text: This was our first time eating here. (our actual first time --we left as the wait was 45min)  We were quite pleased!   Upon arriving we were greeted friendly and asked table or booth.  Normally we take a booth but when they showed us they were in the bar, we changed to table.  The person taking us to the table took us to the first table we came to, near the door.   Umm.....not very nice for a first time here and a Bday dinner.  So we asked if there was another, and she snapped at us and said "how about I follow you to the table".   Okay now you are talking!  ;-) I didn't want her attitude to ruin our time.  We picked a table in the back near the windows, it was perfect, we could see the whole resturant and take in the atmosphere of the place.  We had the best time here!  Celebrating my husbands 60th Birthday.   We started with Alligator  appetizer which was fabulous!   We chose the trout and salmon.  Such great choices!  They were so good.   We both ordered a baked potato and it was so big we had left overs for two days.    ha ha    Our server was Jade....she made our entire visit the most pleasant of all!  Jade was the best host of Pappadeaux  and she knew her menu and details of it.   Jade, we couldn't of been more happy to have you serve us!  I would of given 4 stars due to the girl seating us, but Jade made this a 5 star visit!    Dessert was fabulous..... Key lime pie and brownie with fresh brewed coffee.  Jade, Thanks for making our visit to  Pappadeaux fun!

d2N5SrOq5obFfEKh6Vr4UQ.text: The restaurant is super roomy and offers plenty of space no matter what time of day you decide to stop by. I love seafood and it's always hard convincing my husband that's what we should have when we go out. Luckily he loves the pasta Mardi Gras! I personally love any of the chef selections! Oh and you can't leave not having tried the crab and spinach dip!

YoTZTxvykCD1ZwPsfPditw.text: Happy hour menu in the bar is the best way to do this place. Reduced portions and prices allow guests to try multiple items. Fresh shucked oysters and ice cold beer make this a great happy hour option.

kksDDN8fulGgBk7r9MdBkQ.text: Visiting Pheonix we were in the area and thought we would stop by, I pulled up yelp and noticed all of the good reviews. The parking lot was full and seemed very busy for a Tuesday night, we went in and was seated immediately.  I ordered the catfish and fried shrimp with red beans & rice.  This food was delicious! The fish was firm, hot, and crunchy; the shrimp was butterflied and crunchy as well.  Both had just the right amount of breading where you could taste the meat. It was very well seasoned.  The red beans & rice as also good, it was enough for 2 to share, the beans were cooked firm but not hard and were seasoned just right.  I will come back every time I'm in Pheonix

MjarhvKrY2etwu0mLAVfsA.text: Had lunch here while in town for business. The food was very good and the servings were huge. I ordered fried shrimp and French fries. 5902fMT8P9910TsM7vhvyQ.text: I love me some Pappadeaux!  We actually drove out from Los Angeles to Phoenix to get our cravings satisfied and we were not disappointed.  I'm a huge fan of the Shrimp Etouffee and my mom loves the Crab Fingers.  Shoot, everything is pretty good at Pappadeaux!  I wish they could quit playing and drop a location in the heart of LA.

nw1aIvWOYJ31QmkMKJQD4w.text: I was really excited to come here because my friend had posted so many yummy looking pictures . It had a nice ambiance but I was pretty underwhelmed by the food for as expensive as it was . The service was great, the drinks were good but I could have made better seafood @ home . The catfish wasn't crispy or as flavorful as delicious catfish should be . The crab cake was good but the stuffed shrimp and crab just tasted like a hush puppy .. which I'm not a fan of, so maybe that's just me .

F_H0gsGSrLjjQ6cT1VpUIw.text: Had a great lunch there ... The mussels by far were the best ever! Service was great .. a bit noisy even at lunch but I'll take it.

MqQkouiQskUT8I_QpF4vIw.text: I'm from out of town but have been here twice. Try one of their house specials - the catfish was delicious! And save room for the massive desserts. Fun ambiance, good food.

Bh-YQg0Z9QeAJ8YyMzd9lA.text: Love this place! Clam chowder was piping hot and creamy delicious! Our waiter, Christian was delightful and attentive, an Awesome waiter ! We shared the PapaDeux platter so yummy and lots of good sample of crab cakes shrimp catfish and fries. We will be back! Bought the gift card special they have right. Ow! Good deal!

ER0yTMj157A-gP5CHjDyJA.text: Called to do call ahead seating was told theuro was no wait and couldn't do call ahead seating, but could change.  Called back 15min later and was told there was a 45 min wait. So why not do the call ahead seating from the begin! !!

R4lbDGoqxx5k2w1YjhM1Tg.text: We travel to Phoenix sometimes and when we do our number one place to have dinner is Pappadeaux Seafood Restaurant. This place is absolutely amazing I wish they were here in San Diego. The lines are sometimes a little long but while you wait in line they have a nice waiting area and they offer you free appetizers while you wait and you could get a drink at the same time. Definitely a great dinner experience and customer care. The food is Cajun style and all freshly made. But do not hesitate to try the Crispy Fried Alligator as an appetizer, it is delicious (Not like you could imagine).  Steak & Lobster is the best anywhere! Great service and great food.

nhoEG9uAxIesBTEl4RXx5Q.text: I come to Pappadeaux regularly. I love this place everything is always good and fresh. The atmosphere is great,service, and southern vibe makes me feel like I'm at a restaurant in New Orleans. Thanks Pappadeaux!..I'll always be a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun Mardi Gras pasta. One of many favorite meals here. Love this place.

GnynOHN8tylow959dVneuw.text: First time ever going there had a few months back and the food was phenomenal I love seafood. They had a wonderful menu, they even had crocodile puffs that tasted just like chicken. Sounds funny I know but my boyfriend and his family and I went and I have the best time ever the interior is really really authentic, mixed with the southern Louisiana and Cajun look. So totally would recommend it to people little bit pricey but totally worth it.

sbrXmIdwoOIZVTJdgsrM_g.text: On almost every birthday my family brings me to Pappadeaux this place has the best seafood and while it's a little pricey it is absolutely worth it because they have the best seafood the best Oysters very good service and desserts that are to die for! One particular time I ordered for pick up and they made a mistake on my order so they fix the problem by giving me a gift card and it was awesome!

oJZucn7lOSvhmuZ27oZPoA.text: I fell in love with this place ever since i discovered it when I was in Dallas on business.  I was extremely excited when I found out they were opening a location here.  I like seafood to begin with and when you add some Cajun spices, it's even better.  The servers are always so nice here.  This time our server was Olivia and she was great.  We started out with the wedge salad and for dinner we shared the Pappadeaux platter and a baked potato each.  So much food, if you ever walk away hungry, then you need help ... LOL.  The place is always packed but clean.

FMCoj_mRlWCVAtIEqDbEfA.text: Every chance I get when near Pappadeaux I will hit it.  The food is always great! We were doing a foodie road trip to the Phoenix area to hit some select spots.  Pappadeaux was the #1 spot for us to go!  Well worth the drive from Las Vegas.   I had the catfish blackened and dirty rice both were great.  I have been to locations in Denver, San Antonio and Austin worth it every time and every where!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OsER2pOljVmJtX0tszGIFQ.text: We don't live nearby, so it's been a while.  But we happened to be nearby and so came in again.  I don't recall it being so loud last time.  It was VERY loud.  I mean really LOUD.  Not sure why.  The place was full, but I don't see why everyone was shouting.  Weird.  Various dishes were ordered.  I was hoping for a Cajun catfish.  Breaded and deep-fried.  Sounded good.  Well, it was a disappointment.  It may as well have been Long John Sliver's.  There was no seasoning.  The waitress was nice enough to bring me some Cajun seasoning which I sprinkled on the fish.  It helped, but I think it would have been better if it was part of the coating instead of adding it later.  The other dishes ordered were better (I got to sample them).  So it's clear I just ordered the wrong thing.  However, I think it fair to deduct points for this.  Everything should be flavorful and exciting.  And the fried catfish just wasn't.  It's not a question of not liking something.  The catfish was cooked properly and tasted like catfish.  But there were no exciting flavors unlike the other dishes they offer.  Why did they do that?  I expect more than Long John Silver's.  I also got a bowl of gumbo.  It wasn't quite as good as I remember from last time.  it had a slight burned flavor to it.  Like maybe they cooked the roux too long.  But it was otherwise flavorful.  I'm still a fan based on the other dishes I sampled (and wished I had ordered).  I just won't order the catfish ever again.  I also had the key lime pie.  It was a bit too sweet.  I've never had such a sweet key lime pie before. The tart tang was there, but overpowered by the sweet.  Strange.  Maybe they assumed the raspberry sauce they drizzled on the plate would help counter the sweetness?  Don't know.  I didn't use the drizzle because I just wanted key lime.  Usually whipped cream is there to counter the tartness (and there was some).  But the pie was too sweet already.  I gotta deduct a few points for that too.  So I'll take one star away.  I can't really justify taking two from them.  I definitely expect better than what I got.  It's one thing not to like something, it's another when something you like isn't executed as well as it should have been.

ufjro63FkD_xOMTdIMsnGA.text: What a wonderful meal. I like to sit at the bar, as I feel that it gives the best view of the rest of the restaurant, for people watching.  From the attentive and knowledgeable staff, to the expert chefs that prepare the delectable dishes, dinner was delicious and perfect.    I started with the oysters,  which were large and perfectly prepared. I highly recommend them.  I ordered a fresh seafood item, the scallops with sweet pea risotto.  Absolutely Devine!   Since I am celebrating my birthday month, I also enjoyed a dessert.  The mixed dessert of  pecan  and sweet potato pie, creme brulee  , and banana pudding was the perfect ending.  You can sign up online for your complementary birthday dessert. I hope that your visit is as delicious as mine was.

WH560_DwlwNha4-3Czsyxg.text: The food was not very good for how expensive it was.  I hate to say this but Red Lobster did a better job.

uZrsrR-z0TAtv3to5_YPyA.text: We've been here several times and enjoyed the happy hour. We went for a dinner last week for my birthday and remembered why we hadn't gone for a full meal here in about five years. The food is fine, but overpriced. A small cup of gumbo is $9, which isn't worth it as it's just okay, not great, and it isn't like any gumbo I've had before. It's like vegetable soup with a few shrimp thrown in. It's the service that needs so much improvement. It was a busy night, and we we're shown to a table that didn't have any utensils or napkins. The hostess didn't notice, the server didn't notice and the person who brought our apps out didn't notice. With our food sitting there getting cold, I left the dining room where we were seated and went into the main room and found napkins and utensils on a table, and as I headed back, I ran into our server and told her that I'd come out to get our utensils myself. She smiled and said very cheerfully, "Oh, that's fine!" As if I'd been apologizing. By the time our meals came out I'd finished my cocktail and asked the person who brought our food for another and she said she'd get it. 25 minutes later, I'm done with my meal, and our original server walked by, saw my empty glass, and said, "Oh yeah, I was suppose to put an order in for another." Says that to us, then runs off before I can say that I didn't want it any more. She brought it two minutes later and I drank half really quickly because we were paying for it, but we were done.

MuPJNyVCDqvJRsXcMKhWEA.text: Let me start by saying don't know if I would ever go back!  I took my wife there for her birthday and it was really bad. We had a party of 15 people the lady's at the front desk were rude they wouldn't seat us unless we had all 15 there and they where counting and being careless I had a a family member who recently had heart surgery.  The table was ready and we only where missing two people from party. After our order was taken it took well over an hour to bring us our food. My wife order wasn't rite and the food was cold it was just really bad service.   Dont know if I could go back!!!

S0fgaw5Rv0_hDUOIt-zaRQ.text: This place offers you a break from the "usuals". For an AZ native I was pleasantly surprised with our wild card for our couples night. The servers were well aware of the flavor and menu which is good knowing you can trust their guidance and recommendations. Chicken Fan try the *Aligator* & Fish Fan try the *Frog Legs* ;)

AXxMidCyRGU-Rb-h-04ZoA.text: @ 6 pm on a Monday evening there was a fifteen minute wait. Seated and no server but Nick stopped and took our drink order and said he didn't know who had table. While Nick was getting drinks ( Beer and waters) another waiter put waters down probably seeing we hadn't been waited on. Nick went and took our table and I ordered a dinner salad with bleu cheese dressing ($4.75) and the chef specialty -  SHRIMP & SCALLOP ORECCHIETTE PASTAshrimp & scallops over orecchiette pasta with jumbo lump crab & asparagus in a creamy parmesan vodka sauce 29.95. The salad needed more dressing but was good. The pasta was VERY good with the three large scallops exceptional and three shrimp tasty. Just the right amount of food!
