mGFAUvVZym_SMljxNCxxtg.text: Came here last Sunday for lunch. Had a reservation. Table was not ready at 12.25p. Restaurant was at 20% full. Took the appetizers fried calamaris. Medium size. $15 for probably 10 pieces, a real joke!! The bread served is absolutely disgusting. Frozen, even ducks in the lake can t eat that. Took the tilapia. Good. Took the fresh oysters. 3 on 6 were eatable. The fried platter was super dry, with uncooked french fries. And finally the half chicken( not an half to be honest,) priced 22 dollars, yes 22 dollars, with side of spinach was undercooked. A huge disapointment for a 200 dollars bill. Will not come back again.

AB-NiFVJXh-kTSGSZmbmfA.text: I have been to this restaurant many times and are amazed every time! Not only is the food out standing, but service exceeds any normal expectation. The "Oysters Pappadeaux" makes my mouth water just thinking of them!  I was there today with a party of nine today and the service was outstanding and the food met everyone's  expectations! I will a regular!!

jdD675mAW0xV3tMhKuNfvQ.text: I have been waiting to post this review until after I got in touch with the restaurant to discuss my experience, and I finally have. I visited Pappadeaux for the first time last year after spring training and the food was wonderful. Everyone in my family loved it, and I insisted we go back this year after spring training again. We usually only spend one week a year in Phoenix, so choosing things to do and places to eat is very important as it costs a lot of money to vacation and we want to have a great experience (I promise this matters). It was our first day of the week in Phoenix when we ate here. I ordered the Costa Rican Mahi Alexander, and it tasted amazing. Unfortunately, a few hours after eating here I became very sick, and couldn't stop throwing up for 8 hours. I had to go to urgent care and get IV fluid, and was stuck in bed for a total of 3 days and unable to eat anything solid for the rest of vacation. I made Pappadeaux aware of what happened, and a representative from the restaurant called me to discuss my experience. She was very apologetic, which I appreciate (and why I am giving 2 stars instead of 1), but I am still disappointed in their suggested settlement of the issue. The total bill cost approximately $250 for the 5 people in our party, and they gave me a choice between $125 and a gift certificate to eat there again (why would I want to do that??). I took the $125, but it doesn't even begin to cover the urgent care, related medication, or lodging expenses for the vacation I was no longer able to enjoy. I'm upset to have missed out on the majority of this vacation, and hope no one has the same experience. I will not risk eating here again, which is sad because I used to like it so much.

Jx4OHfhGSpEkNCsOsK0eWg.text: Old. Old style food. Old restaurant. It smells old. Dishes are old style. I feel like I went back to the 90's. If that's what you like - then it's the restaurant for you. I personally prefer the Korean next door (with plenty of seafood) or the Ocean's Club of course!

X-Qep4JzXUnGbIaz81twuA.text: The best seafood in the desert !! The service is top tier. I had the bacon wrapped shrimp and my wife had the lobster and both were pure heaven. There is none better.

YwElGRlpTmTUNMi9IYw1kA.text: Best oysters I've ever had. Waitresses have always been attentive and warm. Cool outdoor patio. Definitely recommend a reservation as it's always been Wooooooorrrrrrth itttttt every time I've gone. Can't wait to go back

Olq7haxQ7jaeacWRsr4iBg.text: Tonight we came here for dinner and had the best service from the bartender Ryan. My husband didn't like his food that much. Ryan told him to get the other shrimp and grits. Needless to say he ended up changing his order and giving him the other order of shrimp and it was great!!! If you ever come here come see Ryan he is so nice and great at what he does!!!

nLsKyl8E9G2pbfoYXte6yw.text: Tried the crab and shrimp cocktail with a ceaser salad. Friend had the redfish. All were excellent. Service was flawless from entering the front to leaving it. Plenty of parking.  I don't think you'll get better seafood or service in this area.

KjAOzgHzMmIzwGsclAVWRQ.text: Fresh seafood considering its Arizona! Service is ok, a bit slow to fill drinks and take orders but the food was good.

4Qfu6H12R4pSeIbhQSgY_g.text: Customer Service is clearly not a priority at this particular location!  Very disappointed at the service I received!

Z3MuGwrohM5JbW1SMx4MnQ.text: I stumbled onto this place while staying next door at the Hyatt Place and have been coming here for the last few years. I always thought what a Bizarre place to put a Restaurant but I guess when you have a great product then you acquire a following. This place is always busy at night no matter what night of the week. I suggest the Caribbean lobster or Filet Mignon, both very Tasty.

RSecT8kheQMpduoxOqljEQ.text: The hostess was very rude. They don't like large party's and are un willing to accommodate large parties. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for family gatherings

-2uesTFR58n1MjivkOd_Sw.text: I went here with a good friend.  My friend got food poisoning from the 'grilled red fish and jumbo shrimp'.  She said it tasted gross and that she couldn't eat it.  I decided to take it home not wanting to waste food.  After trying it at home, I threw it away because it didn't taste right.  I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and that was very good.  The lobster bisque did not taste fresh.  It tasted old but the lobster pieces inside the bisque did taste very fresh.  I didn't feel well for the next 2 days after eating here.  I didn't feel better until I started taking a 'parasite cleanse'.  You would think a bill and tip for 2 that came out to be $139 would be a better experience.  Service was good this time.  Last time service was annoying.  We had a waitress that kept on insulting me the entire time and thought that was funny.  We both thought she was weird.  I went here 4 months before and the dishes were hit and miss.  The the fried calamari was stale tasting and tasted like a quick defrost of frozen food left too long in the freezer.  The Texas Redfish Pontchartrain was excellent.  One of the best tasting fishes in the Phoenix area.    The 2 star is really for the hit and miss on certain items and for food poisoning.  This is a shame because this was one of my favorite restaurant chain when I lived in Houston 20 years ago.

YyTeWANBh3XVfKZbH6RUbA.text: Even though when we first came in this yahoo cut in front of us in line and called him a jerk...and he did not care. The wonderful hostess seen what happened and put us in front of him.  This place is a total 5***** restaurant, to me a ways.  I am what is called a picky, picky person. But, our server Kody was one amazing person. Very friendly, over the top informative, thee best. The food and drinks (drink, Garden of Eden)... were the best I have had in quite some time. I have been to some other places that were in equivalent pricing and quality food. They can't even surpass this place.  Yes, it was our first time here. We will be back.

0HUhhNpzdppuQ9v1_Rqfqg.text: The worst service I've had in Arizona since moving here a year and a half ago. Very busy restaurant but no excuse for how slow server cleaned table, brought menus and silverware and and delivered food. Get better staff and staff up!! TX. Pappa locations would never allow this level of service.

OBUP6wmJe-lJgEDHCJ_2CQ.text: An east coast transplant now living in NoAZ, I miss seafood. And while in Phoenix during Mardi Gras week, I couldn't pass up the chance to sample some of the fresh seafood they say is flown in daily. I wasn't disappointed.  I had three appetizers so I could taste a few different things. The cup of gumbo was delicious and filled with various seafood and chorizo. The Oysters Duo, two different styles of broiled oysters with cheese was stupendous and fresh. And the shrimp & crawfish Fondeux with garlic bread was light and tasty. My drink, a new offering -- blueberry mule -- was great. And best of all was the service. My server was really pleasant, informative, helpful and really cared about my meal and experience.  A huge venue, the restaurant was packed and noisy. But for me, it was a good noisy as it was alive and buzzing with people enjoying themselves, and not so noisy that I couldn't enjoy my meal and evening.  The only reasons I didn't give 5 stars in my review where that the portions were huge. My appetizers -- the oysters and shrimp/crawfish dish -- could have each easily been shared by 2 or 3 people. And in part of the serving sizes and the price of fresh seafood in this part of the country, the prices were on the high side. As a single diner, I would have much preferred smaller portions or a tasting menu so I could have sampled and enjoyed more of their offerings. And maybe because of the size of the place and the number of diners, my dishes were served rather quickly but were on the more warm than hot side. I would have preferred them to be a little hotter when reaching the table. But overall, it was great and I will return.

Z-7FAQ3MUqNJOIPCHjTEsg.text: Food is always top of the line and best service! Yummy :)

uI5RTwPLOsboOMWLa5p5Ow.text: Small portions, hefty prices. Service not the greatest either. My brother in law ordered the chicken and shrimp and fries and it was brought out on a small salad plate. He thought it was a kids meal. Not impressed.

lltW0LCKVkwWi2cbNDPROg.text: I do love coming to this spot, it's always lively and the food is usually good. I returned for Happy Hour with a gift card given to me by Pappadeaux because they had over charged me and admitted to 'bad service'. (very nice!) My first catfish app had 6 pieces, 2nd had 3, why? Ordered a glass of wine and was told happy hour was over even though it was 6:05. (ends at 6:30) Bartender..'Oh, sorry.." Got my bill and again they had charged me for an extra drink. Bartender, 'Oh, sorry.." They applied my gift certificate and it was still incorrect. Paid and left. I'm not complaining to management again. Fun and crowded place but be sure to check your bill, seems they consistently make mistakes.

1GYxkjVaw-5WOqKy_FlBBA.text: Seafood are soooo fresh specially the oysters. I'm a seafood lover & it's my 1st time eating in Pappadeaux & I'm definitely gonna come back. Service is great as well.

nYB5S1VZihbQDaHLTOD-gg.text: Had lunch here with our daughter before heading back to Missouri. Would like to stay and eat here again!  Superb lunch for all and delicious key lime for dessert. A wonderful place with a very nice atmosphere along with great service. What more is to be said !

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5U9BdOqFROL9vVOQ968jiA.text: First heard of this restaurant in Houston a few weeks ago.  Absolutely perfect.  Almost too good.  Found out there was one in Phoenix, AZ, where I live.  Tried it, expecting it not to be as good, since the Gulf is well known for its seafood, and Phoenix is not.  We received the exact level of quality in food and service.  Highly recommend this Restaurant  Have been back several times, and all have been fantastic until last Sunday. Waitress was obviously new, but without trainer.  Spoke very broken English and I knew she wasn't understanding order.  My wife ordered soup for app and crab and lobster salad for lunch.  I ordered one crab cake for app and pan seared talapia for lunch.  Even pointed to the dinner item so she wouldn't mix it up with what my mother in law ordered, which was the lunch grilled talapia.  Totally different dish.  First my crab cake came out.  10 min later my wife's salad came out.  I asked about her soup.  Waitress replied that she wasn't sure which she wanted first so she guessed.  2 minutes later the soup and our lunches came out.  I received the wrong lunch, as I expected.  She asked me if I wanted to change it.  Didn't feel like waiting, so I ate just the fish, but none of the sides.  The waitress just asked how everything was, even though my plate was barely touched.  She should have noticed, and not just smiled and took my plate.  At minimal, she should have sent the manager over to talk to us.  Figured she just wanted to cover her mistakes.  I am 3rd on regular check in's, so we will continue to come back.  Service was definitely not up to their norm.  Was not very busy at the time, so she was not rushed.  Just grabbed a to go order. Very efficient and super friendly. Heard that they were rolling out new training for take out. Everyone was enthused and seemed happy to be there. Thanks Pappa!

URqb1ZKtP6TEJg5xV2CxtQ.text: Food was good experience not so good. Was told an hour wait, waited an hour an forty five minutes after complaining. Went to the bathroom and noticed six open tables. Waiter forgot our orders and never filled our drinks, and took forever to box up our leftovers.  For a 110 dollar tab for two. Not my top choice.

hHisIAngxa6OcufLlm_XmA.text: Restaurant: Came at night and the restaurant and decor was what was expected, lively and a little loud.  Service: Was seated right away. Server was very quick and food came out quickly. Drink refills were done timely.  Food: Ordered the spinach dip. It was excellent. Sampled some of the other food from friends' plates and they were all good.

gCnlqT9qC3ENIR2OUvv89g.text: We arrived checked in and advised about 20-30 minutes. We had waited for 30 minutes, they had advised us twice that they were wiping down the tables. After another 20 minutes we were finally seated.  When we did get to our table the table hadn't been wiped down.  It was dirty, trash(food) around the table, table was not set.  They finally came to wipe down the table. We waited another 5-10 minutes before we ordered drinks.  It took some time before the drinks came.  Typically, we get excellent service and this time was a huge let down.  At this time, we still had no silverware, no settings or anything at our table.  Bread came and it was cold, that is not typical.  The food came and it was mediocre, nothing screamed Pappadeaux, it was a huge let down, the food was luke warm.  Also typically you see a manager that comes around and we didn't see a presence of that last night.  I was very disappointed as this was one of my favorite restaurants as I drive a distance to enjoy the food and it was my daughter, niece and son's birthday.

KxHBoTvCOWUkJmtF5xZpnQ.text: I was very happy to see that there was a Pappadeaux here - a little bit of home!  It gets busy at peak times so either go early or plan to wait a bit. The food is excellent so bring your appetite.

uhFKrS_ZQ40wVWJ9nEKatA.text: Love this place.  Food is great.  Taste fresh.  Doesn't have that  old fish taste.  Atmosphere is good.  Service is great.  I had oysters and shrimp then New Orleans crawfish etouffee. Everything was on point

C1m-LCUh6HBSc_XrS0GZNw.text: This restaurant is our all time favorite seafood place. food is excellent, they never failed us . seafood is fresh like we leave near water. I always order the fish opelousa comes with rice, bread is great. Oysters are very fresh I live in surprise and I don't mind driving here every week

rjZFQ-kUoWxoEQ92PtETZQ.text: Since my last review of Pappa, we've been back about eight times. In fact, six of those times were to celebrate my or my hubby's birthdays, which are two weeks apart. Last visit was last Saturday, the 8th; previous was Dec 26th. This review update could fit either visit.   Again- quoted 45-50 min wait, but vultured around the bar until a couple of seats opened up and dumped our table wait. It was CRAZY busy this time, with all of the folks in town for BCS, etc.   Oysters - wow. They were HUGE, delicious and showed up quickly. Our shucker even came by, after we were finished, to ask if we were happy with our order. Boy howdy, yes we were.   Hubby got filet mignon w/Alaskan King crab compliment; I got my usual crab cake on lemon-caper sauced crawfish bed (sweet potato garnish changed up to fried onion strings with a tomato-y relish on top, yum!). We were both 100% happy with the food. When I mentioned to our bartender (he gets his own paragraph) that it was hubby's birthday, he offered the normal comped dessert (key lime pie, MMMM), but threw in a bonus gift: the rum bottle token. It was appropriate; my hubby had sampled five different rum drinks during our meal. (Pirate Punch was my favorite!)   Ben was our bartender; he was just incredible!! Before we even got seats at the bar, Ben was asking what drink he could make for us. In fact, despite the extremely busy and loud atmosphere, his excellent and attentive service made it feel like he was our personal server - and I noticed that he was giving everyone around his end of the bar the same service. He is just that great! Or maybe he was just that happy that the Colts lost... :). Another 'tender, Kim, also kept a great eye on us and other nearby patrons, whenever Ben had stepped away. Our thanks to them both, for an absolutely fabulous experience which guarantees the future of our 3-year-old birthday tradition!

BkCj2fsp2tS3CyoK6Rgo8g.text: Place is bomb.. had the grilled Frog Legs, Lobster sushi Roll, and the seafood cobb salad for lunch.. sooooo good..   Been here once before and had the aligator appetizer, which was really good and also the crab stuffed shrimp.. everything was great.  Tiffany, the girl that waited on us, was really nice and very helpful as well.  Will definitely go back again !

-om8xuJSCQVDzbH8iSzRsw.text: Great food but had some issues with being told they were out of the selection after order went to kitchen.  But manager really went the extra mile to correct things.  Would go back.  Very fresh fish.

LkWLUriIGw5fJny3vU-l-Q.text: Great food.  Fantastic service.  Lovely atmosphere.   Dinner was absolutely Delicious.  I wasn't sure if I liked some of the sauces that came on the entree & the waitress had me taste everything before I made my final choice. It was a busy night & she apologized for our food not being up faster, without me even complaining about it, & gave us 20% of our bill!   The atmosphere was casual & relaxed. The staff is so friendly & welcoming, you just can't help but feel comfortable & happy to be there!   They have a return customer in me :)

WZdnHRNusqSxGi9F2Px3Yw.text: This is the 4th time I have been there and it was the best experience this time.  The service was outstanding.  The waiter kept checking on us and refills came without asking (even after the bill was paid).  I ordered the naked fish selection: blacken costa rica mahi with dirty rice.  WOW, it was very tasty and delicious!  I ordered my fish well, the normally serve it medium.  I was so full, I did not make it to dessert.  The other ladies were impressed too.  One had the cedar planked salmon and the other had a greek salad.  No complaints from us...

jZejgYD9wuHUOo_4kO-cPw.text: My fiancee and I ate here and we enjoyed the aura and ambiance of the place. The Shrimp Brochette is to die for!

vqvdiN4zZAqZVbt9qshsZw.text: I have only eaten twice at Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen, once in Denver, CO and the other in Phoenix, AZ. Both visits were excellent! My second and most recent visit was at the Phoenix location. The restaurant was very busy, even still our wait was under our quoted time, by only a few minutes. Everyone from the bartender to the server were all friendly and accommodating. The live music playing outside was an added benefit. Management was also outstanding. We had a challenge with the timeliness of our meal and the manager was very helpful in resolving our problem. The food was outstanding, with nice portions too. Flavorful, creative, and well presented are just a few attributes describing the food. Please consider Southern California for a future location!

u1Aowpi_G-tp0WWNQSqtXw.text: I have been here 4 times, the first time I went here the service was awesome and so was the food. The second time was great service was great and so was the food. The third time I went here we had a party of about 15 for my mother in laws wedding, we called and made a reservation yet when we got there we still had to wait up front and we stood there for 40 mins! We had made the reservation days earlier. When we went to order they were out of half of the stuff we wanted so I orders the roasted chicken. I was disappointed it was so dry and tasteless. The 4th time was this past Monday, first of all they forgot my food so while everybody with me was eating I was just watching them waiting for my food, I wanted about 15 extra mins, second I was waiting for my server to refill my water almost every time it was gone, and the worst part about all of this.... I got the WORST FOOD POISONING from this place, I had to miss school on Tuesday and I'm missing work today. The only thing I have eatin in the past 32 hours is 3 fruit bars because that's all that my stomach will allow!!! Do not waste you're money at this overrated place, it truly is a waste of money and time, and if you do go here just know that you are taking a chance and you might get food poisoning and honestly I have had it before about twice but this is by far the worst case! DO NOT GO HERE!!!

CWlLKNMoG3JjlrRNzyP4hg.text: I thought the food was only ok. I  have been t Papadeaux's in Houston,Dallas and Austin and the food was great!    We were hungry for Cajun food and even though the restaurant was 30 miles away,my wife and I gave it a try .  The gumbo was as far from the real thing as I have ever tasted. It wasn't awful,it just wasn't gumbo.  The Shrimp Po Boy was ok and they were generous with the amount of shrimp but I wouldn't drive 30 miles to go there again.

CEqTo4c-egWOR6086jwEWw.text: This is the 2nd time I have been here. After a shopping excursion with my Wife, we stopped in around 8pm. It wasnt too busy, and found a booth in the bar right off the bat.  We decided to be a little adventurous and try out the Fired Alligator and Fried Frog legs. Both were extremely good. Since I am afraid to death of alligators it was a little self satisifing eating one! Now instead of looking at them as scary things, I see them in bite sized fried nuggets!  The Frog legs were equally as good. As the saying goes, tastes like chicken.  Dinner I had the Australian lobster tail. It was cooked perfectly! My wife had the tilapia laffayette thing, and it too was cooked perfectly. Nothing was overcooked or undercooked. They definately know what they are doing here cooking fish.  Waiter was prompt, courteous, and was johnny on the spot for water/tea refills. We didnt feel rushed at all, but we were definately in and out very quickly.  Would definatley visit again!

GETwhvCT2LsHR5WajEq-GA.text: We loved eating here.  The wait staff were very friendly, especially at the Atlanta restaurant.  We celebrated our anniversary in Atlanta and my birthday at the Arizona restaurant all within two weeks. We will definitely return whenever we can. When will we have a restaurant in So Cal?

sviD4toreVLKu6h7JqJmGA.text: Arrived on time for our 8pm reservation (party of 5) Came here for a 60th birthday dinner.. it was my first time here and it was absolutely amazing! Our server was obviously very busy but extremely friendly and very knowledgeable about everything in the menu. We had a few bumps throughout our dinner because of the computer system and another because the wrong dinner entree was brought but the manager Melissa made everything right and had the correct meal out asap! She absolutely made our night. Thank you for the great server from your staff and your management.. we will be back!!

_AvMDeKjU3QHwc7lhf8v3w.text: Favorite seafood around. Great steaks and drinks as well. Fried gator isnt too shabby either. Wait can be long but worth it. They do take reservations as well.

pn1reeooTi3elN-to63RsA.text: Great service food okay at best but the desert is phenomenal so between deserts and service was the savor for the fried tilapia but the shrimp and Caribbean lobster tail was great I think the person frying the fish may have been a little off this night

DlcNeD1PJ8kWnfE6aKba6Q.text: I love this place - I especially love their Fried chef's platter and the Calamari appetizer.  I often have the Calamari appetizer for dinner - it is THAT good. The Calamari is fried but then mixed with artichokes and feta cheese and tossed with a lemon garlic sauce.  It is really wonderful.  My husband and son love the fried cray fish and my son loves the catfish.  Here is the thing - I don't think they take reservations so you have to just get there early.  Bar seating is limited or you sit outside so if they are crowded, you may have to wait.  It is very popular so often crowded.  But, it is worth the wait.

B3N4ODZiSp7fXReTsgBjVw.text: We went to Pappadeaux shortly after it opened and loved it. However the prices have gone way up in the last few years.  We paid $8 for 8 stalks of asparagus as a substitution. A meal off the lunch menu for 2 people, one soft drink  ended up costing $65  before tip. The blackened fish wasn't blackened but covered with mystery sauce which was all you could taste. The service was slow but the restaurant was not crowded. From now on the only thing we will order there is gumbo to go! That is still great although overpriced.

_HndbX99WwErqvG-8OycRw.text: I came here to celebrate a birthday. We got the appetizer's and the drinks fairly quickly, but the bread took an extra 5 minutes to show up. We got the Fried Alligator, and it was delicious. I ordered the seafood gumbo, but the restaurant was out of oysters so it had extra shrimp. I felt like the Gumbo wasn't as good as others I have tried. I also tried fried Crawfish tails, and they were delicious. For desert I had the Creme brulee. Overall the service and food was great, but I was disappointed by the Gumbo.

h4eaM12KvLyUpGJofHClQA.text: The atmosphere is really nice. My food was okay, nothing special. What rubbed me the wrong way was my wine ordering experience. I was focused on the people I was with, and had not really thought about what I was going to drink. The waiter was there to order, so I quickly looked over the wine selection and ordered what I thought was a simple glass of wine (left column number). It was one of the more expensive wines but was what I wanted since they were out of my first choice, Malbec. When I got the bill, I noticed that the wine was significantly more than what I had thought it was and asked about it. Turns out, there are TWO wine pours (5 oz and 8oz) and for whatever reason, he decided, without asking, that I needed the more expensive pour. I guess the lesson is, don't just assume that those 3 columns are glass/half carafe/bottle or whatever, get your magnifying glass out, read the small print and specify what you want. I have been to a lot of restaurants and have drank a lot of wine over the years, but this was a first for me and felt a little shifty in nature. I will very likely never be back.

d4qaa-PyZOqxc2O7piEZFw.text: With seafood cravings at an all time high, I had high expectations of Pappadeaux, I mean it has the word seafood in it's name after all ...  I came here for dinner with intentions of ordering oysters and possibly trying their other signature items I've heard so much about. Kind of gimmicky since it's has that themed restaurant feel, think Bubba Gump's, Red Lobster and the likes. It's dark and covered with seaside/fishing decor.  I went with a Watermelon Lemonade to sip on. A dozen Blue Point oysters and the Appetizer Trio to share. No entrees here as we knew this place does hefty portions. The service here is good and very quick, they refill waters with a quickness!  The Watermelon Lemonade was okay, just a lemonade with watermelon syrup and really sweet.  The Blue Point Oysters were good, though they came with horseradish, cocktail sauce, spicy soy sauce, and lemons, I was hoping they would at least have served it with a mignonette. The horseradish was okay, cocktail sauce too sweet and the spicy soy sauce was just plain wrong. I ended up eating the oysters with lemon and Tabasco. Nice and slightly more briny than the Pacific oysters that were also on the menu and had more of a bite to them.  The Appetizer Trio came with fried gator, Crawfish/Shrimp Fondeaux, and Smoked Salmon. To be quite honest, the fried gator is hands down amazing! I have never had gator and didn't expect it to be so juicy, tender and delicious. The sauce they serve it with is such a great pairing. The Smoked Salmon was juicy and cooked well, slightly smokey flavor. The Fondeaux tasted too strange for my liking, the shrimp tasted off, crawfish was a bit tough and the cheese for the Fondeaux did not pair well with the seafood and garlic bread.  This place is pretty pricey, appetizers go from $10-16 and the entrees from what I recall go from $25+   The only thing that was good about Pappadeaux was their fried gator, other than that I would have to pass.

j8YhHmldMoNYyeMWABS4DA.text: We just left Pappadeaux's and had a wonderful evening! Our server Jalissa, was so engaging and informative. She let us know our options before choosing our food. We had the Filet mignon  with lobster tails. Delicious! Then to top it off, we were served a complimentary yummy dessert for our Anniversary. We are looking forward to returning and hopefully having Jalissa again. Thank you for a great night!

Fovy7J0MQcPxXltRerSAFA.text: Had the worst dining experience ever last night. One member of our party of four was served five minutes before everyone else. Salads and soup brought to our table the same time as our main meal. Drinks never refilled. I finally got up and found a pitcher and water and poured it myself. My wife ordered a baked potato, received French fries. When pointed out to waiter he said, I'll go put that order in now. Never did get it.

MOH7W2uFm-VYhZEAbPeaxg.text: The drinks were perfect! The wait was long......my food was mediocre. Our server tried to make it right for us but after being there almost 3 hours, I was over it. Maybe it's Arizona. Everything I ate while visiting was blah.

aVV48VPET1QInY2Y5Tu9TQ.text: In town for work. Sat at the bar. Happy Hour app was very small, like 2 bites small but yummy. Cocktail was perfect, not too sweet. Stuffed shrimp was ok, but  not memorable. Well seasoned fries. If I was with the company of some friends seems like it would be a fun place to get together.

AcGyJmc_g6CXzzI95LAg5A.text: We have been there several times, & have always had exceptional experiences. They acknowledged our date night we posted on Twitter, & we were impressed they took the time to comment.

L3PmqX9wfTNwCoZoRZWb1A.text: You get what you pay for. This place is amazing, never had a bad meal or experience. Some of the best seafood in Phoenix.

Yr0DYYv-y-YS56NBdnIC7g.text: 3.5 Nice seafood spot with a variety of grilled or fried entrees.   For apetitizers my hubby ordered a half dozen Gold Coast Oysters. He said something about them being an aphrodisiac HA! I ordered baked lobster mac and cheese. We shared the Pappadeaux platter (1 pc catfish, 1 pc tilapia, extra shrimp, fried crawfish, 2 blue crab cakes, and french fries) and still didn't finish it. The shrimp and crawfish were too spicy for me my hubby loved it.   My dad ordered the fried catfish, red beans and rice plate while son ate grilled shrimp/grilled tilipia/broccolini and fries.   The desert presentation was the best. Although we were past stuffed, we tried to make room for the key lime pie and the humongous serving of vanilla cheesecake.  Overall, the experience wasn't horrible. We would def do it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gulf Coast Oysters on a half shell!!

TtIQOB60NqaIP8ajLyaHUA.text: I have been eating oysters my whole life. I've been to every single place on the West Coast just about in these guys have the best or Oysters I've ever had. Me and my girls favorite place to go!!! I've tried everything on the menu and have never had anything bad!! Service is great!!! Bartenders are on point and the manager Destiny is super nice!!! Best food/service/drinks!!!  David and Tonya

OQOE4Cpr_-UCNCG9og8-8w.text: EVERYTHING was delicious!! Our food, appetizers & drinks. We left there happy, full - totally satisfied. This location was everything I thought it would be. I've only been to the location in Atlanta but so happy I got a chance to visit this location also!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #ATeam
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moroccan Salmon &amp; Shrimp
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilean Sea Bass

PiJiDl_00Q5hG6Iqma0Euw.text: If we didn't submit a review previously back in November 2017, sorry - we ate here, loved it, and are coming back for more!! We live in Missouri but found this place when we came to Phoenix 6 months ago; thanks to yelp. The seafood is T-O  D-I-E  F-O-R!!! Brent even brought his father and brother when they came to Phoenix last month for a golf week. Raw oysters look amazing and are very popular!! They are shucked by Jose, a really sweet, attentive "mother-shucker". Don't forget to tip your shucker!! :)  Brent has gotten the crawfish etouffee all three times, and has LOVED it every time!! I got the small fried shrimp and then this time got the fried shrimp and scallops. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! While Pappadeux's appears to be a chain - we saw one in Albuquerque, we are lucky there isn't one in KC!! We'd be fat but happy!! Btw - my fried shrimp and scallops is not on the menu, but our awesome bartenders, Susan and Amanda, said it's not a problem whatsoever to do a fried combo, so they got exactly what I was craving. And it's beyond words!! And look at the size of the baked potato. Amanda/bartender said this was a small one. :/  Amanda and Susan worked their butts off at this large bar, but were extremely attentive despite the rush of people and drinks. They had awesome smiles and great, friendly attitudes!! The bar is where you get the best service!!! For those of you with larger parties, larger than Brent and I, there appears to always be large parties of 8-10 people that get seated quickly. Don't let the filled parking lot scare you off!!! Come - enjoy this place!! You will have a wonderful, YUMMY meal!! And - as the added bonus - they have Diet Coke!!! :). That's not why they got 5 stars, though!! :)

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crawfish platter
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried shrimp and scallops platter

TfPTAK3C0O79B2gyELWi1g.text: The best Cajun seafood I've had so far. Everything was perfect as far as service and food. Expect to wait a little bit on a weekend, but well worth it. Everything had the right flavors and serving sizes are large! Shared the alligator bites as an appetizer which I recommend! The Mardi Gras pasta was huge portion but soo good! The praline cheesecake was literally life changing. Love this place and will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alligator bites! Super good, almost takes like chicken lol
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Gras pasta

nciJoecFzQOj0QTFWu077g.text: Food was 5 stars, manager was 2 stars. Being from Texas, I love Pappadeaux and we come here on a regular basis. Food was great, as usual, but the food service time was awful as they seemed to have lost our order (sat in the bar, which is normally great). Our oysters came timely but we sat for 35-40 min. after that to get our food.  Saw the bartender talk to one manager and she went to the kitchen to make things happen. After we ate, no consideration for the delay.  I asked to speak with the manager and a different one came up.  She apologized and said they didn't expect to be so busy (really, on Saturday?) and that the bartender was new. No real concern or consideration. Then asked if I would be back next Saturday(!). Hoping for a better experience next time.

LpKx1BRYGEXqH88m62iPGg.text: Experienced happy hour for the first time.  Amazing food and drink for cheap prices.  Only downer the bar tender.  It was a pasted on smile.  I will return and take people with me.

4FboTTMz_e-hDmFBzwMWMw.text: Love this place! It's a Father's Day tradition for us. I'm a huge fried seafood fan. The Pappadeaux Platter is what I enjoy. Can't beat the Craw-fish.

CWrGLfR4uizhtvwO7NOTGQ.text: Amazing food drinks and atmosphere.  bites are really good, I love the trout when it's in season. Love the ambiance.

52lZ112j1zgv1dGD2k4dRA.text: Not sure how seafood in the middle of the desert gets this good.  I live in socal near the ocean and this place blows doors on any of the restaurants in my local area.  Every time I travel to Phoenix, I will eat here.

aZ-dSas2XX4kfZDkX7p02A.text: Love this place. Great food!  Closest thing to new orleans seafood.  I always bring my family here and they really love it!  Prefect for big parties.  Note: must try the category 5 daiquiri (more than one is at your own risk) lol! Enjoy!!!!!

wCvvEzEQh8Oc8PQHlxtTrw.text: Best and freshest seafood in AZ! Flown in fresh daily. All appetizers and entrees were delicious! From alligator to oysters to crawfish and more... Desserts are True "Nawlins" style! Bourbon sauce on bread pudding... OMG!!! Oversized and yummy creme brulee ... I'll be back!!

bGECBf0Fn5vCcNDSbsriBQ.text: Amazing, amazing gumbo for an appetizer then sea bass for lunch was to die for !!  Service was A+ ....look forward to my next visit !!

jjNDT9xx9nMHe3b8EYq0aA.text: Always very impressed when I go. Everyone is very personable, and never get a bad waiter. Everyone seems happy to be at work. My company host some team builders there and have always had great service. For my birthday I receive two gift cards to there and can not wait to cash in. Just an all around great atmosphere.

n8bIQwhJxuI3DCISewK56Q.text: Wow this place is great!! We came in town for the probowl and came to eat here. We had the gator appetizer and it was nice and tender. Catfish is very clean flavor. Price is a bit up there but well worth it. A must visit next time. My server Kamarie was great.

98scI14BXNEANliXJw-vbA.text: I love to go sit at this bar! Also, very yummy food. Anytime I want artery clogging sauces on delicious fish, this is the place.

IYgTXEpCtam1IuIpk_DwRg.text: 09/07/12  The place is huge and beautiful inside and outside. The entrance is somewhat hidden.  The service is very friendly and helpful from the moment that you enter, and there are employees everywhere!  I ordered the handcrafted strawberry lemonade. It was delicious.  I inquired about the spiciness of the crawfish etouffee, and ordered it with a request to kick up the Cajun a bit. I've been craving for some good etouffee since a recent visit to a place in Bakersfield.  The crawfish etouffee was excellent, the portions are huge. My order was accidentally split in half, and each half was huge!   Yummy...  A freshly baked loaf of bread was delivered to my table.  Robert was a great server and did a great job! Thanks robert!

b7Oe64Xzi7adL9JvhjMwXA.text: I won't lie, Pappadeaux's used to be WAY better years ago, but it's still a great place to go with flavorful fare. My absolute favorite dish is actually the stuffed crab, which is an appetizer but I order as an entree. Bread pudding and Banana pudding are both delish! Attentive staff. Can get loud, very busy, long waits some days, but is to be expected for a good restaurant.

MzQXIt9N0PMH0uP-fCVc4Q.text: I don't get over to the Phoenix area all that often but when I do this is one place i make a point to visit.  I either get my Pappadeaux fix here or i've got to go to God's Country (Texas).  I always enjoy the food and this time was no different, service is really good.  Vibrant noise level.

Tf-nQdcnznfPSK4sr29kvQ.text: The Halibut and was tasty and service was good. Only reason not a 5 star was the price. Spent $130 for two with a drink each and tip. Wife and I didn't choose the cheaper items on the menu but I will try this place again.

OXAfeqF3yjJ-wwwAMd4VDw.text: This place had some seriously amazing Louisiana style sea food dishes.  Too bad i showed up off-season for craw fish, but other than that, it was total class.   They seated me and my friend in the corner but we end up having a great view of the place, and seemed a bit more intimate that way. This also gave us a great view of the outside seating area to people watch as well. The food itself was very rich and delicious.  I don't remember the name of the dish but it featured baked oysters.  Every bite was delicious. I am definitely coming back there if I am looking for a nice seat down in the West Valley.

LpqdGtW5faF5O-4U2f81Lw.text: First timer here! Alexa was great and made sure all our beverage and food needs were met. I got the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette.....delish! Another in my party got fried shrimp (good bit nothing special) and another for the pasta Marti Gras which was also delish!

z5HBii-9NrpTvJHFFEinjw.text: It's a chain but a good one. It's been at this location for a long time now, they're still thriving, and it's all for good reason.  There are a lot of great options here but some of my favorites are the catfish po' boy, fried alligator and crawfish boil. One must try appetizer are the sauteed frog legs. If you haven't had frog legs before this is a good place to try them.   They've got great atmosphere indoors, a great patio that typically features live music and the service is always fantastic. A fine choice for lunch ,dinner, drinks or all of the above.

OUEZ94nzVZrnfPYILlDUQA.text: Wow! What a great dinner and dining experience! We ordered the shrimp and crawfish fondeaux appetizer (which came with an awesome garlic bread loaf), Chilean sea bass (topped with jumbo lump "crab gratin"), and crispy Atlantic salmon (seared, topped with crab, shrimp & scallop), a cup of andouille gumbo, and finished with a house-recipe key lime pie.  Every dish was excellent, and the fondeaux lived up to all the Yelp hype. All of these items were at the recommendation of our young but very knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and attentive server, Tory (you were awesome Tory and thanks for all the great recommendations). Our only regret is that it's taken us so long to finally try this place. We've passed it a thousand times, never realizing it had so much quality food and ambience (New Orleans flare). It's crowded, for good reason, so make reservations. - Mark & Rebecca

sUK8uEXLqnQpjjgQgdvvNQ.text: So freaking delicious!   I love this place.  Crawfish Etouffee is to die for!

ZPsJha2tC2dJHQXLjNr37w.text: my dad took us here for my mom's birthday -- one of the best seafood restaurants i've been to! prices are reasonable for the quality of food and service you receive. also, complimentary choice of dessert on your birthday. great place!

rYnJ22HyXXRqIMkhPBSopg.text: Good food, very good actually- the oysters tasted like they were fresh and I usually eat them fresh off a boat.  The staff was a little odd with the check in, and I could do without the band, but the food was excellent.

vDYRez2tV-h2XvVDxOxK9w.text: So good.  But, be warned - it's expensive!  Four entrees, two appetizers and a couple of beers totaled nearly $180.00.  Our server, while a bit confused, was charming and likeable.  The food was delicious.  We tried the fried alligator (a first for me) and I'm hooked.  I also got a tilapia fillet that was cooked perfectly with a delicious sauce and side dishes.  I'll go back, just maybe not while we're still in a recession.

u06clf89VfKQHjc1LqwppQ.text: Went on a Saturday night and it was hard to find parking, but we got seated right away! The shrimp brochette is by far the best shrimp every! This will definitely be a repeat dinner destination.

dzIRVsL2wQDRqcUS-j3IGQ.text: I usually enjoy a trip over to Pappadeaux but last night was the worst dining experience I've had in years. We were quoted a 10-20 min wait time... no biggie... ended up waiting 55 min to be seated. It is spring training and spring break so not a big deal because we did arrive at 7pm. The problem is we left at 10:30pm! I ordered the seasonal craw fish as an appetizer since I had an hour to look over the menu I ordered right away. Took 45 min to get the craw fish out and when they came there was an old dehydrated piece of corn with scraps of potatoes. I had watched other tables getting several pieces of corn with large potatoes so we must have been given the "left overs". It was truly pathetic. We ended up just getting the gumbo since we had already filled up on bread and my real motivation to eat here was the dessert. We ordered two desserts and after 15 min our waitress only brought out one (she forgot the other one). Our waitress was nice but just not good at her job. Every time she knew she messed up she would have the manager come to our table instead of just explaining to us what had happened. It was a long confusing $50 app, soup, and dessert. I would recommend going at 2pm for a stress free dinner!

U40mbIlhYMNeKfeBf9pZ_g.text: Chains are usually very predictable, usually on the negative side. However I find Pappadeaux probably from a quality and consistancy standpoint, the very best. I was reminded again today at lunch having a seafood gumbo and half a shrimp po boy which could be a whole sandwich anywhere else. Dinner is also great but can get rather pricey especially for a chain. However despite of that, it's worth going back. Just save your pennies for your next taste treat.

lQbNuehMTcPSvPzqNLLLrg.text: Last night my husband and I had a horrible experienced! I met him and a friend there for dinner.  They were having a glass of wine in the patio when I got there.  We went inside for dinner.  Angela, the waitress came and asked the guys if they wanted more wine. I had to ask her if I could have a drink!  She came with drinks and we ordered alligator.  Alligator came and no bread, had to ask for it.  Our dinner came, friend was served. We ordered mussels.  The guy tried to pour them out of the pot and they were stuck in the pot!!  Both pots!!!..He said that wasn't good and would get new.  In the mean time Angela came out to tell us she was sorry and asked if we were done with the Alligator (2 left) and she actually had her fingers on them while she was talking to us!!!  I couldn't believe my eyes, also asked if we were done with the bread (with her fingers on the towel the bread was wrapped in).  All this time she was coming out to talk, she sounded  like she was reading from a book or something, slow and not saying anything worth anything. Was also watching people wiping off tables, very slow and really not liking what they were doing.  Get another job!! We have been here a lot and have seen workers fast and doing their job.  Busy and getting things done.  And the food was excellent.  But what has happened?  They should look around and maybe clean house!  The table next to us had a  big serving platter with dirty dishes and left over food next to them thru out their dinner and we had our appetizers next to us thru most of our dinner. The manager finally came out to say she was sorry also, I think it was the kitchen and waitress that was the problems here.  Alligator was very chewy, the mussels were like they were just cooked in water and had no flavor.  We have brought our out of town guests and family here and have always had a wonderful experience, but this time I don't know what went wrong. We will think twice the next time.  I think they are having issues with cooks and workers!!!

s3_Alo0leaZfAm7x8MOYnw.text: My new favorite place to eat.  Fried alligator ROCKS!!!

m0VGy21B3SSTe4_izDdhOQ.text: We LOVE pappadeaux and go every time we are close to one.  Never have been disappointed. We started at the bar with a couple happy hour grey goose lemon drops. Coconut shrimp app followed by cedar plank salmon and stuffed shrimp (unbelievably delish!). We also added some king crab legs and a beer and blood orange mojito. Got out for $112 including $20 tip. Service was top notch food was phenomenal, if I had to knock something the crab legs were a little soggy. Server immediately tried to replace them or comp them but I can't waste crab legs so I ate every scrap of them!  Can't wait to go back.

Vdv8njeO_B0PtdN4IUrvlA.text: Mmm Mmm, love Pappadeaux! Such great cajun/creole style food in a really fun environment. You must try the fondeaux and lobster bisque - my favorites! Always super crowded, so I would def make a reservation.

8i3D-OkSF-TqyYH6vJO8Pw.text: good food quantities and seafood if you like creole style.

eWgRdCDDXaOMXRni1HEsgw.text: Can't go wrong. Great atmosphere, wonderful food and great service. Really fun outdoor area and a large comfortable indoor space. Food is not overly spicy (which unfortunately seems par for most "Cajun" restaurants).   Very tasty and while not exactly cheap, it's more reasonable than you might expect given the quality and amount of food you get.  Nice bar area too.

rL2F5gCzAD4BE3GxtqC9XQ.text: Pappadeaux is an excellent place to have delicious seafood in the Phoenix area.  They have a wide selection and every time I've eaten here the service was prompt and courteous, the meals well prepared, and they always seem pretty busy.  I had the Caribbean lobster tail, scallops, and shrimp wrapped in bacon followed by key lime pie.  Everything was cooked to perfection and I always try to eat at  Pappadeaux when I'm in the Phoenix area.

s1IUoqLXTW9sUj_e4fvXKw.text: First off, I know I'm going to come off as sounding crazy because it seems like everyone loves this place. I have had 3 separate experiences that just weren't up to par (1st time was a pick-up order & the steak was extremely chewy 2nd time was similar to my experience I had on Sunday.) I went to have dinner with my boyfriend and  we were promptly seated, but that is where the promptness ended. When we finally received our food (both had the seafood sampler for somewhere around $21 per plate) and everything tasted similar without any of the WOW factor I was hoping for. The worst part was when we were done eating the waitress brought us our to-go boxes and then took 30 minutes to bring us the check. We debated on just leaving but decided to be responsible, but lets just say the tip was minimal. Overall this place just wasn't worth my $64 bill at the end of the night. I ended up having a BOMB dinner the next day at Jason's Dell for $20 and I enjoyed it WAY more! nuff said

-a8eTTAPvzCtndiMae8c-g.text: Great stick to your bones food.  Try the fried crab claws and fried gator. The service is spotty however, the food is great.

LBzYZFbD2a-cUrvPXDsWsg.text: Had a fantastic dinner here on 7/22.  P.H.I.L. was our waiter and he was phenomenal !  Food was GREAT! As was service!    Highly recommend this place!  Sat outside and was very comfortable!   Will be back again and again!!!!

UuLzLFv2jWrczwQv8xTcqw.text: This place is so messed up.  I've been maybe 10 times now, and it is so hit and miss. I keep coming back because I love the king crab legs and the lobster tail; haven't found another place that has them along with a decent array of other food in a lively atmosphere, but they don't inspire me with confidence considering I always spend over $100. My partners always end up with poor meals.   First of all, their seating management is a disaster. On Friday's visit, I first called for a reservation - 9:30pm was the earliest offer.  I drove there anyway, arrived at 7:30pm, put in our name for a table for two, outside (new system in place - no more numbers, but vibrating alert gizmos).  I asked for outside, but she said 'let us know that when you are called' - probably the problem right there. We were told '20-30 minutes'.  No problem, we went to the smaller bar next to the outdoor dining patio and had a beer.  The Patio was 30% full only, and the waiters servicing the outdoor patio were standing around idle. After watching the patio remain largely empty for at least 20 minutes, I approached the front desk and asked, 'how come we aren't being seated since the patio is not full?" She immediately grabbed a couple of menus and seated us.  We later asked our waiter what was going on, he said ...'million dollar business with a couple of high-school kids running the front desk'.  Just about sums it up!   We also got dripped on and generally over-chilled by the misters and fans. We finally asked for them to be turned off, but it took a good 20 mins for the misters to completely 'dry out' (one of the reasons I want to sit outside is to avoid the over-chilled interior).   I had the lobster tail, it was great. My partner had the 'hudson bay combo' ... the bacon-wrapped shrimp were great, but the lobster tail and the scallop were totally lukewarm, tasting like they were cooked well in advance.  Not good for a $27 entree.

Kg1xiA9T0i7lhh_FbpVQ8A.text: Second time I've been at Pappadeaux's and it was good food. They give you a roll of bread to eat that is free. The bread is rock hard and it feels like it will break a tooth. They should definitely invest in a different bread recipe, I like soft bread! I ordered the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and it costs 10 dollars. The shrimp cocktail tastes good but it is very small in portion and not worth the money! The waiter recommended a jumbalya type of dish and it was around 23 dollars. It was big in portion and tasted good. My fiance got filet Mignon and she said it tasted good except the sauce wasn't very good. She asked for a salad to substitute the asparagus and the waiter said he couldn't. The asparagus comes the size of tree trunks lol. The bill totaled about 70 for two people. I would say that the food tastes good but it is over priced. The waiting staff was very good as well. The reason for the 3 stars is the over priced food.

QCEBjz-5TMfqzaxkifXZ7A.text: Went to this restaurant Monday night while my father and I were in town for spring training.  The front desk clerk at our hotel (which was conveniently walking distance) recommended this restaurant to us.  When we arrived the hostess told us it was going to to be an hour wait.  Rather than drive (or go to Fridays) we decided to stick around.  My father sat down and I went to the bar to get a couple drinks.  Albeit the bar was busy but the bartender, Mitch, asked me twice what I would like and then completely ignored me and never got them.  I waited for 20 minutes before Linda came and asked me for my drink order and promptly took care of it.  When two seats became available at the bar she quickly suggested we jump on them.  We ended up having dinner at the bar and everything was wonderful.  At Linda's suggestion we tried the Mediterranean calamari which was outstanding.  For our entrees we had the bacon wrapped shrimp and the scallops.  Both were delicious.  And Linda was simply amazing. She made up Mitch and made our evening wonderful.  We will definitely be back when we are in the city again.

wtLxy1ReQUHZD1FSPB5cTQ.text: Never been here before...never even heard of them actually, until this recent biz trip down to Phoenix.  For being a "chain" restaurant, boy were they good!  Everything tasted extremely fresh and the quality of the seafood was wonderful.   I was accompanied by two of my co-workers with all very different palates.  We each ordered something extremely different from the other and all you heard was the sound of us chowing down.  One colleague got a salad which she devoured...said it was fresh, not too little/much dressing, etc.  My other colleague ordered the crab legs and she loved every last bite...tore it all up.  I ordered a tuna dinner item...don't remember the name...but it was a special item they had that evening and it was divine.  The mashed potatoes were so fluffy...loved it all.  I also ordered the banana pudding for dessert and was a complete pig...and ooooMG was it worth it.  It was layered so well and served in a keepsake mason jar...very cute.  Anyhow, it beat my mom's banana pudding which is one of the many foods I would eat before death...!  SO, I couldn't believe how delicious everything was.  Additionally, the service was SUPER prompt and the young woman who was our server was extremely courteous and efficient.  Would definitely return again!

mH6PWSfVN6rUedWLiLbrAA.text: Food: To be honest I was not that impressed with my pasta dish. I got the Mardi Gras pasta and I have had way better pasta for half of the price. I went with a large group and everyone else thought that their food was delicious. So maybe I ordered the wrong thing. I am a huge pasta lover so I am a little harsh on pasta but I was not even a fan of the way the shrimp was seasoned.  Service: service could have been better, especially for how pricey the restaurant is. My water glass was empty multiple times and I had to ask for them to be refilled.   Ambiance: the restaurant itself if GORG. I love the outside and with nice weather it was nice to sit outside.   I will try and give this place another try but my first experience I was not impressed.

wb77aAPH4PMloMzpaoHs5w.text: The place I fell in heavy like with dirty rice, yum.   Love Pappadeaux as a dine in or take out option. Best seafood place in Phoenix where you really can't go wrong. They have a pretty decent food happy hour menu with wall to larger option dishes to choose from.  When craving seafood I'll swing by for one of their seafood platters and it definitely takes care of my craving.   Love their margaritas, and most drink options. Disclaimer: the drink sometimes can be strong but I'm not complaining   The servers are always friendly but I've only sat at the bar or ordered food to go.   Love the desserts. I tried their cheesecake and it was amazing. Best part, the serving size was pretty generous .

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen Margarita
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Boiled Shrimp,  during the happy hour.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Broiled Shrimp

Xw1dbN-6m7EKoLXp7PhNCg.text: If there was an option to give this place 10 stars I would but since there isn't, we will just have to settle for 5 stars and the most exceptional review I could give. If you are a foodie and love exploring this place is a must! Like a top 5 places to visit- it's that good!!!   I live in California and have been making trips to AZ for the last two years and had wished I went here sooner. The establishment is huge so even on a Saturday night around 7pm we only had a 15 minute wait for a party of 3! I know jaw dropping right???   Then the food- amaze balls!! There wasn't one thing I was disappointed with, well actually there was. The only disappointment was that I couldn't eat more! There were so many more things I wanted to try but I could barely finish my meal! We had the mozzarella bites as a starter and they were light not oily or over fried! I'm not a huge fan of marinara sauce but theirs was the bomb! I had a cup of lobster bisque- heaven!! For the main course I had the shrimp creole with grits and the worst thing was that I couldn't finish it- but what I did eat was A+++ Now just because I was full and probably ate the equivalent of 3 days calories here was no way I was leaving and not getting dessert- creme brulee it was, to go but still was delicious!   Service was on point and I will make sure anytime I go back to AZ to stop here again because there are so many options on the menu I need to try more things!! Oh and the drink menu is also amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Creole &amp; Grits

_3O-KCUNcuw2MMczwCulXA.text: Wanted to give Pappadeaux another go around. Once again the service is so friendly, attentive and efficient. The decor is creole comfortable! Love the fire lanterns that remind you of a turn of the century New Orleans street lamp. Our server was very knowledgeable and she was excited to share her favorites/inputs. Everyone in our group loved their food but for the sake of time I'll just stick with mine. I decided on the crab cake appetizer as an entree and it was incredible. Three large crab cakes I could only tackle two of them. The fresh crab inside was huge chunks with a fantastic seasoning on the outside. The sauce they had underneath them had a subtle zest to it, just enough to compliment the fresh crab. I added a loaded baked potato and it was gigantic filled with heart clogging deliciousness. Definitely going to be a second meal tomorrow!

q5u-TxN9jxVcNyhwpRlzDQ.text: For a chain restaurant, I'm always amazed how good the Cajun seafood is.  The menu is extensive and the food is always fresh and delicious.  I love the naked fish options with dirty rice.  If you are out in the West valley this is a great spot to eat. I have some customers out here, so I like coming here.

_aC999xNX8L3hFJ1r6HePw.text: Pasta Mardi Gras, shared + 2 Flor de Canas w lime.  This is an excellent shareable!  Husband and kids like ordering the Alligator.   Tip: Party of 2 on a special occasion day (i.e. Valentines, Mother's Day, etc), try sitting at the full service bar.  Husband and I went for Valentines Day & waited at the bar for our table.  We ended up sitting there so long, we decide to order dinner and it was just fine.

o9lagRsZp83s0epuBV7Bug.text: It's very very cold in the building And I like the cold If I were you I'd bring a jacket just in case

4m4csssmuQyPwQefGIzp3w.text: We had a 13:30 lunch and were seated immediately. Ordered our drinks and waited for the Bread to be served. 15 minutes I contacted a different Server and received the Bread/Butter within a minutes. Food was cold, sent it back. Received the food again took over 15 minutes. The food was warm, but still had the half eaten Shrimp,(1), still on my plate as well as my Guest's food was returned with the piece of Bread that she had taken a bite from. The Beans that were supposed to be cold, were now warm. Obviously the staff didn't re-create our plates, just reheated them. The Manager came to our table and offered a Desert, we declined. The Manager's attire appeared She had just finished working in the Backyard.  Hopefully, Pappadeaux will use this review for future Training purposes.

CS5BzN_ELte9Bf_bn5b1og.text: Took my wife for her birthday to Pappadeaux.  Was told a 45-1hr wait.  She wanted it so I said ok.  1hr and a half in , I asked to see what's up.  Was treated rudely by one of the hostesses.  Considering we were 45 bucks on 3 drinks in I waited.  Not sure if the manager cares or not but don't come here if you don't like to wait.  Food was a solid B.  Service once we sat was good.  But the hostess and wait killer it.  If it's a 2 hour wait say it and I'm   Went back to Pappadeaux.   It's was wonderful this time.  From service to food.  Much better.  I appreciate the great service and polite hostess.  Will be back for sure.

ColKHIUcFiDUL2gcdbpoTw.text: Service was poor. We waited for quite a while and were approached by a server who asked if we had been helped. Advised we had not, so she apologized and took our drink order. Her name was different than that was written on the check. The waitress we were originally supposed to have brought out the drinks. She did not inspire confidence in her knowledge of the menu when we asked questions. Waitress did not seem to have a sense of urgency at all. Food was ok, but the service made the experience less pleasurable. Had the live Maine lobster. Server asked if we wanted dessert and we ordered. First two things requested were sold out. She said maybe she should start by telling us what they did have, lol. She then went and got the dessert tray and went through the available options. I've been here many times and more and more so the food and service have been hit or miss.   UPDATE: Received a response from Felicia with Pappadeaux. Said she wanted to make it up to me. I responded and she never got back to me. It's too bad. I really wanted to give it another shot as she requested. Disappointed further...

kbSPAgI5ItRmYuftt3c-Cw.text: This is by far the very best seafood restaurant in Phx Az! They do offer other non seafood dishes for those not into seafood. I have been here a handful of times and it has never disappointed me. The atmosphere, the waiters and food bring this place to perfection.   Chowder is a must and the calamari appetizer plate is my favorite. But the Caribbean lobster has topped all the dishes I have tried!!   The plates are huge so come here hungry! And yes the prices are not low but well worth it for the quality of food.  This place is perfect for anniversaries, dates and birthday celebrations.   Ohhh!! Let's not forget the dessert menu!! They bring over every option the have so you can decide.  My favorite is the cheesecake but the cream brulee is equally good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yVFNm89uUv2QHnH4Vf1KVw.text: My husband wanted to take me out for a really nice lunch that isn't too far from our house so he picked Pappadeaux since I enjoy eating fish. I went with the Creole Caesar salad with blackened Salmon.  Short story - is that for $24.95 I expect a Caesar salad to be made with  Properly Made Caesar Dressing and I didn't receive that.  Long story-   In reasonable time I received a large salad with a generously sized piece of salmon. It wasn't very blackened but was prepared reasonably well. My issue here is that the house made Caesar Dressing was a loose white almost tasteless dressing that isn't Caesar Dressing. I'll be honest and mention that when I pay $24.95 for a Caesar salad I expect a properly made Caesar Dressing made with anchovies, garlic, an egg yolk, oil, lemon, Worcestershire (some wine vinegar) parmesan and black pepper. Those ingredients make a delicious flavorful dressing that I was expecting instead of all that I received a very bland almost tasteless dressing on my salad. I think guest should be warned that Pappadeaux does not serve Caesar Dressing and serves something else for a Caesar style salad. The other part of the salad that I don't understand was the creole roasted tomatoes. I received delicious roasted tomatoes but noting on them made them creole...they were just roasted. Other than all that the salad was good.....not great like it should be but good. Not bad enough to complain or send back. It was a nice big salad with a nice piece of fish. It just wasn't a Caesar salad....just Caesar style.  All went well with the Grilled Shrimp and Andouille Sausage. That is a great dish and is a great value for $18.95.  I was hoping I'd love the Key Lime Pie. For my taste and my husband's taste it lacked lime flavor and had an off-putting jello-ee texture. (but that is our taste and not everyones) However the crust was delicious and spiced nicely.  Our waiter was as sweet as can be and seemed very well trained on the menu.  A-ok means A-ok it doesn't mean to avoid it means basically good but I have some reservations.

JeV0pDmITBc_NRRidLaX-g.text: Fan of Pappadeaux's for nearly two decades since we moved to Phx in 97'. Been around the globe numerous times, eaten at some amazing places, but PPD's is absolutely a must go to, in the Phx area. Please soak up the other reviews as many here put great verbiage and flavor into their reviews so I won't do that here in duplicity.   It's the restaurant my wife and I will travel to as a sure-win, delicious, always busy, always friendly and palate pleasing to the max location! It's now our interim stop from Tucson to Flagstaff every 3 months... Never, in two decades have I walked out with a dissatisfied meal, no matter the party size I've brought in. They do it right, they're attentive, the food is perfect and realistically, priced right. Can you identify another area to get excellent alligator - in the desert?? See my point?! I'm also a fan of their Blackened Catfish and even their scallops are tasty. The crab and lobster are always on point and your drinks never seem to get to the bottom of the glass because the drink fairies are always floating around eyeballing your tables.   For any and I mean ANY negative reviews on here, I seriously question if they properly or adult communicated the issue or they're just beyond too darn picky...LOL.  Zero complaints. Love it. You will too!  Cheers.

4HDI4IY7AWTHz3GBBidu5Q.text: Great food. Great portions. I always get the fried fish. My husband gets various things. Today he got a seafood salad. Our server tonight was Wyatt and he made our experience so amazing! The only bummer about this place is that it is about 400 miles from home.

qFyhxdW_LqWDpKKMaruk7w.text: Ron was our Server and he did an excellent job!  When we wanted the music turned down, he got it done.  He kept us fed and with just the perfect balance of attentive and non invasive.  Food was to perfection too.  Lobster, oysters, crab legs, shrimp cocktail, cheese cake, or do cake, martini's, wine, we ate it all!  Great job Pappadeaux's.  See ya again for the next celebration meal.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster, oh yea!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our Server, Ron, was the best!

8PBSIoLl_OGXjpuaTXCmGg.text: In the mood for some Cajun food? Looking for a fun place for a "cheat day"? Then Pappadeaux is the place to be!    To start the restaurant is HUGE!!!  And when a place is this huge and still packed (there was an hour wait...thank goodness we had a reservation!) then you know that there has to be something special to it.  And considering there aren't that many places here in the Valley to get authentic Cajun cuisine, this makes it all the more special to check out.  And boy...did we indulge! Here's what we had:  Appetizer: Alligator bites - breaded, fried and incredibly tender. Comes with a cajun dipping sauce that I wanted to smother everything in. This was my first time trying alligator, and based on this experience, I am officially a fan.  Second course: 2 soups (because one was clearly not enough, lol). We had the Gumbo and the Lobster Bisque. The gumbo was good, but the lobster bisque was clearly the winner in this battle. It was creamy, had nice chunks of lobster....would definitely order this again.  Main course: Redfish with lemon caper sauce. The fish came out spice rubbed and ready for a good time. It was cooked perfectly, and the lemon caper sauce was seriously kiss the chef good. We demolished this.  Dessert: Banana pudding - this isn't something I'd normally order, but the waitress recommended it so we gave it a shot. The pudding was so light, had chunks of banana and something else delicious inside of it. It was a great way to top off an already amazingly indulgent meal.  To wrap it up: eat here. You won't regret it ;)

MD8HCXABDLOJZOZpdViAEg.text: Love this place consistent great food family came from out of town and just thought everything was wonderful

bvN9VMSSrjBgKFEcdHbQ9A.text: Absolutely one of the best meals I've had in years.  Incredible friendly service from Amanda with very diligent and professional follow up by Christy the manager. Understanding of food allergies and just the nicest folks you'll ever meet.  5 Stars from start to end.  Thank you.

nw4gVHhfvsNi38Eb-kEqyg.text: Love this place, have had many lunch meetings and family and friends gatherings here for years but gotta say this place has lost its finesse.  Food has lost its personal touch in regards to presentation, flavor, customer service and the obvious the cleanliness of the restaurant.  My advise to management is to take the time to turn on all the lights and move the tables and chairs and really clean the floors.  Your counters, your trims, the fixtures and frames on the walls are dusty and dirty.    Very disappointed how much this place has fallen.  I would have my business meetings during the week and family and friend gatherings here all the time on the weekends but not the case with all the bad experiences I have had these last few visits.    Sorry but your prices are not worth my return, also can you please tell your staff everyone should buss tables.  If your heading to the kitchen take something with you.  How can you encourage me and my guest to have dessert and coffee when I have dirty dishes sitting in front of me for 15-20 minutes after we have finished our dinner...    Sorry but you are not what you use to be.  Still regret not sending my King Crab back to the kitchen when I have to pay 65 plus or so for crab that is over cooked and chews like a piece of gum before even being able to swallow, by the way we had three king crab orders at our table that night and all were over cooked.    I recommend the GM takes a good look around and really take a step back and fix these issues.

5vlXMOf5dCIn9Q_KT54dJQ.text: This place is okay but I just hated the fact that you had to pay 60$ for a crab legs meal and all the other meals have no crab legs they have crab chunks like think about other people's orders

XLewNNnf4Y2NXoFMrH_G2Q.text: This is my favorite date night spot.  The seafood is killer!  The ambiance is nice for a romantic night or just to enjoy your meal.

3eVLOrlrkuV_8DuwDFrn1A.text: My boyfriend and I come here about once a month and we have never been anything less than ecstatic about the food and service. Tonight was a whole new level. Our server Rebecca and the manager Ciara were absolutely too notch. I rarely find such accommodating and 4 star service, so this was unbelievable. Not that we had any doubt, but we will be back every month for a very long time. Would not hesitate to recommend this place for special events or work meetings either.

xXcTS2uhyHqCoZPXwdx2sg.text: They don't have one in Michigan so I was excited to stop here in Arizona.  The food way good but had just a bit too much seasoning. The lobster bisque was good, but not the best I've ever had. The spinach artichoke dip was good as well.  I'd like to come back just not sure when.

5GMKsJi40Ae4W2XDlj-lqA.text: Really enjoyed this restaurant.  It is easy to access and has an adorable ambiance both inside and out.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The food was delicious.  Really enjoyed my shrimp and grits.  My son enjoyed his plate of fried seafood and we both had plenty to bring home leftovers.  They offer kids meals and my friend enjoyed the gumbo.  There was only one negative to the trip.  My daughter (12 years old) accidentally stepped out of the car with her reusable coffee cup from home.  By the time we realized we were already walking in and it is HOT (getting to be summer in AZ) and we were all hungry.  We told her she shouldn't do that but proceeded into the restaurant.  At the hostess stand we were informed that she couldn't have the cup and that they could throw it away.  Instead of walking all the way back to the car or having the cup tossed she went outside and placed it on an out of the way table, to be picked up on the way out of the restaurant.  We weren't seated but a few minutes and an employee holding the cup walked to our table.  We were told the cup can't be out on the table because it might be thrown away (this was a risk we were willing to take).  At this point we walked it all the way back to the car.  It was just a silly damper on an otherwise very enjoyable meal and experience.  The cup could have been placed in my purse for goodness sake.

TxxVshYPNVAS6Vq08q9XdQ.text: Gorgeous restaurant fantastic Cajun style food ! Lobster crawfish oysters alligator pasta and salad for the weak... love the atmosphere  and decor .. service is always on point . Calamari check seafood check service check and decor check ... wow
