M5Sg9Llvirui5DajneOSWg.text: Honestly disappointed by my experience at Pappadeaux for the amount you would be spending here the customer experience is exceptionally terrible. The food is good but you can find food that taste a lot better and cheaper else where. The main attraction for myself is for the experience which I was thoroughly let down by their staff. I will never be going back to to this restaurant again for over priced food with complimentary crappy customer service.

m7xF7n-9RaROoxLTRbrewg.text: Amazing food. A little pricey but if you like Cajun try it out. The andouille sausage and grilled shrimp is one of my favorites.

ljtf0cKCX6Y7rupG4DIWkQ.text: It has been a while since I have eaten here but it was a great lunch. I had the grilled seafood brochettes they were excellent:) OMg there were a lot to eat also. Would definitely recommend this. Good service from Adrian also.

gNQ6yXt3Mzx9iseHvo6jCQ.text: This review is long overdue but much needed. I would like to start off by saying this was by far the worst Pappadeaux that I have dined at this far and I've been to quite a few of them across the United States. This past Mother's Day my family (party of 16) wanted to attend Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen for the special occasion. From the beginning I didn't have a good feeling because we were unable to make a reservation. We were told to just show up. So we showed up and ended up waiting for an hour and fifty three minutes. They did have people walking around serving drink, sausage, and cheese which was cool but still didn't make up for the almost 2 hour wait. Anyway, we finally get seated and are greeted by our waiter right away who was really nice by the way. Everyone gets their drinks and being that we were such a large party we needed extra time to decide on an order. Eventually everyone is ready but we ended up waiting another 20 minutes before anyone came back. So everyone finally places their orders and the food actually comes in a decent amount of time but it was terrible. My husband and I both ordered the seafood platter. Mine was burnt and it tasted like my husbands had been deep fried in old grease. My moms salmon was ordered well done and was frozen in the middle. My mother-in-law had to send her po-boy back because it was burnt. I understand that it was very busy this day but I don't feel like the lack of food preparation was acceptable, especially for the price that we ended up paying for everyone to eat. Needless to say my family and I didn't have a good experience at this Pappadeaux location.   -Ashley

AaezxyFFC0RoS4CFIKB8nw.text: Great place to relax, eat, drink, get some alligator tail....delicious BTW........very nice ambiance!

-7DS2xCnLPYsu7VRqfwmTA.text: Here is my take on this place. Staff is always great and helpful. The food tastes great and always fresh. The happy hour is good, but not a party style happy hour. More subdued happy hour. Good prices but a little more quiet. The restaurant is clean and well kept. Problem I have is the portions continue to get smaller and smaller but the prices never change. I understand market value, but cutting portions into half and keeping the steep price seems a little disingenuous. Really my only issue is the price to portion here. Everything else I love.

QszvZ4X_rxPGHBtyKPJ2yg.text: Second time coming here. Great ambiance, service was good. Food definitely mediocre for the price point. First time had the fried oysters, that was pretty good. Came on a Tuesday and had the fried and blackened alligator for appetizer and the crawfish etouffee. The alligator was well cooked and flavored. The etouffee was very disappointing. There were bits of shell left in the etouffee and the flavor was not great. Not able to get rid of the muddy flavor from the crawfish either. Maybe stick with the fried stuff, although for a nice establishment, just sticking with the fried stuff is sad. I would give it 3.5 stars but no half stars available. Just not enough bang for the buck

VI0XXOVohqaF7mGvmcSw8w.text: Great place to eat seafood.  Very pricey but very good service and food!  When you have an occasion to splurge come to this place!!!

SAiMXtB3u8ZgeOvqYsEicg.text: I didn't post this from a few months ago, but we should have. My wife and I called In reservations and arrived 15 minutes early. We waited an hour and a half after our reservation to be seated. So a total of 1 hour 45 minutes. When we were seated the staff made an extra table close to the restrooms as they were very busy, they then set another table so closely to ours that when I turned around I sat cheek to cheek with the couple that they seated there. They complained,  we complained the other couple was moved and the table remained for the next guests. The second table wasn't moved, Neither of our two groups were accommodated this time and the waiter became noticeably agitated. We gave up, ordered two drink each and waited for our server to return. As we attempted to order appetizers he left our table to attend to a larger group, returned and said" ok, ready for your check"? I was floored. We paid for our drinks, paid  for drinks and apps for the second couple as I was now noticeably agitated, our night was ruined and I didn't want to ruin theirs and we left after speaking to the front desk. We were assured a manager would call but not a peep. So to re-cap we spent $215, no food, no apps, no call from management. We have four children so that time out is special to us. We went back last weekend, same attitude, same service at the bar as last visit. We left before being seated and went to desert ridge. We won't be back any time in the near future.  What's worse is the company I work for routinely has management dinners and we usually get great food and are treated well.   It's shows that the service you receive is based on the amount your parties table is worth.

VFbLfDU0hqRw-4ycPTQoPA.text: Great food and great service.  You cant go wrong here. I usually order the cheese fondue, which is in my opinion one of the best appetizers on the menu.   The crawfish is soooooo good. I love the crawfish etouffee is so delicious.

FM7TTa58SebPNW8XjzcQqg.text: The courtyard here is beautiful, and they pssed cheese and sausage whilw you wait. However, he didn't carry napkins, which was odd. We went to the bar and paid $3.25 for a soda (i also got a cocktail). They charged us again for a soda at the table. I got the redfish, which was delicious,  but the risotto was terrible. It came out cold. It was described as a butternut squash risotto but was really an onion risotto with 2 chunks of squash in it. Terrible and tasteless. It took a loooong time for a single glass of wine, ordered with the meal. Hubby ate his entire wntire appetizer, and still we waited. Marcus told me 3 times it was coming, and still i waited. Then he and the manager had a convo about it in front of 4 tables. And it wasn't comped. Hubby had pasta mardi gras and it was a better value,  loaded with seafood. Overall it was disappointing.

Fl38W-rYFm0sEppOw4u3qQ.text: What can I say? I love this place. When I lived further away, I found myself here only for special occasions. Now that I live 2 miles away, I come here much more often. Lunch, dinner, happy hours... they never disappoint. Food is always delicious. Love the bar area during happy hour. Fun and lively, yet not too raucous... and bartenders are always cool as heck. On wknds, they have live music on the patio, always nice if you like live music, which I do and always appreciate.  Once recently, I mentioned to our server that one of my sides was really salty. I didn't want any comps or new food and told her so- yet she sent her manager over to our table to reassure us with some kind words. In a world that seems to have forgotten good, old fashioned customer service, Pappadeaux knows what's up.

YKGeSZMdugAjSuqe1vAvZA.text: Always a good time at Pappadeaux. You want seafood but wanna spend a little less than Mastro's Ocean Club in Scottsdale? Come here then. The service is always good. I usually get a two pound lobster with sides and their oysters! Yum.

ZQ_aJ4GzeITLf-fi3v-HxA.text: This place is great but the food is extremely expensive. My group went here for a dinner party and it cost us around $2000 worth of food. Anyway, the portions are alright and I loved the crispy alligator plus several types of lobster tails. The only one dish I didn't like was a dish that contains rice, two pieces of sausages, and a baked potato (I think). The sausages were too soft and soggy. They ran out of cheesecakes when I wanted to order. But the creme brulee was good. The prime rib was huge (I mean for that price it better be). The margaritas were great and there were four types of margaritas. I didn't like the Swampthing too much. We ordered like 10 batches of oysters. My favorite was a sea bass dish. The fish was soft and melt in your mouth. It's covered in a creamy and buttery white sauce. The service is great!

U6ozCl49TRIQzzCIQy7--g.text: I got the Caribbean lobster tail and filet mignon and it was my first time trying lobster, that why I figured if I didn't care for the lobster I'd eat the filet. Well the lobster was amazing, so delicious. They filet actually needed more seasoning, so I was glad that I did like the lobster- which I should it's a $50 plate. But it was well worth it. I also got the purple voodoo and that drink was very good too. Can't wait to come back and have the lobster again.

kuTYqbNXVo8uvSgGJWQh5w.text: Always great but prices are getting out of reach. Service for this location seems "Iffy". Sometimes good other times not good. We have frequented at least 10 different Pappas restaurants in Texas and AZ. location. Big fan but the prices are rising and there's no real reason other than padding for more profit margins. Understand all that but it's making it a "No-Go" for a budget minded family.

qMkvXDOExbmAQQXoU3GGNg.text: Great great food. I come to Phoenix every couple weeks for business from La Jolla and still can't believe the seafood here is 10 times better. This place is a jewel.  I also like the AC in the bar is now nice and cold

QBNvqq_fBpcSj6zJzBwzzQ.text: Stopped by here to have a bite as we waited for traffic to subside. I got the salmon, octopus, and shrimp plate. It was good and hit the spot! I think if you're in this area, it's an obvious choice.

WPprL_FQK-zXU9fm_h0eXQ.text: Jalissa was amazing. It was my first date and she made it amazing.  She was quick, amazing, and friendly. The food was great.  If she wasn't our server I'd walk out.

dCatbM7x7HXY7lwTglWkfw.text: This place is a joke. We are a party of 4. The restaurant was half empty. We were told wait time 15 minutes! Almost felt like they didn't want our business. I saw too many employees either standing around doing nothing or running around looking like their heads were cut off. This place very disorganized.  They were out of too many items to boot! The food very salty and overpriced. The plates, too big for  small table for a party of 4. Come on people, this is a sit-down restaurant. I could make better food at home and be comfortable!To top it off we were overcharged for an item that was not ordered. Always check your itemized receipt! This place is a disappointment. Very embarrassing for what was supposed to be a special night for taking the in-laws out for dinner.

ay2BYnlWgXFphrUbi_UQpQ.text: Very nice place to get seafood. Huge restaurant with lots of seating. The food was very good, I had crawfish bisque and the salmon Yvette. The food was served quickly. My waitress was great she was attentive, friendly and talkative. I look forward to visiting again.

6ecjNVi2dXZ8rxACKFJ2bA.text: The best place in Arizona for fresh seafood. I've been to places in Scottsdale and just big prices without the freshness and quality.  This is my top pic for lobster, crab and fish.

8L7orbwTEVVQvSLwvaDwyA.text: Located just off Highway 17, this Pappadeaux's never fails to deliver when I am in town.   Always pleasant staff, I have eaten here in passing for a drink and snack at the bar, for lunch, as well as for dinner. Never a bad experience.   A must have is the Deep Fried Alligator appetizer. Very appetizing and tasty, no off or gamey flavor at all.   Also, the cheese sticks here are the best I have ever had, more like cheese logs. These have the lightest and crispiest fried crust you will ever have.   Other dishes to try are the Crawfish Etouffee as well as the Pasta Mardi Gras.   The only downside at this location is that it can get a little noisy when it gets busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deep Fried Alligator

btQQX-fDmwYm-6sr5rG9Nw.text: I would like to extend a formal apology for not walking into this place sooner. It honestly blew away all my expectations! The food, the atmosphere, and the service were all absolutely wonderful. Our server was Brent and he was fantastic; sweet, quick, and very polite and happy.  It has been a while since I've set foot in this place. Not because of any slight or grievance on my part, but because of a long string of bad luck. This place is not for people looking to save money, but if you're tired of being practically robbed at your local Red Lobster, you might want to give this place a try. Better options on the menu, infinitely better quality, just at a little higher price, but to me the price was worth it. Started with the calamari appetizer. Delish! Extra points for the fried artichoke hearts. Entrees were the Pasta Mardi Gras (for me) and the Scallop & Crab Pappardelle Pasta. Good lord was the Mardi Gras good. Actually grilled shrimp (instead of browned shrimp dowsed in liquid smoke), crawfish (I know it's lazy on my part but I was so happy they had already just put the meat of the crawfish into the dish instead of placed whole ones in; I'm clumsy by nature so I would have made a mess), and andouille sausage (which I've never tried before but found I liked it greatly) all in a marinara creams sauce (my favorite). I highly recommend this dish because I couldn't find one fault (not that I go looking, but the other seafood restaurants near me always manage to somehow magnify their faults when I visit so it's hard not to just expect mistakes). I wish I'd had room for desert because I'm sure it would have been wonderful, but then again it gives me an extra reason to come back. Please don't be scared of the prices because in my mind it's completely worth it due to everything backing the prices up. This is a great place for once in a while special occasion type outings! Especially for people who are fed up with the subpar seafood most places like to tout out of their kitchens!

MgvEIm2nt6cVo1Z3WwC57g.text: I took my son and his girlfriend here one night , it was their first time there.   We were welcomed with smiles, seated and very well taken care of.  There were a couple mishaps, but the server was new, so it was a learning experience.  We each ordered, not knowing how large their plates are.  We ate the appetizer and that was pretty big!  Then the plates came!  They were huge!  We easily got 3 meals out of each one!  I will be going again!

UwsfYUGMdy-htfQamOwt0w.text: Great place to have a great meal, however if you dont like long delays to het in I recommend dining on off peak days or hours as this place is super popular on the weekend evenings.  Everything is super good wait staff is great!

Q4uShs72Ir6nE233m201cQ.text: This was our first time here!    Such great service from Haleigh and Christian!   Best crab cakes ever! !!!

lW24T9TZ9TIda01wEsM4fw.text: Went here for the first time the customer service was great the drinks OUTSTANDING & VERY REFRESHING . Quickly became one of my favorite spots

oEj8jxdX1CMUDqXVukGiTg.text: I don't know how many times I've been here with my family. Obviously I can't have much here because I'm a vegetarian. But oh my goodness. my family rage about this place like nobody's business. Gator to calamari to the steak. But i... I get mashed potatoes and asparagus on the side. Haha

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Because I can :D
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. :D
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My vegetarian dishes

zZeFk1k5Vwgp-xWZKP4qEw.text: Oh my goodness. The alligator appetizer is so good. Probably my favorite menu item! I've tried the frog legs and they were good as well, I haven't had something that I didn't like so far! Friendly staff and prompt service. One of my favorite restaurants.

Uc_NmLRTTbxJIxTfAHqfjQ.text: Returned after was contacted about post .. this time I had a good waitress and the food was great . I ent at lunch time and it was slow no waiting and great lunch specials ..  I will be returning ..  The voo doo drink was BOMB ..

xH2GeY890giQBeymkeDciA.text: The food was very delicious. However, the service was very very slowwww. We sat close to 10 minutes without being acknowledged by our waiter. Finally took our drink order and then took close to another 15 minutes to deliver our iced teas and take our entree order. Checked on us once late in the meal. Which is unfortunate because we did need a few times after our entrees were delivered but were never offered additional service. Empty tables all around us. During our meal a family of 5 was seated next to us. I heard the father say "I can't believe we waited 20 minutes to be seated here when it was open the whole time. Maybe if you 4 hostess girls didn't gather around the podium and chat we would have been seated quicker." This gives you an idea that several customers were unhappy by the service provided by the restaurant employees. The food is delicious. The prices are high. The service is poor. Now it's you that has to decide if it's worth experiencing. As for my husband, mother-in-law, and I....probably won't return.

KhHmmP8e3BA9lujYfkoGyg.text: Came here for my birthday dinner and wasn't disappointed! I have always been a fan of seafood, and they do it right at Pappadeaux.  If you're into oysters I would highly recommend the gulf coast oyster platter on the half shell. So delicious. I could eat those things for breakfast, lunch and dinner for life!  The seafood gumbo was tasty and they didn't skimp on the seafood.  The Pappadeaux Platter was a huge plate of various fried seafood on a bed of french fries. I would have rather have more seafood and less fries, but that's life.   I'll be back to celebrate special occasions.

EAhgOeoV1zKT1RbwGZ4NYw.text: We had a great time there. We went with our kids and it's a great place to get great food where it's not so formal, so if we are a bit loud it wasn't a problem at all. We arrived at a busy time (on a Tuesday night the place was packed - good sign) and had to wait for our food a bit, but the manager came and talked to us to apologize and offer us free deserts. Service in general was great, our waitress was attentive at all times and everyone is nice and smiling. Great food and atmosphere!

CVjpL0Aym10C3MaaX86g3w.text: Went here for happy hour with my girlfriend. Prices weren't bad $5-$10 for items on the happy hour menu. Bar staff was pretty nice and helpful, get there early for a seat, the place fills up pretty quick. We had the orange peel shrimp and the mushroom/cheese fondeaux, one of those (thinking the fondeaux) make us both really sick that night. If we do go back we will definitely be avoiding it.

m9SOscgC6wFxLInVEsMW4Q.text: My son and I decided to give Pappadeaux a try -- had never dined there before.  We had Mia as our server -- she was excellent and so was the food!  Everything came out to ou specification and the food (temperature wise) was hot!  We very much enjoyed our dining experience there!

7cU1ccYSYikxQk9zmxb7Mg.text: hubby & I both gluten free & when asked for the menu the server gave us a 1-page nothing. She said they only serve what's on that menu for GF patrons. I asked about chilean sea bass which was not on the GF menu but based on how it was made it sounded GF already, server said she'd check w/the cook. Came back & said yes, only the cheese sauce would have to be omitted so I ordered it. It came on a bed of broccolini which was overcooked, tough & tasteless. Fish had nothing on it & was also extremely tasteless. Husband ordered scallops & they were bland as well. Price is way too much for what you get. First & last visit.

R--Cnf9q7w_jo23fjMEHvw.text: Absolutely delicious. Worth every dollar I paid! Great service, great environment and absolutely wonderful food. We've wanted to come here for quite a while but just have never been, wish we could've come here sooner! Hands down the best place I've been here in Phoenix.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna with jumbo crab was so breathtakingly amazing

Os0991sou-G_IZLK2AZ29w.text: I'm not usually big on chain restaurants but Pappadeaux's has consistently been good at every location I've been to.  I almost always get the Crawfish Etoufee.  I'm so addicted to that stuff.  I took my husband here for his birthday on our most recent visit and mentioned it was his birthday.  Hubs got to pick out any dessert he wanted, complimentary!  I know a lot of places do this but it was also a full size dessert.  Awesome!

qr2HebYcA98yVw3LgiczGg.text: All I can say is WOW. I love this place from the building and how the lounge area is set up to the food and service. First they have a fire pit outside with lounge chairs and couches so groups can have a nice relaxing time outside and enjoy. I thought that was really awesome. Second the food was sooooo delicious and it comes in large proportions. I couldn't even finish my food and I'm a good eater. The drinks were the best and reasonable pricing also. The most important part was the service because that was A1. I really couldn't say anything bad about this place and that's why they definitely deserve 5 stars. I will definitely be back there every time I go to Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Alligator
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood mixer

RZ4PkicUQI5y1DVEFaTdFg.text: Great food! Go here on special occasions as it is a bit expensive but worth every penny. Servers are friendly and well rehearsed on the menu.

JUWxy-GOqaJzLXq7DBwWrQ.text: I have been waiting a long time to eat at Pappadeaux so forgive me if I get carried away. In town for some Harley riders fun so we knew this place was going to get crazy crowded, like Vegas Buffett crowded. So as soon as we arrived on Friday we decided to hit this seafood sanctuary early afternoon. YES best decision EVER. We heard the wait time for the whole weekend ended up being over an hour and a half, not for us, not for the trio that has been waiting on this moment since 2012. After we gave them our phone number so they can text us when our table was ready, we walked around to find a seat to wait and as soon as we sat down DING..... The doorbell to foodie heaven rang, literally a 2 minute wait. Okay so now we're headed to our table and I'm scoping the place out left to right up and down all around, this place is HUGE. Fun decorations, big window to see the chefs in action, lobsters in tank, dessert trays, bar popping, patio popping, plates piled with fish, waiters trying to keep a fast pace through the crowd, and lots of happy people. The drinks are fruity and strong, bread n butter on point. Their menu is extensive so it took us awhile to order. I ended up with the seafood platter, hubby had catfish fillets, my ride or die girl had the salmon. People talk about how pricey this place is BUT the portion  and the freshness of the seafood was stellar. We all had enough food left over for another meal. The lump crab cake is just that lump crab delicious. Stuffed crab was perfection. Fish was fried just right and the dirty rice was excellent. I can't wait to return next year same time same place, we will be there because I was checking out the king crab legs and they are now on my radar.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hurricane in one hand bread in the other....
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood platter a pound of dirty rice under all that
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We have finally made it......

Bc1K-o7aUAgNxOSijcLEJg.text: This was a very good place the food was awesome and very good I would love to keep going back but I don't have the money super good eating there if I become rich I will always be there

lR8KVLU3IwV4xJfVN5qvSQ.text: Very loud and noisy restaurant, i do not recommend it.I went there December 8th for my birthday dinner it was only 3 of us. it took almost 2 hours to just have  dinner , we hardly saw our waitress she was gone most of the time ,very very very bad service . it ruined my birthday plans for the rest of the evening Way overpriced. I do not see the value in this restaurant. Very loud and noisy restaurant. 2 stars for the spinach dip.

VKw7iMmtA7fd7Ic2E-fuuQ.text: Love this place for fish!  I enjoy flying though Houston airport just so I can eat at their restaurant during lay overs.  It is very pricey $$$$!!!  I always get a great meal, but not everything is a "Wow" on the menu.  Friends from time to time get a dish there that is at best - average.  I find that if you get their specials, or fish with a sauce topped with crab and shrimp or crawfish you can't go wrong.  The Calamari has always been really good too!

QusmQdKUhLJ_Fs7OxkqVKQ.text: Great food. Great service. Started with the wonderful Blue piont oysters. I had the Seafood platter, and it was the first time I ever had anything served with fries where I couldn't care less about the fries. Everything was lightly battered and not at all greasy. Husband had the Pasta Mardi Gras, and it too was amazing. We topped off the night with house made banana pudding and pralines cheese cake (both free for our birthdays). Stuffed and happy to have leftovers.  Oh, and they also give a Veteran discount with ID.

OYmQclrmCBbb4PN9nxrmUw.text: Amazing food. Amazing atmosphere. Great service! Our server, Mia, was fantastic! Recommended a dish for my son and she was dead on. The crawfish combo dinner was delicious and spicy. The greek salad is made fresh at your tableside. The praline cheesecake was really good.  I would definitely come back to this restaurant and would recommend this if you've never had Cajun food. :)

wApe54Jj0sBisWjOsce4kQ.text: My 2nd favorite happy hour in the valley .  Mix Seafood grilled  skewers over dirty rice.  Is a must try so much food

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My new favorite cocktail raspberry peach fizz.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skewed mix grill seafood and dirty rice

89q3vEPtgahswmx3ykxIlw.text: Love, love, love Pappadeux.  Only my second time here and both were on Fridays to connect with friends. Both times we had EXCELLENT service with fantastic and attentive wait staff. I don't mind paying a bit more when I get quality food with great service. We enjoyed music on the patio with a pretty cool local singer/songwriter.  The vibe of Pappadeux is unique with families, couples, and large groups all appearing to have a good time.  I had grilled shrimp with sauteed green beans and my. oh. my... was my mouth was happy!   Last note:  I never have dessert. The dessert tray was toO unique to give it a pass. The King cake cheesecake was to die for.  you should order that!

5xhSpP5054KAXeqPFaObLw.text: I love the atmosphere here!  I'm not a big cajun fan, so I did not give it 5 stars.  I do wish they had more offerings for food other than cajun.  We would go here more often if they did.

kz-eUnuw3K9_HkyqaOVp2g.text: We went here for happy hour and enjoyed the fried alligator and great sauce. The shoestring potatoes on the side were crispy. I've been trying to eat healthy when I go out, so based on the description on the menu, I ordered the Greek salad and added crab for an extra $7.99 for my entree. Although it says "prepared at your table," they brought it to me already dressed, the lettuce was literally drowning in the vinaigrette and limp, and there was maybe a tablespoon or two of small pieces of crab on top. The salad had no cucumbers, but had green peppers, which is unusual. A Greek salad always has cucumbers. As I stirred my salad around so I could get a little bit of everything in each bite, the crab basically disappeared and I only saw a couple of Mediterranean olives. The feta was on the light side also. I mentioned to my waiter that my salad was not what I expected and a manager showed up a little while later. I told her my concerns, including paying $8 bucks for the little bit of crab, and very few olives or feta cheese. She told me the salad had 2 ounces of crab and three olives. Excuse me, but if you figure that out, they are charging $64 a pound for crab!! It wasn't even lump crab, and basically disappeared into the salad so I felt like I didn't get any. The green salad was $12.95 and adding the  $7.99, I could've gotten a full entree for that price ($21). She did offer to bring more olives and feta, which I accepted - however, the $8 worth of crab that I couldn't even taste was my biggest complaint. I was very disappointed in my meal, felt it was overpriced, and was still hungry when we left.

K7bU6jt74FbLA_U0ualOQw.text: Love this place! My server was Matt and he was awesome. I asked him for his recommendations and he knew them right off the bat.  He has many favorites as you really can't go wrong but I decided to go with his top picks: the lobster bisque to start with and the Jumbo Shrimp brochette with dirty rice. SO GOOD. When I got there, they had just opened 30 mins prior and already they were pretty busy. The place is clean, excellent food, and marvelous service. I'm definitely making this my go-to spot for my monthly business visits. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From my seat :) I love this place. Awesome service (Thanks Matt! ) And clean bathrooms which is important to me.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Lobster Bisque with generous chunks of lobster. YUM!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Jumbo Shrimp Brochette with dirty rice. MARVELOUS.

U2bc-d5V09BxgOUNugjeaw.text: This place is amazing I had the sampler and it had too many things. I loved it and after ordering that I really got to try a lot of things including alligator which I had never tried before. The staff is super nice and very helpful.  I give it a full 5 stars and recommend this place for when you want to impress someone. The prices are very good for the food your eating. 30 per person.

Uv2GbKIJs1ON12sm3IfcQQ.text: What an interesting concept...  Seafood in the desert.  Nevertheless, it was very good and probably the best meal that I had in Phoenix.  The things that we ordered:  1. Oysters 2. Gumbo 3. Ahi Tuna 4. Fried Alligator  5. Calamari  The food was delicious. Although I was hesitant, the alligator was quite delightful - It was surprisingly flavorful and tender.  The servers were very accommodating and it was an great atmosphere.  I'd definitely come back here.

t104UcCCfC3ZQoBDagy4lg.text: Yes, I'm once again a fan of Pappadeaux.  Sweet hubby picked up some to-go a couple weekends ago and they are back in the game.  The food was MUCH better than our miserable experience in March.  He enjoyed the shrimp po' boy and seafood gumbo (he kindly gave me some of the gumbo, including a gigantic oyster, which I thoroughly enjoyed).  I ordered the lunch Blackened Catfish with Shrimp Etouffee Pistolette and Dirty Rice.  The catfish was sweet and tender and oh so yummy.  The Shrimp Etouffee Pistolette was a dish of their outstanding Etouffee with a hunk of French bread so decadent, I think they actually dunked it in melted butter and then deep fried it (Texas State Fair anyone?).  I saved some of the Etouffee and cooked plain wild rice to go with it for lunch on Monday.  The dirty rice was once again delicious, so happy they use ground chicken livers, as it should be.

3PnZeTU8S5_JUWkd8Y3CnA.text: My first time at a cajun seafood kitchen and let me tell you it was great.  I wasn't so sure how the whole experience would go since I don't usually eat fish and I haven't had a lot of experience with cajun food either.  But my hesitation quickly slipped away as the ambiance of the restaurant engulfed me.  This is a fun place.  It was a busy night and so we had cocktails and appetizers on the patio--great patio!  As our table came available, we were escorted inside to nice location by the window.  (I love tables with a view.)  Our waiter was very helpful with the selections explaining in detail which dishes would suit our individual tastes. Nice variety of dishes on the menu.  My ceasar salad was was as nice complement to the shrimp etouffee and dirty rice.  Everything was spiced just right and the favors were just watering.  Our waiter checked back on us periodically, just enough to keep in touch but not be a bother.  He was attentive and concerned that his dinner suggestions met with our approval--they did.  He was very good and I wish I could remember his name, to give him a proper shout out.   Needless to say, I'll be back next time I'm in Phoenix---Love you, Pappadeaux's!

r-7NJRyio0O6ovu6RxtDIg.text: I hope this was an isolated incident, because I really love Pappadeaux's.  It's not someplace I go regularly, rather reserved for special occasions. It's a little on the pricey side but certainly in line with the usual value they offer. The food, service and ambiance have always been top-notch and I've been saying for weeks now that it's where I wanted to go for my birthday dinner.   Despite the fact that they're a chain (huge in Texas and elsewhere, but only 1 single location in Phoenix), I feel like they operate like an indie and get it right on most fronts.  My favorite dish is the Crawfish Platter (a ginormous platter piled high with authentic dirty rice in the middle, flanked by breaded, fried crawfish on one side and thick, savory crawfish etouffee on the other side).  Last night's birthday dinner was unfortunately an absolute bust.  I was excited to show my boyfriend the amazing wonder of Pappadeaux's, as he'd never been there before and I'd been talking it up for weeks.  We were seated right away (which was atypical because they're always packed), but we did get an annoying end table right on the corner so there were constantly people pushing past us and bumping into my chair.  Whatever, luck of the draw, and I was happy to be seated right away.  Our server Erich came over and took our drink order.  I ordered a Coke and water.  I got Diet Coke, which tastes like poison.  Waited a few minutes trying to flag him down (admittedly this guy had at least 2 other tables he was waiting on) and I pointed that out to him and he launched into some weird back and forth about how it should be Coke.  You're tellin' me buddy, that's WHAT I ordered.  He took it away and a different server brought me a regular Coke with a smile.  Very nice.  Thank you.  Then Erich returned and babbled awkwardly about the mishap. It's fine. This happens a lot. Most people drink Diet Poison - I get it.   He took our orders and said he'd be back with some bread.  The bread and butter was dropped off pretty quickly, which is when we realized we had no set-ups.  It's kinda hard to spread butter on your bread without a knife.   We waited a few more minutes looking for him to flag him down again.  He grabbed set-ups for us and said something about "I wish we could assure that all tables could have set-ups when they're bussed but that's nearly impossible..."  Ok, whatever, I just want utensils and a napkin.  Thank you.  The food this time was OK.  Normally it's stellar. Maybe I was already annoyed by what I considered "Strike 1" and "Strike 2".  Both crawfish entrees were great.  The dirty rice was definitely subpar --undercooked and very dried out/chewy.   Erich asked us if we needed anything. I asked for an extra tartar sauce and a spoon for my etouffee.  He brought them right over.  At that point, at the beginning of the meal my Coke was still full. Like most people, I drank it intermittently while I chewed and ate and it was soon gone, but I still had half a plate of food to eat.  No sign of Erich.  No Coke in my glass. So I just continued eating and finished my plate.    At the end of the meal, Erich re-appeared and asked if we needed anything.  My other half motioned at my glass but at that point my food was gone and I just wanted to leave.  Erich then realized that maybe I wanted a refill and asked if I did. I said don't worry about it and asked for the check.  Then we waited some more.  The check came and I swear to you the fastest thing I saw the waiter do all night was process the check and get us out of there.  What bugged me was that I could see many other tables around us being served and having a great time with their servers, lots of smiles, hospitality and ambiance. I felt like we got the shaft.  I have to say that in the past I've always had impeccable service, amazingly fresh food and a top-notch experience at Pappadeaux's.  Perhaps this was an off night.  Perhaps Erich had too many tables.  Perhaps we shouldn't have even left him 10% gratuity.  Three dings on service, one on food and one on the crappy table.  I'll have to think long and hard before spending my money there again.

3p8msqfimS1s_s7S5yJg6w.text: We try to avoid chains when we travel but there were very few restaurants in the vicinity of our hotel except this one. We were well pleased with the food and the service of this place. It had the feel of a mom and pop and we had a good waiter. We had shrimp and fish dishes that were very good.

IU4U1AVy2cB3D1M__I8FHQ.text: This is absolutely the best place for fresh lobster/seafood. I was able to pick out the lobster I wanted from the tank and it was served fresh with butter and asparagus. The service was incredible and made for a great date. I will be going again soon I hope.

vuWLUI36N9ptta6UTRmT-g.text: Been here several times and never dissapointed!!!! Foods great, service is amazing!! Wait time can suck but worth the wait

LGIzWHXNGI1Ydw1H6ihTNw.text: Come on! Who doesn't love this place?! The best seafood from down south Cajun style or not, you cannot beat this menu! I know it's a little pricey, but the food is always super fresh and delicious. A great place to go for a nice broiled lobster! The specialty drinks are yummy.

U4LqK7DaSxzI240LN8kkjw.text: New Year's EVE - we arrived @ 4 PM.    The waitress was a fly we wanted to get rid of.   It made the dinner most unpleasant.  I understand they want to turn the tables - but don't be a gnat.   Several times we ignored her.     The clam chowder hadn't been cooked enough.  The potatoes were not cooked.  It seemed like they had been added as an after thought.    The short well drink of gin/tonic came to almost $7 a piece.   REALLY? On New Year's I always give a 50% tip.   Not this year.   It was quite disappointing - from several servers outside smoking to the icky waitress.    TOO BAD!

cDuZV4R7zBo2ggObMZ-YQg.text: We came and they were out of crawfish on the last day, but it's okay I'm not mad. However, another customer and I did agree at they need bigger TV screens.

8flq6wXLD9zMFkeQ_iat8A.text: Flavorful dishes!!!! Everything from their WATERMELON DRINK to the DIRTY RICE are delicious! It is a family owned and operated restaurant meaning even the trucks that deliver the seafood are employed by Pappadeaux!!!! Definitely try their BANANA PUDDING served in a mason jar!!!!!!!!! One of our favorites!!!!

tPnrrXSZ_t7DY0cYn3r45w.text: My favorite place in az as of yet ... I've never had anything I don't like ... The whole menu is great & drinks are just as yummy

JxpZ1QW1cfqYwSK_luOLZw.text: I love this restaurant no matter what location. We had Justin as our server Sat night. He was informative, hospitable and very accommodating. The mussels, gumbo, and lobsters were cooked perfectly. The bread pudding was delicious.  I wish we had one closer to Chandler.

P-cO5DfmrkYy7LJ39Zo0wg.text: Not impressed. I waited years to go here, heard great things. The restaurant was too packed. Very loud. Had to shout to have a conversation. Food wasn't great. After spending $110 the kids meal was the best thing

VbTkFl7AsqLpEqQlxsHT3Q.text: My favorite place to go! They have got a large variety. I love their oysters I really enjoy the atmosphere...

7zZ83vhE2OV0bjD6XLu3Ig.text: Had such a great time and meal, I would recommend Pappadeaux  for sea food. So many great choices, crawfish, frog legs, alligator, oyster . The Manager "Dawson" was awesome dealing with my family. It will be a dinner experience we will talk about forever. Can't wait for our next trip there for dinner, I just wish it wasn't so far from us (about an hour). Many thanks to Dawson and our server for an enjoyable experience.

6yq9aXhaqhEI0aHI9wpabA.text: Second time eating here and each time has been outstanding! Fantastic service, top notch food. Happy hour offers nice range of foods to choose from and they're all excellent. Alligator was great, shrimp and the mini fondeaux (sp) was all amazing. Will be back as often as time and my wallet allows!

QgHNbpDmtkrUETuXl-2lxw.text: Have been going to Pappaduex's off and on for awhile now.  Seems like I go through spurts where I wind up there several times in a row then not going back for what seems like a year.  That said, this chain is consistently good.  The service is always good, some times better than others but never bad.   It is hard to find good creole and/or cajun food here and while this may not be considered authentic, it is good.  The alligator is lip smackin' good. The atmosphere is somewhat lacking as the acoustics make conversation almost impossible.  Not a good place for a romantic meal, but a good place to have fun with friends.

F0iqeEM8PjOWIm1GsV-Plw.text: Loved their food but their service sucked! She acted like she was doing us a favor. Paid $10 a shot for Patron n I asked for another n she rolled her eyes! Then I had to go to the bar for salt n pepper shakers. SMH

asMf8LMcm9fW30CNEmpHIQ.text: This place is pretty great. It's a bit pricey, but from what I tasted, you get what you pay for. I had a "alex-something" dish, and it was amazing. The menu is huge, and if even half of it tastes as good as what I had, then I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. I will be back.

D78zXESmxyaVfJoEWxsmcg.text: Great seafood - Blue Point oysters are so fresh and you don't want to miss. The only reason I did not give a 5 star rating is ... it is pretty loud and the price range is high. The quality of the service is not consistent - either you get a super good server or lazy one. Overall, I always go home happy after visiting there :)

eS99JJi9GhTXj8VKGow7_g.text: We tried to make reservations about an hour ahead of time but they were booked up for reservations.  But not all tables can have a reservation.  So we decided to just go anyway and were seated right away.  The place is huge and has more tables than I could count.  The bar area is also very large with many booths and tables.  The menu had so many choices it was hard to decide.  So many cajun dishes too.  Our appetizer was shrimp cocktail.  It came with 9 shrimp instead of the usual 6 served at most places.  The cocktail sauce had a half teaspoon of straight horseradish sauce for those who may want to kick it up a bit.  We prefer less kick and dipped around the sauce.  It was a great way to start the meal.  My wife and I split a small order of fried shrimp (8). It was served already split in separate plates which was nice. The shrimp were butterflied, light and crispy, delicious.  She also ordered the stuffed shrimp and a baked potato loaded.  The shrimp were rolled in a rich crab stuffing which was seasoned perfectly.  The baked potato was huge, hot and smothered with all kinds of goodies (butter, sour cream, bacon, chives, celery).  She ordered the smaller portion that came with two stuffed shrimp.  If you get an appetizer this is the size you should get, more than she could eat and she loved every bite.   I ordered the Shrimp Creole.  It came with a side of cheese grits with andouille mixed in.  The creole was not too spicy like a lot of places.  The sauce was full of veggies and chunks of tomato.  It was outstanding and worthy of a repeat order.   My wife had a frozen margarita blended and sipped on it throughout dinner.  I had Cabernet Sauvignon by the glass.  Our server was sweet, spunky, and very attentive.  She was enthusiastic and genuinely wanted us to enjoy ourselves and our dinner.  We both probably ate too much but everything was cooked and seasoned so well, it was almost impossible to stop eating.  A truly memorable meal which these days is hard to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Creole with cheese Andouille grits

SYxVZ8tkB_05nY0k9n5wgg.text: Food was great . we went on a Thursday night. Staff was great too. Chowder was amazing .

Ia16tyEK6D9GWfsnveBICg.text: This place has the best food! It is a little pricey but so worth it! I recommend this place to all those who love sea food! They have a variety of dishes to choose from.

0XpbewlKoXbsEbFLKAg5Ww.text: An old favorite. Love the boudin and the wide selection of fish and Cajun-style entrees. A bit heavy on fried food... and so I can't get my wife to return. But I would on a business lunch or dinner.

2rYnHH-BbjTriuf2sNsbEw.text: It was our first time dining at this restaurant, and we will definitely be back! The atmosphere was fantastic, and service was perfect. The food was absolutely delicious. We had the lobster and the muscles.  Paul was our server and he rocked it! Personable, very friendly, and checked in just the right amount of times. Thanks Paul!!

ru0Lq9jJAWlXSSQqusDrFg.text: I have a question about an odd experience at this location today. I've dined here before and multiple times at other locations and never had this happen before. Basically the waiter asked to take my ID and show it to a manager. He then retained my ID for roughly 15 minutes. Anyone have any idea if this is a normal practice and the reason for it? Thanks in advance.

eRR87rgnq4EuSdh42Q-zDA.text: This is probably one of the best dinners ever!  The waiter (native of Santa Monica, CA) was beyond professional, pleasant and attentive!!!!    The food fantastic!!!  Our our sadness...........there needs to be a Pappadeaux in Los Angeles!!!

CdbAqTgO15EhYGb3wz8CVQ.text: I absolutely love this place the food is delicious and the service is amazing. Dustin was our server I took some friends there for the first time and he made the experience an unforgettable one! He was efficant and always made sure we were taken care of properly he made our experience a fun and fast visit.

tvKfTtwQI-UCRB7RgSjhnQ.text: Great food and great atmosphere!  A little on the higher end pricing for Phoenix, but justifiably so!!

tqh5KT7zz0e8JRiWUvNJ_w.text: Had a business dinner recently, for a party of eight. Place was pretty crowded and busy. But our service never suffered, food was very delicious. In fact, the coconut shrimp was my favorite for the night. Seems like they were able to get everyone seated in a timely matter through out the evening. It does get a little noisy. Food was very good, service was really good, never had to request anything refills. Since I am not a huge seafood person, I also had a very good Caesar Salad.  Overall we had a very good experience,

RKtEAmDmquN8D_gvLHbaYA.text: Last two time service had been very poor, tonight we were with a group of 11, just got out of church, when we arrived we saw our pastors son, with the out of town evangelist, I asked our waitress to please let me get there check, I then asked after we ordered, then when we are done two hours later, so slow, didn't keep up on refills, no bread, asked for bread it came out as desert, everyone was done with dinner. Then see Pastors son leaving, and asking for our check, waitress informs me by the time the manager told there server they already paid, two hour it took her? Really !!!! So waitress said the manager was coming over to explain, Lisa the manager comes over and says your waitress said you were upset about something ????? I said no, she said ok and walks off, she really didn't want to be there. So we left a great tip. Don't plan on returning, sad I have been coming here for 14 years and it's been my favorite seafood place, and there service was awesome so sad

EYHLT0AmGSbNjLZs7HN02g.text: From a person that has lived in new orleans this place is. Amazing! Super great food and the service is always great.

LA0kKIHgZmfl2S_OOmU0rw.text: I went here for the first time with some friends a few days ago and was not disappointed!! My server, Andrew, was very attentive and was super nice. I ordered oysters and a few others that were all pretty good. My daughter ordered the crab mac n cheese and fries and although the mac n cheese looks like a small portion, don't be fooled! She was full halfway through the plate. Some orders my friends did not like, but everyone has different taste buds. The bill came and was a whopping $300. Get ready to splurge if you eat here.

3C54aF2ApK2p893e6zki9Q.text: Terrific happy hour, amiable staff. New Clam chowder is scrumptious. A great place for an ice cold on beer and some calamari.

4qSdBT8u9RPLkr5j8TDJoQ.text: If you want seafood or authentic cajun style food, this is the place. Their prices are moderate and the food is excellent! My daughter and I used to love their shrimp cocktail, but they changed it and we don't like the size or the rest of what they put with the shrimp now. Everything else is great!

dDHXBNd1pdbBAOEWTsZhHQ.text: I've never had a bad meal here and the service is great.  The atmosphere is fun and the food very flavorful.  We like to go here on special occasions and highly recommend it!

2Eir6it3FOy26CH8wZ0cEA.text: What a treat it was to eat here. For appetizers we had the fried alligator, calamari, baked oysters and raw on the half shell.  For dinner I had the ATLANTIC SALMON ALEXANDER - Blackened salmon with shrimp, scallops & crawfish in a white wine cream sauce, with dirty rice. Everything was prepared to perfection. The service was outstanding and the atmosphere was phenomenal. This was my second time eating at this restaurant. The first was in TX and now in AZ.  It is a seafood lovers paradise. Enjoy.

UjpZFi9pa5fG_3YHWEJ--Q.text: Everything was good as far as alligator,gumbo,jambalaya and raw oysters.service and decor was just as perfect and a reminder of New Orleans.

SrMXAwN_-gN51JqCS8CgGQ.text: Audrey B is AMAZING!!! Came here the other night for my birthday dinner with my father and brother and was served by one of the best waitresses ever. She was very kind, funny, sat us at a great table and just made my overall experience the best it could be. She got our drinks to us very fast, got our appetizers to us fast and did a great job on upselling us to a great choice of another appetizers. She never missed a beat when we needed something at our table. Never had to wait for our food or drinks, always had something in front of us.   The food was great but the service Audrey B gave was fantastic.

fLzrF0m0QePuHuHs8SE3kw.text: Everything was amazing from the atmosphere, menu choices, quality of food, to the service. Lisa our server was knowledgeable, friendly, efficient and just beyond amazing. It is pricey but you get what you pay for. Everything is made in house and you can taste it. Seafood is flown in fresh.

L9JGE-cL9otaB3W6VPOwhg.text: Great food & service is hit or miss but overall it's very decent.  The pasta & seafood dishes are delicious everything we've tried we've been satisfied.

61rrzIJoCuC2oqNwg32E0w.text: Quality and prestige have fizzled out. Used to go there often,but it has been lack luster as of late. Far better places out there with more flare.

nccN9oPdwHfP6H2X1UIo5Q.text: I've always had excellent service at Pappadeaux and the food is incredible. The Moroccan salmon and shrimp is a family favorite.

KSntw68xEAZ9NlB2JKRHwA.text: I Love LOVE LOVE this place!!!! The Bread melts in your mouth, Butter is so yummy!!! The Seafood is so Fresh and Perfectly seasoned..You can order Anything off the Menu and be Happy.. Drinks OMG again SOOOO FRESH,CREATIVE AND TASTEEEEE..I have even ordered Pies to go home on Holidays...ok I'm done..JUST GO..Thank me later lol

5-xGkvW8ktoGRlgjMbWAZg.text: Love this place.  Had the almond crusted snapper for lunch.  It was the absolute best fish I have ever had!  We also had Greek Salad, Calamari and a pasta dish.  Everything was delicious!

hYMnaWgl3QxKuLF0hRiFkA.text: We went here early on New Year's Eve. There were 8 of us  in our party . They were very, very busy. Even with being that busy, our server, Joshua, was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Our water and drink glasses were kept full.   We had a full variety of appetizers and entrees. Everyone agreed the food was excellent except for  the salmon  which was  overcooked and a bit dry . The  price on the food was probably average for the kind of food, the service and the restaurant ambience.  It was cool enough that most people were eating inside, but they do have a nice outside area and they have a nice area where people wait for the reservations. They did take reservations until 4:30 and after that it was first come first serve.

ISZ1kC-TQz5upDOcwfxKpg.text: Excellent service! Love the crab cakes! I don't think I've had one dish that wasn't good.

I2ixtNYw17Icr5uPHWH2ow.text: Two stars for service- food as always great but do not have a large party here- we where a party of 14 and quite frankly it was way to overwhelming for our waitress- after some fraustrating minutes waiting on our drink I asked the manager if she needed help? Manager did she was one of her better waitress- we'll all went down hill from that moment - 20 minutes wait for refills, drinks and that is with constantly asking- I can go on. It a shame because I was entertaining customers and they were quite surprised by the service. One more thing - I ordered desert to go, when I got to my hotel- no utensils! Well fist time I had cheese cake as a finger food.

This is a top notch seafood restaurant.

MnMjpBm6YJXoXUstrCSI_Q.text: Excellent if you like butter + fried foods. I'm not a huge fan so got the crudo which looked amazing when it came out (and it wasn't bad at all). Ten stars for Dominic the really tall server -- SUPER nice and friendly and helpful and kind. I dunno, maybe I'm spoiled with Bay Area food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend the place to friends. Interested to try Cleo's next time. yelp.com/biz/little-cleo...

8oCbBVVTSCw2qDwkEvGQFQ.text: I am now OBSESSED with Pappadeaux. My friend and I sat on the patio by the water fountain which was so cool. Lucky for us they messed up and brought over 6 lobster tails instead of two and everything was just so delicious. I 100% recommend & cannot wait to go back

mrWCDQUmXXrgbAqhH_-aiA.text: Our meal at Pappadeux was excellent, I ordered the crawfish etouffee/Fried crawfish combo.  I was a little leary as I have traveled this year to New Orleans and even the server wasn't sure how it would compare.  Note - it was excellent. My dad had the catfish (as always) and it did not disappoint.  My mom only had the lobster bisque and a wedge said and again she loved it.    Mom also had Creme Brulee and again it was very good. She loved it and I liked it which is something since I rarely care for Creme Brulee!   The special cocktail which was made with watermelon was also excellent.    The restaurant did a great job with seating is as my dad uses a walker so closer is better and this is a huge restaurant!

The eggrolls are yummy and so is the alligator.  so tender.  and desserts,  oh my.  i for sure recommend this place.

zWRoBRYqbFejG6SQY8_VuA.text: Love the bar and outside seating. Great atmosphere. Bartenders were awesome. The fresh lobster is fantastic. The only problem is that it is very loud and very crowded so it doesn't make for a great "date" place. Good family dining though.

J6qioThmI85tGO0VJUMgxg.text: Yuk.  Grease, grease and more grease   If you like fatty fried food this is your spot   If you like Cajun spice.  This is your spot.    If you want fresh, clean, healthy seafood.   Don't go   Plus the prices are outrageous.

bF8NWCrPgiTP9cKMglMdFg.text: Stopped in for a quick bite with the little guy. Sat immediately by a young host. Server came by quickly and we skipped the intro as we have been here multiple times. Order the chargrilled halibut, crawfish etouffee and a Lafayette topping. Our server Ben brought us a cold glass a milk and a tall Kilt Lifter. Life is good. Infant loves fish and crab. Was out in a flash and had a few good laughs.

RA_2OzQSF4E2BU-PIHp04w.text: This is my Favorite Restaurant by FAR. There are a few cons in the past 3 visits though.  Food on one hand is always excellent. Service is usually  really prompt, but if you want optimal service I would eat at the bar.  1. Lobster Sizes. I try to Order 2lbs or So, and every time I have been up-sold to a 3 or 4 pounder without any discount. 2. The Lobster Eat All you Can deal was turning away customers by 7pm on the opening night,, I was showing off and brought 4 guests up from Gilbert, just to get turned away. 3. The Temperature in there is a bit chilly, so if you don't devour your food quickly, it can tend to get a bit cold.  Best Dish Lobster Best Appetizer P.E.I Mussels Best Drink Fat tire  On a nice Date, expect to pay about 80 to 100 per couple..

h1xuIL8S0zmHxFlPZVh5qQ.text: Love... Love... Love!! After my long flight back to the Arizona desert, I was excited to try their frog and alligator - extremely delicious.  Next time, I will try the frog and alligator legit, no frying and no bread crumbs to change their natural flavor.    Oysters are soo yummy.  I automatically taste the ocean, which I miss dearly.    Definitely recommend and don't be scared to try the unusual!!

qT3RXq-68Wz7hHG1sdp4Zw.text: Okay so this place is pure indulgence. Not a restaurant for someone trying to watch the calories. Long story short: the food was excellent, atmosphere fun, service great, and desserts AMAZING.   The long review: we were able to call ahead which was a lifesaver. This place was BUSY and for good reason. We waited about 15 minutes where others were being quoted 45-60. When we got seated we started with the alligator. It was fun to try. I honestly think it tasted like any other meat since it was battered and fried. Anything tastes good fried, right?  What made it special was the dipping sauce. I liked it. For dinner my husband ordered some type of fish with the dirty rice. I could not stop eating his rice. I would love to know the secret ingredient.  I ordered the shrimp platter and it was heavenly. The shrimp with crab cakes on top was seriously something I will be craving.   The portions are huge. We were so stuffed and yet could not resist taking a peek at the desserts. We ended up taking them home to eat later after we walked off some of the food we ate. We dropped them off and later when we got home to eat them they were still delicious.   We got the bread pudding and banana pudding. I don't usually care for bread pudding but they have converted me with theirs. The next day we ate the banana pudding and again- I am converted. We bought our babysitter the chocolate cake and she seemed to really like it.   Definitely will be returning!

X5InieBhFPjkpYeYp1RkxQ.text: Huge restaurant.  Neat atmosphere but pretty noisy.  Portions are gigantic - my wife and I could have easily split the main entree (and we are both big eaters). I had the Parmesan Crusted Flounder it was really quite good.  My wife the pan seared salmon which she enjoyed as well.  The restaurant turns tables fast - we were in/out in less than an hour.  We didn't feel rushed though - just everything was timed perfectly.  Drinks, salad, entree and deserts offered.  Note: The deserts looked phenomenal , but we were so stuffed had to pass.  Next time we will split an entree and save just a little bit of room for desert.

u8w3R0FATAUw2LbkSnqM8w.text: ABSOLUTLY FABULOUS!!!!!! Amazing staff and even better food! Alligator was good and mahi mahi was great too! Look behind the bar for the secret outside private patio tables!! You won't regret this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from private patio tables behind bar.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi mahi

NXCzIj5oLVDCl_xED21lrw.text: We went for our anniversary on a Friday Night. There was a very large crowd and a thirty minute wait. We decided to stay, and boy was I glad we did. They had a live band playing in a very nice court yard with water features and seating outside. The cocktails were very good. I started with a dozen oysters, they were excellent. I also had the Filet Mignon and grilled lobster tail. It was beyond words. The service was excellent. A little pricey our tab was over $300  for a party of three. I would go again. It is a very fun environment and very loud, so if you are looking for a quiet romantic place, not so much.

ugY7_6ZD-IZVFEDZig4tsg.text: If you want to spend for a night out to dinner, don't even think past Pappadeaux. From great drinks to their perfectly prepared and presented lobster from the tank - you are in the one place in Phoenix where anything you order is going to be fantastic. And seafood in the desert?  However they manage it, it's fresh. And the taste is everything from a delicate rice to the boldest spiced gumbo. Go and sit at the bar and share their crab dip. The bartenders make eating at the bar easy and fun.

DYqYcFyBfQAjLvQKTiHVlw.text: Great place with a large variety of menu choices from alligator, crab, lobster, pastas, and steaks.  The banana pudding is a must have for dessert.  A bit pricey, expect to spend over $50 for a dinner for two.  Has a nice outdoor seating area and offers a full bar.

mUaZRvOy-QaUtsepWxxzRg.text: Very nice variety -- My hubby is a huge fan and practically has our car on auto-pilot to drive in and grab a bite.  The restaurant is beautiful inside, definitely not a fast food place, but still comfortable and relaxing.

u66EjV9z4FCgoSDm9XT0CQ.text: I was here a couple of weeks ago and has the lobster and shrimp salad with mango, avocado and cashews. DELICIOUS! Lots off shrimp and lobster.  Really wonderful.   I'm back today on my own dime. I ordered the same thing. Still delicIous. Really. Also ordered mushroom risotto. Very good.   Service by Marlin was excellent, attentive and quick.   My only real complaint is the noise. At 4pm the place is not full and it is NOISY. OH, and whoever brought the child/baby/demon who let out several ear splitting, blood curdling screams.... Thank God I'm not you.   Yeah, the place is expensive. I'm worth it. The calories, oh the calories. I'll be back in January for my birthday. I hope to be thinner by then and can afford the calories.  Three months away, I can do it... Maybe. I shouldn't have ordered the banana pudding in the mason jar.  It is DELICIOUS. And I got the lid and I'm taking most of it home.  If I was good, I'd give the leftovers away. I'm not that good a person or dieter.

qWX0iao5BkW5MOkBWn6RqQ.text: Service by Ryan was good. Enjoy appetizers Oysters main course Shrimp Etouffee, coconut Shrimp, Atlantic Salmon Yvette.

LK4izyN06QYJDVKgfZ9A9w.text: Overpriced, Food average, extremely overcrowded, slow service. Waited 1/2 hour only to be sat at the bar crammed next to a wooden pole, that my right arm was jammed against it (my friend was seated on the OTHER side of the pole too), sigh, so difficult to carry on a conversation. It wasn't worth it, & I will not be returning. Crab Shack, Blue Water Grill much better.

3wbms690ihxrs-RvaqYlpQ.text: Used to be one of my favorite places until a friend of mine and I came down with food poisoning that made me wish for death. Notified them and they apologized and said they'd send a gift card for a future meal. Never received it, but would NEVER go back anyway.

_8Rg8NeJGk0d9R79FBN3jA.text: Yes, it's a chain... but there are some good chains. This is one of those places that has such a gargantuan menu with so much goodness that you want to go back just to try everything that you missed on the first run.  The appetizer offerings had so much I wanted to try, particularly the fried alligator; however, this time we tried the mussels, which were delicious.  I'm pretty picky about mussels, I don't like when they are small and have that graininess when you bite into them.  The mussels at Pappadeaux were fantastic -- large in size, very mild, without any graininess whatsoever.     I ordered the Big Bay Platter for the main course, which comes with Montage Shrimp (jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab), 3 small Caribbean lobster tails, and grilled shrimp.  The price was reasonable for the amount of seafood, about $25.95 and I was really happy with the dish.  The shrimp montage were delicious, stuffed with generous portion of crab meat; the lobster was pretty good, and the grilled shrimp were basted with a spicy sauce that was very tasty.  This was all served on a bed of dirty rice and green beans.  There is so much more I want to come back and try, like the alligator, and some of the other entrees.    A few tips:  - Get there early or call ahead to get your name on the list, this place gets packed.  -  be prepared that it's very loud in here, especially when they have the "New Orleans trio" band playing.    - Watch out for the parking lot, it's like a parking lot at the mall on black Friday. You've been warned.  I will definitely return to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4TqRT19MkeN0TuryAvPnqQ.text: The best part of the dining experience was sitting on the beautiful patio. Service was average and took a while to get drink refilled. I wish there were better options for non-fish eaters. We had a friend there that had a difficult time as most were seafood dishes. I enjoyed the meal but wasn't impressed enough to go back. I had a salad and it was ordinary. Two people had the mahi and enjoyed it and the grits.

uD-tfg3Slwj6J8tGRaHi8g.text: Soooooo yummy!!! I love the dirty rice and their shrimp is to die for, along with some of the best scallops I have ever had. My family comes here every New Years Eve, and we have always had exceptional service. This year we sat on the patio and we had the BEST server. He was super nice and he really paid attention to what we needed. He kept our table clean and our glasses full! He was so great. And Megan, the kitchen manager is so awesome! She came out and asked us how our meal was, and she was so wonderful. Love this restaurant and its staff.

jPomlrECJdM5f7yT3EKfVg.text: As a non-seafood eater, I was extremely pleasantly surprised with this restaurant! It is certainly a seafood driven menu, but if you're like me, you will have the option of mozerella sticks for an appetizer, several salads, and chicken tenders or chicken pasta. And the chicken tenders were absolutely delicious- very moist. My seafood loving husband enjoyed the alligator bites and catfish immensely.   The service really pushed Pappadeux above and beyond on my list. Our waitress, Esther, was so sweet and professional and did a great job of taking care of us without hovering. We will most certainly be back, maybe next time for Happy hour on the absolutely gorgeous Nola style patio!

E6FDG3AZKOBSXlegQSPaow.text: Great seafood. I tried Alligator for the first time. It was pretty good. But the service could use a tune-up. My Son had Swordfish, I had Salmon, and my land lover Wife had Chicken. All were delicious and cooked perfectly. We love this place and will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Alligator / Swordfish / Salmon with Crab

jZGC3_mBCDwCvc_waJo5oA.text: Went here with my grandparents for one of their birthdays and all I can say is it is excellent food and waiting staff. Keep on the god work

hgxBx6SAqi1yZYkgC2lIgg.text: love the place! it speaks for itself only thing is the long wait. What can you expect. After years of coming here it still a very nice and fun  place to have dinner and enjoy the live music.

5egwgcVE8P8bTseljI9FcA.text: We come here at least 2x's a month... We always ask for Audrey, she is the best waitress, fun, has a cool Boston accent and is great at what she does. I would recommend her, so request her. :)  Food is always great, I've had 2 instances where I had to send my food back, one was because my toddler sneezed all over my food after only two bites, so they gladly took it back a replaced my meal and the other time was when I was preggo, I had ordered salmon and it was just a little too, "not done"... So the got me a new meal and gave our whole table free desserts. They are excellent at making sure you have a fab dinner and are happy. So be kind if there is an issue, they gladly make thing right with a smile on their face.   I love many dishes on their menu... Seafood Cobb salad, oysters, gator (1/2 blackened & 1/2 fried) which is a fave of ours, Alexander mahi, salmon Alexander, good ol plank salmon and asparagus, bacon wrapped shrimp is amazing, their pastas are great and we especially love their banana pudding!  Go, you won't be disappointed!

Ni36eVlRYXe7g7lsYZAiIw.text: Love love love this restaurant. My boyfriend and I had sworn off any restaurant that had served seafood after many awful dinners but one of my clients had recommended this place... After looking over the menu several  times online, I figured it would be worth trying. We will only be coming back here! Our waiter, Kyle, was very attentive and took the time to go over the menu with us. We had alligator and oysters as appetizers, they definitely hit the spot and salmon and the Alaskan king crab for our dinners. I couldn't be more pleased with how everything turned out and I can't wait to go back! Even their drinks were delicious!

auRaEJHeqVt7qg1u10xAqg.text: Been coming here for over ten years and our go to place for cajun and seafood. Prices have kept up with the times but it's still worth it to get some excellent dishes. Seafood platter and pasta mardi gras are two of our favorites. I tried the shrimp & grits today and it will be added to my list of favorites.

VF_sOPOIPxkZJDChRx-roQ.text: Go here frequently and usually get Lobster and Filet Mignon. I can honestly say I personally have never eaten anything here that wasn't of great quality from Lobster, Filet Mignon, blackened salmon, Southwest Grits, Lobster Mac & Cheese, even tried alligator for the first time here and it was delicious (I believe that's the name of the Grits  and Mac & Cheese). I can honestly say I don't have one complaint from ever going here.

IoEMvJhKNsmoOORCH8hshQ.text: I am always happy when I can enjoy fresh seafood in the valley of the sun.  After all, this is Phoenix, Arizona. My family and I went to Papadeux Restuarant during the                                                                             holiday season.  I had a pleasant experience. So,here is a brief review.  The restuarant is decorated in a French Quarter New Orleans Louisiana style. The menu had many entrees to choose from. Our seafood dinners were delicious so were the appetizers and the desserts. The customer service was professional and staff was friendly.  I enjoyed it and will go back.

OrOnl2ls8BjrLCPxJFyLAg.text: Came here last night for the 1st time. The experience was okay, I may have given it 5 stars if I actually got everything I ordered.  I was really looking forward to trying the clam chowder,  but when it never came with my meal I was disappointed & decided to be happy with the food I did get; which ended up being a challenge. The stuffed shrimp sound better on the menu than they actually taste. The mashed potatoes tasted as if they came out of a box, which is surprising considering how much they charge for them. The best part of the meal was when my husband kindly let me try a bite of his lobster bisque.... and I don't think I've ever tasted anything so delicious!!  that one bite is the reason I gave this review 4 stars instead of one. I will go back here again but only to get a to go order of the lobster bisque!!!

botKO3biDb5b5yijBps10A.text: I was first introduced to this restaurant when on vacation in Arizona back in 2012.  I've been back to Arizona two more times since, and always made an effort to stop at Pappadeaux with whoever was traveling with me, and every one of them have loved the experience!  The food, drink, and service has been fantastic every time, that I would probably consider it my favorite restaurant.  It's unfortunate that there aren't any closer locations to me, but perhaps that helps keep the quality exceptional and my visits more memorable.  For the record, the alligator bites are a must for an appetizer!

BJOKN55oK2MBTj68MwvpKA.text: This is one of my favorite seafood restaurant.  I could not wait to get to Phoenix to go to the restaurant.  I shared the combo plate with my husband since it is so much food.  We were not disappointEd.  My husband also had the gumbo which he enjoyed.  I also enjoy their catfish.  I definitely will make it one of my stops when I go to Phoenix.

9q4xKcsYgln6twT7YajBig.text: Well - this is finally it, my very first bad review.  So we stopped in for dinner and it was about 5:30.  The hostess was great and made us feel very special, ask if it was our first time there and/or if it was a special occasion.  Once we sat down nothing from anyone.  We waited 15 minutes before just getting up and leaving.  I asked to talk to a manager right before leaving and had to wait a couple of minutes for them to pull her from a meeting (looked like about 8-12 people in a room having a meeting) not sure why at 5:45 (dinner rush they were having a meeting.  The manage apologized and offered to treat us to dinner, I choose not to accept as my time is worth more than a free meal.  I was so upset that because this my buddy from the mid west comes to town often and raves about how good there food is (I was originally from Seattle - looking for good seafood in AZ).    So with that being said - horrible experience (actually the worst experience I have had so far in Phoenix)

L_GU-oEFkKemd1hovSVjlg.text: IMHO the meals at Pappadeaux look better than they actually taste.  The flavors were either underwhelming or over salted.  But, they have a great staff that aims to please and is very good about providing substitutions for anything on their extensive menu.    What I found amazing were the desserts.  And as picky az I'm iz, it's hard to find amazing restaurant food.  Anyway, this review is strictly for the dessert.  Very yummy!  If I could eat sweets all day, I would order all desserts and feast like a Roman.    The usual suspects:  vanilla cheesecake, praline cheesecake, chocolate cake, bread pudding, creme brule, banana pudding, key lime pie, pecan/sweet potato pie.  Some were topped a la mode, some with yummy creme, berries, thin vanilla wafer, and came with sauces.  (I don't care for sweet sauces with desserts.  That's just overkill.  For goodness sake, aren't we obese enough?)  Who(m)ever is doin' the desserts is mmm oohhh mmm yeah  doin' it and doin' it and doin' it WOW  doin' it and doin' it and doin' it WOW   The portions are large so unless you're a glutton like me, you'll need to share.  Move over salmon!  These are the ones that I made room for:  1.  Banana pudding comes in a mason jar that's your keepsake.  Make sure you get a lid, too.  Topped with a tall serving of whipped cream, side strawberry, and a thin vanilla wafer.  I hadn't eaten whipped cream in such a long time, I ate it fast but it took a good five minutes before actually getting to the pudding.  Not a pudding fan, but it looked so pretty, I had to try it.    2.  Slices of cheesecakes looked about 4" in height and the top is browned so you can tell that they've been baked, deliciously, and then topped with whipped cream and berries.  One came with strawberry sauce, the other with caramel sauce.  The cheese sat on thick graham [Of Course!] crust.  It was hard to stop eating - ur, tasting - these.    3.  Slice of key lime pie was...key lime pie.  Decent sweet / tartness and a good thick crust.  Holds its own, but I'm not an avid eater of key lime.  4.  Slice of pecan/sweet potato pie came a la mode, quite sweet, and came with bourbon sauce.  The top is packed with pecan halves layered over the sweet potato.  Unfortunately the syrup from the pie, over powers the potato layer (which I could not even taste) and seeps into the crust.  I love pecans.  I love sweet potato.  But I gots no love for syrup.  It sort of ruined the pie.  Did I eat it though?  Sho' nough!

uMDhh82_hhy3IsRXqnsCqA.text: Great seafood and steak.  Love surf and turf and getting it from here, I know it's extremely fresh and tasty.  Great place to take a date or meet up with friends or take your clients to.  I'll be back.

cTnXy1w5EQbEPt1770UENg.text: Great food and wonderful services. I love Cajun food, and living in the desert doesn't help. My husband and I love this place, it's the closest thing we can get to the south. Service Carla was so knowledgeable,  wonderful, and gracious. Give her a raise ya'll!

8YQpN595MR6VoihKLtt29w.text: This place is the place to be if you like seafood,great atmosphere and great food prices are really good the only bad experience I had there was the wait the hostesses told me 30 mins for a party of 2 and we waited a lil over an hour but still gave them 5 stars cause there food was great

g-J7YP0hjSwQj49bA2oUjQ.text: Really really good food. the food was one of a kind and I can't even begin to describe how good the The bread pudding was. Highly recommend !
