XnrROwKTmA_IDoDb5orScw.text: Yummy seafood appetizers. Large varieties of dishes had the salmon special and enjoyed it. A bit on the pricey side so nice treat to yourself and family.

wUMxEzAQrk9wZhaxbeE0Eg.text: OMG! I really love this place! The best seafood place in Phoenix! It's pricey but really worth every penny! The food will never disappoint. I like the fact that they have FRESH seafood deliver EVERYDAY! THAT'S A HUGE PLUS we're far from the waters. Highly recommended to anyone who love seafood!

JirZ_D_cTqxq4gOjlWH5mQ.text: $6 for a dozen Texas Gulf oysters Mon-Thur.  We ordered 8. Waitress was slick and upsold us on alligator, which contrary to popular belief, does not taste like chicken.  Get the spinach dip with real crab meat - it's fantastic.

uv4-jmYnJw1esM9k-Kr0bg.text: So good! Fresh seafood in the middle of the desert? Yes, that's possible. However don't fill up on their delicious apps like I did. Service was a bit bleh but the food made up for it. Get here early because it fills up fast. I'm from SoCal so coming all the way to Phoenix for good seafood surprised me!!

7we_KC4OHqd6ISUGh7iREg.text: This is my favorite seafood spot when in TX. Glad they have a location in PHX!  We had lunch here and we were extremely satisfied with the service we had with our server Jaclyn. Jaclyn was timely, very polite, attentive, and has a great sense humor.  Jaclyn is overall fantastic!  When you have a server like Jaclyn, everything else will fall into place.  Great food and drinks!  Thank you Jaclyn!

-nFS63kZ6VCTjTlJtw9cYg.text: Good was great as usual but I Was very disappointed in the service this time.  Took a very long time to receive out me main course. The server also didn't keep up in clearing our table from appetizers and bread to drink refills.

Fhl_AkJp6EcuSZRGogVZ5A.text: I've had multiple poor experiences here. First, this place is always busy and has terrible parking. Every time I've gone, I've had to circle the parking lot looking for a spot. Because it's so busy, the service is terrible too. They're always busy. You have to wait to get a table, even with a reservation, then wait for a long time for them to take your order. The last time my family went, the staff was VERY apologetic so maybe our experience was unique. We counted and they apologized to us 10 different times.  I concede that the waiting may be due in large part to going during popular nights (Friday and Saturday) and that this is a VERY popular restaurant but I didn't find any of it worthwhile.  I love seafood, but I really didn't think the food was very good, honestly.

qBnAUP5l2OGCmyoLWsxWag.text: Soooo amazing! The 1000+ positive reviews alone show how good this restaurant is and they were right. I was very impressed with the food and service here. Came on a Saturday late night and when I called around 8pm to gauge to wait I was told 45 minutes to 1 hour yikes. We decided to go anyway and take our chances. Just our luck that soon as we put our names down a booth in the bar area opened up so we got super lucky and were able to get seated instantly. My sister and I shared baked crab mac and cheese, gumbo, crawfish bisque and fried shrimp with fries. Don't come here with a small appetite because the menu is so vast that it's so tempting to order more and more just to try everything especially if you are a seafood lover like myself. I thought the prices were reasonable which was another impressive point. The drink menu is also very expansive with lots of cool options so overall this is a great place not just for food, but if you want just a drink since the bar area itself is quite large. For sure recommend!

RylPStruQ7dW6x2EpfOiKQ.text: Good food, out of oysters, waiter had too many tables. Tossed the butter at us, and forgot to ask us if we wanted another drink as he rushed by to give us water

GQrhAa8RBEUXkyLW_tw5vA.text: My all time favorite restaurant and I visited this in Dallas and Phoenix. Awesome seafood and portions are large. for appetizers bisque soup is a good choice. Totally recommend papadeaux specialities. I tried almost all the dishes listed under specialities and you cannot go wrong with them. Highly recommend this restaurant to all sea food lovers.

TWTmny5n9v500Z2_VqMB1A.text: Ok, it has been awhile since we ate here. The food is pretty good, but not outstanding this time. It used to be out standing. The portion sizes used to be outstanding; not anymore. The service used to be outstanding...and yes not anymore. I will allow everyone has an off night, but Aubrey B. Was not very on tonight....sorry. Ok baked oysters where very good...the rested just ok.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We used to get this dish when they first opened, it would feed two and have leftover...not anymore...it&#39;s the crawfish platter

4yiJ-RdJknHihR6toIRQZg.text: I love going here.  The staff is always friendly and helpful even when the place is packed (which is often).  The food is always good.  Fresh seafood is actually fresh and not frozen.  The drinks are good and not watered down.  I love coming here for special occasions.

L0vSyWFu9Undj-v-57QaUw.text: Excellent service! My daughter loves the coconut shrimp. The shrimp fondue was yummy. Alligator was delish ... Drinks complimented it all

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grand Hennessy

HsszNm249z_kkS5aA1Nefg.text: Went to this place twice in one week! First time in on a Sunday, and second time on a Thursday.  Making a road trip and passing through Phoenix, we saw this place.  Cajun & Seafood will alway catch my attention.  Ordered a dozenoysters both times-- Amazing! Menu was great, all the tasty cajun seafood creations that any spicy cajun lover will be in love with. If I lived closer, I would be a regular here.   Totally recommend this spot.

bihMx_Psg0LrOik6kDgUWQ.text: This place is pretty decent, but never gets to really great.  The food is good, yet not always totally fresh.  Service is pretty good if they are slow, but sometimes the place is packed and you have to wait a long time for everything.  There aren't a lot of cajun options in this area, so I still come here every now and then.  I'd go somewhere else if that was an option.

O7ZvQPNwSedxnzeRvZCKfg.text: Amazing food, gorgeous patio, and an authentic atmosphere. My hands down favorite restaurant in town.

WXoxvGayd6fZEhTSFYtnHQ.text: My server Esther was super nice and helpful. We talked a little too much, felt like I was hogging her from others. I'm sure she didn't mind as she carried half the conversation.  I ordered the appetizer of macaroni and cheese with seafood. And the Pasta Mardi Gras. Both delicious and large servings! Most I took home as we were talking so much my full signal went off.   It's on the expensive side, but the food, service and decor makes it worth it.

itJZ4jOLiuoPcK_wN5FujQ.text: Papadeux is a treat when in the Phoenix area. The place is always crowded but the wait isn't always very long. Best Cajun food I have ever had outside of Orleans and service is very attentive. If your looking for a steak this place isn't the place, they have steak but the seafood or chicken is where it's at.

CHcrJjgYIJDaQ7FCosB9_w.text: Good atmosphere. Not very impressed with the menu. Seems like an upscale Red Lobster.

dU4q3J8ceQADus0Kc_OB5g.text: I've only ordered one thing from here and it was the fried shrimp. I love it! It's spicy and crunchy mmm! I have tried the fried alligator once though. The flavor wasn't bad, I just don't like the texture of alligator. At least I tried!  The price is very expensive BUT they give you a good amount of food so it makes up for it.   The staff is very nice especially Nora! She's the best!

2uBIKrmFZ-RPYyY1cK1ajw.text: My family and I always go to the Pappadeaux in Albuquerque so when we saw this one off the freeway we knew we HAD to stop for dinner.  We had a big group when we went but it really wasn't a problem for this place because it's such a large restaurant. The menu is extensive and heavy on the seafood which is awesome since it is delicious! We always get the fried alligator appetizer which is SO GOOD! I know it sounds gross but where the heck are you ever going to find ALLIGATOR?! Try it, especially with the sauce... YEAH! We have also tried the oysters on the half shell (great) and the fried oysters with fries (yum!)  For dinner I like to get the pasta mardi gras which is linguine with shrimp and sausage in a creamy marinara sauce. It has a bit of a kick to it which I like but the portion is really big so it's best to share. Crawfish etouffee is great and is a favorite of my dad. We have had the king crab as well which is yummy but can be hard to crack the shells and take apart. The filet mignon oscar was good but a little light on the crab meat that is on top of the steak.   This place can get quite loud so be careful! Also can be a bit pricey but I believe the cost is less if you go for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked potato
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 12 oysters on the half shell

S9iPZ9_dVp7eRYJZ6Ha-VQ.text: Overpriced greasy, slimy food with below average service. Service was so so. Loud inside. My mother was looking forward to coming here and she couldn't wait to leave. Similar to Red Lobster. If you are looking for tasty seafood and a fun atmosphere, I'd say the Angry Crab is a good place

pkGt9s6opIkKNtutcdSMJw.text: The alligator bites are so tender and tasty.. Thier fish is always fresh and cooked just right. If you have room for dessert try the bread pudding.

1y4BuzaUOyeFZXAvRwztIA.text: So for my Dad's birthday dinner I decided to show him one of my favorite places to go around the valley.    So we had a reservation at 7:30 and got there around 7:10 which was fine we got to sit outside and enjoy the weather which is awesome this time of year.  At 7:35 we were called to our table.  We already saw the menu outside so we were ready to order once seated.    My dad got the stuffed lobster and I got the Chilean sea bass.  After about 20 min the manager came over and apologized for the wait which I wasn't even concerned about yet.  She said they overcooked the sea bass the first time so they had to re-fire it.  They brought our dishes out about 5 min later.  Everything was good as always and then about 7 min later she brings over this huge piece of sea bass and said again she was sorry.    I was amazed as I was not worried about anything and didn't even get upset for the overcooking the first time.  She also said she was going to comp a dessert for me which worked out great cause it was my Dad's bday so she brought a special creme brulee at the end of the meal with a candle and happy birthday written in chocolate which was just perfect.    I love this place and it brings me back to New Orleans every time I go which is a great place to be reminded of.

nS5JGPf17_mWOMtHrN99aA.text: Awesome. Pricey but worth it. Try the lobster bisque it's to die for!

D9qafHj8Zqv9pDHMR4qoQA.text: Loved everything! We ate there because my Mother-in-Law got a tip from her friend that they had an Oyster deal that couldn't be beat! Dad hadn't had Oysters on the half shell in many years. The place is very large, dimly lit and was busy busy busy! But I think they have a lot of experience with handling the crowds. I would have preferred a quieter restaurant, but the food quality was worth the inconvenience of barely being able to carry on a conversation without yelling. We had appetizers (alligator was good!) and a good meal  -Costa Rican Tilapia LaFayette. OH man! the food was excellent. I would definitely go again in spite of the noise and crowd... I understand why the crowd!

Lkxdv2hvuKvWUtqO_3ADlg.text: Had dinner here with the family and would Defenetly be back; staff was great and food was darn good. Wait wasn't to bad and the enviornment wall busy was pretty relaxing. We had 5 people in our group that all got something different and everyone loved what they got.

FUbeZqsMa4GKW4cn8f29eA.text: This was our first time here and everything was amazing. The jumbo shrimp wrapped in bacon over dirty rice was super good. We started with a sampler platter which included the fried alligator it is a must try it was very good. Inside the restaurant was a bit loud but we sat out in the patio which was very nice. We had a great time we will definitely come back again. Our server Christopher B. was on top of everything . All servers should be like him.

1y7bOQflCgElVAPkr72O_w.text: I eat here all the time. the food and the atmosphere is absolutely great! I've had so many different meals here I cannot count them. I will definitely be back!

ZcnwHD9pVZQPIt007ZUUrQ.text: Just left after having dinner and this time just was not a pleasant experience. We started with an hour wait (no problem at all we sat and had drinks) At the bar we had frog legs mmm they were good. Our buzzer went off and we got seated. First they never gave us silverware I had to get up and ask for it (no problem they were busy) Our waiter seemed pre-occupied and made us feel like unwanted guest.  We sat with our drinks empty most of the dinner our appetizers came late and our food came cold. I had Costa Rican Mahi it was very good although cold the grits and sauce were amazing. My husband had bacon wrapped shrimp he asked for a baked potato side was quoted a $3.95 price (I may be wrong on the change) and when the bill came it was almost $6.00 for a baked potato that also came way after the food came out. We went with friends they had the seafood platter and chicken linguini. Meal is over we are thirsty as our glasses weren't refilled. Our friends food gets taken to the back to be boxed only one meal got boxed and when we asked about the other he went to the back and came back with a piece of fish in a box. When we asked where the rest of the meal went he said it got dumped. Well wait that makes no sense as I have a piece of fish right here how do you dump fries but save the fish that was on top of the fries? Needless to say they won't be eating the fish!  He did give 2 free deserts to make up for the food that got thrown. Key lime pie was very good as was the chocolate brownie.  Of course we will return we enjoy this place. Hopefully next time it will be better :)

wngyepkV4PMeej2RtwyRoA.text: The food is always excellent here, but I can't give them 5 stars because their price point is quite high.  The service is good, with the staff being friendly and detail oriented.  They are not in the best of areas to be charging the prices that they do.

xqRTyPgNW40pbBf6AJLwng.text: This place is so worth the wait! My brother, bff and I came on Valentine's Day 2015. There was an 90-120 minute wait and no reservations, but that was okay. A bar server named Justin came around to take drink orders outside and was extremely prompt and courteous. Once inside, our server Nora was nothing but friendly and professional. Even though the restaurant was slammed, she treated us as if we were the only diners here. Extremely attentive and lovely. The food was exquisite and the drinks were fabulous! We cannot wait to come back!

EouRW-pbCXCX1sS-X9jvPw.text: Pappadeaux has been my go to ever since I moved here.  I remember spending a night at their bar watching Kim blow the D-Back's lead in the World Series while eating some fried alligator.    Since then I have learned to appreciate food more and have become quite fond of Pappadeaux, especially during happy hour.  Pappadeaux's has never let me down in regards to food.  When you sit at the bar the service is sometimes, more often then not, lacking (hence the reason for only four stars).    You can't go wrong with the Oysters, and their Po' Boys are on point.  If you are there for dinner anything you order is sure to please, but maybe try the seafood platter.  Pretty sure we have sampled most of the menu, which does change.  If you have never had Alligator, try it!!  I can go on and on, but again I don't remember a menu item I did not like or would not recommend.  Me not being a dessert fan it is hard, but I would recommend the key lime pie.  Pappadeaux's you are a treat, thank you for the fresh product and refreshing drink.

Q-MiNhYcznmbPdPsfrKi6A.text: I have eaten at a Pappadeaux's twice in my life; this experience was better than my first at least.  If you are from Louisiana, or travel there often, this place doesn't compare to the real deal.  Our party had the half-price oyster deal and ordered several orders.  They liked them, but I thought they were just OK.  It was a good value though.  I had ordered the new scallops and sweet pea risotto, and it was pretty tasty, but the portion size was way too small and way overpriced.  I only had 5 scallops on my plate and they were relatively small.  I felt like I could have gotten more scallops for less from the grocery store.  We got the bananas foster cheesecake for desert, which was pretty uninspiring to me.  Seemed like a regular cheesecake with very little topping whatsoever.  If it's not a traditional bananas foster desert, don't bother with it.  Also, there aren't very many non-seafood options on the menu!

SCkpzOMbEJFE_oIgrNogew.text: With all the great reviews and seeing as how crowded it was, I was really sad that my experience wasn't the same.  It's been a long time since I've been to the ones in TX but I certainly don't remember the experience being that bad so maybe it was the timing and the location.  On to my review...  We ordered the fried alligator, Mississippi Catfish Opelousas, and what I think was the Crawfish Etouffee.  The only saving grace was the fried alligator which was very well done.  I always used to get it at a cajun place back home so I was excited to try it here.  This is the one thing that Pappadeaux cooked right.  It was perfectly fried without it being too greasy and the alligator was tender.  The Mississippi Catfish Opelousas on the other hand was awful!  Maybe it was an off day but it wasn't nearly as good as it sounded.  The catfish fillet itself was the worse part.  You know how they usually make catfish nuggets with the stomach of the fish? The not-so-good part of the fish.  Well this fillet tasted worse than that.  The whole fillet was such bad quality that we didn't finish it.  I hate wasting food but I didn't even bother taking it home. It was a really big piece too.  It still leaves a bad taste in my mouth clearly.   The etouffee was meh.  Not as horrible as the catfish dish but I've certainly had better.  And this is not even including the ones I had in TX and New Orleans.  Didn't bother taking that home either.  And I love leftovers since that means I don't have to cook!  Sigh - overall, I was sorely disappointed especially more so b/c of all the great reviews and how crowded it was.  I'll have to go back again when I am in TX visiting family and see how it compares.  The one nice thing was the live entertainment on the patio area while we waited outside for our table.  The band was good.

YTbsyV7HBdESPXBdtG1Y9w.text: Ugh... I love Pappadeaux, but I will never understand why the service is so bad in the AZ location.  We asked to move tables and after arguing with me for a few minutes the waiter finally agreed to let us switch to a more suitable table (one with slightly less flies) ... He promptly stood back and watched me carry all of our drinks and plates to the next table.  Another server was kind enough to come from his section to help my grandmother from her seat.  Food is typically delicious, but the continued poor service leaves an awful taste in my mouth.

tHe5qGu9tzFVZTavl1z-7g.text: Ate here tonight! This is a really nice, spacious restaurant with an outdoor area that had live music tonight. We ate indoors though, and the decor and general ambiance was really nice. Not so uptight as to make you feel uncomfortable to eat with your family, but certainly befitting the price range and quality.  I have a few minor quibbles that would make this more of a 4.5 star review, but I thought I'd round up since they're so insignificant.  To begin with, the food and beverages were good! I had the Strawberry Tea and my mom had the Mango Lemonade, and they were both flavorful without tasting artificial. No review on the alcoholic drinks, unfortunately. The meals were VERY generously sized (Seriously, we all took home enough to have a second and possibly third meal tomorrow) and good... for the most part. The fried crabfinger dinner was a bit salty and the lobster bisque might not be for everyone. The clam chowder and pasta mardi gras were amazing though. Also, beware the dirty rice--the taste really lives up to the name, and you may not be prepared for it. My mom, thinking it was just a clever name for a rice pilaf, certainly wasn't.  Service was great! Our waiter was very ninja-like, suddenly reappearing with refills. He was extremely friendly and helpful with the menu. Our only issue was that at one point, as we were at the end of our meal, he seemed to disappear completely. We wanted to get our plates boxed and our check paid, and that took much longer than we expected. Still, it wasn't exactly a hassle waiting for him to show up and I'm sure we could have been more proactive about getting the bill if we had really been in a rush.  In short, a great place to dine if you don't mind spending a bit of money. Considering this is seafood and they give you huge plates, I think the cost is definitely worth it, but don't be surprised to see those $20-$30+ entrees.

Cyf3vRcczwi0jdJOpy3M0A.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my recent date night at Pappadeaux.  The Hubs and I have been dying to try this place out thanks to all these amazing reviews on yelp and boy are they right.  The place was packed on a Saturday night at 5pm, which is a good indication one is in for a treat.  We made a reservation just in case, since we were going to see a show later that night.  Our waiter greeted us quickly and was very friendly and upbeat.  He told us the specials and took our drink order while we looked over the huge menu.  In the end we got the lobster roll appetizer, halibut, and bread pudding for dessert.  Everything was soooo... good and very filling.  The lobster appetizer was full of flavor, especially the sauce it came with.  The halibut was cooked perfectly and the grits on the side were amazing.  We loved the bread pudding, which was HUGE for the price.  I wish there weren't as many raisins, but all in all it was great.  So glad to have found this place!  I know it's a chain, which I usually don't love, but the old-school vibe and good quality/quantity of food made up for that.  We'll be back for sure!

ISFO2NDM90Twqj14a5CG4w.text: The food is decent. A knock off of New Orleans Cajun food. We have been to New Orleans many times and there is no doubt when your eating at Pappadeaux's you are not eating in New Orleans. It is fairly high priced for what you get. At the best it is ok

QI93vQyHK36PG-56nnrqIg.text: Have gone here for years and always enjoyed the food. Unfortunately tonight was not going to happen as someone at the restaurant decided to park not only a storage container blocking off parking spots in the back lot, but THEN an entire flipping SEMI-TRUCK with trailer that blocked off a good 8-9 parking spots.   No way to find a place to park, customers were driving in the parking lot, looking then leaving. Sad to say I was one of those. The food is IMHO great but if you cannot get a place to park you cannot eat. I may be back but not sure when....

VZvi0EwvPmHnzT3wO1dS8g.text: Took my daughter and her fiancee there for his birthday... finally had instance to eat inside (love the patio) it was very comfortable and enjoyable inside.  Server was amazing.  The meal was great.  Oysters are always a top favorite, lobster was cooked wonderfully.  Nothing but praises, nice to have a comfortable and fair, reasonably priced place to go to. Plan on needing a 'to-go' bag.

MSrg0fBrdmr8qtugeEtdlQ.text: My in-laws wanted to take me somewhere for my birthday, and Pappa's always used to be one of my favorites so for dinner, this is where we decided to go. Even though many chain restaurants have come and gone in the era, this restaurant has remained a staple along the I-17 freeway. It's always tricky to get to especially when heading south on the I-17 since you have to go one exit past the restaurant, make a U-turn, and drive on the access road, but it's always crowded no matter what, even on a Thursday evening.   The oysters were really good. They were fresh and regular in size.   The Grand Hennessy drink was an especially tasty treat! Almost dessert like from the start! It featured the Hennessy VS Marnier with fresh lemon and orange juices with a "splash of Moscato D'Asti." It's also very refreshing too - something I'd really enjoy during the summer.  I usually order more traditional fare like catfish with dirty rice or similar, but this time I ordered the biggest photo right smack on in the middle of their menu, The Lobster Boil. It somewhat reminded me of what you'd find at Joe's Crab Shack, but definitely much higher quality and less salty. I felt like everything was deliciously bathed in butter and light spices.   The service was less than to be desired. It seemed like the restaurant was understaffed that night. From the get go, they sat our group of four instead of the couple that arrived there before us, so they brought only two menus, so as the hostess sat us, she only gave us two menus and took away the other 2 place settings. No problemo. I simply asked for her to keep those extra settings there and bring us two more menus. But then, our waiter would disappear for long periods of time, and forgot to bring my father in law a 2nd drink as requested, so the less than stellar performance kind of left us disappointed even though the food was good. It's not a deal breaker or anything, but that cheerful memory of this place is definitely jaded a bit now.

EcR8k4utkQl9OEgtJ_70lw.text: Glass broke infront of us get wet all Over The manager came in and just said " i saw that happen before and did even do anything  Sk just all be careful wen h guys pick up ur glass!!!! Well so happy the manager did us a nice  gesture !!! Well done

KYJjsvugh3LI99ikaqdB8Q.text: Food was very good. I ordered a half dozen Gulf oysters. It took 30 minutes to serve them. My dining buddy finished his appetizer and waited to order his main course.  I ordered a second glass of wine which took 10 minutes. Maybe our server, Alexa, was overwhelmed but it sucked.  If I return, I will sit at the bar.  F

EOQzxbA5KWslNWVbPX6nUQ.text: All good but BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT EVER! Why oh why have you discontinued your Mediterranean Calamari? Absolute best thing in the menu, best Calamari in the whole United States. Dumb dumb move Pappadeaux!

ZuEROe4CA9dLSeO18KX5JA.text: This place is cool! It's crowded every time we come so expect a little bit of a wait. There's a lot to choose from on the menu and the portions are pretty big. They have a lovely cocktail menu as well. Come here when you wanna Treat Yo Self cuz it can be a touch pricey.

l0yKBfWz2NaQ0RzrmKyO8w.text: This was my first visit, we were a party of about 20 people celebrating a friends birthday. The service was good for it being an extremely busy night. I tried the surf and turf pasta, it was tasty. It was only on the lunch menu which I didn't realize, priced at $19, but I was charged  $28. The gave a really good amount of shrimp, I could have done without the sausage. Wasn't a fan. My boyfriend ordered chicken strips and fries (he doesn't like seafood). The portion was laughable, it looked like he ordered from a kids menu. Small portion, which could have been ok if they atleast plated it nicely. It's all just tossed on a small plate. I am definitely interested in going again and trying something else, I was playing it a little safe.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious drinks!

5J5khjCCQxEMOibyC6XwBA.text: Great Sea-food with an Outstanding Service Help.........

US5ChssRk8Qh9viWvOfvFQ.text: This place had to be the highlight of my trip to Arizona. I haven't had such good seafood in a long time. Not to mention the great service by a young lady named yelena who well deserved the tip that she received, she made the experience even better. It was seven of us and she made sure drinks were full and food was out in a timely manner .Three of us had the shrimp etoufee and all i can say is Mercy. The crab mac and cheese yummy goodness . Also the fried calamari and seafood platter . I can keep going on and on because we ordered so much food we were stuffed before our entrees even came out. Everything was so good no complaints at all. On my way to catch my flight to San francisco lets just say this spot is now one of my favorite spots to visit in Arizona.....See you next time

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5jXcorxMwOUwVhMvupysrw.text: Love this place! My go to for celebrations of any kind. Food is always perfect! My favorite is the jumbo shrimp brochette!

Db8i3VkwVjpM1BPBqSlo2A.text: I wish I could give this place a higher review because I love the food here but the last several times my husband and me have came here we have been mis-quoted how long of a wait it would be and not by a little bit. We were quoted 45 mins it's now almost two hours in we wish we would have gone somewhere else but now we will be waiting no matter where we go! Don't come here hungry you will starve before you get your food!**update, we mentioned our wait to wait staff which let the manager know and they quickly handled the situation in a wonderful way! We will be coming back :)

l-iTwaNzgGqmU2AAR4UfTg.text: Great service from hostess, bartenders and wait staff.  We were very disappointed in the quality of food for the price. Fish was not hot or crispy as expected from the fried mixed platter. Fries were not hot either. Not worth trying again at their prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iCwi7j2x3IRdKeW56ZYY7Q.text: I fail to see the value in this restaurant.  Management seems unable to figure out how to schedule wait staff.  On a recent coerced visit there were 40 - 50 people waiting outside to be seated in an empty restaurant.  We were told the servers weren't scheduled to start for another half-hour.  How absurd!  The responsible manager should have been terminated immediately.  Prices are extremely high for the quality and quantity of food served.  Simply put, this is a chain restaurant that is trying to be upscale; and failing miserably. Service is slow, the wait staff have way too many tables; the bartenders are Chili/Applebee quality but with upscale bar pricing.  The recent salmonella episode at the restaurant adds to my "never again" attitude.  Eat at your own risk.

awrQMI_xXCvrVkomgU5lmg.text: The gulf oyster on 1/2 she'll  were good. I love their own sauce. And on special for $9.95/fox. Love it!" M We usually love Papadeaux French bread but The waitress brought us a not so fresh loaf of bread. That was disappointing.. Asked her to bring us a fresh baked one. Brought us same kind. Papadeaux either changed their French bread recipe or the bread back in the kitchen is just all stale and microwaved to warm up. First time to be disappointed with Papadeaux French bread. All their restaurants in Texas serve great fresh bread but Phoenix I guess has to microwave theirs. Greatly disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gulf oysters. Fresh and tasted great like the ocean.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked Cod/ smelled fishy but tasted ok.

CVBSF817vihLvdrTooGLng.text: Prices during happy hour is decent but the house wines aren't much to brag about.  Spend a little more for the Grey Goose martini.  Hot boiled shrimp with potatoes is the best deal on happy hour.  The portion is big enough to make a meal in itself.  Too bad they don't serve this on the regular menu.  The catfish beignet is also good.    The quality of fried calamari is better than most places.  Fried alligator is decent.  And spend a little more for the blue point oysters.  They're huge and tasty.  I've had the mahi mahi alexander, grilled shrimp and andouille sausage.  The latter isn't all healthy but delicious.   Don't get the fish fry or filet steak.  I'm picky about fish fry.  In my lifetime, I've only found 2 places that makes really good fish fry.  One in northwest Phoenix and the other in North Carolina lol.  Granted fish fry isn't all that healthy, but I want to be able to see the fish, not taste all the batter and grease.  The filet was overpriced and more fatty like a ribeye. Go to a steakhouse instead.   Oh, lets not forget about dessert.  Creme brulee is usually my favorite dessert, it's light.  They now have the Andes mint cheesecake.  The best of both worlds.  Yum!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 10 ounce filet costs more than Steak 44 but quality is more ribeye than filet.  Not worth it.

okprXLvYBm88kgOx9lsLvg.text: Haven't been here a long time not much has changed food is still pretty good for a large chain way better than Red Lobster I have the sea bass it was cooked perfectly very juicy great texture he can tell his fresh the calamari was okay at best little cold when I came out not very crispy didn't like the red sauce the white one was was little better but not much now that deserves a delicious at the banana putting and the bread pudding both are excellent we wanted the praline cheesecake which I've had in the past I think it's probably the best she's ever had but they were out one thing I did notice about here can see everyone has some kind of cocktail they do all of delicious though maybe next time I have to get one now for the service was it very very slow she didn't know much about the menu wasn't helpful I even had to go find my own picture of water I understand that they were slammed busy but I don't know how many tables she hand and she was never really around overall it's better than most places we have in Phoenix bless you up to Scottsdale and pay $100 a person probably be back lunch is probably best time to go little slower and food seems taste better

SAnU_HT1c1Ex2wNkGpa2Lw.text: Granted You shouldn't go to a seafood restaurant and expect a great steak, however every time I go to this place they managed to screw it up. Told the waitress twice today I wanted my steak medium rare and what did I get medium well. The food isn't that good to begin with and I always screw up my order. I wouldn't go there at all except that's where the group wanted to go. Just be aware when you order make sure they understand fully what you want

iXYszt6vy8hmJxiydGNEGg.text: My wife and I just returned home from a fantastic evening out.  We went to Pappadeaux's to celebrate our 31st wedding Anniversary.  Our evening started with the Crab Lump Spinach dip appetizer and a Classic Caesar salad split between us.  Then the main course, my wife had the Brazino on the Half Shell and I had the Costa Rican Mahi and Lemon Chile Crab.  We finished then evening with coffee and the Bread Pudding and Bourbon sauce.  To say the food was excellent is an understatement. Now for an equally if not more important part of the evening, our server. Victoria, AKA: Tory did an exceptional job.  Her knowledge and explanation of items on the menu, and her personality in general made for an enjoyable evening.  We never wanted for anything! We won't hesitate to recommend this restaurant and we'll definitely be back.  What a Great Place!!!!!!

fMBq7ueGhAtA21FAUUCjSA.text: Dined at Pappa's last night and it was nothing short a great. I love coming to Pappadeaux because you will almost never be disappointed. We ordered their Alligator and our server Tammy informed us we could do half of our order fried and the other half blackened. I love gator and hearing the option to do half n half was music to my ears. The versions of gator were great but the blackened gator was magnificent. The Mardi Gras pasta and the stuff shrimp were absolutely delightful. Tammy was an awesome server. She was probably the best server I've ever had in my life. If you have never dined at Pappadeaux before, my first question is what is wrong with you? My second question is why not? My third question is when are you planning on dining their because it's a wonderful restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuffed Shrimp
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Gras Pasta

tSiABXjuRPwKbVhI4NPJZQ.text: Dropped in for HH on a Friday, plenty of seating.  The service wasn't too bad, but the food was unimpressive:  Catfish beignet-  basically just deep fried catfish but I'm a fan of catfish and couldn't tell what was in the batter Crispy orange shrimp- not bad, tasty Fried calamari-  standard Mini fondeaux- best thing we ordered...get this! Crispy alligator-  "tastes like chicken"...it really does.  I already knew this, but tried it for pure novelty reasons Oysters-got a  dozen, but not on the HH menu  We weren't sure what Phoenix had to offer, but it was an ok experience.

ltYBc3CLVnsGlnmwS6asyQ.text: We returned here for dinner and had a much better experience than previously.  This time, we ordered the appetizer trio, shrimp gumbo, the fried shrimp & cajun chicken tenderloins platter, & the 2 catfish plate. We thought that the best thing on the trio platter was the shrimp & crawfish fondeaux! It was really creamy & tasted delicious with the crostini. The two other items on the plate were also worth mentioning; the hot salmon was really flavorful due to the honey mustard that it was topped with & the alligator sauce was really tasty (I've never had alligator & it wasn't for me but it was really crispy). The shrimp gumbo was interesting ... again, not for me but not bad either. Our dinner items we had ordered were good - the shrimp & chicken were both crispy & tasty, the catfish not as much but still okay.  I think that this restaurant, based on the service & food gets 3.5 stars (4 only b/c I really enjoyed the fondeaux!!). This would have been much more impressive of a restaurant if the prices were lower, but I'd leave it as an option for a once-in-a-blue-moon date night option.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 Catfish Plate.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small Shrimp &amp; Cajun Chicken platter.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Gumbo.

9PHGvUsIw2byWxFTSYEgIA.text: The restaurant was busy on a typical Thursday night, but the experience that I got was incredible. I cannot even remember the last time I was here - probably it was 5 or 6 years ago - since I live in the East Valley. I was running errand and decided to visit the restaurant again.  A long long time ago, I was amazed by the flavorful and scrumptious crawfish varieties. However, since crawfish is not on season anymore, I ought to try other items on the menu. I was hesitate at first, but pictures and appealing descriptions of the food got me. So I decided to try Mixed Gulf Coast Oysters & Shrimp for appetizers, along with Seafood Cobb Salad,  Chilean Sea Bass, Crab Fingers Combo, Atlantic Swordfish, Scallop & Shrimp.   The seafood were so fresh, and the Crab Finger Combo was creamy and tasty. Especially, the Seabass was fantastic. To me it tasted as close as the taste of lobster - Well... I may be a bit of exaggerating, but it was moist, chewy, and cooked perfectly at the same time.   Our server was quick and attentive, needless to say the fries came out within a heart beat. I'd recommend this place!

FowSP6GVU_iInI-SVjF70g.text: This place is best Seafood restaurant, hands down!  Servers and staff are very attentive even with a full house. If you are in the area definitely check it out. I recommend the alligator or frog legs as appetizer. Our server Ryan M. Was fantabulous!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu cover

TBNZwShS9Vh-rsjBVD1cJw.text: The Mediterranean calamari is to die for as an appetizer or a meal.  I wish the East valley had a Pappadeaux.  I would go all the time just for that specific meal. The rest of the menu is awesome as well and I love Cajun seafood.

MYsCaRbt-5AHMB1NZ4Bctw.text: It's been awhile since I have been here. Now I remember why. It was an expensive disappointment. The tilapia had a very dirty, fishy taste. Butternut squash dish wasn't appealing. So we left the fish and squash, over half a meal uneaten. Talked to the waitress about the taste of fish. She offered another piece to go. We declined. I'm sorry why would we want another piece of the fish that we didn't like already. Never once did a manager come around and check to see how things were even though there were 2 of them walking around. We felt as a customer and with a bill of over $100 for 2 people they could have offered something to make us feel like a valued customer and want to bring us back and give them another try. The 2 Managers walked right behind us as we were leaving and never even acknowledged us or even said thank you! This would have been a great training opportunity for the new server who was being trained. Overall disappointing experience, sad to say.

R5dajRp-DRo-3f9CD-a3GA.text: So I'll confess... I'm from NOLA & my expectations are always high at Pappadeaux, but this location def missed the marked.   I've been to most of the ATL locations as as Houston and it's always been "good for a chain." But dropping into the Phoenix location for HH left much, if not everything, to be desired.  Drinks: Chain seafood is one thing, but you can traditionally always expect good drinks at Pappadeaux. The bartenders at this place, however, were dismal at best. Ordered the Baton Sweet Tea and the Swamp Thing, and they were so weak that it felt like I had ordered them virgin.   Food: The Mini Fondeaux is typically a great appetizer and a highlight on their HH menu. In Phoenix, it was a barely palatable mix of cheese and mushrooms. If there was any seafood in it, they must have swam away before it was served. We didn't bother getting our usual entrees, the cheesy mushroom soup that out fondeaux resembled was just enough to hold us over until we could make it to a better restaurant.  Service: Mediocre, but met the bare necessities.  Ambience: More monotone and quiet than usual. TNF was on, but with the awkward TV placement, I'm sure no noticed or cared.   If you're starving or have low expectations, give it a try if you must. I'd steer clear otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vino &amp; &#34;Fondeaux&#34;
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bayou Sweet Tea

XvT4fiY21FeLFvAJqGn03w.text: Have to be the best and the freshest seafood money can buy. Price is little bit on the higher side but the quality is as great as the price. Worth it.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K2XZOMwyfcZnVteSn-qupg.text: If you like seafood, then this seems to be the place. Personally I don't eat any seafood but came with friends. To my surprise, I really liked the scallops. They were the best cooked scallop I have ever had, which says a lot for someone that really dislikes the taste of ocean creatures! I love the creole inspired dishes and the warm bread that comes as an appetizer. Service was also great!

sRaFiW0Nma8m-YUmCx2SMQ.text: Ryan (server and trainer) was absolutely amazing. He was very attentive to our party and knowledgeable about the menu. He provided great recommendations and pairings without coming across too informative. He was very kind, personable, and exceeded expectations. Looking forward to being in the area again, and we will be sure to ask to be seated in his section. Great oysters at fair pricing. The cocktails are exceptionally made. A nice restaurant to swing into in between running errands around town.

5C-p7FF_tweR43dEa_zWnw.text: Chose this place for my bdairthday dinner. Only my 2nd time here; lived up to everything I thought it would be.  Great meal, delicious appetizers, and a free desert for my bday! Looking forward to my next visit.

fRiKrZI6sKrgRjcWat1-Mg.text: Awesome seafood, cool atmosphere, and great service. Shoutout to Jordan, the greatest waiter who ever waited!

oC6U4OhKv75opFvM6Wtvow.text: They have amazing seafood. It's just delicious. A little pricey but it is worth it. This is one of the go to spots if you're new in Phoenix.

uMffOap0czeV6PSwnGtKnA.text: Went here for the first time a few weeks ago and was very impressed. Clean and relaxing environment. Staff were friendly and attentive. Their happy hour is good and the calamari is wonderful. I've been back twice since and the experience was the same. Consistency is key!

fbK-9z_-ZHVeCOS5WWpDSA.text: We love Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.  It is our go to date night place!!!  We often bring out of town guests to Pappadeaux's above all other restaurants! The bar is a fun place to sit and you can order full dinners.  We love Jose who the best and fastest oyster shucker!!   Staff is always accommodating and professional!

riyh96gzkrTr3Pfn7M5djA.text: My family and I recently went to Papas for a birthday lunch. They were so kind to let me bring in my own cake! The food was great as always but Im mainly writing this review for the excellent service we had. While everyone there was great there was a stand out server by the name of Wyatt. He was so kind, attentative and patient with our very large party. His service was so excellent because of his upbeat and happy attitude. Its possible to have great food but a ruined meal because of poor service. Well Mr. Wyatt brought great food and a great service! So well done! Highly recommend Papadeauxs and to Papadeauxs management, please keep hiring more individuals like Wyatt, it makes for a great experience.

ze5OWLvUDILMRa5WYDcPcw.text: Excellent food & service, first time, plan on returning to try some other menu items, fried alligator was delicious, the Filet Mignon & Grilled Caribbean Lobster was excellent. Great selection of appetizers for happy hour.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet &amp; Lobster, Probably wouldn&#39;t order the beans or red beans and rice again, beans were very hard

7ohg_BKamoTP3ppvU4pRYA.text: You can never go wrong with anything you order everything is so fresh and delicious service is always on point love to have Ivana or Nick as our server and Melissa is one excellent manager did I forgot to say oysters are he best in town?

7pcd8sOnEcin6Fvm9S-uvg.text: We were in the mood for seafood on a Monday night and thought Pappadeaux would be the perfect place. To my surprise, this place was packed and I know why.  Our waiter Benjamin was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. We were in the mood for some calamari but decided to go with an untraditional version of fried calamari. Benjamin recommended the Mediterranean calamari which comes with a lemon caper sauce, feta cheese and artichokes. It was amazing! The fried calamari was served hot and crispy despite being served in an abundant portion of sauce which was so flavorful!  We ordered a Caesar salad and to my surprise, it had the perfect amount of dressing and cheese! I say this because I find myself always having to order extra sauce or dressing on my entrees because most restaurants skimp.   We were also served a hot baguette fresh from the oven and our server recommended that we dip the bread in the lemon caper sauce from the calamari and it was addicting!   We ordered the lobster tail which came with mashed potatoes and broccolini and the shrimp and scallop orecchiette pasta with asparagus and lump crab in a creamy vodka sauce.  The 12 oz lobster tail was cooked to perfection, perfectly seasoned, grilled yet very tender. Each bite tastes like little pockets from heaven especially when you dip it in the melted butter. 12ounces is actually a very generous portion. The broccolini and the mashed potatoes were the perfect sides for this succulent and flavorful lobster tail. We had just come back from Newport Coast and this lobster tail dish ranks as one of the best prepared shellfish entrees that we have ever had.   My pasta dish had plenty of "tomatoey, creamy" vodka sauce. It wasn't bitter or spicy. It was flavorful with the right amount of cream in order to cut out the acidity and bitterness of the tomato sauce. My pasta was cooked al dente and it came with 4 jumbo sized shrimp. One of my pet peeves is when shrimp isn't properly deveined or cleaned. That was Not the case here but let me tell you about my scallops! My scallops were sweet, tender, savory and they melt in your mouth. On top of my pasta dish were portions of lump crab meat that only because of its color, could easily be missed but the naked eye but not by your taste buds. No doubt that the crab meat added to the decadence of this dish which also had a few pieces of perfectly cooked asparagus tossed in. I truly was doubtful about the combination of scallops, crab and shrimp in this entree has to be one of the best seafood pasta dishes in town!!!!   For dessert, yes we still ordered dessert! How can you pass up dessert when they bring out the fresh dessert tray for you to view?!!!! We ordered the banana pudding. I know what you're thinking. Of the entire selection: key lime pie, creme brulee, cheesecake, praline cheesecake, and Haagen Daz ice cream (I can't even remember the others), I picked the vanilla wafer banana pudding?!!!! Yes I did! The chilled banana pudding is served in a mason jar, is densely layered with wafers, whipped cream ( actual heavy cream that is whipped and sweetened with sugar! No cool whip here!), and fresh banana slices. When I say fresh banana slices, I mean that there was not one brownish, mushy banana slice in the jar! This dessert doesn't look like much but the portion is very generous and we could NOT finish it.  We decided to take the dessert home and they bring you the lid to the mason jar so you can take it home.  Overall the value was excellent! We took our entrees and our dessert home.  Now let's talk about the service!!! Benjamin our waiter was attentive and never needed cuing from us for him to refill our beverages. We always had plenty of everything! New forks for the salad and main dishes, plenty of napkins, bussed the table immediately. I really appreciate when the staff is able to make recommendations because they are knowledgeable about the menu. He was excellent, polite, attentive yet allowed us our privacy. I have had experiences at restaurants where waiters tell us their entire life story. Uhhh awkward! Pappadeaux knows what they are doing and it shows!  I swear to you that I am not receiving any compensation or benefit from this review. We overheard someone say as they were leaving the restaurant,"This place makes me feel good!"  Enough said!

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gGSCawRr_B6F8bLqWXpNIA.text: Our new obsession! Went there for the first time after my daughter gave me a gift card for Christmas.  Now, we are HOOKED! We always sit at the bar, but I shouldn't tell you that because it can be tough to get a seat there already. Not a cheap place, but the food is awesome, service is just as awesome, drinks are awesome. Do yourself a favor and try the blackened alligator. Then try the lobster bisque, then try anything else on the menu. They also have happy hour deals that are fairly priced and the desserts are amazing!

Gl_HcYGyeHyhh1EYmxZX9Q.text: Food is okay...... simply put........ overpriced..... Service and staff is excellent!

P7NqnAli711BulJ7WQTw8A.text: Came to celebrate a graduation with my family! Unfortunately, didn't even make it to dinner. The hostess at the front was the absolute WORST! (I didn't get her name or I would have mentioned it). When we arrived, we were told we would receive a text telling us we have an updated wait time, and to go to the front and they would let us know how long. After waiting 30 minutes, still NO TEXT. We went to check and she told us it would be about 2 hours, and that other reservations had "come in" and were put ahead. So after waiting for 30 minutes, we finally were told we were behind EVERYONE ELSE when hardly anyone else was even there waiting!! Which was bad enough but we would have waited. It was her abhorrent attitude that caused us to take our money elsewhere. Didn't even make it to the dinner to give this place a fair rating. Disappointed to say the least.

4I85sAbSRZhX-pD-KM-APA.text: Its a Thursday night and the kids are at Grandma's house. Catfish and shrimp are two of my favorites and they were excellent here. The place is packed yet the service was still great. I've been coming here for years and will continue to. And The shrimp and crab fondue is awesome!!!

5yfRde8JSwkLD4Nr2-ZcKQ.text: I'm giving this place a 5 star review because not only is the food excellent, the service was exceptional!   I've eaten here a few times and I can't review the meals I've eaten in the past and I'm sorry but my meal tonight was not seafood.  I went for their original Greek salad.  At the bar...solo.  bar help all work together, they all seem happy to be here and they are so polite and service oriented.   My salad was put together right at the bar so not only will it not get soggy in route from th kitchen, I was able to approve of everything that went into the salad.  Great experience.  Next time I will review thir Seafood meals!

AmzMisqDCZmI4Js4MDuWxA.text: This place used to be good...Great even!  Going here was a treat and a family outing because it's kindof far from our house.  But for about a year now, the food has gone down hill a little bit.  the past 2 times we've been here the roux has been burnt!!!  Is anyone else picking up on this??  My Grandma who was born and raised in Louisiana and has cooked creole food for years says she thinks they've switched to pre-made roux from a jar.  Either that, or the chef doesn't know what he's doing.  When we went several months ago, she ordered a big bowl of the seafood gumbo, I ordered a small cup.  Immediately she said it tasted burnt and sent it back.  I sent back my cup as well and had the lobster bisque, which is always excellent.  We thought it was just a fluke or an off night, so when we went a couple weeks ago, she steered clear from anything with roux, but my lunch order came with a cup of seafood gumbo...Once again, it tasted burnt to me...so that was the last straw. Something is off with their roux and thats twice now, spread months apart..Maybe they HAVE switched to store bought roux...who knows. I wouldn't expect a restaurant of this caliber to do that, but something is definitely off with their roux.  If and when we go back, I'll steer clear of it and just order something else.

CzeWub6ZM7JMtcQhdMzw1Q.text: One of the best restaurants around!!!.. Austrailian lobster tails....fried gator...pretty much everything on the menu is terrific!!!. If ever near or passing a pappadeaux's, please stop and go sit down and eat and you will not be disappointed!!!. When in the area this is my favorite place to dine at!!!!!.:)

dN67AMY5lPdcovE99ax3Eg.text: The staff was first rate here, from host staff, to bartenders and servers. I had a chance to watch them for a long time, as I was "vulturing" on one of the outdoor balcony tables: there are three, and they are offered on a first-come-first-served basis. The patio seating was devoted to private functions on the two nights we dined here, and we really wanted outdoor tables, because I have a shellfish allergy and wanted to be in the open air. The reason I mention a food allergy is because of the highly professional and dedicated approach the staff uses to ensure an excellent and safe guest experience. After telling my server, the manager actually came to the table and the manager has to basically be in the loop on the order, which is amazing. The food was great and our experience was delightful. Hats off to this place!

FqG3FG4zCLImEab56A4c9g.text: In town for business, and came to Pappadeaux's for dinner...what a great experience.  Hostess, wait staff, and servers were all outstanding.  The food was amazing.  Perfectly cooked vegetables to accompany the Costa Rican Mahi.  Ice cold beer on a hot, 102 degree day was a welcome addition!  Although we later found out our waiter was in training (it was his first day), he was attentive, professional, and available to answer any questions we had.  Highly recommended.

rafU0O7ny3Q1XsPfiVBdAA.text: Hubby and I were back at Pappadeaux last Monday. Right off the bat I will say that I have never gone to Pappadeaux and not had at least a 15 minute wait. There have been times that I was quoted a 1.5 hour wait. Waiting sucks but the food is worth it. Personally a 45 minute wait is my cut off but if there is a seat at the bar I will get a few drinks while waiting.   We were seated and the waitress explained that she was training so we expected to possibly experience a couple hiccups. We ordered a dozen oysters, fried gator and shared a blackened salmon and salad. Our oysters and gator came out immediately with bread and butter. Everything was excellent. Then we waited for our entree and salad....and waited...and waited. After about 15 to 20 minutes our waitress came by and apologized and let us know that our entree was coming. I tried to play it cool and not act agitated but at this point we knew we would miss the movie that we had planned on seeing after eating. I requested that she bring out our salad while we wait for our entree.   Our waitress arrived 5 minutes later with our entree and salad in hand and once again apologized for the wait. She also explained that our there was an issue with our salmon when the chef split our meal onto two plates and that she would be bringing us out another fillet shortly. BTW, it is nice that it was split for 2 but I would have been equally happy to share from the same plate, however I do see this as an over and above service and appreciate these little efforts. She also offered to bring us a dessert at the end of our meal to make up for the wait and the problem with the salmon. The food was all delicious and as promised the waitress brought out the dessert tray and asked what we would like to try. We went for the creme brulee which did not disappoint. Our check did not include the dessert and we were given half off our oysters. This is why I adore Pappadeaux. If there is a problem they go way beyond to fix it and make it up to you.

6wQFTI4n9obLr6OxPQO5Dg.text: If you looked at any of my previous reviews, you'll see I eat all over the country!  This is one of the few places I've tfound to be very consistant,  excellent service, great decor, and some of the best food you'll find for Cajun restaurant, that has a multi-state presence!  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is its always busy plan, so ahead! Secondly it is pretty pricey $$$$! So definitely bring your favorite credit card,  you'll need it! Overall this is one of the best locations, and the Servers, the Management team,  just really great folks. I think you'll find nothing but a wonderful experience for you, Family, and Friends.

8kXjWNuFNJMgtdtru-myKw.text: This place is always packed so my husband made a reservation to avoid the wait.  This was our 1st visit and the food and service was great.  I ordered the Caribbean lobster tail and he got the deep fried shrimp & chicken.  He mistakenly ordered a large portion which he couldn't finish.  We ordered the sweet tea and mango ice tea and they were the best we've ever had. I now get why this place is packed all the time.

MWleokf33i1apztV-sl-YA.text: We have never been disappointed here. We've been customers for years and have always had delicious food, amazing service, and a great dining experience. This is a favorite of ours for special occasions. It is worth the long wait on the busy days. We'll keep returning as long as they keep up the great service and delicious food.

9KZz_8_0Ak0sbx6msHGp1w.text: I have been here 2-3 times in the past and remember liking it a lot more.  Today, however, I went during the lunch and thought the food was very uninspired.  I really hate to say this, but I think Pappadeaux is becoming Red Lobster with a Cajun twist.  This place has somehow transformed itself from a unique eatery into a full blown Red Lobster meets Joe's Crab Shack franchise.  The only difference is the price (higher) and the seasoning (Cajun) instead of over-salting.  The seafood is no doubt frozen as well.  Sure, I love fried fish and other creole calorie bombs just as much as everyone else, but I think this place is losing its authenticity as it makes its play towards the masses.  Anyway, I wouldn't mind coming back to try more of their offering to prove my theory, but I'm certainly not going to rush.

muJHzN8IO0ooX_2w1wMhSQ.text: came out on Tuesday night after hearing all those positive reviews. I had high hopes for this place especially since the entrees were mostly $18-45 each. I ordered a crayfish platter, a sausage and seafood gumbo, and then a shrimp brochette. My friend ordered a pan seared tilapia. My friend's tilapia had jumbo shrimp and crab meat on top. The tilapia tasted moist but under-seasoned along with the shrimp. The shrimp was crisp but that was the only good thing about it. As for my gumbo, the muddy taste of the oyster ruined it for me. The crayfish platter was NASTY!! The fried crayfish half was ok but nothing special. The crayfish creole part tasted DISGUSTING along with the dirty rice. I tried one bite and then told the waitress to take it away for me. My waitress recommended another entree for me which was the shrimp brochette. It was another huge disappointment. The bacon and cheese wrapped around the jumbo shrimp was so overpowering and fattening that I couldn't take another bite. The manager came over to apologize and took the two items I ordered off our tab but I don't think I will come back again....charging such high prices for bad quality food #smh

lidxDPuwPjXKdYdw29kZng.text: The food was amazing. My sister and I took my mom there to celebrate her birthday. The down side was for a Wednesday night we had to wait 45 min for a table, and we could see open tables this was at 7pm. They should have had all the servers on by that time. But other then that it was great. The food was so good. We had the fondue which is rich creamy. The seafood is fresh and delicious. I would definitely return. Our server was great and they even gave my mom a birthday dessert. Thank you all for the great time.

HQngKUrerDSj_l0Suq-7sw.text: This place has been my favorite restaurant for 10 years.  It's amazing!  I always get the Mediterranean Calamari and oysters on half shell... But truthfully... Everything is awesome!  5 star!  Highly recommend if u enjoy seafood!

1Uh14kOvB1tPUDiEJTjGlw.text: I'm not an expert on New Orleans seafood by any means, but the mixed seafood grill was very good.  Everything was cooked perfectly, which is quite a trick, especially with the variety of meats on the skewer.  I would have saved some for leftovers, but my hotel room doesn't have refrigerator or microwave :(  The only thing I could have wished for is wild Pacific salmon instead of the Atlantic salmon, but I guess that would make it less authentic.  I dined on the patio, so I didn't much of a feel for the ambience inside, but it did seem rather loud as I passed through the lobby...

7eoqMNtAe3rqBbaFeL71Fg.text: I USED TO LOOOOVE THIS PLACE!!!! It has gotten a bit grimy around the edges of late, been around for a long time and they have never really changed anything. The food is usually A+ I wish they would try to incorporate more or any organic food options in their menu because that would allow a lot more people to enjoy the food a lot more often!!  And, it would explain the super high prices :/ WHEW!  $25.00 for 6 medium-large sized shrimp they call Jumbo wrapped in bacon, stuffed with some cheese and jalapeno yea it has the cheese and jalepeno inside...gets my mouth watering at the thought of how delicious it is but is too expensive to enjoy but maybe once a year or on a very special occasion.  Good food but everything is fried and sometimes the dirty rice has weird chunks in it...not sure if it is grizzle from sausage or something else from the meat(s) in the dirty rice..

XsOlw04fJIG32-LEUCG6Ng.text: One of my favorite restaurants. The service is amazing. Place is clean, and beautiful. I love lobster, and this is my place. Manager comes to my table every time with a smile to make sure everything is to perfection,  and they never fail to deliver. Good Job guy, keep up the good work.

wtOuRrsXKdMIhx-jtuXU5w.text: Amazing food. Came here on a Saturday night with no reservations and got in a table in 20 min with a packed restaurant. The server was very knowledgeable of the menu and had a answer for every question  I asked. Great service never waited long for drinks and food came out quicker then expected for a full house. The portions were huge and everything I ate had lots of flavor. Seafood was the freshest I've had and lots of it. Ill definitely be back soon

roUX4F5uPmQM2GlNUt0UBw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!   Get me some lobster bisque and the Mardi Gras pasta and I'm all yours!   Happy Hour here is pretty darn good because the prices become more affordable. I feel that you get what you pay for at Pappadeaux's in terms of food and service, but anytime you can get that with a discount it definitely gets better!   I love all the desserts, but the sweet potato pecan pie with a cup of coffee really makes the evening paired with a side of Jazz on the covered patio.

YlNZ3ajAHcut_qfBZVbc0A.text: Fantastic food. Amazing service. Dominique, our waiter, was attentive, friendly and energetic. We were so happy with him. Drinks were refilled before we had a chance to ask. The fried alligator was so tasty! Ambiance of the restaurant was great as well. Will definitely be coming back!

6-loT3TM_Lh1HQFrG0Hzaw.text: Always a killer meal here. King Crabs for the win! Love the atmosphere. One of our party knew the bartender on duty and he made it his life mission to get to know all of us and take care of us.   King Crabs were cooked just like I like them. Hot and Juicy.

eMOM5g5OK4USZoYkDTyM8w.text: This is our first of many visits to this excellent Cajun Restaurant. on this trip we got the alligator appetizer,  my wife ordered the seafood platter and I the crayfish platter.  Keep in mind you get a large amount of food for every plate.  Alligators is superb with the perfect amount of tastey spice. Slightly hot but outstanding seasoning. The side sauce is very smokey and pairs perfectly.  The seafood platter was excellent. I ate the crab cake for my wife since it was a bit spicey for her. She loved the fish, shrimp, and the huge baked potato fully loaded.   Crayfish platter was a huge portion of fried crayfish and a large full serving of crayfish etouffet. Wonderfully seasoned with perfect heat. Amazing food.  Also had the excellent praline pecan cheesecake that surpasses all cheesecakes I gave ever eaten.   All said and done we had 4 to go boxes that could easily cover two more meals.   I can not say enough wonderful things. Our waiter was so knowledgeable about every aspect of the food and made our stay outstanding. We asked for the manager to sing his praises. Outstanding guy.

0NfJBpuhuqdaQd8WxPQOCQ.text: Enjoyed a yummy lunch and had great great service by Kirk. He recommended the Costa Rican Tilapia and I'm so happy he did because it was delicious.  It was busy, but the service was so great by everyone that it didn't affect our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Costa Rican Tilapia

TEWhvsFPxP-0kW60FLHZmQ.text: I love Pappadeaux's! They have amazing food and great service. We always have great waiters!

LKyOUmAwurMOoJnEaIsIkg.text: We went in early on a Wed. to avoid the rush.  We sat in a bar booth.  They have a good variety of seafood to pick from the menu, which is something you don't see all the time in Arizona.  Service was good, but began to feel a little rushed as we lingered over desert.  We split a Caesar Salad which was very fresh but a bit overdressed and it came with a small loaf of warm French bread..  The 2 different salmon dishes we ordered were really good, well seasoned and cooked to exactly as ordered (didn't need the side sauce.)  By the way the house margarita is pretty good as well. One came out with broccoli rob instead of the green beans on the menu, but  the waiter quickly took it back and returned with the beans and gave us a couple glasses of wine for the mistake.  We finished with coffee and a Pecan Cheesecake which was very good. When we left there were a bunch of people inline waiting for a table and the place was packed. All and all we considered the experience to be positive and will return again. I have heard wait time during peak time can be greater than a hour, so I would suggest to go in off hours or plan a large wait time.

9E5dzb0KBIHxwKCsbYa96Q.text: One of the BEST CAJUN SEAFOOD restaurant that I've eaten at! Vontae our server was spot on with his recommendations from the Blackened Alligator, Cajun Crabcakes and Pasta Mardi Gras with extra sauce on the side. I HIGHLY recommend checking this place out, the menu is stacked with seafood entrees with fish flown in daily & everything is made from scratch. Be prepared for an even more pleasant dining experience if you are fortunate to have Vontae as your server. Can't say enough great things about this place. Kudos to Vontae as this was my first time eating here & in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. N&#39;walins Watermelon Punch
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Mardi Gras
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun Crabcakes

QNQ4M6DuCvAiguADgOLt0w.text: We loved our server and her suggestions. We made a meal out of different appetizers instead of an entree as per her suggestion. You got to try the lobster and shrimp spring rolls they are amazing!

ZHGQQh6VIrIORVIVIlcHZA.text: My friends  love this place . I am always  tempted  to eat there . The wait is horrible  normally  45 minutes . I tried it recently.  I love their jumbo but it is a little  on the salty side . The restaurant  is dimly lit . Menu is huge which makes it hard to decide.  Service was a little  slow

ITDsNO2Ep6CpzpLL3RlEMg.text: YUM!!! Worth the wait if you do not have reservations. The food is delicious and the drinks are very good! I had a Purple Voodoo drink  Apps: Shrimp cocktail, Calamari, and bodain A+  Meals: Salmon with Maine Lobster was good BUT kinda deceiving it came without a lobster tail it was just a FEW (4) LITTLE chunks of lobster.   (This was why I only gave 4 stars)  The Cheesey grits are so good and so is the crabcakes! The dirty rice is to die for!!  We shared Key lime Pie and banana pudding  My husband left his credit card so he ate their a 2nd night and LOVED the food so much we will be going at least 1x month

oHgdjCFpugDfCFtAncLvNg.text: We had the best server I have had in a very long time, thank you so much Brandon for the best service for me and my fiances birthdays! Great service, great food this place is my new regular seafood restaurant spot forever! We had the best gulf Coast Oysters, the crispest alligator and amazing jumbo crab cakes! So glad my parents referred us to this place. And don't even get me started on the Creme Brule ! I work in the restaurant industry and it's rare to have my standards met and damn did this place do an amazing job. Yah.. boo hoo we had to wait 10 mins with a reservation but it was so worth it even the bread was amazing!

oVKPftOlxMgKbdXcljXPmQ.text: We enjoyed the atmosphere with a southern bayou vibe. The menu had quite a selection. Some menu items were intriguing. I ordered the Halibut,shrimp & octopus entree. The halibut was a bit over cooked but tasty, shrimp was yummy too. The octopus was very chewy & I wasn't fond of the taste. My daughter had the filet mignon Oscar & love it. It was just the 2 of us & we did have an appetizer & each had 1 cocktail. The check was $142 which is on the steep side.

rRRT2MFlm4guL4Ytr3mCbw.text: Delicious! The only drawback was we were freezing, the air must have been on 50Nick and Christy were awesome! The overall service at the bar area was laid back and on point for a Friday afternoon. The seafood gumbo w/ andouille sausage was sooo good, as well as the fried cat fish, seasoned, fresh and delicious! My husband totally enjoyed the red beans and rice. We will definitely come back again when visiting Phoenix ...we're still disappointed we don't have a Pappadeaux's n Cali!

lo7xRg-aPInW6kWHaIIvRQ.text: What a night! So I decided to treat myself to some lovely mudbugs aka crawfish during the annual crawfish boil that happens every March to April here at Pappadeaux's. I got in just in time to get a seat at the bar and get situated. The fantabulous Susan, Sarah and Colin took GREAT care of me all night. From Susan nudging me to get the bigger glass of beer (good call and it was an easy nudge) to all three of them checking in on me as I was devouring the 2.5 lbs of crawfish I had ordered. #teamgreedy in full effect!  So between the fabulous bar staff and me meeting some new bar patrons, it was a great night. I chatted it up with about everyone and we even had some skinamax stuff going on at the end of the bar. Funny indeed. Oh and to top off my night, my entire dinner tab was paid for by the nice gentleman I had chatted it up with most of the evening. How very sweet and overly generous was that? ( No,no love connection or anything just a kind gesture with NO expectations!) Wow, talking about being blessed.   I only have about two more weeks before the crawfish boil ends. So needless to say I will be back again the next two Thursdays to get my fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poor things never had a chance!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2.5 lbs of yummy goodness!

_8_JT3b292_OPF3Oo5Wu_w.text: Been craving Pappadeaux's ... I'm from out of town and try to stop by whenever I pass through Phoenix. I have to say that this trip by far was my best experience. From the moment we walked through the door till the moment we left the service was beyond fantastic. Cierra our server was incredibly knowledgable, attentive, friendly and could not have been any better. (Thank you) drinks never with empty food was quick and fresh and absolutely delicious as usual. I eat out often and don't typically do too many yelp reviews but could not go another moment without posting how satisfied we were with our experience. Thanks again Cierra for being so wonderful.

AeAUXgdinRA997X3nekTLQ.text: My first time at Pappadeaux. I LOVED the architecture, ambiance and landscaping. Very beautiful.  My review is a 3.5 stars.  This place is very pricey $113 for two.  HIGHLY recommended:   * Cedar plank salmon with asparagus. * Banana bread pudding in a mason jar! You can get this to go too! INCREDIBLE!! * The pasta that comes with the NOT recommended alaskan king crab legs was yummy. Just get the pasta ala carte.  NOT recommended: * (2) Alaskan king crab legs with pasta. Very pricey and my friend and I were greeted and relayed that their seafood is fresh and flown in. I ordered this item and it was definitely NOT fresh. The crab legs were extremely salty, inedible. The texture was super off.  * Creme brulee - was extremely bland, without flavor and the consistency was very loose, soup -like. Interesting enough I inquired about this to the hostess and she says that's how they make it. I just left it alone. * Mojito (1)  I'll definitely return for other items to try. Yet, I recommend asking what is fresh before you order it. My oder was very disappointing and ironically enough the "NOT recommended" portion was mine. Boo.  Good news my friend shared and treated.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappadeaux banana pudding!! Absolutely spectacular!! You must get this!!!!

8Ndo4TpKX_LuYHhrPL8wxw.text: The Wife and I visited this Pappadeaux  this evening...and i must say i thought the one in Illinois was great, but this one was even greater. It is the only location in the entire state of Arizona...and it is very spacious with plenty of outdoor seating with cool zone fans. They were having a special on Crawfish which my wife had and i had to show her how to eat them...but she really enjoyed them. I had my usual blackened Halibut with the yvette sauce, and dirty rice and it was simply delicious as usual with other locations i have been to.  The happy hour there is top notch as well, we will probably try that next time...but this place while always packed is so very relaxing and the service is spectacular. If it is not on the menu and you want something in particular they probably will have it there, and they will be more than happy to prepare it for you. It is a little expensive to eat here because it is quality seafood...made to order...but it is well worth it. So the next time you want some great cajun and seafood delights make a trip to this establishment off the I-17 South here in phoenix and you will leave happy. Eat, Drink, and Be Merry my friends!!!!
