qfN18F_XNEShPQVoDQCX2A.text: I don't eat seafood nearly enough, primarily because it is typically so expensive, and the pricing here was no exception.  I showed up for dinner at 9:30 on a Tuesday night, so they were not very busy. The restaurant itself was rather large and very nicely decorated. They had a beautiful patio area and I asked if I could be seated out there, but was told it was not available at this time. (I don't know if this was due to it being 9:30 at night or what, but it was an amazing 75 degrees out and would have been perfect. Of course, for most acclimated Arizonans, that is rather chilly.)  I wish I had requested a table as the main area of the restaurant seemed really relaxed and intimate. I ended up being seated at a booth in the bar, directly next to the very loud kitchen.   The waitress was reasonably friendly and promptly re-filled my water cup at least six times. I ordered the Alaskan Halibut & Jumbo Crab.  Within minutes she brought out a loaf of hot, freshly baked bread. It was delicious. My meal came out not long after that. My first impression was, holy crap, that is a TINY meal for $40!  The food was amazing, however. Lot's of flavor and cooked just right. Although I tried to pace myself, it was over all too soon. Immediately upon finishing, I was thinking I could have easily eaten three more just like it. A little bit later, after the meal had settled however, I felt very satisfied, if not quite full.   My total bill, including the tip, came to just less than $50. As I stated above, that is a lot of money for me, and it will definitely limit how often I eat at this place.  I am sure I will try it again sometime however.

RXsN_xWLbqiVDZn9xFhV3A.text: I have been here many times....I keep coming back for the blue point oysters, even though sometimes they are out but I still come back in hopes I will get them eventually...lol The service is great every time, the servers are fast and always willing to go the extra mile.  It's not really your romantic type of a restaurant, the table are very close to each other and it is very loud in there but the food is amazing!

Z-66BCMdtyXV-dQMWEY9ag.text: Delicious seafood and expert staff who know their menu and their food inside and out. Expensive food but that is because their seafood is flown in by airplane fresh every single day. It is worth it. The dining area was a bit too crowded together, though.

A6pdgy7b2bVojgLj-IvpEg.text: Much disappointment :(  This place has great reviews, but I am not sure why..    1) There is poor communication and timing in the kitchen   2) The food represented online/in yelp/on menus are grossly misrepresented   3) Food is average   4) Staff needs training on how to pronounce menu items     I came here with a group of 8.  We started by ordering the Crispy Fried Alligator, Crab Fingers (sauteed), Frog Legs, and Calamari.  The Alligator was the best thing we ate the entire meal.  The Crab Fingers were mediocre and very messy.  The Frog Legs were average, and the Calamari was sparse among a pile of deep-fried artichoke (not mentioned in the menu)  Next up was the Andouille Sausage and Seafood Gumbo, which I thought was great; enough for me to finish my cup.  We ordered meals (I got the Crawfish Etoufee).  1 person in our group got her food 20 minutes ahead of everyone else.  The rest of the group received their food by the time she finished her meal.  The guy who had my plate kept pronouncing my dish "Ee-too-fee crawfish" so it took a while for us to figure out what he was saying...  Halfway through our meal, another person brings an extra random dish (the same dish that the first person received).  Not a single person felt the need to finish their main course; it just didn't impress us.  The pictures on the yelp site and on their menus may have led us on a bit too much.  Thank goodness my phone can make anything look good...

3yEdR_b1MqVrvDnXUymScg.text: I cannot believe these prices for what you get. Pappadeaux offers a lot of food for amazing prices. I got the Salmon Alexander which was some of the best blackened salmon I have had and the other person ordered the grilled seafood which were two large kabobs of salmon and veggies. I recommend coming here if passing through or staying in Phoenix.

Wf6WAXBnErGkTNc-Q45Jqw.text: One of my families favorite spots to eat. Love the oysters and the gumbo. Always a good spot for a weekend lunch or dinner. On our top 5 faves!

lzHLNuGnoF7oyqLCRZz_tw.text: Yayyyy for happy hour and a beautiful setting and scenery!! We love coming here for Happy Hour. We stopped coming here to just have dinner. Their entree's aren't that great in our opinion and especially for the high price. But their Happy Hour and almost all their appetizers and drinks are worthy of 4-5 stars!! My -1 star is for their regular entree's. We love love love their sauteed crab finger (you won't have this amazingness anywhere else, but they only have them when crab is in season,) Alligator (usually melt in your mouth,) and perfect oyster's! They also have Grey Goose Martinis for 8 dollars (happy hour.) The oyster's have this delicious ceviche sauce, it's a must try!! The building is mostly red brick, surrounded with water fountains and greenery!! It's very gorgeous. If I could imagine a restaurant in Louisiana, I would imagine it to look and feel like this. We will be back for Happy Hour as we have been doing for about 2 years now. But most likely that's it. Wish we enjoyed the entree's but the Happy Hour is plenty worth it!!

cwJEVYvKels-B7WGQramwg.text: Unbelievable food for a chain restaurant! Normally we would never go to a chain place for dinner - especially in phoenix - but i could not resist all the pics of their food on facebook.  We started with the spinach/lump crab dip, it was good but not outstanding. I ordered the big bayou platter with stuffed shrimp, bacon wrapped shrimp and lobster - it was excellent (dirty rice was great too). My gf ordered king crab legs - wow - she got the medium and i swear it was a full pound and they tasted great.

eEbfqjcP73WOP5twNnlsdQ.text: Love love love!!! This place was so amazing, I've heard many things about it, so given the fact I would be in the area to try it I just had to. ASX3H_DqFzkqsjqrBjqe4Q.text: First time Pappadeuaxs and it was great! Our server Cristil was fantastic. She had great recommendations! Get the grilled soft shell crab and dirty rice.

vgPcLUKyhE_ntEDrYcEPKA.text: Disappointing experience! Every restaurant has a bad day and this was it for sure. We had a party of 15- a yearly drive from CA for my Moms bday. For over 8 years we have had flawless service, food and management. *see my previous review! None of those were on point this weekend. We had a reservation made a month ahead, we called an hour before to confirm, and checked in when arriving. 45 min after reservation time we were seated. Management was lacking and seemed not to want to take accountability for their mistake. The table it self was several tables with a large space between so we could not even be one party. Food for the first time was really a disappointment. Burnt roux gumbo and crawfish dishes left uneaten. No birthday wishes, etc. Typically on this birthday weekend we dine there twice this time only once. Our family left questioning what happened to the Pappadeauxs we always loved.

MYDan-DT9iZD-uFXrL_omw.text: Ok. Used to be better now I think it's just average. I like things on the spicier side and I think it caters to an older crowd.

_ic6ugZuStkv3_jtroNRXw.text: Been here 4 times and every time it is very good. Steaks and seafood are fresh. Service is good every time. Love this place.

ov31o2ljjhrdhrdXbWvK5A.text: Food is so tasty and plentiful! I think I had a Mardi Gras platter for dinner and breakfast AND lunch!!!

i8t368tScooyz_cSVdUpEg.text: I admit that growing up in a coastal Atlantic town where we caught our own crabs and fish, it's a very high bar to scale.  I have eaten here twice. The first time I had as a appetizer the Oysters Pappadeaux, a variant of Oysters Rockefeller.  I had to send them back- they were way way way too salty.  For an entree I had a fish and pasta dish, it was okay, but not spectacular.  Today I was someone else's guest, but I got to pick the restaurant. June is the time of year when blue claw crabs molt, and when soft shell crabs are available fresh.  Since I saute them when I cook them when back east, I ordered the pan grilled and not the deep fried softshell dinner plate with three crabs.  Traditionally the lungs are removed,  the eyes and "face" of the crab removed, and the rest left intact.  There are also strict rules regarding harvesting of crabs, that their top shell must be a minimal length from point to point.  These softshells had the tops completely removed. The actual bodies of the crabs were grossly undersized, and I mean grossly. One of my three crabs had a body that was only an inch wide.   I don't know if Pappadeaux has crab farms where they raise them, and then segregate them at molting time, or if they are wild harvested.  If they are wild harvested then the crabs served to me were hardly legal, unless they were not from the Atlantic coast.  On top of that, a crab has saline liquid inside of it, so there is no need to put a salt laden coating on the crab before grilling, but Pappadeaux seems to salt them. Eating the crabs was like eating mouthfuls of salt. Had I been the one paying for the meal as I was the first time I ate there, I would have sent them back.  In the future I have decided it is better to wait until I am visiting a coastal area to eat seafood that is brought to market from boats moored at local docks.  The flown in seafood at Pappadeaux has failed to impress me.  The waitstaff was professional, prompt and  friendly. Pity the food does not live up to the servers.

4SKkC8T1MDy0bqwj8UEh_w.text: My husband and I went to Pappadeaux for lunch today, and I have to say I was disappointed. The bread before the meal was dry and a bit stale, and the shrimp in my salad had a bleach taste to it, which was absolutely awful.  We've been to this restaurant before, and had a much better experience, but it's been a while. We won't be going back.

FSLsymDvvvxPnQhJpdQjbg.text: This was my first time visiting and I will be back!  The fried alligator was fantastic, crabs cakes were the bomb!  For the entrees I had fried shrimp and fries and the other 2 in my party ordered bass stuffed with crab & scallops and pea risotto.    The signature cocktails are yummy!

R7LhV3a3pm4cjIe_DcfnMA.text: I treated a young friend to her 1st real New Orleans oysters. We began with orders of oysters on the half-shell and Pappadeaux's version of Oysters Bienville (baked cheese topping). I lived in New Orleans for years, so I was disappointed at the soup-y cheese that couldn't stick with the oyster -- took the adventure out of it completely. My favorite, Oysters Rockefeller, was substituted by their version adding hollandaise sauce to the spinach (yuck!) so we passed.  The entrees went better. I had the Shrimp with Andouille Sausage & Red Beans (excellent red beans!) and she got the Shrimp Po Boy & Gumbo combination. We topped off with Praline Bread Pudding in Bourbon Sauce. Highly recommended.  Service was mediocre. Our server was no help even tho I mentioned it was her 1st oyster outing. I tried to the point of frustration to order the appetizers, and she only regurgitated the menu to me repeatedly. I knew how to read. I didn't know how to order combo raw oysters & oysters bienville in a way she could understand, even tho I've done so hundreds of times at Felix's or Antoine's or nearly any New Orleans restaurant. After waiting 20min for our check, we stood to leave and she brought check to us at the hostess stand, so being cumbersome, I signed for a $75+ bill writing a large 15% pointing to tip line and left. Not a big thing, but my checking account was deducted for a $15 tip instead, which I would have not blinked except the service was not worthy of over 15%. For the $3.25 hustle at the register, they got the motivation to write this review. Sad, as I had looked forward to *my kind of restaurant from my old neighborhood.*  The manager did present himself at our table to clear up an allergy question, and he was outstanding. I told my friend, "Now he's like the waiters usually are in a good restaurant!" Friendly, interested, concerned, competent, professional. Not so with the overly-tipped waitress.

etoVpqP8HGyG_nl4mfS3WA.text: My boyfriend loves to come here for their alligator and even though he's over the frog legs and he'll never eat those again (last time he had them they tasted like swamp is what he said) they have a great filet mignon! Chris Ruth's has NOTHING on them when it comes to their filet mignon! I didn't even need steak sauce because it was so good without it!! We use to make it a yearly thing since we are pretty far away but we seem to be going here way more than our pockets can afford! Hahaha

I3JX5AQRMLj66KtXUM6IFQ.text: Came in at lunch for my Christmas eve clam chowder and boudin, both were excellent , as they always have been. I have tried just about every thing on the menu here , it's always been good, best alaskan king crab legs in the valley. I swear they change the menu  and the prices every few months.   Everything keeps going up, but very , very tasty food. The deserts are all good, if you have room after dinner. I love the key lime pie, not too sweet , or sour.

T4qOyLm-tGzGCf2on8tL5w.text: Bad service, old seafood, crappy drinks. I think that sums it up. Ordered a dry martini. A dirty martini was delivered. When I told our waitress she just looked at me like "so what?!" Had to go stand down a bus person to get water. But mostly the shrimp was really old and the fish was old. The dirty rice tasted like chemicals.

kzL8-uIgvM4nUGLWqYm5lQ.text: My first visit to Pappadeaux was in Houston in the early 80's. Living in the dessert now I miss the great tasting flavors of living on the Gulf Coast and then some. This is the place we migrate to when we are looking for a that type of feel good food.  Both outside and inside is fixed up so that you feel like you are in New Orleans or nearby. Service is exceptionable. Just let them know what you need and / or want and they will make it happen. Grandpa Mark says so. Trust me!  Food is always very good and tasty. We like to start off with a  large portion of fried alligator with an extra side of their special Creole dipping sauce. The complimentary French Bead with butter definitely take it to the next level. Dip Me Baby!  Some of our favorites are anything deep fried of coarse, the blackened fish, all the items they grill, as well as the gumbos, salads, all the etouffees dishes and the dirty rice. Tally ho! The menu is just too big to go over it all.  Yummo!  Last visit with the extended family we ordered the Ginger Salmon, Blackened Mahi, Blackened Catfish. Sampler Seafood Platter, Shrimp and Catfish, and of course some Alligator to get things rolling.  Mention a special occasion like a B-Day celebration for an extra special treat. Hmmm?   This is not a Long John's Pete's type fish place so prepare to enjoy. Place gets really busy and loud at peak times. Recommend going there for an early lunch to get the extra attention.   Mr. Mark ........ table ready.  Ah-YEE!

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch - Blackened Mahi with Broccolini and Lump Crab.

ehzTaAGHE3uyJ32UkgiWow.text: Wow!  What a place!  Their food is way too good not to take back with you as they are served in decent amounts.  They have a great outdoor patios and several areas designed for an "intimate" drink or appetizer next t their misters (a necessary staple here is AZ.)  We drove here from Scottsdale and it was worth the 20 minute ride.  Parking can be hard during the busy hours despite their large lot.  They have great Cajun and Creole style food.

7V3fC5zlwFhKMMDuHx9tZg.text: Literally my favorite restaurant. I'd give it 5 stars but they recently changed their menu and increases their prices.

cpJ8h3HuUo5MDFVfChgr0A.text: Everything, every time. I t doesn't matter what the occasion the food and the staff at Pappadeaux impress me.

LYvHtXrZKAxNUM0SdFbhEw.text: We flew in from southern Cali and this was our first stop. We were headed to Sedona. I have been to several of the restaurants in different cities and wanted my husband to experience the delicious food. Eddie was our server and he was excellent. He shares the history of the restaurant and how the fish is sourced. Our meal was delicious the calamari appetizer was exceptional it was prepared to perfection being crispy and tender at the same time. My husband had the gumbo and  mixed seafood screwers with  rice. Both were delish and ample portions. I had the friend shrimp and catfish. You can't do better than that!  The drinks are spot on unfortunately we didn't have room for dessert but had left overs to enjoy later when we reached our destination. Love this place and the efficiency in which it is run. Keep up the good work.

ArRXhi5uTbLG3EYPFFKSAQ.text: Pretty crowded for a weekday! Had about a 20 min wait. I had the Mardi Gras pasta and it was awesome. Lots of meat, sauce was flavorful and portion was great. I will definitely have that again. The prices are a little high, I felt the meal could have cost less.

etoXIioYvdGwmzFJkKc7Og.text: Went in over the weekend for an anniversary dinner. Prices are pretty high so it's good place for special occasions. It's very busy at all hours so be prepared to wait. The restaurant itself is beautiful. They have a gorgeous patio area with a waterfall and plenty of seating area to wait. I have been here a few times and service is always fantastic! Everyone is very friendly and prompt service.  We got the appetizer trio to include fried alligator, fried frog legs, and mozzarella. Everything was great. The alligator is a must have and the breading is so light and delicious. The mozzarella sticks were huge and tasty too. We also split the mussels in a sausage, lemon, garlic, wine sauce. Plenty of food and delicious. Mussels are huge! Save some bread to dip in the sauce. So good (:  Of course we ended with the creme brulee which was perfect to share and very good. Overall everything was amazing and looking forward to coming back again soon!

fHgfgqBe3YSI_AfHg2kC0g.text: I love Pappadeux the service is fast and accurate, and the food is always delicious. If you're looking for somewhere to celebrate a special event I'd say this is the perfect spot. great for date nights to have a dimly light dinner! I've eaten here for my graduation and my birthday and have nothing but positive things to say. I had the salmon and shrimp with couscous and broccolini, and creme brulee for dessert! Yummm

l_BJULD4JxsMm7cjEHen9g.text: This was my first time eating at Pappadeaux. I was so I g with friends and the wait time was not long at all. Our server James was really nice and took care of us very well. I am giving this restaurant 3 stars because the food was really good, the only problem was the wait time. We waited about an hour for our appetizers and about 45 minutes for our entree's. The managers frequently visited our table to make sure everything was okay and even took half off of the apps.  Overall, the service was okay, but the taste of the food made up for it.

k7zq7YFBviZ9DYjqWXQa2Q.text: There is a reason this place is always busy and it's because the food is spot on.  If you like oysters this is a must stop for you and if you have never tried oysters this is a place you want to try them at.  Great seafood all the way around.  Service has been good every time I have been there and it doesn't hurt that this place is my wife's favorite.

XFMPOEuJ0BZNuc2nR-tz4g.text: Came here for a farewell lunch for a retiring coworker.. and boy is this place pricy!  Thank goodness I didn't have to pay for her meal, dodge that bullet.  The quality was decent, but still miles from top notch.  The restaurant was pretty clean, and the staff was pretty attentive and annoying.  Service was super slow due to it being so busy, and the parking sucks.    I wondered why my subordinate did everything to not come here even pretending that he has the stomach flu and that he was stuck in the loo doing a two.  He knows quality and value, I should of known if he doesn't like it, I probably wouldn't either.  Overall an average experience, I don't see a reason for me to return anytime soon.

GjJRaQNbdr5d8pB20HIK4A.text: Came in with my family to give it another chance. We were seated right away. The ambiance was dim which i personally liked, but it got too dark after a while. While looking at the menu you notice that it is soooo expensive! Literally everything. which is a bummer because you could go to BBW nearby or Olive Garden or Red Lobster for less. We still decided to give it a try again. I had the pasta mardi gras. my son had the chicken tenders usual for kids lol and my hubby and daughter shared the medium sized fried shrimp plate with baked potatoes. It was really busy when we went and i had to keep asking our server to fill up our drinks multiple times and I felt like i was bothering. Our server was a good sport though. We got the lobster spinach dip which was really good. Our food finally came. My plate was huge! Lots of noodles and crawfish and shrimp! The sauce coulda been a little thicker to my liking. It seemed a little watery, but still good. My son enjoyed his food. My daughter and hubbys plate seemed like a small portion. The shrimps were like little tiny shrimps. They enjoyed them, but i feel like chaarging 30.00 for some small shrimps was a rip off. The baked potatoes were huge!! We couldnt even finish them. Overall it was a good experience. It was expensive and the food wasnt like amazing. Probably wont be coming back anytime. But worth a try if you like seafood.

elO7sCOkRlCWXrjpKFYiVg.text: This amazing place almost got 5 Stars. It is honestly a terrific place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. My Brother-In-Law was up from Tucson and had been recommended Pappadeaux, I've been here several times and had already been a fan. I also invited a couple buddies so there was a lot of food to try. We started out with 1/2 doz Blue Point Oysters, really good! They are served on ice with several sauces and lemon wedges and are fresh and delicious. They also serve Gulf Coast Oysters but I love Blue Points. We all ordered Bloody Marys from the full bar, you can choose how spicy, these were very good. My Brother-In-Law started out with Boudin- a New Orleans chicken liver sausage, never tasted it before but I liked it. It has Creole spices on it which I liked (my Brother-In-Law by so much). He then ordered a Catfish Po' Boy- excellent. My other buddy order a Lobster Roll and enjoyed it, my other buddy ordered Blackened Catfish and commented it was still moist (they are often kinda dry) I ordered Lump Crab Cake and really liked it. Another round of Blue Points and we were full- no desert. The service is excellent, the Wait Staff wearing white shirts and black ties. It has a good handicap ramp out front leading into a garden area with a water feature where you can dine. Pappadeaux is a Winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0MzE8QP-msY08nh-zNjSDQ.text: Food was excellent ambiance was outstanding wait staff...not so much.  Greeters were cool...wait staff...aaaaahhhh...  Get there early to get a spot outside they fill up quick.  Bloody Mary after a night out in Phx was right on point.

frnArCL0Y0XMNIXSghmUtw.text: Amazing food and service. Great items on menu. One of my favorite seafood restaurants. Delicious!!!

B3zwezx4day14snwpIVQvw.text: Every time I go here which isn't very often anymore.. I get bad service. I slipped and fell there in their greasy floor. The food isn't as good as it used to be. Way too salty for me these days.  Chefs that use that much salt are hiding something!

S_gBt04BN47fZN3n-9KYLg.text: The taste was delicious however I ordered the shrimp platter...they weren't deveined...yuck! I disappointed that such a restaurant as Pappadeaux's would take such short cuts. Disappointed!!!

I4mC1sohB_dy-c_noPoZ3A.text: This is the place that food dreams are made of. I love Pappadeaux. Although I have not been here in a few years now. Time goes by fast. But, as always it was wonderful!!! Our server was John and he could not of been better! We sat inside although it was a lovely day out. This place is decorated so beautifully , you forget you are in Phoenix. The outside Patio area is amazing and so peaceful. It really just adds to the wonderfulness of it all. Our food was divine! Really good. I started with a cup of the Seafood chowder. Even the Bread and Butter were great! For my meal I had Shrimp and Grits, so good! My friend had Tilapia with Hazelnuts. She let me have some. Oh my gosh! Divine, and I cannot wait to go back here. We even got Dessert and shared it , but we could not finish it all. It was such a large item. The Brownie cake it was.  Lots of parking here, Restrooms are clean and nicely decorated as well. The decor inside and outside is great. The staff are wonderful. I have always had a great experience here.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tilapia with roasted Hazelnuts
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the brownie dessert oh Em Gee!

H0rC2KdJyGxg5C1EriZoRw.text: Terrible service. We had asked our server not once but three times to bring us some bread and continued to serve other tables. I had a side of broccolini, literally tasted like it was seasoned in some sort of sanitizer or poison. I will never return to Pappadeaux. We've had multiple incidents of disgusting food, and feeling sick or actually vomiting afterwards. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

3wWmkiatYcGo_l9-YTEHuQ.text: Ohhh is that alligator? Fried? Why yes it is! Gumbo too! You can't miss this authentic New Orleans staple right new the I-17! Family stays at the Marriott nearby and we take them here when they visit! It's even nice to wait outside because they often have a rather long wait but a huge patio at this location so you can take some really cool pictures if you're willing to put in the wait time. Trust me!

189Sb66r3B_JcG1Q_G-phg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants for seafood in Arizona. I usually have the seafood Cobb salad that is delicious. The staff is awesome here, very attentive and friendly which makes the experience very comfortable.

wRHFjrTyTOWOfaw9RNWmmg.text: 3 words: Chilean Sea Bass. I have always loved this place. The atmosphere is Great!  My fiance and I always get the oysters and Alligator. It is a bit pricey, but well worth it. We go every chance we get. Service is ALWAYS on point! Love love love!

_aA812OijsLiGrz54jg7bw.text: Been here a few times as it's a nice place to take people after a long day at the office.  Food is good especially for those who like seafood.  I would say get here early...it gets pretty busy when the sun goes down, at least the last couple of times I was there.

mCbo38a6UmoA_sFGWMwjdA.text: Yummy...Seafood.. This place has both seafood from the west coast and east coast..  I love their selections.. Their shrimp and lobster salad looked succulent and their Cajun gumbo was to die for..    This is the real deal if you want to eat a seafood restaurant.. Hands down one of the best seafood restaurants I have been too in a long time...  Wonderful very bright atmosphere makes you feel like your on island in the middle of the desert...hehe

W1h_ZYv040ijnbiqRqTrbg.text: My Pappadeaux experiences have been different every time. But the negative has outweighed the positive. On a first visit a couple years ago I went with a group of friends and our children. We enjoyed various appetizers of Shrimp and Crawfish Fondeaux, Calamari and Fried Alligator - which the kids got a kick out of trying for the first time. All was tasty. I ordered a plank salmon with grilled asparagus. No complaints. We did have a mighty tasty watermelon cocktail that was refreshing and strong.   A second visit was a little less desirable. I was meeting a friend for happy hour. It was late afternoon...about 4:30 and it was quite packed. I had my 11 year (at the time) old daughter with me but she was being picked up by a friend on the way home from work so I could enjoy an outing with a girlfriend. There was a wait to be seated and we wanted to sit at the bar anyways. There were a few chairs and we took a seat. I ordered a chocolate milk for my daughter and was told by the bartender, 'she's not allowed to sit in this area'. I said, 'Really? She's being picked up in 15 minutes anyways so it won't be long. She's sitting here.' Not to mention there was a table right NEXT to the bar behind us with 2 children at it. I'm sure he just didn't want the seat taken by a child and reduce his drink orders...but he was rude about it and I wasn't pleased. Almost wanted to leave. The rest of the visit was decent. Had a cocktail and appetizer with the girlfriend and then left. Bartender continued to NOT be friendly.   3rd trip was a date night and my first time trying oysters. We ordered an appetizer to start and then a dozen oysters that came out later. My date gave me tips on how to eat. I enjoyed the first one. 2nd one we both ate...had debris, shell fragments, sand or whatever else might be in the oysters that aren't properly cleaned. We ended up returning the oysters and leaving disappointed and still hungry.

p6sX82Y_RrkV-JrwzI5_Qg.text: Since writing the original review, I have been contacted by the manager of the restaurant. He discussed correcting the problems that I noticed, and sent a card for a free meal. Since I accept no free meals from anyone, I gave the card away to another person who would like to eat there. While I can't give another star without eating there again, the concern of the manager speaks volumes to me. I will be reevaluating this restaurant in the future.

JiYeFnzyc6uTkoURfFldNw.text: Met our daughter to celebrate my wife's birthday. Coming from FH was about an hour and the traffic was congested but we made it on time, 6 PM on a Friday. As we walked to our table, I noticed that this place was packed.  Our server, Audrey, was right on top of things. She greeted us, asked if this was our first time and told us about the specials. She made us feel like we were invited to her house.  We started off with a small order of alligator which my wife and daughter have never tried. I told them it was like a very tender chicken nugget. They loved it., especially the bed of fried potatoe shavings. I loved the lettuce wedge and it's just as large as the one at Cheesecake Factory. My daughter ordered the Crispy Fried Shrimp. My wife had the Live Maine Lobster and I ordered the Cedar Plank Alaskan Salmon. The shrimp dish had butterflied shrimp with french fries and the main lobster was enjoyed, but I think I would have preferred the Caribbean lobster because the meat would be much firmer. My salmon was cooked just right, it only came with the asparagus which was nice and plump. I brought half of my dinner home. We finished off the dinner with a Key Lime pie which was delicious.  Our server had a keen eye. She automatically assumed that it was a birthday dinner, because she saw my wife reading a birthday card and opening her present from my daughter, and comp'd the desert. Audrey made our evening enjoyable and when we go back, we'll ask for her.

TEZtQlrfQXZNO2WmEdjp7w.text: The best advice that I can give is that if you plan to dine at Pappadeaux, plan to arrive early.  This place is positively packed later in the evening! Still, if you're ready to set aside the money to have a good night, you'll probably get it here.    The restaraunt is extremely customer-service oriented with very polite employees who attempt to fulfill all your needs.   They'll even offer suggestions on what items to select depending on what your party is looking for, very helpful!   On this particular trip I settled on the Crawfish Etouffee and ordered a Bloody Mary from the bar.  Between my meal and our appetizers (we went with the combo platter and pan-fried frog legs) I can say that I was totally satisfied by the end of the night.   Things were noisy but we were in the mood to relax and have fun and the atmosphere was certainly condusive to doing just that.     The food may not have been particularly authentic compared to real Cajun/Creole food but it was completely satisfying and I was surprised that my drink was relatively inexpensive for its size and for a bar inside a restaraunt in the middle of the city.   While it can get expensive fast at Pappadeaux, the folks here definitely earn their money.  The live music on the patio was certainly a plus as well.

uHVl2gCmxlttIPyAmhRWDw.text: INCREDIBLE! My dad had been to their locations in Texas and highly recommended we go out of the way to try this place. So glad we did. EVERYTHING we had was to die for. Even the bread. So I imagine you can't go wrong with anything here. I had the sirloin and was blown away. And the bread pudding... Again, incredible!

QjZU0eQz4bBXl4vKELZ_6Q.text: I'm here on business and this came as a recommendation from where I'm working and I am glad they did! The food was absolutely delicious, menu choices abundant yet easy to read and the service was stellar. I had the cedar plank salmon and it was so tender and juicy! A little bit high on the price, but worth every penny!

SKPbWsE_uvL4mzr5xm8w5w.text: Fried alligator no way! Is what I've said before trying it here. We ordered the appetizer that also came with a cheese crawfish n shrimp fondue that I wanted to pick up and drink straight out of the cup. The portions are absolutely amazingly enormous! I was stuffed after the appetizer that could have easily fed 4 people. I am so glad we decided to share our main entree (Pasta Mardi Gras). We enjoyed the little kick it had which we later found out from our waitress she specially adds a little chili flake. If you like the spice might want to ask. I was very appreciative of the mindfulness of our waitress as well as she split our meal for us. The atmosphere is a little loud but that has to be because people love this place. We went on a Saturday night at 10 pm and the place was still full. The hostess told us that they just got over a rush! That speaks volumes. I stand by what Rachel Ray says, "You go where the lines are" it means it's good!

nVSoSyTaz1FaWmOInAJFAg.text: I love this place. From gumbo, to crawfish I have never had anything bad here.  The service is always stellar, I have had the pleasure to talk to some of the new waiters in training and it is intense apparently. They have to have the menus memorized backwards and forwards and be able to answer just about any question you can think of on the spot.  However if I can give one piece of advise: Save room for dessert. Their dessert tray is to die for and they will bring it to your table so you can see everything on it and make your choice, then they will make you a fresh one of whatever you choose.  Pros:  Great for families Great food Amazing Service  Con: Kinda expensive on the wallet

dqw3hXgwdfZo9KazYn7ctg.text: This is one of my favorite places.  Great seafood and great service.  A bit busy sometimes but that comes with being a great restaurant.  Everyone wants to eat there.  And this place has been packed since opening night.  Try the crawfish platter or the jumbo shrimp brochette.  Both are outstanding.  But then, pretty much everything is.

ILjGIzLzbx-vbOWMd8WLTA.text: By far one of the best places out there to eat. No matter what I order it never disappoints me. Most definitely need to try som Fried Alligator.

Zk28y51ZYnrcqd0Fxco9dA.text: First off - the food is freaking incredible!!  Secondly, Daphne (our server) is the sweetest and most helpful gal on the planet.  We were on a quick lunch before we hopped on a plane and I just wanted a salad - she recommended the chopped salad and holy cow!!!  It wasn't just an average salad.  Super fresh, hot juicy grilled chicken - YUM!  Best service!! Third - the spicy Bloody Mary is to DIE.  Ask for Amanda at the bar - she's legit!  Your welcome. ;)

j5a67aUXzuZ7ncE-IJN6qw.text: Came here for mother's day! It was packed but the wait wasn't too bad and they had a band and drinks while you were waiting.   We got Calamari for the app. It was your typical Calamari. My sister and I shared the Sampler Platter. It had Tilipia, Shrimp, and Chicken with fries. We got full pretty fast, and it was really good. I don't normally like seafood, but it was all fried and good. Dessert we shared the turtle brownie...It was a little dry and needed to be warmer.   Our server was really outgoing and funny. It was super busy so it took her awhile to get to us, but she was a good waitress. Made us laugh quite a bit.   I'd like to go back on a calmer day to see if the quality was lacking because of the Mother's Day rush.

zmiUAg5Bm3cfwuScrRtDjA.text: Wonderful place, I always recommend. The service is good. It's our top place for birthdays and special occasion. I love the atmosphere it's so nice. My favorite dish would have to be the Pasta Mardi Gras! I get it every time! Yum!

_eYgHAkGOdzkxQ4LfZ866A.text: The seafood here just tastes so fresh! Great preparation and selection of food. This was the first time I tried the oysters and they were great. Knowledgeable staff too. I just don't like the ambience that much bc it just seems too crowded

mD0Xh66IfkRHPZu7qDAZCA.text: Amazing food , friendly  staff , and the menu always has scrumptious  changes every time  I've been there... mostly when PPL  visit from out of town , or a celebratory date night

rjqwWv51ACPqy9pmrHiwdA.text: If you want Cajun food in Arizona, this is the place to go.   If you want Oysters (remember, in season in months with an "R" in them) this is the best place in the valley to get them!   If you want a giant hurricane with a skewer of fruit sitting on top, this is the place for that as well! What can I say, I love an alcoholic slushy!  My personal favorites are the Pappas greek salad, the gumbo and the crawfish etoufee.   You'll pay a fair bit, but you'll never leave Pappadeaux hungry or unimpressed!

wIs3iORtF7Uil0bPVhrNMw.text: Craw fish season! Came here last night with a couple of friends for oysters and crawfishes. It was delicious. The crawfishes are juicy and big. Our server was nice and attentive. The environment inside however is quite loud since the tables are close by. If you have a large group of people, help to make reservation ahead of time.

22PYtGiJ6XcPuMyl-yyshQ.text: My wife and I have been going to Papadeaux's in Phoenix since 2008.  We always sit at the bar.  We are from New Orleans and this is as close to "home cooking" as we can get in a restaurant.  Our favorite bar tender/server is Ryan.  We always feel like we are seeing family when we see Ryan behind the bar!!!

CoYNZHfRWEI8O8rZ0PHFZw.text: My family took my Mother-in-law out for her birthday dinner on Sunday. We all enjoyed our meals, as we always do here. The food is uniformly excellent!  But I want to address the service. Our server was a young man named Deon. He immediately developed a rapport with my mother-in-law, and he went out of his way to make her day a special one! In short, he treated her like a queen! He even sang her a song as well as joining in on 'Happy Birthday'! The rest of us also received wonderful service! His service was exceptional, even for Pappadeaux's! I had the opportunity to watch him wait on the other tables, and he was no less spectacular there!  Pappadeaux's is a favorite restaurant for this family, a place we can celebrate our milestones and special moments, and on Sunday we experienced a truly memorable time! Thank you Deon, you truly made her (and ours) a wonderful experience!  If you are going to Pappadeaux's ask to be seated in Deon's area, you will not be disappointed!

DG5RsHNXLVU8ql9-57-bGg.text: 1st and fore most I need the address the greatest part of the night and that would be Ms. Jada Woolridge. She was fun, delightful , entertaining, and so attentive. I will always say Service can make and dinner experience great.   Ok now the appetizers mmmmm we started with the oysters Baton rogue, oysters Pappadeaux, and raw oysters on the half shell. All so good I wanted to stop my dinner experience because I thought the flavors could not get any better. I was wrong.   Then the main course the sea food platter. Each bite was fresh fish punching my taste buds with awesomeness. And the sheer amount of food was impressive I was expecting from a bougie place scrawny amounts none no the case. Who ever was cooking my vittles thank you.   Dessert To many choices, it was breaking my heart. I chose the banana pudding and it was the final knock out punch of a prize fight. I was down and out for the food coma.   Pappadeaux with ms. Woolridge and the quality of your food this hungry Hawaiian will be back to accept another food fight.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters Pappadeaux

NSd2QrkAr4ybnfRlZ7z0Xw.text: This place was really good but was too commercial feeling for me to give it 5 stars. We got the crab cakes to start as well as a shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were fresh and fantastic. The crab cakes were good in the middle but the outside of the cake (breading) made it seem like they were frozen before frying. Wasn't my favorite. I got a cup of the lobster bisque to start and it was a small portion for almost $12.  Everything seemed really over priced here. I ordered the filet Oscar medium rare with the butternut squash and green beans. The filet was cooked perfectly but the bearnaise sauce was not good. Didn't taste homemade. The veggies were really good too. The dessert selection is phenomenal. I barely had room but the group of us shared a large slice of the praline cheesecake. Really good!

1dCbkRfMQ5uas4i-IeJV5Q.text: For the price range it was just ok.... I could only order sides or salad (minus the bacon)...because there were very few vegitarian options...I had a side salad..which was good. I ordered a squash risotto however the rice wasn't all the way done it was crunchy so I asked them to cook it longer my server said they couldn't do that....ummm what you can't cook rice more? So I politely sent it back...but the pasta with veggies were so yummy there was like a garilicy evoo at the bottom that was delicious...I wanted extra to dip my bread into but they could do that either....I think I had the lazy crew the night I went so I won't be making any special trips back... But the happy hour menu is good if you eat the meats.

1YBxa1_mrGZYawQcHEZyrQ.text: Always worth the wait. When I moved to Arizona I was super excited to live close by Pappadeaux! I made reservations and arrived early.  I was surprise they let me go to my seat early! This was a Bonus because I was hungry! The service is great. Food is amazing. Cocktails are on fire and desserts are delish! Love this place!

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten free meal with grouper and spinach

DnataSzF-89neTYAfkjS7A.text: This was my first time eating here. I'd always wanted to go but in my traveling I discovered Pappadeaux is a chain restaurant and one was in the Texas airport. After I discovered this the place kind of lost its ambience and it fell further down on my eatery list.  My friend picked this spot for our monthly lunch date and I'm glad she did. I saw shrimp and grits on the menu and my heart skipped a beat. I've been to Nola twice and had shrimp and grits at the same place and the flavor was next level. As much as I was excited about seeing it on the menu I was also afraid it would not hold up to my Nola experience. Our waiter assured me it would.  Now let's talk about the wait staff. I liked my waiter so much I took a picture with him and if you read any of my other reviews or look at my pictures I don't take pics of waiters but he took such good care of us I had to give him a shoutout.   Ok back to the food. The shrimp and grits did NOT disappoint and as I closed my eyes I was teleported to Nola once more. My colleague had the tilapia and shrimp platter with green beans, I have no idea what butter they use but it was to die for.  Now time for dessert. I was stuffed but our waiter said since it was my first time I had to try the praline cheesecake. I'm not a big fan of cheesecake but I trust my waiter and so far he's been spot on. One there's no way you can eat this thing in one sitting, it's HUGE. Two it was the best tasting cheesecake and the crust along with candied pecans and pralines gave me life.  Chain or no chain between the service, herbs and spices this place has won me over.

oAj_2zPGVoDb-tqcYPCfNQ.text: Pappadeaux is such an amazing place to dine at! The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, the food is always amazing and I love their wait staff. I've never had a bad experience here. I will continue to come back whenever I can talk my husband into going!

RS4g31AhUcrlFoWRCaWtFA.text: What a dining experience you'll have at Pappadeaux!   Set off of the 17 in Phoenix, the decor and ambiance will bring you back to the South if you've never been.  The food is an explosion of pure joy that's delectable with ever bite.  The catfish, jumbo shrimp, oysters, etc will bring you to food "O" guaranteed!   And to top it all off, their signature cocktail, "Swamp thing", will bring back memories of the OG brain freeze experience from your fav 7-11's adolescent days.    Warning:  dining here when you're out of state will leave you craving for it's aroma and seductive tastes... but worth the withdrawals.

gbADXTWlypRD2kNTcUzQOg.text: Love the place 2nd visit need I say more. The Grilled Shrimp & Grit is to die for And Banana Pudding is heavenly sweet Love the patio/garden area design even just to walk by.

t-5tVNqIpBn0xyEGZ6ID8g.text: We came here again on a week night for my birthday.  We had a party of seven and we made reservations. No waiting. We walked in and we were warmly greeted and sat right away. Our service Bryan was awesome. As always the cops was top notch. I just love this place!  It is as excellent as the one in the Chicago suburbs.  The food is awesome and the atmosphere is charming.   We had the alligator, crabs cakes, crawfish trio and the 1/2 chicken.  All were fantastic!

9K0_KkHS9WxN0SWl-741DQ.text: I took my wife here for the first time to celebrate her birthday. Our experience was excellent. Our server was Esther. She was so friendly and attentive. She even boxed up our leftovers for us. The restaurant itself is very classy inside and out. The Cajun music was also a nice touch. The menu is extensive with many wonderful options. If you like seafood, I can't imaging not finding exactly what your in the mood for. Our meal was excellent. We had the grilled seafood platter and blackened salmon. As an appetizer, I ordered the lump crab with the grilled cheese garlic bread. OMG, I could eat that for my whole meal! I sure wish I knew what cheese was used. Definitely give that one a try!

KwTudMKV9Wfuw_QpwpBQyQ.text: It was my first time where with a large group and was really surprised with the atmosphere and food. Keep in mind that if you make a reservation, majority of your party size must be present in order to be sat. Otherwise, you'll have a 15 minute window for all of your party size to arrive otherwise they will give up the table. Aside from waiting over an hour cause my friends don't understand the concept of time, they have a large patio area great for waiting. We were then all sat in their wine room. A private room that is honestly really awesome. It's sound proof so y'all can wild out. Because it's also a wine room. Servers will come in and select wine so that can get kinda awkward sometimes. The food was great. Raw oysters tasted fresh and the horseradish and vinegar paired with it is amazing. The filet minions and lobster tail were some of the best I've had. Not bad of a place to come and eat with your friends. If you have a party of 10, try to get the wine room as it's more fun to just have a room to your party to keep it quiet. Will be going back soon.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gjhr3f6sBnPZ9Ea_IlVioA.text: This is so hard... I had my first Pappadeaux experience was February 2018 in Houston, Texas.  I loved that dip. I can't remember what it was but boy oh boy it was suck your tongue down your throat and lick the bowl clean while waiting for the next bowl to come. I could eat that as an entree.   However, the seafood platter was not what I had envisioned. Especially after having that dip.  I was severely disappointed in the coating on the seafood.  That was the first time I've ever left seafood untouched.  That dip though...

TeJy6cROlF9U_XNjQ3M11g.text: Having lived in Houston where this corporation started, I have been to different types of restaurants the Pappas family runs (Mexican, Italian, Seafood), but hadr been to the one in Phoenix so.... This location was my choice for a birthday dinner, so we went and what a beautiful location it is (much like the ones in Houston but even nicer).  Packed at 4:30 pm already on a Friday night!  I chose the fried catfish and paid the tiny nominal charge for a fully loaded baked potato (which I never get, and heck! I'm eating those calories on my birthday).  Catfish cooked perfectly, but the only complaint I have is their tarter sauce is some canned and processed awful tasting stuff considering.  I have a better recipe for tarter at home, so I know it can be done in their kitchen.  They need to do alot better there. Other party had stuffed trout which was superb--and beautiful on the place.  Tasted wonderful, and wish I had gotten that now. Since it was a special dinner, I got a free dessert of my choice.  Not wanting to miss a calorie, got the brownie with ice cream to share with my partner--delicious, of course. Walked out like an old, fat drunk (I drank water, by the way), but was so stuffed I almost couldn't walk straight.  Good food. OK, the place is super loud, the service from Ron was super fantastic--and this place doesn't do the obnoxious thing of not wanting our coupon they send for the free dessert (and then ask for your driver's license to double-check it's really you which I have had happen before at another restaurant)--! Overall, good dinner...just a little bit too loud there which is disconcerting is all.  And get a new tarter recipe, Pappas!!!

dXr6RZkrcDccO2OaWrapDA.text: We loved our anniversary lunch here today. Mia is the bomb. What a great lunch date.   Scot has the Blue Point oysters and I had the ginger salmon and shrimp. It was so scrumptious.

sv1d6oXilejo1FV7ZBPGkQ.text: Piper, our server is the best! Stephanie and Charlotte the two managers on duty were really on top of there business and very accommodating when it came to some items that weren't available at the time of our visit. Food is always superb, love this restaurant.

hky3o5V10x2kpfWgVYmbBA.text: My husband and I went here on a last minute dinner date, and we had to make reservations a few hours ahead of time but that was fine we knew we had to do that.When we got there everybody was very friendly, and they were very attentive to what we needed. After our main meal we asked to see a dessert menu it took  out waiter literally 30 mins to come back with our check that  we asked for almost 45 mins prior. Long story short we never got our dessert menus or even to order desserts, and boxes took forever to get to our table. The beginning  of our dinner was amazing. Food was cooked perfect but very pricey, Hubby and I spent at least 150.

hqbdVHlVz1ftixqPQhW0bw.text: Consistently good we returned for happy hour and snacks. Great cocktails! The oysters On The half shell were amazing. Very large singles and tasted so good. We also shared some boiled chilled shrimp which were great. Love Pappadeaux!

a4vp_N0FtqdYTlka3KNOhg.text: To be truly honest, I would have to say good old Pappas has had a slight decline in service and food quality since its initial opening. This is especially apparent during its busy times, which is practically every lunch, evening and weekends. The wait time is ridiculous during these meal rushes.   The last two times that I was there in mid May and just a few weeks ago, my dinner companions and I haven't been able to sit in the normal dining area due to the millions of people already waiting before us. Now don't get me wrong, the patio and bar area are comfortable but sometimes you just want to sit at a normal table. I would definitely suggest trying to avoid the lunch and dinner crowds, by either showing up once they open their doors or maybe and hour or two before they close them, just about any other time outside of that its going to be a mad house in this place. Another thing about seating, on occasion the host or hostess will try to seat you at a back table next to the restrooms. If you're uncomfortable with that (being a 'germ-phobic' person or just don't like the close proximity of the restroom and its visitors) you can ask for another table, they may shoot you a dirty look, but they'll reseat you elsewhere.   Now to talk about the food. I haven't strayed from my usual dishes all that much, but they're are quite a few for them to be usuals. I would have to say, I'm quite a fan of the hot and fresh bread (on some days it is) and a bowl of their Crawfish bisque. Another favorite of mines is the Salmon Salad, sometimes they under cook the salmon despite how I tell the waiter/waitress for them to have the chef cook it throughly. Other days I'm quite keen on the Po'boys, I jump between a catfish and shrimp combo and an oyster and shrimp combo. Here as well, I tell the waite/waitress that I'd like my oysters fried "hard" (if I wanted them soupy, I would have ordered them right out the half shell) to avoid a soggy Po'boy and I'd have to say 5/10 times they actually did listen and the oysters didn't soggy up the sandwich.   I have a knack of making the appetizers meals. One of my new usuals has been the fried alligator and I would have to say, it is pretty good, but I don't like how they go skimpy on the shoe string fries. Those things are too good to hold back on! Before the alligator came along, I use to order the fried crawfish appetizer, which is about the only dish there besides some of the desserts that I have nothing to complain about it.   And oh my if you think the dessert tray looks good, it tastes even better. I have had everything on there that doesn't have chocolate in it or on it. The sweet potato pecan pie, I must say is one of my favorites, the creme brulee, for the few times I have had it, is scrumptious, and I love Nila Waffers, so the banana pudding is pretty yummy if you like bananas and pudding.   So, if you catch Pappas on a good day and time, I would say you're looking at a 5-star rated dining experience. But if its busy, crowded and the kitchen and staff are overwhelmed you may be looking at a 3.5 or a 4.

0S2PjZQZ_zfhJH7Cc6JPpw.text: There was a 7lb lobster in the tank! OMG! We only get to Pappas once a year so we definitely ate a lot of food. During happy hour i had a delicious cocktail, the cajun fonduex, and the gator. I was full before i even ordered the entree but, i still got one anyway. We ordered the Hudson Platter, The Shrimp Brochette and the fried catfish. Everyone loved the shrimp but i thought it was too cheesy, and i love cheese. The fried fish and hudson platter were the bomb, especially cold the next day. I can't wait to return next year!

LROWSw7f5Q6bj3CeAY6kkA.text: My team of 54 people left well fed and commening on how effecient and friendly the wait staff were. With our large group they worked with us on price and selection. Way too much food in the end. The shrimp brochette over tender and spicy dirty rice- excellent. I hated the fact that I ate soo much of my key lime pie but even though I was bursting at the seams I couldn't help myself. Good food. Good service. Very pleasant atmosphere.

GCgduCJqAkzyQez6ZUAJpg.text: I acually always go here with my mother who absolutly loves this place!  I think the service is great and the food is really delicious!  I am a fan of spicey food, and they totally meet the standard here.  I like everything about this place, I only give it a 4 star rating because the menu is too freaking huge!  I never know what to get since there are so many creole and cajun dishes and they use lingo more native to like Loiusiana, so I don't know what it means.  But all in all a great experience every time.  My mother even chose this place to go to after her wedding.  So cute mom!

zvkpYgMwry0zDk6zsA91Iw.text: Always great food and service.  It's always busy and boisterous, not the place to come if you're looking for a quiet evening...

cCu217JQa4BtVg3T_bCEWQ.text: Holy Moly! This food is sooooo yummy! I came here while on vacay in Phoenix with a group of people. The restaurant is pretty huge and it was PACKED! Good thing we had reservations! We started off with the oysters, which I thought were tasty (though I'm no expert). Then we had the coconut shrimp, which was awesome! The breading was very tasty! Then I had the scallops which were phenomenal! So melt-in-your-mouth with a little kick to them! Finally we had to have the sweet potato pie. Holy Smokes did it ROCK! This is an absolute must try! The key lime pie was also good (not too sweet). This restaurant has quality food and quality service.

FdvV-utXFnJpuBob9NFrOg.text: First time and last...very dissapointed w service and food not good at all...guess that we are  not coming back. Joe's Crabs is.the best.

4ZQ8AyHcSX3RwQs7wI3yaA.text: Recently my husband & I joined some friends for dinner at Pappadeaux's in Phoenix. Neither my husband or I had ever been &, based on our experience we won't go back.  For the prices, we expected better.  We each had a drink but, the glasses were filled with ice & just a sliver of liquor. We all ran out of drinks, including water & iced tea, as our server never checked on us. Everything is ala carte, with a baked potato being an extra $2.60 & even though we asked for butter & sour cream, the potatoes were dry. Our friend's wife ordered a dinner salad which did not come until after the entrees were served & she asked about it. As it was a different server who delivered our entrees, he had to tell our server who, upon finally delivering the salad, lied saying she, "had to yell at the kitchen" for it.  My shrimp, which I was told would be large & butterflied, were as small as popcorn shrimp & our friend's scallops were undercooked.  She did mention this to the server but, at no time did the server offer to get the manager to make it right.  $250.00 meal. I will not return or recommend this restaurant to anyone.

9wrQT1mAauOtdxwXF6OHvQ.text: Three of us went here an hour before they closed (9pm) and were seated right away. We ordered the alligator appetizer and a cup of lobster bisque. The alligator with the Cajun sauce was deli-sh! My cup of lobster bisque was creamy with chunks of lobster in it. Probably one of the best that i have had. When ordering our waitress was very helpful, we ordered Costa Rican Mahi Alexander, Crawfish Etouffee, and the Soft Shell Crab. By far HANDS DOWN the Alexander was the best dish. It offered a little bit of everything and the flavor or the sauce plus the amazing dirty rice. OMG it was amazing and i am kind of upset that i wasn't the one who ordered them. The Etouffee was colorful and deli-sh the crawfish were really soft and easy to chewy plus the flavor the sauce thy were in was amazing. I ordered the soft shell crab... i had never had soft shell crab before. It was pretty good! I would recommend that you put a little of the Cajun sauce that was served with the alligator.

uOG9NySUgY-TrGYqMTZAZw.text: Staff was wonderful!  Waiter went the extra mile to get us waters to-go as he found out we were tourists heading out to Sedona for a hike.  During happy hour, bartender was extremely courteous.  When we wanted to move to a booth, she not only helped us bus the table herself personally, but she also continued to bring extra ice teas.  I really miss the service at Pappadeaux.  If only all restaurants give the same experience.  As for the food, order the Happy Hour Fondeaux, cheesy wine butter crawfish and shrimp delight.  Half dozen Oysters for $4.99!

W8Zftee8s9glXBh1gGw7BA.text: Went there for happy hour yesterday (Friday).  Food was excellent, service was spectacular, and the oysters were quite good.  The desserts looked amazing but when it came time for a slice of cheesecake we were just way too full...  Great prices for happy hour!

TV1q76bPb2Td2fo9A8olBA.text: We ordered the mixed seafood platter but found that it had been "too" deep fried and therefore too heavy for us. We should have ordered something like a grilled fish. Friends of ours rave about this restaurant so we'll have to try it again and next time be more selective about what we order.

Q6bFoKByMJAyn1rCtmTTQg.text: I absolutely LOVE this restaurant! I try something new every time and they've never let me down! Everything from the fried alligator to the crawfish to the costa rican tilapia w/ lobster taste like a little piece of heaven!!

tPhwcA9i3iD7C_0pRViEJA.text: amazing food and  good drinks! Service was incredible! Definitely try the gator! and Sea bass!

b7fckU0GFBu1seuaM1eiQQ.text: My wife and I stopped in here on Saturday night after the D'Backs game and were told there would be an hour and half wait.  The very visually frazzled hostess kept her composer and let us know that the bar area is first come first serve so we decided to try there.  We scored some seats within 10 minutes and were immediately met by Sarah the bartender and the smiles and service never stopped.  Based on our questions Sarah knew it was our first time and really explained their menu and how everything works.  Our whisky was 10$ a glass but based on the "long pour" it was worth it.  There was a mistake in the kitchen and someone miss ordered a crab legs, we scored because Sarah brought them to us to try.  AMAZING... I ordered a sampler trio as our appetizer and the wife loved it all until she realized it was not breaded chicken and little chunks of lobster in the seafood fondue (I may have led her on a little) but rather alligator and crawfish.  The smile on her face (maybe the whisky) or just the general fun atmosphere and the food quality was well worth the total bill at the end of the night.  I can't wait to go back...

8GrDgkdc_cdcup1m2hlbDg.text: My wife and I have been there twice within the past 2 years, the second time to see if they could redeem themselves after our horrible first visit.  Service ~ fair: our host never established eye contact and it felt as though we were being seated at a buffet. Our server - although very nice, was inept. Appetizers took 30 min to arrive, then she asked if it would be okay the serve our main courses at the same time. We said no and continued. We finished our appetizers and about 20 min. later the server made to back to our table. Our main course meals were horrible both overcooked overcooked, reheated or whatever, not edible. We spoke with the manager, returned the food, paid and left. The bill would have been $100.+ for very substandard food but the manager did credit us for the bad food. Our server never offered to refill our drinks (beer and mixed drink) pure profit for the biz. We left once again disappointed with service and food. The thing is my wife wants to give it a (perhaps final) try again today (about 3 months from the last visit. I will report back

JySuEg-lpU0mxbWuZmTXlA.text: Pappadeaux is an old favorite of mine.... good menu and good prices and good service.... my last visit was no different... Jane our waitress was perfect! knew her menu and was able to guide us through our choices... will be going back!

4QE1FL65xPUh85nBYBniXg.text: My first experience with Pappadeaux was ~6 years ago, just after moving to Phoenix (I worked nearby and drove past it every day). Try as I might, the only remarkable thing I can recall about that meal was the alligator and was unimpressed with how chewy 'gator is.  Fast forward to the present: five stars for ambience and freshness of seafood, three for value, one for finding a myriad of extraneous items in my entree. I had ordered the Blackened Catfish Opelousas (with oysters, shrimp & crabmeat in a lemon garlic butter sauce with dirty rice). I found a mini pearl (which I promptly lost when it rolled off my napkin) and sliver of something hard like shell in the butter sauce, and a small oddly shaped nugget of God-knows-what in the dirty rice. I'm still confused by that last unknown item. No, it wasn't an uncooked grain of rice; it was shaped somewhat like a dreidel and about the size of a mustard seed. It was in one of the last bites of food on my plate and left a poor impression in my mind as I left.  The girlfriend and I ordered bloody marys and a dozen oysters on the half shell LONG before our waiter returned for taking our entree request. Drinks came first, then an apology about why it was taking so long to get the oysters shucked. On the second return to apologize for the delay, we put in the rest of our order. A third return to apologize included a loaf of their french bread. The bread was phenomenal, and went well with our bloody mary drinks - but between their house bloody mary and the Absolut Cajun Bloody Mary, go with the house version. It's $2 cheaper and virtually no difference in spiciness - which was a disappointment to me because I really like bloody marys to be quite spicy. The oysters arrived a few minutes before our entree, and at $9.95 per dozen they're a rockin' bargain despite their delivery being late.  I don't understand how people think this is a cheap place to eat. All one has to do is go to their website to see prices up front. Entrees are generally priced $19.95 - $24.95, although steak items are significantly higher. Adding a drink - not your obligatory diet Coke, but a REAL drink - and tax, AND tip, pushes the price easily into a 3-dollar sign tier. Unless, of course, people opt for the cheapest items on the menu, ask only for water, and tip a mere 10%.  I'll return, but only for happy hour and cheap oysters.

4LC7mF50192oLEytFbeo2A.text: This is my hubby's go to place for seafood.  Love the fresh oysters and fish. Service for the most part is pretty good...it can be spotty in the dining room.  Food is consistently great every time.

3M8SfJw9xPY3LHOVs_hFXQ.text: My hubby and his friends are huge fans and they took me there 2 days ago for dinner.  Disappointed, I would say.  To me, it is just another Cheesecake Factory restaurant NOT in terms of food portion but the style: noisy, dark, crowded.  For those of you who have never been to Pappadeaux, I still think you should go experience.  Try especially the dirty rice.  Would I go back?  Probably not.   I just hate talking to people by yelling and being not able to see the food clearly.

9jAM9vm5qybum-7XF607dg.text: There is absolutely nothing bad on the menu. Try the blackened alligator, really delicious. Giant shrimp and grits is my favorite. Pasta Mardi Gras is another favorite.

Z7vAKb72CNDfAgGI_JsyRA.text: Worst experience !!! My server Erin was awesome! My food was delicious! But, yes and there is a but, there was a family with a screaming 4-6 year old girl ( at the top of her lungs, the sound that hits the nerves in your back) she was at the lobster tank and her father was teasing her with the lobsters and taking pictures and no server or manager did a thing about it. So I complained and the manager did nothing and her excuse for doing nothing was lame! Manager, Kathy Belford, her excuse was this is a family restaurant . Like it's a Pieter piper pizza, which I would expect at Peter piper pizza. I spent with tip, $145.47....... Papadeaux thanks for the wonderful entertainment not I'm never coming back!!! Kathy Belford, you must be a millennial!

OvR13nFlzOgtBmozR3_3lg.text: Expensive, but worth it Everytime! Dessert is yummy and meals are great. Kind of a dark setting, but delicious nevertheless. I would however recommend making an appointment cause the wait time could get long of you just walked in. Most things have some extra spice to them also, being a Cajun Resturant it was to be expected, but the gumbo was very spicy, almost too spicy even for me. Delish however. No complaints at all. Great service, ambiance and experience.

EQHmFYLbJtN-TRPz19B2oQ.text: We know it is a chain, but the food is consistent and good.  It is a little expensive and can get crowded.

IzW0KImpcFN_i4tOAwXT-A.text: A welcoming spot, strangely bare on weekends.  We don't have this place around our area so visiting r there is nothing much for me to complain about. Gumbo is quite tasty, the bread I think was complimentary but I devoured like it was a meal.  Drinks refreshing and pretty strong.  We got lucky and got a great server, so service was attentive.  Stay put, Papadeaux, we will be back!

It's so worth the drive

H_7SCUJjvdrEbJfT7CjDJQ.text: Great date night spot or get together with friends place!  Food is good, not cheap but not overpriced...  Cool spot and the food is great!

znImVSdlCDl5UF5W-TEtQQ.text: Probably the most expensive food without the flavor.  Maybe it was my dish?   Blue crab...  spongy and boring.  Thank goodness for the baked potatoes &dinner rolls...   that's all I ate.  Definitely won't be spending big bucks here...Red Lobster is better ...

7Z5ql9TN6KJ-uYuu2BzJNA.text: Let me start out by saying that I don't like chains, but I do like Pappas. However, living in California, I rarely have a chance to patronize them. Was in town visiting this past weekend, so I finally had my chance. Turns out that we liked it so much on Saturday that we came back again the next night on Sunday!  In order to avoid the wait. we had reservations both times. On Saturday, Andres C. Rodriguez was singing and playing some beautiful acoustic guitar, so we decided to sit outside to listen. Even though it was over 80 degrees, it was OK, since the sun wasn't on us. Colin was our server, and he did a great job. Good selection of local beers on tap in 18 and 12 ounce sizes.  Started with Oysters Pappadeaux with crabmeat, spinach & hollandaise, which was absolutely insane! Mom and I agreed that it may indeed have been the best single dish that we have ever eaten and a good value at $13.95 for six. Despite the cooking, the oysters were still juicy and not overdone. I had the amazing Seafood Platter, which included Fried tilapia, shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab with French fries. So much food...I couldn't finish it! Had the fries and one of the tilapia fillets for breakfast! The tilapia was very lightly breaded and perfectly fired. Still very juicy inside. Perhaps the best fried fish anywhere. Mom had sauteed soft shell crabs with dirty rice. No...room...for...dessert!   On Sunday, we went inside. Nice cozy, dark space. We tried to be clever, but we still over-ordered. Started with the complimentary warm baguette and the small Greek salad, which was expertly assembled table-side and was 100% crisp and fresh. Shared a full bowl of seafood gumbo. Amazing flavor, with okra, crab and tons of shrimp! Followed by Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes over crawfish in a light butter sauce ($23 for two) They were served with a garnish of potato sticks and a bit over-wrought for my taste. No need for breading...these deserve to be broiled. Loved the sauce...mopped it all up!  For our entree, we ordered the Crawfish sampler which was half fried crawfish and half Crawfish etouffee over dirty rice. Took a few bites of the fried while it was warm. It was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. No need for extra sauces. Took the rest to-go. Etouffee had tons of large, juicy tails. It was delicious, even when re-heated in a microwave (I know, god forbid!!!)  One of the good parts about a chain is consistency, in food quality and service. Both were made very clear at this location. The prices aren't cheap, but it's not ridiculous either. Both times, our bill for two, with drinks was in the $90 range. Wish I lived closer. I'm now dying to find proper Gulf Coast seafood in Los Angeles...it's not easy!

p0GVtdAEl8RYxrC8r1P-FA.text: Was it craving satisfied? Yes, indeed. This place took us down memory lane to our many trips back to New Orleans. I'm in love with their Mardi Gras Pasta. I even had left over sauce that I ate with rice it was so tasty and delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crime Brule. It was just ok.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Gras Pasta was a bomb. Sautéed crab fingers was  delish. Gumbo, Rice and Beans and Sausage hubs enjoyed it.

A44uF7ho2r4FMfGSSEo5QQ.text: Love the food and atmosphere. You can't go wrong. If there is a long wait love to set at the bar. It does get a little noise but it fits .

m5Dd8Tu02NNnH1UHvNdTwA.text: A friend recommended Pappadeaux when I asked him where we should go for our anniversary dinner.  The restaurant itself is beautiful both inside and out.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and seated very quickly.  We didn't love where we were seated though, feeling as though we were in the middle of a walkway.  The dining room wasn't very full when we arrived, so we think we could have been seated in a less busy location, but it is what it is.    We ordered the fried calamari appetizer and we're a bit disappointed in the size for the price.  There was a lot of just batter prices and fried artichokes (something we'd never had in calamari before), and not as much actual calamari.  We were concerned that our entree might be lacking too, but they most definitely were not.  I ordered the Texas redfish Pontchartrain which was delicious!  It came in a le!on butter sauce with some shrimp and crabmeat and dirty rice.  Hubby ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette, which was bacon wrapped shrimp filled with Monterey Jack and a jalapeno sliver with dirty rice.  He really enjoyed his as well.  The entrees were a great size.  For dessert we had creme brulee, which was very good too.    Overall, a very good meal and we will probably return, although we're not likely to order the calamari again.  And really, we didn't need an appetizer because they brought out warm, crusty French bread and that is really all the appetizer we needed.

E1z2EVeDjs8W8lwUXY_LJQ.text: Love the food great service however when we asked for to go boxes our server took our food in the back for about 10 minutes and then returned without food I did not like that it make me nervous

qZwf-MwJFfYg3DJnl-sGqg.text: We went in for a light dinner and some drinks. It was happy hour, but that never applies to anything we are drinking. Grabbed some lobster bisque, sausage & Seafood gumbo, and a shrimp po'boy. I was kind of in the mood for a half and half (shrimp and oyster) po'boy but that wasn't on the menu. I'm sure they could have done it, but I was honestly too hot and tired to fuss. Tossed back an Abita and a Blanton's bourbon while m' lady sipped her 12 year old single malt. The prices are steep - so get ready if you aren't having lunch specials or happy hour items.

KlX4X8OdzNUAI9FAi24vlw.text: Okay so the wife and i decided to come by for lunch on the day of the Eclipse.....and once again our dining experience was incredible...scallops seared to perfection...Stone IPA in the coldest frosted goblet ever....The wife ordered the crab fingers as usual with Yvette sauce on the side....magnifico....!!!! Our server Jaclyn was flawless....God bless this woman what a great personality.... Destiny our usual bartender was the floor manager now and they couldn't have made a better decision...thanks for a great time folks...see u next time...

PfsE1iQI7TFgXL0u0aeq0Q.text: Shrimp po-boy all the way!  The bisque is good too!  I love this place. 1/6/15  Back again!  Still great!  1/31/16

eYByvvYuXEVW-byEVb8D6g.text: Really clean place to go out and enjoy lunch. Really good service and amazing seafood really recommend to anyone living in the valley

81zkpkvQccW7TLQfInqaeA.text: This spot is as good as it gets for Seafood in the West Valley, nothing else to say!  AMAZING in every way!

1TUnasOHDEpR8qMnIShJqg.text: Best steak and lobster!! Fried alligator appetizer is amazing!! You wanna impress your date while indulging in a fantastic meal? If so, this is the place to go!

ckrTrC-j_ota-HbPqDupQQ.text: My date took me here last night as I was craving it and wanted to have a nice belated new years eve dinner date as he just got his car earlier. The place was busy, but not too busy where it was too loud to have a conversation. The date was a success given how our server, Josh (remembered the name written on the order card placed on the table) made it amazing. As it was my dates first time here, he gave him a good introduction to the menu and the specials. He also gave us plenty of time to look over the menu and decide what to get. Our food was delicious and gave us leftovers for days. He even remembered my dates side of green beans he didnt get upon serving our food when we both didn't. The wow factor that earned him a 20% tip was that when he was about to pack up our leftover banana pudding, which was divine btw, someone took it and threw it away. So he got a new one made for us on the house and split it in both takeout boxes so me and date had half each to take. My date thoroughly enjoyed his food (and enjoyed the stuffed crab I had as part of my meal) and he would definitely come back again sometime. Great service throughout my meal and the table wait bartending service when we had a pre dinner drink.

05SM5HzKO-QAhRQXRb2ApQ.text: This place is the best if your in Phoenix don't miss this place. James our server was the best server I've had in a long time.

aH512ktIa2nBUez_4Au5Gg.text: Came here for dinner on Valentine's Day. Of course there were a lot of people so our wait time was about 45 mins. While waiting I had a swamp thing from the bar..that drink was so good. We were called in about exactly 45 minutes and it was definitely worth the wait. The food was fantastic. I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras. It was a large portion so it was enough for 2 people. Our waiter was very friendly and he gave me some beads in celebration of Mardi Gras. I hope to come back again soon!

Qf9y-yeyFWDOPKyQtu4q1w.text: What a great lunch. Service here was impeccable. Our server, Ariel was very attentive, super polite and such a sincere, friendly smile! It was two of us and we ordered an appetizer, entrees and was sure to stop early so we could have dessert. Ariel even put our leftovers in a container with ice since we were going to a movie afterward. Very nicely done all around. Oh yeah, the food. Wonderful. Flavors that explode. Carefully devised recipes that resulted in truly satisfying mouthfuls bite after bite. Well done. Slow clap. Where's my pillow?
