v2MpTKgm9dSQ_VSllD-ZNg.text: We had a great time food is good a little pricey but atmosphere service worth it we had a private room by luck it's real loud there but exciting definitely worth it. 5 stars is taking everything into account, server Vivanita  (I think) was great she handled table of 9 separate checks never rushed us. I had shrimp etouffe was good and spicey decent portion  gumbo was awesome  (small portion) we were in the wine room which was wonderful because it was private except for servers getting wine every once and a while. Well worth it, the restaurant itself large vibrant bar activity and people watching on a Friday night was great. Diverse crowd was beautiful. Keely the manager also was very nice.

uSJUvolJzsNUKNkC_cVImg.text: We visited Pappadeaux last April.  The old man and I were visiting  from out of town.  Well we chose to visit during some kind of bike week. Reservations were out of the question so we were put on the wait list. We waited about 2 hours before we were seated. But hey it is what it is! Once we were seated things started running like clockwork. Like I said the place was bursting outside of the seams. However our server treated us like we were the only people in the house. Its been over a year since our visit. The food was good,  I totally forgot what we ordered with the exception of  a Greek Salad that I split with my brother. It was massive. So 5 stars here...We are visiting Phoenix in July. I will be calling ahead for reservations and plan on going to lunch as well as dinner.

hCUkK4NYPyCWOYM0RdDQmQ.text: Food was excellent and staff was very friendly and attentive. We never had empty glasses, food came out hot and fast (but not too fast). It felt pretty cold inside, but I guess that kind of goes with the whole atmosphere of the resturant. Would not hesitate to recommend or return.

azVxFhqLu3KvnXNZBClOrQ.text: The fact that the tilapia was the best tilapia I ever had. And the crab cake with fresh crab sprinkled with lobster chunks. My bf got the salmon that was about a foot long covered in scallops and scrimps definitely coming again and again and again lol. Tons of leftovers

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papadaux #bestfoodever. Phoenix AZ

3V_UVs2Su0NI_VDvK4SL9g.text: Great service, delicious food and fresh seafood.  Our waiter gave us the heads up that the Crawfish Etouffee is spicy and the item most sent back for heat.  He suggested a trio of crawfish:  fried, ettouffee and cream sauce.  Good call because it was definitely spicier than I like.  I would definitely go back to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.

_t0jQUlKl_y-41GneFstTw.text: We used to live in Illinois and would frequent this restaurant every week. We were so excited that it's now in Phoenix.   We don't go weekly, but we try to get there as often as possible. There are so many things on the menu that we love.  Great atmosphere, consistently great food, and live music on the weekends.

9KVh_Sqi7vep_zOIdLuS-w.text: The most amazing food!! Wonderful atmosphere. Service was wonderful! I had the Halibut and spaghetti squash and my boyfriend the oysters. Will definitely go back!! Wish they had one I the east valley hint hint, but the trip was worth the drive!

xuMBw7EkMHUkOdI-2sKz0Q.text: I just don't see how this place gets so much credit. Maybe the illusion of how good it is is set by the high prices. Having lived in Louisiana for 18 years, this place doesn't do Cajun a whole lot of justice. Yet it's always packed which makes it less appealing in my book. There is no desirable ambiance and the tables are snugged up together too tight to make conversion at your own enjoyable.  There are more atmosphere friendly places in the valley with much better food and much better prices, like Baby Kay's. Spices are much more spot on as well.

i4Y-E6ZDOStR8XcPpJPuew.text: The food was very good, but overpriced. The out door area is beautiful! The service unfortunately was not so great. Everything seemed to take forever!!!! Not sure if that was our waiter or the kitchen, we were surprised he hadn't put our daughters dessert in when we asked while we were about done with our entrees. The time delay ended in us not trying dessert and cancelling hers simply because we didn't want to wait another 30 minutes just for that too.

kw6lEm9otw1PhhMG46Ww4g.text: Wonderful oysters, amazing staff and lovely company.  Will be returning soon!  We sat at bar and table and both were romantic atmosphere.  Enjoyed the alligator and lobster also.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OPsAnnabQx5fW62dRwNsDQ.text: I frequent the Pappadeaux in Denver which has been consistently excellent over the past 10 years.   The Pappadeaux here in Phoenix, while "never" up to the standards of the Devnver franchise, was always worth the trip. Not so on my past 2 visits, while the ambience is still up to standard, the food quality, service, and bar energy has dropped off a cliff.   The place was still packed with customers, I guess there's no accounting for taste.  I can't see myself going back.

ibVggUrakDk-_cI_x4n1nA.text: Food and service is amazing!  Waitress Audrey was excellent!!!!  Everything that is seafood is so good. I cannot wait to dine here again next!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy classic oyster
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is fella good oyster
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nwalin punch

Hj9FOAz0_zhxl03z3-8d2w.text: So I have been here twice in as many months, my gf dad, loves this place...I think it is OK. I liken it to an overpriced red lobster.  The service is ok. And this place is always busy, so you can expect a few hiccups with service being slow, or your waiter forgetting something simple like bread or silverware or water.  They are trained well, but I think are often overwhelmed, often times you have to ask someone to come remove plates to make room for new stuff, once again if they were not so busy or had a few dedicated bussers, I don't think this would be an issue. But alas it is.   Food, the food is just OK, I know people that rave over it, I just don find it that appealing, I am a huge fan of gumbo, so the last time I was here, I ordered the shrimp gumbo, only to end up almost cracking my tooth on a piece of bone from god knows what was in my gumbo. It might have even been a piece of the bowl as far as I know...  This last time similar experience got the rainbow trout and shrimp, Loaded with butter almost drowned it, and bones thru out...does not make for a good dining experience. This place is ok, but for the prices I would expect more attention to be placed to small details. Will go here if invited but have experienced better seafood places throughout the valley. And if I had to choose I would go there instead.

K6gLzhB6hfUgZas-ytYnlA.text: Update!!!! so upper management reached out to me after reading my review. We spoke and they were very helpful and expressed concern about the situation that occurred. I'm really glad that someone at the corporate office took the time to do so. I will not let this experience ruin the brand name for me and will visit other locations   . Ok Yelpers by far this is the worst pappadeux I've ever been to! The waiter we had was horrible the food was cold. I just can believe that I'm writing a bad review. The service was so bad that we did a FIRST, ZERO TIP... Let me explain. My moms order was totally wrong.  She ordered catfish and got crawfish yes they both start w a "C" but she also said blackened so that should've said she wasn't saying crawfish. Ok skip the fact that we were never asked if we wanted drinks or appetizers, he just bought us water. Then after eating COLD food we asked for to go boxes. Waite boxed our food and just scrapped everything off the plate including garnishes into the to go box, mixed all the food together. I'm talking catfish tomato shrimp and rice and everything all together and basically said "HERE" don't ask me what my waiter looked like bc he didn't spend more than 5 min total at our table. Maybe it was my waiter but ILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT (in Phoenix) EVER!

WVPKwTbKP8bRaRukBSr8uQ.text: This location (Phoenix) was having kitchen issues that night, but the manager came by and apologized and took items off our bill. Food was good. Service has never been an issue at other locations I've visited (Houston, Chicago, Atlanta)

xfUs1Vd2e2RqADrM0gwIXg.text: Get here early or late, othrerwise a 630pm arrivals nets an hour and 45 minute wait. But it is worth it!  My husband and I used to visit Pappadeaux every Friday for the past year or two, until we recently moved to CA and I almost didn't want to move because there is no Pappas in the East Bay area of San Francisco/Oakland CA. BUMMER!!!!   I highly recommend the soft shell crab, the mixed grill skewers, Salmon Yvette, and the andouille grits! We usually sit at the bar and have Nate, Susan, Rich, or Le Andrew serving us. Great atmosphere, great food, great service.   WE MISS YOU PAPPADEAUX! We will make sure we visit whenever we are visiting Phoenix, AZ again.

o1e6dDGfI01qvIYYhVimJw.text: Loved it! I had a reserved a table in advance and we were able to get a table outside in one of the balconies. Super gorgeous! The food was delicious and very rich. Will definitely come again.

c3qydyzoW1s8MKg1-IpqkA.text: The food was amazing. Date night was a blast. Food was hot and we did not have to wait long. Drinks were not watered down. Atmosphere was very delightful.

cgEVYMorXSuDwXyGN1g0mg.text: This place. I was seriously looking forward to this restaurant. From the reviews I read, pictures I've seen, I was very excited to try it out.   I initially called to make my reservation, within seconds of speaking with an employee, I received a text confirming my reservation. I received a text a day prior to my reservation as a reminder. I thought all of that was very cool.   Walking into this restaurant, I was shocked to see how full it is. Which leads me to my review...   Let's have a seat, shall we?!  We started off with the Calamari. Large sized. Which cracked me up when it got to the table. The large size looked like the medium size. So I'm not sure I would want to see what the medium size looked like. Was it a "large size" because it had two small bite size pieces of fried zuchinni? The calamari, which I heard was the very best, was mediocre at best. It wasn't all it was made out to be. The little fried bits tasted like churches chicken. Not cute.   Onto my main course. I got the Mardi Gras pasta thing. It sounded amazing, looked amazing, smelled amazing, however, it wasn't as good as I had hoped.   As with other reviews I read, the lobster tail is overcooked. It tasted as if it was previously frozen, cooked, and then left under a heat lamp until it was chosen.   The cheesecake slice for desert was massive, it was ok.   Our waiter, John, was great. He was at our table at appropriate moments. He wasn't over bearing, or no where to be found.   All in all, I wouldn't go skipping to this place. It wasn't what I had imagined. I will not be back, thumbs down.

iJGHJg63qveLR-_2tYbAZA.text: Delicious food. Audry-our waitress-AMAZING! Took care of us quick and with a great smile. Prices were a tad more than we expected. Alligator was excellent with fresh squeezed lemon.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alligator

WCkC1GzPgu7bsyPJkBPySA.text: So back again and this time we weren't disappointed Jemma was awesome and very attentive and made our dining experience very enjoyable. Total difference from night and day.  My wife had the seafood sampler and I had the half chicken  omg it was delicious every single bite and not a single complaint. I'm a very satisfied and full customer. Jemma restored my faith in the company we will be coming back again.

n9Y3JdnnRmdsS4ylI2KiNQ.text: I attempted to place an togo order first phone call I held on 12 minutes, second call 4 minutes.  I was informed there was no togo person today. Your menu offers to go ordering. I don't have 16 minutes to waste. I'm done with this company.

erIKzokAdhFYLefg9przTA.text: Great atmosphere. Staff was fantastic! Had a good time @ happy hour....we will be back

UFHipk19k763ARvfooOLSA.text: Service was really good - very experienced server who knew her stuff.   Food on the other hand was a bit lacking.  I had an oyster poboy and with 6 or so small oysters spread out over an entire bagette it was really unimpressive.  I tore the bread in half and piled all the oysters on one half and that was a bit more like it.  My husband had the crawfish etouffe (his go to) and he said it was pretty standard.  Not a bad meal but I remember when Pappadeaux used to be really excellent.

9bqpIaAelaCrnTeP2uMoeA.text: Appetizer: Fried alligator (tastes like chicken) and crabcakes were great.  Main: Crawfish etouffee and Caribbean lobster tail - good portions, great taste! The etouffee was definitely my favorite!!!  Dessert: Portions are HUGE! Went with the dessert trio, and all three items were good :-)  Service: had a long wait on a popular night (around Valentine's day weekend), but this is to be expected. Seated and had decent service from our water. Place is busy and noisy! Very enjoyable night out with friends!

DAVms8Dj1Ll9sbOcSiWgxw.text: Always great seafood!! The Mahi and the Redfish are outstanding. Fresh and never fishy tasting. Can be a bit pricey with long wait times around dinner, otherwise would be a 5 star for me.

D1rTE5Fe2tZwR7FG0Ba-jQ.text: I am not a seafood fan, but this place has changed my point of view. The quality of food, atmosphere and service are absolutely great! We started with the crab spinach dip. The server described it as more of a spread and she was right! It was so thick and had chunks of crab meat. It was so savory and decadent. We had never had dirty rice so the waitress brought out a "sample" of it. First of all it was basically a side of rice and second it was DELICIOUS! We finished the whole side and also got it with our meal. I got sea bass and my husband had a scallop, shrimp and mahi mahi combo. Everything was excellent! I'm such a fan of this great, fresh seafood! Not to mention, the excellent customer service was so refreshing.

dFKwt-0_oXCwFoTWh9Qumg.text: Exclusive seafood restaurant... easily the best in the phoenix area. we love the fried frog legs(try pan fried too) . also the crab cakes are awesome. first time oyster eaters and it was a great experience.   the items on the lunch and dinner section are very pricey but worth it. too rich in flavor if looking to find a fault. don't buy drinks , even their strongest drink (swamp thing or something like that) was a joke. buy another round of frog legs instead !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pan fried frog legs!!!!!

xwbFU7gVo40Uy4zZrjV1JQ.text: Great food and great service!  Even though it was a busy night, they did a great job seating us in a reasonable amount of time.  Once we ordered the food came out quickly.  I highly recommend if you are looking for Cajun food in Phoenix.

0ajNFAmTX9DJKOkcQ-XxfA.text: My family loves this place. It's a great family restaurant with exceptionally fresh seafood. We look forward to always eating here. The reason I didn't give it a 5 star, which for the service and the food it deserves a 5 star. Is that we wait a long time to get in. We always wait 40 minutes or so for dinner. Other than that we love coming here. Their oysters are so darn good and their grilled fish are so delicious and fresh and everything you order is great.

d8a-Uvs1oafY2jPObyNqnA.text: This is a favorite place to go for us on a cold rainy day for some Gumbo and Cheesy Grits.

revSKhAvyZaJSNrA8xyYpw.text: Food was amazing. Portion and service was great. We definitely will come again the next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OjRV2ZLZ_w0jPbsUFR-g7Q.text: I don't care for the dirty rice or the gumbo. Lobster salad isn't worth your money. But nearly every fish entree I've had was delicious. The raw oysters are also so fresh. The mac n cheese appetizer is especially good. Pasta Mardi Gras is a MUST whenever I come. If I don't have it for dinner I'll order it as a take out to have lunch the next day. It's that good. The service here is also usually excellent and I haven't had bad dessert. Overall, it's one of my favorite restaurants for special occasions. But if you go with a group of 4+ people, just know that you will have to shout across the table to be heard! The restaurant is very loud! I actually came home with a sore voice..

c3oIBalcdPYKaNd5r5RBog.text: Damn this place is definitely a 5 star. The food was so good and the portion was perfect,  I didn't even finish my meal. I ordered the mardi gras pasta which had big shrimps, prawn, sausages and the sauce was amazingly great tasting.  I also ordered the alligator nuggets as an appetizer and I was impressed,  that was the first tyme I tried alligator and maan it was good along with the sauce they give you with it. Our server a young black gurl, very curtious, helpful, knowledgeable, and on point with our drinks never had an empty glass to drink what ever it was. Kudos for the great service and amazing food. I cannot wait to come back n taste all the other food on the menu. It is a lil pricey so bring ur wallet but the portions are good. And the ambiance was cool, nice decos, fairly big establishment,  nice bar, n very very classy. MY NEW SEAFOOD SPOT IN AZ!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our meal tyme. Yuuuummmmmmy!!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alligator nugget sauce. Very good.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great gumbo

MyThUTdghUunffjxcHmbOA.text: One of our favorite family places to eat at.  Large proportions from a large menu from a cook to order kitchen.  Most of the time we just share appetizers instead of ordering a meal.  It's fresh seafood flown in daily so be prepared to pay for it.  They get very busy but worth the wait & we've always had good to great service.  My only complaint is they are a 45 min. drive away wish they would open another restaurant in the SE valley.

IpFhb0lebQ8UPkOY4Q38bQ.text: I am a native Texan, so dining at Pappadeaux was simply a way of life!! When my family and I moved to the Los Angeles area, we were deeply saddened there were no Pappas restaurants in Southern Cali. The nearest one is Phoenix.....so what do we do??? We plan our trip to Phoenix just to eat at Pappadeaux! Not even kidding!!   We made reservations for a Saturday night , 7/22/2017, at 7:30pm and the evening started out horribly. Our server didn't smile, didn't share her name, didn't welcome us, nor did she take our drink order for the first 17 minutes of us being seated. The entire time, my family and I are saying, we drove over 300 miles, we are NOT going to allow one server to ruin our evening. My kids were asking, Mom, when is she going to offer us bread or water? She never did. After I flagged her down so she could finally take our order, her demeanor was even more negative. Even after all of this horrible service, we were still holding out for a better outcome.....until she disrespected my husband in front of my family. My husband asked for butter for our daughters entree because this is the way it's served in Houston. Our server immediately says, "we're not in Houston, but I'll get it for you anyway." And that was it!! We were done... my husband got up to get the manager.  Even though our evening started off on a rough note, Keely Cambridge made us feel sooooo much better. She apologized and made us feel so welcomed. She made our evening spectacular. She also changed our server to Cristil, who catered to us! Thank you Keely and Cristil for turning our lemons into lemonade! We will be back soon

0bqD8wBnvTg9vQTOUPEs3g.text: This is the spot for a little bit of Nola in the desert. I thought this would be like Applebee's with seafood-- I didnt have high expectations. Instead, i was pleasantly suprised to see quality of seafood to be much higher than anticipated. I had some Alaskan crab which was delicious. It wasnt cheap but you get what you pay for. Being fron the northwest, I'm excited to have somewhete with some good seafood close by.

o772eNHj0ud_RICbUiWFfQ.text: Went yesterday, the service was excellent however I got a Caesar salad, shrimp and fries, side of onion rings and fresh fruit and everything I had I did not enjoy. Salad was over dressed and salty, shrimp was mediocre, onion rings were soft as if microwaved, fries were old and fruit was sour. Even the bread was hard.. my party and I had to keep asking for fresh bread; it would come out warm yet still hard.. I don't think I'll be going back. Very overpriced as well.

aHfz3Ts9JHFqo1wcporvog.text: One of the best seafood places in town. The wait may be long and the prices are higher but you won't leave disappointed in the food and drinks. The atmosphere of this spot is also very welcoming and fun. The cocktails are delicious. My pick was the Swampthing which was so sweet and perfect and my husband enjoyed his old fashioned. The seafood is fresh and I have never had one thing that wasn't good. My favorite is the shrimp and scallops pasta and the halibut.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; Scallops pasta with crab and asparagus. It was delicious and filling!

mJJT7J4U-zs8JqjvyBd6oA.text: Fried oysters were tiny.  Many were only fried batter with no oyster inside.  Unexpected poor quality for a 20 dollar meal.  Coming has been a family tradition but not with this kind of experience.

vPUGe-2kfu0B06MyQru5rQ.text: Our waitress was wonderful.  Her name is Ashlynn.  It was very busy, and she still took her time to talk to us about the menu.  Her suggestions were perfect.  She was so sweet.

iYoOj0MGQivXVeqZbPE1Ag.text: Always a great place to visit.  Great food, atmosphere, people watching.  Great for a special occasion or just to pop in for a dozen or so oysters and a cold one.

dvjYvSDyp2StmiS8u-E50Q.text: Food was great  Service was excellent   The only downside to this restaurant is that if is very noisy.  You actually have to speak quite loudly to your dinner companions.  However doesn't mean we won't go back

XJM2unlkRY2ntxMF8l4Pzg.text: We came here for Valentines dinner. The majority of the food was just amazing.   But, the lobster bisque was terrible, worst I've ever had.  The only seafood tasting thing in it was the clump of lobster in the middle. Lobster is sopose to be the main spotlight of this dish, but the ingredient that stood out like a sore thumb was the green bell pepper. Sooooo much green bell pepper that's all you tasted besides salt. Gross.  Other then that dinner was very nice.  The salmon was cooked medium rare, so it was super tender with a crispy crust. The giant shrimp and grits was super super salty but totally yummy. I would totally order again and just ask for no additional salt when plating. We also had the shrimp and crawfish fondue. It was a very large appetizer.  Very yummy.  Too full for dessert but they were reasonably priced. The service was fast and our server was very informative and polite. Be prepared to spend about 100$ for 2 people.  It's pretty expensive but you will love the freshness of the seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and crawfish fondue 22$ HUGE! Yum!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate martini 14$
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Giant shrimp and grits 33$ very delish. Spinach so so

CZQGwTe0UZjMT79Tv0KZrQ.text: This is a Louisiana twist kitchen, fresh fish, oysters, alligator, crab, lobster, steaks and much more. I have been coming here for years and I can finally write a review! The key to a good experience here is "Reservation!" You don't have a Reservation you could be waiting for an hour to hour and half for a table. We ordered gulf oyster on the half shell it comes with horseradish/ketchup/cilantro base soy  dressing on the side and I love mixing the sauces it was very good. I had the Alaskan King Crab legs and they were so fresh and sweet and just right. My fiance had the Branzino with grilled shrimp and Broccolini in a herb lemon butter sauce it was yum! Check it out it! It's a fun experience also this place comes with a heavy bill at the end of the night so be prepared! Happy Eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alaskan King Crab

CIIvff9Gt1YrEq-RIANoAA.text: The wait was quoted as over an hour at 8 pm on a Friday night. We ended up sitting at the bar. Less than 10 minute wait for 2 people. The blackened gator bites were really good and Service at the bar was actually pretty fast. Food was delicious and the bartender/waiter did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key Lime Pie to go
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Atlantic Salmon &amp; Scallop*
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9MvkINPJRkiDSynPw4px_Q.text: My daughter turned 21 today-July 3rd. She wanted to celebrate at Pappadeaux. We ordered lunch. My husband and I split The sampler platter and my daughter ordered a crab and shrimp appetizer with a side salad with ranch dressing. We ordered water and our waiter Andrew brought us sliced lemon on the side. We informed Andrew that my daughter has Celiac Disease and he explained the manager would be coming over to talk with us about the issue. The manager was very nice to us -- she wanted to make sure the food organization der was clear due to my daughter's Celiac Disease. Our waiter, Andrew was very friendly; the atmosphere in the restaurant was great. We were seated by the window by a really nice hostess.  The food was fresh, hot and delicious. Pappadeaux is a nice place to dine whether for lunch or dinner. I highly recommend this seafood dining establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen strawberry margarita.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My daughter Rachel with her 1st alcoholic drink-frozen strawberry margarita on her 21st Birthday.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My daughter Rachel with her 1st alcoholic drink-frozen strawberry margarita on her 21st Birthday.

Z5B0lgBJpb_6sOc0wNgD_A.text: For our appetizer we had the Crabfingers and Crab cakes they were both delicious. Our entrees which were equally delicious consisted of the Pasta Mardi gras, Crawfish Etouffee, and the Sampler Platter. The desserts were sub par (the reason for the four stars) key lime pie and turtle fudge brownie. Next time we're in town we'll be back !

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turtle Fudge Brownie
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Mardi Gras
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key lime pie

C_NevmDXHtA0Plke_h8gtw.text: It is Pappadeaux, I don't even think it really needs a review, however, for those of you who are not familiar with their restaurants (also Pappasitas), they are always the top of the line chain it their cuisine choice. If you see the soft-shell crab available and do not order it, you will regret it more than any other mistake you made in your life, the moments you are eating it will literally be the highlight of your life.   tl;dr get the softshell crab

2veG04P0nSGghac5HN_CAw.text: We really enjoyed eating here. I have heard of this restaurant for years and never come until yesterday. I had heard it can take a while time get seated because it's popular. We were seated right away.   The restaurant is big and has plenty of seating so I imagine the special occasions and maybe evenings would be the only time you'd have to actually wait to be seated. We came at lunch time on a Saturday and it was fine.    Our waiter was super nice and explained things. He didn't ask us how the food was with our mouths full of food. They give you like a loaf of bread and butter to get things started lol.  I got the pasta Mardi gras and my gf got the shrimp and grits - both were lunch specials. The total was about 42 bucks prior to tip. We didn't get anything but water to drink. So that gives you an idea how much it costs to eat here.   As far as the food goes I liked both of our meals. I've never really cared for grits but they make theirs different. It has all sorts of flavor mixed in. Portions were good.   We had some of the praline cheesecake as well - to go, because I was stuffed but the dessert looked legit. It was comped by the manager because it was our first time here :) I'm not sure if I'm to share that, but it was totally a surprise and made a good experience even better.   The sauce on the cheesecake had a rum flavor to it and it was awesome. It would have been about 7 bucks for a big slice.   The restaurant itself is cool. I wouldn't say it's super fancy like Flemings where you'll feel weird wearing jeans. So you can come causal or dressed up and you'll be good.   We'll definitely come back to try some more of the food. We were spying on other people's food and it all looked good.

VZa7mJlYCoh5LaHPPa-Y7w.text: Went today because they had a special on oysters. A spot I frequent because it is one of my favorite places to eat in the valley. My whole family. I have been with my family and loved ones more times than I could count because one thing I can count on it that the food and service will always be the best. I subscribe to their email notifications so I received the offer for discounted oysters which are one of my favorite items on the menu because they serve with not only lemon and cocktail sauce but now two other delicious sauces. I have tried many things that you would not be able to try elsewhere such as grouper, quail, raw oysters, frog legs, red snapper, and even a mixed seafood fondue! This is such a great spot if you love seafood like I do. My favorite thing on the menu is the red fish! They have it two ways and both are amazing it is such a great fish. Especially how they cook it. They also serve dirty rice! Which is a Cajun style rice that is so good! Pairs very well with the sauces that creep over from the fish entrees. I will never stop going here though they have changed a few things on the menu since I first started going years ago!!! Such an amazing spot 10/10 would always recommend.

JLYlRNWvHi0Sog3mKcCOIA.text: The atmosphere was good but the music was to loud. The waiter and alligator bites I would have to say was the best part of our evening. The food was a bit spicy and I took back the crawfish etouffee which was not tasty at all. I have been here with friends before and had a seasonal dish I loved. I came back this time and my husband liked his catfish dish. I was not to keen on my dish and it was replaced for free but it was spicy and my daughter took hers home and threw it away, it was the Mardi gra pasta or something like that. It had sausage, crawfish and shrimp but it was a bit to spicy. The service was awesome and he was fast and friendly. We didn't get dessert at the end. The waiter did take off the crawfish etouffee and my meal but neither one of us liked it. I like spice but I like to enjoy my meal without my mouth on fire. I usually don't like to complain as I know it is a hassle.

jBcLKiNKfUHWvHZVtR07fw.text: I was so disappointed with this place it's honestly ridiculous.  We showed up with a party of 7 because I was celebrating my birthday. I let them know this when we made the reservation. First, our table wasnt ready and we had to stand around waiting for them to get it together. Then, when we arrived at our table our server took forever to arrive. We ordered our drinks and it took 30 freaking minutes to get just drinks.  When they finally arrived only half the table had even had a chance to request drinks so obviously the other half wanted them. Because of the slow service of getting them I advised everybody to order their food now just in case the food was just as slow. We ordered the lobster bisque which when it came was fishy smelling and required seasoning. The gumbo that was a joke! It tasted like a bland progresso soup version of gumbo. The crab cake was drowned in butter and had no seasoning and for almost 20 bucks a cake this is asinine. The lemon butter chicken pasta dish (cant remember the exact name)  was also bland and tasted of neither lemon or butter. The fried catfish and crawfish was over cooked and bland. The crab puffs were also bland. The best part of the whole meal was the lobster artichoke dip. Our server was rude and careless. He forgot to put in one of the drink orders  Now mind you at this point the first half got their drinks after 30 minutes,  these never came and we were halfway through our awful meal. He came back to the table and admitted to forgetting them and it still took 10 more minutes to get them. He said he would comp the drinks and didnt rudely stating they "cant give anything away". Honestly this whole experience but a whole cloud over my whole birthday evening. I expected much MUCH better from a place of this calibre.

cajNbKqeF0G73tYdLaiELQ.text: We love you Pappaduex!  We were only visiting Phoenix for the weekend but if we could have come back for another meal we would have for sure!  Excellent customer service and our salmon salad was yummy!

dvz4QK16U7EfTUrlAiUdLg.text: Easter Sunday I ordered two to-go entrees and there were challenges with both of them.   I came in today, spoke with manager Kristyn W. She LISTENED with a smile, never interrupted me, used the experience as a teachable moment for her staff, and made sure my order was perfect this time.  She made it Right! THANK YOU!!

IcYlUo5XDgpJRiEQfPQdIQ.text: While a little pricey, the food is terrific. I've been wanting to stop in for some time as I knew they served fried alligator, which I love, I was thrilled to finally get in there. While I was not too thrilled about the sauce it was served with, the alligator itself was terrific. I look forward to making my way back in here in the best future to try some more items on the menu. If you love fried alligator, check this spot out!

jVwPkhPcauFkMfw2tad-jQ.text: Let me start by stating we have been going to Pappadeaux for many years. We wanted to celebrate our 54th anniversary with a nice dinner and we chose Pappadeaux. My wife needs a walker to move around, so when the hostess went to seat us I asked for one of the three empty tables right by the door.  She then proceeds to walk us to the back and when I stopped her and said I want one of these tables she got annoyed, really.  So now we are greeted by our waiter, nice friendly guy. takes our drink order and returns with them. He never brings us water or asks if we want water, no big deal. He takes our dinner order and my wife ordered crab legs de-shelled. I order a shrimp dinner, we both ordered Caesars salads. We got our salads and he never asked if we wanted fresh ground pepper on them which is kinda the norm for those salads, and before we were finished with them, our dinner came out, boy, bums rush tonight I thought.  So I said he could take mine but my wife was no where finished.  But when he put her dinner down, the crab legs were not de-shelled and so he had to take them back and said it would be just a couple of minutes, so my wife got to finish her salad.  Meanwhile her side dish was left on the table and I waited before starting to eat as I wanted to eat with my wife. Well the 2 minutes turned into seven minutes and I started to eat as my food was getting cold as was my wife's side dish. We finished dinner and asked if we wanted dessert. My wife asked if it was free and he said it would be so we accepted. Very disappointing dinner for us and not the norm for Pappadeaux.  I believe our server Matthew should go back into training as he was not ready for prime time.  He really made our dinner very disappointing. I hope this is not a trend for Pappadeaux. The food is always very good and don't let our bad experience deter  you from trying it for dinner, although It will be awhile before we return anytime soon. Not all their servers are Matthews.

gSZzUqlMTYoWpTUGQGCdPQ.text: Truly an upscale fine dining restaurant. Great for a group get together or dinner for two. Exceptional service. Shout out to our server Sheana tonight.  We loved the atmosphere and the food choices.  I enjoyed my combo of a catfish sandwich with soup. The soup had shrimp in it so the best of both worlds. The bread served before the meal was crusty and delicious. My catfish sandwich was perfectly cooked and was perfectly seasoned, needing no enhancements to give it flavor.  My friend and I enjoyed not being rushed through our meal and this place also has great ambiance. We plan on going again next month. It is pricey so great for those special occasions or when you want a really good meal.

Gr7fs5pZC_-8friJwEfuyQ.text: My coworkers and I went to Pappadeaux for a lunch celebration and it was fabulous! Our server Connor was very helpful and attentive! I got the ginger salmon lunch special and it was priced perfectly! The salmon was about 8oz and had a sweet and tangy galaxy on top! It came with rice and green beans!   At the end of our meal our server brought was the dessert tray! It was a beautiful sight! We ended up getting the creme brule and the praline cheesecake! They were both great portion sizes and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert tray

aD3P0yBVoiGJ9sd87SZP-Q.text: OOOMMMMMMMOYSTERS!!!!!  This place is delicious!! Went last night with a group of fellow nurse coworkers and the food and service from Eddie was AMAZING!    We all had a night out away from home (no kids/no spouses) & it was enjoyable.  We are a LOT and everything was bueno!!  Came back tonight to get some shrimp gumbo for dinner and I had to get a platter of 11 oysters for & 9.95.  Come to find out that promotion ends today, and they are packed!!   Definitely recommend PAPPADEAUX's to get your seafood fix!!  NEED IN A LOCATION IN TUCSON!!!

AQAc7tR_Ne4o78IhND8lqw.text: Over priced and underwhelming.   Group of 5 so we were seated after 30 minutes. Gabriel, our server, was real nice. He took awhile to check on us, grab cards and deliver receipt. The restaurant wasn't even that busy compared to what it normally is at other locations.   Calamari app was good and tasted fresh, lightly breaded and fried with a side of sauces.   Complimentary bread was placed on table after having to ask & a hour later.   I ordered the shrimp and grits- wasn't the best. Shrimp was great! Well seasoned and cooked perfect temp but the grits were thick and lacked depth of flavor. The spinach side was kinda random & was just soggy & unseasoned.   I cant remember what everyone else ordered exactly but there was an order of Pasta, tilapia something, salmon steak with shrimp & then i forget the other.   Overall everyone was really underwhelmed and it was disappointing considering how excited we all were.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Creole &amp; Grits

Gq1O3QhKD4-FqsqyF8tNXQ.text: Another birthday celebration, and meals enjoyed by all. Comfortable table, efficient service. My choice today, the large order of Alaskan King Crab. Perfectly cooked, huge portion, and delicious. The chefs here know what they're doing.  Our server , Eddie, was outstanding! Very patient and professional, with a member of our party who needed special attention. If I have any complaint here...gets pretty loud. The food quality equals and surpasses most high end restaurants in Phoenix, and the value here can't be beat. You actually get what you pay for here. My personal favorite for a special celebration.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alaskan King crab.....ohhh mama!

wIepmv_PlvhovpuV1XbVvA.text: First time here and I am happy to have made my way over. Huge portions of good seafood! It's a cute little fancy date spot! Good seafood is hard to find, but it was delightfully surprising the freshness and quality. Our waiter was sweet and the overall experience was enjoyable.

CmQCxz76Ktf4MO78Y15SOA.text: Read the reviews on TripAdvisor and Yelp before deciding to go. The reviews were spot on regarding the food and service!   I felt that we got way more food than we could eat and for a very reasonable price. I know some of the reviews say otherwise but we couldn't finish our Seafood Grill (skewers) or our Grouper with Shrimp and we didn't have any apps or salad!   The outdoor patio is awesome, they've got misters to keep you cool!!  Check it out if you're in Nth Phoenix, it's more of a destination, it's off the beaten path but it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exterior

CQthRSphFwEv-yM0T4hBJA.text: Pappadeaux is one of my favorite Cajun-Creole chain restaurants.  I've been to the Pappadeaux's throughout Texas and when I am in Phoenix, I always try and visit this location. You can sit at the bar if you are dining alone, but be sure to come hungry because they serve great food in large portions and serve refreshing and creative cocktails.   If you come with a small or large party, sharing is a good idea, especially the appetizers, so you have the opportunity to try different items on the menu.  The crispy southern fried quail was tender and fried perfectly.  The shrimp and crawfish fondeux was absolutely delicious if you love dipping bread in a wonderful cheesy sauce.  I still ordered their Texas Redfish Pontchartrain as an entree which was more that I could eat, but was wonderfully prepared.   We had no room for dessert, but if you dare, be prepared for a giant "Claim Jumper" sized serving.  Great New Orleans-style restaurant with cocktails, seafood, steaks, and good service for overall value!

I got the Crispy Atlantic Salmon, crab, shrimp, scallions and spinach. It was all excellent. It was just SO expensive. And it was extremely loud.   It I did get a free dessert for my  birthday.

cRchrLAga6AaBXn5vgRGdA.text: I had never been until today. Amazing meals across the table. Service was quick and frankly great value for the amount of food we ordered. Hubby had 2 lb lobster and I had the shrimp with grits . A+ will be back for sure

0kqNgS7msdT6srNa8QleUg.text: Everything was great! Came in for a birthday party and our servers kept everything in order and were very attentive. Most places when you go in for a birthday party it may take forever to get drinks, but not here.   I had the Shrimp and Grits and it was SO GOOD! I was definitely full quick, and I still had left overs. The shrimps are pretty giant and you get about five or six. The only down fall was the pile of spinach (or whatever it was) on the side, didn't taste as well. The grits were on point, it had some creamy corn to it, loved!  To drink I had the Henny Penny and the Garden of Eden. The Henny Penny was so good, it waste too strong rather a bit sweet. It was perfect for me. The Garden or Eden taste more like cucumber than not, and I really didn't taste much alcohol, bummer! Won't order that one again, unlike the Henny Penny.

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Giant Shrimp &amp; Grits

73SRiL2fIfCTO7RU-JiC7Q.text: This is one of the few go to seafood spots out in the Phoenix area. Their menu has plenty of options for all to include steaks for those that aren't into seafood. They have a menu that is ever changing so some options are only available for a limited time.   Not a fan of their bread that they bring out before the appetizer, salads, and entrees. I do believe a lot of their competition offers better bread. That being said the New England Lobster Bites were swimming with flavor as the lemon garlic butter sauce, spinach and those that love grilled cheese bread brought it all out. Wish there was more lobster for the price paid at $32.  I ordered the Pappardelle Pasta which was pretty decent but not my favorite thing that I have had here. Their pasta dishes are always changing and I can never find the first pasta that I ordered, always chasing it. The Atlantic Salmon Alexander has real flavor to it and a slight kick but definitely good for those that love salmon, shrimp, scallops and crawfish.  If you haven't tried this franchise out yet in a state near you then I would strongly suggest stopping in and seeing what it is all about.

Tried the Tilapia for lunch and we also ordered the  GRILLED TILAPIA & JUMBO SHRIMP  With crabmeat, charred tomatoes, hazelnuts, herb lemon butter & fresh green beans  SEAFOOD COBB SALAD  Mixed greens with honey Applewood bacon, bleu cheese, egg, avocado, baby tomatoes with house vinaigrette & creamy vinaigrette, with choice of shrimp, shrimp & jumbo lump crab, or shrimp & lobster.   Lobster Bisque is very good and the Salmon with Scallops are also a good choice.  Good quality food, but a little on the pricy side

There are few restaurants that I HAVE to go to when I am in AZ,  this is at the top of my list. The meat quality is great but I would stick with seafood and pasta.

zTE_1LLmgHn0MrbMY94d1Q.text: The True heart of Pappadeux is 5 stars. When done right, this place can be the #1 spot in AZ... And today, they delivered!! So I would like to update my review. The place is packed, but every keyn was moved to sit me outside right away. And that was just based on the fantastic server outside to open up room for one when I requested... And for that I am extremely thankful. Luz Helena delivered with lots of smiles and a bunch of patience. My favorite dish last time was a failure... But today was the most exquisite dish. And I needed thatb today. I wasn't feeling all that fantastic ado my favorite food was key!! And glad I gave it another try. I shall be back, and back  and back. Thank you Pappadeux!!

KG3ixxNStXbMri0fp9e5kQ.text: I'd always wanted to go to this famed seafood spot. I've heard it was one of the best seafood spots in town. It was a bit of a far drive but oh well. The place was HUGE. It was very beautiful, with peaceful water features and lovely green leaves trailing about everywhere outside. It was quite hot however, so my love and I opted to eat inside. I liked the decor and ambience. It definitely seemed like a special date night spot type of place with how dim and intimate it was. Tori was our server and she was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The menu was pretty extensive and had lots of seafood options. Pricing was a bit on the high side, everything on the menu was mostly $12 and up, with mains being $25 and above. My bf got a Surfside Soda as a drink and it tasted refreshingly perfect. It was made of house-made passion fruit, pineapple and strawberry syrup, vanilla, fresh lemon juice and soda mixed together.   To start, they brought out a complimentary crusty loaf of bread. It was hot and toasted to my liking, with creamy yummy butter to spread on it. However they didn't bring out a bread knife so we made do with ripping bits off the loaf with our fingers. Not sure if this was supposed to be the usual practice. They were having a $9.95 one-dozen Blue Point oyster special so I immediately went for it. They brought it out promptly. However, My love didn't like oysters so I ate all twelve of them myself! I liked the variety of sauces given; there were three: ketchup with horseradish, some sweet-garlic sauce, and another sauce I didn't know. My favorite sauce was the slightly sweet one.. I wished there was Thousand Island sauce, which is my favorite to eat with fresh oysters! The oysters were pretty good and I of course doused them with Tabasco sauce. My bf opted for the crispy fried alligator. It was delicious and I loved the sauce that came with it (not sure what it was but it was sweet, not overly so though). It also came with little crispy potato sticks? (Think deconstructed hash browns) I felt they complemented the dish nicely. My bf however felt the dish was average. I think he thought alligator would taste more special/different? I, however, was happy with it.    For mains, my bf got the Chef's Selection Stuffed Rainbow Trout: a pan-grilled trout with wilted greens, butternut squash and jumbo lump crab with pecan brown butter. I got one of the Pappadeaux Classics: the Atlantic Salmon Alexander dish. It was either that or the Mississippi Catfish Opelousas. Tori suggested the former, so I got a 7-ounce blackened salmon with shrimp, scallops and crawfish in a white-wine cream sauce with dirty rice. My bf's dish was delectable, with the skin of the fish delightfully crispy to perfection. I enjoyed the brown butter sauce and the pecans and capers that added to the flavor of the dish. I didn't like the wilted greens that much; however, that was more of a personal preference than anything really.   My dish was yummy, just as Tori suggested! The creamy sauce wasn't overly-rich or overpowering, but complemented the seafood and dirty rice perfectly. I savored every mouthful. At that point of the meal we were sooo stuffed and couldn't eat any more. We couldn't even finish the alligator appetizer! I felt quite sad because I'd heard rave reviews of their desserts. Nonetheless, I resolved to definitely come back to try more dishes next time. I would advise coming with a big group because then everyone can share and try new things. We brought back tons of leftovers and were happy with our night. Service was good as well. I can't wait to return!   Please note serving sizes here are pretty large, and portions are generous. I would advise sharing food unless you want to bring home lots of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Atlantic Salmon Alexander. Delicious! Not overly-rich and creamy!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuffed Rainbow Trout. Scrumptious as well!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My boo and I

cqOwamuTMPXtDUe400APZA.text: Yesterday was my very first time going to Pappadeaux's for lunch. I loved the entrance and walk way are. Very vintage New Orleans vibe and so beautiful. I have no seen that many green plants in Arizona, but I saw many here just walking into the restaurant.   I ordered fried alligator, Oysters, Craw-fish Antufee, and the most amazing of them ALL; Grouper with Crab Crust  I loved every part of this entire meal. I had wonderfully made drinks as well.  The grouper was cooked to perfection and the crab crust with Almonds was breath taking. I loved every second of that meal.   I recommend you try the Pineapple Mule. It was very refreshing and perfect to drink in this hot weather.   The scenery, decorations, and the ambiance of the entire restaurant was classy but fun and lively!   The staff was so professional and they deserved and worked very hard for that Tip.   It was nice and cool inside and there was even a section I saw that you can watch sports at.   Please check this place out for a nice,, classy date.

xmCU8pb9szi3ODAuNf4PzQ.text: A great Louisiana Seafood Restaurant..Has jazz on weekends, great happy hour. You could have alligator,frog legs & fresh seafoods,soups,gumbos,dirty rice, grits with sausage (spicy)shrimp,salads,crab & lobster & much more. Their desserts are to die for.Military get 25% off everyday. The place is beautiful, their bathrooms are amazing. Staff are all great & goodlooking,professional, .NOT a Place for babies or kids.
