ETDp8ujXIxpqpxkL0ZSRXg.text: Pappadeaux's is by far my favorite seafood splurge in AZ! Although this place is a chain the customer service is always excellent as well as the food. I've been here many times and have never had anything I didn't think was extraordinary. This last time I went I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee with Dirty rice; every bite was loaded with crawfish it was so much I could only eat half. It was fairly priced at $20.95, which at any other restaurant I would tucked my tail and hide but the food here is well worth the price. For appetizers my favorites include the Lobster Bisque, Fried Alligator and Crab Fingers. The only thing I don't like about Pappadeaux's is they don't have free refills on the Strawberry Lemonade.  Which again is fantastic, it has a delicate balance of sweet and sour but the glass is so loaded with ice you're literally paying $3.50 per glass on about  cups of actual juice.  The atmosphere is fun the lighting is more on the dim side but it fits the New Orleans theme throughout the restaurant. This place handles large crowds like a champ, my group this past Saturday was a party of 12 and the server had no problems with remembering who ordered what, as well as properly splitting the check. I highly recommend the restaurant to any seafood lover. If you don't like seafood there are a few other options but not many; the few they have are well executed. I also recommend trying out the Chef's Special of the Night. This place has an outdoor patio and the band is always playing on the weekend which serves as great entertainment when waiting for your table.

cZN_wyK039AoBgNPXLpDpw.text: if you're looking for authentic cajun, this is not the place.  it's more like Joe's Crab Shack with a Louisiana theme.  overpriced food, the servers/bartenders are too busy to be attentive .  I ordered a special redfish dish (which was not cheap) and the redfish had either been frozen for a long time or, most likely, microwaved.  tis was the deal-breaker.  everything was decent until I got my entree but eating rubbery-textured redfish was not a great way to top off a meal.  I have spent some time in New Orleans and LOVE cajun food and this place does it no justice!  and for what you have to pay for the food, you can pretty much fly to N'Awlins and have the real deal.

imbIy-q_tLancnofcMwZVQ.text: A long wait but the gator and frog wernt too bad!

z3-vDanL3y0cRz5fqnrRrw.text: I am all about great customer service and after my last experience, I considered Pappadeaux's off of our restraurant rotation. I was promptly contacted by the customer relations department and they assured me that my experience did not meet their standards for service or food.  This level of attention exceeded my expectations. After another visit, I am once again a FAN!!!!

DvtjixfPIYAdP02_bdkkzw.text: Had lunch here with my wife today. It's the second time I've been and her first. After my first visit it rocketed into my top five favourite restaurants of all time. They have some top notch food, and the best thing is that it's such a deliciously welcome change from the bottom-feeder's Mexican crap that you see all over Phoenix. The menu is varied and I think I eventually will want to try everything. Appetizers include fried alligator and frog's legs. The main I had today was their Mardi Gras Pasta, which is linguini with tomato, thin-sliced garlic, andouille sausage, crawfish meat, onion and delicious shrimp topped with a really nice creamy sauce. Absolutely delicious. The wife had mahi-mahi with an even NICER sauce, and dirty rice on the side. Although a tiny bit on the pricy side it's definitely worth coming back to. Large open seating (outdoor seating also available), dimly lit, old-style jazz, a large full-service bar and a very quaint outside waiting area with water feature, giant fans etc. The service was also great and both times I've been, the waiters have been very helpful (the first guy told me that if I got the large serving of alligator, to try it 'half-blackened' - a great tip which allowed me to taste both 'styles' of the appetizer). They also have things I've not heard of before like etoufee and opelousas. If my dad didn't live over seven thousand miles away I'd take him here in an instant - he'd absolutely love the place. You will too.  Oh yeah, they have creme brulee (with fresh fruit) and sweet potato pecan pie, amongst other things, for dessert. We had the latter - yum.

kVBU6m9rciNNsk_qbGoxtg.text: the Greek house salad....... is friggin delish!    lots of different offerings from the sea........ lakes and rivers too!  haven't had the gumbo or etouffes...... but i hear they're pretty decent.  the most recent visit consisted of: Greek salad Grilled Costa Rican Tilapia Lafayette Blackened Catfish Opelousas Oven Baked Stuffed Tilapia  everyone was happy with their food...... but i am guaranteeing i will b gettin the blackened catfish opelousas next time!

wb6SCuYlq1d0EgxGRJUCTw.text: Aarrgghh! I feel like a Pirate inside the restaurant. I love the atmosphere!  It is not my first time but I thought it was time for me to give a review. I asked to go for my birthday. Did not disappoint as usual.  The hot loaf of bread with butter is always a good start to get my taste buds going. Of course, I fill up too much on it to get to dessert.  My hubby and I normally start with a dozen of raw oysters and they have been consistently fresh and briny. Then we have a few appetizers as our meal. The frog legs have been great and have a light spicy kick. The Fried calamari is light, crunchy and not over fried (like the addition of the artichoke hearts mixed in with the calamari).  This time I had the Costa Rican Tilapia Lafayette. It was perfectly done (I hate over cooked fish) and the sauce was plate lickin' good. My hubby had the Pasta Mardi Gras and he gave it the thumbs up. I gave it a taste and it was very flavorful with the Andouille sausage and in a very rich cream sauce.  We'll be back soon so I can try more items off the large menu!

tpmXeM6weCwSxKb7OrCnbQ.text: Seafood is so fresh here! And cooked to perfection.Surprisingly this place is affordable too. Makes red lobster look like a mc donalds in terms of quality.

ZyPXzEaBHvq1CMlL1A5ivA.text: We went to this restaurant last night and noticed that the prices have gone way up, so I had settled for expensive plate of simple chicken when my husband and I noticed that a small roach-like bug was crawling up the wall behind us. We were seated just on the other side of the kitchen, right below the window to look inside of it. We told our server who got the manager. He said "oh it's just a stink bug" and grabbed it with a tissue and threw it away. We asked for a new table and he went to find a new one. While he was gone (about 3 minutes) another critter started crawling up the wall and went right under the wood by the window into the kitchen area. At that point we just left. It was really disgusting. We have always loved their food, but I think it's going to be a very long time before we can go back there and we will not recommend this place to anybody again.

cGwY4s3Z-EqRX7AFanE6kA.text: I ate here with a friend about a week ago and we both got the most horrible food poisoning ever!! Plus, we waited over 45 minutes for a table when the place was nearly empty. The host staff was extremely rude. The manager and our waiter were helpful and friendly but they're food is unsafe. Never ever eat here!!!

fiiQm_HEXO9arntpiu4ZUQ.text: Pappa deaux more like Papa-don't. The only reason to come here is the 3.95 dozen oysters. We got here super early on a sunday afternoon (4:30) and the place was still packed for lunch. Service was friendly, kitchen was a little slow, the food was a step above Red Lobster. The stuffed friend shrimp and crab was not really good at all. I guess if you live at least 4 hours a way from fresh ocean this place will have to do.

4nktEN0IeypuvDHl5W5Vlg.text: Went here for a business lunch with customers. Was seated right away, greeted within a minute and had fantastic service. This place was recommended for their seafood. We started off lunch by splitting the sampler of mini shrimp, crawfish fondue, fried alligator and calamari. The alligator was the bomb digitty. I had the fresh sushi and it was fantastic, everything has a southern creole twist on it. Lunch for 3 with appetizer was $75.00 but well worth the money. I will be back again.

GeDf26I3HVcDCkJs7F_u6g.text: I grew up in AZ and still have family there so every trip home going to Pappadeaux's is a MUST!  They have the greatest food and a huge selection even for those who don't like seafood.  They have great Oysters and Jose the oyster shucker is the best!  The staff there is always warm and inviting and even when you have to wait on weekends they have a great live band out on the patio.  It's always packed so I would recommend reservations.  I usually get the steamed muscles and the cedar block salmon which is sooo yummy it's served with asparagus that is the best I have ever had in a restaurant.  If you are going to Phoenix or live there, this place is a MUST!

MKx3SHWUSuXqAo3UZCSZ5g.text: Went to Pappadeaux's last night for our 20th wedding anniversary. Have been here a few times for special occasions. Never have had a problem. But had to write a review about last night. Great service, Tanya (our waitress) was perfect. Her attention to detail and her skill was amazing. Found out after speaking with her that this is her first waitress position. You couldnt tell.  Definitely ask for her if you can. The dining manager Forrest, stopped by to wish us a happy anniversary and comped our dessert for the occasion. Very nice touch. Loved the food, we had alligator and blue point oysters for appetizers, yum, i had the shrimp brochette, husband had the costa rican mahi alexander, all was perfectly seasoned and served hot. This definitely will be a continuing date night spot for us in the future. Truly enjoyed our visit.

D3YIgSiRVURgnctOvBY27Q.text: Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux... what more do I need to say.  This was the first thing I tried at Pappadeaux's and I have ordered it every time since.  From the fried seafood menu, the Pappadeaux Platter is great and there is enough food for 2 if you get an appetizer to start, unless you are real hungry.

PSmBQfeWNAK1QGHz5cwy-A.text: Went here for the first time today and i'm in love!!!   I think that Crawfish nights are Asians' night. When happy hours hit, I felt like I'm back in the old country.   If you have ghetto nails with all kind of crystal-ness, be careful not to choke on the crystals when you go to lick the deliciousness off your fingers.

FPHDTqxmPy0a7Ag9H0GcRA.text: We had an excellent meal here.  The mussels were cooked to perfection; fried alligator was spicy with a great dipping sauce, shrimp gumbo, delicious and  the etouffee, to die for.  Our waiter was excellent, one of our party was very late arriving so we were ordering courses one at a time, never fazed him at all.  We will definitely be back!

ZKelX-l09bT2qHjQD2wWyw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The food was amazing,who cares if it's  chain restaurant.       We had tried to go the night before but they were packd so we made a reservation for the next night.It was really busy when we go there but we were seated immediately.Our server was really nice and very helpful when we told him we had never been there before.            We ordered the fried alligator app,and loved every bite of it.I had the filet mignon and rock lobster tail.The steak was cooked perfectly and was a good size for the price.I'm not usually a huge fan of lobster but wanted to give it a try,Pappadeux has changed my opinion about lobster,the meat  came right out of the tail.It was buttery andjust plain yummy! It was the first chance hubby and I really had a chance to go out to eat without the kids,so we really wanted to make the most of our time.And we wre definetly able to do that here.Refills kept coming even after we had paid the bill.I also loved the live music from the jazz quartet making its way around the room.The only thing thats keeping me from giving it 5 stars is that the tables were too close to each other,and it was so loud I could hear the discussion at the table next to me but I had a hard time hearing my huband across the table.I will definetly be going back to Pappadeux over and over again.

8cs0qh-ZeK8x2HCGrehqmQ.text: It is only a short time in spring when crawfish are in season and on Wednesdays and Thursdays, this place flies them in fresh and offers them until they run out.  I am addicted to the mudbugs and have been to Pappadeauxs 5 times since mid March to get my fill of them.  The bartenders recognize me by now.  I have been going in every season for the past 4-5 years.  Usually I sit at the bar and find the service to be friendly and top notch.  I most often start with a half dozen raw oysters and then move on to the crawfish.  Oh, boy, are they good and go perfectly with an ice cold Shiner Bock draft!   Took my mom last week and we sat at the bar.  Had some mussels to start.  Very good again.  Even though this place is packed every time I go in, there never seems to be a break in the service quality.  I have also been in recently with a large group and sat in the dining room.  Fantastic meal.  We all had something different and everyone was pleased.  A little loud for my liking but that is to be expected when a place is as busy as this restaurant always seems to be.   Don't let the metro location scare you off.  Quality seafood and quality service.

cnLzgadtplU24XT8KncxXA.text: My bestie and I came in for dinner a few weeks ago.  Everything was perfect.  The food is by far some of the best I've had in a while.  I definitely recommend the spinach and lump crab dip, the Mahi Mahi, and the creme brulee.  The ambiance is dim, lively, and very New Orleans.  Our server, LeAndrew (sp?) was perfect and made us laugh the whole time (a couple of times I'm pretty sure he didn't mean too; he was just so accommodating it made us smile).  Additionally, any staff member who walked by made sure to clear our dirty dishes and fill our only half empty waters.  Even though it is far from my Mesa home base I WILL be returning!

Vl26BD-aE6Nx4D_7MoITvQ.text: My boyfriend and myself have been discussing where we should eat for our first anniversary so he brought up a place called papadeux. He added some details about this resturant and the food was mostly southern themed. Also, the cost is a bit pricey but worth the trip to dine there. I decided to read up the reviews and did some light skimming based on people's experiences here.  Finally, on our anniversary we drove up to papadeux which was around 8 - 8:30 when we got there. Luckily, they closed at 10pm so *whew*. lol.   I already knew what I wanted due to looking at other people's reviews on which entrees were good.   The place was really lovely and words can't describe how romantic this could be coming here on our first anniversary *hearts*  When we arrived, it was pretty empty and very dim too, I wasn't sure how to take it but I was just nervous and excited to arrive to such a lovely and uppity place.   We were seated immediately and our waiter was Johnny. I really loved our waiter! He was very attentive, very well mannered and had a really good intuition which he could anticipate our expectations and such. I was so awed and wowed by this waiter and there couldn't be anything more lovely then having a wonderful and smooth service.  He asked if this was our first time here and I mentioned that my boyfriend has been here once but this is my first time so Johnny came around my side and opened up my menu and just went through each section of the menu and explained a bit of some of the popular dishes for each category. Which i loved! *hearts*  so I picked out an appetizer, I don't remember what the name of the appetizer was but it was really good! I had the lobster bisque soup with lobster chunks in it....oh man that was soooooooooooo delicous and the lobster was a bit chewy but still tastey!   Then I had the costa rican naked tilapia the 7oz, now that was seriously good *drools*  But in between our dishes, johnny kept checking up on us and communicating about our food and the time which was very excellent customer service...i mean his service was so top notch I couldn't have been any more happier *smiles*  He also was talking story to us and I loved that. I really could tell that he was very laid back and wanted to get to know us a bit and also asked if there was anything he could do for us. He also was curious if there was a special occasion as to why we were here and I mentioned that it was our first year anniversary and he smiled and congratulated us *blushes* I seriously felt that johnny just knew we were here on a special occasion and he has a really good intuition. Again, such an awesome waiter!  towards the end of our lovely meal both of us were getting a bit full and I must admit that the food at papadeux is really rich but delicious food *drools* I couldn't admit defeat yet and I went on to getting desert . I got the banana bread pudding and I was sooo full but I was determined to finish it so I wolf that sucker down. lmao. Though I was bloated and full and...just wanted to roll out instead of walking. lmao. food was really good.  In the end, my first experience went so smooth and perfect for our first anniversary that I was very very happy and I am hoping to come back again for another special occasion!  I do want to add that johnny was so lovely and helpful and he boxed up all of our left over meals. He is such an awesome waiter! If any of you guys get him, you'll be taken cared of very well!

_skLwasU2p1ycal3GBFRUA.text: Excellent service!  I've been coming here for years on my way from L.A. to Tucson and I can always expect top notch service!

S44oys6Iwq8P5rdNldu1OQ.text: We always come to Papadeaux when we come to Phoenix! The fried shrimp and catfish is my go too! I have tried several things here and they have all been tasty but there is something about the simplicity of fried shrimp and catfish that just makes me happy! :) The portions are large there's always good food. It's hard to save room for dessert so we ordered it to go. Definitely get the banana pudding. When you order it to go they just put the whole mason jar in the to go box and give it to you!

WxmfuTMleQkQvSXu6QlEWQ.text: Loved this place - great atmosphere, food was delicious! However they did screw up my order and sent the wrong platter to the table which I didn't even realize until the next day because i was too full to realize there was chicken on the platter. Oh well. Husband was in love with the king crab legs...calamari was great...flavoring on the fish was delicious too.

GvAnVv4OxeKrhKJ_cfwx8A.text: This place is a little more fancy than I expected....decor and atmosphere-wise...I thought it would be plain and simple like Red Lobster but actually the place has a very southern homey feeling to it.....although a seafood place they had like deer heads hanging and other sorts of weird decor.    Came here for dinner yesterday night with my bf and his apartment-mate...we got a table right away but even for a weekday they were still half a full house. The first thing I saw on their menu was the Crispy Alligator appetizer. ALLIGATOR! ooooh but then I wanted to try their oyster appetizers cause they sound good too....ahhhhhh their menu is full of yummy choices! It was difficult deciding what I wanted to get...but after much debate....my bf and I decided to order the Oyster Duo appetizer and share the Pappadeaux Platter -- which is an amazing sample platter of all the fried variety they offer on the fried seafood section of their menu.   So the Oysters Duo -- comes with 3 oysters on half shell baked with a parmesan romano cheese sauce and 3 oysters on half shell topped with crabmeat, spinach and drizzled with Hollandaise sauce. -- oooh they were both delicious however I recommend the later one more just cause it's very unique to this restaurant. I got to also try a few pieces of the Crispy Fried Alligator from our friend's Appetizer Trio Platter - It was pretty good actually tastes like chicken...but surprisingly more tender - I was thinking alligator meat would be tough and rough but not at all....I wouldn't have known it's alligator meat if you didn't tell me. But now I can say I have had alligator meat!  The Pappadeaux Platter was pretty good - everything is well  -- fried! However I like the blue crab cake the most, the mini fried crawfish (kind of like popcorn shrimp) is second best however I have to say that the fried Tilapia was a disappointment because it was sadly bland and really dry...it was the only thing I didn't like on the platter. but everything else was good. - - I even tried their watermelon lemonade and it was super refreshing!  I was really excited for dessert cause I saw them carrying around a platter of sample of the desserts that they have...so when we were ready for dessert I was excited to see the dessert platter - unfortunately there was nothing on the dessert platter I wanted because they all looked really rich and sweet....such as their sweet potato pecan pie, key lime pie, praline cheesecake, praline bread pudding souffle or turtle fudge brownie was just too much even for the eyes..lol They were also massive in portions so I decided not to have any.   The service was really good, our waitress was pretty quick and friendly. Overall I enjoyed the most of the food (except the fried tilapia) and the service is good so it earned it's four stars. :)

zwAR97cgvz3mmoDynfmpwA.text: Awesome food, great customer service. The only bad part was when my pregnant hormonal fiance saw a gentlemen taking a lobster from that big tank to its death lol.

iCASB3Yd04rj08n_pSf2_A.text: Bring more Pappas restaurants here! Being displaced Houstonians (where Pappa's corporate office is based), we were so happy to see that our new home had a Pappadeaux within driving distance. The food is not as good as it is back home, but much better than anything else Phoenix has to offer. I love it all. The flavored teas/lemonades, sourdough bread, soft butter, seafood, etc.

VS9IBqCZcaXX0X1bPjWAwg.text: Much better than I expected being that it's a chain restaurant. The fried alligator was fun and good especially the curry flavored sauce. My Mahi Alexander was delicious as was my husband's Chilean sea bass. I couldn't finish mine so I asked for it to be boxed while we shared some creme Brule. Unfortunately someone tossed my leftovers but no worries they made me a whole new order and didn't charge me for the first! I didn't even complain just thought I wasn't going home with leftovers no big deal but they just did it. Great aercice5

ET0uQD7rauR2DvIiXMeISg.text: The restaurant is a great environment and the food is excellent. I recommend getting the alligator bites as an appetizer or their oysters.  Every lunch and dinner entree I have tasted has been top quality. The only reason that I do not give Papadeaux a 5 star rating is that all entrees are high price. I understand greeting crab stuffed crab claws and lobster being pricey, but typical Cajun dishes are $10-15 over priced. Expect a $75-100 check if getting an app with dinner.

i-PZUzvpFb6iMsRdajSQyQ.text: I know this place is a chain restaurant and I usually avoid those but damn the food is too good to resist. We always receive fabulous service at this location even when the place is packed. Management is good about actually having adequate amounts of servers at all times. We have been here for many lunches and dinners. They are wonderful at either time. The lunch specials do make this place more affordable for all.  Whatever time you come just know it will be worth it.

XQvDruqMy5Qxz14nCPuV9A.text: My favorite place for great seafood. My husband and I shared a shrimp cocktail which had jumbo shrimp with a wonderful texture and great cocktail sauce with fresh horseradish. Crawfish platter in a medium size was too much for me to finish. Blackened catfish was perfectly cooked. Hubby enjoyed bread pudding for dessert. All desserts are huge. Prices are high but worth it for quality. Service also great. The down side of this place is the noise level. But for the noise I would have rated 5 stars.

x3Dk3YOAj84Y77HsP2yQSA.text: This place is awesome.  Never had a bad meal here.  Service is exceptionally good.  Love their oysters... the complimentary bread and especially the restaurant made butter are also to die for.  Recommend making reservation on the weekend to avoid long wait time but you can go to the bar and grab a beer or glass of wine while waiting for your table.

Qem3B-WcFXCa_o_f8tmKdQ.text: Wow!  Great food and great service.   I got the pan seared tilapia and it was perfect in every way.  It had a brown butter sauce that was amazing and was topped with crab meat and grilled shrimp...so delicious!  Even the green beans were cooked to perfection.  My dinner partner had the redfish and it was also wonderful.   Huge portions too..no scrimping here.  Our waiter Kyle was great too.  We look forward to going back soon.

uyr3L9ndAZB-qd7G1-aYxg.text: My Favorite in Dallas  This is my favorite restaurant to visit when I'm in Dallas.  I haven't made that trip in awhile, so was eager to come to this one.  The building layout is the same and the food is just as good.  Be ready to pay some $$ as it is not cheap.  $90 for two people.

qFtarRRo1dCF51g-Aho1DA.text: I've come here multiple times and each and every time I HAVE to get the alligator. I love almost everything on the menu. It's all worth trying. Just watch the deep fried platters...there is such a thing as too much deep fried food on one plate. It can tend to get a bit overwhelming. I think my only complaint is that the service always kinda seems a little slow and the prices are a bit much. I mean, I understand that seafood prices can be a bit much but they seem to seriously jack up the prices at this place. I love the little dessert tray they have to show you what they have on the dessert menu that night. I'm a visual type of person and it's just so helpful. They're desserts are really good too so if you can manage to leave room for them, I suggest you try something.

mMEIzi5WAcUjKJP7aZFB_Q.text: You get what you pay for. If you think the rich are better than you are go here. You'll realize otherwise. God rich folks are nasty unethical behavior and flat out childlike. Back to the review lol, the waiters and waitresses are classy and excellent and so is the food and restaurant. Just had to throw in the rich nose blowing crouching out loud non manner rich snob rant in here. Because I can.

E3LYVSiq4Byjn0QiKaGPew.text: Every time I go to Pappadeaux  I get the item on the Appetizer menu, Large order of Fried Alligator.  I always ask that I get half Fried and half Blackened Cajun.  Take a piece dip it in that AMAZING sauce that it comes with and be prepared to know what HEAVEN IS LIKE!!!  I just LOVE this dish so much that I get it at least once a month if not more. And anytime I go to a Pappadeaux's Resturant I get this dish.  ITS UNBELIEVABLE!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried &amp; Blackened Cajun Alligator with Dirty Rice &amp; Fried Catfish! A meal meant for a King!

lYPHJKLvu-7hoaZFPeliFQ.text: I really enjoy Pappadeux. Servers are usually competent, food is quite good and the prices aren't outrageous.

QnJcUm1X8pMKUvRkD_7Y_Q.text: I really enjoyed the banana pudding.   The coconut shrimp was awesome.  My favorite entree was the lobster bisque which I ate the next day.     Most importantly the service was immaculate. Julie was an excellent server; she answered all of my questions concerning the menu and kept the drink refills on tap.   On the other hand, the seafood gumbo's roux needs a little work.  Very thin and void of flavor.   Five star nonetheless.

WvIvlcvSmfPbyJu1dopz5Q.text: Lived in Louisiana for three years. Best Crawfish served daily. The Bisque soup is the very best with Crawfish isn't it amazingly great. Good deserts and Cold beer and great Wine.

saKhz5_OSaCDJxVu42WE-Q.text: I have a love/hate with Pappadeaux. Their prices are high, the selection is great but not so great.  $20 for a catfish plate is exorbitant; however, what they do, they do it well.  The catfish was perfect, especially with a side of grits and bottle of Louisiana hot sauce.  The platters are huge and enough for two people to share. Not much in the way of non-seafood options - which made it hard for my family members that don't eat seafood to find something. That menu needs to be expanded to more than $40 steaks.    The Mediterranean Calamari appetizer is $20 and the best app on the menu - however, it's a huge plate for a large table.  I wish had a smaller option.  Only 2 people at our table would eat such a thing but no way could we tackle such a huge plate and calamari isn't something you can take home for later.   This restaurant has the best patio in the valley.  Open air, fans and misters, lots of greenery and shade.  I could spend forever on Pappadeaux's patio.   Our waiter was excellent, though the food took a long time. I think it was the stinking steak being cooked.   *So here is your take-way: Only come with seafood lovers (the rest will be uncomfortable), sit on the patio, have plenty of time to hang out, and be prepared for a high bill - but you won't be disappointed by the food or the atmosphere.

s6ukxktXU9OvOo7h_dBIgg.text: We arrived and found parking quickly. Very few people waiting in the outside seating area. Feb 15th on a Weds. Checked in at the host station she told us 15-30 mins. The lady behind us had a child and a male with them. They where told the same time.  Our kid and their child starting talking and watching the lobsters. 25 mins went by and they complained to the hostess and they where sat promptly. I wait another 5 and said something. The hostess was extremely rude and said " I can see how long you have been waiting" when clearly they seated several people that arrived after us. She never mention the bar table area was open seating.  At 42 mins of waiting I told them either seat us now or we are leaving. She said sorry I can't and people are taking longer to eat than expected. Another server heard us and said some one was getting up I. The bar table area.  She was kind and offered to help. She cleaned the table and got us menus then told us our server would be with us shortly.  Not one person greeted us, looked at us or anything for ten plus mins. We where not even looking at the menus because you this time we knew what we wanted 25 mins ago. Out 4 year old was starving  We started to leave and the this server guys said. I am going to get to you in a rude sarcastic voice.  I said no thanks and we left.  I did call as we drove to another restaurant and the manager was friendly and offered to buy us dinner if we came back. At that point we just did not feel welcome to eat their so we declined.

7SBgnWpH1HIQv2x1J5yf-w.text: This is the best Cajun food I've ever eaten. Lisa the waitress was awesome. The shrimp Great atmosphere was good highly recommend it.

-dKm9EEhs5VJGyK17UMwzw.text: This place really stands apart from most restaurants around the valley. It has a large seafood selection and everything I've had is fresh and delicious. There are a couple other restaurants popping up that are giving them a run for their money, but as for now if you want some pretty good quality seafood in Phoenix then you should definitely try this place out. Be prepared for it to always be crowded, but they do accept reservations even for small parties which is very nice. The service could definitely improve, but it's really hit or miss. We had a birthday last night at our table and the hostess said she would tell our server. Not sure who forgot but it got missed. We also sat at a small table with dirty dishes and drink cups the entire meal and even when we finished. It was a bit of a drag, but the food was good! We spent about $200 with 3 adults and 1 child. We had 2 appetizers and 4 alcoholic drinks so it can be a bit pricey. I expected way better service for the amount we spent on our meal. Minus 2 stars for the service

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing sea bass! Would order again
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta with scallops and shrimp

zUqkgkASyKS5ZWJ1eHixPg.text: Live this place for their delicious dishes. I have had something different every time and have not been disappointed.  Love life e their food.

-X68xo6eNwkPCchukNS8ig.text: I HATE SEAFOOD!!! I was dragged to this place but I do want to say that the chicken pasta I had was very delicious. Their drinks were amazing.... ( I HATE TEA!!!)  But their sweet southern tea OMG so freaking good!!! I want to go back just to order their drinks!!!!! They were very busy so we were forced to sit outside on the patio which as first I was groaning about since it was 99 degrees, however how they have the fans and mist it was very nice and cool.... I had a great experience the waitress came by often was very sweet and chatty and even helped me find items that were non seafood for me to order. Even with the amount of people in the restaurant at that time they came back often and refilled our drinks/ asked if we needed anything often and it was very appreciated.

5sWPxVmH6n0EOSFobw4Tqg.text: I would've given Pappadeaux a 5 star rating, but our service the day I went wasn't the best. Other than that, they have a great gluten free menu! Check out my full review here: adventuresofahungrylatin...

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened red fish with broccolini (gluten free option)
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creme brulee prepared gluten free
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First Kiss

T84mxBsbU_mLapJdSAQMtA.text: Always a good time there.  Food is great and the service is amazing.  I need one to open one up in California.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SqTdtcWdu9iR5jCVc6pKUw.text: So I was an idiot and thought gumbo was jambalaya...  I set myself up for disappointment when I received a bowl of soup. BUT WOW it was so jam packed full of flavor. I don't think I've ever eaten real crab either. It's always been that fake imitation type. And the shrimps!! Mmm I love shrimps.   I'm sad I'm leaving Phoenix today. I won't get to try the other seafood items, but just from this bowl of gumbo I can tell the other food must be bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tJJqgIr9leKQKeq8ZWyrug.text: One of my favorite places! Nice ambience, great service, really good seafood, nice portions, I truly enjoy it!

siAr90uuuG9uyHIaqXBVBA.text: Their happy hour is the best! Fair prices for Pappadeaux and get the swamp thing drink.

PYgnhoHWYFg7t3p4a7i5rw.text: One of my favorite seafood places in Arizona. Has a Cajun style that is to kill for! Their fried alligator is excellent as an app! Always friendly staff . Good job. My only complaint is the wait on food - but it is well worth it

7vmyzdZTf8bW0yzt2Z1gDA.text: We've only been here once, but would love to return. We had a great experience overall.  We visited on a Friday night, on a holiday weekend (and Fiesta Bowl weekend) and it was raining.  The place was packed. It because it's so big, the tables seemed to turn fairly quickly.   We were told it'd be an hour for a table for 2. They take your cell # and text you when your table is ready. They also have pagers available (for those of us whose cell service is extremely poor there!  Note - they had wifi for guests and we were able to get service but it was splotchy.)  We snagged seats at the very crowded bar for a drink and an app while we waited.   There must have been 7 bartenders on duty - which was awesome. The three women on our end of the bar regularly checked in with us for more drinks, etc.   (Note - drinks are good, and they have some of the NOLA staples like Hurricanes. Drinks ran about $10-11 a pop for their specialty cocktails.)   We were called to our table in less than an hour.  Our server appeared right away and explained the menu to us and made recommendations.  The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was hot and tasty.  We held back a bit so we could save room for dessert, which also did not disappoint.  They have a lot of options for your sweet tooth.    Will definitely return as there were numerous menu items we did not get to try.    Here's what we did have:    Voodoos and Swamp Things (drinks); Lump crab and spinach dip; filet (w/green beans and potatoes); stuffed jumbo shrimp; baked mac n cheese with crab; and NY cheesecake with strawberry.

UyDBGhqcj43nrymTjm8hMg.text: This place, this oh so magical place never disappoints me.  From the low and cozy lighting, to the dirty rice, to those little bits of crab cake heaven, to the juicy lobster tails.  Perfect place to go on a date with your boo and come out with a happy, warm, and most likely overstuffed belly.

TricrrTxXUozYMJzlCtHqw.text: Great seafood for a reasonable price! The waitstaff is always prompt and the ambiance is always welcoming!

LiCl7LOqwgVUJe_ASekQkg.text: I love patio dining.  This place provides a very large patio dining and would be good for small parties. The food was good and next time I will try the oysters. The banana pudding in the mason jar (lid provided for taking leftover) was very tasty and not overly sweet. It tasted like homemade pudding. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WKusB6q4ZQIXegQ2YDtyOw.text: It was awful and it was my birthday. We have not been here for a while since we live in Scottsdale. The drive getting over was not great but I was so looking forward to my dinner with my family. My husband ordered a beer and it was not served so he asked the waitress about it and it was eventually brought over. He had a metal butter dish on his coaster and she flicked it a crossed the table to make room for his beer. My mother asked for hot tea and the waitress told her you going to have to give me a minute to get that. My husband and I wanted to order the Redfish and the Mahi and they were out of both. Our reservation was 6 pm how can you run out? My sister who is gluten free asked for her scallops to be cooked well done were not cooked on both sides only one side. It was such a bad experience we will not be back. So sad because I use to love this place but between the food quality and the service it is off our list!

IvIiVEd2zOXr6-Hw7wLX3w.text: The food was great!!!  We ordered gumbo, fried oysters, calamari, and a crawfish broil. The oysters and calamari were cooked to perfection!  Best I ever had. The crawfish boil was good as well. Seasoning was not over powering and 2.5 pounds were more than enough for my table of 3 to share. Only minor complaint I have was that the crawfish may have been overcooked as the meet wasn't so easy to get out of the shell. Either that or they weren't fresh.   Everything else was good. Service was a little bit slow but to be expected on a Friday night when every table in the house is occupied.

gMsWU8KVnZ84pai6R3bfqw.text: Pappadeaux is our go to spot to celebrate special occasions or with friends in from out of town. the food is always excellent, as is the service. Megan, on of the managers, knows us on site and always swings by to greet us.

1k4iNdrWFqJiCCNvsVNf5Q.text: The food is yummy but to greasy  the service is excellent and the restaurant is beautiful!!

_TsE43wGlc8-pywiGOZl_A.text: Best seafood, and service in town! Busy on weekends. Happy hour specials are legit! Dirty rice and bacon wrapped shrimp are very good! Truly a nice place for special occasions. You will not be disappointed.

1XOuyctrVg47jj_mXp7Chg.text: I was visiting Phoenix, Arizona and went to dinner at this establishment and was denied an opportunity by mangers Catherine Belford and Lisa Winslow to order a drink according to the law here in Arizona, which it applies to state residents not out of state. Their interpretation is incorrect! I will not be coming back here again. And I suggest if you're 21 don't even bother ordering a drink here. After reading this law, I am interpreting that this law ONLY applies to Arizona residents. I am NOT a Arizona resident! The staff would not serve me even though I was legally able to drink. I am 21 years old! The law saids: Acceptable forms of ID include an unexpired driver license or identification cards (vertical or horizontal) issued by: - Any state OTHER THAN ARIZONA, - The District Of Columbia, - Any Territory Of The United States or Canada if the license includes: - a picture of the licensee and - the person's date of birth. A liquor-licensed business may not accept as the only form of identification an unexpired, vertical (under age 21) ARIZONA driver license or identification card when the owner/presenter has been age 21 for more than 30 days. This applies only to Arizona driver licenses and identification cards. If you are age 21 or older and have been denied entry into a bar or denied the sale or service of alcohol and would like to replace a vertical ARIZONA driver license, you will find complete instructions by visiting this link to the Arizona Department of Transportation website: azdot.gov/mvd/driver-ser....

JwSEhDA6jIjtY3aOuRWd9Q.text: Been here once the place is legit, pricey little on the heavy side but you get a huge meal for what you pay. Most def recommend going on a pay day

RIbriXp-PKWb-9MYxs_6ZA.text: The food is pricey but if you need a spot to celebrate this will get the job done. Everything was delicious and service was well done.

3s7BOvqSnF1m5ZUV-8AeRw.text: Love this place! Food is always delicious sand the staff is so friendly! I always get the Live Maine Lobster and it never disappoints me. I also recommend the blue point oysters

5vrepK9_Pdd8dpLxUmAMfw.text: Service was sub par especially for the price! Sat at the bar had 1 glass of wine and oysters, wanted to order dinner but could not get service! I was staying at the hotel next-door and will be staying there three more times but will not be back to this restaurant!! damn shame

zlge5t3tmgmiudK5kPbZXQ.text: My family decided to come here for my mom's birthday dinner. One of my brother's was super eager to try it! The high prices were exactly what I expected, so thankfully that wasn't a surprise when I opened the menu. I only mention that because others have mentioned the high prices.    Anyhow, I was able to try new foods, like: alligator and frog legs! Alligator was breaded and fried, while the server recommended we get the frog legs seared because they come with better flavoring that way. The sauce was delicious, but I wouldn't order them again. I'd definitely have the alligator again. I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras for dinner. So good! A huge portion, of course.  Our server, brought out a dessert platter and had my mom choose one, on the house!  She chose bread pudding, it was delicious, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, oh and candle :) Server was very attentive, and personable.

iS1os3fMfXu-LFuKB9EMFg.text: The shrimp was overcook d and WAYYYY over season... That's that...  We did came in light but why serve us food then if it's going to be all bad.  My friends fried food was dry as hell, they didn't have any more pasta for the Mac and cheese so they used linguini noodles.. with watered down cheese sauce.  I got to admit worse late night dining ever.

6DtZlMFbx_vYJvr9gE9c4A.text: The name of our server today was BEN KYLE and his customer service was BAYOU PERFECT! I'm so happy I dropped in, each visit is more special than the one before. I always get more than just a meal... they truly make me feel like home. PS --- I'm from the south, Dallas, TX to be exact. I was raised on Cajun food from the boot (Louisiana). You guys franchise the taste and feeling well. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The coffee woke us up after we dined so sufficiently. I love this stuff. Go Pappadeaux!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dirty rice and beans set the bayou scene. They call it DIRTY BEANS!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papadeuxs dies it again. #SatisfiedCustomer - the Rainbow Trout and shrimp is excellent!!!

lnkwJHfG4FuPwsXBT4EEIg.text: My wife & I had a lunch here & everything could not have been better. Excellent food and service.

xgNiO570nxRq_n7wzyNJ2w.text: I've eaten in pappadeaux in Chicago as well as Texas and the food and the atmosphere was amazing. Here in phoenix the food was not worth the bill. After the server forgot to bring me the right drink three times I received my meal. I ordered the Alligator tail and it was extremely salty and taste horrible compared to the restaurant in  Schaumburg IL. My fiancee fish was burned on the other side and was tried to be hidden with vegetables.  One the good side they comped us the 1 drink and still brought me a bill for $120.00 and yes they no longer have swordfish. waste of a drive. Pappadeaux is a great restaurant, just not in Arizona.

5-a4WQ-9UtNFxkNDKWLeYQ.text: I was in Phoenix for the annual Origami Owl convention.  Pappadeaux is where my team leader chose to have our team dinner. I loved this choice because of the extensive options on the menu. There was so much to choose from that I didn't know where to start!   I studied the menu the best way I knew how while hungry . I chose a cup of Louisiana  Shrimp Gumbo to start. It wasn't salty like most places it had the right amount of spice to clear your throat. There was also a generous amount of seafood for the size.  I chose the Mississippi Catfish Opelousas for my main dish  after much debate  going on in my head. I usually like my catfish fried but I thought this would be healthier even though it would be sitting on Lemon Garlic Butter sauce. I really can't say, " No" to things with lemon garlic butter. I had an issue with eating oysters that night so they simply left them out and added more Shrimp and jumbo crab meat. It was absolutely divine with the dirty rice ! Loved it!!   I was stuffed but I couldn't turn my back on the Banana Wafer pudding that was served in a cute mason jar! The pudding was nice and thick and not too sweet. It was perfect! I also shared my husband's drink Swamp Thing but it was too strong for me.   I wish we had one of these restaurants in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Swamp thing
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gumbo

Fubv8uGJ4nzoHq-IUcvQkg.text: This place is very busy.  The menu is large.  Ordered their special of the day.  Blackened salmon topped with scallops, shrimp, crawfish, dirty rice.  I asked for the salmon to be medium rare, came medium well.  The shrimp were overcooked.  The scallops, came perfectly, medium rare!  Overall I thought all the food was very bland and did not have a fresh taste.  Seemed like I was eating at a cafeteria.  Kind of reminded me of the New Orleans section at Disneyland...crowded, not much flavor.  We wished we went somewhere else when we were done.  It was someone's birthday, and we did skip the free desert they were offering.  There is plenty of food.  The plates are huge and when the food arrives, it does look small, but really, it is huge.  So you do get well fed.  Parking is great.  Their patio looks great!  The staff was very friendly.  Service was average.

L_zLunoj0YNv04kK2z09iw.text: Second time here and not a bit disappointed. Seafood selection is amazing. Alligator and Steak for the non-seafood individuals. All in all this restaurant is a 10. Don't be deceived by the parking lot, this place is huge and has a great sized bar. Christy was our server and was absolutely phenomenal. Definitely a pleasure to have been served by Christy. She was quick, knew the menu inside and out and is a True asset to this establishment.   Apps and drinks were served promptly and dinner was amazing. Caribbean lobster was huge and cooked perfectly. The ettouffe  was to die for.. .. Just as if we were back in New Orleans.. Great flash back and desserts topped off the meal. Love-love-love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Something for everyone. 6-8 desserts to choose from and frosty goblets for Dad.

IFyxym65i6dRE7BimGKDqA.text: Pappadeaux never ceases to disappoint. I have been to quite a few of their locations and they have consistently had great food and service.    This time I tried the Atlantic Salmon Alexander prepared medium rare with shrimp, scallops and crawfish in a slightly spicy cream sauce. It was cooked perfectly with a portion that was big enough to feed 2. No matter what location I go to this place is always busy and has at least a 20 minute wait even longer on the weekends. The owners of these joints originally started in the steakhouse business in Texas so that is what I want to try next time. My servers name was Nick L and he went above and beyond to make my dining experience pleasurable.

lgQd-oLcajUf-kOvK2YUgw.text: I came was not happy with a food item I received nut  Lisa made me so happy that I will return . She provided me with another dish and I was happy. Jackie was my waiter and not one time did she get frustrated.  Love this place.  Thank you for a great experience.

MSZ8KewsatXkeXyerhbA1A.text: Service was nice and friendly but when you order something and ask for it not to be spicy and it come to the table with xtra spicy flavor that is not good. Sent it back to get a one with no spicy seasoning to then get changed for 2 orders for the same thing  request to have a mgr look at the bill and tell me there is nothing wrong with it.  I had to point it out that one should not be charged for an item that was wrong and should not be doubled on the bill.

VpUqM-OsbRU1SopM2GhiBQ.text: My family and I always go there. We love this place. We have tried pretty much everything on the menu. We are also satisfied with the service. Everyone here is friendly.

iMruz3qw_XGfms37fVKazA.text: Last night, my wife and I wanted to treat my parents to a celebratory dinner at our favorite restaurant. Little did I know, we were going to have a terrible experience. We were being seated by the hostess and walked past over 2 dozen empty tables in the middle of the restaurant to be seated in a walk way. We politely  told her we did not want to be seated in in a walk way and was going to have us sit rightg next to the bathroom door. We didn't want that either for obvious reasons. I asked her why we couldn't sit at 1 of the dozens of open tables in the middle and she ignored me. We finally sat down to the hostess' next spot which was one table over from the bathroom table. My family and I just wanted to sir down at this point. Everything was fine up until the point of the appetizer came (I won't even go into how the Mediterranean calamari got taken off the menu). Then we notice a HUGE group of 35-40 people come in and sit at the table right behind ours. Since that time, the group was so loud that a baby a table next to them started crying. To try and talk to my parents across the table, I had to yell. Not to mention the people of the large party bumping into my wife and I along with countinously going between our table to get to there's all while we are trying to eat and try to enjoy the celebratory occasion. This nonsense went on for an hour. Towards the end, our waiter got pulled to help the large group while we sat for over 15 min to get the check, then another 15 to receive payment for the check. As we walked out I told this all to the manager and she looked and sounded as if she could care less because we already played out Bill and are leaving. I don't blame this on our waiter or the very large party, I blame this mostly on the manager for not putting the party in the banquet room and for allowing other customers to be seated next to the large party. She knew that a very large party was coming in and showed large lack of respect and concern for other people who wanted to enjoy tgeir time there. Also, some of the blame needs to bed put on the hostess for not sitting us where there were dozens of open table( most of which were not sat at all night). At this point, I don't think I'll be going back for a VERY long time. WOSRT experience there by far.

N1PcT8LO7PF_y5sCdwVI1Q.text: My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for many years. We had the best service from Brenda this past weekend and I had to share. She is worth requesting when you stop in to eat! Thank you Brenda for such great service! Can't wait to eat here again!

_PO0lG4oJNMWdeH2RfsKMQ.text: Had some gator, pretty cool. Long wait to sit and the place is so busy that any messes are swept or kicked under the table. For my wife and I to eat, it cost $120 including tip. Cheesecake was awesome.

gmVtBA_KD3eUSc-6BRkuDQ.text: Tried this place for the first time and was not impressed. Started off with the appetizer oysters pappadeaux and alligator which were very good. The wife and I had the sampler platter the tilapia was dry and not very good, you couldn't tell the difference between the shrimp, crawfish or chicken tenderloins everything was fried. Had Four Peaks beer on top which was delicious and the service was great and the atmosphere was pleasant. The food was not worth the money. $70

6aOQ1-7oMzDcVCFTbjPV3A.text: Great place to eat ...best Cajun food I've had! Love the variety and portion size! :) will be back again

uU9zi3CQjFBWZsVx30--RQ.text: I absolutely looooove Pappadeaux! I haven't had pappadeaux since 2011.  I would come all the way back to Phoenix just to get a taste. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

qJnpmkUwQ3hiWhHgqiyNsg.text: Patio dining has great atmosphere with the fountains and lights; it's also the only place where you can converse with your table mates as the inside dining room is extremely noisy. Unfortunately our food and service were lacking. Ordered the Sea Bass and grilled shrimp; sea bass very nice, shrimp over cooked and rubbery. Table mate had the shrimp and orecchiette with vodka sauce- pasta over cooked, shrimp rubbery, vodka sauce very nice. Asked three times for tableware, water brought one glass at a time, couldn't find a spoon for my coffee, drink refills had to be requested.  For the prices here I expect better service and food properly prepared. In the past both the food and service were great; last nite, not so much.

LFrcl0zPKbx9UhUlALd_5g.text: I go here about twice a month. It is Amazing! The gator appetizer is delicious. Everything i have had is delicious. All the salmon plates, filet and lobster, bacon wrapped shrimp with cheese and dirty rice OMG so good. Great Environment feels comfortable spacious. Servers are always kind. Even the drinks are good. Must Go.

l_c0vkUKkWSfvzUeJBr1vw.text: I've only eaten here once but the 2nd time around and oh man its way better. I recommend the jumbo shrimp brochette. Basically jumbo shrimp wrapped in bacon with pepper jack cheese and a slice of jalapeno. I will definitely come back!

uEHdb-nJ3qnnqRP-ftYanQ.text: Excellent restaurant, very fresh seafood, and a nice ambience. Our server was a bit wet behind the ears, but polite. I would definitely come here again! Good place for a date night.

Sdcff3g1PD41pLw0rxA1Yg.text: Excellent food and service! Highly recommend if you love New Orleans style food! Yummy! Jessie and Erin at the bar are the best ever!!!!! First time here and will definitely come back!

RunX0BJF3LX5w2wjRGQ2JQ.text: One of my all time favorite seafood places. Went on Father's Day. It was really crowded but still enjoyed the food when I finally got it.

yfsrrBeUs3Qhg5qpFcR67A.text: Chilean sea bass is to die for. Bartender ryan was excellent.  Outstanding food and service. Oysters pappadeux were incredible.

N_HhubIf8_VnnNb8Gq2C3Q.text: The salads here are absolutely ah-mazing!  My fav is the chopped salad with crawfish....delicious!

Kjg2eYer2C7ziBfbcqqC8A.text: Date night success! The fried alligator and calamari appetizer was so good- my boyfriend and I inhaled it. I had the seafood platter dinner which was a ton of food- I had a lot of leftovers to take home. Very good, fresh tasting seafood. Only downside was there was a wait to be seated but no worries.

GQQx44KRqEdjQjpZidvhqA.text: Out of Flounder and no halibut tonight. Mushroom risotto very salty and too mushroomy. Very pricey. Everything else ok

pIArABQMIYal8MSP1t4rKQ.text: This restaurant never fails to amaze me with the food and service! My boyfriend and I had a great dinner here. We sat at the bar first since the wait was so long. The bar tender was very assertive and even delivered out oysters to our table once we got one. I forgot his name, maybe Trent? He wore glasses. Then our server Ariel was just great!! She was extremely sweet and attentive. Request Ariel if you're there on a Friday night!! Oysters were on promotion for 10 bucks a dozen. We had no clue so it was a nice surprise!

xlcSa3WyvaO7lbbQGnfhng.text: This is my favorite lunch spot in Phoenix. The portions are always plentiful, and the quality of the food is outstanding. I enjoyed the chopped salad with crawfish today, and it was so good. Although not the cheapest in town, I challenge you to find quality and portion size with anyone else. I encourage everyone to dine at this restaurant, you will never be disappointed. The waitstaff is incredible, attentive, and informative. I feel they add to the dining experience. GREAT FOOD!

UkWS_R3PpYl-auZ-bn74xA.text: Food was great but not as great as out waiter Anthony ABad he really made our dinner awesome and gave us the best service We will be back and will make sure to sit in Anthony's section

U0GZS1CwpzMhqSZ7K5YK8g.text: Food was good, but a little overpriced.  Drinks were good.  Food was cooked perfect, lobster and filet mignon with asparagus was done to perfection, I had the catfish, it's not my favorite.  Very crowded and little bit of a wait.  Service was good, we got everything we needed right away.  We will be back.

BGPHGonk8tTAUCbXfKc_8Q.text: I have always enjoyed my dining experience here and occasionally have business meetings over lunch. The service has always been friendly and treated me professionally and their manager took care of me when they made a mistake. If you like seafood and don't mind paying a little more you will enjoy the experience.

dRf-sFZZLGVnCchx-85D5g.text: Best cajun food outside of Louisiana, without question. I could eat their crawfish etouffee every day for the rest of my life and die a happy man

4EHe_qWRJOk99Yv5vAHOSA.text: Love the dirty rice and the cajun catfish. If it wasn't so far from home I would eat there more often.

8T4JBCkcqW3un1bB9bOGSw.text: Waitress spilled ice cold water on me in first 5 minutes. Drinks from bar were really bad. Had to send the first back. Second still was not good. Took her 10 minutes to make the Greek salads at the table while the other guests food got cold. Bad experience overall. This was Monday.

3ypC2dlUXcRYWP5QlgAjbw.text: Food was amazing, service was exceptionally suburb, and overall a wonderful experience. I ordered the table size greek salad with 4 oz of lump crab (enough for 2 people) and the seafood kabob lunch portion. Sad we don't have a Pappadeaux in San Diego! But glad I visit PHX for work often enough and this is my go-to for lunch. 5 stars for the exceptional service our server Mia provided. She was attentive, friendly, on top of our refills and such a natural! She also provided great recommendations that we actually chose and was glad that we did. My colleague and I left as happy campers (as usual)!

o2Im95r4_znlzA-fzuBrhQ.text: I'm allergic to seafood/fish. So I could very well be disqualified for reviewing this restaurant. However! And its a big however! They have the yummiest banana pudding this side of the Mason-Dixon line! Where is that by the way??!! LOL! Seriously, it comes served in a Mason jar and if you don't finish it all ( I never do), they give you the lid to close it up and take it home! I guess I could share it....but noooo!!  Natalie's F*#! the Recession Item: BROILED CRAWFISH w/ Potatoes & Corn only $3.95 per 1.25lb Wednesday & Thursday Only. March 4 thru April 30 After 5pm Dine In Only

DSWcPqghlKpsHwVeuOdjkg.text: Came here for dinner we were a party of four everyone was very pleased with what they ordered and service was excellent. We also ordered dessert we ordered an assortment of desserts the one that absolutely hands down was my favorite was the pumpkin cheesecake ohhh soooo delicious if you like pumpkin and cheesecake which I happen to love both unfortunately it is a seasonal dessert. The reason I give it four stars is just that it is very pricey but it is sort of a fine dining place. I would definitely eat here again from time to time.

KlYwHQoKD3VFbX7hffrR2w.text: Delicious! Devine! Food coma! Great food, so tasty, and awesome service.  I look forward to visiting this restaurant again in the near future!   This place takes the cake!!!

gCViNnA3A2Bvzw1eHNg-FA.text: The Chilean Sea Bass was so well caught  packed, cooked and prepared I can not imagine a seafood experience in the middle of the desert so exceptional. It's no mirage. Great service! Worth the drive. Ill be back.

H1aNQ8h8L6wC4rt4U2t-0A.text: Seafood Grandeur. Reminded me fondly of the great seafood days I had in New England and Boston in the past. The fish and chips (two-headed fried shrimp, fried tilapia, french fries) is so very New England. The Blackened Mahi Alexander is so creative they put shredded crawfish on top. You may choose something other as an entree, but please do yourself a favor and order the Lobster Bisque, which isn't only brisk bisque but also generous with lobster bites. You'll be full, so don't even dream of somersaults afterwards not unless you're purging.

P-4iMlDlKsliRwY6ULxu1w.text: I have been here twice and twice I have been satisfied. Of course the parking lot get's full after 1 pm , poeple want to dine with friends and family also the waiting patios gets full very fast. So make time to plan it. Well, any ways  , My wife and I tried the Gumbo and Shrimp Coktail , Pasta Mardi Gras and Shrimp  Scallop Pasta. For Dessert the " Dessert Trio " ..  Pricey but Good.. I dont' always dine here, but when I  do I enjoy it..... There is alot of plates to choose from they look good. Very good come and check it out .

cnjvckrBfzqpH7RskD_5bA.text: Live this place!!! My favorite thing to have here is blackened Puerto rican mahi, it's so tasty...I'm only allowed to eat fish once a week but if I could I would eat here everyday.

4Row2R6aR8vYnVeyZ43OMA.text: Lovely tomato salad with lump crab meat enough for a meal by itself, mussels are great as an app! Good food and consistent.

hDCrj-TTqco5utOkqkVJ5A.text: Wow. Catfish poboy and the father in law had fried oysters and shrimp with a baked potato. Portions are big and the good is outstanding!! Server was Jessica who is more reason to give this place 5 stars! The Mrs. ate before we went and just tagged along...also decided to get the bread pudding and loved every bite. Place is huge and the atmosphere is a lot of fun. We'll be back for that poboy and to see Jessica!

KOe-ZzLZJtuqYwkNdA8v2A.text: I've been meaning to check this place out.  Very Authentic cuisine and nice atmosphere!  I had the seafood gumbo and a salad..which was the perfect size for a lunch.  My friends were all happy with their meals and everyone had leftovers.  Our server Denny was very personable and attentive.  I appreciated how accommodating he was and that the restaurant lets you make substitutions with side dishes.  I would definitely go back.

jbj98U7Dlg7ERvA5VHzu_Q.text: Awesome food and great service!! Took a client over for lunch (large group of 20 people) and we loved the experience...

QjVvA5ZLKZjhNKJhk75Pwg.text: Awesome happy hour deals but ooohweee it gets crowed :) food yummy

xF_2H0aNKLv-7JDsyukAuw.text: Blue Point oysters were excellent. Seafood platter- broiled with tilapia, stuffed shrimp, mesquite grilled shrimp and crawfish! I'd order again. Very good service and the presentation was top notch. We don't have many seafood choices in the valley and this one is just as consistent as any.

0zrDg4kw51Ce8CUbKGvqkQ.text: This place changed my wife's views about seafood. When we first met she was not a big fan of seafood till Pappadeux took her mind to a new dimension.   Must try items  * Seafood Gumbo * Shrimp Etouffee With white rice * Atlantic Salmon Yvette * Tilapia Lafayette  Pappadeux is a winning at all times wish there was more locations in phoenix

puH7pcALleoDgnQLcjk-jw.text: Hands down,  this is the ceasar and emperor of seafood restaurants!  period! i started my delectable journey with pappadeaux's in the early 90's when i used to take business trips to houston,  dallas & austin,  texas. then in 2005, i discovered that they were in phoenix, az. equally as phenomenal!  now, over 5 years later,  i'm back in the phoenix area and of course i have to stop back here! and its just as delicious and phenomenol as ever!  you must order the new salmon & shrimp and the sea bass. they are both off the chain!!!! if eating those dishes were a crime!  it would be a felony! the catfish is omg, so, so, so tender, meaty  and dreamy! I PROMISE ALL YOU NON-SEAFOOD LOVERS THAT YOU WILL CHANGE YOUR MIND FOREVER ABOUT SEAFOOD ONCE YOU'VE DINED HEAR. They Ship in Their Seafood "DAILY, DAILY, DAILY"..., Did I Stutter? I've Had 5 Conversions of Clients or Colleagues who Absolutely Hated Fish and Other Seafood,  in My Extensive Dining Experience over the Years, at PAPPADEAUX'S in 2 Atlanta Locations,  Houston, Austin, Phoenix and Denver. IF YOU'RE NOT CONVINCED OR CONVERTED AT THE  END OF YOUR DINING EXPERIENCE THEN YOUR DESTINED TO RECIEVE THE BEST DESSERTS IN THIS UNIVERS!!!,  Not Because Your BEYOND HELP, But If You're a Virgin/1st Timer at PAPPADEAUX'S SEAFOOD KITCHEN, the Management should, at Their Discretion, give You any Dessert on the Dessert  Tray on the House! Especially,  if You Were Too Lame Not to Love the Seafood! BUT I PROMISE THAT YOU WILL BE CONVERTED!  YES, THAT'S THE GOSPEL THAT I'M PREACHING!

SydFmnhogDiee6HXVdRoAA.text: Great food and great service! If you want to experience New Orleans delicious cuisine, this is the place. I will be back and recommend it !

MrWdTr-jCI-33AH494bThQ.text: Our 2 servers, Viv and Josh were outstanding, providing AMAZING EXCELLENT service and very professional, esp. Josh who served the children table. Thank you both. It was the first time for our family dining at Pappadeaux, since we re from SoCal. The portions were HUMONGOUSLY YUUUGE!! The wifey had the Blackened Catfish w Shrimp. Our son had the Fried Shrimp plate (long story short: Josh had a mixup and thought he had orderd from the kids menu, so his platter was a bit smaller compared to his teammates dining at the same table. Josh was so cool, he brought out more than a handful more fried shrimp!! ). Our daughter had the hot dog bites w fries, came w fruit & lemonade from the kids menu, and I had the very delicious Mixed Grilled Seafood Skewer platter (came with Salmon, Scallops & Shrimp w Dirty Rice, and Grilled Veggies). Wifey and I also shared a bowl of their equally delicious Seafood Gumbo. Would definitely come back again!  The Prodigy Hoops Fam

CBiy-xolGgDR2wyLEe1auQ.text: Pappadeaux ended up making for a great night out!   Given it was $6.95 for a dozen Gulf Coast Oysters, my girlfriend and I did have to wait for about 30 minutes until we were seated. However after that wait, we were seated and quickly assisted by a kind waitress, who's name is passing me right now. She was a great waitress given she was attentive but not overbearing.   My girlfriend and I ordered the Gulf Coast Oysters as a starter and we're pleased with them. They came with horseradish, lemon, and a soy sauce garlic type of sauce. After scarfing those down, I ordered a bowl of Scrimp Gumbo and my girlfriend order mussels. The gumbo was good, but the broth had an abnormal flavor that I wasn't accustomed to. The mussels; however, were excellent. They were in a white-wine garlic sauce that was topped with parsley and lemon. For dessert we thoroughly enjoyed and shared a glazed creme brulee with berries, that was also excellent. Through and through, with an exception of the gumbo, the food was 5-Star.   Shortly, the atmosphere was similar to an average creole restaurant. Given the Cubs were playing the Indians, the bar was packed and quite loud. The fun laughed and formally dresser servers makes for a romantic atmosphere.   With all of this being said, Pappadeaux is a great place to eat at for creole and seafood.   4.35 Stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our dozen Gulf Coast Oysters on the rocks!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The shrimp gumbo that must have had 15 shrimp in it!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mussels that were served in a flavorful broth!

msIyCbL1wUltLvXDdlAmxA.text: We were given a gift card to try this out and we are impressed. Service was exceptional. Food was filling and yummy!! You have to try the lemonade drink and crab dip!! Those two were my favorite. I also enjoyed the one of a kind creme brulee!!!

0Gf_-ftlGJpozsiXutNNxg.text: A unique place in Phoenix where you can get fresh fish, craw fish, gator tail and soft shell crab!  Great service,  very nice ambiance, but it does get crouded and loud on the weekends.  Don't forget your wallet, because it ain't cheep to bring the swamp to the desert.

fChqNEbhWo2ytN6hTn8gKA.text: Did the happy hour here a few times, food is okay nothing to really brag about and it's expensive to boot. Atmosphere is friendly but not too over the top for the prices they charge. The fish is fresh but the wait was too long especially with two kids in tow. We've gone a few times but just can't seem to get the full satisfaction of good food, good environment and good ole customer service!

gBamv7yFARpBXoSZpBg75g.text: Had lunch there today, spent about 80 dollars not including the tip, the food was salty, mine was not warm, my Moms gumbo was terrible. this was from the Phoenix, AZ location, and now I find out that we should have had complimentary bread with our lunch, maybe the bread would have been good, but we did not get any.. Never again!

c1t8rBFQynmM4l1wGRflbA.text: Amazing food and atmosphere! Visiting from San Diego and I must say this is one of the best seafood restaurant for the price.

ETC8309Kew5Pb1BtWCTr8g.text: Best seafood restaurant in town. The atmosphere was fun and festive and very family oriented. Outdoor seating is available and indoor there is a bar and a huge area for dining. The menu could get a little overwhelming, but our waiter was very sweet and helpful. She suggested we try the baked crab Mac and cheese for our appetizer. Let me tell you, it was very delicious. We also ordered the fried calamari with artichoke hearts, and that too was very tasty. The restaurant was pretty packed/busy for a weeknight but our main entree did not take long. It came at the perfect time after finishing the last bit of our appetizer. I had ordered the Moroccan salmon and shrimp. It was served with couscous, it had the perfect bite to it! Salmon was grilled to perfection, very soft, buttery and moist. Shrimp came with a lump of crab which I did not expect but so good! So much flavor in a dish

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WlJAGi_kMa2OfemJXBdZYA.text: I would like to share an update with my fellow Yelpers.  After making my initial review I was contacted by Guest Relations and was offered the opportunity to return to give it a second try.  The General Manager stepped in and that was honorable of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen to right a wrong and offer an apology for the service that was provided.  I was also given a gift card as a token of respect as a customer (the amount doesn't matter) and I will choose to give it another chance, which is why I have given them another star for the effort.  The food has always been decent when I've visited on other occasions, so let's hope that I can add some more stars the next time I visit.

rlCT3t0Aax7kKRqTugn7nA.text: This place has a beautiful ambience. I highly recommend this place for special occasions. The restaurant has a lovely Patio area if you want to avoid the noise inside. We ordered few drinks and crispy calamari for appetizers, which didn't disappoint. My husband and I ordered pasta Mardi grass and scallops shrimp pasta. Both were delicious. I ordered creme brulee which was out of the world. Overall, I give 5 stars and highly recommend this place for finger licking sea food.

Ev67fQiw8lQlErY74cOZ_w.text: Loved this place.  Quick seating for a city, friendly staff, and delicious food.  Crawfish Etoufee with dirty rice was the bomb! The cheesy grits are a nice surprise with the sweet crunch of the corn.  Loved it.  The desserts are ginormous and can easily be split two or three ways!

9oVF2qNiHmvP7eO4X5wYpQ.text: We love the restaurant and have patronized this location for years. Some changes over time are somewhat troubling, but the overall experience is typically very pleasant. Please bring back the Mediterranean Calimari!!!! Regardless of some small menu changes that we disagree with, we will continue to visit for the fine food, service, and atmosphere.

J73MOCmGpJVvEt_rdLW8mA.text: I love everything about this place.  I have tried so many different items from the menu and they all taste so good.  The Chilean sea bass is so amazing.  Tonight I had the Moroccan Salmon and Shrimp with crab couscous. It was cooked perfectly and so flavorful.  The cocktails are so tasty and you can taste alcohol  Love this place

dt81ClRrGDsnx1KT4cufHQ.text: This was my boyfriend and I'd first time coming here. We ordered a dozen cold gulf shucked oysters, fried alligator, shrimp creole and grits, and Atlantic salmon Alexander. The oysters were great, the shells were pretty dirty on the outside that my bf's napkin had so many black smudges on it but I mean you don't put the shell in your mouth so I didn't mind as much as he did. The fried alligator was so tasty and the sauce it came with was awesome and zingy! It also came with these shoestring like fried potato thingys. I ordered the shrimp creole and grits and a baked potato on the side. I have never had grits before but MAN, were those so good!!! And so was the shrimp creole, it had okra, green bell beepers, and I think tomato chunks. My bf ordered the Atlantic salmon Alexander with dirty rice and he said it was the best salmon he's ever had. It was topped with grilled shrimp and scallops and the flavors were perfection. Biggest baked potato I've ever had btw.   For dessert we ordered the double turtle brownie topped with Haagen Daaz ice cream and Caramel sauce. Since it was our first time they comped the dessert which was so nice of them!  Only reason I gave 4/5 stars was for less than perfect service time management.  We got seated, 10 min later he came and asked what drinks we wanted and we ordered apps. 15 min later our waters came. Another 15-20 min our drinks and bread came out. Then another 15-20 min he came and took our orders. The food didn't take too long to come out but when we would look for him to order things it felt like he was no where to be found. We were there for 2 and a half hours and even though we weren't in a rush it felt like a long time.  Benefit of the doubt, they are a big restaurant with an always packed Saturday night. So if you go on a Saturday night, just be prepared to enjoy some quality time with whoever you go with.

ulHHXCJAOo4Na2ugZKiDFw.text: This was a terrible experience.  The Waitress Carla was so short with us, was slow, ignored us and didn't even offer bread.  I know this isn't the standard because every other waiter/waitress was friendly and upbeat.  I wanted to order a whole meal but couldn't fathom waisting another minute with Carla.  This was my first time coming here.  Also there was a piece of lobster shell in my bisque as well as a hair in my water. I didn't complain to the manager but I should have. Never again. Steer clear of Carla who is an older woman  with glasses and bad attitude. Not to mention it was our Anniversary!!!!

xOrj1jJEaDJzE9cjLe7j3g.text: Great food and great service.  Fresh flowers all through the restaurant.  Good selection from the menu and every bite was fantastic.  Service in most restaurants is a lost art.  While I knew what I wanted to order the waiter explained the menu.  I also liked the fact that he told of the selections he enjoyed to eat himself. Had a very nice lunch and great service.

zfT-sfT-Kgrng41iTqisZA.text: I like this restaurant very much, and actually  I have been there over ten times since 2013. Especially they have many types of beer, and many Cajun foods so I enjoy drinking beers and eating Cajun foods every time. Today my wife and I ate gumbo and spring roll, thus she said they tasted great, and I also felt good for them. In addition the server Ms. A was very kind and gentle for us, so we were very comfortable with our lunch time there.  I really want to visit there to enjoy lunch and dinner again.
