FJms6FUTni6srzY7G09J2Q.text: Okay came here for a birthday dinner and ohemgee it was sooo packed...that place was literally poppin. We asked for a table for 6 and they told us it was an hour and a half wait (actually ended up being 1 and 15 min) but we decided to stay coz it was worth the wait! They have a garden patio waiting area whichbwas very pretty and lush green on a nice spring night! If I wasn't starving that wait wouldn't have been bad with company... And there's always the bar while you are waiting (21+ only tho ) got me a pina colada! Yummmyyy tasted coconuty and creamy.  We got the apetizer trio to share but substituted calamari for the salmon. The other two were the fried alligator and shrimp/crawfish fondeux. Fried alligator was interesting but good...didn't like the sauce coz it was too salty. The fondeux was good but I still prefer peeling my own crawfish than it already mixed in a sauce(its part of the fun). And the calamari was breaded and crispy yummy!  I decided to order crispy atlantic salmon with maine lobster. The waitress told me that the lobster was only abiut 2 ounces (I guess I don't know what that estimate is because when my plate came out and I saw three tiny pieces of lobster) still considering... My plate was delicious even if was the most expensive plate on the table for 33 bucks and also the smallest portion. The salmon was a good size and yummy, also came with crispy shrimp that was seasoned very well and the tiny pieces of lobster with the side of roasted acorn squash (never had this before and it is freaking delicious and buttery). Everything was delicious and worth the wait!  We got a free dessert and another one for the table to share: brownie and key lime pie...eh... But they sure were pretty!  Our server was great! Her name was Lena :) love the ambience and I think there was live music earlier but i didn't know where it was coming from. It was a great time! Can't wait to go back here!!

Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy atlantic salmon with the majne lobster ( find the lobster lol)

gmExCZu_H2dvUFLpfGffGw.text: Fantastic. New favorite. As busy as they were the staff is dialed. The blackened alligator was to die for.

mBeIqaR6J4U_TLspMNnMlw.text: The food was excellent and our server was wonderful. I wish I remembered her name. We travel over an hour to eat here. Definite favorite.

pqgIWagp9PLWJ6UklLXY9Q.text: I had dined at Pappadeaux years ago, but this was the first time for my wife. Although the restaurant was busy, they were able to seat us right away. We were warmly greeted by our server Jenny who shared with us the cajun influence on the food the restaurant serves. Additionally, she was sure to explain that all offerings were made from scratch in the kitchen- meaning that any dish could be customized to suit anyone's taste. My wife ordered a Crescent City Sangria, which she found to be flavorful and refreshing. I ordered an Old Fashioned which was True to the classic cocktail but nothing special. For dinner, my wife ordered the Grilled Tilapia and Jumbo Shrimp which was served over a tomato, hazelnut and green bean salad and topped with crab meat in a lemon butter sauce. I'll admit that I stole a few bites from my wife's plate- it was perfectly cooked and bursting with citrus flavor. I had the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette which consisted of 6 jumbo shrimp stuffed with jalapeno and Monterey Jack cheese, wrapped in bacon, char-grilled to perfection, and served over dirty rice. The medley of flavors in this dish were savory and spicy. And while we didn't have room for desert, who could pass up a free desert offering from our tentative waitress, Jenny? So we indulged in the Pecan Truffle Brownie and it was excellent- moist brownie, loaded with pecans, and served a la mode with vanilla ice cream. Our meal was delicious and reasonably priced for a seafood establishment. Altogether, with drinks and entrees, our total was $85. We will be back!

FcjBM5iVcx5YEkOllnsIHg.text: I love seafood and I love Pappadeaux Seafood.  The alligator is to die for and all the fish is fresh and they get it delivered daily (that's what the server told us).  My husband got crawfish etufee and it was delicious.  I got the Salmon alexander with dirty rice and loved it.  We will definitely be back!

v4oqkw2iUPOby5-6LOpvDA.text: We were visiting North Phoenix for a volleyball tournament at Arizona Christian University.  Searching for a place to eat on Saturday afternoon, we found Pappadeaux Seafood on Yelp with a good rating and very close to our hotel.  We love good Cajun cuisine, so we took a chance and had an early dinner there.  In a nutshell, the food was excellent and the service was outstanding.  Very surprised at how fresh the seafood was given the time of day and the fact that the restaurant is in a land-locked area.  Live Maine lobster of quality sizes were in a tank at the front of the restaurant.   We ordered pasta dishes with seafood such as crawfish and shrimp, and andouille sausage.  Marinara cream sauce was awesome.  And our daughter got stuffed crab that was delish.  We shared a cheesecake for dessert that was gone in no time.; it was our first time at a Pappadeaux's restaurant so dessert was on them.  And at the end, our bill was under $80.  Great food, great service, and all at a great price.  Highly recommend this restaurant if you are ever in North Phoenix.  Go early!  The joint fills up fast especially during dinner time.

VQsS0pFsaoVumJLehylUmg.text: Disappointed. Went to Pappadeaux for an early Mardi Gras celebration. No redfish. No king cake or cheesecake. Bathrooms were disgusting. We sat at the bar and the servers seemed to not care that we were there. It took 30 minuets to get 6 oysters and by the time we were done we finally go some bread.  Our side dish came out several minutes after our entree. Someone needs to teach the kitchen and food runners to look at tickets to make sure an order is complete.

0qdEihe8HkpYPeym2EMOKw.text: It's rare that Phoenix has a great restaurant that California does not have.  Phoenix always seems to be the step-child in terms of cuisine when it comes to dining in the southwest compared to California.  So it's quite nice that we have Pappadeaux locally to enjoy some southern food.  We first came to Pappadeaux 10 years ago for fresh gulf oysters, when a friend introduced Pappadeaux to us.  We keep going back for the live crawfish during the spring.  The prices have gone up since we first found this place 10 years ago, but it's so worth it for the best live crawfish in the west coast.  We come here for special events, like birthdays, celebrations, etc.  The ambiance is fantastic, the service is great, and the food is delicious.  The prices are on the higher side so expect to shell out more, but it's worth the cost for special occasions and live crawfish!  This place gets busy during Spring training, nice winter months, and weekends, so make a reservation or you may be waiting for a while for seating.  The only negative is we now have to wait until next spring for the crawfish again, that is a long wait!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday dessert, decadent!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Live crawfish, yum!!

tmkpF6VRRHsGG6oDIRy81w.text: Love this place. The waiting area outside is cozy. I've never had a bad meal. Great specials too.

ghfRBb8tFZ2-kLWd5QIlmQ.text: This is my favorite seafood restaurant! What an amazing experience with my boyfriend and I to celebrate. I have never seen such amazing food and huge portion sizes at the same time! Great value for your dollar. Everything we ate was amazing so we kept ordering different foods to try! I'll never forget the food. We will be back over and over again it's worth the drive from Sedona. Angelica was our server and she was very knowledgeable, attentive, caring and made our experience extremely memorable.

pR2Cm5oYQys4tjeLgWkIkQ.text: I will come back...the food was excellent the fres  fish was very fry just.  The restaurant was nice.

RxUXjs27Jc_4zx27oBgYZQ.text: My co-worker suggested this place during our conference and I could not get it out of my mind. So I had a friend take us there for dinner last night. At first glance the place is very nice and adorable; items on the menu seem to be pretty pricey; but after you get your food... boy is it the most delicious food I've had in a long time! Also our waitress was amazing, available and not pushy. The Swamp Thing drink was super strong as it had 3 different alcohol drinks in one. I would definitely come back again when I'm in Arizona.  I ordered the Atlantic Salmon Alexander and Andouille Sausage Gumbo and my friend ordered the Grilled Tilapia and Jumbo Shrimp and caesar salad. The portion size was a good size and the food was delicious that it made it totally worth the price. I really enjoyed my experience at Papadeux starting from the host and all the way to the end. I wish I could have ordered appetizers and dessert, however the waitress was right as what I ordered was plenty of food that I had to take half my food home. Next time I'll bring friends so that I can order more food and share the experience.

-_OGAkqXbdRosRuyTN5GyA.text: Love this place! A special shout out to Audrey a server in the bar. Lady knows exceptional service and proper wine opening. Thank you for keeping service standards alive!

ADCj72fTrzuJEOdUFK54NA.text: Had the Atlantic Salmon Alexander. My wife and I shared the larger 11oz portion and took home leftovers. This was one of, if not the Best meal we've had there. Scallops, crawfish, shrimp, blackened salmon covered in a white wine sauce. I'm cheap but considered this to be worth the $32. Nearly a perfect meal.

CIV4KleMdrZUwn9UkFi94w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the WORLD. I love seafood and flavor. If you want both, Pappadeaux's is a master at the highest level. I always try something new and I am never disappointed. The atmosphere is always energetic. The food on a different tier than its competitors. I have tried the lobster, seafood pasta, seafood fondue and others. It is all fantastic. My only regret is that there is not one in southern Oregon. Each time I am in Phoenix I swing by. Thank you for your memorable food and great service.

aDKQaf2bj9qDMl0E3kaU6g.text: This is as good as the best of New Orlean's  cooking. Real busy but they know how to take care of people.

cPrxb0MQPlzVKQ2yEQQKZQ.text: Some of the best grits you can find at a restaurant, this was our first time here and it was amazing. The only thing better than the food was our waiter Nick, he took very good care of us and insured that I will return whenever I'm in Phoenix.

kI_xK9AzDXtSV703ViEXPQ.text: Our last visit was horrible on every level and I am happy to say tonight  it was amazing on every level! Thank you Chris for the best service we have had in a very long time! We will definitely ne back.

cE52evLZzIlIOGlkcysnQA.text: I love the ambiance and the look of the place. The food is really good but pricey. Great service and always crowded.

3blTEoLLizZxcH5TKMDC_g.text: The food was fabulous and the atmosphere was also nice.  Louisiana Seafood and Sausage gumbo was good, the seafood gumbo was also good, the Seafood platter was great (fried shrimp, fried tilapia, and fried crawfish) and my husband had the shrimp etouffee, dirty rice and   fried catfish and it was also very good.

AuLJUbFc-EXJ0XmfPPoqtA.text: Great food & service is hit or miss but overall it's very decent.  The pasta & seafood dishes are delicious everything we've tried we've been satisfied.

1O3wcKar_n0F95lFUiDGXg.text: Originally from Texas I'm a huge fan of all Pappa's eateries.  While there is a time and a place for some good cajun eats Pappadeaux is your one stop shop!  While I always make time for crawfish season thier food is always spot on and I know I'll get exatly what I'm craving for when I walk through those doors past the lobster tank!

74S6t1cZhhrPSkWQIMH2sw.text: Love the Pappadeuax delux platter.  Enough food to feed two easily with extra to take home...great value!  Love the environment, and the desserts are awesome!

opKDAEFIlhRYC4yhrnUC2Q.text: we heard about this place so much. so we gave it a try. we both love sea food. mine was ok but nothing special. my husband had a fish - and was sick for three days because of that.  we don't go there any more. high priced but low quality food -

MnLgy17UhSV-6S6TjkRjnw.text: We were looking for a place that served oysters so I looked up best oysters in Phoenix area and on the top of the list was Pappadeaux.. so we decided to try it. From the moment we walked in we had great service from the hostess to our waiter Sam. The manager even came by when she heard it was our first time there. Sam is a great server, very attentive to our requests , very helpful in describing the different dishes they serve & believe me they have a very big list of things to choose from. he food was delicious and plentiful. We tried the gator tail , which i've eaten before in other places. It was so good. The raw oysters are superb and I decided to have fried oysters. I grew up in Fl and grew up eating them so I was hoping they'd be good. They were ! My husband got the crawfish etouffee which he loved. the manager even had us pick out a dessert to take home, on the house. We were way too full to have it there. The dishes are more than enough , you won't go home hungry. The atmosphere is great, very nice looking place. We most definitely will be adding this place as a favorite to eat.

kB1RlehRdYCcA_3_N99wvw.text: this restaurant has really good quality seafood. the menu is large. the restaurant is large, romantic and has a separate bar area. it's very pretty and classy on the inside, but not snooty, meaning you can go casual and relax. the food has always been good especially the catfish. the prices are ok.  they're generally anywhere from $11-$15 for a really nice meal. of course there's pricier choices depending what you're getting.  it's a great atmosphere especially for a romantic date. the only downside, IT'S ALWAYS PACKED WHETHER YOU GO THERE FOR LUNCH OR DINNER. IT DOESN'T MATTER WHAT DAY OF THE WEEK. IT'S ALWAYS SUPER BUSY. if it's an especially busy nite like a friday or saturday, they will give you a pager. sometimes the wait is over 1 hour. alot of those people go to fridays directly next door for cheaper drinks then go back to pappadeaux when it's gets closer to getting a table.

HxyRg52e_UHDEV1Cvw2sPw.text: I have not been to New Orleans for a while but last weekend I felt as if I were there again, WOW!! This place is great, the ambiance, the food ,the people, a cornucopia of what was to come. We started with oysters on the half shell, fresh,briny, and sooo cold I got brain freeze. I've had frog legs from Alabama to Zanesville and these were far by the best ever fall off bone croaking delicious flippers I ever had. My 1 1/2 lb. fresh Maine lobster was so sweet I did not even think twice about using the clarified butter. The claws were as big as a baseball mitt. Oh, by the way I did have the wedge lettuce with blue cheese and bacon dressing and again it was the best. The rest of our party had food fit for a king and remarked on every aspect of our dining pleasure.When ever I get a hankering for the Big Easy again this fine establishment will beckon my name, and it will be soon.

zFTwFrFQCH85LFY5nN8m8g.text: this place sucks the portions are smalllllllll and very  overpriced the food taste okay i guess but there is hardly any of it

Jr6xZzoLLElWOsUd8ndb6A.text: always consistent quality and value. we have been regulars of pappadeaux in our previous  home of TX, and we still are big fans!

XhPIkkd0OM58fp23j5JDlg.text: We have been to Pappadeaux restaurants before, in other cities, and have always enjoyed the experience.  This location was no exception.  Friendly, attentive service.  Great selection of seafood dishes and Cajun style entrees.  Mixed drinks were flavorful.  A bit pricey, but portions are very generous -- we went home with leftovers. Nice desserts that we took home with us.  Great experience.

pVusvXTz6QnexrdCREgYGA.text: Love this place! From the service to the food you won't be disappointed. The portions are always hearty and delicious. I like the Crawfish Etouffee with dirty rice, YUM!

XyRmdD1u-QaQXfJLpe3EWw.text: The shrimp and mahi with dirty rice is fantastic. The French bread before the dinner is fresh and tasty. The restaurant is a bit too loud though.

EAVpSoTAfPiN0ySbsOGMng.text: Son of a gun, had some fun on the bayou...  We decided to splurge a little for a special occasion, and I'm glad we did!  Pappadeaux was a really fine evening out with exceptional food, delightful surroundings, and excellent company.  I ordered the lobster despite my inexperience with how to approach it -- our waiter gave me a quick tutorial and I'm so grateful.  My husband ordered Pasta Mardi Gras and loved it - he likes it spicy!  I was glad we left the young 'un home so we could be free and easy on a date night, but we could have brought her as it was kid friendly and she would have enjoyed it.  It was a grand night on the town - we loved the ambiance and the swanky yet unpretentious feel of this place.  Their website says "Fun, Festive & Always Original" and I must agree...

0TeT_8HIrn-eIfMT9DGWWg.text: This place is amazing.. any time I have extra cash I spend it right here! the service is amazing and what I love is the fact that I could order a to go order and still get the same amount of food and bread as if I were sitting at the table to dine in. This is something that many restaurants lack! when ordering take out many times they take away a soup or salad... not at this place! The seafood is always fresh and the staff always have a smile!!! I love it here

PTmVns1jfh6LSvEyutltcQ.text: We went here last night for my fiances birthday and I was very pleasantly surprised! The environment and ambience reminded me of a restaurant from New England. Casual but classy. Our server, Marcus, was absolutely delightful. He explained the menu to us and made some great suggestions. I ordered the Costa Rican mahi and it was perfect. It came with green beans and cheesy grits. I felt the seasoning was just right. We got the creme brulee for dessert and I highly recommend others to try it!

Pg6pTBQUk22-SChPsQ88lw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix by far!  Pappadeaux makes awesome cajun food. Cajun is one of my favorite styles of food because it is a way of getting food that is spicy and/or seafood and/or covered in butter.  My favorite dish is the mediterranean calamari.  This calamari is fried with artichokes, then topped with feta, capers and tomatoes.  Finally, it is drizzled in butter.  There is clearly a greek influence in this dish, which is another one of my favorite types of cuisine.    I have frequented this place enough to fall in love with several other appetizers as well: the lump crab and spinach dip, the shrimp and crawfish fondeaux, the jumbo lump crab cakes and the lobster bisque are all delicious!    For an entree I would recommend the soft shell crab or the lobster tail.  If these are out of your price range, just get a bunch of appetizers and save room for dessert!  The seafood here is the freshest that one can hope for in Arizona, so I personally think it is worth splurging a little.    Their cocktails are great!  If you get any of the blended ones, be careful!  They are so tasty, you may not notice how strong they are!  I like the frozen margarita and the swamp thing.  Last, but certainly not least, you will undoubtedly be tempted by the deserts here.   This is not only because they have a dessert tray but because they are southern comfort classics.  I am addicted to the banana bread pudding, the key lime pie and all of the different styles of cheesecakes.  They have a few staple items which are always on the tray and they have seasonal selections as well.  I love the atmosphere here.  It has dim, romantic lighting.  It can get loud at times especially when they have live cajun music.    The service is great here, most of the time.  Once or twice it has been a bit slow, but because of how great the food is, I will always come back for more!

TDNtNcDtHjd6uRQhniRNyQ.text: There's usually quite a limited menu in terms of fish and fresh food in Phoenix but Pappadeaux is really different. They had an amazing menu, I decided to have some of their crispy fried alligator which was so much better than I thought it would be. I mean alligators don't exactly look tasty, but the restaurant really did an excellent job in cooking it.   It was absolutely delicious and it is now something I will be completely willing to try again instead of having to be talked into it. The service in the restaurant was alright, the waiters were friendly enough but they weren't that attentive so I did have to wait when making an order. After actually having ordered my food though, it did come out pretty fast. It took about 15 minutes and everything I got was delicious.   The food was a little overpriced in my opinion but overall it was a decent restaurant.

DosmLgayzlOQ4UgJqoiGuA.text: First great service! Our waitress filled our teas and was just wonderful.  Even brought us a to go ice tea. The appetizer was the fried calamari.  I would call it a 3.5 it was tough and chewy and greasy. I ordered the Chicken Pasta dish and I give it a 5/5. Big portion great flavors. My husband had the Cajun Combo. He loved the catfish but the shrimp portion had a huge pile of white rice with tomatoes and then 5 little shrimp. Still a great value and well done. I recommend sitting in the back as its a noisy place but great atmosphere.

P3vYcXu-d7odZpiEqJrenw.text: I do not understand why a recipe gets changed after years of proven success.  I love Pappadeaux's - but why change the PO Boy recipe?  I was in Houston for business & thought how lucky to be getting a Po Boy from Pappadeaux's.  I did not read the menu as I knew ahead of time what I was going to get, but to my surprise it was different.  Instead of Remoulade Sauce, it now comes with Tartar & Cocktail sauce and pickle slices??? Not so good anymore...planning a trip to Phx in August, want Po-Boys...but not with the new recipe.

W8IP5963XjwEkabrmA0brA.text: EVERYTHING I have had here is amazing. I'm just going to make this review short and sweet. GO THERE. It's worth the wait. Always busy, but fun atmosphere and you will love the appetizers, entrees and desserts. AND the drinks. Only place I will make the drive to from Gilbert. I heard people travel from different states to come here! I get it now! ;)

UipKTT0Mp9ryYXo9SwwdeQ.text: Love the seafood fondue. Shit is straight up amazing.  I only take advantage of happy hours here. Service is poor but what do you expect from servers who never get tipped by the lower class.  Great atmosphere, kick ass patio during the winter months and pricey.

rBk5vurl4YDpMyM3ErFI4w.text: The food and the service was great. Kirk,our server, made our visit totally awesome. I would recommend this place if you love seafood and Cajun food. The cook George did an awesome job too.

je9tWsqmiVBFYA9Ay0cvfw.text: We drive by this place every day on the way home from work. One Friday night we decided we would have dinner here. Upon walking in, I absolutely fell in love with the patio. They had music going and the atmosphere was amazing.   We were seated before the rush kicked in. Our waiter was SO nice! We told him we had never been there and he was very attentive and helpful. He suggested we try to fried alligator for an appetizer, we both hesitated because we had never had alligator. But it was a go big or go home type of night so we decided to try it! Oddly enough we both LOVED It!   My boyfriend had a fish dish and I had lobster with shrimp dish. I had never ate lobster and did not like it, but that's just my own review of the lobster NOT of the restaurant. We will definitely be going back!  The only downside to it is the price, although for both of us our bill was about $120.00, we will definitely be going back. Next time we may not order as much food though.

MjorXxtEW3mc00UpFCFvtg.text: Some think the term "It is what it is" is stupid.  I think the saying " I hate fish that tastes fishy" is stupid.  Especially when the person saying it  just happens to be the Summer's Eve poster child and coincidentally, your date for the evening.  I've eaten here since they opened, trying everything on their menu at one time or another, even some things not on the menu.  If you don't see the cedar planked salmon on the menu, ask for it.   You'll never tell another soul how you don't like fishy fish again after eating this salmon...it's the most un-fishy-est, yet fishy-est fish fish dish you'll ever eat.  If that makes any sense.  You do however have your date to contend with afterwards. Or did you forget? Oh well. It is what it is.

3sD5A_2lqTpfJOOjB6MinQ.text: Great food. Never had a bad meal. The fondeaux is crazy good

K1Ut3yv9TuVVsj_xeciuGg.text: Contrary to the sign in front, this restaurant serves the worst seafood in the Phx valley.  I took some family members to dinner hear on a sunday evening and the experience was a total fail from the beginning.  Despite a plethora of open tables, we were told we would need to wait at least 15 minutes to be seated.  I think this may have been because we were a mixed race family. Predictably, when we were seated we were given a poorly situated table at the back of the bus.  We demanded and were reluctantly given another nearby table.  That should have been a sign to leave, but we stayed to endure a truly terrible and overpriced meal.  We ordered an appetizer platter to share, and then entrees of stuffed fried crab, stuffed fried shrimp, cajun catfish, and a cesar salad.  The only good thing in the entire meal was the salmon on the appetizer plate.  All the other seafood items were over-salted to the point of being almost inedible.  Two family members complained of feeling uncomfortably bloated after dinner due to the salinity of the food.  YUCKERS!!!  The service hear is also atrocious.  Despite the fact that this is a fairly expensive restaurant, it is completely staffed by inexperienced high school and college students. They even attempted to overcharge us for one of our entrees.  I left a 10% tip, which was in retrospect was way too much. No return trip ever!

zEgj6gCLJwMKsp727kaf4g.text: Expect your 20 minute wait time to be more like an hour. Zero respect for their patrons time. This is ridiculous.

yybGkOENPDYIW4BuUVgSDg.text: In my opinion, this is the best seafood in Phoenix. I've never had a bad bite in the 5-10 times I've been to this location. I'd recommend the mahi-mahi with pontratrain sauce; it's amazing! Other favorites include the crawfish etoufee and bisque as well as the seafood gumbo. You really can't go wrong on this menu. For dessert, the banana pudding and the creme brulee are quite good.

pXA5_irKBbdzPynUEzeZOQ.text: Not only is their food delicious, but the infrared sensors on their toilets aren't overly sensitive. I was able to take a prodigious dump there without getting auto flushed a single time.

yd2Tgmz8xtHBx7GsCoYuVQ.text: This place is right by my folks house and I have been here many times. Great happy hour spot to. I have had so many things on this menu its rediculous. They have deep fried aligator app that is so good. Inside they have a lobster tank with for sure the biggest lobsters I have ever seen. Today I went for lunch and got the Crispy Halibut sanwich and fries. They gave me shoestring fries, if you get fries make sure you get the regular fries cause shoe string fries look cute but they are just annoying. The sandwich was so good, and it was a big piece of halibut for $12.95. My girlfriend got the wood fired talapia with greenbeans, shrimp, and veggy. It was so good and the lunch price $13.95. She usually gets the crab legs and like i said, so many good things i get something different everytime. Nice big bar with a few boths and the dinning area is huge. This place can get busy at night and especialy on the weekends but its worth the wait if you have to.

uxhOK8VpFgZw48bvLVpjhg.text: Pappadeaux and I have a history.  We're both from Houston.  At home, I've been to just about every Pappas restaurant there is many times.  The Pappas family is an integral part of the Houston restaurant scene, love them or hate them.  (Most people love them.)  And in good old H-Town, they have a longstanding informal rivalry with the Goode family, who are like the working man's Pappas family, maintaining similar but less pricey/fancy restaurants.  At home, given a choice between Pappadeaux and Goode Co. Seafood, I will always choose Goode Co., because that's how my family rolls.  But when you take Pappadeaux out of that context, you must acknowledge that it is really a great restaurant.  This place is a carbon copy of the original, down to the plants on the patio.  I'm fine with that.  Why fix it if it ain't broke?  As far as I can tell, the food is carbon copy too.  And I'm fine with that, too!  It's pretty darn good food, and it's an accurate representation of the kind of food that our part of the world loves best.  You've got your Cajun, you've got your Creole.  You've got your fried fish (yummmm) and you've got your grilled fish (yummm!!!).  Their po-boy is not too terrible at all, considering how removed it is from its original context!  As a matter of fact, it was downright tasty!  I much prefer flounder to catfish, but hey, I'll live. The original down-home dishes are what Pappadeaux does best, and I am always weirded out to see it advertising itself as some kind of fusion restaurant or lobster buffet.  Sushi?  Seriously?  Come on guys!  You don't need a gimmick!  This isn't a Landry's!  If I had to pick favorite dishes, I'd go with anything mesquite grilled, their fried shrimp, and their crawfish bisque, just because I love bisque (although Pappadeaux does not, I should add, have the best in the world).  The service is always good, although I miss the witty signage that all Pappadeuxs have in Houston.  AH WELL.  I enjoy their atmosphere because it is like so many other seafood restaurants on the Gulf Coast, where I half-expect to see a picture of my grandfather's boat on the wall.    I haven't had much of what Phoenix has to offer in the seafood department, but I'm willing to bet, based purely on my Houstonian hubris, that this Texas import is one of the best in town.  Now if only we could get Goode Co. out here...

dDHPsepZmmgtvuL4h-PKLw.text: Just had dinner here tonight and absolutely loved it.  I had raw oysters, boiled shrimp, salad, and prime rib with asparagus.  Everything was superb and perfectly timed.   A young man named Steven waited on our table and took excellent care of us.    The one complaint I have is that there was no hot water in the men's rest room.  I hope that the restaurant is not trying to cut costs, especially considering the many menu items that require eating by hand.

93DY5LZhZ9QLO7Qz574QQw.text: I stop just short of 5 stars only because it's a chain.  Not a huge chain, but a chain none the less.  I love the oysters, but the appetizer trio they have is incredible, especially the fondeaux.  Everything tastes fresh and flavorful from start to finish.  Fried alligator anybody???  You betcha'.  And an incredible dessert selection to finish it all off.  Have the banana pudding with Nilla wafers!!!

Ay-2QdTZAXM9pLzYSNA_fw.text: Very nice environment. Prices a little spendy but the experience is well worth it.

w_DmSUbH_QRR5nltTCkZSg.text: Being from Louisiana / Mississippi I have a special spot in my heart (and stomach) for Cajun food. If you want truly authentic Cajun food then look no further than this restaurant off the I-17. Everything is great. No matter if you want broiled fish or fried seafood the taste is awesome and the price is good. The raw oysters are great. The crawfish platter is fanstastic. The crawfish bisque is to die for. The boudin is authentic and good served on a bed of white rice. The only other place in town for Cajun food is Baby Kay's. I'm posting a review of them as well.

pr1dIG0e3Pfnvuo_yd3dAA.text: I love happy hour at Pappadeaux, $5 Grey Goose cocktails and great appetizers.   Try the Grey Goose with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, so refreshing!   Order the oysters when in season and ask for blackened alligator, which is so good.   It's not usually on the menu, but they will make it.   I prefer it to fried alligator.   The cold boiled shrimp are to die for.

j-YNKQdmsmBYKiVpgkNjyw.text: Very Very Disappointed ordered the $35 Big Bay Plater. The shrimp on skewer was over cooked with no flavor and the Caribbean lobster tail had no favor what so ever. first time there and might just be the last.

NlqiRTNd7ieYLLv_oAxp2g.text: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Friday night with his parents for his birthday celebration.  I had heard it gets backed and that I should make a reservation.  Trying to ensure no annoyances with waiting, I made sure to call early in the afternoon to ask for a 6:00 pm reservation.  They don't take reservations during that time ... okay, that's fine, I understand BUT they will accept call-aheads and they will make sure your name is already on the waiting list before you get there.  Woo! that works! I call at 5:30 pm and let them know we will be half an hour.  Due to the fact they did not have a wait at that time, they would not take my name or party information.  When we got there at 6 pm, they had a wait.  I was decently annoyed but since it was only a 15-20 minute wait for our table, I wasn't overly annoyed.  We got our table, our server, and placed our order.  Sadly, there were multiple tables around us in and out before we even got our entrees.  There were several tables that ended up having three parties in and out before we were finally done.  That was a pretty big annoyance to say the least, especially since we were pretty hungry and we saw other tables getting served at a much more rapid pace!!!  The place does extremely well because the food is absolutely AMAZING.  The seafood gets flown in daily and not too many seafood places in Arizona can say the same thing.  Despite the waits we had to have to get seated and to finally get our food and then the wait for dessert, I still managed to embarass myself with the amount of amazing tasting food I devoured

f2oR4hRH6tyiq_2hUSRA8g.text: First time here and it was great! Server (Matt) was very knowledgeable and helpful. We had crab and blackened mahi, both were great. Also never had to ask for a refill, my iced tea was always full!

n4mEETR5NhsM0LrUSb0Z-A.text: First off, the don'ts: Don't bother going to this joint on the nights they do they oyster/crawfish specials (I think it's Wednesday and Thursday), it's packed far past the point of unpleasantness. It's just no fun, it ruins the experience, period. I mean, you know, unless you love oysters more than butterflies and rainbows and sex, in which case, knock yourself out I guess. I'd rather drive to the nearest ocean, pluck oysters out of it myself, take them home, spend a month learning how to prepare them properly and then make and serve them to myself than go to this stupid place when it's packed. Also, don't order the gumbo. It was awful.  That's really all I have bad to say about the food I have had at Pappadeaux. Everything else has been just wonderful. I had the whitefish dinner with lemon butter and capers, my wife had the shrimp and lobster platter (I can't remember their fancy Cajun names). We shared the appetizer plate that had calamari and alligator tail meat, among other things - all of it was truly stupidly delicious. Their calamari preparation (and sauce) is the best I've had in my life, and that's saying something.  So why the three stars, you might be asking, instead of four? Well frankly, it's just too expensive. It's obvious they've got hella overhead, the place is truly beautifully decorated, but you know what? I don't like paying for overhead, and there, I said it. I like paying for air conditioning and good food. I don't care if you've got one of every species of edible fish mounted to your beautifully laquered ornate wood trim or not, I really don't. If there are two of you and you are having a couple of drinks, it's difficult to walk out of this place for less than a benjamin and I frankly just think that's too much. We're not being served gold leafed fois gras and caviar here. This is especially so considering the portion sizes, which are not as criminal as Fish Market used to be, but are still not exactly a feast. In addition, the waitstaff is sub-par. I've said it before and I'll say it again, when I'm laying down this kind of jack, I don't expect to have to flag my waiter down like it's the last lap at Nascar. All that having been said, if you're craving good seafood and have the money and patience and can get a seat without waiting for an hour, Pappadeax is about as good as it gets in Phoenix.

V648ehryRoyTW7Zs7h7P1w.text: Service was horrid!  When a party calls with a reservation and you confirm said reservation they should not be told to either sit outside or wait for an additional thirty minutes before being seated.  (This is after a 20 minute wait past the reservation already.)  All food was either overcooked or undercooked.  Some meals were not even brought out until after other party members had already fisnished.  Trying to flag down a waiter for a refill on a water was nearly impossiable.  I realize that it is not the wait staff's fault but rather poor management.  In the future I will stick to a less pricey better tasting cajun option.

BE1IasqSUShKWNTloi5CMg.text: I CRAVE their etouffee, their lobster bisque, and this amazing seafood dip with tons of cheese and cream and delicious garlic baguette. OH man, I'm making myself hungry right now!  It's sooo nice to have a great N'awwluns restaurant in north Phoenix. Go early to get a seat for happy hour or plan on standing around!!! They will steam your oysters if your boyfriend wants them that way and they will give you samples of different drinks if you can't make up your mind about what you want.  They have great happy hour specials!  The music is great, too.  I go there for my birthday every year, it's a great tradition that I love and transports you out of the desert (which a former friend who shall remain nameless once described as a "godforsaken wasteland" what a jerk) to the decadent, delightful, deep south. I've been going there for 5 plus years now and the servers are very professional and attentive. It's a fun, different, and top notch dining experience. Wear something elastic or that allows you to loosen the belt, ha ha.

8N3PzCPci2hZuB7OvWDzag.text: all the way from cali,had to have this place oh how i love the food great place icant lie i love there food

EJkCrl3CyP5xM5F7SHwZPw.text: First off... the smoking section is to open and close to the people waiting to be called for their tables... I don't mind this so much as i hate watching a stand-in hostess stuff her face with crackers while we wait 20 minutes (which turned in to longer, of course while people that got there after us went in before we did...) We get to our table and get the most lethargic and unresponsive waitress we could possibly get. Great we get our order in with no feedback or questions on how we want anything cooked or substitutes on sides or how we want our potatoes... absolutely unacceptable. Get our drinks and my SO's drink cup has a layer of grease film on the top of his Extremely watered down coke... yummy. Menus left on the table, extra silver on the table. Our waitress didn't even clear anything off and just let it all pile up. We ordered calamari and get this microwaved, freeze burn crap that tasted like rubber on some pieces and gushy  on others... gross. Look at the extra plate left on the other side of our already cluttered table and it had food flecks on it.... Absolutely disgusting. Will NEVER go back there again. bad bad bad.

_BnpA4H8jsNCk262YtP93Q.text: Pappadeaux is overpriced and overrated.  There are so few choices in seafood restaurants in the Phoenix area.  It's a shame.  Franchise.  The food is ok.  One step up from Red Lobster.

-rLpLfKBZ4LJm1ZQz5ovUw.text: We walked in and were completely impressed by the ambiance and the overall look of the entire place.  We stared with the shrimp cocktail - which had Fresh gulf shrimp, chunky avocados & pico de gallo in a spicy cocktail sauce.  I can say, this was the best shrimp cocktail I have ever had.  We also split a ceasar salad which was perfect.  For dinner, I had the Mahi blackened over dirty rice .  The fish was fresh and spicy - all their fish is flown in daily.  My date had the Pasta Mardi Gra - Linguine tossed with crawfish, andouille sausage & crimini mushrooms in a marinara cream sauce topped with jumbo grilled shrimp. . .  This dish was quite spectacular... We thought we were in New Orleans...  For desert, we had NY Cheesecake - with fresh strawberries in a sauce - topped with fresh whipped cream - I can't think of any cheese cake I have ever had that was better than this...  The desert plate they bring to the table has all the deserts on there - they all looked amazing- quite a difficult choice... WOW - the entire dinner was perfect!  AND on top of it all, our service was top notch.  SAM was excellent - he talked with us and explained the items we had questions on, cleaned the table in between courses, and gave us fresh silver ware - along with always keeping our drinks full.  And he had a great attitude - he acted like he wanted to make our dinner very special.  The manager came and talked with us also, and thanked us for coming in.  Quite impressive.  This was one of the most memorable dinners we have had, from the time we walked in the door until we walked out.  We were completely impressed with Pappadeaux - and can't wait until we return.  If I could give it 10 stars, I would, it is worth it.

7eG0GB11g0mODOkgwgClgA.text: My first visit to Pappadeaux didn't start off well. I decided to grab a quick dinner to avoid rush hour traffic back from Phoenix to Chandler, and Pappadeaux looked good. I waited almost 10 minutes for someone to even acknowledge me, in spite of a half dozen servers standing nearby talking about their various life dramas. (It was 115 degrees that day, and ice water was definitel at the top of my list of "must haves," seconded by a glass of wine.)   As I started to leave, determined to find a restaurant that actually welcomed its customers, an astute server -- Johnnie -- realized I was ready to bail and proceeded to treat me like a queen for the next 45 minutes.   I was sitting next to the dessert tray and he said, since I'd waited to be served, the restaurant would treat me to a dessert. I don't eat dessert, but I tried to be gracious in light of his offer, so I said thank you. Johnnie realized it wasn't going to be my thing. I ordered the filet topped with crabmeat and a wonderful sauce. It was perfectly cooked according to my request, and certainly didn't need anything extra to enhance its flavor. Johnnie talked to his manager and, after his talk, I was comp'd my meal (less my two glasses of excellent wine). I told his manager that Johnnie had saved the day. The manager said the person who was working my area of the restaurant hadn't shown up for work that day. I didn't really appreciate the excuse. A half dozen servers were within 8 feet of me and could have seen I wasn't been served. But Johnnie did -- and took responsibility. Good for him!  The food was excellent. (I'm not a big seafood eater, but the sauce for the steak accompanied by the crab was perfectly seasoned.) Johnny earned a handsome tip because of his attentiveness, and the restaurant earned a second chance in the future.  But I think I'll ask for Johnny as my server.  Cheryl

glbdXVcLL7NIbbgj8Xuu6w.text: Oh Papadeaux, you are one of my most f-a-v-o-r-i-t-e places to go enjoy a lovely, fresh and deliciously flavorful creole or Cajun seafood meal. I love the ambiance of this place as it truly feels like I'm back again in NOLA. I don't even mind waiting 30 or so minutes to be seated while live blues music serenades me in preparation for those addictive flavors to come. The sights, the smells, the sounds, the service and most importantly the flavors, Papadeaux consistently delivers the entire package. I most certainly will return again and again!

3MHAqSqyZAf0OwKPK32WEA.text: Love this place. We went tonight, the Sunday  before Labor Day, and it was quite busy. We were quoted 45 minutes, but we were called after 15 minutes. We decided to stay at the intimate, quiet bar. Our app, the trio, took awhile, but was so worth it! We replaced the calamari, which they were out of, with more alligator. The app was great! I loved the fondeaux, but my hubby thought the alligator, which was usually moist, was king of dry. We ordered the horseradish plank tilapia and the porchartrain. The tilapia was a bit dry, without sauce. I loved my fish, but I feel like there wasn't enough sauce. The service at the bar was awesome. We will definitely return, but maybe try new entrees. The potions are huge, so we will have a great lunch.

P2YdJS6HpA5G9RscqhYGfQ.text: I come here for my birthday alone, kinda sad but like a treat myself day. The food is good so far, i got the oysters and seafoods items. The only one i feel sadder than eating alone, is my server. I think because i sat at the table in the corner so he didn't attend my table much, only after the table next to me about to go, then he became nicer to me. But so far so good.

iGeve6lX927c4yv6vwOxFw.text: My favorite Cajun restaurant the food is always cooked perfectly. The staff is professional at all times. I don't like sitting at the back of a restaurant but I am willing to make the exception sometimes at Pappadeaux. Love the food always worth the wait.

Chrn_Y8J8-zMrfFwAuklBw.text: To start our visit, the manager very rudly, informed us they do not allow outside drinks, my 10 year old has a 1/2 full Gatorade bottle, we all ordered drinks, not watter.  They removed 2 items from the menu that were our favorite dishes. Service was very slow. 40+ min. This was a Sunday at 5 PM, was not very busy when we arrived but had picked up by the time we left. It is now off our list of go to places.

JIDca5jziojtm4Lzad0Xcg.text: Went for a Sunday night dinner with a group.  I wouldn't have picked Pappadeaux but he group wanted to go there.  Had Crab claws for an appetizer.  When they came they  were drowned in a sauce with little on them and way too much rice.  Had the fried clams for dinner.  Tough and overly chewy and for a full order not really very many.  All in all I think Pappadeaux is overly expensive for what you get.  Service was good though despite the fact the place was very busy, and for he life of me I don't understand why.

ElOsGi0C3XEwvoeTdMHPsg.text: Still a favorite for the family.. cant gonwrong with the alligator and fish.the staff is great always the waits are fast moving as well.

wKq_obhx3qldpWTyCI5DmA.text: We had a fantastic food experience here.  The food is exceptional and the service is one of the best restaurants in the Phoenix metro area.

rLrCaZ-y5Rz5DI_YGJFtkw.text: The restaurant itself is super cute. Good location, ample seating available indoor and outdoors. We started with the Boudin, which is a spicy Cajun sausage which was cooked to perfection. It's served with dirty rice. Very simple dish but very tasteful. Our server was really nice, her name was Jackie, attentive and definitely making sure we had everything we needed. Another thing that we really appreciated was that my cousin has a dairy allergy, after we told Jackie about it the manager came out to our table and clarified everything with my cousin to make sure it would be cooked correctly. Downsides were that we did notice that it looks like a lot of the staff seems to be over worked. They don't have enough servers or something. Our table wasn't set when we sat down, no silverware or napkins. Overall my experience was fairly good. But for a dinner for 4 costing over $200 dollars I expect a little more than just good.

ShB1fdK2-G5przp3Z2T8Uw.text: We have been here a couple of times and the seafood is fantastic! It a pricey but amazing.  If you want top notch service and seafood, stop by here.  We love it.

ltCorJ7ths7H8A_fyS3V-Q.text: Favorite seafood in Phoenix, especially when they have oyster specials. The restaurant has great chicken and steaks as well.

x1BHVA7w2pJoG6bHVuiisA.text: Even though the prices may be a little steep, I enjoy the food and atmosphere once a year or so. Think it would be a great place to take friends and family on a special occasion or outing. The only reason I'm not rating them higher is the prices. Food and drinks for 2-3 people would be lucky to keep it under 100$. But it has a good vibe and I continue to visit them.

7tWuzezZt9ONU7dGuJIixw.text: I've had Pappadeaux in San Antonio, Dallas, and Denver. This one is by far the worst. I'm not sure if it was because the Mother's day crowd and they were overwhelmed. But very few of our party of 10+ were satisfied. Very disappointing for such expensive dishes.

6bCq_cIP47LdrJ7nfqAOHQ.text: This is a really great choice for New Orleans style seafood. The details of the courtyard and restaurant is really stunning. The lobster bisque soup was a big hit. I was disappointed that they didn't serve clam chowder or mussels. Really great options if you enjoy seafood, especially shrimp. The fresh lobster was the hit at our table.

Pb0OoISfhfYKiUD5a1gWuw.text: This is probably one of my new favorite seafood restaurants in town. I had my first experience here on Christmas Eve to celebrate my birthday with friends and I must say, even though they were crazy busy, the service was excellent and the food was very fresh and delicious! Of course my only 'beef' is that it's a bit pricey. However, it was worth it for the freshness of the food.   I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a great seafood restaurant in Phoenix area. Even though it's a chain restaurant, they delivered! Two thumbs up from this super taster!

ay-Heny6I-goWkLyZtlZ_w.text: Best meal and best service in a long time! Our server, Wyatt, did a great job and the food was on point!

F3054Y_wXhsHybpid56_fA.text: This is my first time here in pheonix and wanted something indulgent after my flight.  Pappadeaux was right next to my hotel and it looked flashy and inviting. So I decided to give it a shot. I looked up the yelp reviews and I knew I chose well.  I had a blue moon, the lobster bisque and a crab cake. Not a lot but I knew it was going to be hearty and filling. I was right.   Lobster bisque was creamy but not too thick. Had large chunks of lobster and was overall amazing.  The crab cakes though were phenomenal. So yummy and filling. So many different textures and flavor elements. I could eat those all day every day.

DV7IAuiPBtNmXXoIElnPXw.text: Amazing! Everything was so delicious! I can't wait till the next time my boyfriend wants seafood! I loved everything about my experience at Pappadeaux. My boyfriends dish was an orgasm in your mouth!! Shrimp jalapeno cheese and bacon oh my yesssssss please over dirty rice!! Yummmy!!

docKTKcgpqrvWLe6DUnacw.text: I had a new dish today, it was o k. I definitely wont try this dish again I usually get the shrimp with jalapenos and bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nNe8riu6keEJO0WVKDgXow.text: Fresh oysters on the half shell, best service from Jaclyn and Jose. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best fresh oysters on the half shell. Thanks to great service. Jaclyn and Jose, made my birthday so relaxing.

ItGVRqk6pCgeq8xNUWyJZA.text: While returning from a trip up North, the timing was perfect to head over to Pappadeaux (only 1 location in the Valley) en route to heading home. Typically the wait can be LONG but catching them on Sunday afternoon for lunch was perfect.  Just me and the kid and I sold the idea of this place over a fast food chain after being in the car for a while. As expected, no real wait. We were seated immediately but after the initial table, I made a request to move us to the bar area with a booth and a view of the AFC Championship Football game. Worked out perfectly!!!   Needing a drink, I went with the Strawberry Mangearux Tango drink, a Kids Fried Shrimp & fries meal, and a Louisiana Gumbo & Po boy combo. I wasn't sure what to expect with the PoBoy but figured if it wasn't enough shrimp I'll just steal from the kid. That wasn't the case for lunch. Po Boy sandwich had plenty of shrimp (maybe just 1 sliced pickle too much, but easy to remove) and good complimentary ingredients. Bread used wasn't the same as the baguette type brought out with butter prior to the meal but same taste. Instead of Fries with the Po Boy, that's where the Gumbo came into play. A few choices, but when I heard Andouille sausage everything was a blur. With family roots tied to the south and one of the family's specialized "go to meal" of gumbo, It's always hard for me not to be critical of any others. This one was cool... A little too much juice, but decent flavor. I like mine a bit thicker so some Gumbo Filet may have helped resolve.   Good options for lunch and the timing from order to table wasn't so bad with the football game playing & kids menu games going on. Next time I plan to give the oysters and fish a go as many of the fish plates leaving the kitchen were looking good...

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Mangeaux Tango
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Game view from the booth at the bar
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gumbo with shrimp and andouille sausage

c97tMGyZZFQ_OJpx1koBUg.text: Giving 3 stars because our waiter packed us the wrong leftovers.... The weird part was one of the boxes belonged to me and another I didn't recognized. Besides that.........the best part of the meal for me would have to be the appetizers. The Blue Coin Oysters were my favorite, they were fresh like they were just pulled from the ocean. The fried alligator was delicious. I was not impressed by the main course which was the Catfish and oysters w/ dirty rice. The fish was pretty bland didn't have much a flavor to it. Next time I'll come just for the appetizers, and make sure there's no left overs lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dirty rice and catfish
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Alligator
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half a dozen Blue Coin oysters

Q6AybA9yl4igTbOjZlETnQ.text: We had to try here being that I love seafood & my hubby is the oyster man!! So glad we did, it definitely did not disappoint!! We left there full as a tick & we could barely even finish our entrees since their portions were quite generous. We started with the oyster & chilled shrimp app as you'd guess, my hubby chose to start with the blue points & OMG is all I can say!! He was completely in love with the oysters & the shrimp were a definite hit also, very good value for the buck!! I then had to try a cup of the crawfish bisque, all I can say is there's really nothing to say except it was creaminess heaven!! Then yes the hubby needed just a few more oysters so he wanted to compare the gulf coast & he could of course tell the difference with their saltiness compared to the blue points sweetness but he said either way they were both sheer bliss!! Then we've got the entrees but at this point who really has room, lol!! My hubby chose the half of grilled chicken because he needs more white meat in his life, haha & he was so glad he did! He had the chicken with the brocolini & red skin mashed potatoes, he said everything was so moist & fresh! I had the grilled seafood skewers with the chilled barley salad with fresh arugula, okay everything was soooooo good & the portions were huge!! I literally could only eat half of one of the skewers & the barley salad was so good you almost forgot that it was healthy!! Can't wait to bring my southern mother in law their when she comes out to visit us because she'll absolutely love it. This will definitely a hit & will be one of our regular spots, you definitely get a great value for your money!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun crawfish bisque, yes lots of cardio afterwards!!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blue points, hubby loves them!!
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish oysters &amp; cocktail shrimp to start!!

k9VkOpqFmC2h6eltHYaxig.text: Love Pappadeaux!!! I really love the atmosphere here and the decor. It's usually packed here which I don't really care for but that means it's a yummy good place. They have amazing appetizers, the creamy dip and alligator! They have some yummy seafood entrees. Although I do wish they had more crawfish options. I love coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gator
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crawfish bisque decent
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gator!

af9kVgjUocCVgsIo6JZEBA.text: We gave this place a try for the first time. I expected more delicious food or maybe we're just not seafood people. I had the Moroccan salmon; it was a little soggy for my taste. My hubby ordered steak and said it's better at Texas Roadhouse for less the price. The calamari is really good though and the dip that comes along with it but overall we most likely won't be back.

BjT58uhaNuzznwZ6IlHCsQ.text: I am so disappointed! I went with my husband for his birthdaThe wait time was less than 5 minutes, the restaurant is beautiful and the food was amazing but .... we have waited 10 min to get our drinks, another 15 minutes to get bread and another 10 minutes to get our food. Total we waited 35 minutes from when we placed our order to get our food and the worse is that our plates were cold --'. My husband and I are two bites and decided to take it home. Another 20 Minutes to get the check and boxes. Too expensive for the service we got! Bad experience!   Update  After my review the manager nicely mailed me a gift card to try again. This time the service was perfect, Brooke was really nice, effective, and quick! The food amazing as usual!! I am giving a 5 stars BUT the tables are really too close to each other :/!

wvvaYA2ODIVX7XX-mCoLBA.text: Cris R guest relations manager here is my mailing address for my post on Yelp  I would of gave them less if I could. My co-workers and I went to this location through word of mouth. We ordered the Crab crusted Mac-Cheese it was so bland I couldn't eat it. We also ordered the Seafood Platter this was good quite a bit of food cool. Here is where the one came in for a referral. We got ready to leave the waiter Eddie offered us the desert off of the try. We were full and decided to get the banana pudding. Eddie swore by it saying it was made fresh everyday. Well here is this mess that they call freshly made the bananas were spoiled in the jar the cookies were extra mushy and the pudding was gritty. We drove from the Radisson on 44th by the airport which in traffic took us almost 40 minutes. We were so disappointed if they were close We would of drove back. Don't order desert. Or the Mac n Cheese
