kTdomrsSOLwwpU7lNGSZzA.text: Not happy with my experience which is weird since I've been here before. This time they just couldn't get things right. Filet over cooked as well as my lobster. By the time they remade the meal I was over it and they still took 20 mins to give me melted butter.  Still had to pay for it all. Will not be coming back. Really upsetting.

5CMf6KTTmkwR4MAFbojZbA.text: Pappadeaux's a bit difficult to get to but you would expect it to be difficult to find Cajun food this far west.  Really popular place for the weekend crowd but if you call about 15 minutes before arriving they will put you on the wait list so that's nice.  Decor is pretty good but the dining room is so big it sort of feels like a factory, maximize the number of times the tables can be filled and flipped.  Well, that's enough about that...bar was kind of disappointing especially since they do not carry any southern beers, no Abita no Dixie.  I was actually surprised about the beer selection being so sparse, if I remember correctly 8 choices, nothing really a standout.  The food....it was ok.  She had the steak...a rib eye if I remember correctly, it was not a 37$ steak by any means.  Presentation was not great at all  meat looked lumpy and misshapen.  I had the crawfish etouffee and fried crawfish.  It was ok...really nothing special.  Etouffee was by far much better than the fried but I did not walk away waiting to come back again.  For a starter I had a dozen raw oysters on the half shell.  They were the highlight of the night by far.  Nothing else really wowed either of us.    Bottom line:  if you're craving some Cajun this is the place to go in the phoenix area, but you will probably not leave feeling like you just had a memorable experience.

xtTeK9pRBTCczepIe38ykg.text: Hubby and I were wandering around on a late Friday night looking for something to eat.  Didn't see a lot of options so we drove to this place just looking for some appetizers.  Everything on menu looked good so we ended up ordering the appetizer trio, seared ahi tuna, and some alligator meat.  The ahi tuna was very tasty and definitely my favorite dish of the night.  The alligator meat was a bit on the chewy side, but not too bad.  I would skip it next time around though.    The service here on a busy Friday night was still great!  So glad we found this place and was able to eat right away.

ATkOdt90TEbtHlTKfZ5Wsw.text: Excellent experience and excellent food. Went for the first time in San Antonio and will definitely be going back. Yiasou

__-i1h_F1L_PvF0CQQf-ug.text: The food is awesome!  The service is PERFECT!  Though, it can be expensive.  The Pasta Mardi Gras should come with a cigarette...

XqbeyAbE_2ni0cgpO8ckcA.text: Went here for a holiday dinner. Food was good, service good, all was good. Unique seafood offerings for sure.

RrKlYKU2YVVqXYfsyTtWIA.text: Have been to this chain many times before this particular store it's further away from my home then I usually travel however my friend insisted we go. We arrived early for a Friday evening about 5:30 PM and scored a booth in the bar area service was extremely attentive and food was fantastic ! We had raw oysters  and shrimp on a stick  for appetizers ...( shrimp however, was  lightly breaded ) tasty but I normally do not eat fried...  For My mail course  which  I always take at least half home and in this case probably three quarters as it was a lot of food I had  the halibut with brussels sprouts and it was melting in my mouth fantastic!   They have a great happy hour beverage selection and a few good appetizers but a lot of it is fried.   I'm usually into quality not necessarily quantity however pappadeaux's  provide both I would certainly return.   Seafood in the desert is hard to find but this chain restaurant gets it right!

DkHrKHOLTWOgdlWyCV_umw.text: Very fresh seafood. Been here twice and enjoyed the grilled salmon and fish & chips. Fish had a light but crispy exterior; fries were well seasoned and perfectly fried. Do not recommend the gumbo. It was full of seafood (shrimp, oyster, crab) but I didn't like the overall flavor (although I did enjoy the andouille.) This place is very busy so expect a wait.

aXO-kVq3gtYymRMD4pdRvQ.text: Love this place!!! Best seafood around. My last visit, I went for lunch. I tried the shrimp and sausage jambalaya. Yum!  Service is always great! Relaxing atmosphere with indoor/outdoor seating. Prices are very reasonable.

RdbqfhRaXH_bphnqiQXnLQ.text: Waitress Crystal was Excellent.. A big thank you to her for being patient with us. Our first time here and the menu is overwhelming but awesome choices.   Our drinks Mojito and my Tom Collins both were Superb... We had to do two rounds!   Appetizers simply delicious coconut shrimp and alligator!! Fresh and crispy mmmm good!   Halibut was out of this world fresh with delicious butter seasoning!   The sampler trio with blue crab :) beyond amazing! Loved the fried fish, stuffed ball of crab cake was a slam dunk in my belly.   We ordered the gumbo.. Woohoo SPICY!  Red beans and Rice boy there was a Cajun party going on.. spicy!   Cheese grits omgggg sooo heavenly!   No room for deserts tonight but we Will be back next trip here to beautiful Phoenix!   Thank you Again Crystal.. She really made our experience a delightful experience!!

oF5_PB3ygK0GUtjqya14NA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. The seafood is perfection and the steaks are excellent. It has a great ambience and service. I leave longing only for my next visit! Never have I been disappointed.

TkeQZiiAKOwFky5rEgBPXg.text: I really enjoy this restaurant.  I have been here three times and love coming here. It's a bit expensive for a dish but you get a lot of food for the price. I have gotten the oysters, mussels, fried samplers platter,and a couple of the fresh fish options. I also usually get a cup of gumbo with my meals.  The place is usually packed on the weekend but they have a bar and some tvs for the wait.  The services here is always really good as well. I have nothing to complain about this place. Definitely will keep coming back to try the rest of the menu.

nNmGxNW335PaLPJTZuQCDw.text: It's hard to find good Cajun restaurants in Phoenix.  I enjoy this place immensely, but I wish they had more steamed/grilled than fried foods.  I did have the shrimp and grits, which was out of this world delicious!

CirbdjXLrlZdkPI5hhDQXQ.text: Overpriced, mediocre food. The wife's lobster was dry, my pasta dish had shrimp and inedible pieces of sausage. The ambiance was crowded and hectic, service was nothing to brag about. Bread was late, but was about the best thing about the meal. I think I'll not be returning.

1VGv2O7tHhMpqm-T0rc5dw.text: Went for lunch on Black Friday, holy cow!!! This place is sooo yummy!! Everything was fresh and you can totally tell they make everything from scratch. Everything was absolutely delish!!! Definitely recommend this place!!! Waiter was great too!! Great service great food!!! 5 stars all day!!!

5e8_p6X8EMEr7ma6-whfFQ.text: Ugh....so disappointing.  Went there for with another couple to celebrate his birthday....and well it was probably one of the worst dinning experiences ever!  Our server was horrible...she was pleasant however really should choose a different career path because serving is NOT it.  She was NOT timely with her service, came and took drink order, forgot to bring menus, brought some of the drinks "oops I forgot his beer", "oops forgot your wine", rushing us to order when we were still waiting on appetizer???  Got tired of waiting for the "gluten free" menu, so one of us went looking for one....  But here's the best part, we ordered a salad that two of us were going to share......you'd think - BRING an extra plate when you bring the salad, after all she knew we were sharing......NOPE! No plate.."can you bring an extra plate, please?"  "OK"........YEAH not sure where she went to find this elusive plate, because it never arrived, we had to share off the same plate .  Oh and if you're gluten free...be ready to be interviewed by a manager regarding your deficiency on gluten....REALLY, we need to discuss the level of allergy?....Gluten free is just that, NO GLUTEN in my food please, not rocket science!  No return visit for us - let corporate know, they said "oh sorry, here's a gift card so can try us again".................hmmmmmm

67NHaMdU1Y5VlWKya0kp4w.text: I don't think I will be visiting this restaurant anymore.  This past Thursday my second time visiting this location the 1st was in may of 2013 both times I was very disappointed in the service from the staff.    In May 2013 my family and I decided we wanted to have our monthly family dinner at the restaurant and my mother called to see if she could schedule a reservations since it would be about 12 of us on a Friday night,  she was told no and that we would have to come in and wait to be seated.  We came and of course it was busy,  we expected a 30-60 minute wait but after 90 minutes and seeing so many people be seated before us we go back to the hostess and she assures us that there is no table to accommodate us yet but she can sit us in an area that we will be close to each other.  With grumbling stomachs we agree.  When we are seated we are light years away from each other and there is no way for us to communicate with one another.  My mother brings it to the attention of the manager and he was able to fix the problem immediately and for her troubles comped one of the 4 meals she had on her ticket.  I had the blackened Mahi Mahi that night and it was absolutely amazing!   Fast forward to this past Thursday,  I took my mother for her birthday and it was an utter disappointment. I had Mahi Mahi with Alexander sauce and dirty rice.  My mother had the etoufee.  My fish was great but the rice was very undercooked and hard when I brought it to the attention of the manager and asked for a better cooked serving he said he would see what he could do but it may come from the same batch, which only tells me that he was planning on giving more guest that terribly hard rice.  My mother's etoufee was extremely greasy when brought to the servers attention he tried to say that's the way it's supposed to be but my mom is a regular there she knows what is supposed to taste like.  I was brought a fresh batch of rice that was delicious and my mother was able to order a new meal which she had to get to go because the grease from the etoufee upset her stomach and killed her appetite.  The server I wish I had his name was inattentive,  hardly checked up on us and was a bit rude after we complained about the food.  I thanked him twice and both times he looked with no response.  If I'm gonna spend $70 on a dinner for 2 I expect a friendly accommodating staff I get better service at my local burger King.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi Mahi in Alexander sauce with a side of rice
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Etoufee

CxZPtbXmKXHNAcsJOr7EpA.text: What brings my review down a peg is that our server was not very attentive or efficient.  Barring that, the food was good except the cold fries under my frog legs, which my complaint fell on deaf ears.

C1fyFQL1wZY0lY0WXfEY4Q.text: Very nice restaurant. Ordered takeout and sat at the bar while we waited. Friendly professional bartenders. I'm not a fan of calamari. As a matter fact I really dislike it however companion ordered it and of course I thought I'd try some again. It was delicious perfectly made.  The food came out promptly and it was very good except my rice and beans or very very spicy but good. The portions were also very good. I would most definitely go back to this restaurant the food was excellent the staff was friendly and professional and the wait was not long at all. I want to add that they don't have Jambolaya on the menu. Really strange for seafood place that spouts Cajun in Louisiana style seafood. Very big disappointment

W1D7srNR6xrdfYKBGWk-Ww.text: I usually go to Pappadeaux for a special occasion.  I think the seafood salad is amazing.  I had the creme brulee for desert.  The coffee the ambiance is so nice and the wait staff are wonderful.  It is not everyday type fare for me, due to the fact it can be pricey.  Everyday is usually packing my own lunch.  I would recommend this venue for "power lunches" and meetings with others.  Just walking in the door improves my mood.  For a date I would say, stop in for an appetizer and a glass of wine.  Excellent food.

XNc_FvjgiMq0LXOTS8SEkw.text: Very, very good seafood just about everything on there menu is great ask for Johnnie for your waiter he is excellent he is on point with the menu he explains everything you need to know very nice gentlemen

MRyODa9Z_-n50XHn5NS3Kw.text: Very delicious never had food like this before I'm from san diego so this was new for the family i hope they consider putting a location out here i know the people would love it

MCKp3yKhs6zYa3zLA5_8lw.text: Delicious seafood! If you love seafood and can style, this is the place to go! Wonderful customer service too! My second time visiting Phoenix, and this is my second time coming here.

W1AqCfyjTQfzsC6zqiy-dg.text: The food here is phenomenal. You could literally close your eyes and point to anything on the menu and it's likely to be delicious. Portions are well sized, staff is always friendly and the food is always fresh. Plenty of seats that get filled quickly during dinner time. It's a little darker than I'd prefer during dinner but I get it, it's the ambiance.

9ZkaWk3hvEgcJ3i2DinTGw.text: We have been to several of their locations in Houston and Dallas and this one didn't disappoint. Our server, Audrey was wonderful. Her personality and professionalism made the dining experience perfect.   The portions are large so go easy on the courses or plan to take lots home. My husband had the tilapia and I had a red fish. Both were amazing. I want the recipe for their spaghetti squash!

-L77whu0cm8A76AEsj1rmA.text: Had the Costa Rican Blackened Mahi-Cooked Perfectly Also had the Oyster Duo-Both were excellent. Very pleasantly surprised by this restaurant!

ZLa7VK7Wh2A6OAe-Br-avQ.text: This place is always a return for me whenever I'm in town. I have to say, I'm never one to really like chain restaurants, but this is an exception!   The food is generally really good and portions are just enormous. I like this place cuz of the oysters. Was a little disappointed that they didn't have the Blue Point, but for $5.99 a dozen for the Texas Gulf Coast was a score. The gumbo is always tasty. If you feel like sharing among others, order the Jumbo size that's not on the menu! The Greek salad was a good touch to all the heavy food that is served there too.   One side note for the bartender. When serving a shot of whiskey or anything else, please don't add crushed ice. It sorta ruins the drink. I'm just saying. You don't serve whiskey with crushed ice.   Bottom line: repeat for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jumbo seafood gumbo and Greek salad with crab.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Texas Gulf Coast

_W_JZZUgD5KGpn4zMTFvqw.text: Ate here with my grandparents-in-law when they came for a visit. We had the best time. We started out sharing a greek salad that included shrimp. It was fabulous. Then we all ordered either lobster or a fish dish of some sort. we tried each other's entrees and all were perfectly cooked and spiced. Their dirty rice is off the charts amazing! I had a salmon dish with a cream sauce that I would definitely order again. We were so full we didn't order dessert but if I went back I would love to try their pecan pie. It looked amazing!!!!!

GVGTFveXPH_IV7Y6hXG1WA.text: Probably the best seafood in Arizona.   A bit pricey but worth it.  The desserts are fantastic.   A very loud atmosphere so not great for a quiet night out.

uPLsctf5AHG9GetR5tueTw.text: I ordered the Cajun Combo not amazing but very tasteful it was beautifully cooked and was buttery smooth only thing I did not like was the saltiness of it but otherwise great atmosphere and wonderful crew.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looked amazing tasted fairly good not the best but overall pretty solid!

VaY7W-dgpu0JLukjT36DVQ.text: Ate here with my husband for a small dinner while we were visiting friends in Phoenix. Since this restaurant was within walking distance (less than a 5 minute walk) to the hotel we were staying in (Candlewood Suites), we decided to eat here. The first thing I thought of when we came in here was that this was one of those expensive tourist restaurants... and well it is (well duh, it's located right next to a few hotels).   Anyways, when we first came in here (sometime after 9 pm), no one acknowledged us. There was no one by the hostess area. So we waited by the front for a few minutes before deciding to just walk over to a table and seat ourselves. When we sat ourselves at a booth near the bar, a server saw us and brought us 2 menus.   We ordered the following:  Crispy Fried Alligator: We got a large order and was surprised that it didn't really come with a lot of pieces. Would really have liked to have more, especially since the price tag was a bit high. Anyways, my husband wanted to order this because well, how many opportunities do you get to eat alligator? It was tasty, but a little on the oily side. And it tasted like chicken (but you know, a lot of things taste like chicken). I don't know if I would ever order this again just because of the price tag and I didn't really feel like my palate was wowed a new culinary treat.  Louisiana Seafood Gumbo: We ordered a bowl to share and really liked the flavor of the gumbo. My husband just wished that there were more seafood pieces in this instead of just a few pieces of shrimp and mostly sausage.   The service we received was below average... Our server only came to our tables a total of 3 times (1 to get our order, 2 to bring us our food and 3 to bring us our check). He was not attentive to refilling our water and so I had to find another employee to get us some more water. The place wasn't even busy at all, there was just a handful of tables with people eating and no one at the bar. The place was basically empty (pretty spacious, which made the emptiness more noticeable).   The ladies' restroom was clean and there is plenty of parking in the lot.   Overall, would not come back. Food is overly priced and nothing seemed to wow us. This is just one of those tourist traps who just like the convenience of dining here due to proximity to their hotel.

ilf5AjOB6crBXRxKZcH1WA.text: Absolutely fabulous!!! Alaskan King crab and oysters are amazing. ALL the good there is amazing, especially the butter they give you with their bread!! Nick, he works at the bar, he's always friendly and knowledgeable about the food. He's a good guy. Also Jose, he chucks oysters at the bar, he's the man. This place is highly recommended!

mXvC6ZetEtLPOUl9t2EIAg.text: This place wasn't bad. The food was overall very good although there were some things that weren't the greatest. I got oysters and the alligator for appetizers. The oysters were probably the best I've ever had and the alligator was amazing! Not at all tough. Although on the menu it only lists the alligator as fried, they also serve it blackened which I totally recommend. They let us have half and half. Then for my main dish I got the Costa Rican Mahi Alexander. Although I only wanted the smaller portion, I forgot to say so, so I was given the larger and paid more than I expected. It was overall a very good dish though my scallops were a bit undercooked and my shrimp were a bit over. Over all a very good experience. I wouldn't mind going again but I wouldn't go out of my way to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half a dozen of the Blue Point Oysters.
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Costa Rican Mahi Alexander.

px-J0unVLEgMBzZMbAhSDg.text: Went on date night and was Amazed! Fantastic food, great staff, awesome cocktails! Just have to be patient, it's Very popular, which means it Very crowded and long wait! But the bar helps with that!

gwH5EgHVPPdovgWVgSe-oQ.text: Great service, beautiful atmosphere and very, very tasty,....we loved it all! We all tried several dishes and ate off each others plates,...hahaha! My one and only suggestion is add tomatoes to the po-boy. The French bread was ok, but when you've had New Orleans french bread, it's hard to not compare! I will definitely visit Pappadeaux's every single time we're in town! Thanks for the good eats,.....my taste buds were doing the HaPPy dance!

6RLsU0XAzpCPiSpgXlCwfA.text: We have had several terrific meals at Pappadeaux's, I enjoy the crawfish etouffee.  My wife likes the Salmon, and we normally order the blue point Oysters on the half shell, very tasty.

0lxqTL_P4ryro_dX1bkm6A.text: My wife and children splurged on me for father's day and brought me here knowing how much I love it.  We were sat immediately which anyone who knows this place is a miracle!  ....we were thrilled!  The place was buzzing with people being sat and I heard each of the wait staff we passed say happy Father's day when we were greeted by our waitress, Ashly, not even as much as a welcome to Pappadeauxs....  We ordered our drinks and when my martini was served it look half full so my wife asked in a comical way where the rest of it was and if looks could kill...she would have been vaporized!  We are a very comical family and when we go out, which is usually limited to special times or celebrations, we lime to have fun and Ashly wasn't having any part of it.  She was strictly business and throughout the entire meal we never got as much as a smile.  We had a heck a time getting her attention whenever we needed refills or any service.  We cannot complain of the food but we were VERY disheartened by the service we received and if we choose to spend our next special night out Pappadeauxs we will make sure we are not being waited on by Ashly.

ONxzn50u737wnhSWKU2tyA.text: Great place to eat. Can't go wrong with some down south food. This is the best place in the valley to eat. If you sit at the bar you get super fast service.

ze_zNR7a5YuvKHdvvImkww.text: Wonderful fried alligator and "ok shrimp gumbo". Seems like the bowl has shrunk on the gumbo, or it differs by location.   We came here for lunch. The wait on a table was about 30 minutes and the fried Alligator came immediately. However, it took over 35 minutes for our meals to come.  Seems coming on a crowded Thursday business lunch was a less than stellar idea. Generally, I've enjoyed this chain in other cities, but was a little less enthusiastic about this location and the food quality.

WRP1yOkYxcnKBgj8WEmvTA.text: Excellent food. but really expensive  great happy hour. Their fried shrimp is to die for. But their catfish is soso.  I will be back

R_zmoQybLqEL6RgbgIuDHQ.text: Yum!  Food was great, service was even better- we had a wonderful time at this restaurant when friends were in town and will definitely be going back!  Must try the desserts as well- delicious!

pW3WXjp8f3LZZrNp-va6iQ.text: The best word to describe this restaurant...AWESOME!!  I  have found my new favorite dish...Jumbo Shrimp Brochette.  Wish Pappadeaux was in San Diego!  Everything was delicious!  Blue Point Oysters on the half shell, alligator bites, Jumbo Shrimp Brochette, Pasta Mardi Gras (spicy and creamy) and excellent desserts! Even the kid's menu was good.   Do yourself a favor and go indulge!!    Our server Audrey was great.  She gave us helpful tips, suggestions and kept a great pace on the food.  Wish all servers were as efficient, professional and friendly as she was.

3j2TGQ1bXLIGkdEv4SB_Sg.text: Love the Alexander sauce. The mahi is nice too. You cant beat the atmosphere. The problem i have with this place is all the seafood has a hose water aftertaste.

u62hQOPCM1gmPEVJwsn7Og.text: I do not go here often, but would highly recommend it for those special occasions.  The atmosphere was stunning, with romantic lighting as well as a live entertainer.  I had the sea bass and every bite was delicious with lots of flavor and flaked off on my fork.  Can not wait to go again.

6RKunqFfxBzIrQgJqk2CGA.text: Met up with a friend in town and decided to go to Papadeaux, was not disappointed. We started off with the crab cakes and they were fantastic. Our fresh squeezed lemon aid was great and the stripped bass main was perfect! Our wait staff was friendly and quick to serve when asked, we will go there again. Say many other meals come out and they all looked fantastic! I don't think you could get a bad meal at Papadeaux!

TGTSMLEjb1HZUzu6-P71Kg.text: If you love seafood this is the place.  Service is amazing, Ryan G provided me and my guest amazing service.  Highly recommend, the menu offers many options.  Love it.

Xq2lAOZhKVf78gL3pRqcMQ.text: I went there as part of a work team lunch. Since we were a big group and didn't have much time, my manager asked me to call in our orders. The person on the phone told me we couldn't do this at first but then luckily the manager did allow it.  Our table was ready when we arrived and food was on the table right at 12 o'clock when they said it would be. That was very nice.  The place itself is just beautiful. I really liked the style and feel of the restaurant. The food looked beautiful too.  I had the medium seafood lunch salad. It was ok. I wasn't impressed. I couldn't taste the dressing at all so I asked for more. They also brought out some bread and butter. Everyone else's food looked pretty good. Service wasn't bad either considering we were 8 people.  I do feel like my experience isn't complete yet. I definitely have to go back to try some other things on the menu. I love seafood so I'm happy to have found this place.

rw0ymTZLIbny2-6HWejd0g.text: We just had the most tastiest dinner. It was wonderful. Six of us had different menu items and many appetizers everything was cooked to perfection. The service was impeccable Ariel has wonderful knowledge of the menu. Such a joyful person thank you for a great 25th anniversary dinner.

U7lEiYQr8JwzCE7OhAKP8w.text: I have been going to this restaurant since it opened. I moved away from Phoenix for a while and couldn't wait to get back to my favorite restaurant; however, this was NOT the food quality I would have ever expected from here... We had soft shell crab (which was reeeeally small, soggy and had the taste of burned, old fryer oil.)  We also had the very tasteless and disappointing, ($20)Calamari appetizer and Crawfish Etouffee (yuck). The over-priced, baby portioned Brussels sprouts were amazing, however...  The only thing that saved the evening was the amazing server, Johnny! Simply wonderful service! It is 2 days later and we are just grateful we didn't end up sick...  So sad.  What a beautiful restaurant with wonderful servers, too bad the food quality has gone so far downhill. Until Friday, this was my favorite restaurant and with the money we spend there I am almost afraid to go back.

HND6qo7tAHZF-8VTtaOD0Q.text: First visit to this location. Not the last. Probably not even the last this month. I have only been to one other Pappadeaux's...it was in an airport...and it was phenomenal (even though I only had 30 minutes to scarf down the food and drink)  I asked the waiter "Sampler platter or seafood platter, pick one" and he steered me to the seafood platter. Good choice! WAAaaaaaaAAAAyyyyy too much food, but nothing will go to waste. I'm set for lunch today AND dinner tonight. My fried food quota has been met.  Baked potato was tasty...but was quickly eclipsed by the tilapia...which was then put to shame by the stuffed crab (is it me or does it taste JUST LIKE my mom's stuffed crab? WOW! MY FAVORITE!!!) Next time I think I'll just look for a stuffed crab meal (after I check out the kitchen to make sure Mommy isn't being held captive for her culinary skills in there).   I have a hard time ordering crawfish from anywhere that isn't in Louisiana, but I might be persuaded to order it from here because the guy at the table next to ours looked like he was in some sort of throes of passion as he buried his head in the plate and licked his fingers (pinch da tails and suck da heads indeed! Maybe they should make one of the rooms in the restaurant ADULTS ONLY?!) . KINKY!!!   Mom in law had the mahi and grits and despite her tiny frame, she was having a hard time putting her fork down! The Hubster (wooooord up!) chose the fried crawfish meal and papa in law chose something that I can't remember w/ a cup of gumbo on the side and he barely uttered a word the entire meal. Shhhh....I'm eating. :)   If we didn't have King Cake waiting at home, we would've been happy to dive into their scrumptious looking dessert tray too, but alas, sometimes we must show a little restraint, mustn't we?  Oh...and the bread and butter at the beginning of the dining event was deliciously fresh and soft too...I'll definitely be back!

66Wch7F-fS9TMW4sOTlJJA.text: Food was fantastic, as expected, but the service given by Martha made the experience even better. Very surprised that we were able to get in without the usual 1-2 hour wait.

HZFm2Hiag_9Uw4HXlW9t-g.text: Oh man.  So good.  Went here on my birthday and went all out with the rock lobster and filet combo.  Holy crap!  It is amazing!!  We also had crab cakes as an app. and my boyfriend got the crawfish ettouffe (sp?).  Everything was super yummy, the server was great (Thanks Alex!) and the restaurant ran like a well oiled machine.  Can't wait to go back!!! PS- get a Bellini!!!

emfAzSddC_tBZF9YOaMgEQ.text: Excellent food and great service. My husband and I been here several times.

yYhB-ri_5tZGeOh1WmW54Q.text: I love their greek salad! Recently took my aunt for her bday and she thoroughly enjoyed it! Great place for bday lunches n dinners!

wR-umt_ERbDoumSxsgSgTg.text: This is a great place to get fresh seafood in the Phoenix area.  This is Cajun style seafood so it is a bit spicy but that is just something unique to experience here.  The atmosphere is very romantic.  I would come back here again for sure - this is a perfect place to take your wife for her birthday or Valentine's day or something special like that.  4 out of 5 just because I'm not normally a seafood fan.

yimMDotlsSwJHSbx9auJbQ.text: This place is exceptional! Food is delicious and drinks are scrumptious. Great staff too! Definitely coming back for more.

vevIfhZ2I487jRCpvOc7EQ.text: Service = 6 stars!  You rock!  The food itself is very delicious (I think it's a little too salty for my taste), and really where it shines is the amazing service, both in terms of helpfulness and friendliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside sitting/waiting area
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front of the restaurant

342jXKtN75VM7pvr7pu88Q.text: I love seafood and love this place. I had clam chowder, catfish, fries, and my husband had catfish and a bake potato.  The food was great.  I cannot wait until my next visit.  The service was great.  Our waiter was great.  We will be back.

uF-wWdVyxsvWZ6iXpfCSdA.text: I had the Red Snapper with squash topped with brown butter tonight. It was FANTASTIC. I expected it to be good but this was beyond good. Thank you for the excellent service, Chad. You are also a delight tonight.

mn27F9AGEZL_6B9XaOsLwA.text: Delish! Everything is always fresh. Never have had a bad sever. At night live music as you wait in a beautiful outside area with a water fountain. Even the bread is so fresh to nipple on as you wait for your meal.

KhBtsCD63aAxJS76x-MDSw.text: At first it was excellent, till I took a bite of my catfish fillet. A long string like object came out which they were claiming was a tendon... you know a tendon 8 inches long ... News flash Im a graduate of aquatic pathology thanks for the fried tapeworm. If you eat at this place inspect your food, my fault for not checking i suppose but wow. Managers and the server were wonderful people but when called by their call center they were demanding proof. Nah ill save the proof for when and if i get worms and then they will hear from my lawyer. Cheers.

1b8bBC1AO96KKtBO2z0qLQ.text: They prepare seafood here like no one else in the valley can . The oysters Rockefeller style is a great starter , a must have !

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lC1kVnBuaxUu154Zmsrx5A.text: The food is amazingggg. Absolutely delicious. But I don't really get the tacky decor/expensive menu combo. I wish it looked more upscale to match the menu.

ePiMfDCdYt2JOiljtOxWow.text: This place is aight. I would come here for the oyster appitizer. in fact that's probably the only reason why i would come here. The food is ok at best, nothing that really blows me away. I still think this place is over priced for what it really is. Honestly if you want sea food for cheap, and sea food that i caught and cooked the same day, just go to mexico. It's better, its more fresh, and you don't get ripped off (unless you're an idiot and you set yourself up for failure).

IMixCqVbzv-J99Ix7AES8w.text: Very busy place  Great food, we have been going for years. We have noticed the serving have gotten really small while the price has gone up crab cakes are totally not as good as they used to be. My husband loves the food there. We will definitely be back! The price is really high!!!!

KeRrEmH1xxK8Ec24VOGNHQ.text: The food here is one of my favorites in Phoenix love it    I ha d the tomato almond arugula salad and fried calamari The seafood platter is good a little bit dry but good The lobster is okay  Mac and cheese for the children okay  We usually come here to celebrate our family birthdays Don,t forget dessert crime brulee so good   The service is good

jp9QoORGA2t-R26qt6Y9nA.text: I love this place! No other seafood restaurant can compare to Pappadeaux. The best Alaskan King Crab-legs you will ever find!

GyxJvoHn17VbERd-dp9wyg.text: One would think this place would be jam packed during lunch with the quality of service and food it has! But it wasn't and that was good for me...I got extraordinary attentive service by a young lady, by the name of Kayla, who is very knowledgable of the menu. I normally base service on how often they fill my water glass since I drink a lot of it and in the 35 minutes I was there she topped it off a good 3 times.   Now to the nitty gritty...I'm normally not a sandwich person but I like to try multiple things when I go to a restaurant for the first time. For an appetizer I ordered a half fried calamari and a lunch combo of a catfish po boy sandwich and a bowl of crawfish bisque. She asked if I wanted everything at once and I did since I had to get back to work.   Food came out quick, hot and delicious. Calamari didn't need the cocktail sauce or the lemon aioli it came with. I thought the aioli was a tad strong for the calamari but still good favor. I'm not a big fan or pickles on a sandwich but I figured if I'm gonna try it for the first time I might as well see what the complete sandwich is like and it was great. Crawfish bisque was buttery and flavorful. And last but not least...banana pudding!! I took dessert to go and it damn near put me in an food coma it was so good.   Strongly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crawfish Bisque
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Calamari

E-81NTBwe0tgrxZ99i_Nsg.text: Have been here once before  and decided to bring my daughter here for her first time. Though they were not crowded, they took us to the very back to were there was a party of 15 and the surrounding tables were full. You would think they would spread out the guests so we didn't feel like we were on top of each other. I agree with many, that the food is fine but is overpriced. I ordered mussels, which I have had before. When they came, I immediately was taken aback by the smell. I tried one and it turned to to mush in my mouth, I had to spit it out. From what I have learned, theses mussels were caught when spawning which cause their meat to turn to mush. Had to send back and order something else.  It is also very noisy and hard to have a good conversation. All in all, an ok experience, just ok food for a high price.

174vc-MW5UQk0TC642x79w.text: Always great food and service.  Their mignonette for the oysters is one of the best I have ever tasted. Great for a quick seafood fix or a nice sit down meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gulf oyster house...The oysters were tasty
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Streamed muscles with andouie sausage...yum yum

_9DlGAdjLnPvshOfBzWm5g.text: In my opinion this is more like a creole place to eat. But it's very delicious, has great herbs and spices. Great staff. Always Keen to make sure your drinks are full and that the food is good. If not they are happily willing to get you something else to your liking. Great beautiful atmosphere as well.

lFVDwZFwZzn-moATzo0AWw.text: Was at a spring training Dodger-DBack game today in the hot sun. Needed a place to be entertained.  Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen was just the ticket.   Came back to the hotel and then we went to the Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen without reservations.  We had to wait for awhile, but that was OK as it gave our party of 10 time to soak in the atmo.  The approach is a bit of  "round the block" but once you get there it is a huge complex of dining, bar and patio areas.  Eclectic crowd, especially for Phoenix.  They had a troubador playing a soft electric guitar and spillin' his lyrics out on the patio.  Lots of fried food.  Their seafood dishes looked tasty.  I asked where the salmon was caught and found out several of their seafood dishes were farm raised.  I am picky about eating fish that was caught in the wild and not farmed.  I had a deep fried chicken and shrimp dish with fries that was good.  Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen will probably not see me again as not really my cup of tea.

O2q7Q-E5-tvBnevBPGlEew.text: Loved it. We always go and the food it great. The service is on point and the look is old fashioned. Reminds me of a simpler time.

Hf3_BriSN1olwrF6-T1fyQ.text: My husband, mother, and I went to Pappadeaux's for a late lunch on Valentine's Day. We didn't realize it, but February 14th is smack dab in the middle of Mardi Gras, so Pappadeaux was quite busy! The courtyard is beautiful, though, with live music, ample seating, and this time popcorn, cheese, and sausage was being given out while you waited, along with bottled water and Mardi Gras beads. The wait was projected to be 30-45 minutes, but we were seated in 20 minutes.   The food was delicious, as always, and the service was friendly and adequate to good. It was a very busy day, so I understand that it is difficult to keep the drinks full. I chose the Blackened Mahi Alexander Style, my husband chose the Blackened Mahi lunch special, and my mother got the Tilapia lunch special. The spices were bold and impressive. Loved the grilled shrimp with my dinner. For dessert, we got creme brulee and pecan sweet potato pie with vanilla bean ice cream. So. Totally. Delicious. This is one of my favorite places to get creme brulee.   I always look forward to my lunches and dinners at Pappadeaux. I was not disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Restaurant, inside.

8rmlPXKCJfQNqgsnM3W9oA.text: One of the only spots in the Valley that I'll eat raw oysters.  Yes, I said it.  We live in the Valley.  No large bodies of water nearby. So, the chances of getting fresh seafood is slim to none. But I've always found Pappadeaux's to come through in that department! Not only are their oysters the bomb dot com but so are the crab fingers! I would also recommend picking out a lobster, most especially the larger ones to share because it is worth it! Desert is always great, too! We've celebrated birthdays and graduations here. I mean, what's not to celebrate here?! Staff are on top of their game and so is their food.

PJs6Tf6LGBfEvDoT57woSw.text: Live food, atmosphere,  and structure of environment. Friendly staff! !! I took my friends from cali to show her a little taste of Chicago.  She said the salad and shrimp and grits was the best she ever tasted! !!

_v504HV50SJzFGx4-J2M6w.text: Food was delicious as always! Service on the other hand was awful. Andrew B didn't appear to want to be at work today, which made our much anticipated visit a huge regret. Hey Andrew, thanks a lot for kicking mine & my mothers birthday off with sour 's

D-AUYgMwEvQRaFQMXSYTDg.text: Place is pretty good...can't complain this doesn't really compare to the one in Houston but i feel that's a unfair comparison...the calamari is tip top and the drinks are made up to par. The service is really good anytime i came...the only thing it's kind of pricey but i come all the time

Qs09Z-FXJYyQZGMJHygZVQ.text: The BEST seafood ever. Their Dirty Rice is the best I've ever had. Great atmosphere and customer service. I highly recommend this place every chance I get. It's one of my favorite restaurants, hands down.

Tvd0JqcnfgOAIPJnsGwz4w.text: I love Pappadeaux. A little on the pricey side but it is well worth it and you get a lot of food for money you pay. They also have awesome drinks!!

vcf46QWwrqFpsF5Xkcv3jg.text: This is the closest thing here I can get to New Orleans style cajun food. I'm from New Orleans and this is one of the two places here in Phoenix Arizona that have food that taste like the food I miss back home.

Difztbt0RhAlvehCKt9Ecg.text: Wow! Went here after my graduation from NCU. It did not disappoint. Food was on point through and through.  Waitress: 10 Food Presentation: 10 Food quality:10 Food:10  Dessert :10  What can I say. I wanted a adjustment to a dish; done no problem. I don't have a bad thing to say.  Had alligator for appetizer: cooked to perfection seasoning, dipping sauce all on point. Crispy not chewy.   I had the Mardi Gras's pasta with scallops vs. crawfish. Excellent. My family was pleased with their meals as well. Their meals looked good and smelled good too! I recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Gras Pasta, Shrimp and Grits and Seafood Gumbo.

lLNl6af-k05RA-CPXyIrlQ.text: We had a very good experience here. We were a party of 7 and had made a reservation which was acknowledged when we arrived but it still took us 15 minutes to be seated, which was a bit disappointing. Our waitress, however, made up for that with her great service and the food was really really good! They ran out of sweet tea so refills were not in the cards for us but other than that and the initial wait, it was a near-perfect experience. Great service, awesome food, nice environment (a little loud but it's Saturday night) and generous portion sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried mozzarella!

hYFDZWcOhQ5vw3eVf1_saA.text: Fantastic authentic NOLA restaurant. Great service and awesomely delicious food. Great drinks! I had the lobster tails, succulent and cooked perfectly. I also had the seafood gumbo. Lots of wonderful fresh seafood. A very special experience! We will be back!

4BwzxrniSvyQw_tMeIBa3A.text: This place is amazing!!! If you like fish and seafood it is a MUST!!! Some plates are shareable!!! Yummy!!

DiHviD05uhlhsgpAmxpwIg.text: I want to thank the papa'a staff for making it worth it to go back and visit. My wife and I went back to celebrate a transition in life and and we wanted to thank to the papa's management. The shrimp cocktail fiesta was amazing. I would highly recommend this dish to anyone. The service was top notch and not in any way disappointing.

NxXzr-6MBYYlleS1nZWCgg.text: Went to Pappadeaux for a family dinner last night, I ordered the salmon Alexander (something like that) it came not warm, my plate was hot but not the actual food, my server took the plate back for me, I received a FRESH plate of EVERYTHING, it was amazing! To top it off the manager came to apologize and comped my plate, which she didn't have to but she did. That's great customer right there!

UZU_lOmI1FBP3m8c7s9xfQ.text: Today we try take my daughter out for her birthday at our favorite place. We arrived at 9pm, no one there waiting outside, got check in they don't even tell us how long the wait is, let us hanging. I very understand for those people have rsvp, but here is too many people come after they all get table, their is so many entry table they don't even want to fill people in. At 9:37pm , my husband went in to asked them how longer we have to wait, the receptionist told him another 26min. My kid are thirsty and hungry. Thank you for ruining my kids birthday party. Never again so long.

2pMml_-ySfTud-sp1csI5g.text: I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile now..I've been hearing few of my coworkers that the food is pretty good.. it's a little pricey but other then that it was pretty good.. we ordered the calamari which I liked..we ordered the small portion which I thought was the perfect amount before having our meal.. my boyfriend ordered the soft shell crab and I ordered the mardi gra pasta which was pretty delicious.. the restaurant is pretty big, bigger then I thought it was going to be... the staff was pretty friendly and even though it was a little busy our waitress still checked up on us which I liked...

hludoW2gqCSzKBeC1RK_cg.text: OMG went to Pappadeuxs seafood kitchen last Wednesday we could not wait to go it is our FAVORITE restaurant there food is out of this world the service is always fantastic so friendly my son had his favorite soup crawfish bisque cream style he would eat it everyday if he could I had my all time favorite crab finger dinner it is out of this world I have it every time we go I wish it was in season year round but sadly no my son also had it for the first time and he loved it now if I could get my husband to order his own he always nibbles on mine after he is done with his dinner which for him is lobster or fried catfish and shrimp which he loves we also tried there new appetizer lobster bites they were great all in all fantastic food wonderful service great drinks and dessert fabulous night out at our favorite restaurant. rSUfMXR2skEcK4RskUDhBQ.text: The food was excellent. The only thing I think was bad about it is the price. Expect to drop $150 for a family of three. But it was worth it and sea food is fresh.
