PfgyoQz3I6o02a6rpl5ZBA.text: Very poor service.  Went in for late afternoon lunch (3:00) and the restaurant was less than half full but looked like a good number of servers working.  We were sat at a table and there we sat for 10 minutes without ever being acknowledged by any of the servers that walked by our table - after 10 min we walked out.   Good service isn't hard people - it's not rocket science.

RrlP3EKojVWK2FqI4P2BHw.text: The sea food was fresh and Samuel was an excellent waiter, however I have NEVER tasted such salty food in my life. I debated sending it back but decided to tough it out. I don't think it could have been any more salty if someone had purposely tried to over do it.  The prices also rather shocked me but I knew it would be expensive to have fresh seafood in the desert. Almost all entrees start at about $30 and go up from there. And then there is exorbitant up selling of salads and side dishes. Also be prepared for extreme noise levels during dinner. This was my last dining experience here.  I don't wish to overpay AND get hyper-tension.

pMWEwSHXOFLGSgDqve4Y5Q.text: The absolutely most delicious Cajon food I have ever eaten.   Great family atmosphere,  friendly staff and yummy drinks.  My favorite restaurant of all times!

VKW0FTalivMin2Z03NgZ3g.text: Mm mm MMM. this place is outstanding!! Excellent food, not to mention excellent service!!! My boyfriend & I dropped a pretty penny here, not to mention our server got a great tip for being so outstanding & helpful. Super cool guy, our drinks were always full, went above & beyond explaining all the food/dessert options they had, super polite. I have nothing to complain about. Food was promptly delivered. Thanks guys!

9MS7Q5YXL5XS2_kgIinKdw.text: The food is pretty good and they have a huge selection of items on the menu. I think it's a bit overpriced but the service is great.

JeBuT8Un4OfPxtzXShy2wA.text: Best seafood place I have found in the Phoenix area.  Everything from the crab dip to the crab legs and oysters is delicious. They have a wonderful fish selection as well and even their steaks are good.  Service has always been excellent every time I have gone.  Can get very busy on nights so try and go early if you can.

KHeqTtI994X89uShPzZxPA.text: For my 100th review, i choose Pappadeaux. The first time i was ever there , Saturday night.   Fantastic ,Wow we loved it!   Our server was Robert, he gets an A plus in customer service..We started with Water ,wine, Ice Tea, and my girl got coffee. He brought lemons and straws for our water, Brewed fresh coffee and kept my Ice Tea refilled the entire night. The meals were incredible. Our appetizer  was to die for.    The meals are huge ,we had to take it to go and we had enough for dinner on Sunday. Mediterranean Calamari was so good!  We did not like the Capers in it, but it also comes with fired artichoke!!  Lobster Bisque, was probably the best i have ever had!  The Lobster,Crab, and Talapia were all very fresh. They say they have it flown in every day. I believe it because, it was as i said fantastic!    The decor is very good, dark wood, everything nice and big.    We cannot wait to come back here. Lots of Parking in the lot.

Q6egig4jF23ZE7kUX32fiw.text: My family and I frequent this location often. We've only had a less than desirable experience once but the waiters and waitresses are usually on top of it and the food is amazing! The seafood is really fresh and you can tell nothing they serve is frozen. A must try for seafood lovers.

vIF1LO2Nm0J73uMJQOzTkw.text: Great, unique, seafood dishes! Not to much for the dieter! Good food, and fun atmosphere !

TqGsAw3MukvuVrtUc_uJJQ.text: Best seafood you will ever eat! Everything taste fresh and delicious. I ordered the Wild King Alaskan Salmon and the waiter said they were a little disappointed with the presentation of my plate because it broke in half during the plating process. (even though I couldn't tell) he said they were gonna bring me another piece to make up for it. I thought it was just going to be a piece but to my surprise they brought me a new Wild King Alaskan Salmon! If that's not customer service then I don't know what is! The staff does a fine job of keeping your glasses full and keeping your table just happy to be there at the restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone.... And yes it is 100x better than Red Lobster! you have to try the fried Alligator! it takes a bit like chicken but with it's own distinct flavor.

BSR3vnMYkwfFGNz5jM06jg.text: I told myself I would Yelp on every restaurant that I ate at on the course of this "road trip" I'm taking, so here goes.  We started off in the familiar territory of Phoenix, AZ.  Our "go to" spot in the northern suburbs of Phoenix used to be the Fish Market in Scottsdale, but since it "changed hands" so to speak, we've been on the look out for another destination.  Well... I think we found it in Pappadeaux.  Service:  5/5  The service we received at Pappadeaux was outstanding from the moment we arrived until the moment we left.  It was about 7:30 on a Friday evening when we got to the restaurant, and since we had been traveling, I did not have the opportunity to make reservations ahead of time.  The parking lot was VERY crowded and we were afraid of a long wait time.  But we were quoted 5-10 minutes when we arrived, and were seated after 7 minutes.  We got one of the few booths in the restaurant near the bar area.  Our waiter, Nate, was very attentive and helpful.  He pointed out some of their more famous dishes and the specials, some of which we ended up ordering.  He was prompt in refilling our water glasses when needed and even stopped a moment to chat with us about our 4-month old son.  The only small blemish I would mention is that dessert was a long time in coming.  It took about ten minutes after we ordered it.  Now I know they don't bake cheesecakes on the fly, so I'm unsure about the reason for the delay, but I thought in the interest of being complete that I would mention it.  Food:  5/5  Absolutely no complaints here.  Everything we ordered was outstanding.  My wife and I got the baked oyster trio and split a Greek salad for appetizers.  The salad was great and so were the oysters.  The salad is served table-side for that extra little touch.  If we were to order again though, I think we would have just gotten a full order of the Parmesan baked oysters instead of the trio.  For entrees, I ordered the special of the evening which was Salmon Diablo, a blackened salmon fillet with extra kick.  The only very minor complaint I would note is the sauce was a bit too much.  It was absolutely delicious, a mix of crab meat and butter and cream, but it overpowered the fish to a degree.  I ended up eating it separately.   As I said, delicious, but a bit much.  My wife ordered the lobster bisque and it was every bit as good as other reviewers have commented.  For dessert we split a carrot cake cheesecake.  I'm always on the look out for new and interesting desserts, and while I have had tons of cheesecakes, this was a combination I hadn't encountered before, so I had to give it a try.  The sweet potato pie also looked interesting, but we went with the cheesecake.  Aside from the delay mentioned above, no complaints here.  The cake was moist, flavorful, and delicious.  Overall Impressions:  5/5  The environment at Pappadeaux is exactly what you would expect.  They do a good job of bringing in that Cajun/creole atmosphere and balance an upscale look with a "down home" attitude.  You'll feel right at home here in your t-shirt and jeans, or in your business attire after a long day at the office.  The staff is very helpful and accommodating.    Overall if you are looking for a seafood or creole meal in the Phoenix area, I can heartily recommend Pappadeaux.

nQDIzwzNoxFXKKWAkzyWzg.text: Received an email from Pappadeaux advertising crawfish special on Wednesday and Thursdays after 3pm. So, me and my family of 8 made the 1 hour and 45 minute drive and we were excited as we haven't had crawfish in a long time.  We were seated at 5 pm and the menus stated the crawfish is available at 5. Ok, no biggie.  I place my order then I'm told "sorry we don't have any crawfish". So I ordered the soft shell crab and my son ordered the steak Oscar medium rare.  Our food arrived, mine is ice cold, my son's steak is still mooing and my sister's food was cold.  The server asked us once in a 2 hour time frame if we needed anything.  I will NOT waste my gas to make the trip here again.

nFso3nKZovbYKOjKOn6xYQ.text: I was in phoenix for the day and had a craving for oysters on the half shell.  Living in a small town in northern Arizona a person does not have that luxury.  Went there for lunch ordered the blue point oysters, gumbo and shrimp poor boy. The oysters were  ice cold and fresh as you will find anywhere. Everything there was great including the service.  I will be back.

FYjRyh-yTkBMVLwRfBaBhg.text: This 2 stars is extremely generous. Wanna know why? Read on.  My party of 7 and a baby got to Pappadeux's around 6:30. We were told that it would be a 30-minute wait. It ended up being more than an hour. We were standing right in front of the hostess station, yet no one ever came to give us updates on how long it would be for our table. We would go check about every 20 or so minutes. One time we were told that our table was ready. When we went to check on it after about 20 minutes we were told that they were waiting on a busboy to clean it. A few minutes later they were still waiting on a busboy. In what universe does it take a restaurant 30 minutes to find a busboy to clean a table? We watched group after group after group get seated. A group of 7 that came after us was seated before us. We ended up being sat next to them; by the time we were getting our menus, they were finishing up their meals.  Once we were finally seated, we waited almost 10 minutes before someone came to our table to introduce himself as our waiter. When he asked how we were doing, we kindly told him that we were a little frustrated because it had taken more than twice as long as we were told, and we had been told twice that they were waiting on a busboy to clean the table. The waiter said that it was a busy night and said that he didn't get paid to deal with unhappy customers. He asked, "So are you gonna do this or what?" WHAT?! It was so rude - I don't know how he meant it, but it came across as sounding extremely annoyed. We were appalled and my boyfriend asked to speak to a manager.  The manager came over and spoke with my boyfriend. Not sure what was said, but after that things got much better. The manager brought us an appetizer plate on the house. Our food ended up being really good - including the alligator. I got shrimp etoufee, and it was great. The gumbo wasn't so fabulous. Overall, everyone was satisfied with their meal. We got three different drinks, and they basically tasted the same: like cherry Nyquil.  The food was good, but it's not always about the food. The service was horrible. Don't think I'd ever go there again. There are too many other places with great food and equally great service.

fQs1p4ZlojG0fYRPxiJALg.text: Dinner was fair at best for the price. Mussels were sandy. Otherwise were tasty. My entree was lukewarm. My companions were hot. I ordered the crispy salmon-3 -4 new potato pieces and very woody asparagus. Drinks were slow coming out of thre bar.Waitress was doing her best. No reason to go back anytime soon.

ZzKuqTj_fjlStijadL5noQ.text: Best seafood in Phoenix.  The atmosphere is like dining in a little home restaurant.  The service is above average.  The food is to die for!  Rich and spicy cajun style cooking with delicious sauces.  When you order shrimp or oyster appetizers, you get big bivalves or shrimp.  Everything tastes fresh.  This is a favorite to take the wife for a nice evening out.

fquB5LaG-M9qSpFdXhhpxA.text: This place is amazing!!! Unbelievable how fresh the seafood is, especially since it's located in Arizona. Took my hubby here for his bday and the atmosphere was perfect! Awesome cocktails as well! They just need to get rid of all the soliciters out front.

KAvklslY-yZsd6haoHoDLA.text: The only reason I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars is because the atmosphere inside is terrible. (too crazy, very loud, poor lighting, high traffic)  Seating outside is another story, especially in the fall. It is beautiful. The food is great and definitely exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Atlantic Salmon as I had heard it was excellent there. I've never been a big fan of salmon and have had several bad experiences with it in other restaurants. My first bite was timid, but by the end I thought I was going to start licking the crumbs off my cedar plank. Amazing. Absolutely amazing.  My dish also came with some of the largest asparagus I've had. I'm always very leery of large asparagus as it is almost always too firm. Once again, grilled to perfection just like the salmon.   The wait staff was also very courteous and enjoyable. Overall a great experience after we had moved to the courtyard area. I highly suggest, especially if you are a fan of all you can eat lobster.

6i24U3ua3zlsG7M0rRUifQ.text: AWESOME! One of my favorite restaurants for my "King Crab Leg Fix" ! Great food,fun atmosphere, wonderful service and will always remind me of our first dinner with "meeting  my  family " ! Greg my love, your taste in choosing the perfect restaurant and girlfriend (me) was and still is awesome!

V8NrsNhy-wnNPwCqmTgIrA.text: Recommendations:  1) fried alligator--you have to try it at least once in your life 2) gulf coast oysters--shucked right at the bar 3) cajun bloody mary 4) stuffed shrimp montage  Pass: 1) cheesecake --it wasn't bad; but it is probably better to try one of the other unique desserts like the praline bread or banana wafer puddings 2) cedar plank salmon--my friend's salmon came out mostly raw, even when reheated  This place was pretty frickin' sweet. I haven't enjoyed a dining experience quite like this one in a long time. I savored our meal and had a great time. Our server Rich went above and beyond to make sure things went right.

uL0uO2nqcrSXFEm3xiqt1g.text: Seated quickly, there is not much of a wait at 6 p.m., even though the place was PACKED!!!  We ordered, and watched as plate after mounded plate was  delivered to delighted patrons.  I mean, it ALL looked good.  Hubby had the salmon Oscar, I had ordered the Sea Bass.  The salmon Oscar was roasted slowly , so it was a glistening, flakey slab, slathered in crab, shrimp, and scallops with a sauce I SWEAR I could have licked off the plate.  My piece of sea bass was larger than a tennis ball, slathered with a gooey cheese, and seasoned top to bottom, resting on a perfectly sauteed mess of spinach.  Really.  I cannot stop thinking about how danged good it was.  Wine list was fine, Key lime pie needed to be a little more tart, but that is a personal preference.  All in all, I would eat there three times a week if the budget allowed.  It's that good.

QbPadvdUITTTdM1y_cL-CQ.text: I always enjoy visiting this spot while in the Phoenix area. The food is always delicious. It doesn't matter what I order...love it!!!!

5K2jKVjoY_HH90ue4GB1Tg.text: Food was great best alligator around the Mediterranean calamari was yummy and a delightfully different taste.

60Va6WUdSH8xNjLkLaL2Ag.text: OMG I Love this place! The Calamari was super fresh! And the lemon aioli sauce was so refreshing, it was an explosion of flavors! My husband ordered the steamed muscles and was completely satisfied! They were cooked to perfection and were soooo fresh! I ordered the Main Lobster and it was freaken HUGE! It was definitely more than I expected! Oh and did I mention their oysters were on sale that night? They were like $8.00 a dozen and fresh and so tasty! Our server was so polite and very knowledgeable about the menu.  The price was a little steep but definitely worth it!

Yv3cuyQyhfde_jZMwgmFDw.text: I deliberated over where to celebrate my birthday dinner and I knew seafood was in order. Especially with the limited fresh options in Phoenix, Pappadeaux's was calling my name. I'd been here once before and really enjoyed it and appreciate how flavorful the creole-inspired dishes are!  We had the crispy fried alligator and shrimp and crawfish fondeaux to start. After living on the Gulf Coast, the alligator was not a "shock" to me as it is to some people and it was fun and tasty. The fondeaux was rich and yummy!   A brief flashback to my first Pappadeaux experience reminded me not to fill up too much on apps, since I ended up taking up most of my entree home. I did not listen to that little voice. We ordered our entrees -- Gulf Coast Redfish Pontchartrain for me and Pasta Mardi Gras for him -- including a cup of gumbo. Our friends ordered their entrees too, including the lobster bisque (YUM! The gumbo was good, but the bisque was GREAT!).   Sure enough...by the time our entrees arrived, I was full again!! Fail for me, because the food was all soooo very tasty! The waitress was amazing and willing to box everything up for us.   And the cherry on top?  Well, Pappadeaux's has a mean birthday brownie a la mode that was HUGE and delicious! Needless to say, I've got enough food for 2 days...  I definitely am a fan of this place, especially among Phoenix seafood options...and though there seems to always be a wait, the courtyard is lovely to hang out in while you wait for a table.

IpelulvQ2UCtR8hElbMGyw.text: Being from New Orleans, I was really looking forward to having a dinner here. The opportunity came when I was asked where I wanted to go for my birthday so off we went.   Openers was Fried Oysters, oh how I miss them, but they were merely satisfying. Buried in French Fries, I found about six small ones. We had another appetizer, don't remember what, that we didn't want to finish. It wanted to take home so we flagged a waiter and asked him to put it in a box so it wouldn't sit uncovered on the table for the entire meal. We had our entrees coming anyway. I ordered the Shrimp Etouffee and the other was a pasta dish of sorts.   After about 15 minutes our entrees arrive in a bag. They had packed the whole order to go! We explained the problem and the bag went back to the kitchen.   About 10 minutes later the entrees, and apologies, arrived.  The pasta dish my partner ordered looked and tasted wonderful. The Etouffee looked sad. Over warmed, dry, and tasted it. But it was a birthday gift so I kept my mouth shut and enjoyed the company.   As we were leaving, I took the waitress aside and apologized for the confusion and asked what had been remade and what had been poured onto a plate and sat to warm under a lamp. You guessed it.   Now, two wait-persons were involved. Hey, our original disappeared. But you would think she might stop by to check with us before packed up the order based on a message from a trainee. (Our mistake)  But, really, what would it have cost them to remake both entrees as it was their mistake.   Perhaps a one-off issue but the oysters were disappointing and well, the service badly managed.

4gp95sFsdJ_5LJzYVnvgXg.text: I had dinner to celebrate my wife's birthday on a Friday evening. The atmosphere was awesome, bustling and busy.  It reminded me of New Orleans .  The food was amazing I had coconut shrimp , Cajun red snapper with a seafood topper; crawfish, scallops and crab. The dirty rice was super tasty.  Dessert was creme brulee.  The service was great.  I look forward to coming again.

KvFQSb_7XgAuLOXqEPQODg.text: It was my first time dining here and it was amazing! The wait was about 35 minutes so I recommend calling ahead. I ordered the Caribbean Lobster Tail with Mashed Red Potatoes and Asparagus. It was so good. I highly recommend it. I tried the fried calamari and it was good with the lemon aoli sauce. Our waiter, Jacob, was great! He was funny and really accomodating. Our food and drinks came out in a timely manner. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

SB0CBUrfZhvdns3yvmRhGQ.text: I am originally from CapeCod Mass and I will say I miss the Beach terribly! I also miss the Seafood! We all know that living in Arizona it is hard to find good Seafood, I found this hidden treasure of a restaurant about 12 years ago and I will say it is the BEST place in the valley to go if your looking to find amazing Seafood! Everything is fresh, tastes wonderful, the staff is on point meets your every need and is very courteous and polite, on weekends they have a live band playing in their court yard while you enjoy cocktails and an appetizer if the wait is long and you have to wait for a table, check this place out you won't regret it it's one of my favorites, I go there every year for my birthday.

-028LYbT1_dWH-m_H7BrkA.text: The oysters Pappadeaux were out of this world and the bacon wrapped shrimp was equally as good!

orw07_VRzBXEdmvCanH1IQ.text: went on a Friday night for my gfs birthday. pro tip!! make a reservation we waited more than an hour to get a table around 6pm. we grabbed some drinks at the bar while waiting and Rich the bartender was a great barman.   after we got our seats we were ready to order. I had the crawfish combo while she had the salmon. entrees are pricey at $25 but after we tasted the food it was worth it. ask for bread if you want to have something to much on. they gave us a free cheesecake since it was my gfs bday. definitely a special occasion type of place and it was overall excellent.

zpV0sX11rXr24YcXxlHU-A.text: Best place to go eat on a special occasions fried gator everyone needs to try it so delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried shrimp and fries
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve never had mozzarella cheese sticks this big but so yummy
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My voodoo drink was refreshing.

hQKFulLdmhXSJikEOZSapg.text: My family and I love to get together and have a big dinner here when we can all plan it on the same night! The last time I ate here was about a year ago and since then I have converted to eating a vegan diet. I wasn't too worried because I saw someone's review that they had a pasta and it was really good. When we got there I asked Kami, our waitress, if I could just get a plain pasta with marinara and some steamed or roasted vegetables and she was very knowledgable on how the food was prepared and made sure there was no butter or dairy anywhere near my plate, which after having some bad experiences, I am SUPER grateful for. She was so sweet and she made sure I was happy with everything that came out. We also had an incident where someone's lobster wasn't fully cooked. It came out of the shell still clear and Kami had no problem taking it back to see what she could do for us. Half of the lobster was eaten and was pretty much cooked, it was really just one claw that didn't get fully cooked and the manager at the time Drew was so sweet as she brought back the claw fully cooked and told us that the whole lobster was on the house and that she was extremely sorry for the undercooked lobster. That was really amazing because you just don't get service like that anymore. I can't remember the last time that I had to send food back and the manager actually comes out, let alone takes the dish off the bill.  Always 5 stars and a great time. They are even open until midnight on Fridays! But it is True that they don't bring breadsticks out unless you ask for them.

pvtDNE6YebEn_zqYqqKnTg.text: I can't say anything bad about the food or the service in the past.  Always my favorite place.  However, I went this past Saturday evening and contracted some sort of allergy from the shell fish that I've had many times before.  As soon as I was leaving the restaruant I got sick in the bathroom.  As we were leaving the parking lot, my entire head and neck broke out in hives-and I don't have a seafood allergy. My date is now also sick and we shared the food.  He is having severe stomach issues.  After reading Patricia M.s review dated 11/6/13, I decided to comment in the hopes that management may look into their food quality and kitchen cleanliness.

8cdc33N9TP8LRJnKFuAZag.text: Went here for lunch and everything was great. Ordered the crab spinach dip for app and it was phenomenal! For my entree I had the seafood mixed grill it came with shrimp, tuna, & scallop on top of dirty rice which was delicious with a little kick. For dessert we had the bourbon bread pudding, oh so delicious. It cam out hot with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, warning...this dessert is not for kids, you can taste all of bourbon goodness.

6wANTGnrTweA3PaBBh3FVQ.text: The food is always wonderful here. Tried the Crab & Spinach dip this time, and it was phenomenal. My personal favorite is the Shrimp Brochette with dirty rice. I've also enjoyed the mixed seafood grill and the stuffed shrimp. Crab cakes are awesome too. Really, you can't go wrong here.

Pa8BCGpewQ8keTIbQck52w.text: I loved this place. My boyfriend and I went here for our two year anniversary and received excellent service.   We had to cancel our original reservation and we're able to make another for later in the evening. When we arrived we were seated right away and our server was awesome! She made sure our drinks were never empty, kept the boyfriend's beer filled and took her time discussing the options with us.   The food was sooooooo gooooood, extra letters needed. Based on the reviews we orders the gator tail. We were so full we couldn't order dessert.   And then to top it off, I was so happy, full, and distracted, I forgot my purse at the table. Our server chased after us and returned it, what an awesome chick. She was a blonde white chick (can't remember her name, it's been about 5 months), so if you get her you are in good hands!

ZhZj2gC2T7ESnXH_LU164A.text: I went here for my dad's wedding reception I made a reservation for 10 people and they have a table ready a half an hour before the reserved time. They also texted me to remind me of the reservation before hand. The staff let me set up decorations on the table before the couple arrived and they even offered to help. Our waitress Jannie was super sweet and very attentive!!! Loved her. The restaurant even paid for the newlyweds meal, those small touches really made the experience great. We will definitely be back

Ldxmf08AsjvGGpPfRPN5aA.text: I took my son here for Valentine's Day because he loves seafood. I actually hate it. Anyways, I like that they do have other options here for those like myself who don't like seafood. We ordered the lobster and fillet. Since, I don't eat seafood and my son is five, I asked if they could take the lobster meat out of the tail because well, clearly I sure as heck don't know what I'm doing with that. I was really appreciative that they were able to handle that for us so that my son could eat his lobster. Their dessert was delicious! We ate so much we left so full we couldn't breathe. First world problems.

2pkz27wumB_WNlU9rsYGvQ.text: I was taken here on a date, I don't really eat cooked seafood (sushi junkie here), so there wasn't much on the menu for me to order, which isn't their fault and if I had been given a choice I wouldn't have gone there.  However the Caesar Salad and French Fries I ordered were great! The complimentary bread was also very good! The service though is absolutely phenomenal, they are on top of everything, very friendly. I felt very well taken care of by them.

pz5O65z-ZHWXt6HKBIN9Hg.text: I almost didn't want to write this review because of how busy it already gets there!   But they deserve some serious kudos for the quality of their food and service.     We went as a group and ordered the Blue Point oysters, Mediterranean Calamari, Boudin and Shrimp Cocktail as appetizers.      Oysters  - fantastic, fresh - great presentation - on special for $10 a dozen.   Heaven.  Mediterranean Calamari - Wow they took calamari to a whole new level.   I won't ruin the surprise - just try it.    Boudin - I'm a bit of a freak when it comes to Boudin (aka Blood Sausage).   I like mine with more blood and less filler.   Theirs is more filler with less blood.   It's also quite spicy.   I had to try it, but probably wouldn't order it again. Shrimp Cocktail - Really nice sized fresh tasting shrimp.   Really nice presentation on a bed of crushed ice.   Great appy.  Dinners- I had their Salmon Alexander.    What is Alexander?   Grilled Shrimp.   Grilled Scallops.  Crawfish.   In a LEMON BUTTER WINE OMG SO GOOD SAUCE.  All of this on top of perfectly grilled salmon.  Came with dirty rice, which, on the scale of dog barf to awesome - you guessed it - awesome.  (full disclosure - never ate dog barf before - probably won't eat dog bark ever).  Dessert - Didn't indulge.  Service - You would think you were in a place where they somehow bred servers or grew them on trees.  There are so many of them buzzing around taking care of your every need in a prompt manner.    (I think I finally figured out why there are so many cars in the parking lot - they have a ton of servers!)  Give it a try - I promise - you won't be disappointed.  Just don't go anytime I'm going there so I can get a table, OK???

CQvp4xL34DnBqkYV9guoMg.text: This is probably my favorite seafood restaurant! It is pricey, and on some nights there is a long wait, but the food is excellent! If you go in the winter sit outdoors, you won't regret it!

ZUxghJH_TKgtr5pbU-C8FA.text: I come here about 3-4 times a year for one thing, their Pasta Mardi Gras. In my opinion, it's a much shorter drive than the gulf shores to get authentic tasting seafood heaven. And I never miss on the Crispy Fried Alligator appetizer.

U4r1iCTHewCyLEQnT-DZ0A.text: My wife and I went there for my birthday. We had a babysitter until 9pm. We got there at 6:15 and they told us it was going to be a 45 min wait. We spent $80 buck at the bar waiting before we were finally seated at 8:35?? We're ordered our appetizers and dinner walking to our table because we were now in a hurry? I mean come on guys get your times down a little better then that??

587kDKj256Lymzn_iZKjvg.text: We came up to Phoenix last evening to attend the Amy Grant and Michael W Smith Christmas concert at Grand Canyo University Arena.  We always make a point of eating at Pappadeaux's Seafood Kitchen when we can.  We were running behind.   Lisa the manager and our server, Lexie pulled off a miracle and got us drinks and food in record time.  They displayed unflappable hospitality and friendliness. They did not have to.  It was our fault that we had not allowed appropriate time to not be rushed.    We live in Tucson and would love to have a Pappadeaux's in Tucson but until then, we will always come back.    God bless you for running a top shelf establishment. Lexie and Lisa certainly deserve more recognition than the tip we left.   Happy Thanksgiving and Merry Christmas.   Horace Noland, M.D. Tracy Noland Jeanene Headlee

QhsJWIfrRVqBL2q6CqJzbQ.text: The food is certainly worth the wait and our waiter, Nathan M. tended to our every need. Nathan was great and must have refilled my water four times. The only reason for knocking off one star is really a suggestion for management. At 8:00 p.m., we waited outside, in 101 degree heat for 35 minutes. The heat was oppressive and the outdoor ceiling and standing fans were completely ineffective; in fact, they made the heat more unbearable. I might suggest, especially when you have older patrons, that you assign a wait staff to provide water to those waiting outside. Follow the example of home builders in the Phoenix area; you can't walk into one of their model homes without a salesperson offering a cold bottle of water. Your waiters should be offering glasses of water to your patrons waiting outside, especially when temperatures exceed 100 degrees.

MAhS-Xvj5QZvR1DQVP68xg.text: We arrived with our large family on a Tuesday nite. The initial hostess was kind in taking our name and setting up a table; however the gal she had setting up the table gave an ugly look when told that there would be two adults and 8 children.   We were sat close to the hostess stand and upon leaving the second gal was much nicer. It just is frustrating to assume that all kids will be have badly!  The food was ok. It's been a few years since we've been and it didn't seem to live up to the expectations we had. The flavors were nice but the selection of only fish with no shellfish seemed small. The only non seafood appetizer option was mozzarella sticks. That was a bummer.   I asked the server for her recommendation and she suggested the grilled chicken. This doesn't really build your faith in the seafood restaurant if the servers favorite is chicken.   Bottom line, it's ok but not worth the price!

aKnAJKvPv9FnK21JM0obqw.text: The first time came it was great food. I got stuffed lobster . It came with these noodles with a great sauce. Went back a month later ordered the same thing did not get the noodles with sauce I asked about it. I was told it was no longer available. I was very disappointed. I don't know why it was no longer available. Have not been back since.

j4kqNASdi5LGxKr2dRNe0A.text: Went in this past weekend for a group dinner. Our server Marcus was excellent at keeping the table cleared, making recommendations and getting everything we asked for. The food was pretty good, though a couple misses here and there with the various things I tried. Overall it was really good and I was pleasantly surprised.

7lDTyZ9i_jCdY1h5z285qQ.text: I had a pretty good experience here. I came in and got seated immediately and my server was very attentive. I tried the fried and blacked alligator as an appetizer and was pretty good. As my main dish I got the redfish with shrimp and oh my, it was amazing. Lastly I tried both the bread pudding (forgot the name) and the pecan pie. Both of these deserts were phenomenal. Over all my experience here was great. The service was on point, the food tasted great but just one negative thing about this place were the tables being way to close to each other.

QSkqwsk16ZqM18BkLNIxEg.text: On almost every birthday my family brings me to Pappadeaux this place has the best seafood and while it's a little pricey it is absolutely worth it because they have the best seafood the best Oysters very good service and desserts that are to die for! One particular time I ordered for pick up and they made a mistake on my order so they fix the problem by giving me a gift card and it was awesome

wFoFyeIzEh8JKxqbEXxGjg.text: Super expensive but super delicious! Great for a special occasion with a good group of people.

ZwDnzHGt_Z8-2nvTkHhnzQ.text: Unreal how the quality and service isn't what it used to be!  One of our all-time favorite places and we always take our guests here when they're in town. Sad to say, we will be looking for another place now.

dTaahRbZwp2BACcxBs1ggQ.text: We went here today around 2:30 today and what a great time + delish food! We sat at the bar and had great convo and was happily entertained. Not too mention, the manager, Arizania, was an absolute doll. We LOVE this place! It's our first stop when we come to visit the Phoenix / Scottsdale / Tempe area.

WvacTndK6-SZlpdxYJ5xcQ.text: Excellent food and service! Went here to try some new orleans food with my girlfriend and we had a great time. The location is a bit to be desired because its next to the freeway and theres only one access point but overall a very nice place.

DtMNUX2IkPqzJci5b3DWnw.text: Love this place, both food and atmosphere. They are usually busy at least when we go in the evening. But the wait is reasonable and the atmosphere makes the wait easier.   I am a fan of their dirty rice. And their wrapped shrimp. I have also had a halibut there that to this day is the best I have ever had. It was one of the specials one of the evenings there.   What makes this place great is not just their spices, but the tenderness of the way they cook their seafood.   Service excellent each time.

HF-E8KQD1OTPD9dWX4A4qA.text: Terrible service!   Cold Mahi Mahi Alexander. Cold Andouille Sausage Gumbo. Cold hard bread. Server Renee B had zero personality, wasn't helpful, didn't bring silver wear until well after the meals were delivered. Never came back to check in us. If she did she would have learned that our food was cold and we didn't have silverware. I understand the place is super busy, but none of the other servers seemed to have a problem checking on their tables. I'm sorry, but there is just no excuse for bad customer service.  And what kind of manager doesn't acknowledge when a mistake by his staff or kitchen has been made? Not even an apology? Shame on you Philip! I came from Cali to patronize your establishment and this is how you treat your customers? Not sure I'd return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi Mahi Alexander

WudVNEKllRnQF2HHMl9bEA.text: Service was the best I've had and definitely will be coming back again for it. Food was exquisite and very tasteful. We tried the frog legs for the first time thanks to our server, Joey. He made our whole experience the best experience we've ever had thus far at Pappadeaux. We will be back to see Joey!

0Sl6HWxa52mPxcV6MFPz6w.text: This is by far my favorite seafood restaurant in Phoenix. The selection is really big they even have fried alligator if you can believe that. It takes a while to get seated sometimes but the food is definitely worth it. I would recommend this to any Seafood lover

tt23UgKRN3ylguwJ2I3NZg.text: Came to Phoenix to pick up a new truck, salesman at Bill Luke told us this place was good. We agree. Awesome food.

qxE7l0pw2XtqgcaEZz8sUQ.text: This place is amazing! You have to try the blackened Gator. That alone is worth the trip!

E9mfBOtvx-Ad1ry5Lf4DcA.text: No better place to take out of town guests.  Awesome atmosphere and amazing food.

A7ivJTLtnwWp62kXkDbhiw.text: For a while it was average, seemed like fried shrimp and drinks.    I've found some new loves...crab cakes- best around all crab..blackened craw fish bisque.  The red fish was quite large and ooh so tasty....  The dessert tray is always worth sharing a few.  Say hey to Jose my favorites sticker if you need a few oysters.

QZOcUWNgnz_12x55DrXDnA.text: Yes, yes, yes, yes......YES!!!!!!!! What an amazing spot for some kick ass seafood. Met some friends here for dinner...This is what we ordered:  Mediterranean Calamari and OMG, It's spectacular. Crispy and tender calamari with artichoke hearts, capers & pepperoncini!!  We also ordered a cup of the andouille sausage and seafood gumbo. Yup, another mind blowing experience! So good. Make sure to mix it up well before you eat it, the way it's intended to be eaten. We also ordered (yes, we were hungry, don't judge), the filet mignon oscar. The only issue was there wasn't much lump crab meat, in fact it was next to nothing on the filet so they ended up taking that off our bill. Still so delish and they followed up and took care of us.  I highly recommend this place, great atmosphere and amazing food.

B6KjG4syNrRRi9SOVQGCSg.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant in the city. But the last few times I've been, it has been uninspiring to say the least. This weekend the service was rushed and not warm and friendly. The food was sub par and bland. Neither of us finished a dish, including the alligator which is usually my favorite.  I really hope they turn this around because this was such an incredible restaurant.

8gYtklKIUOrXNpXro4yWbg.text: Given this restaurant so many chances and all fails.  This is not to review the bar area service, which is excellent.  The restaurant itself is like a different entity.    Last night took two guests for a birthday dinner.  Place was empty but by the time we placed our order (45 mins later!) it was packed.  Server (Bryan) was in the worst I can remember; unfriendly, ignorant about the menu, rude to all three of us, failed to offer more drinks, never came back to ask about meals, and this is only the beginning.  To start I ordered oysters appetizer; at 6:30 on a Tuesday they were all out.  Came time to order dinner and chose crab legs; guess what, all out.  Now I know this isn't the server's fault, but in addition, two lobster dinners were completely charred black, dry and tough - like lobster jerkey.  After 1 1/2 hrs. no time to send back so stuck it out.  At one point Bryan was no where to be seen for over half an hour.  He never came to offer dessert until we flagged him down for our bill.  Got there at 6PM and were out at 8:50 - that's how long this disaster took.

ziKu8in8sGBX_lwrQnNAag.text: The last few years while visiting our family in Phoenix, we seem to always fit in a visit here. Despite what my check-ins say, this was our 3rd visit and we have become quite the fans. The first time I came here, I was at the tail end of my pregnancy so instead of seafood, I chose the Pappardelle Pasta with spinach and butternut squash. It was pretty tasty but it was also pretty heavy.  This last two visits, I went for the live Maine lobster and I was in heaven. I thought it would be a lot of work but the kitchen did a really good job preparing it so the lobster meat came out of the shell really easy. This plate comes with pappardelle pasta but this last visit, I gave that to my little one to eat and got the cheese grits with andouille and corn for my side.  It was a good choice because not only were the grits super yummy, the pasta was the perfect size for the little one. She's going through a phase where all she wants is noodles and broccoli so it fit the profile. Even though the menu is extensive, this might have to be my go-to item on the menu. Can you ever go wrong with live main lobster?   This restaurant is really large which means it can pack a lot of people in...which means it's LOUD but the perfect place to bring a toddler. ; ) To keep with her bedtime routine, we made a reservation for (5:15 pm) and still, we had to wait 10 minutes for our table. I was amazed how busy it already was.   That being said, I'd highly recommend making reservations if you plan to come here. The place is a hot spot and I can see why.  We can't wait until our next years visit. ; )

amHzVRDJ0JjC-3M3DhcD1g.text: I hit this spot up before heading back to Southern California last weekend. I heard many good things so I had to check it out for myself. This place didn't disappoint me. I was promptly greeted when I walked into the restaurant by the host. Lisa, the waitress was very friendly and patient with me because I couldn't make up my mind. As soon as she said this is a cajun/seafood restaurant, I knew I was in Heaven. I snacked on some french bread as I was making this "difficult" decision of what to eat. The food was delicious. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This meal was so delicious. I can&#39;t believe this restaurant doesn&#39;t have 5 stars.

JDfFp6BA5wfOebn8JFkY_g.text: Food and service are always great when I go.  The outside patio is lovely if you go on a busy weekend and have to wait for a table. Halibut is my fish of choice but they have everything for the seafood lover.

qmYrA7dD4fRZ1QauhUuhKw.text: You shouldn't have to wait 30 minutes for a table when there is no waitlist.  The Boy and I were in the neighborhood on Friday and he had raved how much he loves the seafood here. Me? Never been but always game for good seafood.  We walked in at 9 PM and were told it would be a minute for them to clean a table for us but the hostess gave us a buzzer and we headed to the bar. The bartenders were polite but were more concerned with interacting with themselves, talking smack about football teams and "Woo Boys Rick Flair" than interacting with us.  Twenty minutes at the bar and I notice a couple walk in and be seated. Then a group of four walks in and is seated. After a couple walked in and was seated, The Boy walked over and asks about our buzzer and how we saw other tables being seated but not ours. No apology from the male host, just "umm we can seat you now".  Our server Nick continued with the poor experience. He was either new, in the weeds, or honestly did not care about our table. Every time he stopped at our table he was two steps past us on to the next table before we could answer. He stopped to check on how our food was and was taking the table behind ours margarita order before either of us could speak. He also floundered when describing the two dishes I was on the fence about. He described the Texas Redfish Pontchartrain as "tasting more like fish" than the shrimp and scallop dish but did slightly rebound with the description of the Shrimp & Scallop Orecchiette Pasta, which I ultimately ordered. I do give him props for not pushing the more expensive dish, which often happens with servers who only want to upsell.   Other table around us received a crusty loaf of bread and butter before their entrees.  I even heard another server rave about how everyone loves their french loaf but none was offered to us or even mentioned.  The food itself was very good. The Boy got the Pasta Mardi Gras and loved it. The portion was huge and The Boy loved the spices and the mix of seafood and Andouille sausage.  He was head over heals for the Cheese Grits Andouille & Corn.   I started with the Cesar salad which was very good. I ordered the above mentioned Orecchiette pasta which was also very good but was disappointed by the amount of shrimp and scallops in the dish. The dish had 3, ok sized shrimp, and 4 mediumish scallops..   Although our experience was disappointing, I watched the tables around us and was impressed by the service.  Servers and bussers worked as a cohesive team while the servers themselves gave exceptional service and attention to their tables.  Will our meh experience cloud us from coming back? I can't say since we don't live in the area but I can say I would be back in a heartbeat if we has the experience everyone else around us had.

qPJVlMYR9EFQ-WcXNahFPg.text: My wife loves this place, so sadly I must go here more often than I would like. I think it's very over priced for what you get. I have had much better seafood at other restaurants, nothing they do here is very special or unique. For half the price you can find at least an equally good, if not better seafood restaurant in the area.

LoELBnuyx_H5tjRx_HrwDg.text: It's been at least 4 years since we have had Pappadeaux in Texas.  Always enjoy it and love the crawfish trio.   This time around tried a variety of items and favorites were the crawfish, pappadeaux platter and the mussels.  Mussels were big and juicy in an awesome broth.    Layout is just like other Pappadeuax's around Texas, but felt a little larger in the patio waiting area.  Great service and got our fix for the next few years.

kb4HrYoD8ysItRBbvezHFA.text: I'm giving them 5 stars for their customer service. They are wonderful here. I ordered the shrimp and crab cocktail. Didn't really like the cocktail sauce.   The waitress and her manager apologized, asked if they can bring me something else. Didn't charge me for the food. Made me feel very comfortable and not like an annoying, complaining customer.   Great service, great restaurant. Will definitely be back. Thank you Lisa and Gianna. You guys are the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and crab cocktail

w813AWPQ1Jk9igTxgMFmKg.text: Great food great service. My only regret this time is my food was so good that I had no room for desert. I had a pasta with scallops shrimp and octopus. Best flavor ever

zKKvUzem5aAiUfofmr9z5Q.text: I've always judged a restaurant based on the service that they give the food can be as horrible as anything but if the service is there then you got me for life this isn't Pappadeaux Pappadeaux service and food is excellent my kids gave me a gift card for Christmas for my wife and I to use and unfortunately my printer ran out of ink for the last 30 minutes between the waitress that was taking my order at the two gold counter and both of the managers assistant managers and anybody that came over we were trying to figure out what was the PIN to the gift card as my ink ran out at the last on reasonable moment to figure out what the pain was we called the customer service for the gift card I called my daughter to resend and I finally found a screenshot of it but at that that time we had locked ourselves completely out of the gift card thank you kudos to Pappadeaux's your staff the managers the waitress that took my order they caught my mail this time because of the Valiant efforts that everyone had to do the take and try and get my order together and figure out what this gift card is I am grateful deeply deeply grateful for you guys and will continue to come out here and patronize your establishment

TW3l0qC5rItg3-_sYc6wZg.text: Wyatt the singer is the best server!! Made the food that was great wonderful!!!! Give him a raise!!! Amazing Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!!

Jzv9BZMRv8adLjvU1TRBPg.text: Ate in this time for a birthday dinner for Karen from my Auntie D & Uncle G. Karen had the fondu with enough to take home for an additional 2 meals. I get the catfish with a baked potato (extra charge for that $3.50).  The catfish was outstanding. We got a freebie desert. I used to getting my catfish from Lolo's. But, Pappadeaux's is much better. But, it is much more expensive, so I would stick with Lolo's. You get sides with it there. The service was very good (thanks to Noel). Great place to go for special occasion, not a weekly venture unless you're rich.

5OcuFz-0xn8tZv6OOQ1C8g.text: Our evening started out not so well. The hostess was extremely rude. HOWEVER, Dion, our server definitely made up for it. He was very attentive and great at what he does. The food is also amazing. Try it out, you won't be disappointed!!

p_4bjcQhSbun_UXpH9G_5g.text: I LOVE seafood! So this was a NO brainer especially since this was my very FIRST visit to this franchise.   The ambiance inside this particular location is a lil dark yet cozy and can easily be intimate for those occasions. my first observation and top concern, iWas NOT offered or served ANY bread & butter after being seated. However, when iDid look around to view and absorb the ambiance iNoticed every other table had bread in a basket, Hmmm??? My Waitress also seems very RUSHED!  My order was correct and delivered surprisingly very quickly! Which made the food Decadently delicious. It was hot and the serving portions are fulfilling. My entire plate was explosive with a variety of spices and savory flavors to indulge your sense of taste in.   This was my first time trying Tilapia fish and it was delicious! Also my first time eating Alligator. Alligator meat is a lil chewy and IF perhaps you didn't know it was Alligator you were eating you would believe you were eating Chicken. The kicker to this appetizer is The Sauce it's served with - Nums! Nums!   BTW, it was also my first time trying Banana Pudding and it's a dessert iWill NEVER eat again! It was nasty, yuck! Not to mention it was recommended by the waitress that night.   I will visit another Pappadeaux again for sure, hoping iGet my bread served after being seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HH-S4jSxRmwZ6eccsAyCJQ.text: As soon as my friends and I got seated here, a man came to our table to greet us--or so we thought. Instead, he complained about my partially consumed $7 Starbucks drink which I'd placed at my table setting, telling us we couldn't have any non-Pappadeaux-branded items in here. I'm sure he thought I'd hand over said contraband to him or throw it out myself, but I said, fine and I set it down on the floor next to my purse out of his reach instead. He grumbled, but accepted that. Turns out he was the MANAGER! Really?!? The manager's first contact is to humiliate their customers in public? So, for the next five minutes we discussed whether or not to walk out of the place and never come back again.   Meanwhile, waitress Catie came by and we decided to place a drink order, while still contemplating whether to walk out or not before placing our food order. Catie got 5-stars throughout, BTW, and ultimately earned her generous tip. She was the only reason we stayed (besides hunger and limited time). We ended up ordering over $100 worth of food for three, but only because of Catie. And also maybe because the drinks eventually made our collective blood pressures finally return to normal.   The food was great (4-stars?) but it was overpriced and at times, uninspiring. A splash of brandy or sherry would have made the lobster bisque better, for instance. They pushed the octopus on the menu way too hard. I suspect they had more octopi back in the kitchen than the Monterey Bay Aquarium. We didn't order any. They took formerly great dishes off the menu (Lobster Mac and Cheese, Lobster Roll, more?) and replaced these with, well, more octopi dishes.  Tried multiple times to upload food photos but couldn't--sorry! Suspect that's a Yelp issue and not a Pappadeux one, though.  No complaints about the waitress service, but can't say the same about service overall, thus the 2-star rating here. Will I go back? Probably not, although I'd be tempted to follow Catie to her next job some day.

APtn2-8DR2tqAioIXNt9vQ.text: The crab cakes were good, not fond of the prices as there a little high, not out of line but higher then the usual.  It's hard to rate this place, especially when we couldn't remember what we ate except the crab cakes, those were good.  Not authentic creole/Cajun fair, but Moe authentic then just adding cayenne to something and calling it Cajun.  Probably won't be back unless somebody else picks it.

0i8Te192kaftQCXHkWXmig.text: What can you say about this Great place. The best in Seafood needs to move into California.

ZMr6cARXOVcc6kl6cJnsGg.text: Our party of 3 came in around 5:45 on Friday without reservations after noting ratings and ++ comments by hotel staff. So we had a 45 minute wait time noting patrons seated outside and a packed bar at happy hour.   So we decide to order a couple drinks on the HH special and the fried gator with fries. The dipping sauce was to die for and the drinks well loaded with booze:-).   It wasn't a great start for service as the barkeep had issues with the POS so maybe about 15 minutes for service. But we were happy with the results. But service time got progressively worse at dinner. It took over 10 minutes just to be recognized after seating and by that time we fortunately knew what to order. Service never bothered to check on our meal, and our water glasses remained empty as we had to ask for the dessert menu.   So why 4 stars when the service was barely north of 1?  The food was that good. Period. I've been to NOLA a couple times and I'm no expert to claim the food isn't traditional (it was a bit different than I had experienced), but it was absolutely FANTASTIC!  The shrimp etoufee was superb and the Mardi Gras Pasta was it's equal. And to top it off, the bread pudding hit the sweet spot.   5+ stars for food and 1.5 for service taking nearly 1 h 45 m to complete the meal.

VvAbKbHMhp1XXKDhlZIIbg.text: This place has never steered me wrong. I ate at the bar this time and really enjoyed myself. It's a great place to eat.

B4e85pZx3pYI_guCWU3OKA.text: It feels like the quality goes down just a bit each time I eat here. I think it's time to find a new place.

JIx-MBDjhsBBO3EC-B4dWg.text: Been here 5 times and have had nothing but a positive experience I love this place and Red Lobster can't come close when it comes to the quality you receive  at Pappadeaux

tSTzKPgZLlyU-IckL1XXnQ.text: Favorite restaurant hands down!!!! It is pricey but you get what you pay for. My husband and I always get the calamari for appetizer and the sauce that comes with it is amazing.

ES0G7OuMhZUhsEWr-c0auQ.text: As always solid spot, portions for price you can never go wrong, great service & options are amazing!  If you're thinking you're going to eat a meal if ordering an appetizer or enjoying their delicious bread don't fool yourself & if you take my advice for it you'll share your entree if smart..!

HVv1VLeQmg_hYlm8iZglmQ.text: Stopped in as it was an easy pit-stop on our way home from flagstaff to Tucson. Our meals were a-ok. Service was slow considering the restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived. The waiter was apologetic and implied they were having kitchen issues.  I had the catfish lunch plate that came with a shrimp, toast gravy dish on the side and fries. (Sorry I can't recall what the side was called) Fries were really bad, also tasted old. Plenty of shrimp with dish and the gravy was good. Pretty heavy dish! I'll agree with Cindy N- definitely a ton of salt in their dishes. The catfish was tasty. My other half had the Pasta Mardi Gras and enjoyed it, seemed to be plenty of seafood in it as well. Although he said there was very little heat to it.   I don't know if we will rush here again.

aVS1Bo690jPALz4d3zG8Qg.text: I love the fried alligator, it is my favorite. There is always great customer service and attention to allergies. This is the only seafood place in Arizona that I will recommend.

171xHURf6S6quvPxWNzs3w.text: First time...won't be last! Seafood was fresh and flavorful.  Staff was mediocre,  but  the food was excellent.  Go there!

c8SYnZ39Q-j-HeVUr3tdMw.text: Awesome service in the bar from Jacob! Calamari appetizer great. Crawfish platter and salmon Alexander were awesome as well!

mMayEpv-KY9EYWh4HqgIbw.text: When a restaurant - or any business - posts a price, then that is the price that the customer should expect to pay. Period. So, what the heck?  I'm more than familiar with the practice of items like live Maine lobster being priced as "market" since it can change from one day to the next.  The posted price above the lobster tank clearly stated that the price for a 1lb. lobster was $21.95. When the bill arrived, it was charged at $23.95. Granted, not a big difference. But, a difference. The server's explanation was that the menu price had recently changed. OK. So?   There was an opportunity here to make right. Strike one when the server made the comment that she did. Strike two was when the server returned to the table with the payment having been processed but the price having not changed and no mention of a floor manager being consulted. Too bad, the differential came straight out of the tip!  Strike three was when mention was made to the women at the hostess stand directly next to the posted sign with prices. The reaction was very under-whelming. No apology. More of a casual brush-off.  Look, I get it. Pappadeaux has been a valley institution for decades. And, they pack the place every day. But, ya know, when things like this happen, there can be a tipping point and things can turn on something as simple as this: if you post a price, then charge that price. Period. If you want to change it on the fly, then make every posting say "market rate," or "ask server for price quote." Just because they do a pretty good job of steaming lobster and charge a reasonable price isn't enough any more.  Oh, and the lobster this time? Well, we ordered two. Each of us got one half of one lobster and one half of the other lobster. How do we know? One person got brain with each half and the other got none. One was steamed perfectly. The other was over-done and chewy. One had a nice, long, vein still in it having not been cleaned properly.  Maybe, just maybe, Pappadeaux is no longer worth the hype that took them decades to build.  Management: read some of the less than perfect reviews. Take note. Make changes. Or, maybe you've gotten so big now-a-days that you really couldn't care less...  Gonna be a while before I come back. I'm disappointed.

gILgiJQtUEO9w007m3NgOw.text: I have been going to this restaurant for years.   Last night was a little short of normal.        The food was not up to there rising cost. $30. bucks for a fish plate that was OK. The appetizer came out late, 2 minutes before the main course. Expect to drop over a 100 to $150 bucks for two people.

5Yo_ZMJmnuaZ9sG3NwntWA.text: Love it. Feels classy, has classy prices and great seafood. I typically save this for a special occasion dinner.

UVnawmB3AOAuxK5pTZo7Tg.text: Beyond disappointed! We had what was a very great evening here tonight! We got one of the out coves. Had a wonderful waiter and really enjoyed our date night......... however now I am sick as a dog with food poisoning and cannot even keep water down! For a 140$ before tip so closer to 170$ bill and to now have food poisoning to say I am disappointed is an understatement........ unfortunately, I will probably be to afraid to come back after this! I plan to try and call management in the morning to inform them of this as well so that no one else hets  Update..... it's been a week tomorrow and I have not heard from anyone from Pappadeaux at all! I spoke with Stephanie a manager on Sunday last week and she advised I would be getting a Call from the home office in a few days and I have yet to get a call back! So glad they care about giving people food poisoning and having them be sick for almost 5 days!

ZFBIUGK9Em2s-1zgBKxYZw.text: We've always loved Pappadeaux.  We've visited many times before. We came in to celebrate mother's day with my mom and this visit really seemed lack luster. Service was off.  We ordered appetizers and drinks, then seemed to have lost our waitress. When she came back around we asked to order entrees and, while apologetic, also told us, oh? I thought you'd just be ordering appetizers.  The alligator we ordered was blackened and fried. The blackened alligator tasted different this time. My mother said it seemed to lack the same signature seasoning.  There was nobody to tell, as nobody asked us how our meal was. Meals finally came, we took some home. Got home to finish off my ahi tuna and bit into one of the pieces and felt something sharp. Pulled it out of my mouth to find what???  Someone's finger nail they seemed to have slice off with a knife. I used to work in kitchens, I know this happens, but also know you are supposed to throw the dish away if there is any chance it had the foreign object in the food you are serving.  Really disappointed all around with our visit this time. Really appears the quality has gone down with this restaurant. Very sad!  Especially since we dropped a pretty penny on dinner tonight.

wuRwt5YYyqSFuEQh7gNCGw.text: Tried this restaurant out for the first time with my bf and wow, I will definitely be back! Tried the crocodile for the first time and even though I was a little hesitant I'm glad I did, it was absolutely delicious. As was the rest of our food.

DiRDZOS3p5NH9D_roIFDyg.text: Food is wonderful, the atmosphere perfect, and Alex is a sweet and charming waitress.

PRwDReaAxshmFur_pwGV9g.text: I've been here many times and have always enjoyed it. The seafood is excellent, I especially recommend the oyster plate... wow!

gWAisiBMHd63MdevXJ1mKg.text: Delicious and great service!  First time I've been here - busy on a Wednesday evening but we were greeted and seated very promptly, had a great waiter and the food was delicious.  Huge restaurant so even though it was busy it didn't feel crowded.  Highly recommend!

I7oPtgGIFvjuBLk_TF44dg.text: My wife exclaimed the tilapia was the best fish she ever had. Flown in fresh daily. I loved the Scallops cooked in brown butter and blackened Louisana style. A perfect combination of texture and taste. Try the coconut shrimp appetizer. We were debating between the crab cakes and coconut shrimp. The waiter recommended the shrimp and said Pappadeaux's is known for their coconut shrimp. I now know why. So delicious. I highly recommend. It was worth the drive from Gilbert to Sunnyslope.
