JrDUdM1HlEn1663_3MRVnA.text: Pappadeaux is good but it had the feel of a worn-down Red Lobster.  This is not to say the food was not good, but that was the impression that I felt.  I have had the jambalaya and the etoufee here and both were adequate, though I had to douse on the Tabasco to truly make the flavor something I desired.  I would recommend this place to somebody interested in a casual happy hour or a family who wants to eat their fill as the quantity was quite large.

bUPKqDrMhaeqlBlO72xBsA.text: Had lunch here today It was great, the food was great We had the Appetizer Trio, Pasta Mardi Gras, and the Mixed Seafood Grill. It was way more food than the two of us could eat. The server was very attentive and very helpful. I would recommend Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen to anyone who likes Cajun food or Seafood there is so much to choose from and basically the server said we could change anything on the menu to have it made just the way we wanted. AWESOME

cxF1Fd_DN-mjFxtSydkeOw.text: While in the Phoenix area I decided to have dinner here on a friend recommendation. The food is absolutely the best. I had the seafood, sausage gumbo. Absolutely the best. No skimping on the seafood or sausage. The breaded, fried alligator was a little spicy for my wife, but it was great for me. Went back the second nite for dinner.  Wait staff very good, service very good. Would go back again.

nlSXQdmHsFdm1Pt3O8Ir5Q.text: Wow!  Great service.  Great food.  Great relaxed atmosphere.  Andy, our server, was awesome.  Very polite, fun and extremely attentive but not at all intrusive.  We were greeted by at least 4 different employees on the way to our table; as well as being wished a good evening by 3 or 4 on our way out.  He gave us a free order of Aligator since it was our first time there.  Everyone loved it!  Only my 16 y/o son was not impressed with the food; although it was his first time trying anything "blackened."  The service manager (I think his name was Malcomb or Matt) came over and comp'd us a desert  for my wife's birthday.  The price was about what we expected for great seafood, but the quality of food and service was worth DOUBLE what we paid.

9i4bCPsDjFZYHCbDSxcGZQ.text: Ok, they should be happy that I am understanding of the flying bug that landed in my dessert and died before it was served.  Yes, I found it as I was eating the dessert, grossed me out, but not necessarily their fault.  The manager came over and apologized and took the dessert off the bill and offered me another one.  Anyway, the rest of the meal was great.  My party and I had the scallops with green beans and capers.  Yummy!  I do like Pappadeaux's overall and this is the first time I didn't have a great experience.

YqPvVgcLf25eLWOupWCFdA.text: Tried this place for the first time last night for Me and My Hubs 19th Wedding Anniv. We got there at 5:30 and had reservations for 6:00, so we headed to the bar and had a cocktail to waste away a half an hour. The bartenders were fast and courteous.  I had a margarita; not bad but to sour for my liking. Hub had a draft beer and it was served in an ice, ice, ice cold mug. At 6:00 we were seated at our table right away and our server, Gerald, was at our table in an instant with pen in hand asking us if we had been to Pappadeaux before and if we had any questions before he informed us about the menu. We had the lump crab spinach dip for a starter, good flavor but not much lump crab to be found in ours.  We had the fried soft shell crab for our dinner and it was YUMMMMMMMMY!!!  All in All it's a great place for seafood, just be prepared to open your wallett $$.

xcZ2GFLSO7hmFAEBDkM5vg.text: I've eaten here multiple time.  Have eaten at other Pappadeaux venues across the US.  Never really had a bad meal here or any other location.  Given that we live in a desert this is about as good as seafood gets.  There are other places that charge a lot more (Eddie Vs for example) but I've found Pappadeaux to be just as good and a whole lot cheaper (although Pappadeaux cost a few bucks).

eYQ3bG7gdmyLWBXf1dhu0Q.text: Great food, but the 1hr wait for a patio table ruined it (while there were a few open tables out there).

NnQdK2kyzBuAuN1syWuJug.text: Oh Pappadeaux's, how I wish you were closer to my home. If I didn't have to drive 40-45 minutes to get there, I would probably spend my entire paycheck on two things: Oysters and Fried Alligator. As such, I'm going to stick to those two things in my review. Those are really the only two things that I eat when I go, because I cannot get enough of them.  First things first, the staff and ambiance. The music can get a little bit loud, but the atmosphere is always fun and upbeat. The staff all seems to be pretty friendly, too. Our server was especially friendly and helpful. This is definitely a place I like to go to with my friends to hang out and have a good night.  Now, I'll talk about the food. First, the oysters. The oysters here are great! They give you a few different sauces to go along with them, each of which has a distinct, delicious flavor to add. To make the oysters even better, they have incredible deals on them! They only cost about $4.00 per dozen for the special they supposedly have running almost all the time. The type of oysters that you get on the special vary based on whatever factors affect the catching of oysters. As for the Fried Alligator, IT'S FRIED ALLIGATOR. As soon as I saw it on the menu, I had to have it. To quote one of my favorite movies (Transformers), "Alligator is the most succulent meat." The Fried Alligator here is one of my favorite things to eat. I absolutely cannot have enough Fried Alligator. The meat is moist and juicy with a light and non-fishy flavor, and the batter/breading layer is fried crisp. That combo of the moist meat with the crispy outside is phenomenal. Add on the dusting of cajun seasoning and the creole dipping sauce, and you have a dish you won't forget.   In conclusion, I definitely recommend this place. I can't really speak for anything other than the oysters and the fried alligator, but do I need to? Come on, it's Fried Alligator and cheap oysters! Stop reading and go to Pappadeaux's!

Ei8g9NPSc1Ay_LCzvO3tVg.text: First time we had ever been to Pappadeaux's.  My husband had the fried platter.  The badder was light and did not weigh you down or over power the food.  I had the Salmon salad.  Best salmon I've ever had!  My mother in law had mauhi over some type of mash.  All the food was fantastic!!  So we shared the bread pudding for dessert.  Best dessert I've ever had!  The server, Joe was also fabulous!  The whole experience is what gives this place 5 stars!  From start to finish, it was amazing!  It's a little higher priced, but definately worth it!  Upscale dining for sure!  Can't wait to go back!

ez59CvkuZrQCM8nFEPb26w.text: Thanks for making my birthday dinner horrible! First, I would like to say that our waitress was courteous and very nice, but the food tonight was inedible! My hubby took me here for my birthday dinner, it was my favorite place and we have been coming here for 8 years. I ordered the lobster bisque and he ordered the clam chowder. Both soups were very very salty, but I was ok with that and ate half my soup. For the main course, he ordered the blackened catfish and I got the sea bass. My hubby took one bite of the fish and knew it was bad. I took a bite and yes it was very bad, not just bad in taste, but it tasted rank/sour. My sea bass was good, but what made me mad was that we told the waitress and she said she would have the manager come over and talk to us...... We waited and waited.... I ate my dinner alone while my hubby had nothing....... Finally the waitress came over and after two glasses of liquid courage, I gave her a piece of my mind. Evidently, that brought the manager over. My hubby didn't want to risk another choice from the menu and I was finished eating. They comped our meal, but that didn't make my birthday any better.... And Pappadeaux, no need to respond to my review because no apology is going to be good enough to have me dine in your establishment again.

yhdYYwRLSLNcGFVqnw7Xmw.text: Anniversary Dinner was fantastic!  First time there, I had the sea bass my husband had lobster. We also shared a ceasar salad, gumbo, and smoked salmon. I know it was way too much to eat but so delicious! Our server was Marlin and he was so friendly and informative. Really enjoyed it only complaint was I wish there was some seating a little more private, it was kind of noisy but tha'ts the only complaint I had. We will definately be going back, I never thought I liked salmon but that appetizer was so good I want to try the salmon for dinner. It is a bit pricey, but you do get what you pay for.

HY9xgHRWuF4ekHfukyljXQ.text: Hello All! Last night my husband Michael and I went out to dinner to celebrate my new job, we went to Pappadeaux which we had been numerous time before but last night I have to say we had the BEST server that Pappadeaux has her name is Kara Reveas and she listen to want we liked she picked up on the fact that my husband doesn't eat meat so when she brought our meals out she replaced his dirty rice with white rice since they prepare their dirty rice with meat. She offered us choices to try on our return visit of certain items on the menu. You could see when she explained how they prepared the meal that she was passionate in her job and wanting the customer to have a wonderful food experience. We also meet the Manager from Mississippi Cori Woods she was absolutely wonderful as well very charming and caring you could tell that she really enjoys her work. If you haven't eaten there please stop in you will be so happy that you did. The food, atmosphere and service is 5 Stars and remember to ask for Kara she works Thursday evenings.  Oh and the Alligator is great you need to try it!!!!!!

LU0IvizRZWywIs5FkS_2Kw.text: I love, love, love Pappadeaux.  I always end up spending way too much.  The drinks are strong, yet delicious and their seafood dishes are to die for.

xX0xjtIvFRCC2sNPDYmCCw.text: If you have a spare $100 and are not real hungry go here. Long wait,poor service very average food at best but hard to tell when it comes out cold

T7NK_bmEjlUEFAia5UvwIA.text: Years back we were regular customers considering our snowbird status. In recent years we hadn't been here so when friends suggested we meet there to celebrate two wedding anniversaries it seemed a good idea. I am not so sure now. Friends split the halibut special and were enthusiastic. I ordered a wedge salad and the mussel appetizer and was happy enough.  My wife had the clam chowder and shrimp cocktail and was disappointed with quality of shrimp and said the chowder was terrible. She loved her cheesecake dessert and our friends enjoyed the creme brulee and pecan pie.  Interestingly enough the salad our friends had came in a separate course whereas the salad I ordered and my wife's chowder came with our other dish which overfilled the table. Wine list was ok.  Waitress was seldom around. Water and ice tea ran dry. It was busy. I still feel this chain normally does a better job. We did get free desserts.

v-PLsmz4qmIZr_DZK4kRXA.text: Just returned from sleep inducing dinner at Pappadeaux's.   In my stomach: half dozen (actually 8) raw oysters, Pontchartrain fillet, and peanut butter cheesecake.   Service was A+... luckily Justin (our waiter) was a jovial one.   Will update next time with details.   My system will have the sweetest sleep tonight.

0fIMU7zB4i21U-6C23nHdw.text: Pappadeaux used to have this oreo cookie mousse dessert thing  It was the best dessert ever in this world.  Ever.  Then they stopped carrying it.  So now I won't go back.  I protest Pappadeaux!

81QbRC5pW1ryx5ECWxrMWg.text: Louisiana born Hubby decided he wanted to go to Pappadeaux's for his birthday dinner after we discovered that Barrio Cafe would be closed Monday. The restaurant was unbelievably packed for a random Monday, but I was a tad annoyed that we still had to wait about a half hour to be seated- and that was with a reservation.   Our waitress was great and got Hubby's requisite Oyster, Crawfish, and Mushroom "Fondeaux" started right away. That kind of chain-y cutesy naming cheesiness makes me roll my eyes, but Hubby is blind to such lameness since Pappa's has a whole empire of similarly named restaurants in Texas (from where he moved to Arcosanti whence I snagged him- but I digress). He also ordered some kind of layered frozen fruity monstrosity that made him positively loopy (in his defense, we're not big drinkers).  After the Fondeaux appetizer, we barely had room for our entrees, so we both have excellent lunches today. I had a mixed seafood grill which had very nicely cooked pieces of scallop, mahi, and salmon together with way too well done shrimp. In apparently some sort of fugue state I also ordered a side of onion rings which I promptly regretted when the platter came out bigger than my head. They were mighty tasty, though, and I have not had much luck before finding really good onion rings (except at Ted's Hot Dogs, of course). Hubby ordered a crawfish platter with fried pieces and etoufee, but the waitress  convinced him to get the triple slam with blackened crawfish as well- and this turned out to be his favorite on the plate. All the portions are gargantuan, so we have to remember next time to share an entree, especially if we need to get the Fondeaux. Which I'm sure we will...

xrMC22MrrSUcPSXMbaHGhA.text: Whatever the crawfish thing is I get every time I go there is, it's so freekin good.    I like sitting in the bar better than in the actual restaurant part where the tables are crammed in and there's probably kids running around them.    A little too commercial feeling for me to give it 4 stars, but I'll still go there for some dang good crawfish.

b3zLmdoBMgQ7N7PotzekJw.text: My first experience at this chain... I usually try to eat local when traveling but my partner wanted to eat here. The service was absolutely some of the best I have ever. Our server was Matt, he knew the menu forward and back and even offered us an appetizer that wasn't on the menu, blacked alligator, crazy good. The food was great as well, I ordered the Caribbean lobster tail, it was huge and very flavorful. We did have one mix up with the kitchen but Matt explained the situation and handled it. One of the best dining experiences ever. Check them out, and ask for Matt, you won't be disappointed.

OD-vZkB3g0tsDSwwue-wvQ.text: Been here many times and even had an event for 20 people.  Best Sea Food place in Phoenix.  Service is always 5 stars and the staff is always great.  Try the seafood gumbo, oysters and lobsters.  I had a 4lb lobster there and it was the best.

6TWsrEcS66aPeoHD0cmGlw.text: I am from phoenix, but moved to Orange County/Los Angeles area 6 years ago, but still visit AZ a lot. I remember coming here when i was little but don't remember much about the food. Passed this place on the way home from the airport on December 29th, and as a huge fan of Cajun food, I had to stop in. I had to give 5 stars because the food, the service, and the New Orleans ambiance were all to a tee. We got a couple fancy (expensive) cocktails while we waited at the bar for our table. Drinks weren't anything special, but the bartenders very friendly, and offered bread and butter while we waited. We didn't have to wait long before we sat, and if it were warmer out, I would not have minded having cocktail hour on their awesome patio before dinner. You would never know this place is right next to one of Phoenix's busiest freeways. We sat down and our waiter was Bo L(sorry if i didn't get his name right, my receipt rubbed his name off). Anyways we ordered some wine and tried their oyster and shrimp appetizer. Not impressive. But everything else was. Their Lobster Bisque was rich and tasty and I ordered the Seafood Gumbo that came with my Shrimp Po' Boy. My mom ordered her favorite, the Crawfish Etouffee which was superior. My Po' Boy was good, but it was the fried and seasoned shrimp that really made the sandwich. My seafood Gumbo was very authentic and delicious, but i am a sucker for Lobster Bisque which I thought was better. We also ordered a side of their Mushroom Risotto which was cheap and very flavorful. I cannot wait to come here again next weekend when I am visiting. I did some research for good cajun in LA, and cannot find any in, out of all places, Los Angeles. I will have to go to Phoenix for good cajun.

HJHEaROgmgFjeZnX8igDmw.text: It's the kind of place that I order what I think will be great, and it is, but everyone else seems to have ordered something even better. I walk out thinking, it's a bit more than what I usually want to spend, but I'm glad we went. The kind of place when we wonder where to go for seafood we wind up there. It seems to have been transplanted, or at least the best replica in Phoenix, of Louisiana when I look at the clientele, who look like transplants from New Orleans looking for a good place to eat. It's lively, and is beautiful building with a red brick courtyard. The staff is knowledgeable, and very helpful to someone raised here and not that familiar with the great variety of seafood. I usually tip larger there than any other place. I've been accused of having moths fly out of my wallet so I have to rate this place very highly. In fact, for seafood I've been here the most often, having been very disappointed with other places in the valley.

U72UE3T7j_nPPL0q1hZ_zA.text: $20 for a double Maker's Mark?  Me thinks not T.G.I. McPappadeaux.  I was not impressed by anything that was there and will not only steer clear but may avoid the I-17 all together.

RDcbjTwVjwFi3sNdrZi_EQ.text: Went with Patrick to celebrate 3 years together. After hearing great things I came in with a really high expectation. They met every single one. Not only that but when they did mess up and gave me mushroom risotto before I even realized the fact that it was not what I ordered (no joke was on the table maybe 2 minutes) they had the risotto replacement on the table! APOLOGIZED AND!! YES AND!! Offered to re-plate it!... this wasn't the waitress apologizing... IT WAS THE CHEF! Talk about making me feel really important. The scallops were amazing the herb risotto was amazing and even the desert (which was given to us on the house for coming there to celebrate) of creme brule blow my mind. I had a food high and floated like a overfilled happy balloon all the way home.

YTCMdOafuv1Hc6wb8PEzaA.text: This place it the bomb. Anything you order will be delicious. I love the Pappadeaux Platter and the Hurricanes. My girls like the Lobsters in the tank when you walk in (Larry the Lobster) and the patio is very beautiful and relaxing while you wait. They have so many people working there and the place is always packed. We drive 22 miles one way to eat here and have never been disappointed. The portions are huge and we always end up eating the left over's for lunch the next day. They also have a balloon artist that wonders around and my girls love him.

ucnr-cLR0hMDxh9kl9XY9A.text: We've been coming here for years - and it has always been one of our very favorite places. Perfect for a special night out - either for a romantic dinner or with friends.  But tonight we discovered a new thing to love here at Pappadeaux: the chargrilled salmon diablo! Perfectly prepared - and the flavors of the mesquite-grilled salmon were perfectly complemented by the slightly tangy diablo cream sauce, with big tasty pieces of crab and crawfish in it. Even the broccoli was delicious! Steamed with a light sprinkling of garlic lemon olive oil and a touch of warm red pepper flakes. Love!!!

iCkshLr6_jVSkNfl2et7iw.text: I really enjoy coming to Pappadeaux. The service is pretty good, and the food is excellent. They have alligator for an appetizer which is very tasty. I love ordering the gumbo and the lobster bisque for starters. As for the main course, The Mardi Gras pasta is very delicious. This place can be a bit expensive but if you love seafood this place is an excellent choice.

1UBM6L1FL0IfCAeCDs1idg.text: I was really excited to try this restaurant as I heard good things.  The food was okay, but everything took FOREVER and they were not that busy.  I probably will not go there again.

45C_ZWEWelkv0kQMw6-dMQ.text: Well we made the mistake of going here on a Friday night at about 7pm.  This place was packed.  Strange considering the average price of a dinner is around 20 bucks.  But we decided to try anyways.  I have been here before but that was maybe six years ago.   Upon arrival we went to the hostess table and she told us there would be a two hour wait.  She said that if you wait for a table in the bar you can get one of those tables first come first serve.  So we took a number and hung out in the bar.  About 20 minutes of waiting in the bar we got two seats at the bar.  Lucky.  The bar staff is very friendly and very fast considering this place was absolutely packed!      We ordered two of the specialty drinks called the swamp thing!   they were damn tasty.  I don't know how much alcohol is in one but that's all I needed for the rest of the night!  We also ordered some fried alligator as an appetizer.  The alligator taste like a  cross of fish with a chicken texture.  It is very tasty! The presentation was also nice not messy or greasy.  We then ordered our dinner.    She got the Shrimp Etoufee and I got the Pontchartrain Fish.  The shrimp etoufee came in a smoky sauce with dirty rice.  The Pontchartrain was the fish of the day which was tilapia and had shrimp and crab meat in a butter sauce with dirty rice.  The food is outstanding!  Portion size is fantastic and food served hot and fresh.  The fish has no fishy taste or smell to it.  Its as if it came off the boat and served in your plate.    Overall I say two thumbs way up!  For an expensive dinner this place is worth it.  Date night yes, want to surprise the family with some creole food YES!     Only thing I would say is that come early and hungry! Also if it is date night the bar is the way to go.  You don't even have to get alcohol you can get a soda and order food.

65p8ActJyKuzmD7brbAC0Q.text: If you are a Cajun or from New Orleans you will be disappointed. If youre not and are just looking for a casual seafood restaurant with some hints of Nawlins, then you may like this place. The food was good, just not once you've experienced The Big Easy.  I do agree with the other review, it was very loud!

UWOO2apchAAU4DrS7VgJUQ.text: We meet up at Pappadeaux for an early dinner Thursday night. We get together about every six  weeks and have a nice dinner, laughs, and catch up. First of all I want to say our waitress was great. The three of us ordered Pasta Mardi Gras. I was so disappointed. I got a bowl of pasta with pink sauce and a couple of tasteless shrimp. Then I saw the waitress bring the next table a plate of onion rings. I called her over, please bring us a plate of onion rings, she did and they were amazing. The onion ring were about $6 and Pasta Mardi Gras was $18. I brought the Pasta Mardi Gras home so I could really look at it. All that was in the bowl was pasta, mushrooms and pink sauce. There was no craw-fish in the pink sauce.What a rip off. Then to top it off, we were sitting in a booth we had people coming up to us asking if we were done because they wanted our booth. For goodness' sake people we are still eating. So, Rude! and the management just watch what was going on and did nothing about it. If you were thinking about stopping in, just skip it, it's not the good food it once was and the management sucks.

bAbcg8ToIrtxVnfMZRdCtA.text: Awesome love to be full and have left overs great place love it here.

ESNFMHrtNKv83Z9tq9mCdA.text: Best seafood restaurant in Arizona, HANDS DOWN! The Shellfish fondue is absolutely mouth watering.  Wednesday night, I decided to switch it up from my usual Shrimp Montage and got the Atlantic salmon. Holy bejesus, it was exquisite!! (Oh my gosh I am getting hungry just thinking about it!!) The staff is always so incredibly friendly and even though the place is ALWAYS packed, they always seem to find a great seat !  If I could give 6 stars, I would! =)

I go to order mine and conveniently they ask for my id.  First of all my husband and I are 35 years old.   The fact that he wasn't asked was completely illegal.  The food isn't worth the cost. Did not tast like bisque at all. Tasted like boiled crab water. Bread was dry and stale. Seafood pasta was good. Seafood platter, not. Dont think I'll be going back. I give up on this place.

_2ixo6rG6D1-fDhPc166YA.text: Pappadeauxs is always a good idea! As always we started with drinks, we had their top shelf margarita on the rocks which is more tart than sweet and exactly how I like it! The hubby ordered the Blackened Mississippi Catfish Opelousas which was fantastic we got the oysters fried instead of blackened, everything was perfectly cooked. I ordered the salmon and scallops with lump crab, the server informed us that the salmon is normally served medium rare, I opted to have it cooked medium and it was one of the best pieces of salmon I've ever had. The salmon was delicate and tender, and the lemon butter sauce was a perfect addition to the dish.  Our server was very kind and attentive..service was prompt. We sat inside with romantic mood lighting and a corner table with a view of the outside garden. When the weather is nice I suggest that you sit outside, the garden area is beautiful. Also, if your looking for a more casual experience the bar is always nice and serves the full menu.. and watching them make their classic cocktails is always a treat! I can't wait until my next visit.

jWlUcW-ywLrmNsgKFtC_yg.text: Can't believe I have never reviewed Pappadeaux. I have probably been to this location three times but guess it has been some time ago.  The vibe and decor at Pappadeaux is on point. The staff have always been friendly and you can tell staff have been well trained.  As for the grub, my family has always loved everything we have had from here. No complaints at all. For my most recent visit, I knocked out their Fish PO Boy with fries and salad. Or probably more accurate is stating I knocked out some of it. The damn thing was huge, like easily two meals huge. There is nothing to the meal I could complain about. The side bread was so warm with plenty of butter to lather on it.  The side salad with ranch was great. It came with the perfect portion of ranch mixed in. Obviously the real gem was the PO Boy. The bread, the fish, the sauce, was just perfect. Loved it all. Loved it on day one and day two as leftovers.  This guy is a Pappadeaux fan for sure.  Side tip though....Keep your car and valuables locked up. There are a couple shady extended stay hotels near by and can guarantee one or two of the hotel guests have done a minute of jail time. Just saying.

wqrX1I__zEQRpwcfrgi-OQ.text: Got a couple of things:   1st: interesting that on their own website,  I was only given an option to leave a POSITIVE EXPERIENCE. Even if they don't want to leave "negative experience" option, can't there be a simple slot for "My Dining Experience"?  There should be.   * I ordered a Bloody Mary. If I wanted the fanciest glass in town, if I were on Instagram, I'd be in great shape. Otherwise, what a colossal waste of someone's art direction. BFD, tall skinny glass.   3rd, the shrimp gumbo was delicious, had great flavor, but served nowhere near hot enough. The shrimp was stringy. Soup was $9. They're not giving anything away.  Make it good.  And hot. Hotter.   If I had to guess it wasn't being HELD hot enough but it also might have sat while my bartender/waiter did other things. I mean , how would he know, at the bar that my order was ready?  Answer: he wouldn't.  The temperature of my soup was 125 max. Should be higher, 160...?  I counted 32 people working this day as servers and kitchen helpers on the floor. Question: are you telling me that no one could've brought out my soup?  The bartender who took the order was  THE ONLY ONE WHO COULD BRING  ME MY SOUP?  Which probably sat there, cooling, to my detriment, waiting for THE ONE PERSON...  * I saw 3 bartenders attempt to draft a beer. They not only had no idea, they poured at least 2-3 schooners down the drain for each one sold. It might have been more and probably was; it was certainly not less.   * See photo. Lemon wheels labeled a week old. Is that Legal?  I don't  know. But fresh?  No. And Ugh.   Look,  Pappadeaux'st is -- IS -- way better than Red Herring, errr, I mean Red Lobster. But that place is HORRIBLE. So, this place is better than horrible.

zMbNiBWTmIXirE744bpTaw.text: So let me start by saying our server was absolutely amazing. She was so on point with everything. Kept checking on us almost every five minutes. She's great at recognizing facial cues. Her name was naundee j. If the managers are reading she needs a raise she was fabulous. Now with that being said the kitchen could use some help. For apps we ordered the fondue which would have been good if it had been hot. It was lukewarm when it came out. Not the greatest. The. After that is when it gets scary. We waited AN HOUR!!!!!! For our main course to come out. A freaking hour!! That is ridiculous!!! We kept seeing people who had come in long after we did get their food which is absolutely absurd. It was our servers fault she would constantly go back and check if it was ready and would always apologize. I felt bad for her because I'm sure we got flustered with her. The manager on duty had come by maybe 40 minutes into us waiting and said she would go check what was going on and by that point we were ready to leave. Only reason we stayed was because of our server. She was just to sweet. Kept asking if she could get us some soup or salad while we waited. The food came and oddly enough it wasn't even hot. Again lukewarm. So needless to say we won't be going back.

We order the calamari app and it was fantastic.   The entree is where they struggled.  We both ordered the shrimp and grits.  The shrimp was tough due to being over cooked.  It tasted like rubber.   Very disappointing as we had a wonderful experience at the Dallas location.  Unfortunately, the Phoenix restaurants food quality has gone down hill.

Tk7uD0lrUnwCvPBIWNEmmg.text: I remember coming here often with my dad when I lived in the West valley. Haven't been in at least 5-6 years. Food was decent but service needs serious improvement. We had a group of 8 and our tab was over $500 and only had one server. She didn't know the menu well enough to answer our questions. We ordered appetizers, entrees, and desserts. I don't think we ever had a busser come by once. So there was empty dirty dishes that just sat there the whole wall. I can see maybe how everything was on the server and she was just busy. But overhearing the table of another 6-8 people next to us and how their orders were lost makes me believe this was our servers first serving job.  Last thing I didn't notice until after.  Husband and I ordered Arnold palmers for our drinks. It was never disclosed refills were NOT free. If we knew that, we probably would have stuck to waters. Overall bad bad experience and don't plan on going back anytime soon.

JIiTqZcXD6UVFICEaGd9sQ.text: We went last night. The alligator is amazing if you have some extra cash definitely  splurge on it. I loved the atmosphere out side but inside it was a bit dark hard to really see the menu. That's my only gripe though. Our waitress was an absolute  peach. A literal doll I wish I remembered  her name. She recommended an amazing drink for me and the Mahi Mahi for my fiance. She was spot on with both. I loved the scallops juicy and not chewy. The manager came over to our table and chatted with us as well she was a sweety to. I'm excited for an occasion to go back!

UdKdQ-65QbAut7yuxS4ipQ.text: Consistently excellent Cajun seafood and meats. I've been there about 12 times. The dinner salad is made at the table now and tastes crisp and fresh. Hot homemade bread served at table. The seafood is prepared to perfection and if dissatisfied no fuss returning it. I have not had any problems in that regard. The halibut is fabulous. Don't forget dessert if you're still hungry. Get there early. For lunch before 11 AM. For dinner before 5 PM if possible. There is always a wait in the evening.  Downside: acoustics are poor. If you plan to visit, by 6 PM it's hard to hear your guests.  Give it a try. Highly recommended. I don't know of any other place in Phoenix that serves comparable food selections like Pappydeauxs.

x_ZNeRKTLfcmVCWcAIqAFQ.text: Last time I came here 6 months ago I swore it would be a long time before I returned due to poor service, and it was.  A friend of mine in from out of town who used to go here with me a few years back asked to please come here.  So, i buckled. Once again the service was horrible and the prices have gone through the roof!  They've now removed my favorite menu item, which is the Mediterranean calamari, so I find no reason to return.  Whoever, rated this establishment with only 2 $$ needs to update to at least 3 $$$.

zARyfji-mw1Ir0IBWOefXA.text: I was so excited to have dinner at this place.  So many of my friends  have mentioned how the food was so amazing. If you know me I'm hard to please but  this place was amazing....  It feels like you have  timed-lapse back to New Orleans before Katrina. This place has a cottage look to it.... with seating all around and water sprinkler everywhere.    As we walked in..... an adorable blond hair waitress smiled and asked me how many?  I said "two"......DID SHE SAY AN HOUR WAIT!!  I'M STARVING I don't have an hour to give. I asked the waitress can we sit at the bar she said "Of course if you could find a seat"....   Aghhhhh.... this place is crowded but as I turned around two seats were available. I'm running now right towards the seats!   Hooray.....  The menu was amazing every fried foods item that you can imagine.... I don't think I have ever seen so many ways to fry shrimp. LoL   I ordered the fried lump crab cakes and my hubby ordered the gritts and shrimp!  WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW!!!  It was the best crab cake I ever had and the shrimp with gritts was amazing. I HATE gritts but this buttery cloud taste amazing. I think I'm crying.    Let's not talk about the trio dessert..... OMG!!! Banana pudding, pecan pie and creme brule....  Now we known for seafood this delicious in Phoenix isn't cheap. It's not super expensive but two meals, with no drinks (non alcohol) and one dessert ran us $90 without tip. So if you plan on getting an lobster bring a credit card. They start at $45.00 but to some people its worth it. I did!!!!!   I'll be here again very soon..... I'm tearing again.... lol

The resteraunt is huge and I do recommend reservations in case they are busy (weekends and holidays).

eeKgr53x-QQAHedJhR3y2Q.text: Love this little Louisiana Fish House ... it rocks you like a Hurricane ... huge menu with plenty of great choices ... a can't miss place for me in Arizona .. try the Captains Hurricane.. the Cajun Pasta and Gumbo are my favs

Js0dIGl0GsbohnEZwiur0g.text: Have been coming to this restaurant for the past 10 years and have always had great food and service . But this time was horrible! Me and wife wife usually seat at the bar for dinner and have great time. We went tonight and Bartender/waiter didn't know what they were doing . No silverware asked twice then were provided. Waited 10 minutes before asked for the order and waited 20 min just to get the appetizer . One of the appetizers were had to be send back . The bartenders Dominic and cierra  had no energy , and enthusiasm and provided horrible service no attention to detail.

Qp-v-D5SCE5cSRqm6zGWnw.text: Sat at the busy bar and ordered dinner.  Service was just passable.  Food was good, but expensive.

QGscxH6crOivyfIEfwbJ3A.text: Love it here the more I come. Got the Alligator Nuggets for Appetizers and I still Love them, especially with the sauce! Then I had the Tilapia & Shrimp Seafood Plate. With 1 Patron Perfect Margarita on the Rocks. Everything to me was very close to perfection. The Margarita was kindof strong but I like it that way! Paid same amount for same Margarita at dave and busters but was worth it here. I forgot my server's name but he was awesome! He was tall, Caucasian ( I think ) and from New Orleans. Pricey Place but with the Overall quality of the atmosphere and food, it is an expected and worth it experience in my opinion. Not use to seafood or luxury meals and I loved this place the first time i came 4 years ago and I loved it Yesterday too!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh and Crispy Alligator Nuggets! The sauce takes it to another level of Awesome!

hty9O4u1HRzfMfRUtWbFUQ.text: Marcus was our waiter and he was seriously the best! Our first time there and will definitely be back. He was so knowledgeable about EVERYTHING on the menu!

DzNcKW1iIZ2vKNTHf3Icow.text: I usually choose this restaurant for my birthday dinner. Their food is absolutely delicious! Tonight they did not disappoint. We started with the crab and spinach dip. I had the Pasta New Orleans which is fettuccini noodles in a pink Cajun creme sauce with lump crab, grilled shrimp, mushrooms and tomatoes. My husband had Mississippi Catfish Opelasoosas which was Cajun grilled catfish with lump crab, mussels and shrimp with a creme sauce and dirty rice. Their dirty rice is amazing! We both took left overs home and we are pretty big eaters. We both got a cocktail and my husband got a Caesar salad. The total was ~$106 before gratuity. The service was great. I loved the atmosphere, such a beautiful patio. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful but can be pretty loud. There is usually live music on the patio on the weekends too. Also they take reservations!

wt7ZOOTeH_g6rNEW0b0-2A.text: Even though it was really super busy and even those very very loud the food was very very good and I had a really good time with my husband on a date and it was very nice to have some down-home south'N N'ORLNs ...

WipkQj5nPuh4x1nO3q1OMQ.text: Our waiter Marcus was amazing. Worth the 45 min drive.  Save yourself time and make reservations

wdbPjw49BXA6yQKP-UcgiA.text: Sat at the bar on a Thursday night. I had a swamp thing and my girlfriend had a beer. The swamp thing is one of my favorite beverages. We ordered the giant shrimp and grits and the salmon Alexander. My shrimp and grits were fantastic but the side of spinach was cold. Her salmon dish was also good by the dirty rice was cold.

-EJw8gdPIIzo18sj7hKRSg.text: Though it is a wonderful venue, I can't lie about the overall quality of the food. Caveat: the Oysters are WONDERFUL (and probably the best thing about the food, but, really you can't fuck oysters up too much if they are fresh shucked...). I also admit, the service was very good, maybe I would add another star for that EXCEPT that the rest of the menu is just plain farce. Poop. Supposed classic dishes like crayfish ettoufee, poop. Crabcakes, poop. I watched my father suffer through a horrible dish of frozen mussels thinking it was good because he didn't know any better. The prices are not nearly worth it. I would go back for a cold beer and oysters, but not for anything else.

NbevKOwlHEXTvNW4bYyBww.text: Love this place.  Food is awesome and authentic.  Can be a bit loud but really enjoy this place, the food and the service.

JKGyj9jPUWQayEhGfJGAdQ.text: Picked up a shrimp and catfish po boy and for $20, I wasn't impressed at all. I never had a po boy with cocktail and tartar sauce but you needed both to get any flavor out of the sandwich. The shrimp and catfish on their own were lacking, like they didn't season anything. And no tomatoes either! Come on. I would hope their other food tastes better if I go back.

LNLkweQUbxktqjWaP23lyQ.text: My girlfriend and I come here every so often, generally the server is decent and the food is just decent as well. But this specific time I came to Pappadeaux my server was a very nice girl named Jada, she made me feel like she actually cares about the tables she was serving, without interrupting too often, she was very polite and on top of everything. An excellent waitress. Also the manager, Arizania, was very polite too. The food on this day was also very good to add, but without the waitress I wouldn't have bothered to write a review.

eHy9qjljwqLzmm8d98N3mA.text: Being someone that spent a lot of time in New Orleans, it's hard for me to give this place any more than 3 stars. Their food is "OK" but way over priced.  The gumbo is not very gumbo like and their PoBoys need "more"  The drinks, however, will knock you out of your shoes! The bartenders are super friendly too!  I totally miss the Gulf Coast Oyster special since the oil spill....3.95 a dozen!  Not any more :( Ahh well. Life goes on.  I can't really suggest heading into Pappa for your seafood fix. There are better places in the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Poboy

7BI22MVyd3_5Q3w4w7NcJg.text: My husband swears by this place as he loves Cajun food.Unfortunately our 12 year old daughter had the crab cakes served straight up in a crab shel.That night she was violently ill! Pain continued along with unsettled stomach resulting in doctor visit as well as labs ordered( imagine what type of lab orders..not blood orders)! Very upsetting and not only did we pay over $100.00 for lunch, we paid for much more.Hoping nobody else experiences food poisoning. ...Needless to say if the husband wants Cajun we will have to go to New Orleans! I've never used Yelp, but felt this was important!

pNmUedXsSxcP-evXh-zLzA.text: I love this place I go for my birthday every year. Their creme brulee is to die for. The salmon is off the hook and I love all their appetizer.;m  The one thing I not a fan of is their clam chowder it wasn't up to my standards. Love their lobster bisque though and would recommend that. The fried stuff is a little heavy but my husband loves it so there a little of everything.

MA5XbUZAYxCLchhakPkyUA.text: 5 Stars is saying a lot about the quality of your dining experience at Pappadeaux.  -I've been here probably over five times since I've lived in AZ and every experience is top notch!  Our server was really chill, laid back and even though very busy always checked to see if we needed anything. Most people these days even if the place is dead will not even check on you unless they are looking to drop off the bill.   -The food is bomb, I had Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp wrapped in bacon over dirty rice (recommended).  Atmosphere is fun and poppin all on a Sunday at that! I was really surprised.   -Beast Seafood in AZ hands down for the reasons above, I would definitely check it out if your in town and want some good food and southern hospitality in the desert.   5 STARS

QBlTbE3kQ9IP6B-g9IekBQ.text: Amazing service I had at Pappadeaux was served up by our server Jada! She is personable and friend and quick on her toes to provide excellent service! The food was amazing and probably one of the best experiences I have had in awhile. I will be coming back soon for another meal!

eSW6TXqUqPpEm6Rk4GLENg.text: Our first time dining here, our waiter seemed visibly disgruntled that we only ordered a couple of cocktails, an appetizer and soup. We just wanted to check it out.  Thinking it was just a fluke, we decided to go back again a few months later, craving seafood and a taste of the south. After being seated we noticed a tray of dirty dishes in front of our table, unattended to, and waited 10 minutes before being greeted, but were happy to finally be able to order cocktails. We waited another five minutes for water to arrive at the table via server assistant, all the while (since being seated) staring at the tray of dirty dishes from another table being unattended to. After another ten minutes of waiting for cocktails we thought we should maybe get up and leave. As we were talking about this, our waiter arrived with our drinks.  He mentioned the bar was backed up (yet, never came by our table the entire time we were waiting to let us know). We let him know we were unhappy with the wait and were just about to leave, but we decided to stay and order: crab claws and boudin as appetizers, beef filet and mahi mahi as entrees.  We waited another 25 minutes for our appetizers and a chance to order another cocktail (our waiter again didn't stop by the table).  We got a water refill by the server assistant though. You would think at this point a manager would have stopped by to check on us, but no.   The crab claws were tasty.  The boudin, when cut open, smelled and tasted rancid however.  We were actually grossed out. When the waiter came back to ask how the food was, thankfully just a couple of minutes later, us being already irate, my date answered "this boudin tastes like shit".  The waiter apologized and said that he would send a manager over to take the dish away.  Really?  Can't you just get the dish away from us?  Ten minutes past as we tried to ignore a dish we didn't like the smell of and eat our crab claws. Just then, the tray of dirty dishes in front of us was cleared. Just after, the manager arrived.  Instead of having the dish taken away immediately, she held it up in front our faces, asking what we didn't like about the boudin. We mentioned the "boudin" smelled, and then... she tried to correct our pronunciation of "boudin", and mentioned some tasting notes about the dish. My partner  replied, in more colorful words, that he was born and raised in New Orleans, and that that dish was not "boudin". She then apologized , said she would take the dish off of our check, and left with the dish. No mention of the long wait times or dirty dishes came up from her.   Our entrees arrived. My mahi mahi was actually delicious, as was the filet.  Our waiter was attentive in checking back on us.  The dessert tray came around, and we decided on a fudge brownie. When the brownie came out, in a reasonable time, our entree dishes and silverware were still on the table. Instead of clearing our last course and then giving us our dessert, we had to push our dirty dishes aside before they put the brownie in front us, along with new forks and spoons... then took our dirty dishes.   We then asked for our check, looked it over and paid promptly. We couldn't help but notice though that there was no follow up visit from the manager or even an offer for dessert on the house, considering the experience. We left a 20% tip anyways. On the way out, no management or any other staff said good bye to us.  Why two stars instead of one?  You can thank the mahi mahi and filet.  Why am I so persnickety about this experience?  Because if I'm going to spend $200 on a dinner, regardless of the dining environment, I expect at the least good service, without disagreeing and negligent management.  So close to our house, but we choose to spend a couple of franklins on dinner somewhere far from here.

k4Yh_z1m1c92Cr4iOCM0Lg.text: Wish we had one in california. everyone's dish was amazing. I had the crispy salmon with scallop, shrimp and crab meat and talk about seafood overload, but in a good way. each savory bite melted in my mouth and although i wanted to eat it all up I was full by the time I was halfway done with my meal. that combined with the voodoo cocktail and brownie dessert made my night. Nichole was super awesome and very patient with my friends and I.

GczX2InEQDnzBBNhYUO33Q.text: The best very,, always stop by when we are in Abq.NM. . the happy hour is great,,  especially the po boy..  we love the fresh  oysters.. Wish we had one closer to us in  Az..  this would be my go to place if I lived there,, would give a 6 rating if i could.. being from Louisiana i know good cajun food,, this is the best!!

t6w2IULOBqRM1zXoddA7cA.text: Pappadeaux is always a "yes" for me. Came here most recently on my birthday with my husband and infant son.... 4:30pm on a Saturday which was early enough to beat the rush, so there wasn't a wait when we got there. We were seated promptly and our waitress was pleasant and prompt with our menu and drinks. She told me they were out of the Crab claws that came with the Alaskan Halibut Piccata entree I wanted and what the substitution would be. I was ok with the substitution and ordered anyway. Once my food arrived the substitution Jumbo lump crabmeat was a joke, I could barely see any. I told the waitress. She took it back to the kitchen and the manager came over. The manager said she'd make sure they corrected the issue and took 50% off my check and gave me a free birthday desert. The food came back to my table and was fixed with the added  crab meat that was enough to see and taste. The Bayou cake was everything. They made an unpleasant substitution issue better. I will always have a soft spot in my heart for Pappadeaux and will definitely return. The manager Arizonnia was gracious and kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday desserts; bayou cake and Tuttle fudge brownie

iwcQ9U8w5BVsg4P9mhxFCw.text: The epitome of a 4-star restaurant.  Very good food, very large portions, lots of menu options. service was friendly, but not totally unrushed. Try the fried alligator and cajun bloody mary. Also, shrimp is delicious  Food was somewhat overpriced. Wait times are long on Friday nights.

mmiSQ_UtTETmtjmx6m2eHQ.text: Great food and service.  Only draw back is the dining area is huge and loud so it makes it very difficult to have conversation.

QX6t2fMBWWq48j7k690DIQ.text: Delicious food, overall great experience. Always greeted with a smile walking in the door. While the kitchen can lag when the restaurant fills up, it is always worth the wait for great food.

yVBhLMUBKjJGgnj0tmMnAA.text: I highly recommend this restaurant!!! Excellent food and excellent service!!! A bit pricey but worth it!!

RUY9mAeuUyfE0Xj9f8-G6A.text: Well worth the drive from Chandler... there have been many who have tired to duplicate but this is the closest to NOLA food there is here in the valley.  The atmosphere is great, the staff is always prompt and polite... and if you sign up for the email club you get a comp dessert for your birthday..get here

hoLwM1kiBh_4GLo3PMoRQQ.text: I've eaten at this restaurant in Phoenix twice now. Last night, a Saturday night, was incredibly busy and as many others have mentioned, it is extremely loud! We were a party of four and could almost not even communicate with each other.

DZPQ9KAA2xPuHY3yH2sI7Q.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! The Mediterranean calamari and coconut shrimp are the best appetizers! Their lobster is phenomenal, the best I've had. I would recommend creme brulee for dessert! Cocktail of choice is the Frenchmans spritzer...or something like that ;) the ambiance is beautiful, there is often live music on the patio which is always the best! I'd highly recommend a reservation, otherwise you will wait 2 hours...worth the wait!

JLJP_pPsWjZW_w-HFSigLQ.text: I'll start off by saying I don't like expensive, crowded restaurants where we have a long wait for a table so right off the top I was a bit annoyed. And the only place they could seat us was out side in Phoenix in nearly 100 degree heat ... again not something I wanted or enjoy.  But all was corrected once our meals arrived. There were nine of us and everyone got a very different entree...not one would I have been unhappy being served.   The Mixed Seafood Grill looked amazing, the lobster tails delicious,  salads were huge and piled high with salmon and lobster. Several melt in your mouth fried platters and creole favorites left nothing lacking.   Overpriced maybe, but some of the best seafood I've had for a long time. And this was land locked Phoenix which seems funny since we live steps from the ocean in southern California.

L4QM0M4fU4bT2xpk_Kbk5Q.text: Love this place! Had the Moroccan Salmon and the Sea Bass. Outstanding! This place ranks up there with Emeril's New Orleans Fish House.  Make sure to ask for Johnny C. to be your server.  He was the best!  Made great suggestions and was very attentive.

ydqRHq-GC5IIky7FFf6oHw.text: Good basic Cajun without too much spiciness. Had shrimp with cheese grits and was not disappointed. Although certainly not a Paul Prudhomme type of Cajun meal it was enjoyable.

TT8SSoLxq3eQuIC9zfVh6Q.text: MIA was the best the Manager I forgot her name was very kind and grateful.. the food was amazing literally all of the staff was kind and funny and sweet thank you MIA you made my experience amazing.

Wagyn6nRczEwNy9Tk2jGmw.text: I have been to Pappadeaux a couple times, but yesterday for lunch was the most recent.  My dad & bro like to eat lunch early to beat the "lunch crowd" so when we got there around 11:15 it was pretty dead, probably only about 10 other parties there. Sounds like a lot but this place is huge inside.  I don't remember her name but our server was a sweet girl & always made sure our glasses were full. And when I couldn't finish my meal she offered to box it up & even threw in an entire loaf of bread, nice!  My dad & bro are one in the same & ordered the blackened catfish with broccoli instead of rice & I ordered the mardi gras pasta. I sampled the catfish & it was delicious, literally melts in your mouth. My pasta dish was very good but also very rich/filling. I ate about a third of it & took the rest home for hubby. He loved it! If it wasn't lunch time & I wasn't so full already, I would have ordered dessert. Their bread pudding & creme brulee are amazing!!  If you have never been to Pappadeaux you must try it, you won't regret it.

dLYhV_ae7lvi4v2jWlQ-Sw.text: Very nice and beautiful restaurant, prices are very nice $$$ not a cheap restaurant but not really hight end either. We used to eat weekly,  and so many time ordered  oyster found some dead for many day, and lobster frozen undercooked but management seem to be  fine with this but not us. We asked our waitress less salt but she answered that is our concep, ok then salt and fat are the most killer for human immune system and blood pressure, we care about it and pay $$$ for fresh & healthy food but not getting weak with all the heath issue. Thanks for nice concept but we will skip Papadeaux even we love the ambiance and decor. A New manager recommend.

c2BOsHh2Fpr8H4zaP4Z5KA.text: If you like seafood this is a must place to eat when your in Arizona going back before I leave here We ate well  and you won't break the bank Dang this shit is Real Good

doG0dyWYPSKLk2KSiEUuQQ.text: We went here for father's day. The place wasn't too busy when we arrived, about a 20 minute wait so we took seats at the bar which was open. It was nice to see that the bar offered full service and had the wait been longer we might have entertained the though of sitting at the bar but there is limited space and we weren't sure how big the servings were, the plates, etc. So we grabbed a few beers and waited. They do have Turbodog on tap which I had never heard of before then. The bartender offered me a sample and I really enjoyed it. We weren't up at the bar long and our pager went off. We had to cash out there which is customary and we headed to our seat.  Our waitress was very friendly. We already had beers so she didn't need to get us drinks and we already knew what we wanted for appetizers so we ordered right away the and appetizers came out pretty quickly. We had the oysters Baton Rouge were fantastic to be honest with you. No complaints at all there.   For our main dishes I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette and Brandi ordered the Crawfish Platter which includes fried crawfish and crawfish etouffee. Each dish was 23.95 and neither dish was worth it. The jumbo shrimp was flavorless. All you could taste was the bacon. You could have served me straight bacon for 5 bucks and it would have tasted the same. The jalapeno rice that came with it was good though. the fried portion of the crawfish platter was plentiful and very good but the etouffee was bland.   On top of that we never got any bread until the meal came out and here's the kicker on that. It took an HOUR for the meal to come out. Keep in mind they weren't even really that busy. We had 3 tables sit down around us afterwards and all three got their food before us. And the thing is the waitress was oblivious. We had to track her down in order to inquire about our food. I feel it is part of her responsibility to know that we are sitting there for an hour without food. She said she would get a manager right on it. and when we did get the food it was brought by a manager to us but he never once acknowledged us or said he was sorry for the wait or anything. Didn't ask if we needed anything else either. Came, dropped our food off and split. To be honest with you I expected the food to be cold as if it was sitting somewhere forgotten about but it wasn't. Seemed fresh which makes me think the order never was put in and when it was they made it immediately.   For me to go to a place to eat and drop 100 bucks I expect better food than what I got and I definitely expect better service.   I was extremely disappointed in this visit.

iZTbA9WLhS7fvGjgZ4dxJQ.text: Great seafood and an enjoyable atmoshpere! It's always packed and they are still timely with seating, order taking and refills. Crab cakes are a must!

umPcg82wqMD64T3Jl8NBYw.text: The food here is great for a franchise chain, and great service too.  But the prices are way too high.  I mean $8 for soup, not a bowl, but tiny 6 ounce cup.  Drinks are great but at $12 a pop you might want to stick a bottle of rum in your pocket.  The frog legs are good, but again expensive.  Try the happy hour for a better deal.

2UX9cZ--NM3kjZcsyAcJUA.text: My favorite place in Phoenix ...food never fails and the Swamp Thing cocktail is amazing!

XTp8DWb7_W9aKJ2SbkBdMg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE.   Make reservations or call and get your name on the list at least one hour early....the wait is often 1-2 hours.  Yes it is a chain.  WHO CARES.  The quality is always top notch.  The service is great.  The fish is ultra super fresh 10,000 (if you end anything with 10,000 it means it is the best.)  Most fish are flown in only in season.  Right now you can get a lb of crawfish or a dozen oysters on the half shell for $3.95 (Wednesday nights it he best because fresh shell fish come in that morning.)  PS- Awesome and economic happy hour.

Vs8hB47_0IQ_9i9YACKRKw.text: I have found a new favorite restaurant.  If there is one place on my reviews where I could go for a special occasion - this would be it.  To start - the ambience...  You feel immersed in New Orleans, from the moderately lit dining hall, gaslit lamps, waiters in black pants and white aprons and wonderful music.  The food was absolutely fantistic.  I had the Crawfish Trio, which was a mix of Crawfish Etoufee, Fried Crawfish and Sauteed Crawfish.  The etoufee had a rich, dark, buttery roux and was smothered over dirty rice.    The sauteed crawdad was a pleasant surprise.  I expected a crawdad sauteed in butter, but instead it was sauteed in a spicy cream sauce.  They also served the dinner with a loaf of fresh bread baked in-house.    If you've been to Disneyland's "Blue Bayou", this place reminds you a little of that restaurant.  The shelfish/seafood selection is EXTENSIVE.  Like it and Loved It!  Go to this place and you will not be disappointed.  I heard they have several locations throughout the US.   When are they coming to California?!

BfitI79eRde4HCTbJpKmoQ.text: I had the coconut shrimp several years ago and wanted to take my family. The shrimp did not disappoint, including the lovely Asian slaw mix that is used as a garnish. When our meal arrived, however, it was rather disappointing. The fried shrimp was good, but not special.  The catfish had a nice breading, however there was little flavor. The big surprise though was the French fries. The majority of them were cold. There were a few warm fries mixed in, leading us to believe that the kitchen was aware of the situation. I don't really think we will be back again. It was an ok meal for a good meal price.

_6IaXM5ESoQXTU9W1YrgSQ.text: Hands down the best Seafood and Cajun food in all of Phoenix and the surrounding cities! A must try!

bIJhDjoKfXJQgW0S2qVDHA.text: When I want to get my fix for oysters on the half I come here...you can't beat the price!!  Usually between $4 and $6 a dozen depending on specials they have going on.   They also have one of my favorite happy hours with some limited drink specials but some nice food specials served at the bar.  When I am looking to order a meal I have to say my favorite on the menu is the shrimp brochette (large shrimp stuffed with jalapenos and jack cheese wrapped in bacon and grilled).  I while not bad, opt out of the dirty rice that is served with this dish and have them sub with asparagus or the steamed veggies.   I have had a few other things from the menu like the mixed grill and their cedar plank salmon, and once did the all you can eat lobster special they were running once.   Honestly I have yet to be disapointed by most Pappadeaux's I visit (except the one that was out of oysters).

jLbI9lBqrt2jInbjEUe6Pw.text: I absolutely love this place! I was here for a company get together and was so impressed with the quality of food and service. I ordered the sea bass and it was absolutely to die for! I have heard great things about this restaurant and I'm glad I finally got to try it. I would recommend this place to everyone! I can not wait to go back and try some more! I'm not too sure what the cost is like because my meal was pre ordered for me.

jVUNby2EErIWwEZSFGYRGQ.text: Great restaurant! !! I absolutely love this place.  I just graduated from Grand Canyon University with my Master's degree and wanted to celebrate.  My family and I went here for the first time.  My dad fell in love with the Lobster tail, Mom loved the steak, and I loved all the sea food. Great service,  justified price, and the dessert is fantastic! !.

mYsHOotDtb_T5swfvJ5CUQ.text: Don't come often but every time we do the food is always great!  Definitely get the Mediterranean calamari!  Personally can't get enough of the crawfish etouffee.  Service is always great, the waitstaff definitely know the menu.

V609-R_BGuicfX39nIeFrg.text: My sister and I went to Pappadeaux's for a sisterly dinner a few nights ago and had a good time.   For apps we ordered fried alligator and fried frogs legs. I've had alligator before so the fried alligator was very tasty! The fried frogs legs... well that gets a "meh" from the both of us. But the fried alligator pretty much set the bar for everything else.  My entre was fried oysters and fried catfish with a baked potato. It was a lot of food and we did end up getting baggies for our left overs. Our bad for filling up on the apps and warm bread.  OH yesh, you get fresh bread and butter along with your drinks. :) Awesome.  We did order dessert.. and those were very very delicious!  My overall exp' with this place was great. Our waitress was good. She was very knowledgeable and did not act condescending with all of my questions.   The atmosphere was good.. that place has good vibes!  I really don't have anything negative to say other than maybe the pricey food, but that's really it. And what we spent for 2 people, including tip, was about $100.00.   My sister would say some of the food was salty.   Would I eat here again? Yes. But I'd probably say no to the bread so I can thoroughly enjoy my entre, lol.

-h4qJRbUVSHNXO1bwHKAdw.text: Ok. Nice entrance. Needs to have an ambiance update! Someone call Gordon Ramsey STAT. Established in 1986, and every bit of carpet and mirrored walls to prove it. Food, Lobster bisque was good. Seems more of a place for drinks though. The waitress messed up our order, so we weren't too impressed. A bit pricey too. Not going to go back.

gdHUm8qBzsRzcANcZezgfA.text: Ya know, I just kinda get Pappadeaux. Is it exquisite? No. Is it fancy? No. Is it really really good and consistent? Yes. The food is always spot on. It is as fresh as it can be in Phoenix. I have yet to find anyplace as consistently good as Pappadeaux. It is not cheap but quality seafood never is. Party of 5 with 1 child 300.00 with gratuity. We ate really well. My two favorites are Shrimp Po Boy and Shrimp Etouffe for meals. Alligator is very very good, so is the lobster bisque and the oysters on the half shell. I don't know how else to say it other than I personally totally get it and I love the fact that I do.

mL7s47rsmn25kmTzxRXFsA.text: Ahi tuna appetizer was delicious as were the cocktails. Our waitress was very friendly. Dinner portions are huge, even split are more than enough for two people. Will definitely be back.

fUG-gVz05JGdfSjPDeRnoQ.text: WOW, I want to go back with some of the 5 star rate people and order what they do as I would have been better off at McD's and saved about $80.00. The only good thing about that place was our waiter who was steller in light of terrible food

wqHan0wyXJdtjVSZsbYgqw.text: Absolutely fell in love with this place!! Food is amazing!!! The service is too! Hubby & I had our Valentine dinner here and we loved it! Can't wait to go again & take my parents!  The staff is amazing our server was very very kind and attentive he recommended food and he brought us a free desert!

HMkPkOkSehKBIsdkUNn5bg.text: I am not a huge seafood eater yet. Just recently started eating fish, as long as it doesn't have a fishy taste. Well I didn't want to order a 35 dollar plate I didn't like so I got a chicken chopped salad. It was good but I'm always bummed when I get a salad with romaine or iceberg lettuce. I think it's pretty cheap and would much rather eat spinach or kale, leafy greens. The praline cheesecake was so bomb and I couldn't stop eating that.   The service was pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Grilled Shrimp &amp; Andouille Sausage pasta

Hq7DirHAb6LA2jRtI8DvyQ.text: Excellent except expensive.  People jumping out of line and grabbing open tables was common on the patio. Pissed me off, since wife, son and I waited about an hour and then watched as some smug entitled asshats grabbed a table before it was cleared.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Zc1vd6VcYYsaSWbNBNLciw.text: So I absolutely love this place! To be honest I think the best thing on their menu is the trout. It's absolutely amazing and cooked to perfection. But I would like to give a special shout out to a woman who works at the bar named Susan. This is the type of person that always remembers your name and always remembers what you drink and shows that she truly cares about her customers. Even if the food we're not that good you would go back to this place for that kind of person. She is an incredible human being and working for a great place. Yay Susan Suuuuuuuuuuuusaaaaaaaaaan!!!!

U4DOZPqlYS3RM8fiN6P-yw.text: Fantastic shrimp! Who would think great shrimp in Phoenix? Great atmosphere with excellent service!! Definitely worth the price!

Vgmksx58mQo9-6lfUWZxPg.text: Went here for the first time and it was amazing, first time trying alligator, oysters and octopus and loved it all. Our server was also great, didn't constantly bother us but still very attentive. Can't wait to come back :)

zBRUPorlpewpNeH0-a2E6A.text: Amazing! The food was delicious, atmosphere was nice and the waiter was great. Can't wait to go back!

z2Vr5uPeJWvvXuvtJaAaCg.text: This place knows seafood, but if you don't want to wait go in the afternoon it is packed in the evening.  We really enjoyed the food I had the sea bass and it melted in my mouth like butter. I also had the oysters, these things were huge. My 2 young daughters tried them and loved it.  My wife got the ribeye which was huge and very tasty.  The atmosphere is nice, waiting isn't that bad they have a nice  patio and live music so it's bearable.  The only downfall is the table seating inside is too close to the table next to you. It's like they want to get as many into every spot they can.  Overall the food and service were great.

iK6-NoDH_wAFVDTLChLXHQ.text: Delicious. The Texas red fish never misses. The crab cakes are always awesome. I've been here Numerous times and the service and staff have always been great.
