AyKekmSbNPqJfKsBA4kEZg.text: I love this place. I  use to go to the one in chicagoz/ oak brook. I'm glad there is one here in AZ. The food is good portions ate large. My meal was good. I will definitely go back .

V8BoSv6QQNB7fe2xAkMXmQ.text: I love the concept of this place however, the delivery never comes through. Service is consistently slow. Don't come here unless you have two hours to eat. Half of that time is waiting for somebody to come to your table. The food comes out overly greasy and looks better than it tastes. For the experience, it is way overpriced. To be honest, I am surprised they stayed in business as long as they have. It has more to do with the lack of seafood restaurants in Phoenix than With the quality of their food.

HaxpMOucc6iXaWu-L84d-g.text: Everything was fresh,  The Cocnut Shrimp was very good although are table had 3 orders sold 1 was over cooked. Crab cakes had good flavor they are a little thick but good. Lobster was FRESH and cooked to perfection.  Shrimp Cocktail was delicious. we had fun, drinks stayed full with out asking for more we were a large party we had to servers which made it nice. The place was a bit dark. I would go back portions are large

3meHB5jFCXiG2QxiEJgzvg.text: Wonderful seafood restaurant with great food.  They have fresh fish flown in daily.  I had the Grouper with Crab meat and a cup of their homemade Seafood Gumbo.   It was worth the price.

ZZej0bhAwTypxsCPM6mFOQ.text: LOVE IT! The service is awesome! Atmosphere is nice! Food is top notch! I will definitely be back for more!

f6HFHVnn0qJnmKdUwodIwg.text: Love this place! It's a date night favorite. Be prepared to spend $100+per couple. It's not budget food by any means but the food and drinks are great.

svsGOJuOSg-kdlVy66clVg.text: I do not like seafood, I'll make that very clear. This is a place in which both my family and my fiance's family likes. I keep an open mind no matter what so though I ordered the chicken linguini pasta I tried the calamari, coconut shrimp and the naked halibut. All of which were quite amazing, which says a lot for somebody who isn't fond of seafood.  Our server (Nick) was amazing, on top of drinks and kept the entire group of 10 happy. It was a wonderful experience. For a family event or special event I would definitely return. The prices are a bit scary for my taste though. As a college student, you can't really blame me though.

CDlUHEaJKqz9CiM1YPUYIg.text: One of my favorite places for oysters. This is our  go to spot when craving seafood. Usually get the halibut or the sea bass when in season. Everything is pretty good.

GYboelAyS0hLr7Dd5hwlRg.text: The shrimp creole and grits, jumbo lump crab cake, shrimp and scallop orecchiette pasta and the creme brule were all outstanding.   The fried frogs legs was pretty good also considering I'm not a frog legs connoisseur.  Great food ...friday nite was close to an hour wait but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7-z2PQX2fzudojcFUX9jaQ.text: Made our reservations for 8pm and  sat down right on time. Started the meal with beers that were flat, i then ordered another beer but they ran out of it. Followed by limited appetizers because they were out so many things. As we ordered we were told they were out of several fish selections. 20 mins later we were told they ran out of dirty rice and had to wait 45 mins to make some more. After waiting a very long time i had little appetite.. Once our food  arrived i was unimpressed by the anount of salt it had. Every dish my party ordered was drenched in salt. None of us finished our meal or wanted to take it to go. To compensate for the wait we were offered dessert which were limited because they ran out of so many... No surprise!  I however, will compliment the waitresses. She was friendly and made our experience better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Too salty to eat

f7WFizkBz83OFjdimZJlUw.text: The most amazing seafood I've ever had! Thanx to Catie we had the perfect first visit and the best experience on our first night in Arizona. She was so incredibly cute, so helpful and so indescribably enthusiastic about her job as a waitress. She knew her wine, and when she wasn't sure, she asked questions and allowed herself to learn from my husband who's a big wine guy. Everything about our entre, main and dessert was perfect and the quality was like no other restaurant have been able to provide us, since we got to LA from Norway two months ago   Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Qxg_8jOJxtbUBM1Q9LuqEQ.text: I have never been here before and based on my experience tonight I do not see a return anytime soon. My evening started when we were seated in probably the worst seat in the house. I asked the hostess for a booth and she ignored my request. I wear a prosthetic leg, so a booth is prefered.Then she sits us at a seat that is right next to the main line of traffic and right by the door. There were many other tables available in the restaurant.The table was about to fall over because it was not leveled out. We were approached by a stuffy waiter that was snobbish and rude.  He was not delightful at all. When we placed our order , I was informed that what i wanted was not available. I asked why the hostess or he did not tell us when we sat down that some items were sold out. I was simply responded with a completely ridiculous excuse. Since my guest had already ordered I was rushed into making a selection. The waiter left and the manager came over and was far from genuine in assisting us, mentioning in a sarcastic tone that she heard I was not happy. After offering absolutely no remediation whatsoever she left. I am still confused as to why she even came by.  When our food came the lady that delivered it, simply walked up and started moving plates that we were eating our appetizers off of. She dumped our food off without a word...   On a single positive note the food was good, but I can get bad service at a fraction of the price anywhere. I am convinced that this restaurant has convinced themselves that they are too good for their guests.    Summary: Bad service, horrible guest service from every single person we came in contact with and the seating is clearly specific to what they think you are going to spend or some other type of metric that I am unaware of. I have to say that this was the absolute worst dining experience that I have had in a fine restaurant ever in my life. It is to bad, because the food was really good.

A4Wjxmuc1SeDHVDaMskdEA.text: I know what your thinking. A chain? It can't be THAT good right? You can't go wrong with Pappadeaux. Unfortunately it's the only location in Arizona so most of the time it's pretty crowded during peak hours. I usually sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table.   Starting with the drink options. They have a variety of mixed drinks for whatever you are in the mood for. My personal favorite is the swamp thing.   If you are an oyster lover you came to the right place! They have the best oysters in town so make sure you at least get a dozen for an appetizer. If oysters are not you cup of tea then you must try the fried alligator. Trust me...you can't go wrong with this one.  Now on to the entrees! They have everything from seafood plates, steak, fresh fish, salads, and cajun favorites. Don't skip out on dessert they have quite a selection to satisfy your sweet tooth.   The service is always great here! Everyone is professional, knowledgable, and friendly. I can honestly say this is one of the few places I trust for amazing seafood and cajun style dishes in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried alligator and lobster tail
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Swamp thing
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster bisque

kzVWQqX8mN9kceg1spw-XQ.text: Great service, this was my first visit to the Phoenix location and Noel was our server, he was great, very attentive, polite and just had a kind hearted disposition. When I mentioned I had a fruit allergy not only did he ask if everything was ok he sent the manager over to acknowledge my allergies, she asked if I had any other allergies and she advised me she went over my order to confirm none of the fruit I could not have were include and continued to ask if I were satisfied and to make sure I had no issue with any food pertaining to my allergy. She inquired as she stated to make sure if a strawberry touched or if someone touched a strawberry and accidentally touched my cup would that affect me, I confirmed only of I ingest the fruit(s) would I have an issue. I am very grateful for the concern and addressing me directly to make sure I was ok. In  the past I have stopped visiting certain establishments because after ive mentioned my allergies they acted like that information was not important. The service I received tonight was awesome, the food was amazing and the extra concern was the icing on the cake. Thank you Noel and to the manager that assisted me .

u76DWLaamgsJf7Rf26an3Q.text: I've been here several times and the food is always good. I ordered the scallop and sweet pea risotto which was delicious but the scallops were a little sandy. My husband got the filet oscar which he absolutely loved. Our server Nora was really professional and pleasant and tried the best she could. On a Wednesday night, it was packed and really noisy in there as the tables are packed in tightly. Nora was super attentive but the kitchen was really slow. There were 4 of us and we were there for 2 hours. WAY too long!  Other than sandy scallops and super slow service, we love this place and it's always good to bring friends. We will be back but I won't order the sandy scallops.

_iRm354uFDk5munws_XNUw.text: The food was Delish and waitress was nice. It took forever to get my food and or if you don't ask for bread you won't get any before your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mardi Gras pasta was Delish ! Had lots of shrimp

-yLaCFdccCHV3haC7nke1g.text: Bleh. If you like deep fried, breaded seafood for an exorbitant amount of money, you'll love this place. My boyfriend likes this place so I've given it 3 tries. The first time was an epic fail, horrible service and cold food. Second time, didn't really like my food. Third time just got a blackened fish, it was okay but way too much in price. Not my cup of tea but apparently those who do like it love it, because they are always busy. So, to each their own.

gBWA1cN_r9oNDKNs06vS7Q.text: Fried everything is the best explanation of their menu. I went here to celebrate my fifth wedding anniversary and left feeling about twenty pounds heavier. I'm not into fried foods so maybe this place just isn't for me. I couldn't believe how busy it was considering. The prices are very high. The employees are very friendly. But I have zero desire to return.

rwCP8lc8vBwTdAp-4V9MpA.text: Although we waited over 75mins for our food (after placing our order), the manager made our out of state, first timer experience right. Our waitress was a delight, and I'm grateful they accepted accountability opposed to making excuses. Will return.

EuS4hBRH-PKe-HSyvMEfqw.text: Get the shrimp and grits.. it is the best I have ever tasted.. We also had lobster bisque which has huge chunks of lobster in it.. It is a bit pricey but huge portions and worth every penny.. I have also had the tilapia there and it was wonderful.. Service is right on very good..

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster bisque yummmm

rBbc6vqmL3pSvuE58-WDwA.text: I had a really good customer experience here today. Came here for a business lunch and we got to enjoy it in the private wine room. I told the waitress that I have a shellfish allergy and she told me that "they take allergies very serious" and that  a manager would come out to speak with me. A few minutes later the manager came out and asked me about my shellfish allergy and then educated me on how they will prepare my dish to minimize the contact to shellfish and asked me if that was ok. It was more then ok, I have never had a restaurant go through this to make sure that I was ok with how they are going to prepare my food. Definitely a great customer experience and our waitress was fantastic! The food was great too!

xbz_6hxYv3lvABmMBRZjtQ.text: Loved the food here! A little on the pricey side, but it's not like we live on the ocean here in Phx, so that's to be expected. A big, roomy, dining area, so plenty of room for big parties, and a nice bar area to go with that. I recently celebrated my bday here and we had a party of 6, they got us right in and food was delicious. Along with the free desert they threw in for me. First time here and we will definitely return.

MhGbL48i9dCzYOn7Z43lSg.text: This was our first time here. All in all the food tasted fresh, delivered hot and delicious.  I had the Creole Shrimp & Grits.  The Creole Shrimp was good but I've had better. It was a little bland, could have used a bit more salt. The andouille grits were fantastic.   Skyler was our server tonight. She was wonderful. Very attentive to our needs, took very good care of us.  There are some very good looking items on the menu so we will be back to try them!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner outdoors!

t4D3wYoZjTCcqU2ASJVvSQ.text: I never use the "to-die-for" phrase because I would only die for my kids, but if you come to Pappadeaux' you will likely taste a bite of what I would imagine you would find in heaven (if there is one)! We had the alligator appetizer- medium, a caeser salad, Pasta Mardi Gras, Costa Rican Mahi Alexander, Arnold Palmers, and a Purple Voodoo. The alligator (my first time trying it) was cooked perfectly. Squeeze lemon on it- try the sauce it is accompanied with, or eat it as is. It is great! The seafood (mahi, shrimp, crawfish, scallops) in both dishes was cooked/grilled to perfection and the portions were more than a person can consume at one sitting. The Mahi Alexander sauce pulled everything together for me and was even a compliment to the already delicious dirty rice! You cannot see the Mahi under the crawfish, shrimp and sauce, but it was a huge 7oz portion. As far as the staff, our server, Jaclyn, added so much to our experience. She made excellent recommendations and added wit and humor to our experience. It might be hours from LA, but this will definitely be a road-trip worthy meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xdx6PtJCX0rHegPsd9h2kw.text: My wife and I decided to try Pappadaux since neither of us had ever eaten there before. What a great experience! Not knowing what to expect, I was extremely pleased with the restaurant.   We arrived with no reservations and told it would be a 20-30 minute wait but we were shown to the bar area. As I am a fan of local microbrew beer, I ordered a Four Peaks Kiltlifter My wife had her usual cup of coffee. The bartenders were happy and funny and seemed to genuinely enjoy their job. The 20-30 minute wait only lasted about 10 minutes and we were shown to our table.   The server was extremely helpful and knowledgeable in giving us a few suggestions to try. Even going to the point of letting us know what dishes she prefers in pairing with the appetizers. Since my allergy to mushrooms can cause issues, I asked if the meal can be made without them. Absolutely she replied. What happened next is what shocked us. The person running the kitchen came over to our table to make sure it is just an ingestion allergy and not a contact. She wanted to make sure that it was OK to cook in certain pots and pans. In my 48 years, no restaurant has ever asked me that. I felt taken care of from the beginning.   The appetizers we had were fantastic. We enjoyed the crisp fried alligator and he crawfish and shrimp fondeaux. The fondeaux was the best creamy blend of cheese and seafood I've ever had. Definitely one appetizer you must try.   Our main courses were equally as good. I had the Pasta Mardi Gras. Normally in restaurants when you order a main dish you can finish the entire thing. Pappadeaux loads up the plate with their food. I had lunch leftovers for two days.   All in all the meal cost us about $100 with appetizers and drinks. Not a bad price for the experience we had. The atmosphere and employees were five star all the way. Leave room for their bread pudding for dessert. It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Gator.

3g9t8SjWdMteynubHMlHQg.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! It's food is not like anything else I've really found anywhere else. The alligator tail is amazing and I love the waiter told me you can order it half fried and half blackened bc both ways is delish! The only downside is it's a little pricey but you do get what you pay for.

2N0Ccvq1ZeU9Ec6zDGpsZg.text: While on an overnight trip to Phoenix we decided to try Pappadeaux for dinner.  It was a fabulous decision.  We got a very friendly greeting when we entered.  We were taken to a table right away.  Once seated it was only a few moments when Chris, our waiter, came by to see if we wanted a drink before dinner.  Shortly after they came by with warm bread & butter.  I decided to order an appetizer and enjoy some raw oysters on the half shell.  They offer more than the usual horse radish & cocktail sauce.  I enjoyed them very much.  My dinner included soup or salad so I chose to try the clam chowder.  It was very good.  A bit different than what I was use to but most enjoyable.  For entree's my wife opted for the halibut and I decided on the trout & shrimp combo.  Both were great.  When we had finished our entree's Chris came by with a dessert tray that included some very tempting items.  He told us there was one item available not on the tray.  It was a multilayer cake which we chose.  It was fabulous.  While enjoying our dessert the manager stopped by our table.  We learned later they comped our appetizer & dessert since it was our first time there.  While it was very much appreciated we sure didn't expect it.  The service and food was excellent.  Yes we recommend Pappadeaux and are looking forward to dining here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fabulous Cake
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trout &amp; Shrimp combo
Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blue Point Oysters

5ParM1GD9zX-nb9Zr4rqwQ.text: Tonight was my first night trying Pappadeaux and I couldn't have been happier! Our server Ryan Martinez was probably the best server we've ever had. He was very attentive and made us feel so welcome, as if we were part of the Pappadeaux family ourselves. The fresh Mahi-mahi was to die for and the lobster was exquisite. Desert presentation was so amazing that we had to take home a brownie for later. Thanks for the great night out!

E6sXHXRAEuHWt4cbmZErfw.text: I can't give this restaurant any stars. I went on Dec.12 with co-workers for an office party. Everyone's food arrived but mine and when the waitress finally came to check on us....she was completely surprised. She went to check and said it would be coming in a minute.  When everyone was done my food finally arrived. I ate most of it but it didn't taste that great. They took my entree off the bill and gave us free desserts but that did little to make up for the fact that 3 hours later I was so sick. I was violently throwing up, had diarrhea and chills like you wouldn't believe and the entire next day I was too weak to even move very much. Today I'm better but not back to normal. I e-mailed the restaurant to let them know and someone did call me, which was nice, but he offered me gift certificates and the thought of ever setting foot in that restaurant almost made me throw up again.  It was the Salmon Evette that I ordered so I say steer clear of that.

VpFovKxcM-ihoEn274rkNg.text: Pappadaux is my favorite seafood place in Phoenix!  The alligator is fabulous and tastes just like chicken!  The portions are huge so we usually split an entree, have an app and some wine and still get out of there for $100 and are stuffed.  You can swap out the fish on the menus with any other fish they have.  So if the menus says it's a salmon dish, you can pick a red fish or halibut or anything else they have.

Gv_1pFBKY1Z6AzZ0ac8J_A.text: Here on business and looking for a familiar delicious place to have a nice dinner. Pappadeaux never disappoints - their food seems to be really consistent between locations. Huge portions, awesome flavor combinations, fresh fish... what more could you hope for?! The highlight for me was the service. Kirk was warm and possessed an impressive amount of menu knowledge. He made helpful suggestions and even learned my name. My glass (and bread, and plate) was always full. Yet another great experience at one of the few reliable chains about. Thanks!

19vkjLq4jdikoanybz-qmw.text: I took a very lovely lady here on a whim when our original dinner plans fell through. She had never been here before, I had only been once. It was great. Our waiter was spot on, and the food was amazing.

Tosc19HuoryeNZBd8seE-g.text: Very good food, I didn't actually enjoy waiting so long. But not there waiters fault. Good was great, service great. But because of then wait i'am giving it a 4 instead of 5. The salmon was excellent a must have. Also the appetizer crab cake was out of this world.

_s1coGtolByaU9hrb2eZag.text: Pappadeaux gets my 5 stars ! No wonder the Chilean sea bass is on their menu cover. It is absolutely perfect. The kids had the pasta Mardi Gras and  it was great. Look at it this way, no doggy bag is needed at pappadeaux even though the portions are huge, the food is addictive !

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. tuna and hamachi Crudo! Succulent!

gOiYP8DBCEY7tZAijeCUlQ.text: For someone who's lived near New Orleans, this place was mediocre at best. I'm still craving Cajun/Creole cuisine in Phoenix.

MYRwl7AH__491xOtqmhOig.text: Quality keeps going down, prices going up.  I have tried crab cakes ( my absolute favorite) at every restaurant in the Valley.  Pappadeaux has always had the best I could find. I go here strictly for those! They were lightly fried, large in size,tons of crab with a delectable sauce with bits of crawfish, that made you want to lick the plate. I was just there and their new crab cakes don't even vaguely resemble the former. Deep fried small ball/patties with little taste of crab and a watery sauce with unidentifiable white fish with no taste to it whatsoever. Price went slightly up and these are horrible. No need to go back.

3MJdgoE6hHTdOt0nNvwBMg.text: Wow, super impressed! I've never been but have always heard about it. I generally try to stay away from huge chain restaurants, but this place wows. I started my meal with a 1/2 dozen raw oysters, super fresh and just perfect! I went with this blackened Mahi Mahi with crab, shrimp and crawfish in a spicy cream sauce. Holy hell, this dish was perfect. The seafood was cooked to perfection and everything seasoned well. All in all, a great meal and I'd definitely come back

lgnKUZWCMIRidal7hdt2vw.text: Since I was in AZ area for the weekend with my gf for pleasure we decided to visit one of my friends in the area. She picked this place and we decided to get seafood instead of steak or a meat house.   First of all, I'd suggest making reservations otherwise DO NOT COME HERE. We showed up at 7pm but weren't seated until 845. Good thing we ate a really good lunch otherwise I'd be starving and complaining like a baby. At least this gave us time to have a few drinks before dinner in the LARGE outdoor waiting patio area. I think it was so crowded because it was the weekend before Fat Tuesday. This place kinda reminds me of Bubba Gump or something similar. It seems fun and they do have a large bar and waiting area.   We ordered alligator and frog legs as an appetizer. LOVED IT!!! We wanted the fried alligator and frog legs but the waiter absolutely loved that he worked here and HIGHLY recommended that we order it grilled instead. Since he worked here, we figured why not? I was thinking to myself that the cooks were a bit lazy and maybe they didn't want to prepare it. Lol. To my surprise, it was good as he mentioned. I have had both before but not for a few years so I was pleased. My gf ordered the crab stuffed shrimp which was really good. I ordered a  combination seafood plate which was good but not great.   There are way too many things to order on the menu. A lot of fried food so if you are trying to watch your diet/weight then don't come here.   I would definitely come here again but I wouldn't be in any rush. Great for a lot of people and groups, but PLEASE make RESERVATIONS.

6leEouUTaG7vxUe_ot18Og.text: Even though I had a reservation here, I fully expected to have to wait a while for my table.  Parking lot packed-check. Lots of folks on the entrance patio-check. Large group exiting while i'm entering-check. Yep it's going to be a long wait. But it wasn't! We were seated immediately and our server, Rio, came over and promptly introduced himself. Let me tell you this: Rio's attention to our table was first class.  He was very amiable and was patient and engaging with my too talkative and over sharing father.  Rio made us feel like we were his only customers.  He did his best to make sure that we were satisfied. Ask to be seated in Rio's section if you want great service. We ordered 1/2 dozen blue points on the half shell.  Seven of those succulent oysters arrived at our table with ketchupy cocktail sauce, horseradish and mignonette as toppings.  The mignonette was tasty and who doesn't love raw horseradish! Yummy! My Dad and I both had naked scallops with broccolini, and lemon caper sauce on the side for our main.  I specifically asked Rio for steamed veg, no butter.  The plates arrived with four scallops not three (because of their size, I guess) and a shiny portion of broccolini. I asked Rio again for just steamed veg and he happily complied with a smile and a new portion arrived within minutes - still shiny.  Rio brought another serving as well in case I wasn't satisfied. Rio really is a customer service pro! Scallops were delicious and perfectly cooked although the lemon caper sauce was undistinguished. Three servings of identical broccolini convinced me that they must spray oil on the veg in the kitchen. I just don't get that. I'd give Pappadeaux food 3.5 stars but Rio's service elevates my rating to four.

F0TloQMhVSNsVQhufXb5fg.text: This always a go to spot for us for great seafood. Even though they were busy as heck tonight they offered to comp an entree for me. The service is great and food is amazing and tasty. The unique atmosphere and ambience makes you feel like your in the dirty south. Love this place. I had the usual appetizer trio and also the scallops in my opinion were the best!

R7qaPQGGoD_CwQIaZcMbkw.text: My family and I love Pappadeaux, it's my husband's favorite place to eat. I finally tried the alligator! We had a large order where half was battered and the other half was blackened, it truly was amazing! What I didn't plan on was paying $25 for fish and shrimp and getting $20 worth of french fries piled up on my plate. When I think of Papadeaux restaurant I think of dirty rice not fries. Otherwise an amazing experience.

-rdxa_QBwnPb2uvdR8zfew.text: We had a party of 21...Excellent food and service. Timely, delicious. Personally I had mussels, everyone loved their dinner. The service was superb! Thank you!

oVH3vujnmqfXgvH5yCKEDQ.text: Great seafood!  The fish is amazing.  The best I've had in Arizona and... a lot of places really.  I'd go back sooner but the location, while right off the highway, isn't ideal as far as a neighborhood goes, so I do not find myself in that location often.  If someone said they wanted great seafood though, this is where I'd send them.

PqNJueSnjw2WQ_7_-63tZw.text: Went there on a Tuesday and was very busy but they were able to seat us right away. Took my parents for the first time and my Mom was not so sure about what kind of food it was. Me, my wife and Dad loved what we ordered...fried oysters, fried crayfish, and Dad had the shrimp special. So the first part of this review is to say the food was awesome! So now  how the service is awesome! My Mom was not too adventurous so only originally  ordered a salad...even while we all sat waiting for Mom to order, our server Ryan did not get annoyed...did not act like "come on lady" but was so nice and waited. Then...my Mom decided she wanted an appetizer...the awesome crab Mac'N'Cheese. Ryan did warn us that since he already put in our entree  order he could not guarantee it would come out at the same time...I know Ryan made sure that happened! Our order came out awesome and all at the same time...and mom loved the dish!

1FQwMoaWU5d76wxmkethXw.text: This place is just consistent. Been a fan for years and am not sure why it is not in our regular rotation. But, I have had the opportunity to lunch here the past two Fridays. Our server Audrey was fantastic as always. Try the bacon wrapped shrimp brochettes and sausage/seafood gumbo, of course.

5TxoHxHtZzh1G2zEGlY3iQ.text: Always excellent food as evidenced by the constant crowd. the service typically does a great job; however this visit service was slow and chaotic. I am not going to take away a star for that because everyone has a bad day. worth the visit.

-PKrJ6zZ51xYmk-KQa6rnA.text: The best as always.  It was my girlfriends birthday and we invited my parents and we had the best dinner ever. Our waitress  Esther gave us 1st class service and the food was succulent. Can't wait to return.

bkzKgiiM65HTqQSDtpi_gA.text: Love this place... The only thing that upsets me is that the portion of the aligator is so small for the price...and no oyster tonight. Not a good night. Darn

photos.caption: Photo of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mIzCnK0-Tme9ZmgwpxZaRg.text: I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing! I've been there for their crawfish boils...so perfect and the best price for what you get anywhere in the valley! Any other time, the crawfish platter is my favorite. Actually everything is my favorite :) And for as busy as the place is, I still get my food quickly and an awesome wait staff is there for anything you need.

9Mu2W13wFuhuDc7oTm8Bfg.text: We have been to several Pappadeaux and have always enjoyed the food and experience. The one in Phoenix was no exception. Great atmosphere, service and food. My only complaint was I ate too much but that was my doing because it was so good.

MOGzQV43Bi34E5UYerwanQ.text: Outstanding! The food was amazing. The flavors and combinations were mouth watering. When we arrived they were pretty crowded but were seated within 15 minutes. Inside was quite busy and crowded and was pretty loud so we opted to sit on the patio. It was beautiful and quiet and our server, Kirk, was outstanding, friendly and helpful and recommended some amazing menu items! My husband ordered the Chilean Seabass which was out of this world, and I had the redfish. Both were very flavorful and not too heavy. Our server recommended the key lime pie which was the best I've ever had. We will definitely come back next time we are in Phoenix.
